column2: ['Great school with top notch academics and various clubs. However, also very competitive and not the most closely knit community there is.', 'Greeley is great at face value. Top academics and high SAT and good matriculation to the ivy league and all that. But it is also just another factory for kids to become worker bees. Students are competitive, and often it\'s the most high-achieving students, with 4.0\'s and 1540\'s that cry like babies because college applications are stressful.It\'s a homogeneous town, with very little diversity of idea or passion. Many are rich. Some are very very rich. More students drive BMWs and Benz\'s than teachers.In their downtime, students work on playing sports or music or "volunteering" at their dad\'s clinic in NYC or creating a "start-up" with "actual investors" or doing "medical research." Or they just forge their activities and drop hundreds of dollars on ACT prepGreeley can be a very rough place without friends. I\'ve seen kids spend their entire time there without any close friends, without a group of kids with whom it was comfortable to sit at lunch with.', 'Horace Greeley offers fantastic education opportunities throughout the four years. Teachers build students over time there so when the attend college there are no surprises. Academics are the most important, and students are pushed to take more high-level classes. Unfortunately, the competitive environment created makes students feel isolated and inadequate if they do not match the level the school sets for them. Many students feel pressured to be absolutely perfect in everything they do. Students who don\'t attend ivy league schools or get above a 30 in the ACT are looked down upon as inferior, while those students end up being able to succeed more in college that those who the school considered "perfect".', "I graduated Greeley almost 4 years ago. Since then I have not been back once. Going to Greeley wasn't the best for me. Being one of the very few hispanic/ black person I found a lot of hardships to fit in and be accepted in the school. The education was great only if you started in elementary school, starting in 8th grade was rough. The education was so advance from what I had been used to that it was difficult for me to get the hang of it. I did make it through but it was 4 very long and hard years.", "Class of 2019 Review:Pros:Academics - has a very academically stimulating environment - teachers push students to pursue their curiosities, particularly through the school's science research and independent study programs.Clubs - there are a wide variety of clubs and extracurriculars supported by the school.Reputation - the school is very well recognized for its academic rigor by top universities.Cons:Competitive atmosphere - the competitiveness of the school's students can be stifling at times, as it seems people care more about getting into college than the students around them.Stress - a natural product of the school's atmosphere and academic rigor - it can be a very stressful environment at times.I overall did enjoy my four years at Greeley - best of luck to all incoming students!", "It's a good school to say the least, but I honestly wish there was more diversity. It's been getting better over the years, so I guess thats a step in the right direction. This, I think, can be said for many schools, but especially for Greeley, there is so much pressure to be the best and to have excellent grades so you can get into a good college and sometimes it can all just be too much. Overall though, its a good school i guess.", 'Horace Greeley is an amazing school in theory. I mean, my parents and I moved to Chappaqua SO I could attend. The things we learn are top notch, the technology available at our fingertips is state-of-the-art, and the teachers are phenomenal. But, the social norms here are atrocious. The habits the students practice academically is extremely unhealthy. Students brag about pulling all-nighters and taking as many AP classes as possible. This school, is basically just a machine for getting into good colleges. I remember my SECOND WEEK of freshman year people asking me what colleges I was looking at.', 'Horace Greeley is an excellent high school to attend. Although the atmosphere is quite competitive, the staff is attentive and well educated, and the student body is motivated.', 'Horace Greeley really supports a learning environment. Teachers and counselors ensure that a student is prepared for college.On the contrary, students can be a little afraid to step out of their comfort zones and establish new friends. For new students to Horace Greeley High School (except Freshmen) it can be a challenge to fit in for the first year.', 'Horace Greeley is a great school, though it can be a bit tough to fit in as people can be somewhat cliquey. The academics are wonderful and teachers seem passionate and excited about what they’re learning. The school is quite competitive when it comes to academics which can be both a pro and a con depending on how you look at things. Greeley is well known by the top colleges and does a good job at guiding you through the application process and preparing you for the college experience. It also has lots of funding which makes for good facilities and leaves no departments lacking. Overall a great place to send your son or daughter.', 'Horace Greeley was a toxic and hostile environment. Academics were always cut-throat and incredibly competitive, where students were motivated to do better than everyone else for pride and satisfaction, NOT because of altruistic intelligence or desire to learn.', 'Though stressful at times, Greeley offers a rigorous educational experience, and most of the teachers are very willing to help you be the best you can be, having extra help hours or hosting review sessions after school.', 'Top-notch academics in a liberal and very accepting environment. Your ideas are welcome in the classroom. However, atmosphere can be stressful/ the workload can get a bit overwhelming.', 'Greeley is a top-notch NY public high school: the student body is incredibly smart and academically-driven, the teaching is phenomenal, and the variety of classes to take in all fields is almost overwhelming. However, because the entire student body is so focused on achieving the highest grades possible in the highest-level, most advanced courses available, the competition at Greeley between all students can certainly be felt.', 'The Administration and the Counselors are some of the kindest people anywhere. However, the teachers at this school are more focused on tests and grades rather than students learning (kids too). Most clubs are odd charity things started by kids who want to look good on college applications. This school is way to much about tests and grades rather than actual learning', 'Teachers do not care about the students. They are not pro-student. Place is like a machine with controlling parents doing more of the work than their kids do. Sports are corrupt and kids with influential parents get on teams. Clubs are popularity contests.', 'Horace Greeley is a great school. It has done a very good job in preparing me for college, and has allowed me to choose the classes that I am interested in. It is a great place to go to school.', 'Great academics, teachers and preparation for college. The school and town is a very safe place to live. There is not a lot diversity but everyone can find their place.', "It's got a great community, a great staff, and all the teachers are willing to help. Academics are top notch and you can learn almost anything in Horace Greeley. My personal downside was the couple of teachers who were new and didn't know what they were doing, but they didn't stay for long. For many of the students, the path through high school is pretty simple, with many lights to help guide them through it.", 'What I liked about Horace Greeley was the great group of friends I gained and the intimate class settings. This school gives you the chance to really connect with your peers, with a maximum of 25 kids per class, and the teachers were very invested in helping and connecting with the students.']

column8: ["This school academically has many resources, many great oppertunites, and different classes which most schools do not have. I am greatful to have had these expirnaces. But the school is overly competitive starting freshman year, the parents are obnoxious and breed the competitiveness, and they are materialistic. They buy tutors, and pay thousands for their kids to be smart because they naturally aren't. this school pays no attention to anything besides academics, which is why our sports and spirit is terrible. As a class, we cannot raise money for prom tickets Because no one will go to any events. Our tickets will be about $200-300 each (which isn't a big deal for most people in Chappaqua).", 'There are some teachers that are amazing. They know their stuff, treat students with respect, and are caring and want to help you succeed. Unfortunatly, there are more teachers that are not willing to help. They are rude to you, do not teach well, and are lazy and inconsistent and unfair graders for how hard the students work.', "I think that the teachers are very knowledgeable and they connect with their students very well. They care about the students individually and they try to format they're teaching to fit the students needs. I also enjoyed the electives offered at Greeley.", 'food is alright. grades are segregated. but overall there are many opportunities if you look for them', 'The freedom is great it provides with you real campus life.', "Going through high school at Horace Greeley, I didn't realize how much of a blessing it was to be educated there until I had finally graduated and started college. I quickly realized that Greeley truly prepared me for college, and I found myself getting better grades than I even did at Greeley. I knew how to manage my time and I knew how to study, which helped me in college. The only thing that I did not like about Greeley were some of the students.", 'If you stay involved you will love Horace Greeley', 'I never eat anything that is made in the kitchen', 'Very strict and over reactive at times', 'My teachers have become my biggest supporters.', 'Over half the student body participates in at least 1 sport.', 'Teaching staff is very well balanced.', 'Christopher has had a very productive high school career.', 'The administration supports all activities, from sport, musicals, educational, symphonic bands, chorus.', 'The district is continually revisiting and revising their policies.', 'Academics are the highest priority but excessive because all the kids and their parents expect them to go an Ivy or Michigan.', "The student parking lot at the school is the worst. There are accidents there on a daily basis and the school does nothing unless they don't like the student. There are no cameras. The guidance counselors seem knowledgeable but seem to promote the same colleges like maybe they are getting something from some schools.", 'The Assistant Principal Mr. Corsilia is a horrible sneaky manipulative person and unfortunately the Principal relies on his word. The Assistant Superintendent Mr. Byrne is clueless.', 'There are some really good teachers but unfortunately there is a bad group of teachers as well.', 'This school is horrible. From the Assistant Principal Mr. Corsilia to the parents that feel they are more entitled than others. I would not choose this school again. Thankfully, my children are almost out of the school']

column1: Paul D. Schreiber Senior High School
column2: ["High school has been an important time in my life. I've learned an incredible amount about who I am and who I want to be. Most people have experienced going through phases, and I am certainly no stranger to this. My freshman year, I wore all black, and was just an angry kid. I was unhappy and felt alone and had no idea who I was. I've struggled these past few years, but now I am in a place where my fashion is an expression of who I am, as I wear bright colors and different styles from various decades. I've cut my hair, and I'm happy. I know who I am and where I want to go. My teachers have been incredibly important to me and helped me get to this point. I have built genuine relationships with them, and they have made me feel seen, heard, wanted, and respected. For that, I will forever be grateful. I know my privilege.", 'Schreiber is a very big and modern school. There are many beautiful aspects in the school like our new gym and updated library. I would love to see air conditioning as well as a few other small updates to the school.', 'As a new student in my senior year of high school, I found it very easy to make friends. I even am still friends with people I met freshman year. The school offers a great wide selection of courses, teachers and clubs/sports. The school is very well kept clean at all times. The school is very big. They offer yummy food as well, We have a breakfast bar, a sandwich making bar and a hot food bar.', 'The teachers are excellent and always seem to care about their student’s performance and not just their paycheck. The music programs especially are incredible. At Schreiber there’s something for everyone.', 'I feel like Paul D. Schreiber is overall a good school. It offers a great education and many opportunities for its students. There are 20+ clubs offered to students, as well as the option to create your own. The teachers are understanding and easy to connect with during your free time. As for college, as an incoming senior, I have worked very closely with our guidance office. The guidance counselors do an amazing job of keeping students prepared for college and making sure your ready for every obstacle in your way. The only reason why I took away that fifth star is safety. Overall we are safe as students, but the school can do much more. Students are allowed to leave campus in our junior and senior years which produces a safety risk. Also, there is no good system for checking id cards of students entering the building. As of right now, they are only just looking at it quickly as students walk into school. Otherwise, Schreiber is a very good school that I would recommend to everyone.', 'In my time at Schreiber, the academics, teaching staff, diversity, administration, clubs, activities, science, technology, engineering, and math programs have all been very good.', 'Excellent, challenging academics, very accomplished teachers, great facilities, very strong extra-curricular sports and music / performing arts programs, strong school spirit overall.', 'I thought my high school experience was great - my teachers really cared about your academic success. Teachers would reach out to you and your parent if they thought you were struggling. Teachers were always available for extra help before classes started in the morning and the afternoon. I enjoy art classes and there were so many types of courses to choose from including painting using pastels and jewelry making.', 'Helpful faculty, staff, and teachers insured that I had the most enjoyable high school experience. There is a very wide range of mainstream curricular classes as well as classes I have very rarely heard of before. There is also an endless list of electives to choose from whether it be in the technology department, human development, of sciences.', 'I have had all types of experiences at this school, most of them good, but some of them were bad. Most of the teachers are there to help you in whatever you need. They want to see you succeed. However there are some teachers who not all students will have a connection with, which is perfectly normal. The school is crowded and the food is not that bad. They have gotten stricter with their rules of safety which can be annoying, but they are doing it for the safety of their students. In general, I have had a decent experience at this school.', 'I like how Schreiber  has many AP classes and electives ,yet some basic school problems are over complicated by the administration. For example, they should simply use rectangle tables for more room in the cafeteria or stop using temporary ID cards, as it defeats the new security system. Although the teachers remain politically unbiased, the administration constantly tries to instill ideas like microaggressions and infinite genders which creates a political and ideological bubble. Despite these negative Schreiber is a great school with great people and great teachers which I am happy to be a part of.', 'The teachers are very qualified at their jobs and I personally have felt safe at my school. The only thing I wish is that the students were more open minded when they come to speaking. There was no bullying just ignorant people.', 'The teachers do an amazing job teaching. I’ve had some of the best experiences with the science department especially, and all of my science teachers, past and present, helped me grow as a student and also made me enjoy science! The other teachers are also amazing and clear in their teachings, especially the math and history teachers.', 'There is a huge variety of classes offered and at very challenging levels.  Our son also enjoyed being on sports teams year round and had coaches who really cared about the students both on and off the field.', 'Schreiber is one of those special high schools that ensure safety as well as helping the students as much as possible. The regulations the school runs on are ones that help students know what discipline is. As well as offering many great clubs with teachers who really know their stuff. I love this school for all it has to offer!', 'I loved how the teachers at myHigh  School actually care about our students. We’re much more than just faces at desks to them. They form relations with us and are extremely passionate about giving us the tools we need to further our education.', "I spent 4 years at Paul D. Schreiber High School, and from the first day they make you feel like a part of the community. The Peer Leaders have a program where you're put in a lunchtime group session with other freshman which really makes a difference when you're in a new place. I've loved almost all my classes and teachers, and the clubs and activities are really diverse and fun.", 'What I liked about Paul D. Schreiber High School was that there were a lot of sports and a huge selection', 'I like that Paul D. Schreiber High School provides a lot of opportunities for its students to explore their various interests through its large amount of classes offered and the many clubs that take place both before and after school.', 'It was a great place to spend my HS years. Good balance of structure, guidance in independence. I played an the Football team, wresting team , also I did film and social studies honor society, I had some amazing teachers.']

They offer yummy food as well, We have a breakfast bar, a sandwich making bar and a hot food bar.', 'The teachers are excellent and always seem to care about their student’s performance and not just their paycheck. The music programs especially are incredible. At Schreiber there’s something for everyone.', 'I feel like Paul D. Schreiber is overall a good school. It offers a great education and many opportunities for its students. There are 20+ clubs offered to students, as well as the option to create your own. The teachers are understanding and easy to connect with during your free time. As for college, as an incoming senior, I have worked very closely with our guidance office. The guidance counselors do an amazing job of keeping students prepared for college and making sure your ready for every obstacle in your way. The only reason why I took away that fifth star is safety. Overall we are safe as students, but the school can do much more. Students are allowed to leave campus in our junior and senior years which produces a safety risk. Also, there is no good system for checking id cards of students entering the building. As of right now, they are only just looking at it quickly as students walk into school. Otherwise, Schreiber is a very good school that I would recommend to everyone.', 'In my time at Schreiber, the academics, teaching staff, diversity, administration, clubs, activities, science, technology, engineering, and math programs have all been very good.', 'Excellent, challenging academics, very accomplished teachers, great facilities, very strong extra-curricular sports and music / performing arts programs, strong school spirit overall.', 'I thought my high school experience was great - my teachers really cared about your academic success. Teachers would reach out to you and your parent if they thought you were struggling. Teachers were always available for extra help before classes started in the morning and the afternoon. I enjoy art classes and there were so many types of courses to choose from including painting using pastels and jewelry making.', 'Helpful faculty, staff, and teachers insured that I had the most enjoyable high school experience. There is a very wide range of mainstream curricular classes as well as classes I have very rarely heard of before. There is also an endless list of electives to choose from whether it be in the technology department, human development, of sciences.', 'I have had all types of experiences at this school, most of them good, but some of them were bad. Most of the teachers are there to help you in whatever you need. They want to see you succeed. However there are some teachers who not all students will have a connection with, which is perfectly normal. The school is crowded and the food is not that bad. They have gotten stricter with their rules of safety which can be annoying, but they are doing it for the safety of their students. In general, I have had a decent experience at this school.', 'I like how Schreiber  has many AP classes and electives ,yet some basic school problems are over complicated by the administration. For example, they should simply use rectangle tables for more room in the cafeteria or stop using temporary ID cards, as it defeats the new security system. Although the teachers remain politically unbiased, the administration constantly tries to instill ideas like microaggressions and infinite genders which creates a political and ideological bubble. Despite these negative Schreiber is a great school with great people and great teachers which I am happy to be a part of.', 'The teachers are very qualified at their jobs and I personally have felt safe at my school. The only thing I wish is that the students were more open minded when they come to speaking. There was no bullying just ignorant people.', 'The teachers do an amazing job teaching. I’ve had some of the best experiences with the science department especially, and all of my science teachers, past and present, helped me grow as a student and also made me enjoy science! The other teachers are also amazing and clear in their teachings, especially the math and history teachers.', 'There is a huge variety of classes offered and at very challenging levels.  Our son also enjoyed being on sports teams year round and had coaches who really cared about the students both on and off the field.', 'Schreiber is one of those special high schools that ensure safety as well as helping the students as much as possible. The regulations the school runs on are ones that help students know what discipline is. As well as offering many great clubs with teachers who really know their stuff. I love this school for all it has to offer!', 'I loved how the teachers at myHigh  School actually care about our students. We’re much more than just faces at desks to them. They form relations with us and are extremely passionate about giving us the tools we need to further our education.', "I spent 4 years at Paul D. Schreiber High School, and from the first day they make you feel like a part of the community. The Peer Leaders have a program where you're put in a lunchtime group session with other freshman which really makes a difference when you're in a new place. I've loved almost all my classes and teachers, and the clubs and activities are really diverse and fun.", 'What I liked about Paul D. Schreiber High School was that there were a lot of sports and a huge selection', 'I like that Paul D. Schreiber High School provides a lot of opportunities for its students to explore their various interests through its large amount of classes offered and the many clubs that take place both before and after school.', 'It was a great place to spend my HS years. Good balance of structure, guidance in independence. I played an the Football team, wresting team , also I did film and social studies honor society, I had some amazing teachers.']
column6: ["I love this school! From it's endless opportunities and welcoming staff, Schreiber is a great place to be.", "Schreiber has been an amazing place I got to call home for the past 4 years. It has kept me safe and secure, by protecting me through its outstanding staff. I've been very lucky to have teachers who put their students first and care deeply about their problems, inside and outside the classroom. Schreiber has shown me what it's like to be part of a really great, diverse community. Even though I'm not involved in any sports, I still manage to feel apart of the Schreiber family by belonging to various clubs and getting involved in as many events as I can. I wouldn't have wanted my high school experience to gone any other way.", 'There were many teachers that i found fascinating, although i noticed that my favorite teachers tended to be those who taught AP classes. The one thing i would really like to see improved would be the cockroach population that has increased to the point that they are coming together to form a small nation in the boys locker room. All in all it was a good experience.', 'Paul D. Schreiber high school is a multi-cultural and course high school with an impressive student body and many treat teachers. I have been guided by highly trained professionals my entire high school career and these men and women have changed my idea of learning and have shown me many things during the last four years.', "The teachers are the best. The social studies department is awesome! I honestly feel ready for college, and I'm very happy with my educational experience at Schreiber.", "This school help to learn English very fast I'm so glad to be here.  Also the teacher are very nice and help a lot.", 'Thus far, my experience at Schreiber has been great.  My freshman son has been enjoying his classes and his teachers have been inspiring and motivating.  As a parent, I feel that the principal has maintained an open line of communication regarding school events and school curriculum.  There are a variety of ways to get involved, whether it be through academics or through social clubs.  It is a diverse campus, both the faculty and student body, and we are happy that our son is attending the school.', 'There is a variety of courses here at school there are many APs to try that are different level. As you go up you can choose your own classes which makes me happy and want to show up to class more', "It's diverse. I don't feel a lot of peer pressure and majority are nice. They don't make it difficult to walk around the halls and everyone for the most part accepts each other for who we are.", "They are underfunded and over crowded. The little funding they have just go to sports and don't give enough to to other clubs such as the drama club.", "I like school. However it can get extremely stressful. A majority of teachers always assign tests on the same day. I think it is a good atmosphere and majority of the kids have a good social time. I haven't seen lots of bullying and most people are pretty accepting of each other.", "The teachers are very engaging. Some are great and always there for help when needed. There is a select few who I feel don't help students in the way they should. Those teachers are a bit lazy and assume too much that the student should know what they are doing even if they don't explain it. But majority of teachers are approachable and make the school environment a good place to be around.", 'sports and coaches have been great for my child', 'the teachers I have met have been encouraging', 'I think the school offers a lot of great options for students looking to get the most out of their 4 years.  My child has been able to choose electives that she is interested in.', 'It is the best because I do not remember any problem relating to heath issues.', 'As reflected on my answers I am very happy attending this school.', "Football team is the best experience I've ever had!!!", 'All teachers are very engaged with us. Always available.', "Don't really know about many of the extracurricular activities"]
column8: ['The teachers for the most part are very good.', 'The school is very aware of the safety of the children', 'The school is known for its academics and for getting students ready for college.', "I think a lot of students are accepting of each other, even though everyone isn't friends with each other. I would say that my school is somewhat diverse, but there are a lot of whites here.", 'I think my school is very safe overall. There is not too much bullying or no bullying at all. I think the security is somewhat tight because of the security cameras in the halls and the guards outside in front of the school are very attentive and vigilant. My personal safety has never been threatened at this school.', "I'm the Human Relations club, but it usually doesn't meet. It's supposed to meet on Wednesdays, but the person who is in charge of the club, who is a counselor, always has meetings.", 'My teachers have helped me tremendously to get me where I am now. I have especially received excellent help last year when I was in resource.', 'There is nothing that makes my school stand out from any other one in my area.', 'Over the past four years, I have obtained leadership positions in almost every club I belong in.', 'Some of my teachers go beyond their job as my educator and help me in various ways outside of the classroom.', "I've had some extraordinary teachers throughout my high school career, however, there are some that completely lack knowledge in their field.", 'The school has many safety measures in place. I generally feel very safe.', 'There are many extra curricular activities, depending on your interest. Many students choose to play on a school team. There are also many concerts and plays for those who like to perform. The school also has many clubs such as public speaking, Model UN and multi cultural clubs. There are also many community service opportunities who want to help with environmental issues or assist in our local area.', 'If I had to start over I would choose my high school again. The overall education is excellent with good support from teachers and a very strong community feeling within the school and the outside community as well.', "it's okay, I personally found it annoying.", 'We had security guards at every angle of the school, all year around. Checking Ids to get off campus and required sign in and sing out for visitors.', 'The clubs varied from SADD(students against destructive decision), Tree huggers, Spanish honor society, Bridging the gap, drama club, newspaper, photo club, kaleidoscope etc. The atmosphere of the clubs were always positive and eventful.', 'The school spirt week was always my favorite, the community really gets involve and nobody gets left out. The quality of education and its location is why I would choose to attend this high school all over again.', 'Schreiber has excellent teaching staff, especially the science department. Extra help is given when needed, tutoring at the library is offered to help you excel. Getting one on one help helped me excel acadamically.', "Overall the school is very safe. There has never been a serious threat towards our school, and when there was it was a joke and a very rare occurrence. The school nurses are not that great. Mostly because they are not allowed to give you any type of medication so they mostly just tell you to drink water. The security guards are very good at making sure that there are no people in the school that aren't supposed to be there."]

column2: ['Livingston Senior High School has been vital in the development of my character and interests.  It provides so many resources for its students to thrive in a high school environment but also find what they want to do afterward.  They have so much to offer, including electives that cannot be found at the majority of other schools.  Any student who attends Livingston Senior High School is bound to succeed in the college environment and find a job that they love.', 'Overall, this is a very good school. Livingston High School will definitely prepare you in terms of academics and there is a large variety of courses that a student can choose to take. Teachers and administration all want students to succeed. There are also a lot of clubs and activities, especially some that were created by students, that cater to all kinds of interests. The school is also pretty diverse but definitely has the potential to become more diverse.', 'The thing about this high school is that the social life is very cliquey and segregated which makes it hard to be active socially. This has made my high school experience pretty hard but the academics are really good and competitive.', 'I wish Cafeteria can provide more variety of foods, and would like to have higher level digital imaging class.', "A good school with dedicated teachers. I'm currently in college and I feel like I was well-equipped.", 'There are a lot of great electives and clubs at the school to explore your interests. The only issue I have really seen with the school is the competitiveness among the students to be the best. The issue with this is that it leaves a lot of students feeling inadequete because of the amount of praise and attention the "best" students are given.', 'The opportunities are incredible! There are a major variety of electives that cater to your needs and interests throughout all 4 years of high school. From stagecraft to chorus to autoshop, you can get a taste of anything while at this high school. The guidance office is willing to help you get your schedule as you see fit as well! Very flexible, open minded and just a wonderful environment to be in while exploring your interests for the future', 'Great school with very dedicated teachers. They prepared me very well for college. There was a lack of diversity that come from being in such an expensive town.', "I enjoyed the supportive community, but not the administration necessarily. For example, teachers and students are often very helpful, while administrators make the students' lives harder by implementing useless policies instead of fixing real problems.", "Born and raised in Livingston, New Jersey, I have gone through grades K-12 and recently graduated high school as a student of the class of 2019. Throughout the years the Livingston Board of Education (BOE) and Livingston High School has never let me down in terms of its academics, faculty, and decisions made for the Livingston community. Most notably, during my sophomore year the entire high school received Microsoft Surface 3 computers, although some students and faculty felt uncomfortable with the major transition, I recognized the BOE's decision as an opportunity to excel one's own academics in regards to preparing for college. The BOE's decision made working efficient, faster, and improved students' skills in Microsoft Office. Overall, Livingston High School provides top tier academics, athletics, and activities in the midst of a diverse community.", 'There is good diversity at Livingston High School. Everyone plays sports and a lot of people go to the football games. Teachers care and try to make time for you to get extra help.', 'It’s a great school for anyone moving in. I felt right at home, and so far it has been a great experience. Cafeteria is clean with a variety of food choices, there are many bathrooms and most are kept pristine, and the track/field/gym is maintained in good condition. Only complaint would be the broken gym equipments that haven’t been addressed for the past 2 years. Many who grew up with Livingston Public Schools don’t love the high school, but I believe that oftentimes everywhere else is better than one’s hometown. And for me, Livingston High School is the best school I could’ve moved to.', 'The school offers many academic opportunities unavailable at other schools. It’s a very academically competitive school with a very active student body. The social scene is not as enjoyable as there are many academic pressures placed on you by other students, teachers, and parents.', "It's a fairly good school compared to other ones in the state and country. Each year we send quite a few students to the best colleges. However, the students at the school are very cliquey and there is a lack of academic honor here.", 'I have had a great experience at Livingston high school that has set me up for a successful future. Although grades can be competitive at times, Its inspiring how dedicated and motivated students are at this school. The highly skilled teachers challenge us each day to become better and to prepare us for our future. One thing I would like to see is a raise in school spirit. Livingston High School is a pretty large and growing school, yet I feel that there could be more student involvement to make the school become closer knit', 'Livingston high school has an intelligent staff and diverse assortment of extracurricular  activities', 'There are so many options for classes that you don’t have enough time to take them all. There is opportunity to participate in classes and clubs with a variety of interests. Emphasis on grades come from teachers as well as other students. More the idea if you have free time, you could fill it with a class or an extracurricular. It’s sometimes overwhelming, but there’s lots of support when you’re feeling overwhelmed.', 'Livingston High School offers so many different courses of study at various levels of ability. There really is something for everyone.', "A bit of a challenge. It's a pretty competitive school and you'll see lots of smart kids that varies from race to race. Nevertheless, it has impacted my life in more ways than i can describe. I made many friends there and it'll definitely be a memory i'll hold dearly.", 'There are so many ways to get involved and be apart of the school community. The environment is stress filled and competitive, but there is no chance that any alumni would not be prepared to move onto college. Many teachers are not only good at what they do, but they are also kind and considerate.']

column6: ['I liked Livingston High School because it prepared me well for college and most of the teachers are really good. I was also able to make great friends and learned a lot at my years at the high school.', 'Most teachers are extremely helpful and kind. If you ever need help in a course, the teachers will always be willing to stay during lunch, or before and afterschool to help you. The people there are generally very nice as well.', 'Livingston High School is great in terms of  there academics. They offer almost every AP class and have numerous honors and cp courses. The school is fairly large and is very nice. I would however, like to improve the accommodations the school offers for students with learning disabilities. Speaking for myself and others and can be very difficult to acquire learning accommodations that are needed.', "Livingston offers an excellent education and completely prepared me for college. At the same time, the constant standard of excellence can cause a lot of peer pressure, and competition is very cutthroat at the school. While I do firmly believe that the pressure and education of LHS made me a better person, I've seen less comforting results in some of my peers.", "Livingston High School is the reason why parents move to Livingston. The school is majority white and asian. The school is composed of students who either don't care about school and do drugs, or are super competitive. It is hard to find a student who is in between those two types.", 'It has a very dynamic student body and has a variety of course offerings in a wide range of difficulty levels.', 'I had a great time at Livingston Senior High School and thought the school did a good job of creating a friendly environment for everyone, providing quality education as well as technology, and ensuring the welfare of everyone.  However, the school could have improved on helping students get ready for the college application process, in particular improving the rapport between the high school guidance counselors and the students, and the school needs different people at the upper level of the administration.', 'Good school that prepares people for college. The school primarily focuses on academics and less on school spirit related activities. Pep rally is poorly run and sports are not very popular. A lot of stress in the environment because of the expectation to do well. However, this is all for the best because we will get a head start on our peers when we apply for colleges and etc.', 'Excellent academics, some unqualified teachers. Cliquey culture throughout the student body. A variety of sports and clubs to choose from.', 'The education offered in this school is excellent but social life is horrible in this school, barely any diversity and very cliquey.', 'I had a great experience at this high school. It facilitated friendships that will last me a lifetime and I overall had positive experiences with the teachers, who gave me more than enough preparation to succeed in college. The one things I wish this school had was more options in AP classes and/or more opportunities to earn college credit, as I came into college with less credits than some of my peers who had more of these opportunities at their high schools.', 'This high school is very competitive.  I feel that only the highly intellectual students succeed and benefit from the education and opportunities offered from this high school.  The average student or below average student is offered services, but that will only allow them the assistance needed to graduate high school.', 'Overall, the educational opportunities at Livingston High School make it one of the top schools. The staff and students are friendly and helpful for the most part, and there are a wide range of courses. The free enrollment policy allows students to challenge themselves, or choose not to--their fate is in their hands. The Honors and AP classes can be stressful, but fun and enriching as well. While students may complain about the stress of taking any of the many available AP or Honors courses, they rarely express regret, and instead embrace the hard work that comes with a great education. Livingston also offers a ton of fun electives like Music Tech and Fashion, with close-to state-of-the-art equipment. There are so many clubs and events to include the student body and the community that it is easy for anyone to fit in.', 'Rigorous academics, but high pressure. Some teachers are unfamiliar with material and have difficulty communicating with students.', 'Livingston High School offers tons of clubs and extracurricular activities. Sports events are always exciting and students here are always friendly and outgoing. Teachers are very engaging and they care a lot for the students.', 'LHS is a highly competitive school in academics, but there are students on the other end of the spectrum as well. There are a ton of opportunities and activities available (including archery as part of the PE curriculum in 11th and 12th grade). The music department is fantastic and the teachers at LHS are amazing. Though, there is a lot of homework and stress. The high stress environment really gets to the students sometimes. LHS is always constantly trying to improve its safety and its curriculum though.', 'It is a very competitive environment where students compete against each other. This can be good in some situations and bad in some situations.', "I am very privileged to live in Livingston and especially attend the Livingston High School. Despite having a reputation of awful diversity and a very segregated school of Asians and Whites, the resources available for us to be successful are very helpful. However, there is no one side of the school. The school has very amazing teachers who deserve so much respect with their willingness to help students, but sadly it also has teachers who are very hypocritical- asking for respect from student yet are very disrespectful (usually the ones with tenure contracts). Especially coming from a student who moved from a different country, it is obvious that students who are born and raised in Livingston or around Livingston tend to display a very narrow-minded mind. It's sad to see how they perceive everything being around them.", 'I enjoyed my high school experience a lot. Over the last four years I have made amazing friends, taken classes that exceeded my intellectual limits and created memories that I will remember forever. I do not regret anything I have done, and will continue to push myself until I achieve all of my goals.', "I am currently a senior at LHS and have grown in this amazing environment. I have become a better student and person here, as the teachers at LHS are not only motivating but compassionate about student's lives outside the classroom."]

Sports events are always exciting and students here are always friendly and outgoing. Teachers are very engaging and they care a lot for the students.', 'LHS is a highly competitive school in academics, but there are students on the other end of the spectrum as well. There are a ton of opportunities and activities available (including archery as part of the PE curriculum in 11th and 12th grade). The music department is fantastic and the teachers at LHS are amazing. Though, there is a lot of homework and stress. The high stress environment really gets to the students sometimes. LHS is always constantly trying to improve its safety and its curriculum though.', 'It is a very competitive environment where students compete against each other. This can be good in some situations and bad in some situations.', "I am very privileged to live in Livingston and especially attend the Livingston High School. Despite having a reputation of awful diversity and a very segregated school of Asians and Whites, the resources available for us to be successful are very helpful. However, there is no one side of the school. The school has very amazing teachers who deserve so much respect with their willingness to help students, but sadly it also has teachers who are very hypocritical- asking for respect from student yet are very disrespectful (usually the ones with tenure contracts). Especially coming from a student who moved from a different country, it is obvious that students who are born and raised in Livingston or around Livingston tend to display a very narrow-minded mind. It's sad to see how they perceive everything being around them.", 'I enjoyed my high school experience a lot. Over the last four years I have made amazing friends, taken classes that exceeded my intellectual limits and created memories that I will remember forever. I do not regret anything I have done, and will continue to push myself until I achieve all of my goals.', "I am currently a senior at LHS and have grown in this amazing environment. I have become a better student and person here, as the teachers at LHS are not only motivating but compassionate about student's lives outside the classroom."]

column2: ['Great school, has many clubs and outside activities to participate in. teachers are great, always wanting to help to improve your study habits or grades.', 'Highlands is a really great school but it can get competitive. There are a ton of clubs and activities to join and for the most part, the teachers are very good.', 'Northern Highlands has proven to be an exceptional place for em to grow and prosper as a student. Most of my teachers have been indescribably supportive of my educational needs and the guidance department has definitely supplemented support that my teachers cannot offer. Also, I love all the opportunities the school offer to get involved because of gives me an opportunity to become a more well rounded student and explore interests that I do not get to in classes.', 'Northern Highlands is a very great school for academics and athletics. The cafeteria is one of the best in the state and the staff is really nice. There are many great electives to take including woodworking. It is located in a beautiful town and great atmosphere.', 'It is a great school, the teachers are great and the academics are great. But it can get stressful, and there is a large focus on image.', 'I loved attending Northern Highlands. All of the teachers are really cool and care about you a lot. I met all of my best friends there. Joining a sports team is a really easy way to make friends and find people like you.', 'I love the school and the environment here at Highlands. The students and faculty have helped me grow so much as a student and the variety of clubs is awesome. I am always pushed to do my best here at Highlands!', 'Northern Highlands is a great public high school.  It offers many advanced placement (AP) courses with intelligent teachers. In addition, the food is superb: one of the best food systems in the state. However, it lacks diversity and the guidance counseling system could be improved.', 'Good resources and education but some teachers aren’t great and the administration and guidance are not helpful at all', 'I enjoyed the amount of classes available to students. As long as students were receptive and enough students signed up for the classes, they ran. All students are required to take business courses and art classes and students can concentrate their focus on studies to find their academic strengths. It provides an insight into what major they would most likely end up enrolled in. Additionally, there are varieties of foods that students could choose from. Which is something that I consider to be unique.In words, I would love to see more diversity and a less cutthroat environment; however, I understand that no amount of administrative involvement could radically change this. Thus, there was very little that I found to be inadequate with Northern Highlands. Northern Highlands creates well-rounded individuals that learn to balance their time wisely between clubs, sports, and academics. Alumni become great students that prosper in college as they are already used to managing their time.', 'The academic environment of Northern Highlands is very good. I learned a lot.  If you take challenging classes, it can be a little overwhelming. It is a very suburban and can be cliquey. It prepared me very well for college. The college application time period is very stressful and students get very competitive. Girls soccer is amazing.', 'Northern Highlands was a great stepping stone for college. The courses I took prepared me for the next level, which made my academic transition to college seamless. It was also a great place to meet people and get involved.', "Northern Highlands is a privileged public school, couldn't imagine growing up anywhere else. All staff and faculty are very sweet and are willing to help you achieve the highest level of success. Also, a safe school where people are normal for the most part.", 'Northern Highlands is an excellent school that helps students prepare for college and beyond. One of the many lessons I learned in this school was finance and learning how to save and make money within a business. While some of the teachers are not as dedicated as others, the majority of them go above and beyond and are willing to help everyone excel.', "My experience at Northern Highlands Regional High School was mostly a positive one. The school had plenty of clubs, activities, and resources that I was able to take advantage of. In addition, the wide range of AP's offered is unlike any other school in the area. At Northern Highlands, I was able to expand my education and thoroughly prepare myself for college. However, I would like to see the school have more diversity since the school is predominantly white. Overall, however, the supportive teachers and resources allowed me to have a nurturing high school experience.", 'I started Film Classes Freshman year and have been given the opportunity to take related classes each year. Now I will be off to Ithaca College in August to continue on my chosen path to not only create scripts but advance my movie making shills. Thank you Northern Highlands for sparking my interest!', 'My experience at northern highlands regional high school was wonderful! The teachers are so understanding and truly want their students to succeed. The school had a decent amount of clubs and activities to join. It was easy to make friends because everyone is so welcoming and down to earth. The school sprit was one of my favorite parts. Students would come together to cheer for the sporting events and school plays.', 'I love how their teachers are so helpful and have a fun learning environment. I would like to see more opportunities for guidance counselors to get involved with the students.', 'While Northern Highlands can be a high stress environment, in the end it is an almost perfect high school. There are opportunities to do almost anything you want to do. The staff is mostly very friendly, along with the student body. The quality of education is amazing and I would not have wanted to spend my 4 years anywhere else.', "I have had a pretty great experience at Highlands! All I wish is that the environment at the school wasn't so competitive, both academically and in extracurriculars."]

column6: ['Northern Highlands has a large options of classes, ranging from levels of difficulty to different areas of interest. This school truly has a class for everyone. There are also many inspiring teachers that push their students to succeed while challenging them at the same time. If you are lucky to get one of these teachers, in my experience, they will not only teach you the subject you need to learn, but you will also grow to enjoy the subject even more. I believe Northern Highlands truly grooms their students and prepares them for their college studies.', 'I think my school is extremely high ranked and educationally, is a very good school. However, it is extremely competitive which can be a big disadvantage.', 'Northern Highlands is a very good school that integrates fun days into the school year. All the faculty cares about the students and students feel like their ideas are welcome. The only bad thing about Northern Highlands is how competitive it can get, but sometimes its a good thing. It is because of that competitiveness that students do so well.', 'Northern Highlands Regional High School is located in Allendale, NJ. Their students are hardworking, motivated, and are prepared for college. The teachers are great and there are a lot of resources for students to take advantage of.', "Northern Highlands allowed me to realize my love for film. The teachers here are very helpful and friendly. There are also a lot of great students to meet and be friends with. They have a lot to offer in terms of classes and extra curricular activities. There isn't much that I would like to see changed. I had  good time at this school and I fell like it did a good job preparing me for college. I enjoyed all the classes I took and clubs I joined.", "I transferred to NH halfway through my freshman year. The guidance department did a poor job of handling that, and they didn't improve throughout the years, especially when I had to leave for a full month this past school year. The academics are above average though.", "Education and students are great. We have great teachers here and they will put in effort to teach the students. We also have a great variety of clubs and athletics, so there is plenty of things to do after school to reduce school stress. The students here are very open and friendly, so making friends is very easy. NH also have big events, like pastamania, and the overnight Relay for Life. If you're an incoming student, you will like this school", 'Highlands is exceptional at preparing its students for competitive colleges. The course work is near or at college level.  Academic excellence is status quo for the honors and AP students.', 'Northern Highlands has granted me an overall great high school experience. It is easy to become involved in the school community, since so many sports and clubs are offered for students to participate in. I love the endless number of elective classes offered. I wish certain elective classes were offered during more periods. Many students, including myself, were unable to take certain classes this year since the distinct periods those courses were offered in overlapped with other ones.', 'Northern Highlands is an amazing school.  It has great academics, sports, activities, clubs, teachers, food, and facilities. Definitely recommend!', 'I went here all four years of my highschool. It was a great experience. I met my lifelong friends as well as had some teachers I will never forget.', 'Northern Highlands was a place where everyone was extremely competitive. The teachers were very good at preparing students for the next level classes but it was always about whats next and the future. Everyone there, the staff, was always trying to help the students in any way they could which gave the school a good atmosphere. The only thing that I would change is the way some teachers teach their students. Every student learns differently and most teachers that I had at this school taught the same way, they would just stand in front of the class and lecture. Some students need interactive lessons, some need visuals.', 'I am naturally competitive and the environment of my school plays right into my sweet spot.  From academics to sports to social life, all very competitive and that has prepared me for college and beyond.', "I like the school spirit we have at highlands along with the teachers and the quality of the cafeteria food. Most of the staff are really nice and easy to talk to. The only thing i'd like to see changed at the moment is when school starts, id like it to start later.", 'Northern Highlands is an especially good school in that it helps students in every way possible. Students are well prepared for college, the athletics program is one of the best in the state, the arts program is one of the best in the nation, there is a plethora of meaningful clubs and activities, the faculty is extremely helpful, just to name a few. Although the school lacks racial diversity, the student body is academically diverse enough in that it is challenging for the kids who want to be challenged, and relaxed for the kids who do not.', 'This school is in a nice safe neighborhood. There are many activities and clubs to choose from and everyone is so accepting. The teachers are willing to help whenever you need them and are very encouraging. The food is amazing at least for school food it is. Especially if you go to the international line or get the fries.The only down part is that there is NO diversity at all. If there was a diverse group I would give this school 5 stars.', 'Northern Highlands is a very well rounded school. Accommodating students from all levels. The school lacks in diversity in religion, race and wealth.', 'I am a graduate of NHRHS. The school was fantastic all around. Academics, sports, activities, clubs, teachers, facilities and everything !  Highly recommend anyone to attend if they can!', 'Northern Highlands provides a high quality learning experience to the students as well as a top notch sports program. The experience prepares them for college. They also love the great clubs and food.', 'A well rounded educational program of the highest standards with a wide range of clubs and activities. One of the best sports programs in the area. my kids love the different choices for lunch.']

column1: Middlesex County Academy for Science, Mathematics, & Engineering Technologies
column2: ['Things I like about MCA: hardworking and motivated environment, family society, student-run clubsThings I dislike: not much diversity, only one sport is offered, not many AP courses, not much choice with classes taken', 'So far the professors are really friendly and helpful,the campus is really latge and offers a lot of activities.', 'Ask about diversity and goals of the school. SATs became the goal. The only goal. Enjoy. No principles from from principle. No interests in students interests.', "This school definitely prepared me for college but I do wish I had more fun during my high school years. It's all stress and competition. That said, I probably would've still chosen this school looking back on the decision because it was most likely the best option in expenses and safety.", 'The teachers are challenging and very hard working. The engineering teachers are committed and teach us at a college level. This school is awesome.', 'This school is a good fit if you are self motivated and want to go into engineering. It also involves a block schedule and there is less homework than most high schools.', "The Middlesex County Academy for Science, Mathematics, and Engineering Technologies is a quaint school in Edison. It's meant to be extremely rigorous and provide students with a fine education in STEM. This is wonderful in theory, but in practice it's simply one engineering elective where a student is often lectured in an environment not exactly meant to embrace learning. Most teachers are generally nice, although there are several exceptions to these rules. Most of these exceptions are terrible teachers and terrible people. There is no cafeteria in this school, so lunches have to be brought from home. There is only one sports team, which is soccer. The soccer team is the lowest ranking team in the lowest division. The school is currently unranked on US News, which makes it significantly harder to get into a good school.", 'All and all,  a pretty good place to go to school. It’s rough, but it prepares students for colleges.', "This is a completely terrible school. Administration makes several mistakes on college applications, actively targets certain students whose lives to make hell, and overall does a horrible job of actually getting anything done. Parents, please save your children. Students, save your siblings. Families, save your neighbors. And teachers, oh god teachers, please save yourselves. No student should have to suffer four years under this administration.The principal and the guidance counselor are terrible at their jobs. They waited until the last day of school to confirm electives with students for the upcoming year, creating unnecessary chaos hours before the end of the school year in a frantic rush to rectify their mistakes. They do not listen to students' legitimate complaints about faculty or coursework. If a student tries to contact the board of freeholders or the superintendent directly, the school administration reprimands the student for going over the school's head.", 'My daughter did not have a positive experience here for the most part. She gave up all arts, music, theater and sports to focus on engineering, science and math. She then received an entirely sub par education in science as her physics and chemistry classes were taught by what I can only describe as the most inefficient, incompetent educator I ever witnessed. It was awful. Her math teachers were good.', "Don't come here. Yes, this school is of high ranking, but you will actually destroy your chances at going somewhere amazing and having a good high school experience if you come here. Your GPA will most likely be poor, the student body is always upset, the guidance counselor has made so many mistakes with college applications. This school may seem great, but there are so many problems with it, most students regret this choice. Once you enter, you can never leave, and the administration highly discourages students from speaking out against the problems that are occurring here.", 'The English class there is absolutely no need to do any work. nobody values English, and even the teachers are like "whatever" about it. I honestly don\'t get why this school is rated this high in NJ...', 'Having gone through four years of engineering, Mr. Price\'s "you\'re FRESHMEN!" lectures, forest trips, all-nighters, self-studied APs, and all of the Academy\'s quirks, I can say I love this school - but it\'s not perfect, and while it is a great school with great people, it may not be the best school for everyone. Some people thrive here, and some people would be better off (in a college admissions sense) going to their home district schools; there can be a lot of pressure and a lot of competition. That said, the people are what make the school great, and I wouldn\'t want to have gone anywhere else.', 'not big into sports in this school. They do have a soccer team', 'like I stated before not top quality teachers. They went through 5 different science teachers, when there was only supposed to be 1, 2 different civil engineering teachers. They tell the students to sit and read a book notreally teach about civil engineering. Math teacher was good, spanish teacher was good and so was ELA.', 'the staff is not the most helpful. When my son had a situation with being placed in a class, they were not very helpful', 'I like that the school was small and safe. the students were very well mannered and my son was exposed to different types of engineering fields', 'Not too many extra curricular', 'My son has never had any problems in his high school. Even if he left his laptop there it would still be there days later! Very safe school', "We have a well-supplied lab for the electrical and computer engineering students, something that very few schools in the nation have. We have a few computer labs with various software (programming IDE's, CAD, Microsoft Office, etc.). Our library is small but has a good variety of books.\r All students are provided buses (regardless of distance from the school). The farther you live, the longer the rides are, though even students from Edison and Woodbridge can have long rides since there are more students from these towns to pick up.\r There are resources available for college prep, but I have personally never used them."]

I honestly don\'t get why this school is rated this high in NJ...', 'Having gone through four years of engineering, Mr. Price\'s "you\'re FRESHMEN!" lectures, forest trips, all-nighters, self-studied APs, and all of the Academy\'s quirks, I can say I love this school - but it\'s not perfect, and while it is a great school with great people, it may not be the best school for everyone. Some people thrive here, and some people would be better off (in a college admissions sense) going to their home district schools; there can be a lot of pressure and a lot of competition. That said, the people are what make the school great, and I wouldn\'t want to have gone anywhere else.', 'not big into sports in this school. They do have a soccer team', 'like I stated before not top quality teachers. They went through 5 different science teachers, when there was only supposed to be 1, 2 different civil engineering teachers. They tell the students to sit and read a book notreally teach about civil engineering. Math teacher was good, spanish teacher was good and so was ELA.', 'the staff is not the most helpful. When my son had a situation with being placed in a class, they were not very helpful', 'I like that the school was small and safe. the students were very well mannered and my son was exposed to different types of engineering fields', 'Not too many extra curricular', 'My son has never had any problems in his high school. Even if he left his laptop there it would still be there days later! Very safe school', "We have a well-supplied lab for the electrical and computer engineering students, something that very few schools in the nation have. We have a few computer labs with various software (programming IDE's, CAD, Microsoft Office, etc.). Our library is small but has a good variety of books.\r All students are provided buses (regardless of distance from the school). The farther you live, the longer the rides are, though even students from Edison and Woodbridge can have long rides since there are more students from these towns to pick up.\r There are resources available for college prep, but I have personally never used them."]

column2: ['I am a Senior at the Marine Academy of Science and Technology and have thoroughly enjoyed my time as a student. The teachers are very knowledgable and the curriculum is taught at a high level. That being said, the workload is somewhat overbearing and limits involvement in non-academic activities. The location on Sandy Hook is unbeatable and is utilized as a way to foster the learning environment. There are no sports at MAST and the school has little to no diversity. Ultimately, this school does a very good job preparing a student for college, however they are given a stressful and unconventional High school experience. It is imperative to not only have natural intelligence but to have good organization, time management, and drive to be successful at MAST. Ultimately, the rigorous environment pays off during the college application process and in building overall productive members of society', 'I love all of the aspects of the Marine Academy of Science and Technology. It is one of five career academies administered by the Monmouth County Vocational School District. The school offers small classes with close personal attention. All of the teachers are great. It is a NJROTC unit that has received Distinguished Unit with Academic Honors since the school was founded in 1981. Every course is Honors with the option of taking some APs. It really is a great school.', 'I like the small-school atmosphere and the teacher interaction available to all students. It could use some work in the diversity area, but aside from that this school offers a great opportunity for STEM students and prepares high school students for college.', 'MAST has a beautiful campus. The school is located in Sandy Hook Naional Park. The school owns a boat called the Blue Sea. Students use this boat for some classes. The school has an NJROTC program. The school has an entrance exam.  We have strong math and science program.  Highest math level is multivariate calculus.', "MAST is preparing my son for college, for leadership and for life's challenges. The setting is absolutely amazing.", "I absolutely love the school. It's fun and engaging; if a little stressful at times. The staff is amazing and I really learned a lot.", 'My experience at MAST has been, no doubt, for the better. With its unconventional campus, proximity to the Atlantic Ocean and Sandy Hook Bay, and incredible specialization in Marine Science and Technology, this school is no doubt a considerable experience that any one would be lucky to acquire.', 'I love the school! It is a lot of work, but you know that going in. However, not everyone goes to the school for the NJROTC so I believe that the NJROTC’s influence at MAST should be lower. The school is amazing in every other way! they have a boat!', 'The people you meet and bonds you make with the campus and teachers. Everyone at MAST is somehow the same, yet completely different. Each of our paths are nicely paved by the education we receive and there is always someone to guide you if you ever need help.', 'I really enjoy the close-knit relationships created throughout grades and through all people. However, the ROTC, I believe adds extra amounts of unnecessary stress to students. On the bright side, the ROTC teaches and enforces discipline and attention to detail.', 'What I liked the most about the Marine Academy of Science and Technology was the sense of community. Both students and faculty at this school always look out for each other, creating the atmosphere of a "MAST family." Additionally, students at this school are there for a same reason. This school accepts the top performing students from each district. This exclusivity results in a student body of motivated, driven and enthusiastic learners. The only thing I would change is the emphasis on the NJROTC aspect. Participation in this program is an integral part of the school, but some students are more reluctant than others to become involved with the US Navy. Overall, the Marine Academy of Science and Technology is an outstanding school.', 'This school is very unique due to its location and academic course. It pushed me to have new experiences and exposed me too interests I never even knew I had.', 'I loved my experience at M.A.S.T. and believe that it is a very awesome school to prepare you for college and life beyond high school', "The Marine Academy of Science and Technology is an excellent school that focuses on developing alumni who embody important values like respect, honor, and commitment. The school has a mandatory NJROTC which instills discipline and comes with a great uniform. The academics are spectacular with teachers who truly care about you and want you to succeed. The food is excellent, as the cafeteria is run by a certified chef who makes fantastic food. The school is situated on Sandy Hook and is absolutely beautiful, especially if you're a fan of sunrises. The school has a generally awesome atmosphere and students leave the school with lasting bonds and great memories.", 'The Marine Academy of Science and Technology provides all students with a wonderful opportunity to prepare themselves for a bright and successful future. The academics are challenging, yet rewarding, and all of the teachers are supportive of every student and want to see them flourish. Because it is such a small school, the student body lacks diversity and does not have any sports teams. Despite these small issues, MAST is a tight knit community that will be beneficial for any hardworking student to attend to prepare them for college.', 'Great and academically challenging school. Teachers are amazing and so are the courses. Your experience here will be based on you.', 'Best location best teachers around ! Small classes sizes  and great career academy! Feel wellPrepared for college leaving this school.', 'The students worked hard to get in to M.A.S.T. and the teachers and staff reward that effort every day with an amazing program and an atmosphere of mutual respect.', "It's a hard and fun school. There is never a dull moment and it is definitely not a normal high school experience.", 'Really fun school with a unique environment. Everyone is really close and NJROTC program is enjoyable.']
