column6: ['The Marine Academy of Science and Technology is not a school you want to be deceived into going to. As a student myself, I can confidently say the only positive aspect of this school is the students themselves. Students here are over-worked, and it feels as if those who cheat benefit more than those who have academic integrity. Do not even get me started on teachers. Some teachers are good at this school, but most are not. This "standard" that teachers have on the students is way too high for those who are not at the top of their class. Teacher here (especially in the most needed areas such as math and science) cannot teach, whatsoever. They expect you to learn it yourself. In one case, I tried going for help with a math teacher and was promptly locked out of her classroom. Needs to say I did not do well on that test. I suggest disregarding this school and questioning other students at other schools about the teachers involved with those programs.', "MAST is a unique high school experience that's great for all academic fields, not just science and engineering.  It's not perfect, and it's still high school, but I would definitely recommend MAST over the local high schools.", "I absolutely love the Marine Academy of Science and Technology and honestly would not change much about it. The school's small size gives students the opportunity to learn in a close environment with teachers. All teachers know their students personally so that the highest level of understanding may be achieved. The student diversity is very low from an ethnic standpoint and moderate from a socioeconomic standpoint. The Marine Academy fully prepares students for post-secondary education. The school's clubs have positive benefits towards learning while still remaining fun and challenging for participants. Sports teams are not available at the Marine Academy, so students may play sports for their respective sending districts. Students mostly come from all parts of Monmouth County, whereas some individuals attend the school while living in Middlesex County and other New Jersey counties.", 'A wonderful school and experience. Challenging, yet the organizational and other skills that are acquired with your years at MAST will  benefit you for the rest of your life. From a beautiful campus to proactive students and helpful teachers, MAST is the perfect fit for any student who is up for the challenge and wants to do well in the future.', "I love MAST, and don't think I would be happier anywhere else. The campus is so close to the beach that sometimes we have classes there. The campus is beautiful but I would not say it is the most accessible. It's a long bus ride for almost every student, and being so far away from the rest of the city I cannot imagine the last time MAST Way was paved. Any time it rains, half of the street, which cuts the campus approximately in half, floods. The NJROTC aspect is not nearly as bad as everyone thinks it is. One major downside of the school is that there are no sports teams. Many students play sports at their home high school, but arrive to practice late or have to leave school early to make it to games on time. The classes are fun, most teachers are understandable, and the school is small enough to know everyone like a big family.", 'MAST is academically challenging and you learn a lot. You are required to be part of the Jr. Navy ROTC.  The food in the cafeteria is great! If you want to participate in sports you need to join a team at your "home" high school.', 'MAST was the best opportunity for our son and hopefully for our daughter in 2 years!  Besides the small school feel that Zachary excels in, the courses were challenging and in being so, has prepared him for his next step in college.  The staff (teachers, guidance, etc.) are top notch, giving 150% of their efforts to help the students excel and grow.  I am confident that our son has a "leg up" on the competition he could find in college, due to his 4 years at MAST.', 'This school prepared me for college. I am used to the level of difficulty of the work thanks to my teachers!', 'I feel ready for college because of this school and I have direction', 'We are pretty much all white or atleast half white. However, for our small size we are sexuallu and economically diverse . We are accepting to all classes and races and orientations', 'Good. Available and worth the time.', 'Not a lot of involvemnt, but the ones that are, are committed', 'We really get a great education through the teachers. They want to see us succeed in life. Therefor, the teachers make sure they go above and beyond to ensure every student is getting the most possible out of their class.', 'The school is somewhat unsafe due to the open campus, but never once have I actually felt threatened.', "There's really something for everyone to do at some point in the year.", "This school is the best in its field, and you won't find a more hands-on and prestigious marine science program anywhere else.", "They all want to help you succeed, but they don't baby you .", "There aren't many but they're all very interesting.", 'They are allveterans at their jobs.', 'They staff does everything they canto ensure all students are completely safe at all times.']
column8: ['There are not many of the typical high school extracurriculars but the ones that are available are phenomenal.', 'There are not many schools where your "hands-on" experience is doing research on a 60 foot research vessel in New York harbor.', 'You would have a very tough time finding teachers more skilled in their respective fields than the teachers at the Marine Academy. All the teachers have such a strong passion for what they do and that reflects very well on the students that have had these teachers. There are alumni who come back to visit who are much older but say how great these teachers were even from the beginning.', "Although there aren't many course options until senior year, all of the courses are high quality and challenging.", "It doesn't matter who you are here, you can truly be yourself and people will accept you.", 'In my time at this school I have only had trouble with one teacher. Aside from that all the others were outstanding and highly effective.', 'For the most part the school is very good on dealing with personal matters.', 'There are many clubs available and they are easy to join and get quickly involved in.', 'An overall great experience and education, and if you take advantage of all of the opportunities MAST provides you with, then you will e well on your way to a successful career', "I personally love this school. I have not had many bad experiences, and even thought they don't have spots team the education is definitely worth it.", 'The teachers here are like no other. They have extensive knowledge in their subjects, and are always available to help the students out.', "Teachers and administration are amazing. They truly care about each student's needs and progress. The school provides personalized attention and believes in thoroughly preparing them for college. Top notch education, rigorous courses, and care of students are their top priority and this proves to be evident.", 'Excellent school. All teachers are committed to their students. The majority of students are heavily involved in their educations.', 'MAST is very difficult, and the addition of ROTC adds to the stress. Their bullying "policy" does not exist.', 'People here are very accepting of eachother.', 'Most people at this school are nice to each other and are friends. Most bullying is just teasing. Overall the school is very safe.', "So far, I've had fun at this school even though there is a lot of work and it can be very stressful. The people there are all very friendly, helpful, and supportive. I would choose this school again for the opportunities it gives and the friends and memories I have made.", "I don't usually buy lunch.", 'The students are for the most part nice to each other and behave so there is usually no need for detention or suspension.', 'There are no fields or real gymnasium, but the fitness room has very good equipment and the cafeteria (multipurpose room) is used to play games and volleyball.']

column2: ["Sports run the town and, thus, run the school. Parents have a huge influence. The performance arts division is mildly strong. (Musicals and plays flourish, chorus and orchestra are strong. Band has always struggled.) Almost all teachers are willing to help and will stay after hours to talk with students. Great resources. Very white and very little diversity. Small school which gets boring but it's very safe.", 'Bronxville is very inclusive of new individuals. It is easy to make friends with both the students and teachers, thus for the most part creating a welcoming environment for all.', 'Some of the teachers are super great, but most could improve. Also, the school is rigged for you to succeed. They constantly bump up grades where it is not deserved just so they will look good. That being said, I feel that I have gotten a very good education for the last 12 years in the Bronxville School System. However, the fact that the town is so small makes it a little bit harder to be fully prepared for life post-high school.  At the same time, though, being in a smaller town and a smaller school makes a lot of things easier such as being close with your teachers and knowing everyone in your grade.', "Bronxville High School's academics are really wonderful, and the school really prepares its students for college. However, in my experience, the social culture is not the greatest.", 'I think Bronxville High School is giving me a great education and is helping me a lot with the college process!', 'Bronxville High School is one of the top schools of New York and you are most likely going to have great teachers. There are a some teachers truly love or hate, but that is the situation with any person really. Going after school to talk to teachers show that you care and will encourage you to do better. Guidance counselors and teachers are there for you as long as you speak up and tell them any issues you are having. They want to see you succeed as long as you put the effort into it. The school usually automatically puts you in an honors class and there are many AP classes to choose from. There are many clubs, sports, extracurriculars and classes to make your college application look great.', "I have been going to Bronxville for 12 years and although it is an extremely competitive environment, teachers are so helpful and it is all super manageable. The social life in Bronxville is super fun and seeing all the comments about drinking and drugs makes me sad because that is not necessarily true and honestly most high schools have more drinking and drugs than we do. Bronxville is so unique and it's such a great school! There's something there for everyone whether it is sports or the arts (which have become much more prominent in student life).", "The teacher are fantastic and most of them really do care. There's also a wide array of classes to take.", "There are a decent amount of opportunities here. Although I'm still sad there's no debate club, MUN is generally a good time.", 'The teachers here are great and provide a wonderful education, but that doesn\'t outweigh the negatives about this place. The entire community is exceedingly cruel, vain, and greedy. It\'s all about how much money your parents make and how much of a "lax legend" you are. The environment is also incredibly competitive to the point of being toxic, although it\'s safe to say that the competitiveness isn\'t the only toxic component of this deplorable community. I can\'t wait until I graduate from this hellhole.', 'I like most of my teachers. While a few have been less than satisfactory, most are very knowledgeable and have been very helpful during my time here.', 'Bronxville is highly competitive and students work hard to succeed academically.', 'The teachers care  use a traditional teaching style (lecture) in their lessons.', "There are various types of extracurriculars.  Most people go for sports and this school offers the basic ones. There are some clubs offered and are growing based on student interest.  If there is a club that you want to create the process isn't hard to create one.", 'Bronxville High School is one of the top schools of New York and you are most likely going to have great teachers.  There are a some teachers truly love or hate, but that is the situation with any person really.  Going after school to talk to teachers show that you care and will encourage you to do better.  Guidance counselors and teachers are there for you as long as you speak up and tell them any issues you are having.  They want to see you succeed as long as you put the effort into it.  The school usually automatically puts you in an honors class and there are many AP classes to choose from.  There are many clubs, sports, extracurriculars and classes to make your college application look great.', 'The teachers in Bronxville for the most part are great and are excited to teach students who are willing to learn.  Teachers respond off of students feedback and are always available after school for any additional help.  You have to approach them to be helped and because it is a small school it is easy to form a good relationship with the teacher.', 'Some of the parents are crazy and the amount of pressure put on students at this school is INSANE!', 'The teachers are amazing, most of the time. Some have extremely strong opinions about politics that they share with their students.', 'This is the kind of school where you cannot fall behind. Most everyone is ambitious and hardworking. While this helps the students help each other to strive for success, the highly competitive environment can leave many feeling stressed and inadequate.', 'Most teachers are very invested in what they are teaching, especially those who are thoroughly trained in the topic they are teaching. However, some teachers contribute to the high level of stress that students experience as a result of a looming presence of stiff competition in this school.']

The school usually automatically puts you in an honors class and there are many AP classes to choose from. There are many clubs, sports, extracurriculars and classes to make your college application look great.', "I have been going to Bronxville for 12 years and although it is an extremely competitive environment, teachers are so helpful and it is all super manageable. The social life in Bronxville is super fun and seeing all the comments about drinking and drugs makes me sad because that is not necessarily true and honestly most high schools have more drinking and drugs than we do. Bronxville is so unique and it's such a great school! There's something there for everyone whether it is sports or the arts (which have become much more prominent in student life).", "The teacher are fantastic and most of them really do care. There's also a wide array of classes to take.", "There are a decent amount of opportunities here. Although I'm still sad there's no debate club, MUN is generally a good time.", 'The teachers here are great and provide a wonderful education, but that doesn\'t outweigh the negatives about this place. The entire community is exceedingly cruel, vain, and greedy. It\'s all about how much money your parents make and how much of a "lax legend" you are. The environment is also incredibly competitive to the point of being toxic, although it\'s safe to say that the competitiveness isn\'t the only toxic component of this deplorable community. I can\'t wait until I graduate from this hellhole.', 'I like most of my teachers. While a few have been less than satisfactory, most are very knowledgeable and have been very helpful during my time here.', 'Bronxville is highly competitive and students work hard to succeed academically.', 'The teachers care  use a traditional teaching style (lecture) in their lessons.', "There are various types of extracurriculars.  Most people go for sports and this school offers the basic ones. There are some clubs offered and are growing based on student interest.  If there is a club that you want to create the process isn't hard to create one.", 'Bronxville High School is one of the top schools of New York and you are most likely going to have great teachers.  There are a some teachers truly love or hate, but that is the situation with any person really.  Going after school to talk to teachers show that you care and will encourage you to do better.  Guidance counselors and teachers are there for you as long as you speak up and tell them any issues you are having.  They want to see you succeed as long as you put the effort into it.  The school usually automatically puts you in an honors class and there are many AP classes to choose from.  There are many clubs, sports, extracurriculars and classes to make your college application look great.', 'The teachers in Bronxville for the most part are great and are excited to teach students who are willing to learn.  Teachers respond off of students feedback and are always available after school for any additional help.  You have to approach them to be helped and because it is a small school it is easy to form a good relationship with the teacher.', 'Some of the parents are crazy and the amount of pressure put on students at this school is INSANE!', 'The teachers are amazing, most of the time. Some have extremely strong opinions about politics that they share with their students.', 'This is the kind of school where you cannot fall behind. Most everyone is ambitious and hardworking. While this helps the students help each other to strive for success, the highly competitive environment can leave many feeling stressed and inadequate.', 'Most teachers are very invested in what they are teaching, especially those who are thoroughly trained in the topic they are teaching. However, some teachers contribute to the high level of stress that students experience as a result of a looming presence of stiff competition in this school.']
column8: ["A decent variety of academics is offered, but more is always better. The curriculum doesn't do much to prepare us for real-world situations.", 'Some teachers name-grade, but most are always available for extra help after class hours.', "Somehow, everyone I've been hanging out with since middle school turned out to be queer (including myself), but the rest of the school is painfully white, straight, and Catholic. I can't wait for some diversity in college.", "Nobody usually disobeys rules like the dress code, or bullying others, so that isn't a problem. Detention is given to people who are frequently late to class.", 'The cafeteria is good for snacks, but not a lot else. The meals are mediocre and lack variety. Oh, and stay away from the chicken.', "The counselors are all very helpful when you need them to be, but students have to be willing to reach out to them. The building's facilities are fine, except for one or two sketchy bathrooms. The school does nothing in terms of college prep, and tutoring is available for middle schoolers, but not high schoolers.", "It's good for what students need it for, but as someone who is not interested in sports, it doesn't affect me.", 'Too many sports, not enough art-related activities. The extracurriculars fail to reach out to students of varying interests.', "I wouldn't choose this school because it lacks diversity, too many people are the same and the small town makes me feel like I'm suffocating. Favourite experiences include meeting some incredible people and developing bonds with certain teachers, who I plan to keep in touch with after I graduate.", "The nurses are always happy to help with anything that you need, and are very efficient workers. I've never personally gone to a counsellor for non-academic help, but most are nice and seem willing to listen to your problems and try and help you if needed. Bullying isn't a problem because everyone is too caught up in their own worlds to care much about anyone else.", 'Many of our athletes hold national and regional records, and one girl will be in the 2016 Olympics.', 'The school has given me so many opportunities and allowed me to strive for my best in its challenging environment.', 'With the exception of a few teachers most of them are motivating, kind, entertaining, and challenging in a good way', 'All of our computers are fairly recent models and we have a fully equipped work out room, 3 or 4 gymnasiums and very nice scientific supplies.', 'I think that the school is run very well, all the teachers and administrates have very fair and beneficial policies when it comes to behavior in class and following the rules. As a result there is much conflict among the students.', 'All of the sandwich and and store bought items such as produce are good quality. The food that the cafeteria makes if very greasy and unappetizing. personally I tried some once about five years ago and that was the last time, though its not the worst in the world. A good amount of people still eat the food.', 'We have a good sense of security at our school. Though our facilities are no to the extreme it is ok because we live in a safe and small community with a hospital very close if anyone is to injured or sick for the nurse to handle.', 'Bronxville High school has a wide variety of Extra curricular activities which is nice so that it appeals to all different kinds of people each club has its own vary on tie commitment and it will change depending on the dedication of the student. I personally participate in the Drama Club. When we put on a show we spend about two months on it and any late hours, though regardless of the time commitment it forms a wonderful sense of community between the teachers and student. In the end nothing feels better then practically the entire community cheering you on.', 'I do not come to school with the fear of being beat up, although there is something to be said on the topic of bodily harm. There are so many girls who are borderline anorexic that it is scary. There is a lot of pressure to be as thin as possible, making eating issues a common problem. \r Healthwise, the school has a serious drinking problem as a whole. I know many classmates who are just out of control and a few years away from alcoholism. Many kids are filthy rich, so they actually have the money to support their habits. There is a huge amount of underage drinking, and at times I feel like it is just ridiculous.\r Mental healthwise, bullying is a serious issue. Girl-on-girl bullying is insane. Everyone talks about everyone, and the sports teams are super-cliquey.', 'Our school prides itself on its sports.  We have exceptional student athletes.  A high percentage of them compete at the collegiate level.']

column2: ["Eleanor Roosevelt is a very competitive and rigorous high school. There is a good amount of work given and teachers often give busywork. The school has an extreme lack of diversity and most of the students are white. Facilities in the school are good and everything is clean. Sometimes, I hate being at the school and other times it's ok. Many people I know love going to ELRO but a lot of them also do not like it.", 'Pretty good school, did not like my classmates but most of them were wealthy Upper East Side kids. I felt the teachers cared about me and most of them encouraged me to do well. Wish there was more involvement with preparation for college through advisement at an earlier age.', 'This school is absolutely amazing. As a small school, students foster a sense of community that I didn’t see present at other schools. A small school also doesn’t truly allow for “cliques” because everyone knows each other and are friendly. Students truly want to learn, and form valuable relationships with peers, teachers, and administrators.', 'No diversity!Since this school has District 02 priorities, not many students come from other NY boroughs. This minimizes the chances of having a diverse student body. If you are Hispanic/Black, there are not a lot of people to talk to or who can relate to you. This was the downside to my Elro experience, which became so profound that I ended up transferring. It was hard going to a place everyday where no one would talk to me; I felt invisible and every day became a struggle. On the bright side, the security guard Shirley is the sweetest :) Also Mr. Saliani, the principal, is always looking for ways to improve the school. I think looking at ways to diversify the school is a great place to start.', 'Eleanor Roosevelt High School is a very prestigious public High School and I am happy I went to high school here as they prepared me for college.', "With about 130 kids per grade, we're tight-knit and supportive of one another. Most of the teachers are great, but the workload is a lot. Additionally, it would be nice if there were more course options. As you progress, you get more flexibility, but all sophomores are required to take AP World History and all juniors are required to take AP U.S. History.", 'This school was definitely challenging, but these rigorous academics really prepared me for my college courses. I will forever be grateful!', 'Teachers were approachable and accessible. Small student body made for dialogue to occur. Courses were challenging and expectations were set high. School prepares students well for college and college level courses through work load, readings, discussions, and AP course offerings.', 'At Eleanor Roosevelt we learned a lot but there’s an overwhelming stress to receive a certain Grade rather than actually learning something. Additionally a lot of the teachers have varying   teaching strategies so it makes it very difficult for a person to have a successful teachers. However, the students and the environment in the clubs in the sports in the alliances are great and there’s not a lot of conflict between kids because everyone’s smart and wants to just have a happy and successful high school experience.', 'I absolutely loved my four years at ElRo looking back at it. It was a small community where everyone knew each other. Going to school, you never have to feel any judgements for what you have to say in class. The classrooms are always open for discussions and never once I felt intimidated to speak up.  Of course there are pros and cons to being in a smaller community. But I was able to find myself and build closer relationships with my teachers. The only thing is that I wished we had more resources for sports and arts. Humanities at this school really prepared me for college.', 'This school will prepare you for your future and for college. The gym is non-existent and it is not a sports school. Lots of homework, too much homework. Good music program.', 'Eleanor Roosevelt High School is filled with hard working students. The college counselor is extremely helpful in college process and classes prepare you well for college as well. There could be more hands on learning and going out on field trips to experience what you are learning about. Administration is strict and teachers are personal and caring. The students are mostly from the upper east side which results in lots of cliques forming and school could definitely work on racial and economic diversity.', 'Overall it is an amazing school. The community is welcoming and teachers and administrators really care about our livelihood . Attending this school has honestly been a blessing and I’m safe to say I’m so glad that they chose me to be apart of the graduating class of 2019. By far the friendliest school, it’s always a pleasure to go to school in the morning knowing you are surrounded by the best people. Even our security guards are a delight! The absolute best people you will ever meet in your life, no other place feels so much like home', "It's a highly competitive high school in NYC, and it's predominantly white, located in the Upper East Side. The education itself is high quality, as long as certain teachers are teaching the classes. Otherwise, the school is really safe!", 'Soooo much homework! Some teachers will specifically tell you to set aside 2 or 3 hrs for their homework (each class) on the weekends.  Also, the teachers and students are very set in their ways and are not very open to new/different ideas and opinions (political, societal, functional, etc).  If you are too far ahead in a subject, rather than taking dual enrollment courses for credit, you will have to repeat previous courses.  Also, if you transfer in after Freshman year, the staff is very unhelpful with the transition.', 'The community within Eleanor Roosevelt High School is very tight-knit. All teachers and students support each other. Classes allow learning to be entertaining.', "As a senior at ElRo, I can now say that I have experienced the up's and down's to this small, traditional high school. At ElRo I have had the opportunity to make amazing friendships and build close relationships with many amazing teachers. The academics are rigorous, but I have no doubt that I will be extremely prepared for college. I do wish the community was more diverse, but with its location on the UES and district 2 priority, this is a challenge that might be above the administration's control. I also have not found that ElRo has too many cliques, which is a very common question for parents to ask during tours.", "Eleanor Roosevelt High School is an amazing place to prepare for the academic workload of college. The teachers are fantastic and truly care about their students and I cannot stress enough how dedicated and loving the administration is. The pressure of homework is intense at ELRO, but I've felt very prepared for college because of it. Eleanor Roosevelt High School could seek to improve their after school activities, particularly their clubs.", 'I am currently a Senior at Eleanor Roosevelt High School. The school, though small, does not hold back in providing its students with the best of everything. The faculty is caring and the students are nice to one another.', 'Eleanor Roosevelt High School is a generally good experience. Here we meet great friends, the occasional douchebag, but with a small school like this, almost everyone knows everyone else. We are close knit community and honestly, we meet people we might know for the rest of our lives. Our clubs and sports opportunities are awesome, and you can petition to add more clubs if you wish and have enough people.']

column6: ['I thought going to high school here was excellent! Very diverse, great teachers, and supporting environment. They really helped prepare me for college.', "Everyone is genuinely friendly and I feel safe both at school and in the community. The teachers are relaxed enough to talk to but that doesn't mean that they allow you to slack off.", 'I like that it is a small school.  Very difficult academics but am now prepared for college.  I would suggest this school to anyone that is ready to work hard!', 'ERHS is a small school with no actual gym. My graduating class was 125, while it is usually only 100. There were little diversity in my graduating class, as only about 20 students were from a minority ethnic group. The food was bad and even when it was good (rarely), the serving size sucked.', "I love the environment at ElRo. The faculty and the staff are always caring and willing to put their time and effort into the student's academic success. The teachers hold extra help sessions after school and sometimes even the morning to make sure the students understand their class material. The school work is challenging, but I have heard from many alumni that the amount of work they received during high school was similar to the amount of work they get in college. Everyone at this school is brilliant, so it has taught me to push myself harder in subjects I struggle in.", "Eleanor Roosevelt High School is a very rigorous school academically, which is both good and bad. I feel that I am very prepared for the amount of college work that I receive now, which I am extremely grateful for. However, I didn't feel that I had too much free time in high school at all, due to the mass amounts of homework I would get each night.", 'Great academics. Offers a variety of classes and activities. school lunch is gross, but they let us go out to buy food. Gym is very small, more of a dance studio. ', "It's a great program with a lot of opportunities for students. I would really love to see a change in testing and work amount.", "A highly selective school, Eleanor Roosevelt exceeds the expectation of any screened high school. Eleanor Roosevelt offered so many opportunities to me and implemented strong support systems to help me through high school. It's an amazing high school that allowed me to blossom into a stronger, more confident person. ", 'I love the course options, especially AP Art History which I took this year. I have also really enjoyed the art classes, especially ceramics which was not only fun but really informative and was structured very well (the projects increased in difficulty). I am also looking forward to AP Chemistry next year.', 'All of the teachers offer extra help either before or after school, which is really helpful for students who are struggling. One of my teachers, who I had both last year and this year for Computational Thinking and Physics, stayed until the school closed some nights to help students with projects! His course as well as my other classes were challenging and demanding (especially with the homework!), but the teachers always gave the help we needed. In addition, the teachers at Eleanor Roosevelt are all very knowledgeable in their respective subjects, and most teach advanced courses for smaller classes, such as AP classes or research courses. They are all very approachable, and I have had very good relationships with them over the years!', 'There are a decent amount of extracurricular opportunities for students that range from academic to personal. There is also the option of creating your own club if there is enough support for it.', 'What makes Eleanor Roosevelt High School unique is the class sizes and the school size. Since it is a small school, everyone knows everyone else, and ends up fitting in one way or another.', 'The teachers here try to do the best for the student. They are available for extra help and can even help with personal issues. Some teachers are biased, and play favorites, but for the most part they are helpful and knowledgeable.', 'The school safety guards are very professional and friendly.', 'There is an annual club fair in the second month of the school year to introduce students to different organizations and projects we as a team can help out. Some clubs even have outside activities tied into the program. For example, city walks against various diseases. Bakes are frequent in order to raise fund for causes. Meetings are usually held every week. Not all students show commitment but that is due to the given workload we are all obligated to complete.', "The education here is top notch! From textbook to laptop, the school provides a variety of resources to aid the students to better their education and prep them for college. One thing I do struggle with is the culture the most of the students have created. I can attend this school for 4 years and not no half the grade because the students have formed cliques and don't break those boundaries to make for friends. This happens because there are two types of students at this school, those who are rich and those who are not. This strongly creates a gap between students and makes bonding difficult. However, through years of putting up with this awkward, unspoken attitude, I've learn that it is really not a big deal and one can live through not knowing everyone.", "The teachers at my school constantly reach out to their students because they genuinely care for them. Whether the issue at hand is the student's grade or perhaps family/home problems they're having, the teachers are very welcoming and supportive. Not just some, but all the students here at Eleanor Roosevelt High School strive for excellence and the teachers are more than willing to help the students succeed. They are more of a teacher-friend than a teacher-parent which really helps the students and teachers build a strong, trustworthy connection.", 'It has been an interesting experience, I have learned a lot as well as met a lot of people.  Yet I think I should have transferred after my sophomore year.', "It's challenging but fun. The teachers push me to strive and do my best."]

column2: ['The academics are excellent. The affluent town tries to acquire the best resources, teachers and administrators.  There is competition with other county towns for the same.  The elementary and middle schools follow suit - an expansion of the middle school was just completed.  Sports are an important part of the experience with many students intending to play sports in college.', "Best High School out of three that I've attented. Collefe readiness was by far the best, they even have senior internships.", 'Had a great experience at the high school. There are talented faculty committed to helping students develop their abilities in a variety of different subject areas. The curriculum at the high school allows students to find their preferred course schedule, providing an adequate amount of rigor. The high school has a strong school spirit and culture that bonds the student body together, in addition to the staff. The guidance department is also very knowledgable and approachable.', "I enjoyed taking classes with passionate classmates and teachers who care about student's successes. I wish there was more appreciation for students who are successful in academics instead of student athletes. Much of the school's resources goes towards sports instead of investing in the technology department.", 'New Canaan High School is the ideal environment for a developing teenager. Although New Canaan is not the most diverse town in Connecticut, the school encourages and facilitates students to partake in community service in struggling neighborhoods.', 'New Canaan High School was very welcoming when I moved from a foreign country and began my freshman year there. The teachers are very kind and willing to help us succeed in our academics.', 'New Canaan High School is an excellent high school in the safe and supportive town of New Canaan, Connecticut. The administrators and staff are always committed to helping students and supporting them to the best of their efforts. NCHS provides students with a wealth of resources and extracurricular opportunities and graduates classes well-prepared for college and future endeavors. As a school community, the culture at NCHS is addictive. Whether through pep rallies, school-wide assemblies, or large sporting events, one can always find members of the staff and student body supporting athletes and coaches on and off the fields. In addition, the arts are encouraged and appreciated through art shows and displays throughout the school. While NCHS is somewhat secluded and limited in its diversity within its student population, students are inclusive and kind to all. Ultimately, New Canaan High School is an excellent place that supports all students and faculty and all are treated well.', 'Well prepared for college.  Diverse classes,  many AP courses.  Excellent teachers in science field.', 'The school itself is great: good staff, wonderful academic opportunities, and course options for everyone.', 'They monitor snaps and texts sent over WiFi just to get kids suspended and expelled. Teachers don’t teach, they just hand out work and expect us to know it 4 days later for the test. They give out student of the month to people who definitely don’t deserve it, just to make other kids feel bad. They do well with prepping for college as it’s all just busy work totally unrelated to class with a ton of textbook self studying involved. Everything revolves around sports, and nobody is recognized for anything else (some people go as far as shaming smart kids for having “no life”).', 'Overall very friendly and supportive staff, plenty of opportunities for extra help and services. All teachers seem to care deeply about you and want to see you succeed.  Social scene is very cliquey and not very diverse. Amazing sports team with dedicated coaches', 'As a graduate of New Canaan High School, I would say I have a healthy understanding of the environment  and was very involved during my time there. As of now, I am thriving in college and I give much credit and many thanks to my teachers as well as administration for that. I was one of the few minority students, and although it was noticeable, I wasn’t uncomfortable because teachers would not make an effort to point me out as being different. Clubs and activities were helpful when it came to finding people either who looked like me or were similar to me in another way because you are joining clubs for things everyone in it is interested in.', 'The New Canaan High School is not very diverse, which is not the high schools fault, but rather the towns fault. The school has very good lunches and the academics are on point. The teachers are mostly okay apart from the occasional one that does not act the best.', "The school is great by it's self, but it's the teachers and that students that make it better. Th guidance councilors are always there to help and so are the teachers. It seems as if they all have you best interests in mind.", 'A good school with great resources and overall great people to learn with. People were always helpful and always willing to learn.', 'Honestly wanted to give it three stars for the student community but the education system is pretty solid. Great facility and pretty advanced academics with a lot of support.', "Teachers need improvement. They need to be more supportive and understanding, and unfortunately many are not. NCHS is too stressful and there isn't much of a support system for the students in general. There's no diversity at all which is horrible, and that also needs to change.", 'I adored my involvement with New Canaan High School in light of the scholarly difficulties and distinctive open doors for learning. I have never felt exhausted with my classes at New Canaan High School, and I am constantly given the chance to attempt new courses. The courses are thorough, however, they generally instruct and persuade me to attempt my hardest in everything. Despite the fact that I have had an extraordinary involvement with NCHS, my school is intensely weighted into their games groups, and I do wish there was more consideration on the things like Art Clubs and Art occasions and our school paper, which I am engaged with. Despite the fact that I take an interest in three games groups, I do feel like there ought to be more consideration regarding different parts of our school and our understudy body.', 'The environment is friendly with the staff and other students. The education and clubs prepare your great for college.', 'Given the fact that the basketball coach was just arrested for Heroin https://www.stamfordadvocate.com/policereports/article/Basketball-coach-arrested-for-heroin-possession-12798701.phphttp://stamford.dailyvoice.com/police-fire/new-canaan-basketball-coach-caught-with-heroin-in-stamford-fired/735134/and the BOE had yet to hold anyone accountable I would not rate this as the safest school, if you expect your kids to be kept safe during school and their afterschool activities.']
column4: ['The academics are excellent. The affluent town tries to acquire the best resources, teachers and administrators.  There is competition with other county towns for the same.  The elementary and middle schools follow suit - an expansion of the middle school was just completed.  Sports are an important part of the experience with many students intending to play sports in college.', "Best High School out of three that I've attented. Collefe readiness was by far the best, they even have senior internships.", 'Had a great experience at the high school. There are talented faculty committed to helping students develop their abilities in a variety of different subject areas. The curriculum at the high school allows students to find their preferred course schedule, providing an adequate amount of rigor. The high school has a strong school spirit and culture that bonds the student body together, in addition to the staff. The guidance department is also very knowledgable and approachable.', "I enjoyed taking classes with passionate classmates and teachers who care about student's successes. column6: ["New Canaan High School has some of the best teachers in any school district. They prepare you for college unlike any other whether that be through their classes, homework, extra help or just being involved and engaged. While their I was able to successfully balance school, athletics and social life without a problem. NCHS has some of the most successful athletic programs in the state, and even if you don't play that sport your fellow students, teachers and administration are their to cheer you on.", 'A fantastic school in terms of academics and athletics. It prepares students very well for higher education.', 'New Canaan High School has truly provided me with a foundation for the rest of my education career. The exemplary teachers and rigorous course work, while at times overwhelming, have prepared me for college in more ways I can explain. The school pride rings throughout- the "Bomb Squad" will show up to any game, rowdy as ever, to cheer on the Rams. I am truly grateful for the experiences I\'ve had at this school.', "The students at NCHS are, for the majority, very kind and supportive. The teachers are almost all fun to be in class with and will keep you engaged and driven. The opportunities for classes are great and keep you on top of your game. The extracurriculars are also great with many options and a lot of dedication. The theatre department is particularly special and is truly a family that's amazing to be a part of.", "New Canaan High School offers endless opportunities to those who attend, aka me. With a system that ensures the students graduate and most likely move on to a University this school has an amazing success rate. However, the kids are quite entitled due to the wealth of the town. Not to mention, the lack in diversity also creates racism within the school. Overall I am grateful for the opportunities provided to me but would love to see a shift in the diversity within the school and more accepting of students in other districts who don't have the wealth to live in New Canaan.", 'Great Academics, fantastic teachers, amazing food and beautiful town. Only problem is the students, who are overly hostile. I thought my school was normal and people were just mean until we had exchange students and other people who visited. Upon talking to them, I found that they saw New Canaan as a school with an overly judgemental and all around mean student body', 'I have had an overall great experience at New Canaan High School. The combination of challenging classes and excellent teachers has proven to be very beneficial to my education and preparedness for college. I am so glad to have gone to such an amazing school with a very welcoming community.', 'The teachers were all very supportive and understanding with the exception of a couple. Otherwise, my teachers were all very personable and I got to know most of them well. Every morning, my high school administrators wait outside (no matter the temperature or weather) to greet everyone. They always truly cared how everyone was feeling every single day. The food in the cafeteria ("The Lounge") was delicious. There were many different options for every student to choose from and the options were changed up most days. The staff in the cafeteria was also so nice and they always had a smile on their faces. My principal, Bill Egan, has been the most amazing principal. He gets to know all of his 1200+ students by name and knows many of them personally. I think the school has benefitted incredibly from Mr. Egan taking the position of Head Principal.', "New Canaan High is an interesting school. It can be very cliquey so be careful who your friends are. I didn't become more true to who I was until getting to college and it honestly is so much more fun and liberating, I wish I would've been more free in high school. Going to New Canaan High, getting a good start on your future isn't very difficult because teachers and counselors make sure your on the right track.", 'The overall education at New Canaan High was flawless. Teachers were engaged and highly available as well as helped tremendously with college prep. Wish it was a little more diverse and the kids were not all exactly the same but it is a great school district that will push kids academically but get them very well prepared.', 'New Canaan High School believes that their students should pursue in either academics or sports and they would encourage you to pursue that goal. The community is very safe and diverse and you can always feel welcomed.', "New Canaan High School has great academic resources if you are motivated and or smart enough to take advantage of them. It gives you the platform to get into any college that you want just like a private/boarding school does. Sports here are very dominant, especially lacrosse and football, with much of the accolades being given to athletes with little focus on students' academic accomplishments. The social scene here is very cliquey and it's ostensible if you just look around the caffeteria. Cheating on assignments and tests is pretty rampant here and although some teachers will be strict on that type of behavior, most look the other way; looking to keep their high-quality college matriculation churning. You'll have your pothead burnouts, but the stereotypical people here are taking AP classes, aiming for a top-tier college, all while being all FCIAC on a sports team, while hooking up and binge drinking on the weekend in their happily complacent parents' basements.", 'Great school for learning and extracurriculars. Best sports teams in the state. There is no violence or misbehaving in classrooms. Tough classes but it pays off when many students are going to Ivy League colleges.', 'I personally love NCHS.  The teachers are all amazing and dedicated to their jobs and their students.  The school provides so many opportunities for us and constantly is trying to improve our school environment.', "I have loved my experience at NCHS starting on day one of entering the main building. The staff and students are helpful, the teachers want you to try your hardest, so they encourage and motivate you to push yourself academically. They also love to hear about their student's outside activities/extracurriculars they are involved with. Overall, a great atmosphere surrounds NCHS!", 'I loved my experience at New Canaan High School because of the academic challenges and different opportunities for learning. I have never felt bored with my classes at New Canaan High School, and I am always given the opportunity to try new courses. The courses are rigorous, but they always teach and motivate me to try my hardest in everything. Although I have had a great experience at NCHS, my school is heavily weighted into their sports teams, and I do wish there was more attention on the things like Art Clubs and Art events and our school paper (The Courant), which I am involved in. Even though I participate on three sports teams, I do feel like there should be more attention to other aspects of our school and our student body.', 'Spends most of money on academics and sports, little to no art good art programs or art culture for students.', "I have loved my experience at NCHS starting on day one of entering the main building. The staff and students are helpful, the teachers want you to try your hardest, so they encourage and motivate you to push yourself academically. They also love to hear about their student's outside activities/extracurriculars they are involved with. Overall, a great atmosphere surrounds NCHS!", 'There are almost too many clubs/activities to choose from.  My children love to participate in the charity related activitiesj', 'New Canaan High School has extremely caring and committed teachers']

column2: ['In my years in Rye High School I have had the opportunity to meet a lot of people and get close with teachers but Rye is a really competitive school in every possible way. I would like to change all the clicks in groups and how much people judge each other.', 'Rye High School has great teachers and a high academic rigor. The school prepares you well for college.', "Rye High School, nationally ranked as one of the best public high schools in the country. A title won by pitting students against one another and shaming other students into remission. It's an environment of favorites, driven by donors and entitled children with entitled parent by their side. This high pressure environment pushed students to cope in extreme ways.", 'Rye was a very good school but was very academic specific. It would be nice to see more extracurricular and outside of the classroom opportunities for students to be able to take part in.', 'A great place with little to no bullying. The teachers are extremely well educated and get at their jobs. Was beyond prepared for college.', "An all-white school that bullies kids that don't fit in. If you don't say the N word and don't drink or smoke, then you end up with no friends sitting alone on a Friday afternoon.  Education is great, teachers are great, but its very tough to find a group of friends if you are different", 'Prepared me well for the workload of college due to all the honors and AP courses that were available, but no real support in terms of figuring out your actual long term goals other than pressure to get into a good college.', 'Rye High School is a school containing a multitude of cliques. Any idea that has been prevalent throughout the years in the school and the community. Students have the opportunity to do well in the school academically if they so choose. There are many resources for success such as x-period, any opportunity for students to talk to all of their teachers after school. Lasting from 2:32-3:00 and many teachers will stay later. There are numerous clubs and activities. Diversity is severely lacking,  but a proper education remains.', 'I love my high school. It is considered one of the top schools in my area! The teachers are always there to assist and they are always willing to work after school with you to improve your grades. I really like the our resource room and x-periods. It allows me to seek additional help and complete my homework while I am still in work mode. My senior year got off to a rock start because I am very nervous about getting in the a good school. Everyone walks the hall with their favorite school sweatshirt on! I totally felt left out. Now I can proudly say I a can wear a sweatshirt and be proud of the college I will be attending!!', 'I enjoy Rye High School because it pushes me to challenge myself with rigorous courses (APs). This school also provides the average facility for sports and the positive environment. However, due to the insane pressure on academics and grades for college prep, there are always problems with students when it comes to alcohol and substance abuse. Nonetheless, it does have many wonderful teachers who are always willing to push me to achieve my goals.', 'I have loved my time at RHS.  It is a small school so you know everyone in your classes and get close with many people.  The classes are interesting and Rye truly cares about giving students their best chances during high school and after.', 'The teachers and faculty at RHS were the leading cause for my positive feelings I attribute towards Rye High. It held a strong sense of community considering the town was very small and everyone was familiar with everyone. I felt safe at all times and the education I received was phenomenal. The only thing RHS lacked mostly was strong diversity.', "I've had an enjoyable time at Rye although I lament it's lack of diversity and wish I'd been more exposed to different perspectives. Despite the lack of diversity, however, students at RHS are on the whole very open-minded and accepting of others. I've had a pleasant experience as an openly out LGBT person without being the victim of or witnessing bullying of any sort. Most of my teachers have been well-qualified and good at their jobs. A small few have been sub-par or just awful at teaching. The science department in particular I feel is lacking in strong teachers. Rye does have a strong and well-resourced art department for a public school, and breeds many creative  students by offering an array of opportunities and encouraging artistic accomplishment. The school does a good job of preparing students for the rigor of college, yet the atmosphere is quite competitive and can be challenging to deal with at times, especially for the majority of students with such busy schedules.", 'Great education. the only problem with the school is that there is a huge drug culture. being in one of the wealthiest towns in the united states, most children have access money their parents give them, and unfortunately spend that money on vapes, juuls, and alcohol. We have had 8 deaths from Rye High Alumns who are in college within the past 5 years. It is unfortunate that rye doesnt prepare there kids for the temptations of drugs and alcohol in the real world, and really need to step up in showing the kids these dangers. They do try to have  assemblies to speak up about the dangers on drugs, but these have mostly turned into jokes which kids forget soon after.', 'This a small school with small town politics that can play into the school. The school has great advantages and benefits but several downfalls.', "Academically, it's got everything I could ask for. Teachers are great except for the physics department, which for some reason is horrible. Not diverse at all; the vast majority of students are rich and white. Those who aren't white are most likely rich immigrants. Creates a bubble for students in which the stereotypical elitist spoiled brat thrives.", "Rye High School has amazing opportunities and resources for students to use.  There are dedicated, hard-working teachers who help their students succeed in every way possible.  One of the main things I would hope to see change is for the school to become more diverse.  It is filled with great people, but it's always nice to see new faces.", 'Rye High School is a school that will always be a part of my life. It shaped to be who I am as a person. The education in the school was stellar and it helped me in knowing what I want to be in the future. It helped me figure out my "game plan" or the next steps in my life. Rye High School led for me to find some great friends that are a part of my future plans and even though we will all be going our separate ways everyone will hold a special place in my heart. I am very grateful to the school and proud to say I attended Rye High School.', "Extracurriculars can be found everywhere at Rye High School. There is always an opportunity to join clubs or organizations that you enjoy. Even if you don't find a club that you like, the administration is very open to strongly consider it to be a new club at the school!", 'My overall experience at Rye High School has been great. I have had lasting friendships that have started from high school. All of the staff have been super supportive of guiding me through high school and making sure I got through all of the requirements. I would without a doubt choose to go to Rye High School again because it is a great place for anyone to be comfortable and have a great high school experience.']

The teachers are extremely well educated and get at their jobs. Was beyond prepared for college.', "An all-white school that bullies kids that don't fit in. If you don't say the N word and don't drink or smoke, then you end up with no friends sitting alone on a Friday afternoon.  Education is great, teachers are great, but its very tough to find a group of friends if you are different", 'Prepared me well for the workload of college due to all the honors and AP courses that were available, but no real support in terms of figuring out your actual long term goals other than pressure to get into a good college.', 'Rye High School is a school containing a multitude of cliques. Any idea that has been prevalent throughout the years in the school and the community. Students have the opportunity to do well in the school academically if they so choose. There are many resources for success such as x-period, any opportunity for students to talk to all of their teachers after school. Lasting from 2:32-3:00 and many teachers will stay later. There are numerous clubs and activities. Diversity is severely lacking,  but a proper education remains.', 'I love my high school. It is considered one of the top schools in my area! The teachers are always there to assist and they are always willing to work after school with you to improve your grades. I really like the our resource room and x-periods. It allows me to seek additional help and complete my homework while I am still in work mode. My senior year got off to a rock start because I am very nervous about getting in the a good school. Everyone walks the hall with their favorite school sweatshirt on! I totally felt left out. Now I can proudly say I a can wear a sweatshirt and be proud of the college I will be attending!!', 'I enjoy Rye High School because it pushes me to challenge myself with rigorous courses (APs). This school also provides the average facility for sports and the positive environment. However, due to the insane pressure on academics and grades for college prep, there are always problems with students when it comes to alcohol and substance abuse. Nonetheless, it does have many wonderful teachers who are always willing to push me to achieve my goals.', 'I have loved my time at RHS.  It is a small school so you know everyone in your classes and get close with many people.  The classes are interesting and Rye truly cares about giving students their best chances during high school and after.', 'The teachers and faculty at RHS were the leading cause for my positive feelings I attribute towards Rye High. It held a strong sense of community considering the town was very small and everyone was familiar with everyone. I felt safe at all times and the education I received was phenomenal. The only thing RHS lacked mostly was strong diversity.', "I've had an enjoyable time at Rye although I lament it's lack of diversity and wish I'd been more exposed to different perspectives. Despite the lack of diversity, however, students at RHS are on the whole very open-minded and accepting of others. I've had a pleasant experience as an openly out LGBT person without being the victim of or witnessing bullying of any sort. Most of my teachers have been well-qualified and good at their jobs. A small few have been sub-par or just awful at teaching. The science department in particular I feel is lacking in strong teachers. Rye does have a strong and well-resourced art department for a public school, and breeds many creative  students by offering an array of opportunities and encouraging artistic accomplishment. The school does a good job of preparing students for the rigor of college, yet the atmosphere is quite competitive and can be challenging to deal with at times, especially for the majority of students with such busy schedules.", 'Great education. the only problem with the school is that there is a huge drug culture. being in one of the wealthiest towns in the united states, most children have access money their parents give them, and unfortunately spend that money on vapes, juuls, and alcohol. We have had 8 deaths from Rye High Alumns who are in college within the past 5 years. It is unfortunate that rye doesnt prepare there kids for the temptations of drugs and alcohol in the real world, and really need to step up in showing the kids these dangers. They do try to have  assemblies to speak up about the dangers on drugs, but these have mostly turned into jokes which kids forget soon after.', 'This a small school with small town politics that can play into the school. The school has great advantages and benefits but several downfalls.', "Academically, it's got everything I could ask for. Teachers are great except for the physics department, which for some reason is horrible. Not diverse at all; the vast majority of students are rich and white. Those who aren't white are most likely rich immigrants. Creates a bubble for students in which the stereotypical elitist spoiled brat thrives.", "Rye High School has amazing opportunities and resources for students to use.  There are dedicated, hard-working teachers who help their students succeed in every way possible.  One of the main things I would hope to see change is for the school to become more diverse.  It is filled with great people, but it's always nice to see new faces.", 'Rye High School is a school that will always be a part of my life. It shaped to be who I am as a person. The education in the school was stellar and it helped me in knowing what I want to be in the future. It helped me figure out my "game plan" or the next steps in my life. Rye High School led for me to find some great friends that are a part of my future plans and even though we will all be going our separate ways everyone will hold a special place in my heart. I am very grateful to the school and proud to say I attended Rye High School.', "Extracurriculars can be found everywhere at Rye High School. There is always an opportunity to join clubs or organizations that you enjoy. Even if you don't find a club that you like, the administration is very open to strongly consider it to be a new club at the school!", 'My overall experience at Rye High School has been great. I have had lasting friendships that have started from high school. All of the staff have been super supportive of guiding me through high school and making sure I got through all of the requirements. I would without a doubt choose to go to Rye High School again because it is a great place for anyone to be comfortable and have a great high school experience.']
column6: ["The teachers in Rye High School are the best! All of the teachers I've had throughout my 4 years were all very knowledgeable individuals. They are always looking to help the students before, during, and after school. They teach by incorporating technology, which helps students with having access to assignments and other work. In my personal experience, each teacher has been fair with grading, as well as treating their students with respect.", 'There are always options at any High School one decides to attend.', 'The security officers at Rye High School are one of the best parts about this school. They are so friendly and funny!', "Other than sports people aren't involved in school clubs. What I mean by involved is that they will  simply go to a few club meetings but for the most part don't care.", 'Rye High School is a hard school to fit into too because just like almost every High school you have to deal with difficult teenagers whose priorities can be skewed.', 'Teachers at Rye High School, for the most part, care about the students and will make the effort to help.', "There are lots of sports, clubs and theater opportunities. Students and get involved in many ways as well as create their own club if there isn't one based on their interests.", 'The teachers are incredibly engaging and caring. They work very hard and take a lot of pride in their work.', 'There are several all school assemblies addressing each of these. Bullying is not tolerated. Several drills are performed regarding emergency drills. Health is discussed in all gym classes in addition to it being a required 10th grade class.', 'You get out of it what you put into it. The teachers really have a mutual respect for students and really love to teach and engage students in interesting work.', 'Rye High School is where great teachers are found.', 'Education. It is very engaging. It provides students a variety of different ways to learn. Different topics with educated teachers from all over who know their topics very well. New curriculum is always coming out. For example, a few years ago they started an engineering currlculum.', 'The intense level or study has prepared me for college.', 'BEC and pancakes are a staple to my breakfast', 'Very helpful--always willing to answer questions during their lunch or free periods', 'Just got a brand new science wing', 'Because the after school activities are all student led, there can be some disorganization regarding times and locations of meetings. Each club has a faculty advisor who helps guide the club leaders.', 'Essentially every single Rye High School student and faculty member attend the Rye Harrison game', 'Rye High School is a very politically correct school.  Acceptance is guaranteed as long as the student is friendly and honest.  Joining one of the many clubs or school activities is an easy acceptance for any student with issues.', 'Most things are great, but the corruption with the principal and school board are dragging the school down from where it could and should be.\r By far the best public [non-charter] school in New York state.\r Some of the downsides are also due to NY Dept of Education not having a clue about how the good schools operate.']

column2: ['Students are very friendly and welcoming. Since the school is open campus, you have the freedom to leave campus during free periods or during lunch to get food at nearby restaurants or cafes. The school also offers a wide range and variety of clubs that are very fun!', "I think that my experience so far at MHS, has been pretty good. I love the environment and the freedom because it makes me motivated to be successful. However, often times I feel like what I am learning in my classes aren't significant and we are often only learning material for the exam at the end of the year.", 'I wish that they offered APs or difficult classes earlier on but I do enjoy walking in the MHS doors in the mornings. Amazing music opportunities!!!', "I was able to play volleyball all four years and got a family out of it. My coaches who support me beyond the court. Within my club at school, GSA, I was able to feel accepted and safe to be myself. The teachers here all show that they want to be here. It’s about making kids want to show everyday. The most amazing thing to come from my high school experience has to be the connections I made. It wasn't just the connection with my peers, it was the teachers who chose to see me. To see beyond a letter grade they could give me.", 'Mamaroneck High School was a great educational experience. The teachers are all extremely helpful and understanding. The resources offered by the school, such as the library were also amazing.', "I think MHS was better than an average high school. I've always felt safe at the school and happy to have had so much freedom (open campus, free periods, etc). Overall, teachers are good in preparing you with the material, but I did come across some teachers that were somewhat inadequate. AP classes were challenging but definitely helped prepare me for college, although I do wish they offered more.", 'Mamaroneck High School is a great high school in Mamaroneck, New York. I had a wonderful four years at Mamaroneck High School, and it prepared me very well for college.', 'Leaving MHS, I felt prepared for college. There are teachers and guidance counselors at MHS that will change your life--they opened door for me, when I saw none. Very thankful for this school.', 'I loved mamaroneck high school. All the students are pretty nice to eachother and though there are cliques, like at every school, everyone is very welcoming and everyone talks to one another. There is virtually no bullying and it is a good environment to learn in because your classmates push you to succeed as well.', 'I liked the classes and some of the teachers but a lot of people juul in the bathrooms and I don’t like that', "I like the amount of extracurricularactivities that it provides to all students. However, the thing I hate most is that this school's community is very divided. Cliques fill everywhere and people feel like they have to be with someone all the time or they'll get judged or be looked down by others. You could clearly see this social gap between boys and girls as well which is rather too apparent.", 'Athletics are fun, academics are great but RIGOROUS if you decide to take plenty of honors and AP courses especially junior year. If you care about your grades stay away from Spanish at all costs, as Spanish 3H (sophomore year) is the most difficult and punitive class in the entire school. Highly competitive environment academically, as scores of students aim for top 10 universities every year. Biggest problem with the school is stress and the somewhat segregated social scene. With all the stress, it’s unsurprising that Mamaroneck kids tend to really let loose on the weekends.', 'The school was over all good. I was in the APPLE programand they were very good on there education and how they would break thing down for us to we can learn it more clearer than the other students.', 'I honestly am so lucky to have attended this institution. This is one of the best high schools around and I would highly recommend the district to any family. Although it may not seem to be the most diverse, the elementary schools are currently more diverse than ever before and will add to the ethnic palette of the school, but we are still big on focusing on and empathizing with other cultures. So many faculty are there waiting for your needs. I had an amazing experience at this school and I will miss it dearly.', "Mamaroneck High School is a great college-prepatory high school with a terrific assortment of AP class choices. I feel it has prepared my son very well for whatever college he ends up attending.  Our guidance counselor is absolutely top-notch and has been an invaluable guide for our family in the often-overwhelming college process.  I really wouldn't change anything except for two things -- (1) it would be nice to see more Honors classes at the freshman and sophomore levels, especially in English, and (2) I strongly believe that the annual award ceremony held by the school in the spring (that is invitation-only) should be for Seniors only.  The Junior year and lower categories seem to be more of a popularity contest, where awards go to the student who is most beloved by those who are deliberating rather than which student is the most deserving, has the highest academic achievement, or has the most accomplishments in their field of study both in and outside the school.", 'My overall experience at MHS has been great! The school has allowed me to really grow as both a student and a person since I started attending two years ago.', 'No College or University courses for advanced students available. Math is up to Calculus only for seniors. Very VERY average academics.  Students are entitled and very lazy in gym. Enthusiastic students are almost oblivious among the dull population. Everyone is ALWAYS ON THEIR PHONES.', "teachers are great. Coursework is pretty rigorous if you want it to be, but even if classes aren't that hard, you don't get any free passes. sports are a blast and everyone can play. administration is kind of overbearing at times but mostly stays uninvolved in regular matters unless they need to be involved. overall feel ready for college and have a good foundation.", 'My four years in this school have been great. They have great programs and a nice environment! I love all the opportunities I have gotten from this school. It has made me a more confident person and also enriched my understanding of different materials.', "Great school, very welcoming environment and teachers are always willing to work with their students to help them as much as possible. However, the principle's values are antiquated and she does not respect many of the faculty members."]
