However, the principle's values are antiquated and she does not respect many of the faculty members."]
column6: ["Teachers are great for the most part. For a public school, it is pretty well funded. Many of our better teachers went to prestigious schools, and a few of them have PhDs in their subjects. We don't get enough snow days, though.", 'Mamaroneck High School is the best school in all of Westchester County. The education is amazing, as well as all the freedom and responsibility that the students are gifted with.', "The school is very organized and safe. The teachers get to know all of their students well. However, I wish class sizes were a bit smaller because now they are from 25-35 kids which is pretty large. I also wish we had more freedom in the AP classes we can take. You can only choose from three AP classes starting junior year which is frustrating especially if you don't like the classes offered.", 'Mamaroneck High School offers great programs and courses to get you ahead and start to prepare for college. Every single teacher wants their students to succeed and go beyond their pay roll to do so. I know teachers who would sacrifice their lunch break for you just so you could understand the material. My favorite class ever was probably Creative Writing. My teacher, Mr. Bosch inspired me to become the writer I am today. Go tigers!!', 'Teachers are excellent, good culture- however, their support services are limited, and the competitive climate of the school makes for a great deal of student stress.', "I agree that Mamaroneck High School is an excellent school, however it is not condusive to children who are more laid-back or less competitive when it comes to school work. As someone with severe ADHD, I can't deny that it has been difficult  to fully assimilate into the highly competitive student mentality that exists at this school.", "This school is decent. I went through whole 4 years without any struggles or troubles. It's a friendly studying environment. Encouraging people to engage in sports, clubs. I used to hate on teachers, but ironically I miss them now. The teachers are regularly checked by District Department, so they're really good (comparing to the college).", "I loved my experience with Mamaroneck High School. The school provides countless opportunities no matter what one might be interested in. From robotics to athletics to performing arts, MHS provides possibilities for any student to pursue their passions. The teachers are excellent and know what they're doing, the preparation for college applications is well thought out, and there are over 25 sports teams at MHS.", "My high school experience has been very good. It's given me an opportunity to grow as both a student and a person. The school gives a very large opportunity to succeed academically with the wide variety of class choices you receive as well as the bountiful hours of extra help teachers offer. Outside of classes, the school offers many clubs and great athletic teams with coaches that really care for the team. While there are a few things here and there that are a bit irritable, my experience at Mamaroneck High School has been great.", 'Mamaroneck High school was amazing. They thoroughly prepared me for college. All of the teachers are qualified and are passionate about the students and the subjects that they teach. They also have a very wide range of electives to get students to start to think about what they want to do before they attend college.', 'Very competitive High school.Easy transition into any Ivy or top tier university.The teachers all went to top schools and are very considerate. The best public school around the NY area.', "Mamaroneck High School has a big divide. It's either privileged white kids or hispanic kids from Mamaroneck who have a hard time speaking English. Academics are decent, but teachers could definitely be better. Some are great and some are horrific.", 'In my experience, Mamaroneck High School is a great school in terms of academics and college readiness. However, it faltered when it came to diversity, not only within the student body, but with teachers as well.', 'I am in my junior year of high school. My experience at this school has been wonderful. I love my teachers and my classes. This school has a lot to offer-  academics, clubs, and athletics', "The school is good, but the events are inconsistent, and so are the programs. Couldn't have asked for a better education though.", 'I am currently a Mamaroneck High School senior taking mainly arts classes such as Advanced Dance, Music, and theater as well as Concert Chior and a small all girl singin group called InTreble. This is a great school for the arts, as it has two theaters, a dance studio, three music rooms, and a number of practice rooms. Each space is fully equipped with instruments, lights, and sound. You can do up to eight shows a year, not including small recitals or other events. The English department is very strong and boasts a fantastic staff and curriculum. The other subject areas are about average for high school. Mamaroneck has a number of sports teams, varsity and JV, as well as many club sports. The gym and practice facilities are being completely renovated this summer.', 'I am lucky to have been enrolled here! Wonderful overall experience and also looks great on a transcript!', 'Mamaroneck High School offers a wide variety of interesting courses with great teachers and programs.', 'Mamaroneck High School has a lot of opportunities, such as a great art and music program, many AP classes, and a lot of decision about, which classes to take in your last two years.', 'Mamaroneck High School was a very interesting school. There is a great division between races, and I personally think there is a lot of segregation. I would be in classrooms where I would be the only latina in the class and I would feel out of place because everyone else knew or had someone they could talk to . I wish i could have been more involved in sports during my four years there. I made very strong relationships with the teachers and became  very close to my guidance counselor. ']

I love my teachers and my classes. This school has a lot to offer-  academics, clubs, and athletics', "The school is good, but the events are inconsistent, and so are the programs. Couldn't have asked for a better education though.", 'I am currently a Mamaroneck High School senior taking mainly arts classes such as Advanced Dance, Music, and theater as well as Concert Chior and a small all girl singin group called InTreble. This is a great school for the arts, as it has two theaters, a dance studio, three music rooms, and a number of practice rooms. Each space is fully equipped with instruments, lights, and sound. You can do up to eight shows a year, not including small recitals or other events. The English department is very strong and boasts a fantastic staff and curriculum. The other subject areas are about average for high school. Mamaroneck has a number of sports teams, varsity and JV, as well as many club sports. The gym and practice facilities are being completely renovated this summer.', 'I am lucky to have been enrolled here! Wonderful overall experience and also looks great on a transcript!', 'Mamaroneck High School offers a wide variety of interesting courses with great teachers and programs.', 'Mamaroneck High School has a lot of opportunities, such as a great art and music program, many AP classes, and a lot of decision about, which classes to take in your last two years.', 'Mamaroneck High School was a very interesting school. There is a great division between races, and I personally think there is a lot of segregation. I would be in classrooms where I would be the only latina in the class and I would feel out of place because everyone else knew or had someone they could talk to . I wish i could have been more involved in sports during my four years there. I made very strong relationships with the teachers and became  very close to my guidance counselor. ']

column2: ["It's a really good school! Great for if you want to pursue anything in the communications field. However, opportunities are limited for those interested in other fields.", 'I picked Communications High School because it has a lot of resources if you’re interested in entering a career within communications or visual arts. The art, film, and print teachers are the best, and prepare students in their fields to a point where they could basically start their careers whenever they want. There is a lot here that you can only get in larger schools though, like AP classes, adequate time for clubs, sports are nearly impossible to do if you live over 20 minutes away. But it can be extremely helpful if you know exactly what you want to do.', "I like that Communications High School is like one big family. With a small grade of 80 kids, I quickly have gotten to know and become best friends with everyone. The teachers are always willing to help, and it's overall a very positive environment to be in.", "Communications High School is an amazing place to learn, genuinely one of the best schools out there. I feel so lucky that I'm able to attend, as it provides a unique and rewarding learning experience.", "Communications is a small, tight-knit school. The students are all very friendly and helpful. We often don't even to lock our lockers because that's how safe this school is. The teachers are very kind and knowledgable, and the ones who teach electives have all worked in their field. The only downside to some is there is not competitive sports, but there is a gym with workout equipment available to use.", 'This school is a great environment for anyone who is willing to put in the work, but still have a lot of fun as well. Communications offers a variety of options to study in order to help you with choosing a career path. All the teachers are very friendly and helpful. Everyone is friends with each other and it is a very loving environment.', "The academics, food, and teachers are overall great. However, the atmosphere isn't for those who don't like extremely small schools and aren't as involved in school activities. This is also not a school for those who want to pursue science or math related fields. If you enjoy art (from photography to graphic design) this school IS for you. There are even radio and TV classes for those interested just don't expect to choose classes until junior year.", 'Communications has a great sense of community, as well as great classes and academic scores. Everyone is eager to learn and eager to grow educationally and socially. Communications offers a different take on learning and allows its students to thrive in a variety of different settings. Its unique culture and atmosphere challenges students to be the best they can be intellectually, as well as working in the real world', "Overall, CHS is a great school. Although the classes and workload can be difficult to manage, the teachers are (usually) great, there's a variety of club and activities, and typically everyone seems to find a group of people they hang out with. However, some teachers are just plainly disqualified, and others interact way too much, to a point where it's unprofessional, with students. And although clubs and activities are great and councils work hard, elections are often biased. Above all, diversity is pretty poor in comparison to the other schools of the MCVSD. Again, I love the school and am very glad that I came here. It was the perfect fit for me and it's a great fit for most who come here (as very few have dropped out within my grade).", "The teachers and faculty at this school are outstanding, especially if you're interested in studying film.  I feel like I got an amazing education that I couldn't have found anywhere else.", 'I really enjoyed my time here. I learned so much, and I am so grateful to have been able to work with state of the art equipment, software, and studios while working at a high academic level. The teachers are all so helpful and know so much about the fields they teach. I am so glad that I chose to go here as opposed to a regular high school, regardless of the traditional things I missed out on. There is so much more that I gained.', 'Communications is a great career-oriented school for those looking for either a boost in the Communication field or for a higher, more rigorous learning experience.', "Communications High School is an art school for the smartest creative minds in Monmouth County, NJ. It's just as challenging as it is engaging and the environment brings out the best in each student. Despite the cutthroat and tough academics, at CHS, students perform better in and out of the classroom. Club participation is practically standard and school spirit comes naturally. If admitted, definitely give CHS a chance.", 'So so small. Picture the drama kids, band kids, tech kids, chess kids, anime kids, and comic book kids in one place. The whole school is carpeted. No one locks their lockers.', 'If your looking for a school where you can just ease by and not have a lot of homework... this is the school for you. The lack of challenging courses such as APs is terrible and the college acceptances were not outstanding. Some of the teachers are way too close with the students which makes it feel unprofessional. The social aspect of this school is very weak as well. The specialty classes aren’t amazing either; many public schools have the exact same classes. Basically the kids who go here go here because they won’t fit in at a public school because their social abilities are so low. Some of these kids will never survive the real world.', "One of my best decisions ever was attending Communications High School. As a Freshman, I was exposed to many different opportunities that many students don't get till they are seniors. I learned many abode programs like Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, and InDesign. I traveled on multiple field trips to gardens and museums. I got to make award winning films, be published in newspapers, and construct my own TV show. The teachers prepared me for college work. They care so deeply for the needs of their students and will go to great lengths to see them achieve. I am so grateful for such an amazing experience!", 'Communications High School is a great school, loved it there. Only downside was the lack of sports and AP courses.', 'I absolutely love CHS. Although we are all very smart kids and the academics are very good, what makes CHS so great is the student life. Events such as spirit week and color wars are so fun and indescribable. They are by far the best part of the school. Not all of the core class teachers are phenomenal, but the thematic class teachers are awesome. They have so much experience in their fields and give high schoolers such a great opportunity to delve into art, journalism, film, photography, tv/radio production, and programming while still in high school.', "CHS prepared me in monumental ways for the real world. I felt enabled to directly enter the workforce upon graduation. Academically, the school's one-of-a-kind curriculum challenged me in ways I did not know was possible. Artistically,  I was motivated by my peers and the work quality they were producing. The school's diverse culture and engaging state-of-the-art technologies enabled me to feel comfortable in my school. It made me feel at home. I would recommend CHS to anyone in Monmouth County interested in the arts.", 'Communications High School is a great vocational school, all classes are catered to the communications and technology field.']

column6: ["It's very very easy to get involved although the student must make the edit to stay involved. In order to receive an leadership you must be in the club since freshmen and/ or sophomore year.", 'I hoped for more challenging class, but instead we only receive honors credit.', 'Most teachers are eager to engage students but also provide short and concise lessons to move at a faster pace.', 'The health and safety of students is considered. All students feel their personal safety is considered and bullying is nearly nonexistent.', 'The extracurriculars are varied and inclusive for all students.', "They offer many clubs during lunch. Lunch is an hour long so that any clubs can meet during that time. Most of the clubs have access to high-quality equipment such as professional cameras. As long as you like communications, you'll find a club that interests you here.", "The lack of AP classes at this school is just sad. They only offer AP Calculus and AP Studio Art. For those of us that would not be able to pass an AP Calculus class or who aren't interested in studio art, there are no other options. As for the teachers, I have had some good ones and some awful ones. Some of them are more than willing to explain something to you if you don't understand it and others can barely answer simple questions about it. Overall, the quality of teachers at this school is way below what I would expect for one of the top schools in New Jersey.", "No cameras in the hallways. You can basically do what you want if there aren't any teachers around you at lunch. The doors are locked and you do need to be buzzed in by the office to get in, which does make me feel at least somewhat safe, though.", 'There was never a single moment at the school where any student was legitimately concerned for their own personal safety or the safety of others. The school provided a clean, safe, and structured learning environment.', 'Throughout my time at the school I was a regular member of both the Digital Video Club and the Broadcast Communications Club. Both of these groups allowed me to gain addition experience in fields of communication and media that I had an interest in as well as share experiences and relationships with my fellow students who shared these same interests. The clubs were moderated by dedicated teachers and were very high quality.', 'After graduating I look back at every moment spent at Communications with fondness. I am incredibly happy with my decision to attend the school and would certainly choose the school again if I could go back. The small class size was a unique aspect for the school an resulted in a very tight knit group of students. Moments such as competitive events and school trips are certainly some of my favorite memories in my adult life.', 'Every single teacher I had a course with was highly dedicated to both their students and the course material. Being a communication school technology was always fully implemented in lessons in order to increase efficacy. All teachers displays the utmost respect towards students and this respect was returned to the teachers as well. Courses were challenging yet rewarding and as a student you always know what you could improve on and why received a particular grade.', "The parents aren't really involved that much at this school.", "Some teachers care about their students but some are hard to approach. Certain teachers aren't really teaching their class. Their classes are mostly you teaching yourself. However, everyone is knowledgeable about their subjects.", 'I would definitely go to CHS again; so far it has been an amazing experience.', 'Many teachers in the school care about the students and do their best to help us succeed. Many of the teachers are knowledgeable in the subjects they teach and do all they can to teach the information in the best way possible. The teachers are friendly and respect all of the students.', "I've enjoyed my first year and a half at Communications High School overall. There have been several incidents that have left a bad taste in my mouth, and that has subsequently impacted my rating. I spent my freshmen year on Freshmen Class Council, and was ultimately not re-elected to join Sophomore Class Council because of a lie created by the Vice President that caused people to lose trust in me and not vote for me. I've also seen multiple teachers verbally belittle students and try to justify their actions when those actions are simply not justifiable. The principal has also unfairly targeted myself and friends. He's a man where there are no second chances, and it legitimately negatively impacts the learning environment of the school and the enjoyment students feel here. I've also experienced positive academic challenges and in many classes I do feel as though I learned and excelled more than I believed I initially could, and I've also made great friends here. I enjoyed my time on Freshmen Council as well as participating in multiple other clubs and attending various in-school and after school extracurricular activities. I can't say less than halfway in if I would do it again, but based on all of the things I've discussed, I do believe I experienced a unique high school environment.", "There's a wide variety of teachers at this school, ranging from both personality to grading style. There are some teachers who grade overly harshly, and other teachers who give out 100's in situations where it could be argued that the student shouldn't have even passed. Some teachers are unbelievably difficult when it comes to answering even basic questions, and there's a select few cases were teachers are rude to students on an everyday basis. The principal is absolutely horrific, trying to stifle as much creative expression from his students as possible, and has students specifically picked to target after a minor incident. In spite of all of this, there are teachers who are kind, passionate teachers who are also balanced in strictness and fairness, and are genuinely motivated and encouraged to give the best student education possible.", 'This school provided a great atmosphere that let the students have freedom to explore their interests and learn what they are interested in. The classes were well taught and focused primarily on Communications related subjects, though other courses, such as Math and Science were not discredited. A great place to learn and live.', 'There was a lot of stress academically, but it was overall a good experience.']

column2: ['Bard High School Early College is great for students who are independent. They put a lot of pressure on their students to act like adults and you are assigned a lot of school work. The high school program is hard to adjust to as you have 1-2 free periods but the Y1 and Y2 are great as you have a lot of free time to do your work. The school faculty let you manage your own time so those who are able to manage it do well.', "A wonderful educational opportunity, but the school's resources for students struggling with mental illness were very poor, guidance uninformed and unwilling to learn about issues of homophobia, racism, mental illness etc.", 'The thing about Bard is that the work is not hard; it just a lot of hours spent on homework and essays. Bard has definitely molded me into a very well-written individual and has challenged me into thinking of very complex and unique theses.', "Very mixed views about BHSEC Manhattan. There are times where you enjoy being in the atmosphere of it all and connecting with your peers. There are other days where you feel like you cannot escape the environment and there is a limit to the amount of activities that you want to pursue. As many clubs as there are there isn't a sense of involvement, at times students just sign up just to say they were apart of it.", 'Should be ranked right below Sty-This website is inaccurate if all of the specialized highschools are ranked above bardLook at the average SAT scores College acceptancesTeaching staff experienceEtc.', "BHSEC is the best! I'm about to be a senior at a major 4-year university and have  yet to take a class as academically rigorous as any class at BHSEC.", 'It’s a pretty good school, I learn a lot here and it’s really preparing me. The teachers at this school are caring and they’re always on you to make sure you understand and to make sure you’re doing well in both school and outside of school. Bard really brought me a safe environment for me to be myself.', "My experience at BHSEC was one that I would consider 'average.' As an institution rather than a standard high school we claim to be innovate, unique, and realistic. Over the course of my time at BHSEC it has evolved and become even more enjoyable due to the freedom granted in the courses that can be selected, the academic freedom, and the relationships that can be made with the professors are quite amazing. As a place whose motto is a place to think, I can surely attest that BHSEC does force you to think, and it is quite memorable since you would not be engaged at such a level intellectually, socially, or even spiritually at any other high school in the city.", "Its a really good school,  100% recommended! The teachers teach very well, and there's a rigorous academic curriculum.", 'I loved the atmosphere of the school. The students were taught to always feel empowered enough to fight for what they wanted if they disliked something. The school teaches students to always advocate for themselves and others. The students here are generally both artistic and articulate.', 'I liked that the teachers were all approachable, knowledgeable and helpful with getting questions answered. Something that could be improved is the activities and clubs.', "I love my school. The professors there are so dedicated and you can tell they really love what they do and they bring that passion to the classroom every day. The academics here are rigorous, but professors are more than willing to work with a student's individual needs to help them take advantage of the school's academic and communal resources. The community could use some work, and school spirit is not ideal, but because the school is small I look forward to seeing how Bard can cultivate a more connected community. In terms of diversity, there are students from all walks and life and as a student, Bard has taught me many things about culture, privilege, injustice, and how to be an aware citizen. I highly recommend considering Bard, it is truly a place to think.", "I would say from my experience in Bard, it's a pretty good school. The adults in Bard tried their best to provide a good diverse environment for the student, but also whenever they have a problem, they are free to talk with a teacher and they would help you out. Even though it could be stressful, but I would say every high school are like this. They are simply helping you get ready for college.", 'The academics are amazing. But the teachers are not as understanding as they should be, the administration is not supportive of their students’ activities, and the building is small and not well renovated. All of this aside though, most of the people are amazing, I’ve made some amazing lifelong best friends here and I’ve become the person that I am today thanks to BHSEC.', 'Freshman year you meet a ton of people and the teachers are the best. Sophomore year is not very fun to say the least. Year 1 (Junior) is chill because you learn oriented around what you want and you talk to more people especially in the grade above you. Year 2 is light. But it’s a hard school nonetheless but worth the work load and troubling days. Trust me you probably won’t be as happy when you leave school as you were when you started, but hey you’ll be smarter and ready to face the world. Some/a few of the people you meet will always be by your side, not everyone.', 'One thing that I really enjoy about Bard is the preparation it gives students for college. Bard challenges students academically which could sometimes lead to the work being a bit difficult, but there is always teachers who are willing to help students understand the material. They really enjoy teaching and hope that their students will succeed in the future.', 'I enjoy being able to graduate with a 2-year associates degree in liberal arts. This is a very good opportunity to not only trim down college costs, but also as a mental preparation for what college will be like.', 'This is an amazing academic school, but with that comes an overbearing stress culture and a very difficult workload. This often forces students to give up on their passions to focus on schoolwork. I see the value of this education and am grateful to have had it, but I think that this school needs to find a better balance, because there are serious problems with mental health here. When you walk into the school, you immediately see a board with our college acceptances proudly displayed. This signifies a disgusting preoccupation with image that pervades the administration. This should not be the end goal of an education, and many students have a very utilitarian view of clubs and academics-they are simply tests so you can get into the best college. I hope this changes, but with growing selectivity I doubt it will.', 'BHSEC Manhattan is a fast-paced, academically rigorous high school that is not for the average high school student. Students with curiosity, openness to learning and willing to put in the work would get a lot of the academic experience. The first two years include a workload that is manageable but not light. Expect a lot of "busy work"; Many small petty assignments that are tedious and overly repetitive. The only class that you can choose is your art. In the college program, however, you have a lot more freedom and responsibilities. Choose your humanities electives wisely and add/drop. In the last years, the workload is less tedious but papers are more thorough and frequent. Manage your time. Also, see your teachers during office hours (they\'re very approachable) and don\'t forget to sign up and utilize the writing center ahead of time. If you can manage to do these things I think that you would enjoy the academic experience.', 'Everybody in the school seems to get along and it is easy to meet new people. Most teachers at Bard love to to teach and are happy to be teaching the things that they teach. The work given at bard is rigorous and prepares students for what ever work they receive in college.']
column4: ['Bard High School Early College is great for students who are independent. They put a lot of pressure on their students to act like adults and you are assigned a lot of school work. The high school program is hard to adjust to as you have 1-2 free periods but the Y1 and Y2 are great as you have a lot of free time to do your work. The school faculty let you manage your own time so those who are able to manage it do well.', "A wonderful educational opportunity, but the school's resources for students struggling with mental illness were very poor, guidance uninformed and unwilling to learn about issues of homophobia, racism, mental illness etc.", 'The thing about Bard is that the work is not hard; it just a lot of hours spent on homework and essays. Bard has definitely molded me into a very well-written individual and has challenged me into thinking of very complex and unique theses.', "Very mixed views about BHSEC Manhattan. There are times where you enjoy being in the atmosphere of it all and connecting with your peers. There are other days where you feel like you cannot escape the environment and there is a limit to the amount of activities that you want to pursue. As many clubs as there are there isn't a sense of involvement, at times students just sign up just to say they were apart of it.", 'Should be ranked right below Sty-This website is inaccurate if all of the specialized highschools are ranked above bardLook at the average SAT scores College acceptancesTeaching staff experienceEtc.', "BHSEC is the best! I'm about to be a senior at a major 4-year university and have  yet to take a class as academically rigorous as any class at BHSEC.", 'It’s a pretty good school, I learn a lot here and it’s really preparing me. The teachers at this school are caring and they’re always on you to make sure you understand and to make sure you’re doing well in both school and outside of school. Bard really brought me a safe environment for me to be myself.', "My experience at BHSEC was one that I would consider 'average.' As an institution rather than a standard high school we claim to be innovate, unique, and realistic. Over the course of my time at BHSEC it has evolved and become even more enjoyable due to the freedom granted in the courses that can be selected, the academic freedom, and the relationships that can be made with the professors are quite amazing. As a place whose motto is a place to think, I can surely attest that BHSEC does force you to think, and it is quite memorable since you would not be engaged at such a level intellectually, socially, or even spiritually at any other high school in the city.", "Its a really good school,  100% recommended! The teachers teach very well, and there's a rigorous academic curriculum.", 'I loved the atmosphere of the school. The students were taught to always feel empowered enough to fight for what they wanted if they disliked something. The school teaches students to always advocate for themselves and others. The students here are generally both artistic and articulate.', 'I liked that the teachers were all approachable, knowledgeable and helpful with getting questions answered. Something that could be improved is the activities and clubs.', "I love my school. The professors there are so dedicated and you can tell they really love what they do and they bring that passion to the classroom every day. The academics here are rigorous, but professors are more than willing to work with a student's individual needs to help them take advantage of the school's academic and communal resources. The community could use some work, and school spirit is not ideal, but because the school is small I look forward to seeing how Bard can cultivate a more connected community. In terms of diversity, there are students from all walks and life and as a student, Bard has taught me many things about culture, privilege, injustice, and how to be an aware citizen. I highly recommend considering Bard, it is truly a place to think.", "I would say from my experience in Bard, it's a pretty good school. The adults in Bard tried their best to provide a good diverse environment for the student, but also whenever they have a problem, they are free to talk with a teacher and they would help you out. Even though it could be stressful, but I would say every high school are like this. They are simply helping you get ready for college.", 'The academics are amazing. But the teachers are not as understanding as they should be, the administration is not supportive of their students’ activities, and the building is small and not well renovated. All of this aside though, most of the people are amazing, I’ve made some amazing lifelong best friends here and I’ve become the person that I am today thanks to BHSEC.', 'Freshman year you meet a ton of people and the teachers are the best. Sophomore year is not very fun to say the least. Year 1 (Junior) is chill because you learn oriented around what you want and you talk to more people especially in the grade above you. Year 2 is light. But it’s a hard school nonetheless but worth the work load and troubling days. Trust me you probably won’t be as happy when you leave school as you were when you started, but hey you’ll be smarter and ready to face the world. Some/a few of the people you meet will always be by your side, not everyone.', 'One thing that I really enjoy about Bard is the preparation it gives students for college. Bard challenges students academically which could sometimes lead to the work being a bit difficult, but there is always teachers who are willing to help students understand the material. They really enjoy teaching and hope that their students will succeed in the future.', 'I enjoy being able to graduate with a 2-year associates degree in liberal arts. This is a very good opportunity to not only trim down college costs, but also as a mental preparation for what college will be like.', 'This is an amazing academic school, but with that comes an overbearing stress culture and a very difficult workload. This often forces students to give up on their passions to focus on schoolwork. I see the value of this education and am grateful to have had it, but I think that this school needs to find a better balance, because there are serious problems with mental health here. When you walk into the school, you immediately see a board with our college acceptances proudly displayed. This signifies a disgusting preoccupation with image that pervades the administration. This should not be the end goal of an education, and many students have a very utilitarian view of clubs and academics-they are simply tests so you can get into the best college. I hope this changes, but with growing selectivity I doubt it will.', 'BHSEC Manhattan is a fast-paced, academically rigorous high school that is not for the average high school student. Students with curiosity, openness to learning and willing to put in the work would get a lot of the academic experience. The first two years include a workload that is manageable but not light. Expect a lot of "busy work"; Many small petty assignments that are tedious and overly repetitive. The only class that you can choose is your art. In the college program, however, you have a lot more freedom and responsibilities. Choose your humanities electives wisely and add/drop. In the last years, the workload is less tedious but papers are more thorough and frequent. Manage your time. Also, see your teachers during office hours (they\'re very approachable) and don\'t forget to sign up and utilize the writing center ahead of time. If you can manage to do these things I think that you would enjoy the academic experience.', 'Everybody in the school seems to get along and it is easy to meet new people. Most teachers at Bard love to to teach and are happy to be teaching the things that they teach. The work given at bard is rigorous and prepares students for what ever work they receive in college.']
column6: ['Bard did a great job at preparing students for college level courses. The school could be more diverse and do a better job at supporting their students of color during the college program.', 'Bard is an Early College High School where students earn their 60 credits when they graduate and an Associates Degree. The first two years are high school, and the last two years are college courses. College classes are much more challenging.', "Although I love the academics at Bard and I'm a little sad leaving it behind, I think that the administration should give more effort to produce programs that can help decrease the academic and social stress that all of its students go through. There is also racial tension that has been noticed and mention throughout the years, but not much has been said on how to exterminate it.", 'Bard high school is an amazing school. I was able to meet some amazing people and the professors are the best I have had. The classes are not large so it gives you a chance to really connect with the professor and the material being taught.  The professors encourage you to go to them for tutoring if you need help with anything. They are great people to talk to whether it is academic or personal and they understand when you need help or extra time on an assignment. I love BHSEC and wish I could be there forever.', 'Bard High School Early College offers students the opportunity to earn an Associates Degree in the Arts along with a High School Diploma which categorizes the school as one of a kind providing the experience that students need in order to assess reality. However, one thing that can be changed is stricter evaluation of teachers to ensure that they are using all means necessary to guarantee that students understand the material being taught.', 'Bard is an extremely competitive, academic school. The AA degree is a great thing to come out with, but it is something you must be ready and willing to work for. This is not an easy school by any means, and if you are thinking about applying be ready for a large workload and some sleepless nights.', 'Bard High School is a very rigorous school due to its challenging curriculum. However, Bard is enrolling more students that it can cater to which is resulting to the quality of the college education being slowly impacted.', 'I love the environment and how friendly everyone is. I love how helpful and ready to share the community is. I would change the stiffness of the interactions between the grades.', "It's incredibly stimulating. Teachers are smart, invested, and engaged. I have enjoyed my four years there more than I thought I could enjoy High School anywhere.", 'Bard really prepares you for college. However there are many sacrifices to be made and it is fast paced learning. It can take a toll on some, but for others it is a great challenge, and there are great professors there to help you succeed in courses.', 'As a senior at Bard High School Early College, I think I can safely say that BHSEC is a truly unique place. The challenging academic curriculum and the dedication of all of our professors make this environment a birthplace for brilliant ideas and meaningful discussions. There are, of course, things that can and should improve such as college readiness and student resources.', "The teachers really want to see you succeed. The school size is great for those who don't want to feel overburdened by a largely populated school. This allows for genuine relationships to be made.", 'Great School! Prepared me well for college. The teachers and counselors really care for the students and want to see them succeed.', "BHSEC makes it challenging for the kids in all the right ways. It offers courses at varying levels and provides the right amount of rigor in its expectations. The best thing about this school is its leadership and teaching staff. In the four years my son attended we did not encounter a single professional who was not fully invested in the success of every one of the students there. For a public school in NYC, that's quite a feat.", "It's pretty cool here everyone is really friendly and it was pretty easy to make friends here. I had some friends from middle school that I knew and they introduced to me who to meet.", 'Great experience overall.  Some really good teachers; others, not so much.  Feeling prepared for college.', "Bard High School Early College is an experience, for better or for worse. The school's rigorous academics and even tougher teachers are what make the school what it is. This is good for some students, but most likely not for all. The luxury of graduating with both a high school degree and an Associate's Degree are what entice a lot of students to attend. But the school is not all it is hyped up to be.", 'This school was one of the best decisions that I made when attending. The academics really prepare the students for college. On top of that you get an associates degree with your high school diploma. Not many schools do that .', 'During my time at Bard I liked how transparent my instructors were with what they expected from me, and the wide range of classes that I was offered.  The one thing that I would want to change about the school is its attitude toward students from the outer boroughs and inner city.', "Bard High School Early College is a great school for college readiness and developing a rigorous work ethic. The teachers and staff are always ready to assist you if you are willing to ask for help. Though there is a diverse number of students population wise, there is an obvious segregation between students of color and white students. Academically, this school has done a lot for me. I am a rising junior and I don't think I could have learned what I know now anywhere else but Bard. This school has also taught me tolerance of others' opinions. The only thing I wish I could change about my experience here is the way situations that have to do with race and/or social class are dealt with."]
column8: ['Bard was a great experience that provided an academically rigorous experience and great faculty. There are many opportunities available to learn and grow as a person and intellectual. But there are also ways to have fun as well and indulge artistically.', 'I loved the fact that I could graduate with a high school diploma and an associate degree. I made great friends and I consider myself well prepared for college.', 'Bard did a great job preparing me for college. After entering college I found my course work easier than the work I was doing at Bard. The professors were a great asset to my high school experience. They were extremely encouraging and were always available to help. I would recommended Bard to any middle school student who wants an amazing high school.', "I've attending Bard High School Early College ( BHSEC) for four years. Here I've learned how to flourish as a student, but also what it means to become an adult. Bard has a heavy work load and you must manage your time.If you struggle there are teachers that will help you, but the process is something an individual must be motivated for. The bonus for all the stress you endure is two free years of a private, liberal arts college education. Ultimately, you will gain a sense of comfort and friendship as the staff can be friendly at times. Academics are rigorous and entrance into the school is extremely competitive at a 4.2% acceptance rate. Overall BHSEC is a school where a student will enter nervous, but also with goals and they will leave as an intellectual human being who has accomplished them. Not to mention the bonus of  an associates degree at 18 !", "My current experience in Bard is getting harder and unusual for me. I am for the most part getting used to some of the classes and understanding how to perform well in them for the college program. This will enable me to be an outstanding student and be quite of a standout to colleges. Bard in Freshman year was new and weird for me because I had to adapt to this type of school which doesn't have desks in rows,  but a circular seminar style which helps all of us participate in discussions or helps us to be more of an active learner. If I could change one thing about this school, it would be its gym because I think we need a gym so we can be open to more sports like basketball and volleyball, but overall this school has helped me and is helping me progress as an active learner and a leader.", 'Bard High School has exceptional teaching and manages to be challenging without having the competitive feel that  many  of the specialized  high schools have. Although many comments  seem to indicate that the work is overwhelming  my son, who is now  in his second semester of 9th grade,  has not found it to so. He usually has 2-3 hours of homework a  night which is manageable.  The teachers all seem genuinely committed to helping the students and  the small class size (15-20) means  that they get much more  attention than is typical and  that the teachers are also always available if students  need help with their work.', "The course load is a lot but the friends and experience you have there outways that. Bard is a small diverse school where you can meet a ton of people. You also get your Associate's degree upon graduation. If the school was bigger than it would feel more like high school.", 'I really like the academics at bhsec. I also really like the diversity and opportunities given with all the club choices. I have found an inclusive and rigorous environment I thrive in.', "I would not be where I am today without this school. Although each school has something that keeps them from perfect, I wouldn't say that those imperfections were detrimental to my learning experience in any way. The school, in my opinion, does an amazing job in picking kids that want to go here and learn and truly want to gain the early college experience. All the kids that are at this school want to be here and that makes the whole experience so much better.", 'I loved the rigorous and interesting humanities-based curriculum. I really liked the diversity and tight knit community.', 'Bard is a rigorous school. Students take up to 2 years of high school and 2 years of college. This allows students to graduate with an AA degree. Also the school cares for their students and considers our opinions. The school is safe and welcoming.', "There are interesting clubs, but it's hard to maintain members and actually raise school spirit.", "I love the independence I have here. The teachers are there to guide you, but everything is truly centered around the students. Graduating with an associate's degree is truly rewarding!", 'Each teacher truly takes the time to get to know you, your strengths, and your weaknesses. They are helpful, attentive, and responsive. The fact that they are all experienced and care about the subjects they teach is apparent in the classroom.', 'Students at Bard are generally very respectful. I cannot recall ever seeing a fight break out in school. However, there are resources if a student ever feels bullied. There is a guidance counselor to help resolve issues between students. In terms of security, there are police guards standing by the front door at all times, and each teacher and student must show his/her student ID when entering the building. Visitors must sign in before entering the building. I have never felt unsafe inside the school building.', 'There are many extracurricular opportunities at this school. They have everything from a literary magazine to a jewelry making club to an anime club. Most clubs meet only once or twice a week after school, so it is a pretty low commitment. Each club has a faculty advisor, so at least one faculty member invests time and energy into each club to ensure that it is running smoothly and is enjoyable for the club members.', 'Bard High School Early College is both a high school and a college in one. Ninth and tenth grades are all four years of high school, and eleventh and twelfth grades are the first two years of college. I graduated in 2014 and just finished my sophomore year at Binghamton University. Bard really prepared me for college. Firstly, I entered college with 63 credits, which allowed me to focus my studies on subjects that genuinely interested me. Secondly, the classes at Bard were college-level classes, which granted me a smooth transition into actual college classes at a university. The teachers at Bard are incredibly knowledgable and passionate about the classes that they teach. They communicate complex ideas clearly, and make sure that every student has an understanding of the subject.', "The teachers at Bard High School Early College genuinely care about each and every student. Whenever a teacher is not teaching a class, he/she holds office hours so that students may come if they need help or have any questions. Every teacher makes an effort to know everyone in the class, and to grasp each student's level of understanding of the topics. Questions and class discussion are always encouraged in class. Some classes are entirely student discussion about the topics. Each teacher's teaching style is different -- some teachers incorporate technology and show videos or a powerpoint, and some use the whiteboard and books. In general, all of the teachers demonstrate knowledge of the subject, and communicate challenging concepts in a way that is understandable for the students. Each teacher also has their own grading techniques. The grading criteria are clearly indicated in the syllabus that we receive at the beginning of each semester, so we know exactly what is being factored into our grades.", "Bard is not diverse. They like to say they are a diverse school because they will admit a good group of people but by 11th grade most of the minorities are gone. All the students act the same as well and are very oblivious to what goes on outside of their own world and as a minority it's more difficult to fit in with the general crowd.", "The school is designed to prepare us for college and I think they do a good job at that. I know my high school experience is very different from the average high school student in  New York, even the country and sometimes I wish the work load was lighter but I know this is how college is going  to be. The teachers expect so much more from student once they enter the college program which can be a little difficult because the transition into the program isn't so smooth, but other than that the school is great academically."]

column2: ['The people here are wonderful and special services and accommodations are absolutely incredible. As someone with an IEP, I can full-heartedly say that that the emotional and educational support I have been granted here is so meaningful. I think if I were to pick one thing to change it would be the number of kids that currently vape.', 'Ridge High School does prepare you academically for college. However, the faculty does not does a very good job of socially preparing students for what is to come. Due to the intense academic environment, students often feel as though they are robots. It is a very academically rigorous environment that lacks school spirit.', 'It was a good school. Most of the teachers are passionate about the subjects they are teaching and care about the students they have. Some courses are impossible and there is a very large gap between CP and Honors in some subjects.', 'Ridge High School is a very good school academically. Students are usually very stressed and have a lot on their plate. Ridge definitely needs to work on school spirit but they have been trying to change that. Also this year the administration has cracked down more on kids wandering school/coming in different entrances.', "Overrated. Guidance does not get to know your kid. Principal pretends to listen to your concerns but does nothing unless the parent had a big mouth and clout.  He promised a follow up and it never happened. The really good teachers are not appreciated...and they are outnumbered by mediocre and poor ones who have no clue. My kid has spent many a night teaching herself topics, but that, in turn, has taught her independence. Sports teams are almost always predetermined and tryouts are just for show. There are a lot of conflicts of interest but don't complain or you'll be kicked out of the room.  The building and campus are poorly laid out with only one accessible road. Otherwise Kids walk through muddy/ goose poop fields to get to the building.  Focus seems to be on school ratings and test scores...should I go on??  On the plus side...kids seem ready for college but they don't have study skills because Rudge doesn't give finals.", 'Good school in a good neighborhood; high quality teachers. Competitive New Jersey public school, high parent involvement.', 'Ridge High School was an academically challenging high school with lots of support and opportunities for its students. Sports were popular and theater and  band/orchestra were very advanced. Very small town school where even with a lot of students there was always a familiar face.', "Ridge High School is a very academically competitive school, while still giving you an immense amount of opportunities to participate in sports or clubs. Even if you aren't as study focused, you can still find wonderful programs such as the woods program, or 4 year art program. Academically, There is a wide range of courses that you can take, and they all do an incredible job at preparing you for college.", "Overall Ridge High School is an excellent school; the education is great, most teachers are fantastic, the food is decent, the school itself is always clean and in good shape, and the sports teams are all very competitive. However, there are a few mistakes the district has made along the way, for example implementing the PLTW program into the engineering classes, instead of the more hands-on and interesting programs the teachers led previously. Another issue that Ridge has is the traffic, there are two entrances right next to each other, and they clog up the roads surrounding the school in the morning. Every morning I had to set aside 10 minutes to sit in the car line, so that I wouldn't be late to school. These are two of the issues I know of, but there are more. However at the end of the day these issues don't really impact the overall rating of the school, Ridge will send you to college, and get you somewhere in life.", 'Ridge is definitely one of the more prestigious public high schools out there. From its academics, to sports, to extracurricular activities of every type, this school and its people always strive for excellence. I honestly do not think I could have been better prepared for college applications and with all of the opportunities to give back to the community available for students, my resume has never looked better. The students and teachers there are all wonderful, dedicated, and talented individuals. The only problem that I could say about the school is that with the prestige that it has earned itself from its reputation, there also comes a lot of pressure, specifically on students, to succeed, which has proven to be detrimental to the mental and physical health of students there, and while it is being addressed in recent years, remains to be a consistent problem within the student body.', 'Ridge was an excellent experience. The teachers were very focused on thoroughly educating all of their students and making sure that they all understood the material. Very fun-loving environment, and also very dedicated staff.', 'Ridge High School is competitive public school. Students are competitive with each other in academics, sports, chorus, color guard, etc. Ridge is known for its excellent education and athletics. There are plenty and variety of clubs and activities students can join/participate in. The academic guidance counselor are extremely helpful with the college application process. In the winter of junior year, there will be an assemble on how to prepare for college applications. They explain to students that they should create a list of colleges they wish to attend, prepare for the SAT and ACT, and maintain good grades. Later in the school year, the guidance counselors will have meetings with every junior to see where they are in the process. At the end of junior year, students will have to fill out a Senior Packet and choose teachers who might write a letter of recommendation about the student(s).', 'Ridge High School has always had great reviews some of which I thought were overrated. Now being a student here for 3 years I can confirm that all these aspects that families rave about are true.', 'I like the spirit that all the students show and all the diverse cultures show. I also enjoy the amount of activities and opportunities we are offered. There is truly something for everyone', 'Great teachers and variety of subjects and courses. Challenging curriculum. Clique-y social atmosphere. Very academically competitive, sometimes to an unhealthy point. A great public high school education.', "Good but steadily declining academics. Classes are way too big, but there are many good teachers. There's are lots of opportunities to get involved, however the focus is on sports and the atomosphere is HIGHLY competitive.", "I liked that the school gave everyone many clubs and extra-curricular activities to join to really embrace life. Plus, it's a great place to learn and build yourself as a student. There's not that much you may need to change of Ridge High School.", 'The school is wonderful in terms of academics and educational opportunities. There are various types of classes and the teachers are mainly supportive. However, my peers were not as welcoming. The school can also be rigid in their thinking.', 'I personally did not realize how active, safe, genuinely caring, and a huge drive the school provided its students until I started to look out of my little bubble in Basking Ridge. I saw how other schools didn’t have the natural drive you get at Ridge. The people around you inspire you to do more at Ridge. College prep isn’t only provided by AP classes, Ridge’s whole environment has a part in getting you ready. Endless student participation in clubs, sports, choirs, band, orchestra, forensics, and student government. Ridge has a minimum amount of bullying. Nothing severe because everyone has friends and people to support  them. On safety, the police HQ is literally to the side of the school like a couple hundred meters away, if anything happened they wouldn’t let it get too far, which I’m sure nothing ever would. Overall, Ridge over most high schools changes people’s lives for the better.', "Ridge will set you up to succeed, whether you choose to take those skills into college or straight into the work field, but you'll have to genuinely try. The classes are incredibly difficult in comparison with many other public high schools, with many CP (college prep) classes being more similar to Honors classes at other high schools. The teachers generally want to see you succeed, but some of the math and science teachers leave a lot to be desired. The clubs give you lots of options, and you can create your own club if you want to, but all that 90% of them do is go around trying to sell people stuff during lunch to raise money for ___ cause. The school culture is just what you'd expect from a wealthy, white school, but there's really no violence or drama that goes on. Sports teams are pretty generic high school sports teams, with the men's ice hockey team being very strong and the girls soccer, volleyball, and golf being very strong. There is also a very large track & field team."]

In the winter of junior year, there will be an assemble on how to prepare for college applications. They explain to students that they should create a list of colleges they wish to attend, prepare for the SAT and ACT, and maintain good grades. Later in the school year, the guidance counselors will have meetings with every junior to see where they are in the process. At the end of junior year, students will have to fill out a Senior Packet and choose teachers who might write a letter of recommendation about the student(s).', 'Ridge High School has always had great reviews some of which I thought were overrated. Now being a student here for 3 years I can confirm that all these aspects that families rave about are true.', 'I like the spirit that all the students show and all the diverse cultures show. I also enjoy the amount of activities and opportunities we are offered. There is truly something for everyone', 'Great teachers and variety of subjects and courses. Challenging curriculum. Clique-y social atmosphere. Very academically competitive, sometimes to an unhealthy point. A great public high school education.', "Good but steadily declining academics. Classes are way too big, but there are many good teachers. There's are lots of opportunities to get involved, however the focus is on sports and the atomosphere is HIGHLY competitive.", "I liked that the school gave everyone many clubs and extra-curricular activities to join to really embrace life. Plus, it's a great place to learn and build yourself as a student. There's not that much you may need to change of Ridge High School.", 'The school is wonderful in terms of academics and educational opportunities. There are various types of classes and the teachers are mainly supportive. However, my peers were not as welcoming. The school can also be rigid in their thinking.', 'I personally did not realize how active, safe, genuinely caring, and a huge drive the school provided its students until I started to look out of my little bubble in Basking Ridge. I saw how other schools didn’t have the natural drive you get at Ridge. The people around you inspire you to do more at Ridge. College prep isn’t only provided by AP classes, Ridge’s whole environment has a part in getting you ready. Endless student participation in clubs, sports, choirs, band, orchestra, forensics, and student government. Ridge has a minimum amount of bullying. Nothing severe because everyone has friends and people to support  them. On safety, the police HQ is literally to the side of the school like a couple hundred meters away, if anything happened they wouldn’t let it get too far, which I’m sure nothing ever would. Overall, Ridge over most high schools changes people’s lives for the better.', "Ridge will set you up to succeed, whether you choose to take those skills into college or straight into the work field, but you'll have to genuinely try. The classes are incredibly difficult in comparison with many other public high schools, with many CP (college prep) classes being more similar to Honors classes at other high schools. The teachers generally want to see you succeed, but some of the math and science teachers leave a lot to be desired. The clubs give you lots of options, and you can create your own club if you want to, but all that 90% of them do is go around trying to sell people stuff during lunch to raise money for ___ cause. The school culture is just what you'd expect from a wealthy, white school, but there's really no violence or drama that goes on. Sports teams are pretty generic high school sports teams, with the men's ice hockey team being very strong and the girls soccer, volleyball, and golf being very strong. There is also a very large track & field team."]
column6: ['The people here are wonderful and special services and accommodations are absolutely incredible. As someone with an IEP, I can full-heartedly say that that the emotional and educational support I have been granted here is so meaningful. I think if I were to pick one thing to change it would be the number of kids that currently vape.', 'Ridge High School does prepare you academically for college. However, the faculty does not does a very good job of socially preparing students for what is to come. Due to the intense academic environment, students often feel as though they are robots. It is a very academically rigorous environment that lacks school spirit.', 'It was a good school. Most of the teachers are passionate about the subjects they are teaching and care about the students they have. Some courses are impossible and there is a very large gap between CP and Honors in some subjects.', 'Ridge High School is a very good school academically. Students are usually very stressed and have a lot on their plate. Ridge definitely needs to work on school spirit but they have been trying to change that. Also this year the administration has cracked down more on kids wandering school/coming in different entrances.', "Overrated. Guidance does not get to know your kid. Principal pretends to listen to your concerns but does nothing unless the parent had a big mouth and clout.  He promised a follow up and it never happened. The really good teachers are not appreciated...and they are outnumbered by mediocre and poor ones who have no clue. My kid has spent many a night teaching herself topics, but that, in turn, has taught her independence. Sports teams are almost always predetermined and tryouts are just for show. There are a lot of conflicts of interest but don't complain or you'll be kicked out of the room.  The building and campus are poorly laid out with only one accessible road. Otherwise Kids walk through muddy/ goose poop fields to get to the building.  Focus seems to be on school ratings and test scores...should I go on??  On the plus side...kids seem ready for college but they don't have study skills because Rudge doesn't give finals.", 'Good school in a good neighborhood; high quality teachers. Competitive New Jersey public school, high parent involvement.', 'Ridge High School was an academically challenging high school with lots of support and opportunities for its students. Sports were popular and theater and  band/orchestra were very advanced. Very small town school where even with a lot of students there was always a familiar face.', "Ridge High School is a very academically competitive school, while still giving you an immense amount of opportunities to participate in sports or clubs. Even if you aren't as study focused, you can still find wonderful programs such as the woods program, or 4 year art program. Academically, There is a wide range of courses that you can take, and they all do an incredible job at preparing you for college.", "Overall Ridge High School is an excellent school; the education is great, most teachers are fantastic, the food is decent, the school itself is always clean and in good shape, and the sports teams are all very competitive. However, there are a few mistakes the district has made along the way, for example implementing the PLTW program into the engineering classes, instead of the more hands-on and interesting programs the teachers led previously. Another issue that Ridge has is the traffic, there are two entrances right next to each other, and they clog up the roads surrounding the school in the morning. Every morning I had to set aside 10 minutes to sit in the car line, so that I wouldn't be late to school. These are two of the issues I know of, but there are more. However at the end of the day these issues don't really impact the overall rating of the school, Ridge will send you to college, and get you somewhere in life.", 'Ridge is definitely one of the more prestigious public high schools out there. From its academics, to sports, to extracurricular activities of every type, this school and its people always strive for excellence. I honestly do not think I could have been better prepared for college applications and with all of the opportunities to give back to the community available for students, my resume has never looked better. The students and teachers there are all wonderful, dedicated, and talented individuals. The only problem that I could say about the school is that with the prestige that it has earned itself from its reputation, there also comes a lot of pressure, specifically on students, to succeed, which has proven to be detrimental to the mental and physical health of students there, and while it is being addressed in recent years, remains to be a consistent problem within the student body.', 'Ridge was an excellent experience. The teachers were very focused on thoroughly educating all of their students and making sure that they all understood the material. Very fun-loving environment, and also very dedicated staff.', 'Ridge High School is competitive public school. Students are competitive with each other in academics, sports, chorus, color guard, etc. Ridge is known for its excellent education and athletics. There are plenty and variety of clubs and activities students can join/participate in. The academic guidance counselor are extremely helpful with the college application process. In the winter of junior year, there will be an assemble on how to prepare for college applications. They explain to students that they should create a list of colleges they wish to attend, prepare for the SAT and ACT, and maintain good grades. Later in the school year, the guidance counselors will have meetings with every junior to see where they are in the process. At the end of junior year, students will have to fill out a Senior Packet and choose teachers who might write a letter of recommendation about the student(s).', 'Ridge High School has always had great reviews some of which I thought were overrated. Now being a student here for 3 years I can confirm that all these aspects that families rave about are true.', 'I like the spirit that all the students show and all the diverse cultures show. There's not that much you may need to change of Ridge High School.", 'The school is wonderful in terms of academics and educational opportunities.
