The teachers generally want to see you succeed, but some of the math and science teachers leave a lot to be desired. The clubs give you lots of options, and you can create your own club if you want to, but all that 90% of them do is go around trying to sell people stuff during lunch to raise money for ___ cause. The school culture is just what you'd expect from a wealthy, white school, but there's really no violence or drama that goes on. Sports teams are pretty generic high school sports teams, with the men's ice hockey team being very strong and the girls soccer, volleyball, and golf being very strong. There is also a very large track & field team."]
column8: ['The academics are superior and school consistently rated in top 100 NJ schools.  Ethnic diversity, stellar teachers and unique class opportunities.', 'This school is a great school with a high level of learning. Great teacher and a good preparation for College. But to much homework...', 'I really enjoyed Ridge High School and I think it is a great public school that prepares its students for college.', 'Academics prepare students for college and provide many rigorous courses for students to take. Competitive environment but  supportive teachers and students.', 'Really bad experience with Ridge.  I transferred late freshman year from a very good school but it was a horrible experience.  Guidance counselors treated me very poorly . I felt bullied by them.', 'My overall experience here has been very enjoyable. The teachers tend to be very helpful and faculty are courteous. The demographic is limited however academics here are high quality. Great school spirit and overall kind people.', "When I attended Ridge High School I enjoyed every moment of it. I walked in the doors as a freshman and was nervous to start at a new school but very quickly I was able to adapt to my new school and fit right in. All of my teachers were amazing and helped me prepare for college. I learned so much from all of my teachers and wouldn't be in such a great position that I am in today without them.", 'Extremely good school-- unique and diverse class offerings, amazing academics, (mostly) friendly and approachable staff... environment is ok. Too competitive in my opinion. Some classes I can literally feel the competitiveness in the air. School spirit lacks after the administration had to cut down on spirit events like pep rally and spirit week because of class discipline issues. Also, the social life is very cliquey, but there is a niche for everyone.', 'The education is definitely really great for a public school. Perhaps because of that fact however, some teachers/counselors are not the strongest or most supportive you can get. However, I made some great friends and met some amazing teachers through this school.', 'Ridge prepares students very well for college academics; although the work load may be a lot, but many alums feel extremely prepared for college. In terms of teachers, social life, food, etc., it was not so great.', 'My daughter has been involved with the National Art Association along with the Marching Band', 'My daughters teachers have been very good and helpful', 'My daughter has had a great experience over the past 3 plus years....she has made some really good friends and the entire experience has been very positive', "Extracurriculars are great.  Join clubs and get leadership positions with friends.  It's honestly so fun getting free food every morning before class", "There's teachers who are just amazing (approachable, engaging, willing to help, etc) and others who you pray don't show up on your schedule (boring, tough, biased, etc). More of the former than the latter.", 'The safety and security services are great, but the school nurses can often be rude and unfriendly to students.', "There are various different clubs and organizations to the point where many clubs end up repeating each other's interests but with slight, small differences. For instance, there are three feminism-related clubs, more than two math clubs, etc. Most of the clubs are just created for college applications and die within four years, but there are a few that really do go above and beyond.", 'This school is very competitive; most students compete with each other to an almost unhealthy level. The fact that this school does not give good grades often, especially in the AP classes, makes the competition even worse. Several students end up transferring to private schools and doing very well there, even though they did not do well at Ridge High School. I would not choose this school again if I could do it all over.', "While most teachers practically don't teach, with some going as far to complain about teaching in front of their classes, a select few do work very hard and genuinely enjoy teaching; I believe that this depends on the teacher.", 'I do forensics. Most of the stereotypes are right to a degree: it takes a lot of time and the director, David Yastremski, as well as some of the coaches are a bit crazy. That said, the team is relatively strong, and many who care about the activity can make it to the top, though as of late it has been struggling through various issues, and many people on the team do other activities such as sports or music and also have a life beyond all of that too.']

column2: ["Kids wear exhaustion as a status badge. The workload is insane. I'm a top-10% student, a diligent worker who has never had a problem with procrastination. Right after track, I go home and start my work immediately and most nights I'm lucky to be in bed by 1AM. It’s not just me. You're put on the advanced track in middle school. I worked hard enough in sixth grade for that, but but many of my friends (and my brother) didn't come into their own until high school. By then it was too late, so they'll be stuck taking pre-calc as seniors even though I'm sure many of them would rock in AP Calc now. Even the kids on the regular track are stuck doing homework until 1AM. Overall, mostly glad to be leaving soon: I've had a ton of great teachers, but mostly not so great ones. Wish I could get back those hours and hours of busy work. Pretty sick of the cliquey culture and the majority of students, including my friends, who, even though they’re generally accepting, are so so competitive.", 'My high school experience has been alright so far. There has been a lot of ups and downs throughout the four years. An up would be the services the school has recently provided for the students. However, these only pertain to everything but academical. They recently added a cafe, an array of HD TVs throughout the school, and a rumored "meditation" room in the library. The major down for this school as expected is the education and the teachers that provide such. Quite a few of them don\'t know how to teach and or know what they need to teach to the students for them to succeed in a particular subject. The school district needs to reevaluate those and get new qualified teachers...', 'The teachers are truly outstanding and dedicated. The science research program is a transformative experience for many students.', 'It prepared me for college incredibly well. Unfortunately, the high-pressure environment tends to foster a lot of competition among students.', 'The science research program is outstanding. The teachers and first-rate and truly care about the students', 'They are knowledgeable. they help the students who need the extra help and push the students who they know that could handle it.', 'It was a great school overall. My son learned a great deal and the school made the college transition a lot easier.', 'Focus on success at any cost.', 'Theatre program is top notch.', 'Most teachers are wonderful resources and are willing to help.', "Byram Hills is a hard school. There's a lot of pressure to be number one. However, it is manageable. Teachers tend to be receptive when students complain or give feedback that the workload is too much or too fast. This balance allows for the students to learn better.", "There are many extracurricular activities. There are so many clubs that students can get involved in and they don't require too much commitment so many students do participate in more than one. Byram Hills has a great theater program and the students who usually aren't athletes are helping with the show. There are many sport options and the teams range on how good they are, and therefore their selectiveness. Most students participate in some type of after school program. A lot of the guys tend to use the weight room in their offseason or whenever they feel like they want a workout.", "Generally the teachers in the same subject have a similar style to one another. They usually share notes so it's easy for students who aren't in the same class to help each other. Some teachers are a little less liked than others, but those teachers are still very knowledgable. Most of the teachers are passionate about what they teach. However, Byram Hills' teachers do tend to show A LOT of favoritism.", 'Byram Hills has a closed campus policy, so the security of the students is generally ideal. There is usually a police man on campus. Many of the students are friends with the officer and he is seen as a respected authoritative figure, not as a threat. Byram Hills participates in the peer leader programs, having seniors help lead in teaching sophomores more advanced health. Bullying is not tolerated at all and if the principles or teachers find out, there will be trouble. However, unless reported, it does tend to slip by them sometimes. Overall, Byram Hills is a very safe school and a generally healthy environment too.', 'The academics offered is absolutely amazing. The teachers and curriculum pushes all the students to reach their true potential. But this does come with the price of a heavy work load and scheduling gets tough because some classes are offered once during the day.', 'We honestly do not have much diversity in my school.', 'Security is very important along with the health of all the students. However bullying (cyber) cases could be better handled but overall I never go to school feeling unsafe.', 'You can do almost anything in the high school. There are a bunch of clubs, organization and sports available to all students.', "I personally have had the honor to participate in a lot of the schools programs. I've have been a part of the Varsity Dance Team for four years and Captain for two, raising $25,000 over the past four years through our dance expositions for multiple charities. I have been involved in the Soccer and Lacrosse program at the high school. The String Orchestra and many other clubs such as SWAC (student Wellness advisory committee) and Red Ribbon (HIV/AIDS). I have also been part of the Senior mentor program which is very unique and different in our school than other school's mentor programs. As 1 out of 18 seniors chosen in the entire grade me and my partner taught a class of 24 freshmen 1st period teaching them how to adjust to high school and important life lessons and tips they would need in order to be the best and do the best they could in the next four years in high school.", 'In every school there are those few good teachers but I can truthfully say over my past four years at Byram Hills High School a majority of my teachers have been some of the best educators a student could ever ask for.']

column6: ['Variable, depends a lot on your child.', 'For a relatively small school system there is a wide range of choice for clubs and organizations.  Some require minimal time/commitment and others are extremely time consuming.  There are a lot of groups that support charitable organizations.  The school is very open to adding clubs if there are enough students interested in starting something.', 'There is a wide range of quality of teachers.  Science seems to have the strongest teachers followed by Math and English.  Foreign languages is inconsistent - I have heard a lot of complaints about the French teachers.  Social Studies is the weakest area as you hear many complaints about various teachers and there is one teacher who the parents consistently file complaints about but nothing is done.  Most parents now know to do everything possible to avoid having their child get this teacher.  You have to network with other parents to find out who the good teachers are and try to do what you can to get your kid in their classes.', 'BHHS is a very safe campus and environment.  The students seem to generally care for each other.  Middle school may have some more instances of bullying but you rarely hear of it at the HS.', 'BHHS is generally a good school system but it caters to the top 10% of the class and students with special needs.  Students in the middle are often overlooked and not brought to their full potential.  The school is very proud of its record and academic achievements but I would venture to guess that 80% of the students receive some type of out side tutoring in order to excel.  Parents in this district spend thousands of dollars on tutoring from elementary school on to college prep.  Teachers are generally engaged but the quality fluctuates widely from teacher to teacher. Social Studies is by far the weakest department.  The students do have school spirit and it is a nice, close knit community.  Very little bullying and an emphasis and awareness of providing support for good mental health.', 'Students are well prepared for college level work', 'Seems to be something for everyone', 'Most teachers really care about their subject area and are good teachers', 'Think the school is very safe and students are well cared fot', 'we get a lot of work. the classes are challenging regardless of your intelligence. scheduling process is organized but complicated.', "the nurse is very nice and always able to help. the nurse's office is very clean. physical bullying isn't prevalent in the school. safety is clearly a concern. we have to sign out when leaving our closed campus building. there is security at ever entrance. i always feel safe.", 'there is a club for everyone, and it is easy to get involved in one. we often joke that in 10 years from now there will be more clubs than students. sports are also very popular. varsity sports are competitive and many people participate in them.', 'our school has great school spirit for sports and homecoming. it is great to see the whole school come together. byram hills is a very high pressured and competitive environment. i always feel safe and comfortable at school which is why i would choose it again, however, for some the competitive environment may be a turn off.', 'most of the teachers are good at communicating with the students. for example, they will use Google Classroom to post homework or change a test if they need to. they are also available for extra help and are willing to help. some teachers have ambitious grading systems.', 'We have police nearby and there are locked doors. Always ready', 'They are good at teaching in general and they are smart', 'The academics are good but difficult. There is a lot of competition', 'There are clubs but most of them are charitable or academic. There are no clubs for interests only.', 'Byram has strong academics...homework is brutal...focus is on passing state tests like regents and not so much on quality of understanding...cramming approach....upside lots of ap courses...focus is on the excelling student but leaves all the rest behind...young teachers lack the ability to handle a diverse classroom with various needs...cultural diversity and sensitivity is lacking in some key teachers and administration....bias is obvious...more training and time needs to be spent in this arena...it will help all kids....it will better prepare the students for college and real world where they will have interact outside the Armonk biosphere...which will have people of all backgrounds....also the arts or athletic...or special needs...or minority Asian...black...Indian...Hispanic....or the child of another sexual preference...student has a lot of dimension to offer to the education experience and should be able to feel comfortable in the learning environment and not picked on or singled out', 'Very secure and minimal events on grounds and school works hard to make sure of it...very low tolerance for criminal activity']

Parents in this district spend thousands of dollars on tutoring from elementary school on to college prep.  Teachers are generally engaged but the quality fluctuates widely from teacher to teacher. Social Studies is by far the weakest department.  The students do have school spirit and it is a nice, close knit community.  Very little bullying and an emphasis and awareness of providing support for good mental health.', 'Students are well prepared for college level work', 'Seems to be something for everyone', 'Most teachers really care about their subject area and are good teachers', 'Think the school is very safe and students are well cared fot', 'we get a lot of work. the classes are challenging regardless of your intelligence. scheduling process is organized but complicated.', "the nurse is very nice and always able to help. the nurse's office is very clean. physical bullying isn't prevalent in the school. safety is clearly a concern. we have to sign out when leaving our closed campus building. there is security at ever entrance. i always feel safe.", 'there is a club for everyone, and it is easy to get involved in one. we often joke that in 10 years from now there will be more clubs than students. sports are also very popular. varsity sports are competitive and many people participate in them.', 'our school has great school spirit for sports and homecoming. it is great to see the whole school come together. byram hills is a very high pressured and competitive environment. i always feel safe and comfortable at school which is why i would choose it again, however, for some the competitive environment may be a turn off.', 'most of the teachers are good at communicating with the students. for example, they will use Google Classroom to post homework or change a test if they need to. they are also available for extra help and are willing to help. some teachers have ambitious grading systems.', 'We have police nearby and there are locked doors. Always ready', 'They are good at teaching in general and they are smart', 'The academics are good but difficult. There is a lot of competition', 'There are clubs but most of them are charitable or academic. There are no clubs for interests only.', 'Byram has strong academics...homework is brutal...focus is on passing state tests like regents and not so much on quality of understanding...cramming approach....upside lots of ap courses...focus is on the excelling student but leaves all the rest behind...young teachers lack the ability to handle a diverse classroom with various needs...cultural diversity and sensitivity is lacking in some key teachers and administration....bias is obvious...more training and time needs to be spent in this arena...it will help all kids....it will better prepare the students for college and real world where they will have interact outside the Armonk biosphere...which will have people of all backgrounds....also the arts or athletic...or special needs...or minority Asian...black...Indian...Hispanic....or the child of another sexual preference...student has a lot of dimension to offer to the education experience and should be able to feel comfortable in the learning environment and not picked on or singled out', 'Very secure and minimal events on grounds and school works hard to make sure of it...very low tolerance for criminal activity']

column2: ['Pelham so far has been extremely enjoyable. Everything from Olympics from the classes have been fun and easy to get into. I see some other comments complaining about the racial tolerance but as a minority I never experienced any sort of racism in my entire life at Pelham. The people here are easy to get along with and the teachers truly care about the students. Pelham is a very good school overall and I’m happy to go here.', "It is very safe and welcoming! Everyone's voice matters and it is a great school to be in if you want to learn and grow.", 'Great school with strong academics and school spirit. The school definitely caters to the affluent and is not very diverse.', "A great small public high school and during my time there I was able to interact with interesting and engaging peers and students. However, the school did not prepare me well for college because there was barely any reading for classes. There is a huge divide in the student body between wealthier, white students  and students within the community that struggle financially. If you don't take advantage of certain resources at the school you get stuck without a great support system from the student body/teachers. I know many students that would skip class regularly and the teachers wouldn't even bother to help them. As for the teachers, it really is a mixed bag; I had probably 5-7 teachers that had engaging classes. Other teachers did not care if you did your work and would put on videos the entire class because they had nothing better to teach.", "I wasn't like the vast majority of kids who went to school in Pelham. Sure, I went to Pelham schools throughout my youth, but what separated me from everyone else was that I didn't live in Pelham. As someone who didn't live with everyone else, I still felt welcomed by the community and I honestly feel like I was more-so raised in Pelham than in my actual town. Most students are very nice, and the teachers are always more than willing to help you succeed, because that's their most important objective. What made my years in Pelham so special to me was the school's spirit. Every grade brings a new level of school spirit, and when everyone comes together, whether it's for homecoming or olympics, it just goes to show just how much everyone loves the community and how special of a town Pelham really is. That's what made me fall in love with Pelham.", "It's a good school and it pushes you and keeps you on a higher education level than you may be at in another school. However, there are resources to help anyone in need and teachers are mostly helpful and understanding.", 'My experience at PMHS was fantastic from start to finish. As part of the 2018 class who won two olympics, a witness to the historic 2016-2017 pvp hockey team, the 2015-16 and 16-17 rugby teams, and so many other great achievements, I have incredible love for the community and school and will cherish the people I met and memories forever.', 'My experience at PMHS was great! Each student has so many options when it comes to courses to enroll in and each teacher cares about you.  The access to a variety of resources such as student chromebooks and a large library help set students up for success.', 'Pelham Memorial High School is the classic medium to large sized public school that has set its standards very high in comparison to other public schools around the nation. The determination of the teachers to help the students is impeccable. But the problem is that the teachers are always required to have a minimum amount of homework, tests, or quizzes. Especially in the case of the language department where many times we would be faced with two to three assessments a week. Socially, if you play sports, and like to push your liver to the brink, you will have no problem feeling welcomed by other groups. Otherwise, you can easily feel unwelcomed because of the close-minded peers that you share the halls with.', 'There are many things I like about my school, but I believe the single thing that makes it stand out, is the effort put out by the teachers. The teachers create a personal bond with students that enable us to be comfortable with coming after school, asking questions during class time, and talk about and personal troubles we are having. I believe that has certainly helped me seek help to understand tough curriculum, and help when I needed it the most.', 'No bullying and lots of school spirit! Variety of courses to take. Teachers are obviously passionate about what they do and caring towards their students. Students truly have a voice here.', "As a student that just graduated from PMHS, I just want to say that I had a good 4 years there. This school provided me with a range of opportunities that I wouldn't have received in the previous location I lived in. All of their teachers truly enjoy what they are doing and genuinely care for the students. As a former student, our voices could be heard in PMHS, which I really appreciated.", 'My experience at Pelham Memorial High School has been one of great prestige. Not only have I grown as an individual and young adult, but I have adapted many skills that consist of interacting with people, especially my teachers. Attending Pelham Memorial High School is more than getting a high school degree, as the staff there is truly dedicated with providing students, such as myself, with the best experience possible.', "The teachers put their best efforts to help you understand the material.  They give you a choice of many different types of activities/clubs to help you figure out your interests. It's a very friendly environment and their is support all around. This school also offers open enrollment so you choose between  different class to find the one that best suits you.  Finding a good collage is hard,  the counselors here do everything to make sure your attending your best fit collage.", 'Overall, PMHS is a great school. There are many great teachers who are always willing to stay after school and help you out.', 'I loved growing up in Pelham and lived there all my life until graduating and attending the University of Alabama.', 'every ones is friendly, but can be a little materialistic and money oriented at times. Other than that they are hard working well rounded golden boys and girl scouts it a really sports and academic school. with a great small town vibe.', "I like Pelham although it could use a few changes. The food is horrible I haven't been to the cafeteria since freshmen year. Most of the teachers are awesome, but some are the opposite. There's definetly a lot of resources and opportunities available to prepare you for college.", 'Really nice school. Great atmosphere, plenty of clubs to be in, and faculty  is always there to help you. ', "The school is extremely diverse, and offers a range of opportunities for driven students in both academic and sport-related fields of study. But, I will say that, if you don't like seminar-style classrooms with college-style teaching, then this is not the right school for you (It's basically a private-school run as a public school). "]

column6: ['The educational system at Pelham Memorial High School is excellent in my opinion. Most of the teachers are really knowledgeable, genuine and helpful. The work load can be attainable based on the classes you are enrolled in, however the cirrculum in this school requires more work ethic based on how the teachers determine the difficulty of the tests, quizzes and based on how much work load they want their students to handle. Another factor that contributes to the school curriculum at Pelham Memorial High School is how competitive it can be and how much involvement the parents within the  community have in the school.', 'The Extracurricular activities at Pelham Memorial High School are exciting. The knowledgeable teachers are really involved in most of the clubs. Most of the good students who attend the schools contribute a lot to the development of clubs and other extracurricular activities.', 'The 4 years I have spent here at Pelham Memorial High School have been good overall. It has been an interesting experience, because I got more exposed to both pleasant and unpleasant things. I have enjoyed spending time with my good friends, and have developed good relationships with the counselors who have encouraged me to stay focused on my goals. I have been taught a lot of good lessons about life by my mother, guidance counselors and my guardian to guide throughout my high school career. Going to Pelham Memorial High School has really taught me a lot since I have developed a lot of good characteristics such as being positive, working hard and stay ambitious. The schools is located in a well organized peaceful town named Pelham in Westchester County New York. The older people within the town are kind and I have been able to develop good relationships with different groups of people who are add value to my life and have been a good influence to me.', 'The teachers at Pelham Memorial High School are friendly, persistent, helpful, and well educated. Most of them have inspired me to not limit myself, to go after my goals and to stay focused and keep working hard. My favorite teachers who I would come to see frequently showed me how important it is to prepare ahead by reading more and teaching myself more information. Some were strict graders, for instance, my AP U.S History teacher would show me the careless mistakes I would make when writing essays. Every time there was an up coming test, he would show me the main topics I needed to study. The same thing applied to my Biology Honors teacher I had in 9th Grade. I would always note down the important stuff he taught and I would come review the content with him everyday after school ended. These teachers were considerate enough to help me during times of difficulty.', "I joined a few clubs in high school and I have to say they were not very engaging and I didn't feel that I learned anything after I left. The athletic teams were engaging and fun, even though many coaches are not fair I'm terms of playing time (but that's just my opinion).", "In terms of academics and athletics, high schools don't get much better. However, the social life is quite difficult to navigate in this particular establishment. There are many strongly bound cliques throughout the school, and fitting in, the average American high school cliché, is no exception for PMHS.", 'Overall, the teachers at PMHS are among the greatest in the state, or even the country as far as public schools go. The teachers always strove for excellence and are engaging, encouraging, and helpful to all students. They are extremely knowledgeable in their respective subjects, and they almost always  instruct the material accordingly.', 'Parent support their kids and want the best for them', 'This school is very caring. They are a very sports centered town but I LOVE it.', 'good school. good academics, and good students. also has fun traditions', 'Most teachers care a lot about their students, and all are available after school for academy period.', 'They are extremely enforced. Drills and information assemblies are done often throughout the school year to keep reminding students of safety procedures and the resources available.', 'There are a variety of clubs and organizations available at the school and if not you are always welcomed to start one. They often have a big attendance and support from students with fun options.', "I've had the best experience at this school. They made my transition process very easy and comfortable. They made me feel like I had been part of the school and wasn't just a new student.", "Teachers really worry about their students' performance and academic potential, always encouraging them to be their best they can be and take advantage of the helpful resources they have access to.", 'The school does a good job making sure every person coming in the building is accounted for and checked.', 'Most students participate in at least one sport and if not, theyre probably involved in the play or other arts. Almost everyone is involved in a least one club and everyone is passionate about what they do.', 'Our olympics is something that is completely unique to us. It unifies each grade to work as a whole and its notjust about sports, so for people that arent into athletics theres something for them to do too and they get cheered on as well. The teachers also get involved and we collect massive amounts of cans for a can drive.', 'I very rarely have had teachers who have not been extremely eager to go out of their way to help a student go over something they do not understand or might have missed.', "Doesn't cater to students unless they reach out for help.  Not many different types of people go here."]

column2: ['I really grew as a person at the Wheatley School. I learned a lot and came out of school a lot stronger than I came into it.', 'All teachers care and are willing to spend whatever time it takes to help a student.   Athletic facilities need upgrading.', 'I love this school because there are so many teachers and resources to help students. The teachers have an excellent relationship with students because they are always there to offer help when we need it. The people are very friendly and everyone knows each other.', 'I believe that the Wheatley school is a very diverse and opening school. Wheatley embraces their students and have a variety of after school programs. In addition the school has a great amount of sports open to everybody. I would recommend Wheatley because of the great teacher and awesome education. Lastly Wheatley is a great size and very small classes.', "I went to this school from 8-10. The students are very sweet and so is the faculty. They are on the smaller side of a public school but it doesn't feel small. all the grades are friendly and you have so much extracurricular to choose from.", 'Wheatley is academically strong and offers a wide range of extracurricular activities. Most of the sports teams are pretty good. Grade spirit makes up for the lack of school spirit.', "I love the teachers i've had and all the different course levels they offer. They have so many different clubs for me to be a part of and amazing sports teams that i had the pleasure of joining which allowed me to make new friends.", 'Extremely kind and passionate teachers who all want the best for their students. However, the school system is extremely lenient on its students. Students can get away with getting their grades changed by having their parents call the guidance department. Grade inflation is a big problem.', "I like how it's such a small school that everyone knows everyone. Also I love how the teachers help their students inside and outside the classroom", "Very good school academically. Small school that allows students to have great relationships with their teachers. Downside is there isn't a lot of school spirit and the athletics are decent.", "Small school with great social studies teachers and lots of AP choices.  It's a little too small sometimes as the entire graduating class is about 120 kids.  Sports are not that important at this school and sometimes there is very little school spirit.", 'I am  a graduate of Wheatley High School as well as my older brother, my oldest son and now this year my youngest son. I have to honestly say that I love my high school!! The memories, clubs, academics,  sports, music and the list goes on and on were great!!! I got along with a majority of the students and still remain friends with them thru social media', 'I love the Wheatley High School, and all of the opportunities they provide. They put academics first. and outside activities are for if you do really good with academics. Most of the teachers really try their best to see you succeed in not only academics but also in your personal life. They provide many different clubs and activities. They also prepare you for college, and explain fully the coarses and options that you are able to take.', 'Extracurricular programs are well-funded at Wheatley, allowing students to pursue their interests in all areas from music and the arts to sports and student activism clubs.', 'I would choose to attend Wheatley again because of all the experiences with my peers, teachers, and school actives that allowed me to grow and develop into the person that I am.', 'All the teachers in the school are incredibly knowledgable and engaging and have many years of teaching experience.', 'Security in this school is relatively high in terms of measures taken to not let random strangers just walk into the school.  However, there is almost nothing stopping an armed individual from shooting up the whole place.  The only defense is the abundance of unarmed security guards, but thats about it.', 'There are a wide array of extra curricular activities to partake in in this school.  A club known as ICU for example is a huge hit in school.  It is a club that brings together people of different cultures to do activities together.  This club receives a large number of new, diverse members every year.  It is strongly supported by staff members and students within the school, so much to the point that every year this club is able to host a massive cultural festival for the school thanks to collaborative efforts of students and staff.', "While I do agree that our school is very strong academically and athletically, to me it is not a school that I've had the most pleasant time in.  I feel that certain decisions are made in a very biased manner.  In other words, I feel teachers and parents have way too much authority about how the school is run.  I understand that they have more experience and know how exactly a kid should be raised, but it doesn't change the fact that they do make certain things very inconvenient for us students.  As students I feel like we should have some say in how the school is run rather than handing all the authority over to staff and parents.  I feel that if some of the more trivial matters were decided upon by students then overall satisfaction in attending this school would increase.", 'Most teachers in our school are very effective at teaching students what they need to know.  Some may go above and beyond what the curriculum tells them to do simply for the purposes of making students smarter.  There may be some teachers who do slack off a bit but the majority do what they have to for the betterment of the students.']

They put academics first. and outside activities are for if you do really good with academics. Most of the teachers really try their best to see you succeed in not only academics but also in your personal life. They provide many different clubs and activities. They also prepare you for college, and explain fully the coarses and options that you are able to take.', 'Extracurricular programs are well-funded at Wheatley, allowing students to pursue their interests in all areas from music and the arts to sports and student activism clubs.', 'I would choose to attend Wheatley again because of all the experiences with my peers, teachers, and school actives that allowed me to grow and develop into the person that I am.', 'All the teachers in the school are incredibly knowledgable and engaging and have many years of teaching experience.', 'Security in this school is relatively high in terms of measures taken to not let random strangers just walk into the school.  However, there is almost nothing stopping an armed individual from shooting up the whole place.  The only defense is the abundance of unarmed security guards, but thats about it.', 'There are a wide array of extra curricular activities to partake in in this school.  A club known as ICU for example is a huge hit in school.  It is a club that brings together people of different cultures to do activities together.  This club receives a large number of new, diverse members every year.  It is strongly supported by staff members and students within the school, so much to the point that every year this club is able to host a massive cultural festival for the school thanks to collaborative efforts of students and staff.', "While I do agree that our school is very strong academically and athletically, to me it is not a school that I've had the most pleasant time in.  I feel that certain decisions are made in a very biased manner.  In other words, I feel teachers and parents have way too much authority about how the school is run.  I understand that they have more experience and know how exactly a kid should be raised, but it doesn't change the fact that they do make certain things very inconvenient for us students.  As students I feel like we should have some say in how the school is run rather than handing all the authority over to staff and parents.  I feel that if some of the more trivial matters were decided upon by students then overall satisfaction in attending this school would increase.", 'Most teachers in our school are very effective at teaching students what they need to know.  Some may go above and beyond what the curriculum tells them to do simply for the purposes of making students smarter.  There may be some teachers who do slack off a bit but the majority do what they have to for the betterment of the students.']
column6: ["I've never felt unsafe at this school. There is always an adult I can go to if I do though.", "The level of commitment for the Tri-M Music Honor Society is amazing. The students are all willing to help out and stay to work on projects that need to get done. Unlike some other clubs at school, where there are a lot of undedicated members or members who just show up but don't participate, the people of Tri-M are hardworking and responsible.", "The atmosphere at school is simultaneously competitive yet collaborative. The students care about each other but are ambitious and individual. Ultimately, there's a very caring environment, and the small student population creates a sense of family.", "Overall, the teachers are school are willing to meet students outside of class to help them with the coursework. They are approachable and genuinely care about the students' well-being.", 'Never had any complaints in the department of feeling secure, bullying or anything of the sort', "I had the pleasure tone a part of the Spanish club during my 8th and 9th grade year. Since I focus most of my free time in athletics within the school I didn't participate in any other club until joining the National Honor Society and that has been an honor to be a part of. Complying with my service hours and the volunteer opportunities have given me something unexpected, gratitude. I see know how fortunate I have been these past 5 years as a Wheatley student.", 'I have never felt unsafe walking around the school.', 'Many teachers respond quickly to emails and some even give out their phone numbers for easier and faster communication with their students.', 'Many students are a part of a team and enjoy participating.', 'Because of the size of the school, the principal and guidance counselors are able to really get to know many (if not all) of the students at Wheatley and give each individual student the help and attention they need.', 'Most Wheatley students do not go straight home after school. Many participate in clubs and a majority of students are part of a sport team.', 'This school has provided me the tools to be successful for the rest of my life.', 'The schools is full of great opportunities and has a great selection for every student.', 'The schools guidance counselors are great, and always in their offices if you need any help or just want to talk.', 'The food is either a hit or miss. Some days the food looks fine, while others it looks like cardboard.', 'Our schools fan support is amazing. Every playoff game brings in a packed house.', 'I believe it is a very safe place for my children.', 'Being a student at Wheatley has been an amazing experience. Because of its small size, each and every Wheatley student is able to connect on a personal level with most, or all, of their teachers and peers.', 'teacher for the most part are excellent, there is an occaisional poor teachers but they are few and far between.', 'All 4 of my children had a good experience at Wheatley high school. strong academics, good family feel to school.']

column2: ['Challenging course load, prepared me very well for college. Teachers are strict but have the students best interests at heart! Loved my experience here at Darien High.', "The academics prepares you better for college compared to other public schools in the area. The teachers were friendly but the students weren't always the nicest. The town of Darien feels like its own bubble that a lot of the students have rarely stepped out of.", "Great school, lots of smart kids and it's easy to find your group of friends. Downsides: almost exclusively white (few asian, almost no black/hispanic kids), the food is expensive and mediocre, the workload is a bit much at times, and there's a cutthroat competitive vibe at times.", 'The school is very acclaimed and is generally a great school. They have access to technology and very strong sports, arts, and technology programs. A lot of the students are driven to do well. Downsides include the "party scene" and the low diversity rate.', 'DHS is a great school and there are so many oppurtunites here. I love how teachers are always open and welcoming— you can see them any time for extra help and there are a lot of resources for extra help, as well as a wide variety of clubs and groups. The coursework is very tough and teachers sometimes expect too much and forget that we have a bunch of other classes to do work for too, but overall they are pretty flexible sometimes and really work in out best interest and are very helpful.', 'Very rigorous courses with efficiently prepare students for college. Sports are very intense but provide fun and exciting atmosphere for school spirit.', "Darien is a great community in Connecticut, and with it comes an amazing High School.  Many people may say it's terrible, but in reality it's a great place to be.  It has great academics, sports, people, and facilities.  People may claim that they're are racist Democrats, but in reality those people are just jealous that those Democrats are smarter and thrive better in life.", 'Darien High School has excellent academics but the administration is extremely corrupt. They do not care about the students and constantly coverup abuse in the school and then pay to have these abuse scandals removed from the internet (you can only ever find news stories on them in the physical newspaper, and not often). Take advantage of the academics but steer clear otherwise.', "This school is filled with rich, white, racist democrats. Yes you heard me right. This town has a major problem with hard drugs and alcohol. Narcotics play a large role in any activity OUTSIDE of school. This school has a major problem with cliques and its attitude towards non white Anglo-Saxon people. Kids at this school are just plain mean. Teachers have favorites and don't care about you unless you are an athlete. I myself am white but I also notice injustice and mean people when I see them. I made friends but this school is very selective and specific.", 'The school has great teachers and especially has a strong selection of courses to choose from. Also, there are many activities for students to engage in.', 'Darien High School is home to some of the meanest students. It is a constant competition of who has the most expensive shoes, newest clothes, and most money. Everyone is white, and  is extremely good at sports. Do not join the cheerleading team, you will be ridiculed and harassed daily. I ran into a lot of awful people at this school unfortunately. The majority of the students at this school will pretend to be your friend yet secretly hate you, spread rumors and share your personal information. The amount of bullying at this school is disgusting.  Go to this school if you have money, are white, have blonde hair, and play sports. If not you probably wont fit in.', 'Many teachers I had are excited to teach their subjects, and have unique teaching techniques. The Music Department is strong and I am glad to have been a part of it. Sports are too prioritized in this school, but many people recognize that.', 'Darien offered me the best of clubs, courses, and teachers. My mathematical modeling club, my Mu Alpha Theta (math club), Physics Club (Jets), and Spanish course all earning national recognition and some placing top 10 nationwide in competitions. The school offered me a sophomore college class, Multivariable Calculus, as well as two years of AP Physics, which is uncommon in most schools. I have to say I would like to see more people able to take these top courses than the select twelve of us in both our second year AP physics class and Multivariable (due to restrictions). However, the education provided was top notch.', "Darien High School is a very privileged place to get an education. It has the best facilities (except a pool), strong teachers, rabid parental involvement, and a very rigorous academic standard. Unfortunately, there is very little diversity and the moral code is lacking. Sports and athletes are elevated to an elitist level that is not conducive to a healthy environment.  Although I am an accomplished athlete (finishing in the top 4 State Opens in diving freshman through senior year and earning two All-American designations, with most likely a third for this year), I am disappointed that the students doing other important, vital programs get little to no recognition. When athletes misbehave, their conduct is overlooked and the school works to protect them. I don't feel that this is a good feeder system for society. I have enjoyed my time at DHS, but I am looking forward to being exposed to a bigger variety of people at college.", 'Teachers, counselors, and administrators are all very invested in the well being and futures of all students. There are a great number of student resources and opportunities to get involved. VERY little diversity but overall an invaluable educational experience. I feel very well prepared for college.', "Very homogeneous but it's not impossible to be yourself.  Ridiculously good at sports- there are no places for kids who just want to play a sport for fun or haven't been in the junior leagues since at least elementary school.  Everyone goes to college, so you have plenty of people involved in the process and can lean on your friends.  No swimming pool! (This upset the community during it's construction in 2005 and led to accusations of YMCA conspiracies.)  The teachers are great but not all of them are easy to talk to after hours.", 'It definitely makes sense that DHS would be found in Darien, CT.  It definitely makes sense that DHS would be found in Darien, CT.', 'Darien High School is an excellent school which provides its students with plenty of academic opportunities. With lots of AP and Honors courses offered students are able to receive a very good education. Additionally, the athletics programs are very diverse and well known, offering students plenty of opportunity.', 'Great classes to choose from with both "Honors" and AP classes. Lots of sports opportunities and after-school activities for all interests. Teachers are involved and are helpful, you just need to ask. The school itself is new and large.  Takes time to get from one are/wing to another.', 'The academic quality is strong at Darien High School. The majority of teachers have a passion for teaching and will help their students in any way possible, and will help prep you for college. However, DHS needs a more diverse range of students.']

The majority of teachers have a passion for teaching and will help their students in any way possible, and will help prep you for college. However, DHS needs a more diverse range of students.']
column6: ["I'm currently a senior at DHS and have lived in Darien my whole life. The high school has a very good reputation and its been good while Ive been there.  Great academics but the administration doesn't seem to understand how much pressure is on the students.  There are many groups of kids and clubs are good.  I am involved in theater and other clubs but the pressure is intense to get everything done perfectly.", 'A wonderful school that definitely prepares you for college. It is very competitive and stressful environment, but you have to choose classes wisely. Many people get swept up with the crowd about a number of AP classes one has to take. It is very stifling for the minority, but if you love sports, then this school is very focused on their athletics. Overall, good experience.', 'It is a pleasure attending this school so far! The classes are engaging and interesting, even in a stressful enviroment such as DHS.  I have learned so much in my first year and am excited to learn so much more!', 'As a senior from Darien High School, I have now developed a full experience of my high school career. My time at Darien High school was outstanding. I feel that I recieved a top notch education from an equally great faculty and staff. The school spirit is beaming down the halls everyday. I feel very safe and not just a statistic at Darien High School, teachers and administrators as well as other faculty know you by name.', 'Darien High School is a great school to attend.  I have really learned a lot and benefitted from it.  The teachers are fantastic and the school is beautiful.  I feel very prepared to attend college next year after having attended Darien High.', "The school is the best school to go to for four years if you are white, Christian, rich, straight and really into sports. Most of the minority populations could probably, and sadly, fit into a single class room. It is an overall safe place, in the sense that there are no fights in the hallways. There is the creation  of an alternative high school program that will be located at the local library. Two of my most favorite high school teachers are heading the program and I couldn't be more proud. Two years ago in health, my favorite gym teacher said no one else thought we were old enough to watch the movie HAZE. It's about binge drinking and Greek Life in college leading to death. But, just the other day, admin had the entire senior class watch it in the auditorium. We are changing for the better.", 'I liked the variety of classes that you can choose from, whether they are electives or actual classes. However, there are many students which can result in cliques and students being very separated.', 'The school has a great education system with amazing teacher that make sure the students stay on task with the work!  School had an great moral!', 'Hated being here but I loved the friends I made. You have to hope you get the good teachers otherwise your life will be hell.', 'A lot of different classes and opportunities to be found at this school. Scheduling process is easy to handle and counselors are always there to help you.', "The school isn't very diverse ethnically/racially but theres a lot of student involvement in clubs and government. People are also very accepting of each other and their differences.", 'Very competitive in sports but a lot of fun to be on the team.', 'Everyone was kind to each other on the most part and everyone had fun with their friends', 'Teachers cared about how we were everyday and if we had trouble with something. They had a genuine interest in getting to know us.', 'A majority of the teachers are great and are so helpful, but of course there are the teachers who are rude and do not teach well. The workload can get quite heavy depending on what classes you are taking and what teachers you have.', 'The school is very accepting and there are a bunch of different people. There are cliques and there can be peer pressure at times. Overall, the social scene at DHS is pretty average.', 'There are tons of extracurricular activities at DHS. The faculty encourages everyone to join clubs and after school activities. Even the faculty themselves are involved in the clubs.', "It's only my second year and I have already had some great teachers and amazing experiences. This school is really different than other schools and I love how unique it is.", 'Some teachers and teaching styles are better and more effective tham others, but overall, they are good.', 'Every imaginable club/activity/sport you could imagine. No reason not to be involved.']

column1: Half Hollow Hills High School West
column2: ['Half Hollow Hills West was an outstanding school. With amazing academics that prepared me for everyday life and college.', 'My experience at Half Hollow Hills High School West has been amazing so far. I really enjoyed my time here. there were many things that made my time here quite great, ranging from the excellent teachers who know their material and teach them in a way so that us students can learn effectively and succeed, to the availability of many clubs that students can join, and to the many course offerings that the school gives to its students, allowing us to excel in classes that we want to be in. The school itself is smaller than most other schools, which allows a more personalized learning experience. One thing I would change in the school is just the size of the school itself, as I like to be in an environment with a large student population. However the size of my school is still good enough and not disruptive to the learning experience.', "Highschool west is the best school I've ever been too. The school is extremely diverse with Race, Gender and Sexuality. And the school influences the creative of students and the arts. There's a club for everybody and everyone is extremely nice and outgoing. This school has definitely helped me grow as a person and help me discover who I am. I say that I have enjoyed my time at High School West so far!", "This is a good school and one of the best on Long Island but it definitely has things to work on. Most of the teachers give the feeling that they don't care and most are average to bad. Most of the real learning especially for higher level classes is done by yourself. The food is horrible. It's pretty diverse but people aren't the most inclusive. Overall, this is a good school compared to most. Also no IB classes.", "Looking back on my experiences with High School West, it really was a great school. The variety of classes is incredible- there was always a class for everyone and classes at different levels that allowed you to tailor your education more to you and do more than just your core subjects. There are plenty of art, business, STEM electives and other courses that allow you to study whichever topic you're actually interested in and figure out what you want to do with your future. In general the teachers were incredibly nice and I thoroughly enjoyed participating in their classes. The only issues I had with the school were scheduling issues that generally got solved given some time.", "I truly loved this school but everyone's experience in High School largely differs. My first year here, freshmen year was one of the happiest of my life. This school has a nice atmosphere of generosity and altruism combined with innovation and creativity. I have heard two new kids describe this school as being very nice compared to their old. From what I've heard about other schools, this school is a lot better than most. But this does depend on your individual experience. High School is what you make it to be.", 'I enjoyed my time at High School West. Although simply a high school its moderate size and variety of students and teachers paved the way for different experiences and ideas to flourish.', 'I like how this school is very diverse and has a really good academic program. However, I would like the school to have more lock down drills because even though I feel safe in the school, I would feel better if there was more practice drills.', 'In my opinion it’s a really good school in one of the better districts located on Long Island. The administration is very heavily involved, which allows for a much better relationship between faculty and students.', 'High School West has prepared me for college by offering a number of key advanced placement and honor classes.  The guidance office was always available to provide support and advice during my college applications. There are many clubs and activities.  The school also offers many opportunities to get involved in sports.  They even provided transportation for the kids to stay after school and participate in clubs and sports.', "I received a great education. I was often encouraged by teachers. One of the principals, who I didn't know knew who I was, often seeked me out to acknowledge my achievements and encourage my future success.", 'It was a wonderful high school to go to. Everybody was very involved and willing to help. The teachers were very helpful and willing to set up additional help hours with students. It was very clean. Overall all of the students were very respectful of each other and the building and when and if there was a behavior problem it was handled very quickly. The administration was responsive to the students needs and concerns. Students have a lot of freedom.', 'In my four years at high school west, I have learned life long lessons from various teachers and have learned to become intrinsically motivated for my own benefit. This school offers its students numerous courses that students can be inspired by.', 'A good school, could use some interior updates. Teachers are all friendly and knowledgeable. There are plenty of after school activities, ranging from sports to chess club and other pursuits.', 'Teachers were personable, attentive, and willing to help any student who put forth effort and attended extra help.', 'My experience at High school West was a good one. Some things I recommend for those entering as a Freshman are to join clubs that align with your interests, take enjoyable classes, sleep well, make an effort to not procrastinate, develop a close relationship with your teachers and your guidance counselor, and make new friends. These things are what I did that allowed me to truly enjoy my high school experience.', 'Like a rated R High School Music. Pretty wealthy school compared to ones my friends in NYC go to. Id take my kids here if im still in this area.', "As a first year college student looking back at my experience at High School West, I would say it was overall a great high school. There are certain aspects of this high school that I am especially impressed with as I now realize that not everyone has had the same type of high school experience. It really does have a solid reputation, academically and athletically, and they do have a number of really amazing teachers. Not only is this school extremely diverse, but students of different backgrounds and races are truly intergrated (mostly). The attitude of most staff and administration seemed to be more 'out to get you' than there to help, which seems to do more harm than good. Over my four years the school was becoming increasingly strict, to an unnecessary extreme. This was to the point where it felt as though education was not as much of a priority as enforcing policy was.", 'I like the diversity and the ambience at this school. I feel as if the students may be too competitive, but that makes me all the more ambitious to strive for what I want. The teachers are very resourceful, responsive, and understanding', 'Overall, Half Hollow Hills High School West is a great school with an abundant of many opportunities. I love the variety of people and races that attend this school, and this only furthers my ability to learn about the world. The staff is very friendly and aid me in my growth each and everyday. My teachers encourage me to do my best and reach the many goals that I hold, both academically and beyond.']
column4: ['Half Hollow Hills West was an outstanding school. With amazing academics that prepared me for everyday life and college.', 'My experience at Half Hollow Hills High School West has been amazing so far. I really enjoyed my time here. there were many things that made my time here quite great, ranging from the excellent teachers who know their material and teach them in a way so that us students can learn effectively and succeed, to the availability of many clubs that students can join, and to the many course offerings that the school gives to its students, allowing us to excel in classes that we want to be in. The school itself is smaller than most other schools, which allows a more personalized learning experience. One thing I would change in the school is just the size of the school itself, as I like to be in an environment with a large student population. However the size of my school is still good enough and not disruptive to the learning experience.', "Highschool west is the best school I've ever been too. The school is extremely diverse with Race, Gender and Sexuality. And the school influences the creative of students and the arts. There's a club for everybody and everyone is extremely nice and outgoing. This school has definitely helped me grow as a person and help me discover who I am. I say that I have enjoyed my time at High School West so far!", "This is a good school and one of the best on Long Island but it definitely has things to work on. Most of the teachers give the feeling that they don't care and most are average to bad. Most of the real learning especially for higher level classes is done by yourself. The food is horrible. It's pretty diverse but people aren't the most inclusive. Overall, this is a good school compared to most. Also no IB classes.", "Looking back on my experiences with High School West, it really was a great school. The variety of classes is incredible- there was always a class for everyone and classes at different levels that allowed you to tailor your education more to you and do more than just your core subjects. There are plenty of art, business, STEM electives and other courses that allow you to study whichever topic you're actually interested in and figure out what you want to do with your future. In general the teachers were incredibly nice and I thoroughly enjoyed participating in their classes. The only issues I had with the school were scheduling issues that generally got solved given some time.", "I truly loved this school but everyone's experience in High School largely differs. My first year here, freshmen year was one of the happiest of my life. This school has a nice atmosphere of generosity and altruism combined with innovation and creativity. I have heard two new kids describe this school as being very nice compared to their old. From what I've heard about other schools, this school is a lot better than most. But this does depend on your individual experience. High School is what you make it to be.", 'I enjoyed my time at High School West. Although simply a high school its moderate size and variety of students and teachers paved the way for different experiences and ideas to flourish.', 'I like how this school is very diverse and has a really good academic program. However, I would like the school to have more lock down drills because even though I feel safe in the school, I would feel better if there was more practice drills.', 'In my opinion it’s a really good school in one of the better districts located on Long Island. The administration is very heavily involved, which allows for a much better relationship between faculty and students.', 'High School West has prepared me for college by offering a number of key advanced placement and honor classes.  The guidance office was always available to provide support and advice during my college applications. There are many clubs and activities.  The school also offers many opportunities to get involved in sports.  They even provided transportation for the kids to stay after school and participate in clubs and sports.', "I received a great education. I was often encouraged by teachers. One of the principals, who I didn't know knew who I was, often seeked me out to acknowledge my achievements and encourage my future success.", 'It was a wonderful high school to go to. The attitude of most staff and administration seemed to be more 'out to get you' than there to help, which seems to do more harm than good. I love the variety of people and races that attend this school, and this only furthers my ability to learn about the world. The staff is very friendly and aid me in my growth each and everyday. My teachers encourage me to do my best and reach the many goals that I hold, both academically and beyond.']
column6: ['Half Hollow Hills Hill School West is a great school; it is strong in academics and sports. The high school instilled independence within me and is a diverse school compared to other high schools on Long Island. I would not have wanted my high school experience anywhere else.', "I loved Hills West! High School is  great time but since Halh Hollow Hills High School West is the smaller high school compared to Half Hollow Hills High School East it made it feel more homier. The teachers and students were very close nit including the administrators. Events like Pep Rally and hHomecoming truly showed the Hills West school spirit that today people can't find in many schools.", "Half hollow hills is overall a great district. The teachers there went above and beyond to make my high school experience everything, and prepared me for college. I had the best teachers anyone can ask for from kindergarten to 12th grade. They always made sure I was not falling behind in any classes. Half hollow hills west specifically provided me with the best of the best. What made it even better was I created lifelong friendships with kids from all different backgrounds. My high school was full of diversity and not once did I feel left out because of my color or race. Also, half hollow hills west provides number of extracurricular activities for all interest. We also have one of the greatest athletic system that has developed many athletes who are go off to be in the NFL, NBA, and NCAA basketball. I loved the high school I went to and wouldn't trade it to get a high school diploma anywhere else.", 'I enjoy attending such a great school district like HHH High School West in Dix Hills, New York because through out my 4 years at this school the teachers, principles , students and staff had made the school very safe, fun and do everything possible to make sure each and every student receives everything they need in order to be successful and to graduate on time or even early.', "It was okay, people are snooty, some staff don't try hard enough to push their students. Most teachers want their honors kids to succeed but don't rush their regents kids. I've also never felt prepared for an AP test.", 'It is definitely a competitive school academically, however there is the inequality of teachers. Some teachers are lightyears ahead of other. All ways make sure to do research on your teachers for next year and make sure you get the right ones. It can mean the difference between an A and a B grade.', "Overall high school west is pretty good especially in athletics as it is centered in a very wealthy neighborhood yet if you are looking for a school that's good in academics go to east", 'Some join a club just to put on their resume.', 'Some are excellent, some are ok', 'Social Diversity is very fluent in tis school. I have friends with many different backgrounds and histories.', 'The school has many great and diverse classes as i have been able to find many business electives but there are also many science and social studies one giving every child a chance to pursue their own goal.', 'I have never heard of a bullying story occurring in the school. The health program is excellent as I once sprained my ankle and they were very helpful with getting me to my classes and everything.', 'I am currently involved in many clubs such as Decca FBLA Interact and Spanish club. There are multiple other clubs and they are each very attractive for different students.', 'I have had a lot of fun at my school. I have been to many events including pep rally and homecoming. My parents are very supportive of my work and education.', 'The teachers at Half Hallow Hills West do a great job with learning both in and out of the classroom and keeps the class engaged and participating.', 'There is high participation in extracurricular activities and the teachers are very passionate about the clubs.', "Many helicopter parents who put their nose where it shouldn't be.", 'Many are good teachers although quite a few are hard to acsess outside class hours.', "There are so many area's that this school offers to get involved. It is the best high school if you want t build your resume for colleges.", 'Theres a lot of jappy parents in the half hollow hills area. So, if there kid wants something they are gonna annoy the school, administration, and other students to get what their kid wants. But the PTA is great, at least for the years that I was around.']
