column1: New Explorations into Science,Technology & Math School
column2: ['This school has multiple drawbacks, but overall it provided me with a solid foundation from where I can be successful. There are many pros. The teachers are passionate and care on a personal level. The workload is manageable. Since it is a small school, you get that kind of personalized attention that I personally benefitted from. Some of the cons would be the lack of opportunities for hands-on experience and the lack of art based opportunities and programs. Nest has a classic academic structure that some might enjoy and some might not.', "It is all everyone says it is. The teachers, the principal, the community. The focus is education and learning. Mastery of subjects. The kids are learning far ahead of  my son's friends from elementary and I just can't believe how much our child has soared since going to NEST+M. Our second child is going through the middle school application process now and we know the chances of having them both attend are slim especially since the entry process has changed and there is no longer testing. Amazing school, amazing focus on the community, learning, what is needed to be successful. Healthy competition. The debate team is outstanding and the club instructors have been fantastic as well. We could not be more pleased to have our son in this school.", 'I really love my school. The teachers truly care about their students and are always pushing their students to thrive for the best. The academics are really challenging which is good because you will be prepared for college. However, the school is not very diverse because it is predominantly white', "As a senior, I highly recommend this high school. Attending NEST+M for three years now, I can say that I have had many wonderful experiences. The teachers are strict but fair.  They have high expectations of their students as they are admitted to a gifted and talented program. Students are expected to be hardworking and driven individuals. If they do not understand the concepts, it is their responsibility to ask the teachers for help. Don't be intimidated to ask NEST+M teachers for help, they always want the best for you. They want their students to succeed. NEST+M provides a healthy, safe, and supportive learning environment. This school also promotes mental health awareness. In freshmen year, students are required to take a theatre class that focusses on subjects such as vulnerability and confidence. This class allows for an easier transition for incoming freshmen.", "I love the way the teachers interact with students. They make sure that students know the material and at the same time, the students also make decisions for themselves.  Not only that, but there is a lot of interactions within students that happens within the classroom, therefore students aren't just staring at textbooks or working independently (although there is designated time for that). The teachers are also ready to give advice about most things when you ask them something. In addition, the material is challenging; students aren't just learning the same content over and over again. There is a lot of variety. Last but not the least, the change in students is clear. When looking at their work from the beginning of the school year to the end of the school year, they have improved in their writing, math, scientific knowledge, and much more. I love the school!", 'The teachers are amazing, the administration does not always address the concerns of the parents or students.', 'I have been to Nest+M since kindergarden and graduated from the high school. I had an amazing time, it challenged me enough to make me into a great critical thinker. Even though I struggled with math and science, the teachers helped me reach my full potential.', 'I have spent a memorable three years here, and will be graduating at the end of June. I am very fortunate for the tight-knit community at this school that I could count on throughout my high school career. Many of these people were not my direct instructors, but faculty that have become a part of my extended family, and that I will miss after leaving the school.The assistant principal Mrs. Souffrant,  a leader, cares all about her students, and even took the time to write my letter of rec. Mr. McLaughlin, my senior year phys-ed teacher, knew exactly which college would be the right for my interests. Bao, epic AP bio teacher notorious for no H.W policy, motivated me when I procrastinated, and even gave free- supplies when he noticed my disorganized schoolbag during junior year.  I will always remember Lisa, the parent coordinator, who gave me "good-news" gum after every  college-acceptance. Few schools are like this. Future accepted students, come to this school. You won\'t regret.', 'The academics here are great. There are many AP courses specializing in the STEM field. Teachers always encourage students to do well. However, there is apparent friction between staff and the administration.', 'Lots of teachers really care about their students and genuinely care for their academics. The school has a good atmosphere in general.', 'Would like to have better class selections. Did not feel like the school was the right fit for me. Little to no school culture and community.', 'The administration is absolutely HORRID. everyone talks trash of the principle and they’re correct. Teachers are okay. Some, like arberman and a few others are completely incompetent and unfit to teach but continue to be there because of the terrible administration. It is truly sad. I am a student in 12th grade and it’s sad to see the school going down hill. They’re letting in worse and worse kids every year by lowering admissions standards.', 'I’ve had a great 4 years at NEST. The teachers are great, as is the student body for the most part. If anything could change- I’d like there to be free periods. It’s frustrating that students are required to take unnecessary classes when they’ve fulfilled their credits, especially when they could use that time to catch up on other work.', 'Every time I walk into Nest, I am immersed into such a positive environment. My teachers and friends are constantly pushing me to be the best version of myself.', "Throughout my experience at New Explorations into Science, Technology and Math High School, I have seen a lot of changes, both positive and negative. The diversity in the school has increased a lot from where it was when I started, in terms of teachers and students. One that has not changed, however, is every students' eagerness to learn and succeed. The students and Nest+M clearly care about their academics, and that is very clear. However, I feel that sometimes the voices of us hardworking students are not properly heard by administration.", 'The teachers really do love their jobs and are always happy to help. They genuinely want their students to succeed and always make the classroom a welcoming environment. The students are also really kind and make school a much more enjoyable experience.', 'There are 22 AP classes, most students are ambitious, the counselors are helpful, and the school has great architecture too.', 'This school is very good for anyone who is interested in a STEM or history. Both sets of these classes are interesting, challenging, and prepares you college. Furthermore, the teachers are very knowledgeable and its not uncommon to find them hanging out with students after class. I highly recommend this school.', "I've attended NEST since kindergarten so I have no real way of comparing other schools to it. It has been all I've known and has challenged me to become a strong, hardworking student. However, there's been many occasions when I feel mistakes by teachers, or the hiring of certain teachers could have been avoided just by looking character and qualifications alone. There are some teachers I don't feel care about the students or their futures, and are too lazy to actually put effort in or listen to their students.", 'I think the academics are very strong and that the teachers are very helpful. In my later years, I felt that the administration has been becoming more and more distant from the demands of the teachers and students which has had a negative toll on the education as a whole. Many of my favorite instructors have left for different schools and many appreciated school activities for students have been shut down.']

column6: ["I will always be grateful for the great education Nest+m has given me. I have always been ahead of other kids my age and have never felt like I couldn't do what I someday hope to become.", 'I went to NEST+m from kindergarten to sixth grade. The teachers were engaging and tried to teach in such away that every student could learn. In lower school our grade was not very large; each class had less than thirty students. By middle school, we had over two hundred students in the grade and a little over thirty students per class. The cafeteria serves food with slightly better quality than the typical public school, and the academics are more rigorous than the typical public school. It is an extremely diverse school as it has students from the five boroughs of New York City. However, the school has had many changes in the last few years, so the atmosphere of the school may be different from my experience in 2013.', 'While I have enjoyed my time at Nest+m my opinion for the future of the school is that there should be more options for electives in the high school.', "Overall, going to NEST has been a positive experience. The teachers genuinely care so much about their students and making sure that they're getting the proper help and support that they need. Although a lot of teachers end up leaving, those who stay are some of the most dedicated people I've ever met. The clubs and activities are fun and interesting, and the academics are intriguing without being overwhelming. The small high school size definitely makes NEST a choice worth considering.", 'Extremely diverse school which is admirable, however the quality of the school is beginning to fall from when I first entered the school. Due to the large number of teachers resigning each year, a desperation for new faculty leads to seemingly anyone who applies for the job is hired.  The rigorous courses offered are great, with a wide range of AP classes to take, but the counselors in charge of making schedules never fails to upset every student with their assigned schedule. This leads to the first few weeks of the school year leaving students anxious as they hope they get the courses they are qualified to take. Not only is there a lack of courses in high demand, but some students who manage to be put into AP courses do not meet prerequisite requirements, removing space for students who do meet the requirements. Overall, the cons of this high school highly outweigh the pros as, unfortunately, this "gifted and talented" school seems to transgress into a miserable experience.', 'NEST+m offers a strong academic experience that provides a variety of class choices led by the hardest working teachers in New York. The faculty is rocky but the persistence of the students and teachers make up for that difference.', 'It was a good school . It prepared you for college , challenged you and provided you/ tried to accommodate your needs and want .', 'Lately, the administration at this school has been lacking off. They have been all over the place and have failed the students. There were many schedule conflicts that prevented many students from taking courses necessary for their career paths. Also,  classrooms have been overcrowded with over 38 kids in some. They have constantly been lying to us about what is going on. Other than that, it is a great school filled with amazing, passionate teachers. The education is great. ', "Since NEST is a Gifted and Talented school (G&T), the curriculum is accelerated and more advance when compared to other schools. In middle school you were able to take high school level classes and it would be put toward your future high school GPA. In high school, you get most of your core classes done in the first year which allows many to take AP classes which looks good for colleges. There are AP classes in history, english, foreign languages, math and science. The workload for all of the classes are reasonable and if you manage your time efficiently you will do just fine. If you don't understand something in class, the teacher will be more than happy to help you and will make time in their schedule to help you fully understand the topic that you are learning.", 'There are not that many extracurricular activities such as clubs and sports at NEST. The big clubs are Red Cross Club, Key Club, and the biggest by far is Peer Leaders. Peer leaders is a spirit club but we also organize all of the school events in the High school. We also organize K-12 grade events such as Spirit Week, Multicultural Week, Teacher Appreciation Day, and several bake sales/fundraisers. The sports at NEST are limited to soccer (men and women), basketball (men and women), volleyball (women), flag football (co-ed), track and field (co-ed) and fencing (co-ed). Basketball and soccer being the biggest ones and which most of the money and attention is put towards.', 'Since this is a small school in a small building, you have small class sizes which allows students to get to know each other more intimately and it allows the teacher to truly know a students strengths and weaknesses. Everyone is friendly and the faculty really care about our well being.', 'The teachers really care about the students and are always available to help the students, whether it be before school, after school, or during the day. Teachers are always available and very approachable. You really get that one on one care because of the small class sizes and overall small school.', 'I love the fact that we have so many options after school activity wise as well as sports, however I feel we are many times underfunded', 'The teachers care about the students, they put a lot of work into presenting and teaching ideas in a easy to understand matter', 'We have amazing safety. Both entrances are guarded with amazing security guards. Shout out to Ms.White.', 'Our school has tons of opportunities for children to do what they love after and even before school.', 'My school made me the person i am today and i am grateful for that.', 'I love every single one of my teachers. They are all amazing', 'We have alarms on each door in the building and have to scan out with our id cards', 'The clubs are always filled many attend each club']
column8: ["I will always be grateful for the great education Nest+m has given me. I have always been ahead of other kids my age and have never felt like I couldn't do what I someday hope to become.", 'I went to NEST+m from kindergarten to sixth grade. The teachers were engaging and tried to teach in such away that every student could learn. In lower school our grade was not very large; each class had less than thirty students. By middle school, we had over two hundred students in the grade and a little over thirty students per class. The cafeteria serves food with slightly better quality than the typical public school, and the academics are more rigorous than the typical public school. It is an extremely diverse school as it has students from the five boroughs of New York City. However, the school has had many changes in the last few years, so the atmosphere of the school may be different from my experience in 2013.', 'While I have enjoyed my time at Nest+m my opinion for the future of the school is that there should be more options for electives in the high school.', "Overall, going to NEST has been a positive experience. The teachers genuinely care so much about their students and making sure that they're getting the proper help and support that they need. Although a lot of teachers end up leaving, those who stay are some of the most dedicated people I've ever met. The clubs and activities are fun and interesting, and the academics are intriguing without being overwhelming. The small high school size definitely makes NEST a choice worth considering.", 'Extremely diverse school which is admirable, however the quality of the school is beginning to fall from when I first entered the school. column2: ['Excellent teachers and environment! I felt extremely prepared coming to college  after graduating from Weston High School. I was encouraged and engaged by my teachers, they all made an effort towards my learning.', 'The education at Weston High School is phenomenal. As a recent graduate, I felt overwhelming prepared for college coming from Weston High School. Because Weston is an extremely small town, you know every person in your grade which can be a good or bad thing depending on the person. The teachers at Weston are either one of  a kind gems or questionable as to how they are allowed to teach, with few in between. The exceptional teachers make you want to be the best student you can be which is an invaluable motivation as a high school student.', 'Phenomenal  school system including Weston High School.  Moved to town for the schools and feels like a private school system in which parents,educators and administration have full involvement and dedication to the students and their success.  Excellent resources and communication!', 'Weston High School has many great resources that students can take advantage. One of which are the excellent teachers. I challenged myself throughout high school by taking AP and honors level courses. I was always impressed by the level of expertise the various teachers have in their fields. Teachers are very approachable and when I was struggling or confused teachers were always willing to help. I never ran into a situation where a teacher was unwilling to answer my questions or go over a test with me. All the people in Weston want you to succeed and will go out of their way to help their students. The only problem I have with Weston High School is the lack of diversity. Weston is a primarily white school and as a result Weston students are less accustomed and have had less exposure to people of other races. Aside from this, Weston High School is an excellent place to learn and grow. Weston High School certainly prepares students for whatever lays ahead post graduation.', 'Weston High School is an excellent school for students who have a passion for learning and a desire to achieve excellence outside of high school.', 'Strong community, academics and facilities. Most teachers are passionate, accessible and truly care about their students. Foreign language and guidance departments are weak. Lack of consistency in testing, grading across classes is an issue.', "weston high school makes me depressed. they put immense pressure on their students starting from day 1. they don't really pay attention to the well being of their students based on the amount of depressed and struggling students i have met. however, I will say that the teachers do try to work with their students to help them as much as possible if the student reaches out for academic help. the administration needs to worry a little less about why students are in the nurse and a little more about why students are constantly feeling excruciating amounts of stress and competition in the school", "I like the strength/rigor of the academics at Weston High School; however, I'd like to see more kinds of classes offered, the overall quality of some teachers improve, and general education requirements (PE, Tech, etc) change. Aside from academics, I'd like to see a counselor on duty that has a different time table than the rest of the counselors (and social worker 'available' to give this kind of help) solely for students struggling mentally.", 'The overall environment at Weston High School is what makes this school so enjoyable. The students and teachers of this district are very supportive and contribute to a very calm environment.', "Overall, the academics are rigorous and challenging, the teachers are supportive, and the environment is welcoming, but I just wish that more guidance was provided to the younger students and that the schedules were less complex (it's unnecessary to have 8 different schedules in rotation) and that programs were more inclusive and plentiful.", 'The teachers are great, and they are very helpful. The students are very kind as well as the whole staff. If you ever have an issue or question, there is always somebody who will be there for you. The education is excellent, and this is a great school that will help children get ready for college.', "Lots of AP classes, good course selection, caring administrators. Blue Ribbon School that tries to continually improve and live up to it's own very high standards. Many of the the sports teams win their conferences. Swimming, Track, Lacrosse, Basketball are the most accomplished teams for boys and girls, alike. We have a lot of school spirit, so even though our Football team isn't the best, we still get a lot of attendees and it's a lot of fun. I would say one of our bad things is the food. Even though it's supposed to be fresh, it's clearly not as fresh as it could be, so we usually leave campus and buy food locally.", 'I felt that Weston prepared me incredibly well for college. I was surprised that I did quite well in subjects at college where I had struggled in high school. The small grade sizes and knowing most of the class since Kindergarten creates a very tight bond between students that will last a lifetime. School spirit is good, though I did not participate in sports or attend many sports games. I feel that the administration focuses more on the athletics than the arts, which I was more a part of. Overall, an amazing school with unforgettable teachers.', "I have found that seeking help from teachers outside of class time has been most rewarding at Weston High School. Doing this not only helped me better understand what was being taught during class, but it also gave me the opportunity to expand my knowledge to topics outside of the given curriculum. During my Junior year, I went to my chemistry teacher to review the topic of orbital hybridization and gained lots of knowledge about real-life examples.Also, at the beginning of Junior year, I failed my first test in high school in a very difficult class. To solve this, I went to see my teacher after school and ask for additional resources to help me study in more detail and with more efficiency. With the teacher's excellent help, I received an A+ on the next test I took in that class.These examples demonstrate how helpful the Weston High School staff can be, only if students take the given opportunities to meet with their teachers for extra instruction.", "How could I not love Weston. Like many of my classmates, my family moved here for the school and its proximity to New York. It has a beautiful and practical setting, tucked away between two pristine reservoirs and only 50 minutes from New York City. All of my teachers are graduates from prestigious colleges and universities, and the ones who are not make up for it by being very experienced and knowledgeable in their fields. For a while, I found it easy to complain about its negatives like its lack of diversity, or teachers who just don't seem to care, or too much coddling academically. Eventually, I realized that us students at Weston have it pretty good. Our problems here are much worse at other schools. The cons are a small price to pay for one of the finest educations Connecticut has to offer.", "Weston High School has been great. I've really liked it. I would like to see more school spirit in general, and I would also like to see more of an emphasis on the arts. A lot of the school culture is focused on athletics, while the arts kind of get the back-burner. As an avid musician, this can be frustrating at times when the arts programs do not get the recognition they deserve. But, the staff, in general, are excellent, and the school is pristine. ", 'this school is very focused on safety and security', 'most students who participate in extracurriculars also challenge themselves in AP/honors classes', 'our annual powderpuff game brings the whole school together no matter the grade', 'teachers at weston are some of the most knowledgeable and devoted teachers.']

column6: ['My reasoning for my school being “okay” is not because of the academics or the sports it is truly my decision and the struggles that I have been faced with each and every day of my High School Experience. When I was in the eight grade I was diagnosed with an Auditory Processing Disorder; this diagnosis relieved me of my constant fear that I was just not as “smart” as the other kids. Once diagnosed I was able to narrow down my tactics and work on other possible tactics that would give me a higher chance in becoming a successful high school student. I feel as if Weston High School definitely gave me a wonderful high school experience but I think I would have benefited more from a private school or boarding school that works specifically with students who have learning disabilities.', 'Attending a High School that has a maximum of 26 students per class allows teachers to effectively have strong and appropriate relationships with students. They’re very approachable and make time to help struggling students; not only do they make comments or pointers but they give proper examples to help their students excel in their work. The teachers provide a comfortable atmosphere for their students; granting them extra time when needed or the opportunity to stop by and ask them a question about work from class. The outstanding effort and drive that the teachers put into their teachings forces their students to become determined and successful, preparing them for college or anything else that will come in their future.', 'Sports pretty much rule the extracurriculars, except for Company.', 'Parents mean well but need to be more strict. Would still chose the school again', 'Wonderful and knowledgable teachers. Really enjoy class', 'I really enjoy Weston High. I completed freshman year at a different high school and moving to Weston enlightened me concerning the lack of many positive attributes that weston has. Weston has an excessive amount of school spirit. Everyday there are people wearing weston clothing and there are countless school activities. Another thing that contributes to the united community of Weston High is the merging of grades. Students at Weston are encouraged to broaden their friend group to include people of other grades. For example, in early December, there is a dance; the dates are made by freshmen asking sophomores.  Overall, this is a great school.', 'The teachers at this school genuinely want their students to succeed. They offer extra help outside of class, and take time in class to answer any clarification questions that a student has. Some teachers have a hard time making exceptions to their policies, even when the situation warrants one. However, most, if not all, of the teachers policies are there for a reason other than just convenience for the teacher. Many of the teachers make an effort to make the school more of a community and less of a learning box. They encourage school spirit and take part in the spirit events. Overall, there is not much to complain about, and nothing to complain about that does not occur at every other highschool.', "Weston High School is ranked the number one high school in Connecticut. It's also relatively small with only about 800 students. Each student is connected to the school community due to this fact.", "Over the years I've come to learn that academically challenging courses is one thing this school doesn't lack, but with those challenges come a lot of intense pressure. Whether that pressure be from teachers, or more likely the students themselves, it can become overwhelming as the year goes on. The one thing that is good about the competitiveness of Weston High School is how it prepares us for things like, SATs, AP courses and college; yet if you don't make these high standards set you'll be viewed as significantly worse than your peers. Though we have extremely high marks on tests and very smart students there is little to actually no diversity here. In most cases the students here have lived in Weston since they were seven and sometimes even younger so mostly everyone dresses, looks, and acts the same as one another. Those to some being in such a small town with the same hundreds of people could seem torturous you really learn to love your class and even if you're not close to them all you know everyones name. The Weston community is very close knit, even if some would rather not admit that. Even if you're in different grades then one another you're more likely to know just about everyone that goes to the school because of how small it is. Not only is the community close because of how small physically it is but, 90% of the students here have gotten used to how competitive the school is and are all very serious about our grades and test scores. It is because of this that if I could chose to have a 'do-over' of where I went to high school I would stay in Weston because in the long run going here is the best option overall.", 'Most teachers push their students to do their absolute best and truly want to see them succeed. The math department needs improvement to better support students.', 'The Athletics are not known to be the best. The clubs do fundraising to help local charities and benefit the students and surrounding areas.', 'It has the best education but the cockiest students', "There's a lot of sports that students can watch and support.", 'Although there is not much diversity, the teachers offer a variety of topic s that gives them exposure. The language  and the Social Studies departments continually expose them to new cultures.', 'Very happy in all aspects. My son who is a Junior in Special Ed has excellent services, job training, bulling free.', 'A variety of activities- great sports, great student government association, engaged organizations and fun events planned.', "It's a great school with a great education - certainly lacking in diversity which is the major offset of this school as it doesn't open up to many fresh perspectives or provide the school with a greater world understanding. But great programs and great community.", 'Ms Deorio doesn\'t really do anything except say "Weston High School doesn\'t have a maid service"', "Weston is supposed to have the best school system, but the teachers aren't anything special.", "I pretty much hate sports so reviewing the games will probably be painful. A lot of people come to the football games, but they get bored and then head over to the park to do drugs, so it's not very family friendly if you ask me. Most of the football players are jerks who have probably been demeaning to women at some point in their lives and our team isn't very good anyway."]

In most cases the students here have lived in Weston since they were seven and sometimes even younger so mostly everyone dresses, looks, and acts the same as one another. The Weston community is very close knit, even if some would rather not admit that. Even if you're in different grades then one another you're more likely to know just about everyone that goes to the school because of how small it is. Not only is the community close because of how small physically it is but, 90% of the students here have gotten used to how competitive the school is and are all very serious about our grades and test scores. It is because of this that if I could chose to have a 'do-over' of where I went to high school I would stay in Weston because in the long run going here is the best option overall.", 'Most teachers push their students to do their absolute best and truly want to see them succeed. The math department needs improvement to better support students.', 'The Athletics are not known to be the best. The clubs do fundraising to help local charities and benefit the students and surrounding areas.', 'It has the best education but the cockiest students', "There's a lot of sports that students can watch and support.", 'Although there is not much diversity, the teachers offer a variety of topic s that gives them exposure. The language  and the Social Studies departments continually expose them to new cultures.', 'Very happy in all aspects. My son who is a Junior in Special Ed has excellent services, job training, bulling free.', 'A variety of activities- great sports, great student government association, engaged organizations and fun events planned.', "It's a great school with a great education - certainly lacking in diversity which is the major offset of this school as it doesn't open up to many fresh perspectives or provide the school with a greater world understanding. But great programs and great community.", 'Ms Deorio doesn\'t really do anything except say "Weston High School doesn\'t have a maid service"', "Weston is supposed to have the best school system, but the teachers aren't anything special.", "I pretty much hate sports so reviewing the games will probably be painful. A lot of people come to the football games, but they get bored and then head over to the park to do drugs, so it's not very family friendly if you ask me. Most of the football players are jerks who have probably been demeaning to women at some point in their lives and our team isn't very good anyway."]

column2: ['summit high school is a place that offers many opportunities to their students, the amount of electives are endless and range from a variety of feeds from architecture to even film studies or psychology. summit high school is not only a challenging place but one that helps you grow and get better. sometimes it is too challenging and students can feel challenges by other student academically or athletically I some cases.', 'Summit High School is overall a very friendly place and the teachers are especially helpful and knowledgeable. Theater, debate, and sports are what the high school is best at.', 'I like summit high school. I’ve enjoyed my three years here, and am so far enjoying the fourth too. I feel like I’ve gained a lot of knowledge and had many opportunities to grow and change.', 'I enjoyed my experience at Summit High.  I played sports and was involved with other extracurricular activities.', "I loved all of my teachers, although I did have a few teachers who weren't the best at teaching they were amazingly helpful and friendly. The diversity is not very much the students are accepting and if you are nice it is easy to make friends. There is so much opportunity no matter what you are interested in.", "I didn't have a great experience at Summit High School. The administration targets certain students and gives privileges to certain people over others. The sports teams are the most important thing in their eyes, and the people on the teams can get away with anything.", "Summit High School is a wonderful school. It is a great school to send you child and know that they're safe. It is my experience that this make sure our children a willing to learn in every aspect of the school system.", 'School administration is slightly inadequate. Lunches and food offered general are pretty bad quality.  I personally can recall a time when my friend found mold in his fruit that he was about to eat. Security guards eat in the bathroom hoping to catch students vaping, peek over closed doors in the bathrooms. Some bathrooms get locked because there is only 2 guards so school believes only 2 bathrooms should be open during lunch. Some teachers were very hard to work with and administration refuses to cooperate in changing the teacher even before the school year started, even though for some people they do.', "The school has a good environment and the teaching is more or less very good. The only issue, for me at least, is that some of the teachers are very unlikeable and the way they teach makes it very hard to learn much of anything. And it's not just my opinion either, many upper class men to I've talked to and my friends tell me the same thing about a few teachers. Other than that the students are very nice and most of the teachers are quite friendly and supportive. It's a bit expensive to go but that's because of the curriculum. Everything in summit is kind of expensive after all so that's to be expected. If you're coming here from another town I'd recommend you come during your freshman or sophmore year, because if not it might be a little difficult to adjust to everything since past freshman and sophomore year everyone more or less knows how things work or what to do. And you'll be completely lost. The school does a good job at making the freshman feel comfortable though.", "Good public school education with wealthy town funding.  It's a good looking building in a nice neighborhood, but traffic control is extremely poor and it's very hard to get into and out of the school in the morning and afternoon.", 'Summit High School is among one of the best! The school offers great academics and opportunities to grow as an individual during  ones four years. Compared to many public school Summit excels in all aspects including but not limited to academics, sports, college readiness and rigor in academics.', 'The highschool has a lot of opportunities for the students, whether it be electives/classes, or clubs, or sports. It also has easy access to technology, as every grade has a chromebook and has free access to the internet and printer. The teachers overall care about the students and want them to apply themselves so that they could go to a good college. Their curriculum is also above a few schools in new jersey.', 'Prepared me for college in more ways than just academics.  Got great grades, and prepared me for college social life as well, so the transition after graduation was made much easier.', 'Summit High School, like any other school, has its pros and cons.  At Summit, I received a very good education and learned a lot. However, the social aspect of Summit is not the greatest.  All the sports teams and the musical groups dominate the social aspects of Summit.', 'Academics are rigorous (though there is no IB program), sports are a huge priority, and there are lots of extracurriculars (if you have time after homework and sports).  It is an affluent area, and every little thing is very expensive for anyone of modest means. The administration seems to assume everyone can afford opportunities offered at the last minute.  Some of us have to budget.', 'There are a lot of really great teachers. Most AP classes are very good preparation for the exam, teachers are always available for extra help, and extracurricular options are considerable. Kind of homogeneous student body, and very lacrosse oriented town. ', "This school is in a pretty safe town. It's highly unlikely to feel unsafe. There are a few cases of theft every year, but nothing major. Thieves almost always get caught at this school.", "There's definitely something for everyone. If you want to be involved though, you have to look out for it.", 'Summit High School is actually a great place to be. The academics, sports, drama club, speech and debate team, and other impressive programs are the best in NJ by far.', 'Overall the teachers here are great. There are a few teachers that are far more harsher than others, but every teacher here is knowledgable and fit for these positions.']

column6: ['Getting better as the admin are trying to crack down on drug/alcohol use. Starting to see more police, dogs (dog sweeps), some things have always been incorporated (security cameras, sign in, ids).', 'Great extracurriculars in all fields - sports very strong (ex. lacrosse), music very strong (ex. theatre), debate/science/anything else. Easy to start your own club, easy to find a group of people w/same interests.', 'Teachers genuinely care for students, work really hard, help students, etc. But they will not go out of their way to help you (this is a good thing though).', 'Great theatre, athletics programs, great academics. Teachers, admin care for students. Would go here again. One problem is lack of diversity, although surrounding towns/schools are even less diverse.', 'In Summit High School the teachers are the main reason why we are known to have a class of achieved students. Each teacher is different but they all stay an hour after school and before just in case a student is in need of help. Most teachers use new ways to help us for example, technology. They all have websites which they update everyday with homework and reminders which is such a help. They are really all about trying to teach the material rather than giving a student paper and taking tests. We do hand on experiences especially in labs in any science department. They are really encouraged to helping a student be prepared for college and the world. By setting groups allowing us to lead and teaching us lessons. Their best interest is in the students to see us succeed academically.', 'The teachers are very helpful', "Extracurriculars are great! There's something for everyone and many extracurriculars are very successful. Some even compete at national levels.", 'Parents are 110% involved. If its athletics or the play, they volunteer their time for the happiness of their children.', "Teachers are very dedicated to their jobs. They meet before school, during lunch, and after school. Throughout my four years, they've been very approachable. I love my school.", 'diverse clubs and involvement from staff and students', 'Wonderful staff, good students, academic and athletic programs great.', 'Involved and committed teachers to help students succeed', "You will aways see students after school in some type of activity or club. Everyone has a spot in SHS. SHS offers all types of clubs and activities and if theres one that they don't have its easy to start it.", 'Parents really try to get involve in raising money for the school. Great education. For the most part the teachers are great. The teachers give you work and prepare you for college. English class really prepares you for ACT and other test too. The teachers really want you to succeed and offer help if needed.', 'This school offers many clubs for everyone. The electives are great. For most of the time teachers are available after school and during lunch. Theres really no "popularity" everyone has their own group. Its great because  in gym class you have upperclassmen and underclassmen and you get to interact with them and make new friends. Lunch is also nice. We have an hour to eat, hang out with friends or have a study hall. Overall this High School is great.', 'Summit High School has a well-rounded student experience.', 'The teachers at Summit High are intelligent, and skilled in their field. They are some of the strongest public school teachers in New Jersey.', "The school has a great academic program but certain out of school programs are disorganized and not given much attention. The outside of school life isn't as important as in school, but it would be great if our clubs and academics reached the same magnitude in terms of national recognition.", "I love the teachers and how helpful they are with whatever the students need.  Of course there are some kids who don't fit the description, but the majority of the students are very well-rounded kids who are all great once you get to know them.", 'The people are very friendly and there are a lot of opportunities given in terms of academics, art, athletics, and community clubs.']

column2: ['It is a completely racist school! They use the school - prison pipeline for the black and Hispanic students attending the school. There is no social support for minority students or families for that matter! They will down play any form of racist term used with a one day suspension. On top of acting as though the racial slur used is not that bad. If I knew now what It was before moving in I would never put my kids through the anguish and suffering of verbal and mental abuse.', 'Edgemont is a great place to go to school. The environment is very nice with a lot of healthy competition. There are a few things that could be improved, however, and they shouldn’t be ignored.', 'I came to the school when towards the end of my sophomore. I realized there were very few people like me, Latina, so it was quite hard to find someone like me there.', "Honestly, I have mixed opinions about Edgemont. The academics are great, the classes challenged me and the teachers for the most part care about helping students learn. The extracurriculars are great too, especially the performing arts programs. However there's so much pressure to take advanced classes & get into colleges that not every person is equipped for, to the point where it's unnecessary and pretty toxic. Also it's hard to fit in if you're not a certain type of way and I'm sure anybody who goes there/went there knows exactly what I'm talking about. It's a small school, most people tend to be cliquey. If kids want to spread rumors about you or ruin your reputation, they will. Personally I had such a hard time being myself and barely ever felt comfortable speaking my mind because of some bad experiences I had.", "Good teachers and academics overall. The humantities (english classes, etc.) are very strong there; STEM classes aswell, although lack some funding. The dining services have fallen in quality over the years. Also, so has the strength of the student body. Administration isn't very flexible to unique student paths.", 'As a student at Edgemont High School I hvae gained so much experience and I have been able to get the best education possible. Being part of one of the best school districts in the country Edgemont has a very important reputation to protect.', 'I absolutely loved my time at Edgemont High School. Not only did I have the most incredible teachers who always supported me and my classmates in and outside the classroom, I also made wonderful friends whose friendships I know will last a lifetime. I was given all the resources I could need to be active in my extracurricular activities as well, from getting the opportunity to play on my varsity tennis team as a seventh grade student to starting and leading multiple school clubs to running district-wide campaigns with the help of a supportive and approachable administration. Edgemont has certainly helped me prepare to achieve my greatest ambitions as I enter the real world and pursue higher studies. Most of all, it has given me many memories that I will cherish as I move forward.', 'During my time at edgemont, I was bullied every day. When I told the psychologists they didnt do a single thing. Everyone in this area is extremely stuck up because they are rich and if you aren\'t as rich they hate you. The kids tend to be racist and homophobic and spoiled. The parents are your average middle aged stay at home PTA moms who get way to involved in everything and are all friends with each other. The reason their expulsion rate is so low is because they never punish anyone. I do give it some stars though, because some of the teachers are amazing and the academics are pretty good when they are taught by those teachers. But the bullies overshadow that the bullies especially hate those who have mental illnesses. They will call them things like "the suicide squad" because they think depression is fake. Again the administration does nothing. If you care about your kids mental health, Westchester county is a terrible place to live.', 'The school can be nice at times, since it’s so small it’s a nice sense of community, and an amazing theater and arts program.but really other than that there is no spirit, once you go through those 2 stone pillars of edgemont jr/sr high school you know it’s gonna be a bad day. The school is so competitive and not just academically, it can be from who is wearing the most expensive clothes to who went on the most extravagant vacation. Most students here  bond over how much we hate the school. Teachers here can really be a hit or miss some are very passionate about what they are teaching and some are just teaching because they have to.', 'Great academic environment, but the stress is extremely high among students. Food is ok. Some teachers are good.', "As an experienced Edgemont student, I know what I'm talking about. Edgemont is a very safe, educational public school. Most of the people are nice, except for a select few, but overall very accepting and kind. The teachers are very nice and smart. They obviously have to now what there talking about to join this schools terrific staff. The campus is beautiful, with buildings connected by breeze ways,  its very nice to get a clean breathe of air before proceeding to your next class. The safety is great, with every child getting a metal cart that always them into every building, and without this key there is no other way of getting in. The food is tremendous, with very healthy and yummy options. They even have a snack bar filled with great treats! Over all I feel that Edgemont is amazing, but the friends and things you learn there are better.", "Edgemont's academics is fairly good. The STEM and history programs have very engaging teachers, who are very knowledgable and qualified in preparing students for APs and college. The culture is a little toxic since there is a lot of peer pressure and some bullying. Edgemont events and athletics are very dull and discouraging. Overall, Edgemont is a very safe area to send students and it will certainly prepare students for college on both an academic and social level.", 'Edgemont is a school with some brilliant teachers. Some teachers are so-so in terms of approach and moral upliftment of students. But anyone would be lucky to join here. The debate team is brilliant and starting to build cohesiveness. In addition, the science research course is amazing as well. Anyone who works hard will definitely get rewarded with their efforts. A downside is how the community is snobby. Most Asians have a tendency to be discriminated amongst themselves. Also, in terms of Advanced Placement courses, please do not over pile your work load with them. They increase unnecessary stress and should be strategized over your years of high school. Do your best to excell and to remove yourself from peer pressure.', 'Edgemont is a competitive school. Its a great school for kids. Edgemont is a wealthy district. The school is ranked best in westchester. The teachers are donated on helping the student learn. The academics are amazing.', 'There are numerous volunteering opportunities, tutoring clubs, math and art clubs, as well as literary clubs that people can join.', 'Edgemont is well-known for how erudite the kids are, but also for how amazing the art programs and the close connections the students have. While there are cliques, people are willing to go out of their way to interact with one another and provide a healthy albeit competitive environment.', "All teacher here are extremely well qualified for their positions and allow their students chances to do both solitary and group work. They assign projects and conduct several tests and quizzes throughout the year to ensure their students' success both inside the classroom and on standardized tests in the future.", 'it is a small school - so kids know everybody and all the teachers know the kids. Creates a great atmosphere.', 'teachers are generally very good and very involved', 'There are some excellent teacher, who definitely deserve to work here, but there are more than a few, who are just lazy. They do not know hoe to teach, and will make your experience miserable.']

Overall, Edgemont is a very safe area to send students and it will certainly prepare students for college on both an academic and social level.", 'Edgemont is a school with some brilliant teachers. Some teachers are so-so in terms of approach and moral upliftment of students. But anyone would be lucky to join here. The debate team is brilliant and starting to build cohesiveness. In addition, the science research course is amazing as well. Anyone who works hard will definitely get rewarded with their efforts. A downside is how the community is snobby. Most Asians have a tendency to be discriminated amongst themselves. Also, in terms of Advanced Placement courses, please do not over pile your work load with them. They increase unnecessary stress and should be strategized over your years of high school. Do your best to excell and to remove yourself from peer pressure.', 'Edgemont is a competitive school. Its a great school for kids. Edgemont is a wealthy district. The school is ranked best in westchester. The teachers are donated on helping the student learn. The academics are amazing.', 'There are numerous volunteering opportunities, tutoring clubs, math and art clubs, as well as literary clubs that people can join.', 'Edgemont is well-known for how erudite the kids are, but also for how amazing the art programs and the close connections the students have. While there are cliques, people are willing to go out of their way to interact with one another and provide a healthy albeit competitive environment.', "All teacher here are extremely well qualified for their positions and allow their students chances to do both solitary and group work. They assign projects and conduct several tests and quizzes throughout the year to ensure their students' success both inside the classroom and on standardized tests in the future.", 'it is a small school - so kids know everybody and all the teachers know the kids. Creates a great atmosphere.', 'teachers are generally very good and very involved', 'There are some excellent teacher, who definitely deserve to work here, but there are more than a few, who are just lazy. They do not know hoe to teach, and will make your experience miserable.']
column6: ['Edgemont has an overwhelmingly strong reputation when it comes to college. The academic programs are, for the most part, very good.', 'Every student feels part of this wonderful community.', "The school is pretty safe, and the nurse is professional. Bullying can be a problem, but I haven't noticed it in a while since a program was implemented.", 'I said previously as well that the extracurriculars are diverse and fun. I love debating, although I must be honest about how it needs time to solidly develop well. The school has to put more initiative to creating solidarity in many ways. UNICEF, Model UN, Environmental Club, are some other activities that are equally engaging and provide great opportunities.', "I love many aspects of this school. Unfortunately I have not had a good social experience but that doesn't bring me down. I would go to this school again because some teachers teach in a way that makes life wonderful. Also, I love some extracurriculars that I do such as debate. The school also gives freedom to start clubs, and make yourself open up.", "Most teachers do provide support and in depth analysis. I would be honest about how there are few teachers that don't do that, and are rude at times. But over all the experience you get in classes are unique and worthwhile. Grading depends on quality of work which I find appropriate.", "There aren't much safety policies, but that's because our community is very safe. Crime rate is practically nonexistent. I can't say much for health services, but it seems at least average.", "There are many clubs and organizations to choose from. Though people don't really do much in some clubs, most clubs have many fun activities in events. For example, I'm a part of a performing arts club and recently, we went to New York City and played Christmas songs on our instruments.", "Edgemont is very nice on the surface: the campus is beautiful in the spring and fall, course selection is fairly flexible, small size, good reputation etc. However, it's a toxic place. There's huge pressure to do well in school, take many AP/Honors courses, and get into a prestigious university. Most if not all the people are also privileged and don't seem to understand much about the real world, no matter how much they think they do.", "Some teachers are very good at their job. They convey their lessons clearly and engage the students. Some are also very likable, personality-wise. However, many are not adequate teachers. A few don't even seem to care. These teachers make me surprised that Edgemont is a highly ranked school.", "this is a terrible place - i'd move tomorrow if i could.   The parents offer all of the wrong values and the kids are horrible.. bullys run the schools - from kindergarten - 12th grade...  teachers act like they work for the parents... they do nothing.. totally over-rated town and school district... if you are considering Edgemont... THINK AGAIN.. its a bad place and totally not worth what it will cost you to live here...", 'Bullying is very rare. If it does happened, its always addressed quickly and effectively.', 'There is HUGE variety of food for everyone.', 'Administrators are great when it comes to all policies. They always addressed it quickly and efficiently.', 'Amazing teachers! Most are always very hands on and ready to help if anyone is struggling.', 'There a lot of sports that anyone could do. Every homecoming/big game there is always a big crowd.', 'There is a lot of extracurricular activities that students can do.', 'Most are excellent and really try to help and interest their students.', 'There are a variety of sports and several clubs, even though most are mostly student run. However, pretty much all have backing from a faculty member. The theater program and choral/band groups are especially good.', 'Teachers and administrators take great care to create a safe environment for all.']

column2: ['John P. Stevens is very crowded, the halls are packed and it is difficult to get through to classes sometimes. But on the brighter side, most people here reach high which motivates others to reach high. The academics are the best in the county, maybe even the state.', "Although it was a bit stressful, J.P Stevens provided me with advanced academic instruction, benefiting me for my future college life. The teachers were always willing to give a helping hand, and students were regularly welcomed to come in early for extra help. Teachers have always found ways to make our classes more interactive and engaging, helping students gain the same knowledge but in a new and effective way. Additionally, our school's diversity is widely ranged as well, allowing each peer to get a glimpse of a multitude of cultures and perspectives, which in turn fosters bonding with new people throughout each year. As per changes, increased space would truly benefit due to intense overcrowding in our school. Overall, my experience at J.P Stevens was a great challenge, however, in the end, it is sure to get me prepared for the real world.", 'Highly competitive student population is alarming but at the same time will definitely prepare you for college and a future career. Has its pros and cons, its ups and downs, but still a great place to be.', 'Although very populated, JP Stevens is a great school academically and so many other ways. JP is very diverse with Asians, Europeans, Africans, Latinos, African Americans and many more; it is a melting pot. With food being the lowest rating for JP, I would 100% recommend JP. For the facilities, the school district will be renovating hopefully next as there are plans set up for JP and other schools in the district. The College readiness is excellent with preparations being in junior year for all seniors.', 'JP Stevens exhibits a very competitive yet supportive environment that prepares one for the vigor of college.', 'I started my sophomore year and plan to finish my senior year at J.P. Stevens High School. I really liked how the guidance counselors were very involved and it was more than one you could go to. They did everything they could to help me and I appreciated it all the way. In addition to that each one of them helped me in different ways and gave me beneficial advice to help me along the way of my high school career and for life in the future as I continue to grow and encounter new things. Some things that should or could be changed are having more activities and different programs such as cosmetology and more subjects in that area because I wanted to take that class when I first transferred my sophomore year from my previous high school which had a cosmetology class and I was eager to continue the class until I found out they did not provide that class.', 'I love how the school really prepares you fir the real world and college. I feel privileged to go to a school where I know I am getting a well rounded education. I wish it wasn’t so crowded though.', 'I liked how diverse this school and meeting other people can be easy because you can connect with at least one other person who is like you. But the work load is too much sometimes.', "This high school is often rated very well due to its above average statistics in regards to the academic success of its students. However, the reason that 40% of its students take advanced placement courses isn't because the school just happens to make their students brilliant, it's because of the high pressure culture that exists. Many of the students who are even in such high level courses aren't able to handle it. Most of it comes down to parents paying thousands for private courses and tutors. On top of that, there is an overwhelming cheating culture in the school where most of those who are some of the successful have such good grades because they cheat, not necessarily because they are hard workers. For the rest of the student body, this creates a toxic level of expectations where they are competing with others who are only able to achieve with cheating.", 'The culture here is pretty awful. I think all of my friends have depression. No one sleeps and vaping is a pretty big problem these days. I wish I had never moved here.', "In spite of what people say about the competitive nature of the school, I truly could not have asked for a better high school experience. I was a bit overwhelmed during the beginning of my freshman year, as I was struggling to find my place in the school while balancing an overload on academics, but when I found that place, I learned so much and it really prepared me for college. The infrastructure is subpar and the sports and school spirit might not be that great, but communities and long-lasting friendships can still be made here if you put in the effort. This school doesn't hand anything do you on a silver platter, but if you work hard and have a positive attitude, you will learn so much not only academically but on your way to becoming a responsible adult and citizen.", 'I have had some really great teachers at JP. However, the lack of air conditioning and the prevalence of cheating, drugs, and in the past year, violence, has made my time at JP very difficult.', "J.P. Stevens is a very competitive school that places academics above all else. The teachers are very well educated in their field and make learning the material as fun as possible. The environment is incredibly diverse, allowing for a multitude of cultural clubs and school-wide events. The high school's facilities are somewhat lacking compared to other schools, but they can provide Macbooks to every student, transitioning into a more tech-friendly environment that allows students to interact with their peers and teachers in more ways than one. In terms of sports, J.P. Stevens does not hold a multitude of awards for championships, yet they are a dedicated team of players who strive to be the best in their field. The music department is extraordinary, holding many first-place awards in their competitions. J.P. Stevens is a prestigious high school that aims to make its students prepared for college and beyond by exposing them to challenging tasks and teaching them about responsibility.", 'Overall, it is really good. They prepare you well for college and your career. Only bad thing is the competition. Everyone is competing all the time which could get tiring and annoying.', 'J.P Stevens was a great school that prepared me for college. From the advanced courses to the engineering courses. It proved worthwhile in college.', "I recently moved from India and was feeling extremely overwhelmed contemplating how schools in the US would be. Safe to say, JP was a mixed bag but altogether it was a memorable experience. There were many people who had shifted the same year as me as well many others who shifted in recent years, making it rather easier than I thought to make friends and blend in. On the contrary, one of the biggest downside is the rather competitive academic standards. I was looking forward to leave it behind with my India school but apparently not for the academic competitiveness is extremely high as compared to other high schools I've heard about. All in all, the is school has its pros and cons but is decent for someone who dealing with a major shift in environment because of moving.", 'JP Stevens High School is a great high school for motivated kids who want to be pushed to do their best and go to a great college, but can sometimes be a bit competitive for those who lack motivation.', 'While the school is extremely diversified, there is still bullying and racism that occurs on a regular basis. The competitiveness makes it fun and challenging. The courses are challenging as well. There,however, are quite a lot of fights going around in the school, which is a little scary.', 'Extremely competitive, encouraging teachers. Lots of homework and stress but prepares for high school.', "JP Stevens is a great high schools but the school is getting old and too overcrowded due to many new students every year.  As a result, there are more than 30 students in every class and it can be hard to grab teachers' attentions."]
