column6: ["J.P Stevens is a school which excels in one area but falls short of another. On one hand, it is a very high leveled college prep high school which excels in academics and extracurriculars. However, this is the farthest I can go with this school. The rigorous and mentally straining expectations of performing up to par at this school often psychologically tortures the minds of its students. J.P treats the other aspects of normal high school life as nonexistent. The facilities are disgusting and full of muck, with the only exception being the vape-consumed B wing. The hallways and classrooms are way too crowded and humid, with the school having a demographic of over 2,000 students. If we're to receive the privilege of Macbook Airs for every single student, you might as well spend the rest of the budget on gold-studded toilets.", 'This is a great school in general but the competition between students is insane.  The teachers are very helpful and prepare the students for exams and testing. The diversity is incredible and there are so many clubs the students could join. While the school itself is very crowded the administration is looking for a way to help the overcrowding issue.', 'Overall this is a public school and the students who attend have allowed it to develop competitive nature. For students who work well under stress, this environment is a great motivator but for other students, the environment may be overwhelming. In my experience, this school enabled me to work hard in order to stand out amongst the other 2000+ students who attend the school.', "JP Stevens has the best teachers and some great resources such as presentations about college and interviews and resumes and applications. They also have so many clubs so anyone can find their interests and they offer challenging subjects. I would say that some people are too competitive though. Also the food (Chartwells) is not the worst but definitely not worth your money. It's literally price gouging - students with working parents have no other option than to buy lunch so Chartwells outrageously charges $3.25 for a slice of nasty frozen pizza. But that's not really the school's fault?? But JP also has really good security and AWESOME teachers. We need to pay them more.", 'This high school prepares you for college and how to handle yourself with a competitive environment and challenging classes. Unfortunately, since the school is very focused with college prep, it neglects the other aspect of high school life. There are issues of bullying, low school pride, cheating and too many cases of low self-esteem among the student body. The teachers and faculty are nice. They help you if you need help and the teachers engage themselves with the students which makes the class environment friendly and increases class involvement. Like every public high school, the food is terrible, but some days the food is above average. It is also very diverse and its nice to be introduced and grow up in a diverse environment before heading out to college.', 'This is a very academic based and competitive school. However, when it comes to athletics, I think it can improve on soccer and football.', 'I graduated in 2018. Was a love/hate relationship. Hated the start time. Loved early release. Hated half the student body for being complete nerds. Loved the athletic programs. Nice teachers. Mean popular kids. Great Administrators. Bad use of money. Great facilities. Stupid greenhouse. Great enviorment. Stupid macbooks. Great lunch. Too crowded. New SMALL HALF STACKED LOCKERS, over crowding.', "Lot of competitions! This school is kept clean.  Stronger arts programs. Higher quality teaching. Poor communication availability between parent/guardian with teachers, have heard about unsafe school environment but lucky yet didn't get such experience!", "Good academics. Facilities can be improved.  It's too overcrowded and definitely over the maximum capacity for the building. The teachers and academics are very good, if the facilities and overpopulations issues were fixed it would be a really great school.", "The school overall is pretty good, but many aspects of its culture are quite messed up. Primarily, it is lacking in overall school spirit as the sports teams are not very good. Not to mention the overcrowdedness of the hallways in the cramped building without even an AC or adequate bathrooms tends to dampen moods. It is also lacking in diversity as 70-80% of the students are Asian. This creates extremely high academic pressure as students rarely sleep and have a toxic influence of competitiveness. If you're not studying, you're falling behind. This leads to a lot of cheating in the honors programs. Generally, the students and teachers are nice, though it is high school. JP is good for you if you excel in academics and enjoy competition, not so much if always being stressed is not your thing. Either way, it will mess up your mental health from the cutthroat competitiveness.", 'Many of the features of this school are great, but the tough competitiveness that lurks within the students of this school is annihilating. Nowadays I feel so insecure about my grades because of how tough the people at this school are. However, they have some really amazing mentors, whom I will remember for the rest of my life. Overall, there are good things and bad things about JP.', "JP Stevens is a great place for academics and extracurriculars. The teachers are top notch and go out of their way to help you -- but the disparity between the academic groupings is getting more pronounced every year. Sure, more and more kids are being pushed into the Honors/AP track, but the students in Levels 1 and 2 are being left behind. The music program is undoubtedly one of the best in the state, but gets *just enough* funding to carry on. People are open-minded but not that nice -- there's definitely an atmosphere of competition that sometimes makes students not want to help each other. Overall this is a great school, but still has some issues with its culture that we have to fix.", 'My experience at JPS was very positive ,it prepared me for college.THere are alot of club ND ACTIVITIES TO PARTICIPATE IN AND PEOPLE ARE GENERALLY VERY OPEN MINDED AND FRIENDLY.THE SCHOOL IS NOT VERY GOOD FOR sports, we are well known for tennis though. Academics is the key highlight o the school with student scores in standerdzed testing being extremly high. The choir and orchestra is also well renouned and people usually hod the high school in high regards. The population isvery saturated by south indian so oving to this district can be a challenge, you should review all aspects of the school before commiting to it.', "I am now a senior at J.P Stevens High School and my experience was a pleasant one. Having been at this school for four years I never had a terrible experience. Academically the school is very great. So are the teachers. J.P. is definitely diverse and there is a lot of clubs and activities you can join. I feel very safe when i come into school because of the rules and drills we do and have. The theatre company puts on amazing productions and does a beautiful job year after year. But, of course there are some negatives. Our sports teams are just average as well as our food and resources. The facilities for students are terrible sometimes you have to walk to the other side of the school just to get to the bathroom. Parent involvement is depleting because parents are getting lazy. But, all in all I can't imagine going to high school anywhere else. J.P. Stevens is truly a place where you go in a kid and graduate an adult.", 'J.P. Stevens High School has a great academic program. Most teachers may have a hard curriculum, but they all care about the students here. The environment is a very fun and casual one. It is very easy to make friends in this school with the student count.', 'As a student who has attended JP, it is true that the emphasis placed on college is quite extreme. Most students only talk about college and stress about their applications; our educators also taught us based off of a curriculum geared towards getting a "5" on the AP exam. It\'s crazy that a school can be so focused on college.  There is pretty much no school culture compared to other high schools here at JP either, as most kids don\'t have time to take a break for studying to come out. I have made a decent amount of friends here as well, but none of them I see as people I would keep in touch with in the future. Overall, I was happy with my experience and college readiness, but JP lacked in developing any school culture and always has a rigid atmosphere.', 'As much as I dislike going to school, JPS does provide me with the best education possible and I honestly could not be anymore thankful. I have been able to not only learn so much academically, but also great lifetime friendships. I will miss the place I called home for 4 years after graduating and look forward to coming back whenever I can!', 'The teachers at JP vary, some can be quite great, while others mediocre. There are a plethora of clubs and sports to join, but very low diversity as everyone here is Asian. Academics is one of the most highly regarded aspects of this school, but it is based solely on students rather than teachers.', 'Although the environment is very challenging as everyone is trying to compete against each other, the school overall is a good resource to prepare students for attending college and applying for jobs. The teachers and staff members are very supportive and provide adequate attention to each individual student to enrich their learning experience.', 'I like the school but it is over crowded and very dirty. Some rules do not make sense. It is a very competitive school, which is both good and bad. I have had a good experience overall, but I am excited to move on to the next chapter of my life!']
column8: ["J.P Stevens is a school which excels in one area but falls short of another. On one hand, it is a very high leveled college prep high school which excels in academics and extracurriculars. However, this is the farthest I can go with this school. The rigorous and mentally straining expectations of performing up to par at this school often psychologically tortures the minds of its students. J.P treats the other aspects of normal high school life as nonexistent. The facilities are disgusting and full of muck, with the only exception being the vape-consumed B wing. The hallways and classrooms are way too crowded and humid, with the school having a demographic of over 2,000 students. If we're to receive the privilege of Macbook Airs for every single student, you might as well spend the rest of the budget on gold-studded toilets.", 'This is a great school in general but the competition between students is insane.  The teachers are very helpful and prepare the students for exams and testing. The diversity is incredible and there are so many clubs the students could join. While the school itself is very crowded the administration is looking for a way to help the overcrowding issue.', 'Overall this is a public school and the students who attend have allowed it to develop competitive nature. For students who work well under stress, this environment is a great motivator but for other students, the environment may be overwhelming. In my experience, this school enabled me to work hard in order to stand out amongst the other 2000+ students who attend the school.', "JP Stevens has the best teachers and some great resources such as presentations about college and interviews and resumes and applications. They also have so many clubs so anyone can find their interests and they offer challenging subjects. I would say that some people are too competitive though. Also the food (Chartwells) is not the worst but definitely not worth your money. It's literally price gouging - students with working parents have no other option than to buy lunch so Chartwells outrageously charges $3.25 for a slice of nasty frozen pizza. But that's not really the school's fault?? But JP also has really good security and AWESOME teachers. We need to pay them more.", 'This high school prepares you for college and how to handle yourself with a competitive environment and challenging classes. Unfortunately, since the school is very focused with college prep, it neglects the other aspect of high school life. There are issues of bullying, low school pride, cheating and too many cases of low self-esteem among the student body. The teachers and faculty are nice. They help you if you need help and the teachers engage themselves with the students which makes the class environment friendly and increases class involvement. Like every public high school, the food is terrible, but some days the food is above average. It is also very diverse and its nice to be introduced and grow up in a diverse environment before heading out to college.', 'This is a very academic based and competitive school. However, when it comes to athletics, I think it can improve on soccer and football.', 'I graduated in 2018. Was a love/hate relationship. Hated the start time. Loved early release. Hated half the student body for being complete nerds. Loved the athletic programs. Nice teachers. Mean popular kids. Great Administrators. Bad use of money. Great facilities. Stupid greenhouse. Great enviorment. Stupid macbooks. Great lunch. Too crowded. New SMALL HALF STACKED LOCKERS, over crowding.', "Lot of competitions! This school is kept clean.  Stronger arts programs. Higher quality teaching. Poor communication availability between parent/guardian with teachers, have heard about unsafe school environment but lucky yet didn't get such experience!", "Good academics. Facilities can be improved.  It's too overcrowded and definitely over the maximum capacity for the building. The teachers and academics are very good, if the facilities and overpopulations issues were fixed it would be a really great school.", "The school overall is pretty good, but many aspects of its culture are quite messed up. Primarily, it is lacking in overall school spirit as the sports teams are not very good. Not to mention the overcrowdedness of the hallways in the cramped building without even an AC or adequate bathrooms tends to dampen moods. It is also lacking in diversity as 70-80% of the students are Asian. This creates extremely high academic pressure as students rarely sleep and have a toxic influence of competitiveness. If you're not studying, you're falling behind. This leads to a lot of cheating in the honors programs. Generally, the students and teachers are nice, though it is high school. JP is good for you if you excel in academics and enjoy competition, not so much if always being stressed is not your thing. Either way, it will mess up your mental health from the cutthroat competitiveness.", 'Many of the features of this school are great, but the tough competitiveness that lurks within the students of this school is annihilating. Nowadays I feel so insecure about my grades because of how tough the people at this school are. However, they have some really amazing mentors, whom I will remember for the rest of my life. Overall, there are good things and bad things about JP.', "JP Stevens is a great place for academics and extracurriculars. The teachers are top notch and go out of their way to help you -- but the disparity between the academic groupings is getting more pronounced every year. Sure, more and more kids are being pushed into the Honors/AP track, but the students in Levels 1 and 2 are being left behind. The music program is undoubtedly one of the best in the state, but gets *just enough* funding to carry on. People are open-minded but not that nice -- there's definitely an atmosphere of competition that sometimes makes students not want to help each other. Overall this is a great school, but still has some issues with its culture that we have to fix.", 'My experience at JPS was very positive ,it prepared me for college.THere are alot of club ND ACTIVITIES TO PARTICIPATE IN AND PEOPLE ARE GENERALLY VERY OPEN MINDED AND FRIENDLY.THE SCHOOL IS NOT VERY GOOD FOR sports, we are well known for tennis though. Academics is the key highlight o the school with student scores in standerdzed testing being extremly high. The choir and orchestra is also well renouned and people usually hod the high school in high regards. The population isvery saturated by south indian so oving to this district can be a challenge, you should review all aspects of the school before commiting to it.', "I am now a senior at J.P Stevens High School and my experience was a pleasant one. Having been at this school for four years I never had a terrible experience. Academically the school is very great. So are the teachers. J.P. is definitely diverse and there is a lot of clubs and activities you can join. I feel very safe when i come into school because of the rules and drills we do and have. The theatre company puts on amazing productions and does a beautiful job year after year. But, of course there are some negatives. Our sports teams are just average as well as our food and resources. The facilities for students are terrible sometimes you have to walk to the other side of the school just to get to the bathroom. Parent involvement is depleting because parents are getting lazy. But, all in all I can't imagine going to high school anywhere else. J.P. Stevens is truly a place where you go in a kid and graduate an adult.", 'J.P. Stevens High School has a great academic program. Most teachers may have a hard curriculum, but they all care about the students here. The environment is a very fun and casual one. It is very easy to make friends in this school with the student count.', 'As a student who has attended JP, it is true that the emphasis placed on college is quite extreme. Most students only talk about college and stress about their applications; our educators also taught us based off of a curriculum geared towards getting a "5" on the AP exam. It\'s crazy that a school can be so focused on college.  There is pretty much no school culture compared to other high schools here at JP either, as most kids don\'t have time to take a break for studying to come out. I have made a decent amount of friends here as well, but none of them I see as people I would keep in touch with in the future. Overall, I was happy with my experience and college readiness, but JP lacked in developing any school culture and always has a rigid atmosphere.', 'As much as I dislike going to school, JPS does provide me with the best education possible and I honestly could not be anymore thankful. I have been able to not only learn so much academically, but also great lifetime friendships. I will miss the place I called home for 4 years after graduating and look forward to coming back whenever I can!', 'The teachers at JP vary, some can be quite great, while others mediocre. There are a plethora of clubs and sports to join, but very low diversity as everyone here is Asian. Academics is one of the most highly regarded aspects of this school, but it is based solely on students rather than teachers.', 'Although the environment is very challenging as everyone is trying to compete against each other, the school overall is a good resource to prepare students for attending college and applying for jobs. The teachers and staff members are very supportive and provide adequate attention to each individual student to enrich their learning experience.', 'I like the school but it is over crowded and very dirty. Some rules do not make sense. It is a very competitive school, which is both good and bad. I have had a good experience overall, but I am excited to move on to the next chapter of my life!']

column2: ['John Jay excepting of all people of different races, genders, sexualities, etc. they make it known to the students by doing various activities about differences and having posters stating that everyone is welcome and can go to any adult for help. There is a strong connection between administration and the students. Everyday my friends and I say hi to the amazing lady at the front desk and the principal always has a smile on his face. John Jay is a community where any hobby you have is a big deal.  You always know when the theater community has a show. No one misses a club meeting with the excitement that surrounds clubs at Jay. Clubs and sports games, are always accounted for in the announcements. The teachers will always stay after/come early if a student needs. The guidance department is one of the best parts. Whether you need help with family problems or have college questions, they always go above and beyond. You can go to any of them and they will do more than help you.', "I had a wonderful time overall but lacked engagement and proper challenges. I loved most of my teachers but not all we're perfect. I enjoyed high school, take that as you will!", 'JJHS has a solid academic program, sports program and extra curricular programs. It\'s easy to get engaged with the school as a parent and student. The facilities for sports and theater are very nice although the classrooms need serious improvement. They do not use a collaborative format and by no means focus on the individual student and "how" they learn best in varied settings. The classrooms and the library more resemble something from the 1980\'s or earlier. That said, the teachers are mostly good and engaged with the students as are the administrative personnel. I would increase the college preparedness and offer more advanced areas of study including in the languages and career choice areas (i.e., such as sports management, fashion design, health and more.) Overall, it\'s a very good public school but just needs greater thought-leading initiatives and perhaps greater funding to afford more updated facilities (beyond the sports facilities, which are clearly well funded).', 'The academics and teachers are fantastic, but certain elements of how the building is run can be deeply frustrating for students and unnecessarily restrictive, such as door locking policies.', "I have been a student there for 4 years now. I am a senior and I can say that it has allowed me to grow as a person. I am now a strong leader in and out of school. This school may not have all the necessities needed, but with the teacher's hard work, you gain a lot of knowledge.", 'How great the teachers and guidance counselors are.  They really care about the kids.  The class sizes are not too big usually under 25, the kids are in cliques but everyone can find someone.  The gym classes are the only classes I did not like but the equipment is amazing and the sports teams are amazing.  Many state titles.', 'I am a recent graduate from John Jay and they definitely prepared me for college. The classes I took were relevant and helped me with college classes. College organic chemistry was much easier for me than others after taking my high school chem class.', "I think I'm extremely lucky to have gone such a nice school. If I could improve the school, I would create a better art program that has more resources for students. I would also improve the current parking system.", 'I really enjoyed my time at John Jay High School.   I have found most of my teachers to be very accommodating especially during extra help sessions.  If you struggle in any class and want to improve they will help you make that happen.', "John Jay High School is a school that encourages its students to be accepting and respectful of everyone's differences.  The culture is one of the best things about the school.  The traffic flow could be better in the hallways; there are crazy traffic jams because the stairways are too narrow.  It would be nice if they provided an outdoor area for eating lunch. Teachers are nice. Plenty of clubs, activities and sports. Strong academics, but could use more time management training to get ready for college.  Kids are nice and it's a very safe school.  Administration is respectful to students and parents.", "its a good school with great academics and will provide fantastic opportunities for college, problem is, socially its incredibly homogenous yet divided almost in half. the divide consists of richer kids without many struggles, who can handle school work and balance everything in their lives, to the usually poorer students who can't join 3 different sports teams, can't keep up, and sometimes turn to drugs to cope. its a lot of pressure and a lot of people saying that If you don't go to a top of the line college, theres no hope for a future; but once you get out into the world, you're so much further ahead than anyone. I've gotten opportunities here that I would have never dreamed of coming from someone without too much money. so its not a great school to make lifelong friends or one that helps its students individually, but its usually worth it if you can pull through all 4 years.", 'John Jay High School has incredible teachers. The school counselors assist students in college applications and ensure that everyone ends up where they are meant to be. The faculty and staff are generally cheerful and compassionate people. John Jay does a good job at allowing students to explore things they are passionate about, whether it be theatre, sports, or clubs. While there are many things that can be improved (i.e. an increase in diversity, less censorship, etc.), John Jay High School is a great high school.', 'Other than the normal things that do happen around high schools, it is alright. The only main thing is that we had a serious problem with vandalism when I was a junior and it was solved.', 'I thought I received a great education at John Jay High School and I feel prepared for college. It is a very nice school, in a very calm and safe place (Westchester). I would not change much about my experience, although the school does need a little more diversity.', 'Great teachers (for the most part). We have access to excellent facilities, and get a great education. Lost a star because of the ridiculous lack of racial and socioeconomic diversity.', 'We love the school, teachers and students. How ever there has been allot of changes the past couple of years. New Superintendents,teachers on leave and replacements. The replacements are learning and are not teaching up to code. Recently students were not prepared for the AP psychology exam. We still have a large difference in SATACT scores are lower than surrounding districts. Scrarsdale  is always 100 points higher. why? I love the families, community and the kids. generally we have a great group of students all getting ready for college.  John Jay should offer prep courses for the SAT and ACT but does not . Why?  The community pays a great deal of Taxes all students are ear marked for college and work hard towards that goal.  Sports are utmost important.The school is better than many but still has room for improvement.', 'Great faculty, administration, and peers. Wonderful time here at John Jay High School. All programs are strong with the exception of foreign languages. Competition is very high but overall outcomes are positive. The school excels in athletics especially wrestling and track and field.', "John Jay High School is probably one of the nicest schools in westchester. However the school steadily is becoming worse to the students. As a sophomore, the sports used to be 100x better 4 years ago and the school rules used to be much more flexible. Now, it feels all students are trapped in a jail with no breaks (feb break was taken away 2 years ago). Personally I can't wait to get out but it definitely is one of the best schools in New York so if anyone wants to move here it's a good choice; just make sure you are involved with sports and you'll fit right in.", 'John Jay High school is very academically challenging and has a huge community support base.  There is ample opportunity for kids to get involved in clubs and sports, there is something for everyone. John Jay students graduate will prepared to begin college.', "My overall experience with John Jay was a positive one. I have had great experiences with many teachers. Most of them are there to help you succeed and will make themselves available to you. It's really what you make of it. I do feel as though they care a lot about the smart kids and some people in the middle get forgot about sometimes."]

column6: ['we have a cop in school\r sometimes the nurses are mean', 'lots of clubs \r we have sustainability club, mountain biking club, science olympiad, model UN, chess club, sewing club and sooo much more', 'There are lots of options, but they lack in structure.', "Overall, this school was good academically. However I found no other positive aspects of this school. It is severely lacking in diversity and places a ridiculously high importance on sports, athletics, and technology, to the point where all other programs are seriously over-funded. If you aren't extremely materialistic, liberal, wealthy, arrogant, or stuck up, then you will have a lot of trouble finding friends or fitting in.", "The quality of teachers here vary greatly. There are a number of them that are extremely helpful and really take the time to know everyone individually and create engaging lessons. On the other hand, there are a few I've had some extreme problems with, all of which had tenure. One of them was way too laid back and clearly had no interest in preparing the students for the regents or teaching them in general. Another was extremely rude, disrespectful and passive aggressive to all of the students and had absolutely no knowledge of the subjects she taught.", 'Some of the teachers are mismatched and students tend to become a little bit more apathetic as time goes on, but for the most part we have very quality extracurriculars.', "Some people are difficult to deal with; there's a bit of a weird mix of cultures here, and many people have parents that aren't necessarily absent, but more apathetic. Most people find a place to fit in though, although there is a bit of petty nonsense that goes on between students. This school is definitely unique, considering it's a mix of cultures in a predominantly white and upperclass area, although the mix isn't totally even and is sometimes relevant during race-related incidents; these are very few, however, and when they happen, they are mostly very petty. I've made a lot of friends at John Jay and have little regrets as to the people I've chosen to associate myself with.", 'Quality: Most teachers are educated and well versed in their subjects. Most lessons are understandable, and teachers are happy to explain content to students in more detailed fashion.\r Teaching Styles: Varies between teachers, although this is not an issue.\r Knowledge: Almost all are very knowledgable.\r Interest in Students: The majority are very invested in their students, although some can be a little apathetic.\r Communication: Most are friendly and approachable, and most will respond to emails within 24 hours.\r Consistency in Grading: Some teachers can be inconsistent and will not explain grades to students, although a majority are much better about this.', 'Do not really care about it.', "Academically, it's a very good school. However sometimes it feels like thats the only thing that matters. Teachers put a lot of pressure on students to learn subjects quickly without any context. It's almost as if some times they expect you to teach yourself and then all they have to do is go over the subject matter quickly. When confronted about this, many teachers' responses are that they are teaching highschool/college courses and at this point in time the students should be able to handle the (unrealistic) workload of the class. They don't realize that while the work they assign might not be that much on it's own, when put together with all the other work from other classes it becomes almost unbearable. Another thing is that teachers are kept based on seniority. So basically if it came to the point where the school had to lay a teacher off, they would end up firing the good teacher who's beeun at the school for 3 years rather than the bad teacher who's been there for 10 years. It's all very annoying. Besides the academics, the art programs are quite successful as well( even though funding is minimal) and we have a variety of clubs and extracurriculars to join which is fun. There is a lot of stress on sports, however, so naturally that's what would be taking away from the arts programs. And only the sports that are deemed most popular. For example we were able to build new tennis courts in one summer for a tennis team that's barely succeeding meanwhile we've been toiling for 4-5 years trying to get a cross country course for a team who's managed to make it to states, fedrations and almost nationals consecutively for several years. I'm just focusing on the annoying parts of the school, overall it's a pretty good place to learn even if there is some trouble with being able to discipline students with multiple offenses based on the school code of conduct...", 'overall each high school is unique to each student. For me I have applied and involved myself to the best of my abilities, thus making high school a pretty positive experience. The only negative would be cattiness among some girls.', "Over all, John Jay high school is a reputable school, and disputed my experiences there is a good place to get your high school education, I have only been attending the school for over a year however, I'm not very involved in the social aspect of it.", 'I have had a positive experience. It has given me a great education!', 'they tend to be strict', 'its okay im not too involved with school related extracurriculars. mostly non school related', 'its not my favorite school, faculty is great for the most part but the student body sucks', 'The athletic program is great. Anyone can do anything and get in shape from the weight room.', 'Its great here you can find anything to do and if you want to start a new club you can', "Some of the food is not the best but come on its public school lunch it can't be perfect", 'Some teachers are tougher than others but they all mean well']

I'm just focusing on the annoying parts of the school, overall it's a pretty good place to learn even if there is some trouble with being able to discipline students with multiple offenses based on the school code of conduct...", 'overall each high school is unique to each student. The only negative would be cattiness among some girls.', "Over all, John Jay high school is a reputable school, and disputed my experiences there is a good place to get your high school education, I have only been attending the school for over a year however, I'm not very involved in the social aspect of it.", 'I have had a positive experience. It has given me a great education!', 'they tend to be strict', 'its okay im not too involved with school related extracurriculars. mostly non school related', 'its not my favorite school, faculty is great for the most part but the student body sucks', 'The athletic program is great. Anyone can do anything and get in shape from the weight room.', 'Its great here you can find anything to do and if you want to start a new club you can', "Some of the food is not the best but come on its public school lunch it can't be perfect", 'Some teachers are tougher than others but they all mean well']

column1: Plainview-Old Bethpage John F. Kennedy High School
column2: ['Got picked on early on from administration. Was searched many times for no reason. Clearly discriminating against me being hispanic. Glad for it to be over and personally have no good regards towards the school. Classmates were the only good thing about going to school.', 'I enjoyed my time there thanks to great teachers that made me want to learn! The graphic design courses were my favorite and helped me develop practical skills i could use for the rest of my life.', 'POBJFK HS was an excellent school for developing me as a person and preparing me for my college experience!', 'Plainview Old Bethpage JFK High School has a diverse student body which allows me to make friends with different cultural backgrounds.  I wish our school was a little stronger in the Musical Theatre and Arts department.  There is something to do for anyone who wants to get involved.', 'Great school, wonderful teachers, the building, bathrooms, cafeteria and locker rooms need some updating but they do not effect the quality of your education', 'POB JFK has a lot to offer such as great teachers mostly and excellent facilities. The whole district from k-12 is very good. I would recommend my community to any students.', "JFK provided me with a lot of opportunities. I felt like it was really easy for me to pursue my interests and enroll in classes that were fit for me. There are so many clubs and sports to get involved in, and there's something for everyone. I learned a lot academically and was provided with resources that I needed to succeed. I felt sufficiently prepared for college, and had the opportunity to take challenging courses. Some of the teachers are really fantastic. The food is good and people are generally pretty friendly.", "Academics- unfortunately allows students to opt in to AP classes even when they aren't qualified to take the classSchool Culture- no dances, homecoming or otherwise; I'm pretty sure most of the people at the Homecoming Game are only there out of obligation (e.g. the marching band, cheerleading squad, student council, etc)Food- cannot comment on the food as I literally never had a meal in the cafeteria; lunch is optional and most teachers will let you eat in class so you have room for more electivesSafety- have seriously upped their protocol due to current events", 'Freshman year I was bullied. However, very lucky that the assistant principles and guidance councilors were so helpful when it came to helping me end the horrible bullying. Sophomore year was better but I still had a hard time in classes due to my ADHD. It began to effect my grades. Myself, along with one of my teachers, and mother, got me evaluated and I ended up getting a 504.  Junior year was just difficult because of college searching and SATs. I also began again to get bullied by one of the same groups of people from Freshman year. However, I did not let them belittle me and I stood up for myself. Senior year was the best and worst year of my life. I was finally getting out of high school and getting away from people that hurt me and terrorized me for year. However, personally, I had a lot going on at home. Luckily, many of my teacher comforted me and they were always there for me even when I tried being strong. Many of them I still am in contact with after high school', 'I had an okay experience in high school. I got along with my teachers great. But as for the kids not so much. I know that is not the schools fault. But the guidance counselors and assistant principals could make it a little easier when you are in need of help.', 'It’s a pretty good school, the main pullbacks are the drugs that many kids are on and the annoying parents.', 'Overall the school is very strong academically.  A very safe school with quality facilities and resources.  The sports program needs to be improved.  With the exception of a couple of sports, the school is not competitive compared to schools of similar size and makeup.', "I loved my experience at JFK. I never had a bad experience with a teacher, as all are dedicated to each student's success. It's a welcoming environment with a wide variety of extracurricular activities.", 'It was overall a great one. It is a very nice school. Teachers were lovely and helped a lot. The cafeteria food was better than what I had in my previous school. Diversity was fairly good, but then again it depends on the area. Academics and sports are great and competitive. School spirit is great.', "This High School is an amazing place to get an education. There are so many opportunities to take different classes and there are so many clubs to get involved in. I've had such a great experience so far. The teachers are amazing and are there to help you", 'I really enjoyed my time at the school.  Most of the teachers and the  Guidance Counselors really took an interest in their students.  There were loads of activities to do at school and you could really be kept busy at all times.  There were many remedial classes to help students who were having a problem with the classes.  Parents really took an interest in the school activities which made it very beneficial to the students attending the school.  The school was kept very clean and the security was very good.  I feel that the school was a very good foundation for me now that I will be entering College.  I will miss JFK and the friends that I have made their and hope to visit the school often when I am in the neighborhood.', 'This is my first year going there and it’s pretty nice. All I have to say negitive is getting from chorus to math. I’m almost always late.', "The school is pretty good school. It's almost amazing, but the connection between what students want the school to implement and what actually happens is very weak.", "Great school, with excellent opportunities and faculties. The classes can be scheduled accordingly to the student's interest, so I always had a class I looked forward to. And as a student who struggled in some of my classes, I can most certainly say that the teachers are very willing to help. Additionally, people here are generally quite friendly and devoted.", 'Plainview-Old Bethpage John F. Kennedy High School is a great place to attend to prepare yourself for college and higher education. The teachers at this school are all willing to do all they can to prepare you for your later life. I would recommend attending this school to anyone in the area.']

column6: ['The community is great and very supportive. I enjoy the time I spend at school especially at clubs and activities that show school spirit like Battles of the Classes Week.', 'I can’t deny that unbiasedly, this school is a hidden gem. The fact that this school hasn’t been at the center of some limelight is dumbfounding. The academics are challenging and rewarding the staff are unparalleled and there are endless clubs and activities for the students. Safety is a priority and I feel free to study and wander around campus. I can go on and on, but the home of the hawks speaks for itself on a multitude of levels.', 'POBJFKHS is an excellent academic school. As a student frequently on the honors and AP track, I feel as though I was never held back by the school and always encouraged to maximize my potential. That said, the guidance department and administration, although full of kind and wonderful people, has its pitfalls. These groups often make decisions that backfire at the expense of students and parents, from poor communication and involvement to an alteration of the schoolwide testing schedule on which students were not consulted. Overall, however, this is an excellent school.', "I loved everything about my high school. It had such a great atmosphere, the administration was amazing, i loved all my teachers, i love my friends, i made so many more friends and met so many people. I was involved in many clubs and sports and i wouldn't change a thing about my high school experience.", 'Throughout my four years at POBJFKHS I can attest that the teachers are amazing and scholarly people striving to better the community and provide the best materials for their students. The majority of students here are focused individuals. This can make the student body quite competitive, however this does not seem like a detriment to me. I believe it only enhances the schools atmosphere to include knowable and worldly students who are most defiantly prepared for college.', 'Decently diverse district, people are generally friendly, however there are not as many options to get involved with national social justice events which is desired by the students.', 'The main reason I moved to the town of Plainview was for its valuable education and the commitment to education that the administration and teachers have. I have truly seen this commitment throughout my time here. All the staff at POBCSD are continuously rooting for you and making sure you strive to achieve your best. My education at POBCSD has also allowed me to become more actively involved with my community and give back to the community that has nurtured me and raised me to achieve my best. I highly recommend this school district for anyone that wants to achieve personal growth and success.', "In this school, I either had exceptional teachers or people who shouldn't even have that title.  I was very involved with the choir and drama program.  The teachers in these programs went above and beyond in everyday imaginable.  I love this school.  The administration is very much for the students for the most part.  The guidance department really knows what they are doing.", 'Love attending this school. Teachers are very nice and helpful. They really ensure you are on the right track.', "The teaching staff is completely dedicated to the education of there students and are always available for extra help to  truly help students understand the curriculum if they begin to struggle. I'd like to see an improvement in the substitute staff, days of teacher absences are completely wasteful as of now due to this problem.", 'Plainview-Old Bethpage John F. Kennedy High School offers so many opportunities and classes to choose from. There are so many extracurriculars to choose from to further your academic experience.', 'Plainview Old-Bethpage school district needs to have less involvement of parents in student run activities. The school itself has great facilities and dedicated teachers who are determined to make sure the students are fully prepared to enter the world.', 'I love my School! I feel that there are so many opportunities to explore your interests for the future between the various course selections as well as the variety of clubs.', "Like any given school, there are amazing teachers and terrible teachers. However, the amazing teachers definitely outweigh the terrible few. Most teachers will be the best you've ever seen, even having their student's phone numbers so they can text for help. They engage in the lesson and are more than welcome to give guidance when needed. A few, however, have tenure and are just plain packet throwers.", 'The teaching staff are excellent and work hard for their', 'Rigorous and extensive but worth the hard work through much devotion!', 'Many security guards around the school.', 'There are many extracurricular opportunities that students can get involved in!', 'I absolutely love Metmunc and Choir and band', 'I have had the best experience with clubs and activities and a bunch of great friends.']

column1: Half Hollow Hills High School East
column2: ['HHH High School East has all the makings of a great school. Here, students have endless opportunities to unlock numerous passions in their life. Life within the school goes much beyond the classroom, with excelling students in music, sports and various other clubs. The students are challenged and exceed expectations put on them. The facilities are always updated, with a state of the art auditorium. Overall, Half Hollow Hills High School East, is a great high school environment', 'Half Hollow Hills High School East is a diverse community that has some of the best educational opportunities in Long Island with teachers that genuinely care.', 'The teachers are always working to make sure you succeed and there are always resources available to ensure you do well', "I would give 0 stars if it were possible. I attended 5 different schools for high school due to my father's occupation as a contractor. Half Hollow Hills was by far the worst. My experience with the staff was completely appalling. I reached out for help on numerous occassions only to be met with judgement and ridicule. One teacher continuously humiliated me in front of my peers for having dyslexia. My treatment from the students was equally inhumane. It still confuses me that I had no such problems in all the other high schools I've attended. I felt that at every other school I've been a student at, I was met with kindness, warmth, and understanding. However, at HHH people were generally very closed-minded and cruel.", 'Excellent education with opportunities to improve your learning and get into great colleges. Competitive environment can sometimes be overwhelming but if you find the right people you can feel more at ease.', "Half Hollow Hills High School East is a very good school. As alumni, I came out of high school very prepared to enter college. The school did not receive an excellent score, however, because a number of classmates and I did not feel completely prepared for life post-college in the adult world. The academics, athletics, and student population were a great contributor to the school's overall high rating.", 'The students are very ambitious and competitive. This leads to better grades because everyone is so competitive about their grades. Students are also very friendly and open-minded about things. There is a great deal of diversity in the student body. The teachers and guidance counselors are great and very helpful.', 'My overall experience was great. The teachers genuinely cared about you as an individual student and wished individual improvement. Unfortunately, there were some teachers that had favorites and made it known which can be discouraging to other classmates.', "Im currently in High School East , and let me tell you one thing, this school is very competitive and it's so stressful because everyone is trying to be better than one another, and it gets draining. Also to be honesty our school is diverse, yes ethnicity wise, but mostly just how people act. We have those spoiled rich people, then the people who try to act ghetto, the normal people, just odd people, and then those people who scream in your face while your minding your own business walking in the hallway , and you would be lying if you said this didn't happen to you  or that you never seen this happen. Honestly we do have such great teachers. The school seems big but it really isn't. To conclude our school is kinda wack but that is what makes it fun, even though the school spirt is low, I got to say Hills East isn't too bad.", "I really enjoyed the experiences and the ability to follow any path I choose in HHH through the electives that were offered. I also enjoyed the theater department at HHH which allowed students to express themselves in a different way. Also, I loved the ability to take independent study language classes. It was so cool to learn languages that weren't taught throughout the school day.", 'this is a very competitive school but also lowkey a party Schoo. at this school there are a lot of drinking and smoking especially among the the younger grades. this school is really good with academics tho.', "An opinion based on HHH High School East's exterior would be nothing but laudable. The general atmosphere is incredibly competitive, and while most students are financially stable and have access to educational assistance, a certain population, most commonly the low-income minority population, do not have the same advantages. Boundary lines allow students (including myself) in de facto segregated communities such as Wheatley Heights and Deer Park to attend HHH HSE. Many teachers, while passionate about their jobs, criticize the current administration and the policies in place. Students do not have the liberty to further express interest in areas, as teachers pander to a large indiscriminate audience. This school is not one that stereotypically upholds its sports programs over programs in the fine arts, in the sense that both areas equally lack funding. Deficit spending is the unspoken stain on this district, and excessive purchases only deprive students of support and aid.", 'I like that they want the students to be involved in the curriculum and many after school activities. i wish they would change is keeping the 3 pep ralleys they used to have instead of just one for the fall season', "The school and very good academics. My only complaint is that they come up with extreme responses to danger. It's good that they are quick to change policy and adjust to situations, but the measures they take are a bit unnecessary.", 'When I first started at high school East I was nervous because the school is very big and I thought the transition would be very different from elementary school to middle school which it was. Many people were there to help me when I went to do my schedule before school started which gave me a better sense of where I was going and allowed me to feel less nervous because people I’m the school are there to help me. Although the beginning of freshman year was scary, I got use to the way things were and really liked it. I participated in multiple sports throughout these years such as field hockey, winter track and softball! I met people who I am able to call my best friends. By being on a sports team I was able to learn better leadership skills and having dedication! I also joined the cross campus chamboir my senior year and I wish I did sooner because it is amazing. I am able to balance sports, music and academics all at the same time with the help of teachers and my family.', "I liked when we would do things like Spirit Week and Homecoming each year. It would make me feel closer to my peers than I would on a regular day. I would speak to people that I normally wouldn't approach. The only thing I would want to change about that is it should be  more creative so more people would want to participate. The education is great as well. The teachers are good at their jobs and know what they're talking about when they teach. Their teaching makes me feel more prepared for life after high school.", 'My experience was amazing, the school was warm and nurturing yet motivational in both educational and social aspects helping me to grow and prosper as an individual.', 'The school is better academically. Some sports have better athletes than others.   The teachers are  depending on who you have. There is pretty good diversity with the students and many clubs.', 'High School East really helped me grow as a student and more importantly a person. I have made many friends and grew academically. The amount of resources is astronmical. THere is so many clubs and activites to get involved with and it helps meet a lot of kids. Overall, it was a wonderful experience.', 'Throughout my time at Half Hollow Hills High School East, I have made countless lifelong friends a well as had many teachers who left a profound impact on my life. The memories from these four years will live on forever.']

This school is not one that stereotypically upholds its sports programs over programs in the fine arts, in the sense that both areas equally lack funding. Deficit spending is the unspoken stain on this district, and excessive purchases only deprive students of support and aid.", 'I like that they want the students to be involved in the curriculum and many after school activities. i wish they would change is keeping the 3 pep ralleys they used to have instead of just one for the fall season', "The school and very good academics. My only complaint is that they come up with extreme responses to danger. It's good that they are quick to change policy and adjust to situations, but the measures they take are a bit unnecessary.", 'When I first started at high school East I was nervous because the school is very big and I thought the transition would be very different from elementary school to middle school which it was. Many people were there to help me when I went to do my schedule before school started which gave me a better sense of where I was going and allowed me to feel less nervous because people I’m the school are there to help me. Although the beginning of freshman year was scary, I got use to the way things were and really liked it. I participated in multiple sports throughout these years such as field hockey, winter track and softball! I met people who I am able to call my best friends. By being on a sports team I was able to learn better leadership skills and having dedication! I also joined the cross campus chamboir my senior year and I wish I did sooner because it is amazing. I am able to balance sports, music and academics all at the same time with the help of teachers and my family.', "I liked when we would do things like Spirit Week and Homecoming each year. It would make me feel closer to my peers than I would on a regular day. I would speak to people that I normally wouldn't approach. The only thing I would want to change about that is it should be  more creative so more people would want to participate. The education is great as well. The teachers are good at their jobs and know what they're talking about when they teach. Their teaching makes me feel more prepared for life after high school.", 'My experience was amazing, the school was warm and nurturing yet motivational in both educational and social aspects helping me to grow and prosper as an individual.', 'The school is better academically. Some sports have better athletes than others.   The teachers are  depending on who you have. There is pretty good diversity with the students and many clubs.', 'High School East really helped me grow as a student and more importantly a person. I have made many friends and grew academically. The amount of resources is astronmical. THere is so many clubs and activites to get involved with and it helps meet a lot of kids. Overall, it was a wonderful experience.', 'Throughout my time at Half Hollow Hills High School East, I have made countless lifelong friends a well as had many teachers who left a profound impact on my life. The memories from these four years will live on forever.']
column6: ['HHH High School East has an amazing education system with a diverse amount of class. The teachers are good and there are many AP classes. There are many clubs to join as well.', 'High School East excells in academics and arts. Although there are faults, I feel that said faults overlap upon any high school. High School East is a wonderful school and offers numerous opportunities to its students.', 'Half Hollow Hills High School East is a very vibrant school that has a great academic and athletic vibe.', 'Everyone is very friendly, helpful and teachers are the best, really knows how to help a student out like myself', 'This school district is good academically and sports wise, and the teachers are really resourceful and nice. I have been in the district since I was in 2nd grade, and I am now a senior.', 'I had a great experience in middle school. Most of the teachers are really nice and it’s a good school to attend. I made many friends that I am still friends with today. School spirit is not great but I felt safe.', 'There are a lot of opportunities with the classes and clubs u can take. There is a wide spread variety of AP courses to choose from. The same goes with all the electives there are all different electives involving computer applications, engineering, buissnes, law architecture ex. For the most part the teachers are nice and really try to help the kids but u have to take it seriously and want the help. The building is clean and there is a great selection of music classes. We preform school plays and musicals ever year.', 'I would like to see teachers that care about their students and their success. Many teachers begin to slip and lose their passion for teaching. Too many of my teachers lost sight of their reasons for becoming educators. When they lose sight of their original motives they lose their ability to be effective teachers. Along with their lack of passion we have a lack of diversity among the teachers. While our school is among the most diverse on Long Island, the teachers in the building are hardly representative of the schools population. The majority of the teachers are white women with a few white males scattered throughout the departments and a total of 3 black teachers, whom are all female. The majority of the male teachers are found in the social studies departments. We need to have more ethnic diversity throughout the school so that our diverse population can find teachers they can relate to as well. It is time for my district to no longer be the epitome of racial stereotypes.', 'This is a very great school if you’re interested in very competitive athletics and academic clubs. I enjoy going to this school because it’s easy to connect with the teachers and experience everything that this school has to offer whether it be from a musical standpoint or athletic standpoint, of course with so much more.', 'Great high school experience with many resources to help every student. Teachers were like family and genuinely cared for my success!', 'I enjoyed attending this school very much and felt that it has prepared me for the next chapter in my life.', 'I would like to see better security. There are cameras but more security drills and security precautions.', 'I have made many friends with great people from my school district. It is one of the best school districts academically and the teachers are awesome. I absolutely love my school and it is just great', "High School East is a very diverse school. The food is good depending on what you get. The sandwich and salad bar is the best. I appreciate the academics and the variety of after school clubs and activities. The teachers are very good however there are a slight few that aren't all that. However not everyone can be perfect so it is understandable. Parent involvement at this school is at an all time high which can be a blessing and a curse.", 'Good teachers and positive environment. Teachers are kind and involved, students are friendly. Lots of clubs and sports to be involved with.', 'Half Hollow Hills High School East is a truly helpful advocate for a high school senior applying to college. They push you to strive for the best by taking advanced classes and participating in school activities.', 'Half Hollow Hills offers excellent opportunities for students will all kinds of interests.  From the arts in education program to the pre college courses there is something for every student to find an interest in.  There are over 100 clubs and school activities as well.', "My experience at this high school has been truly amazing; I don't think I would've enjoyed any other high school more than I did this one. The opportunities here are endless. I think I've really transformed after coming here and I think it's a wonderful environment; there is a lot of diversity in this school and the academic opportunities are great too. The teachers are very dedicated and the students are pretty motivated and many of them are high achievers.", 'Half Hollow Hills High School East is a very good school with highly renowned academics! The difficulty level of your classes depends on which classes you decide to take, but it was manegable. The teachers and most of the staff are very helpful and help to create a safer school environment. They try to provide the most for their students. I was happy to have spent my 4 years of high school going there, and some of the teachers really try to help prepare you for the many years to come after high school.', 'The school has a very welcoming enviornment, I feel motivated to work throughout the school day however the hallways can get a bit crowded sometimes']

column2: ["I'm a freshman at South Brunswick High School, and despite the typical difficulties of High School, I love it! I have amazing teachers who care about my success and don't hesitate to help students when they need it. There are lots of clubs and electives to help pursue fields not covered by typical academic classes. There are many advanced courses, and many STEM courses. We have an AMAZING music program, and everyone in it enjoys it. The students at the school are generally nice people, and most people are very friendly. The building is safe and secure; there are usually a few police on campus. The school has many Asians, so diversity is not a strong suit, but there are many different types of people that you can talk to and learn from. The building has 3 floors, quite a few turf fields, and has an excellent athletics department. You'll feel at home right away. I would highly recommend coming to the school because you will learn a lot and have fun!", 'South Brunswick High School is one of the better high schools when it comes to academics. For college readiness, there are some classes that put a lot of effort into their curriculum while other classes do not put as much attention. Nonetheless, they still prepare the students for AP exams and for colleges.', 'I loved the large number of activities that students get an opportunity to get involved in. There are many clubs for sports, community service activities and subject-specific clubs that students can potentially take part in. For me personally, I took part in clubs focused on subjects that I was interested in such as biology and medical-related careers. I also took part in an environmental club that worked to spread awareness and generate solutions for a healthier atmosphere for our district.', 'SBHS was a good school. The academics and professors are good. The school has a lot of resources and facilities for students to utilize. Overall my experience was good.', "South Brunswick high school is a very good school. It's a good place to take a good education. I just came to the U.S last year. I was so nervous at the beginning of the school year but the teachers there help me a lot to success.one of the bad thing is in the school is safety. It's not good or bad. but, many fights happened in this school with students and onetime one of the students went to the hospital because of this fight. there was no one to help her. but overall the school is very good", 'Really competitive, like grades are what you flex here, also above average amount of super rich kids', 'There are so many wonderful opportunities to be had here at South Brunswick High. The majority of the teachers are very friendly and nourishing to their students. However, problems brought up by fellow class mates are not taken care of in a healthy manner. Bullying is very prevalent in SBHS. Many problems come up out of racism and homophobia, causing many students of minority groups to suffer throughout their years of school. There are little to no consequences for trouble makers, but a slap on he wrist. But there are tons of friendly kids. Another thing is, the school doesn’t leave you readily prepared for college as you come up to your senior year of high-school. There are personal financing classes and career management classes, but they serve little purpose in preparation to the real world. There are so many things to say, but these are some of the main things I’d focus on for now.', "South Brunswick is like no other high school. It definitely had bad things but it's a place that allowed you to be yourself and help jump start your future.  The staff cares and wants the best for you. You find friends that help you find our the person you are and want to be.", 'I am currently a senior South Brunswick High School and have attended all four years. My overall impression of the school is that we pride ourselves in being one of the best schools in the area and a blue ribbon national school of character. There are many opportunities available and there is something for everyone if they choose to be a part of something. Furthermore, as a student-athlete, I like the dedication the coaches have to the players in every sport and how they care. However, I think the academic pressure on the students is too high. Students who have a 3.8 GPA are looked down on still because there are many students with a 4.2 GPA and higher. It is good to push students to be the best they can be in the classroom, it is important to recognize the effort made by the other students as well, even if they have a 3.5 GPA.', "Overall, as a student, I would say this school is great. There are so many opportunities and choices for students when it comes to sports, clubs, music, and leadership. The school itself is beautiful and gives a large forum for students to pursue their life goals. But as a student, I do have to take off a star just for my own experiences, i.e. with the school lunches (while options are numerous, the food isn't always that great, uses too much single use cutlery, and increases the price too frequently) or our emergency bomb drills and shooter, which take an excessive amount of time and don't really reassure any student (when it comes to the bomb drills, situating us where we go takes too much time, makes an easy target, and is not far enough from the school and when it comes to shooter drills, what we do right now is not psychologically reassuring to us students who have to sit there and take it).", "South Brunswick High School has a great music and arts program. The academic level is very advanced and great for all types of learners. However, the student body isn't diverse.", 'South Brunswick high school has very good sports teams and academics. There are a lot of good teachers. As for clubs, South Brunswick High School has around 30 diverse clubs.', 'I like the vast variety of opportunities available at this school for clubs, sports, and volunteering. If I had to change something, I would change the amount of people at the school and lessen it a little, as it is way too crowded and has just been increasing over time.', 'I’m a student at this school, entering senior year. I’ve had a really great time here at SBHS and I’ll be sad to have to leave. I’ve made so many new friends, had such wonderful teachers, and been through some really great times at the place.', 'Extremely diverse and inclusive school with great teachers and staff. The extracurricular activities are great, including music and athletics. There are also multicultural clubs promoting the understanding of various cultures.', 'My 4 years at south Brunswick high school is an experience I will never forget. When I started my freshman year, I immediately felt apart of the school culture. Each and every year it became more and more to learn and more to accept. All I can say is thank you to the amazing faculty that made my 4 years of high school as memorable as they were.', 'Overall a good school with good programs. It was very diverse and the school was very proud of that. Student environment was not horrible.', 'I spent my freshman year here before relocating to another state/high school. I enjoyed my experience as I was with other people whom I spent my entire life with (before moving). I found that the teachers were knowledgeable and helpful, the students friendly and the environment motivating.', 'Looking back at my four years at SBHS and having talked to friends that go to similar schools in the area (WWPs, Montgomery, JP Stevens) SBHS offers a stellar education while maintaining a very diverse high school experience. Education wise, SBHS offers several advanced courses and electives. I was able to truly explore my interests in Computer Science and Math (both of which are great departments at SBHS). The teachers are amazing at this school and go beyond the call of duty to connect with students. SBHS is also incredibly diverse in its student body and their interests. The school has an incredible marching band and music groups, top-notch athletic teams and several clubs. Honestly, SBHS was an amazing experience and it was a perfect balance between extracurriculars, academics and most importantly fun.Also I got into a T20 and all of my extracurriculars were in SBHS so I really can’t thank this school enough.', 'It is a very close-knit community of staff and students; a large support system. There is a great deal of healthy competition amongst the students in various facets of high school life- academics, athletics, leadership- that pushes everyone to not only reach but to surpass their potential.']
