column6: ['Very caring teachers. Safe school focused heavily on students. Great balance of sports, band, and academics. Highly diverse school that integrates programs such as Indian Dance and a Male Beauty Pageant. Great college prep and plenty of AP course offerings.', 'South Brunswick is a very diverse school. There is a lot of different cultures and the school celebrates that. We also have very good sports teams and lots of clubs for students. The faculty and teachers are very helpful but I did not feel fully prepared for college.', "South Brunswick High School has done an excellent job in preparing me for my future time in college.  It's safe to say that at least 90% of the teachers at SBHS are dedicated to teaching their students and making sure that they maintain positivity, integrity, and an overall very decent education (I have definitely had teachers that are not like this, although they didn't last long in our school).  Ultimately, it's easy to see why SBHS is one of the best public schools in NJ.", 'I am a student here at SBHS. If you are a parent planning to move to this town to enroll your child, there are a few things you might want to know. Sports, clubs, and activities after school are very good. Coaches work hard and are involved and there are many different clubs to choose from. The resources are great too. Getting help from your teachers is a good alternative to paying for a tutor. Although this school is pretty good, there are some problems. Violence between students online and in the hallways are a problem that seemed to skyrocket this year. The students here are very comfortable in their friend groups, making it hard to make friends. Vaping nicotine and marijuana in the school bathrooms is also an outrageous epidemic here at SBHS and needs to be handled. Overall, I feel about 60% safe walking in the hallway or walking in the bathroom, which is pretty low.', 'Overall, this high school has everything a student can ask for. From advanced courses to excellent teachers as well as a perfectly maintained campus, South Brunswick High School is definitely worth it.', 'The teachers at SBHS are very interactive with you, and want to help you become a better students, and prepare you for college', "The resources and opportunities that South Brunswick High School offers expand far beyond just education and extracurricular activities. Despite a lack of diversity because there is one group of people that is the majority in the area, the school is a safe, calm, and enjoyable environment. You can choose to do anything you like and you have free range to explore it how you'd like. It's a good school that I'd recommend for anyone.", "Great academic, athletic, extracurricular, and community opportunities but it's very divided between kids in honors (and above) classes and kids who aren't. Everyone's always either stressed or depressed or both but at least our football team's amazing, right?", 'My time at South Brunswick high school gave me the tools I needed to succeed in college. Coming to college I feel that I had an advantage over others academically. I knew information that others did not previously coming to college.', 'There are a lot of opportunities and courses to explore what you want to do. There are many clubs to participate in and activities to be a part of.', 'South Brunswick is filled with kind teachers that care about the education for their students. Although, there are issues regarding some students, South Brunswick teachers and facility are trained to handle with care. Also, SBHS is well known for their diversity. There are people that comes from all kinds of backgrounds which makes the environment so much better.', 'I had a great experience attending SBHS. I felt that it readily prepared me for college and beyond. Not only was I taught well academically, but I was also taught how to navigate through the real world—which is also very important. I never felt like I didn’t belong. The community was so inviting throughout my 4 years there and I definitely felt apart of the SBHS family. SBHS was such and integral part of my life and I continue to be proud of how the school has shaped me into the person I am today.', 'South Brunswick High School Has a staff that includes many approachable people whether the issue deals with academics or something else. Many teachers care about the success of their students, though it would be beneficial if some altered the way they teach students, either by providing better review for tests or including different activities during class. Sports coaches work hard to prepare their athletes for games, matches, and the like. Overall, South Brunswick High School has a good rating.', 'south brunswick high school is a really good school so far since i’ve transferred over here. the school is better than my other school in many ways. i’ve learned more and the teachers keep you in checked about all the work and how to do things. the guidance counselors are a great help with keeping you on track and helping you further your education with going to college. the school is just great all around and the do everything differently but better than most school do.', "Central Jersey is a pretty big region, and rarely are there schools that are unique as South Brunswick High School. It can be quite difficult to make friends in South Brunswick High School, especially since everybody is very comfortable in their social groups. Yet, there's still a respect that people have for one another when it's reciprocated, even though there can still be some tension here and there. It's a respect that continues even when students get competitive with one another through exams or activities. The best part is that, not all students are extremely competitive. Though the school may not be the most racially diverse, it's definitely diverse ability-wise, which gives an opportunity for all students to work together at different levels and strive to be their very best. I'm grateful to be in South Brunswick High School, even if I may not be friends with everyone.", "South Brunswick Highschool is great in certain areas and not so great in others. It is a very diverse school with a lot of students and a two large buildings. The food is bad, there is the occasional thing that is good but overall not that great. The teachers are generally good, and the guidance counselors are there to help. But you always need to go up to them, don't expect them to contact you more than they need to. The building its self is maintained well, the is the occasional bathroom stall that won't have a door but nothing worse than that normally. Students are brought together not during pep rallies, but during fight week. There is always at least one week of the year where there is a fight every single day. But that's the most exciting thing to happen in this school, so everyone looks forward to it.", "The teachers and students are very welcoming. They also have good resources and it's a safe environment.", "I think that South Brunswick High School provides a great education. Though it is a public school, it helps students committed to their education grow into truly intelligent people. I think that there are definitely some faults in some teachers, but most I have crossed paths with were great. When talking about supervisors, vice principals, the principal, and other staff higher up, I think there is truly a disconnect. I don't think they are really aware of some of the issues there are with students and teachers. Not a whole lot of school spirit but we have some pretty good sports teams. There are lots of extracurricular activities and tons of challenging courses. Our classes can be overcrowded, sadly. There are too many students for our building and staff. The school counselors also have too many students. Overall, I am pleased with the education I have received at SBHS, but that is not to say it does not have its faults.", "Academics at SBHS is really good. The school provides a variety of classes that benefit to your needs. The only reason for why I gave it four stars is because of the pre-requisites. My friend couldn't get into AP English this year because her English grade last year was ONLY one point below the pre-requisite.  The counselor refused to let her take the class. Some teachers are chill and great at teaching. Some others are chill too but suck at teaching overall. Parents at SBHS are very involved at conferences lol. EVEN IF THEIR KID HAS A 95 IN A CLASS. LIKE HONESTY, THEY ASK THE TEACHERS HOW THEIR KID CAN GET A 100. GEEZ. They prepare us very well for college. I mean, the kids here are super competitive when it comes to grades. It's all anyone ever talks about. Food is okay from what I've seen.  Nothing really works at SBHS, like, the bathroom air driers have been broken for years and they never put in paper towels anymore.", 'I am a new student who, transferred from Maconaquah High School in Bunker Hill Indiana. As a student attending South Brunswick High School, it is very encouraging. As a team they present honesty, authentic, and persistent messages from adults that have credibility in their eyes. It is one of the best school I have ever attended, and any child that attend will have time well spent learning.']
column8: ['Very caring teachers. Safe school focused heavily on students. Great balance of sports, band, and academics. Highly diverse school that integrates programs such as Indian Dance and a Male Beauty Pageant. Great college prep and plenty of AP course offerings.', 'South Brunswick is a very diverse school. There is a lot of different cultures and the school celebrates that. We also have very good sports teams and lots of clubs for students. The faculty and teachers are very helpful but I did not feel fully prepared for college.', "South Brunswick High School has done an excellent job in preparing me for my future time in college.  It's safe to say that at least 90% of the teachers at SBHS are dedicated to teaching their students and making sure that they maintain positivity, integrity, and an overall very decent education (I have definitely had teachers that are not like this, although they didn't last long in our school).  Ultimately, it's easy to see why SBHS is one of the best public schools in NJ.", 'I am a student here at SBHS. If you are a parent planning to move to this town to enroll your child, there are a few things you might want to know. Sports, clubs, and activities after school are very good. Coaches work hard and are involved and there are many different clubs to choose from. The resources are great too. Getting help from your teachers is a good alternative to paying for a tutor. Although this school is pretty good, there are some problems. Violence between students online and in the hallways are a problem that seemed to skyrocket this year. The students here are very comfortable in their friend groups, making it hard to make friends. Vaping nicotine and marijuana in the school bathrooms is also an outrageous epidemic here at SBHS and needs to be handled. Overall, I feel about 60% safe walking in the hallway or walking in the bathroom, which is pretty low.', 'Overall, this high school has everything a student can ask for. From advanced courses to excellent teachers as well as a perfectly maintained campus, South Brunswick High School is definitely worth it.', 'The teachers at SBHS are very interactive with you, and want to help you become a better students, and prepare you for college', "The resources and opportunities that South Brunswick High School offers expand far beyond just education and extracurricular activities. Despite a lack of diversity because there is one group of people that is the majority in the area, the school is a safe, calm, and enjoyable environment. You can choose to do anything you like and you have free range to explore it how you'd like. It's a good school that I'd recommend for anyone.", "Great academic, athletic, extracurricular, and community opportunities but it's very divided between kids in honors (and above) classes and kids who aren't. Everyone's always either stressed or depressed or both but at least our football team's amazing, right?", 'My time at South Brunswick high school gave me the tools I needed to succeed in college. Coming to college I feel that I had an advantage over others academically. I knew information that others did not previously coming to college.', 'There are a lot of opportunities and courses to explore what you want to do. There are many clubs to participate in and activities to be a part of.', 'South Brunswick is filled with kind teachers that care about the education for their students. Although, there are issues regarding some students, South Brunswick teachers and facility are trained to handle with care. Also, SBHS is well known for their diversity. There are people that comes from all kinds of backgrounds which makes the environment so much better.', 'I had a great experience attending SBHS. I felt that it readily prepared me for college and beyond. Not only was I taught well academically, but I was also taught how to navigate through the real world—which is also very important. I never felt like I didn’t belong. The community was so inviting throughout my 4 years there and I definitely felt apart of the SBHS family. SBHS was such and integral part of my life and I continue to be proud of how the school has shaped me into the person I am today.', 'South Brunswick High School Has a staff that includes many approachable people whether the issue deals with academics or something else. Many teachers care about the success of their students, though it would be beneficial if some altered the way they teach students, either by providing better review for tests or including different activities during class. Sports coaches work hard to prepare their athletes for games, matches, and the like. Overall, South Brunswick High School has a good rating.', 'south brunswick high school is a really good school so far since i’ve transferred over here. the school is better than my other school in many ways. i’ve learned more and the teachers keep you in checked about all the work and how to do things. the guidance counselors are a great help with keeping you on track and helping you further your education with going to college. the school is just great all around and the do everything differently but better than most school do.', "Central Jersey is a pretty big region, and rarely are there schools that are unique as South Brunswick High School. It can be quite difficult to make friends in South Brunswick High School, especially since everybody is very comfortable in their social groups. Yet, there's still a respect that people have for one another when it's reciprocated, even though there can still be some tension here and there. It's a respect that continues even when students get competitive with one another through exams or activities. The best part is that, not all students are extremely competitive. Though the school may not be the most racially diverse, it's definitely diverse ability-wise, which gives an opportunity for all students to work together at different levels and strive to be their very best. I'm grateful to be in South Brunswick High School, even if I may not be friends with everyone.", "South Brunswick Highschool is great in certain areas and not so great in others. It is a very diverse school with a lot of students and a two large buildings. The food is bad, there is the occasional thing that is good but overall not that great. The teachers are generally good, and the guidance counselors are there to help. But you always need to go up to them, don't expect them to contact you more than they need to. The building its self is maintained well, the is the occasional bathroom stall that won't have a door but nothing worse than that normally. Students are brought together not during pep rallies, but during fight week. There is always at least one week of the year where there is a fight every single day. But that's the most exciting thing to happen in this school, so everyone looks forward to it.", "The teachers and students are very welcoming. They also have good resources and it's a safe environment.", "I think that South Brunswick High School provides a great education. Though it is a public school, it helps students committed to their education grow into truly intelligent people. I think that there are definitely some faults in some teachers, but most I have crossed paths with were great. When talking about supervisors, vice principals, the principal, and other staff higher up, I think there is truly a disconnect. I don't think they are really aware of some of the issues there are with students and teachers. Not a whole lot of school spirit but we have some pretty good sports teams. There are lots of extracurricular activities and tons of challenging courses. Our classes can be overcrowded, sadly. There are too many students for our building and staff. The school counselors also have too many students. Overall, I am pleased with the education I have received at SBHS, but that is not to say it does not have its faults.", "Academics at SBHS is really good. The school provides a variety of classes that benefit to your needs. The only reason for why I gave it four stars is because of the pre-requisites. It's all anyone ever talks about. Food is okay from what I've seen.  Nothing really works at SBHS, like, the bathroom air driers have been broken for years and they never put in paper towels anymore.", 'I am a new student who, transferred from Maconaquah High School in Bunker Hill Indiana. It is one of the best school I have ever attended, and any child that attend will have time well spent learning.']

column1: Queens High School for the Sciences at York College
column2: ['Academically challenging and an overall nice high school experience-- clubs, student government, sports, and community were all decent. Administration sucks now though.', 'This high school gave me four years of unforgettable education and college prep. Although small, it is mighty! The teachers are so passionate about their jobs and their students, and it shows in every lecture. Although the staff and administration has changed since I graduated, the heart of the school still stands in its students: the hardworking, the aspiring, and the dedicated.Four years at QHSSYC gave me such a huge step ahead when entering college - not only did the AP courses I took allow me to skip several classes, but the high-caliber content taught in my high school English and math classes allowed me to be more mentally prepared for college assignments and expectations.', "Queens High School for the Sciences at York College is a very small school making everyone very tight-knit. This allows for the students and faculty to get to know each other very well which creates a stronger bond between the two. The school has a good academic credentials and will push its students academically. However, there isn't a wide range of after-school clubs and sports because the school is so small.", 'Excellent school, both in teaching academics and atmosphere among the students. However, the same cannot be said about the facility that serves at the school. There is a limited range for types of classes available and the music department has limited funding.', 'Overall, I had a good experience throughout the four years I was at this school. The teachers and students provided a motivational and positive environment, encouraging me to work harder and learn more. The student body can often be competitive but also supportive.', 'The small school setting makes you feel loved and always supported, even in your hardest days. The overall atmosphere of the school is so splendid, I am blessed to have spent 4 years here. However, the administration is ironically lacking administrative skills and there is extremely poor communication between administration and the faculty/student body.', 'Currently, I am a senior at Queens High School for the Sciences at York College and I believe it is safe to say that this school has endured numerous changes regarding the staff, the courses, and the school environment. I hope to for QHSS to become a school that continues to care for and respect the students as well as the teachers.', 'Excellent school with great teachers. Although it is small but it helps the students to establish a more intimate social circle. However, the school could improve on adding more sports team and offer a variety of courses.', "The small population made it easier to become familiar with my classmates. This way, I was able to become comfortable with my surroundings faster. The administration is friendly and relatively easy to get along with. However, the small size of the actual building can be somewhat of a problem. This school might not be for you if you're looking for a school that's bigger than one floor and has more than 500 people in its total population.", 'This high school may be specialized but the only thing special about it are the students. The school is severely undersized, the choices for electives are poor, and the state of the building is decrepit. This school will not provide the nourishing and stimulating environment necessary for acedemically gifted students to prosper.', 'The school life was not bad except for the fact that we are situated on only one floor with access to two other rooms on another. The hallway tend to be very overcrowded whenever class ends.', 'Although the school is small, I can tell that many of the teachers care about their students, both academically and personally.', 'The school is pretty good. This school has incredible teachers and staff who work to bring a positive environment for all students! Its only drawback lies in the limited amount of sports and facilities. The school shares a building with the college and we are very small. However, all students are expected to work through the rigorous curriculum and can do so with the aid of York College facilities such as the library and computer center. The small school atmosphere provides students with lasting relations with the staff and each teacher and devote more time into each student helping the student become more ready for college.', "Although this school prepared me to become college-ready and knowledgeable, it took an insane amount of time and dedication that I wish I could take back. This school pushes students immensely academically which significantly disadvantages some students. There aren't enough sports teams and clubs to accommodate the interests of each student. This school is also underfunded.", "The smaller community size of the school allows for stronger interpersonal connections to be made. Students know almost everyone else in their grade and they have an easier chance to make connections with faculty members, proving to be valuable in letters of recommendation for college applications. Most of the teachers teach well and know their material well, but the limit on resources and classroom size/availability makes it difficult for students to be accommodated into certain courses. There are only a limited number of sports, clubs, and activities too, so a particular student might not find the type of extracurricular they want to participate in. Additionally, the new administration has proven to be extremely incompetent in their budget allocation and decisions.  Despite the lack of resources the school needs to fully educate students, the community is great and I don't regret coming here. The rigorous academics prepare you for college and ultimately serve you well later in life.", 'The little network in this school permits a closer association with instructors and tormenting turns out to be extremely extraordinary because of these conditions. Building up a closer association with instructors enables understudies to get more help at whatever point required. Also, the thorough courses that the school offers help the improvement of understudies and sets them up for the school life. One thing that could be enhanced in the school is number of projects and clubs accessible.', 'This School has taught me a lot. The teachers are amazing and cooperative. The academics is rigorous. One problem is the lack of clubs and after school activities available.', "The community is very close knot and all the teachers know what they're doing and how to convey the information they teach to individual students. However, the school is on the lower end in terms of funding so school trips and major events are pretty limited.", 'The teachers are excellent there, because of a small student body the teachers have time to know each of you better inorder to help you academically and in other aspects as well.', 'It is great academically, but lacks sports opportunities.  There are not as many students, so teachers are able to focus on the students better. The AP facilities are also good. The school is on a college campus, so students receive access to college facilities and can visit the college campus for lunch as well. However, there are very limited sports. Most students are not interested in the PSAL teams present so they do not want to participate in sports at all.']

column6: ['The remarkably small size of the school allows students to have a higher-quality education by enabling more one-on-one time between students and teachers. Issues are addressed in a swift manner, and every teacher cares for a student as if they were his or her own child. The principal also gives her concern for every member of the school and works hard every day to make QHSS a better place.', 'Great small school situated in the center of Jamaica. It has access to the nearby facilities of York College, including the library, performing arts center, and the gymnasium. The community is very tightly-knit and everyone knows one another. Teachers are very receptive to suggestions, although the administration is a bit lacking.', 'The teachers and administration contribute greatly towards individual growth given the small size of the school. Though there is a notable lack in diversity, the students there are very open and accept those of different ethnicity and culture with open arms. There is a great deal towards college preparation and a good variety of clubs and activities to devote yourself to in this school.', 'Small student body, but the space is very limited. AP classes are limited and spots are competitive. Teachers get to know students and there is a lot of support offered to students. Current administration lacks organization and communication skills.', 'I had a great High School experience here. The classes are usually small and the community is  close knit. The resources both through teachers and York College were invaluable and the school is very good at preparing students for college.', 'The small community in this school allows a closer relationship with teachers and bullying becomes very uncommon due to these circumstances. Developing a closer relationship with teachers allows students to get more help whenever needed. In addition, the rigorous courses that the school offers aid the development of students and prepares them for the college life. One thing that could be improved in the school is number of programs and clubs available. The small population of the school limits the options of courses the school could offer to students. Overall Queens high school for the sciences at York college is a great school in a friendly environment.', "Great school. Developing school. The name says sciences and that is a big chunk of what kind of kids (most of) the students are: inquisitive, insightful, multifaceted, and driving. By driving, I mean that the students aren't just driven towards their goals, they constantly analyze their goals to find the best way to optimize their path to success. The school culture is structured so that we learn and develop into thinkers who solve problems rather than hide or avoid them, and figure out how to prevent them in the first place.", "The new principal does not seem to have student's interest in mind, but rather cares more about her reputation. The teachers, on the other hand, are amazing they give so much to make sure their students are happy and prepared for the future.", 'I love how attentive the teachers are. They work hard to give the students a quality education, as well as prepare them for college level standards.', "It's great for kids who thrive in a small school environment. The faculty and staff are extremely supportive but the school lacks resources. You get an amazing education that is challenging and prepares you for college. Since it's very small you tend to know everyone with has its ups and downs, but overall you'll get into a top university from this school.", 'This school has incredible teachers and staff who work to bring a positive environment for all students! Its only drawback lies in the limited amount of sports and extracurricular activities. However, all students are expected to work through the rigorous curriculum and can do so with the aid of York College facilities such as the library and computer center. The small school atmosphere provides students with the attention they need to succeed!', "It is a very small school. Because of this, your options are limited. There are few clubs/sport and limited ap classes. In addition, if you dislike a teacher, you probably can't do anything about it. It is extremely competitive, but with such a small class, it is easy to know everyone.", 'An amazing small school where everyone knows and learns from each other.  With amazing connections and teachers, a student can have a community that will remain a special part of their lives.', 'QHSS is a specialized High School and needs more funding and more space for the school. The one floor that we have creates a small and friendly space for the students, but I think more funding can go a long way.', 'It is an excellent high school that prepares you well for college! The teachers are all friendly. The students become family because of the small class-size and amicable environment.', "Super great school and amazing teachers. It's just that the opportunities and resources are kinda limited due to the small size of the school and little funding.", 'QHSS has amazing teachers, who legitimately care about you and your grades. The dean (who also teaches Global History and AP World) is extraordinarily kind, and the guidance counselors are always willing to help. If there is one downside to this school, it has to be the lack of extracurricular activities (i.e. sports teams). There is no basketball team, no track team, and no volleyball team, and I highly doubt there would be one in the next couple years (because how York College has a vendetta against our school).', "It was definitely an enjoyable 4 years at this school. Everybody is welcoming here and it's easy to find your niche here.", 'Some of the classes are very interesting. The faculty does their best in compensating for the lack of locker rooms and space.', 'This school has excellent teachers, but needs more funding for student activities, facilities, and equipment.']

Additionally, the new administration has proven to be extremely incompetent in their budget allocation and decisions.  Despite the lack of resources the school needs to fully educate students, the community is great and I don't regret coming here. The rigorous academics prepare you for college and ultimately serve you well later in life.", 'The little network in this school permits a closer association with instructors and tormenting turns out to be extremely extraordinary because of these conditions. Building up a closer association with instructors enables understudies to get more help at whatever point required. Also, the thorough courses that the school offers help the improvement of understudies and sets them up for the school life. One thing that could be enhanced in the school is number of projects and clubs accessible.', 'This School has taught me a lot. The teachers are amazing and cooperative. The academics is rigorous. One problem is the lack of clubs and after school activities available.', "The community is very close knot and all the teachers know what they're doing and how to convey the information they teach to individual students. However, the school is on the lower end in terms of funding so school trips and major events are pretty limited.", 'The teachers are excellent there, because of a small student body the teachers have time to know each of you better inorder to help you academically and in other aspects as well.', 'It is great academically, but lacks sports opportunities.  There are not as many students, so teachers are able to focus on the students better. The AP facilities are also good. The school is on a college campus, so students receive access to college facilities and can visit the college campus for lunch as well. However, there are very limited sports. Most students are not interested in the PSAL teams present so they do not want to participate in sports at all.']

column2: ['this is school is pretty good so far. i just moved here so i’m still adjusting, but it’s nice. the food is good, but there arent any healthy options. some of the teachers suck, and some are really good. overall the classes really push you to do well.', "Mountain Lakes High School has pushed me to work harder and has helped me discover a passion in STEM. Their teachers are friendly, but quite a number of them also push their students to go beyond their limits. A good experience that I'm sure will stay with me for the rest of my life.", 'I liked how Mountain Lakes High School provided me with faculty who taught me important life lessons and helped me mature as an individual prior to college. I would like to see future students coming in and out with positive aspirations involving their life and the school environment to be more focused on academic excellence.', 'The environment for learning is ideal. Parents push their children to work hard, and while that creates a slightly competitive environment, I felt it was the right balance. Everyone understands the importance of academics, and college feels like an expected and easy route to go from high school. I would say the teachers are not as good as they could be, other than some amazing ones. There is not enough creativity within the classroom because each student and each teacher feels the pressure of working toward one goal: a number, score or grade. If you work with a teacher one-on-one after class, this is remedied. However, I wish teachers took a little more initiative instead of focusing so directly on the textbook and curriculum.', 'Mountain Lakes High School offers an amazing academic environment that fosters collaboration, persistence, and success. Most teachers help bring out the best in their students.', 'Overall, I had a great experience in high school and thought that the academics prepared me well for college. One thing that I would change however is the involvement in extracurriculars other than sports. There is a big emphasis on sports and not as much as the clubs that there are volunteer efforts', 'The small size of the high school, the community of care that exists in this town, and the opportunity for students of all abilities to take part in sports, drama, and club activities is excellent. Not only superstars get to participate, as in larger towns, in Mountain Lakes there is room for all to learn and grow.', 'I really like the school. It is very good if you want to challenge yourself and/or your kid to excel. It has very little diversity, but it makes up for it due to the fact that it is also a magnet school for the deaf. There is a huge focus on sports in the school, but on the other hand there is very little support for fine arts.', 'Mountain Lakes prides itself on preparing students for college and the future.  They have good technological resources, a good teaching staff, and caring professionals in all aspects of high school ready to help in any way possible.', 'The school is accommodating to supplementing an education.  The school offers a optional Summer Academy to keep students learning over the summer or for some to get ahead.  It is an excellent option.', 'Not diverse and very focused on sports.  Math department is very weak. Rich and white population.  If you are not in the top of the class or the top of your sport the school forgets about you and you get left behind.  It is all about the top 10%', 'Huge emphasis on sports but poor coaching.  Great importance placed on taking AP and honors classes, however quality of teaching is inadequate.  Almost all students end up hiring tutors as teachers are ineffective.  Guidance counsellors tend to direct students to the same "favored" colleges without trying to figure out if they are a good fit.  Many families hire tutors for sat and act prep as well as assistance with college selection and application process.', "There's good and bad teachers and then there's the one that try but not enough to actually do anything and actually teach. The good teachers are GREAT , for example mr. davies , his english class is insanely great and instructive, bad teachers don't care and you basically just have to sign up if even that", "It's just white people, there's 3 black people in the whole school and like 3 latinx people , all christian anti-gay marriage, anti-abortion, it's insane", "Most have no budget and the supervisors don't REALLY care and end up meeting twice a year at most", "It's not great but it's mostly safe, no one will beat you up and no one will like harass you in a physical way , but people can get nasty as hell with rumors and comments and no one minds their business since it's such a small school. You have to push yourself I'm most classes because a lot of the teachers won't do that for you , but the ones who do REALLY push you and it can be extremely nerve-wrecking", "Honestly it's not bad but you have to know which teachers to avoid, for example, Mr. Wallace (unless you're into chemistry, he's hardcore), and which teachers will actually put in the effort to help you get better(mrs. gillespie).", 'Students are involved with clubs and organizations, they never get bored of it.', "Parents are their children's favorites and support every minute of it.", 'The teachers and staffs at my high school for the last 4 years were what every students needed and looked for.']

column6: ['Parents here are all the sterotypical "Tiger Mom," regardless of their actual race. Everyone is held to an incredible standard.', 'Some are great, others not so much. The quality of teachers in this school is highly variable.', 'Choir and field hockey and Big Brothers Big Sisters are my tops.', "The Principal goes out of his way to ensure every student's well being.", 'The majority of the teachers are top notch', 'Generally, the teachers are passionate about what they teach. Without a doubt, the highest quality teachers are those who teach the Honors and AP classes. There are several teachers who are unsupportive, bias, and offer little assistance outside of the classroom, but they are few and far between.', 'We have been lucky in our school district. It is in a small town. Once in a while we hear about bullying but not often. Mostly everyone is helpful and tolerant of others.', 'I really like most of the faculty and teachers. They are respected by the students and you can talk to them if you have any problems.', 'I feel we have wonderful teachers at our school and our school is ranked very highly.', 'Our school is very big on athletics and sports. There are also clubs for everyone. The drama in the fall and musical in spring are great to be a part of. You have to really commit and be present for all of these activities. Then there are the activities which only meet once in a while like the photography club.', 'Way to much focus on sports and favoritism is shown in musicals and dramas.', 'MLHS provides numerous extracurricular and academic opportunities for motivated students. Most of the faculty is excellent and the courses prepare you for college well. However, students are rather clique-y.', 'For some kids and parents this school is the highlight of your lives especially if you are an academic, athletic, artistic or performing star. I was in sports and that was just great. I have many great friends and will always be glad that I went there. It is a unique small public school with very supportive parents and teachers overall. \r But the school does a poor job of working with those who learn differently, focusing on inclusion overall  especially for those who are not academic stars. The school acts like everyone is going to Ivy League Schools which is far from true....look at the data!\r Academic support is there but you have to fight for it. \r More focus should be on true college prep - key college skills, resilience, working in group projects, courses on latest software, presentations, writing/research skills. \r The academic and college advising is TERRIBLE and you have to fend for yourself. \r Might be good if these advisors actually visited a college or two or kept up on Naviance and truly how to best utilize this. \r School keeps no statistics on post high school success - only focus on where everyone went at graduation. What is transfer, actual graduation rate? Feedback process to school to improve overall process.', "The diversity is great, but the education isn't.", 'Like a really rich desert, this school is really great when you first get to know it. They give students lots of freedom and free wifi, kids can roam around on free periods or play mario kart on our game console in the senior lounge. However, as the years go on, I notice that MLHS lacks substance. More than 90% of the student body participates in at least one sport, this means there is relatively little time for academic clubs or non-sport related activities. Things like debate club, FBLA, or our school newspaper are basically nonexistent because there is almost no participation (everyone is at afterschool sports). I wish that our student body was larger and more diverse, in both their interests and their ethnicities.', 'This school offers an abundance of different opportunities for students to get involved in. This town is known for its sports, which is a very popular after-school activity that students take advantage of. The level of competitiveness is extremely high, but in turn many students graduate with offers to play at the collegiate level. This school also offers clubs. One in particular that is extremely popular is Key Club. This club gives students the opportunity to give back to the community by hosting different fundraising events and volunteering at local shelters and soup kitchens.', 'I believe that, socially, this school did not prepare me for college after graduation and "real world" situations. This town lacks diversity and therefore does not give students experience with different cultures and ethnicities. My college experience has definitely prepared me for the real world, working with so many different kinds of people in each and every one of my courses. Academically, though, I believe this school definitely prepared me. It is an extremely competitive atmosphere that shows student the importance of striving for excellence. I also have made great connections with those who are extremely successful in my field of interest. By attending this school, I was able to meet these successful people, one in particular, who is responsible for my excellent internship position I currently hold.', 'After school programs are abundant and fun.', "Students at Mountain Lakes are extremely athletic and hard working. This can be measured by the success of the school's teams, which is even more impressive considering the size of the school. Resultantly, support from the community, parents, and fellow students is very high.", 'The administration is great. They are good at coordinating, accommodating and deal with issues well. School policies are generally very casual and permissive.']

column2: ["I wat to say plainly that this school has given everyone I know mental health problems. The stress that is placed on students at this school is astronomical and the amount of times I hear students say that the school has made them suicidal everyday should be concerning to an teaching working at the school. However, this administrations has put bandaids on a glaring issue. They took away F's and replaced the with E's and have classes like freshmen focus that are supposed to help our transition.  These things do nothing and do not do anything to change the fact that students have too much pressure put on them.", "This is a competitive school, especially in the higher level classes, and people do obsess over grades more than the average high school student. However, if you find the right group of people to associate with, you will really enjoy it here. Of course, there are a lot of students from richer spheres, and some of them are really unpleasant, but there are genuinely kind and thoughtful people here. I'd say about 90% of teachers are excellent and really know what they're talking about, but there are always a few that are... Less than ideal. There are over 100 clubs that you can join, so there's a place for everyone.", 'Students are allowed to have free periods, which are incredibly useful to finish work, get food, talk to teachers or practice for an activity. Students are nice to each other as are teachers. There are many opportunities for students. There is not a full auditorium or performing art center, making meetings for the entire student body or performances for the performing arts difficult to coordinate such things.', 'Going into senior year, I am applying to colleges. I feel ready for the change. I feel that Ridgewood has given me the opportunity to build independence and responsibility. I feel that I have learned more than I could possibly imagine in the last 3 years, and I hope to learn more this year.', 'Offered intellectually stimulating courses as well as specialized programs for students with special interests (e.g. healthcare/medicine).', 'Ridgewood High School was very good in college preparation. With rigorous academia and tons of clubs and activities, it gives you a glimpse of what college may be like; you must learn to balance friends, school, extra-curricular activities, family, and self. Personally, I always felt like the school and the school culture lacked diversity and acceptance of differences. That being said, it is difficult for those who are outside of what is considered the social-norm to find their niche at school. However, with the many students and friendly teachers, I am aware that many adjust and get through the four years learning lots of lessons both in and outside of the classrooms.', 'The best thing about Ridgewood High School is the liberty and academic freedom students are given in any given class. Whether the setting is a math class or history class, the teachers understand that a rigid learning structure will not suffice, and therefore allow students to engage in the topic at hand by themselves with the supportive guidance the teachers provide.', "I'm a current sophomore attending Ridgewood High School. I like the school overall, but I would say that the community is not very diverse. All of the popular girls are white and they seemed to have more power at school. However, the school does provide various opportunities for everyone and I enjoy attending my high school.", 'Ridgewood high school provided me with the opportunity to explore my interests. Since I am interested in a premedical track I was able to participate in the RAHP internship program at my high school. Most of the teachers were wonderful at Ridgewood. I was also able to participate in sports for 3 years while in high school and the coaches were just as great. I wouldn’t have changed anything about my experience in high school.', 'They allow disruptive, destructive and unfaithful behavior due to their over inflated egos and vanity. This is a place that is living in the past and failing to measure up to what is promised in so many ways - intentionally. They excel at segregating, demeaning and belittling students in order to make them understand they are not worthy. The simple things that you teach your child, truth, faith, honesty, courtesy are rejected and discouraged. Run.', 'No diversity. There are some friendly people but overall, people are kind of “cliquey”.Students are not very helpful and outgoing. Administration is okay but you can sense the unfriendliness.', 'Ridgewood High School has academically prepared me for college and, in my experience, provided me with many opportunities that I would not have been granted otherwise that I am largely grateful for. Despite this, I believe the school pays very little attention to the actual wellbeing of its students, as most students struggle with their mental health, academic competitiveness, etc. This school has proved to me that they feel very little concern for my mental health, and because of this I have suffered.', 'The academic program at Ridgewood High School has been praised for years, and although it is very rigorous, there are many faults. Students are not told exactly what they should expect in their classes. If you get placed in a certain class freshman year, it is likely you will be stuck on that path for the next 4 years. For example, freshman year I was placed in biophysical science instead of Biology, which was what almost everyone else in my grade was taking. I was not told anything about the class, so I assumed it was the same as Biology, just maybe a different level. This set me on a path where I was one year behind in science for the rest of my high school experience. I was not able to take certain classes that others took because of this and it greatly affected my time here, negatively.', 'Ridgewood High School is a very supportive and innovative school. It allows students to reach their maximum academic and social potential by providing opportunities. The college prep process is very well established as well.', 'Imagine the rich, white mean girl in a high school movie. If you multiply that to equal a whole high school population, you get Ridgewood High School. The academics is just bad, the arts program is underrated; while the sports program is overrated. Every minute of every day there is at least one person in one of the bathrooms vaping or smoking weed. There is a bathroom the students call “the vaping bathroom.” There is no diversity in the school. The parents are mean and rude. They want their child to be ahead of the other students and betray their friends. I am a sophomore this year and it has been horrible. I’ve been stressed, having all nighters, studying until I can’t process anymore information and forget to do normal things such as eating and socializing with others. If you live in Ridgewood, save your child, DO NOT send them here.', 'Ridgewood High School is very strong in many areas, especially academics and sports. There is also a wide variety of clubs and sports to join, which makes it easy to get involved. However, I would like to have seen more diversity in the student body.', 'RHS is a very inclusive, successful school that incorporates its four fundamental principles into one comfortable atmosphere: academics, arts, athletics, and activities. The faculty provides a safe and cooperative learning space for their students, and I personally have gained so much from them. I have discovered new subjects I am interested in, but I also have discovered subjects that may not interest me as much. This is crucial to guiding me to the most comfortable path towards choosing colleges, and I believe RHS is the perfect school in prepping me for this long journey ahead. I do believe RHS can incorporate more opportunities for students to get to know each other, such as a homecoming dance, junior prom, or formals. I believe these would provide such an excellent opportunity for students of all grades to get to know each other and have fun. Including these activities will surely let students feel comfortable in the classrooms with their peers.', 'Academically it is a great school, however to be one it obviously is rigorous;  the pressured atmosphere  from drained student and large workloads often makes tensions run high', "It's a posh school, full of rich white students and students who only live in Ridgewood for 4 years for the school. When I was in school, the science department was terrible. The physics teacher never taught and expressed his temper time and time again. The biology teacher just gave busy work and reviewed nothing about the AP exam she was preparing us for. Chemistry was so boring as we just studied from a book. The math department was amazing. It was challenging but the teachers really cared about our education.", "I loved my four years at RHS! The only downside is that the STEM department SUCKS. You'll get one good math or science teacher and then get horrible teachers for your next three years and be stuck with mediocre grades. Teachers always say to come to period 9 (extra help) but it really doesn't do much in terms of improving your grade. Also I could see how it may be hard for a new student to find their way in the beginning, (since most kids have known each other since kindergarten) but getting involved in sports and clubs can definitely make it easier to find friends. I'm very sad to be leaving in a few weeks!"]

This is a place that is living in the past and failing to measure up to what is promised in so many ways - intentionally. They excel at segregating, demeaning and belittling students in order to make them understand they are not worthy. The simple things that you teach your child, truth, faith, honesty, courtesy are rejected and discouraged. Run.', 'No diversity. There are some friendly people but overall, people are kind of “cliquey”.Students are not very helpful and outgoing. Administration is okay but you can sense the unfriendliness.', 'Ridgewood High School has academically prepared me for college and, in my experience, provided me with many opportunities that I would not have been granted otherwise that I am largely grateful for. Despite this, I believe the school pays very little attention to the actual wellbeing of its students, as most students struggle with their mental health, academic competitiveness, etc. This school has proved to me that they feel very little concern for my mental health, and because of this I have suffered.', 'The academic program at Ridgewood High School has been praised for years, and although it is very rigorous, there are many faults. Students are not told exactly what they should expect in their classes. If you get placed in a certain class freshman year, it is likely you will be stuck on that path for the next 4 years. For example, freshman year I was placed in biophysical science instead of Biology, which was what almost everyone else in my grade was taking. I was not told anything about the class, so I assumed it was the same as Biology, just maybe a different level. This set me on a path where I was one year behind in science for the rest of my high school experience. I was not able to take certain classes that others took because of this and it greatly affected my time here, negatively.', 'Ridgewood High School is a very supportive and innovative school. It allows students to reach their maximum academic and social potential by providing opportunities. The college prep process is very well established as well.', 'Imagine the rich, white mean girl in a high school movie. If you multiply that to equal a whole high school population, you get Ridgewood High School. The academics is just bad, the arts program is underrated; while the sports program is overrated. Every minute of every day there is at least one person in one of the bathrooms vaping or smoking weed. There is a bathroom the students call “the vaping bathroom.” There is no diversity in the school. The parents are mean and rude. They want their child to be ahead of the other students and betray their friends. I am a sophomore this year and it has been horrible. I’ve been stressed, having all nighters, studying until I can’t process anymore information and forget to do normal things such as eating and socializing with others. If you live in Ridgewood, save your child, DO NOT send them here.', 'Ridgewood High School is very strong in many areas, especially academics and sports. There is also a wide variety of clubs and sports to join, which makes it easy to get involved. However, I would like to have seen more diversity in the student body.', 'RHS is a very inclusive, successful school that incorporates its four fundamental principles into one comfortable atmosphere: academics, arts, athletics, and activities. The faculty provides a safe and cooperative learning space for their students, and I personally have gained so much from them. I have discovered new subjects I am interested in, but I also have discovered subjects that may not interest me as much. This is crucial to guiding me to the most comfortable path towards choosing colleges, and I believe RHS is the perfect school in prepping me for this long journey ahead. I do believe RHS can incorporate more opportunities for students to get to know each other, such as a homecoming dance, junior prom, or formals. I believe these would provide such an excellent opportunity for students of all grades to get to know each other and have fun. Including these activities will surely let students feel comfortable in the classrooms with their peers.', 'Academically it is a great school, however to be one it obviously is rigorous;  the pressured atmosphere  from drained student and large workloads often makes tensions run high', "It's a posh school, full of rich white students and students who only live in Ridgewood for 4 years for the school. When I was in school, the science department was terrible. The physics teacher never taught and expressed his temper time and time again. The biology teacher just gave busy work and reviewed nothing about the AP exam she was preparing us for. Chemistry was so boring as we just studied from a book. The math department was amazing. It was challenging but the teachers really cared about our education.", "I loved my four years at RHS! The only downside is that the STEM department SUCKS. You'll get one good math or science teacher and then get horrible teachers for your next three years and be stuck with mediocre grades. Teachers always say to come to period 9 (extra help) but it really doesn't do much in terms of improving your grade. Also I could see how it may be hard for a new student to find their way in the beginning, (since most kids have known each other since kindergarten) but getting involved in sports and clubs can definitely make it easier to find friends. I'm very sad to be leaving in a few weeks!"]
column6: ['Ridgewood High School despite being being a competitive environment does a great job at making sure you are prepared for college. They do their absolute best to help in the college application process and offer a lot of resources in order to make the process as easy as possible.', "I attended this school in my senior year. School is located in 7 minutes far by walk from the town that is one of the biggest advantages of the school because if your teacher is absent or your class is canceled you are allow to leave the campus. Also teachers are extremely nice and helpful. It was my first year in the US and I had a really tough year but they all helped me to improve myself. School building looks really cool from the outside. Its bigger than almost all other high schools in neighborhood. Has tennis, lacrosse, football, basketball and many other fields. Only disadvantage I could say is people aren't very open for new people. They all grew up together since kindergarten so almost everyone know each other and they are not very welcoming for the new ones.", "I was born and raised in Ridgewood, New Jersey. I loved my community and friends I have lived with throughout my 18 years here. Ridgewood High School is an amazing school with fun, loving and exciting students determined to learn. I have made my best friends throughout my four years at RHS and wouldn't trade for the world. It is going to be a bittersweet feeling once I graduate in two months, but I know that I was prepared and ready for my college career.", 'Ridgewood High School  provides great education with amazing faculty members. Although it lacks in diversity, it is a safe community with well educated students.', 'Academics are great! The people are terrible and no one is particularly nice, but the facility, the clubs, the teachers, and the education are totally worth the fact that the school is made up of rich snobs.', 'Great experience--caring teachers, boundless opportunity to jump start a successful education and career', 'Horrible. Pay for private school. The people lie to keep property values in line with the high school. The biggest mistake in my life. Administrators do not care and athletes get into top schools over intellectuals or how much you ,"support" the school.They blame a child with a learning disability even when both parents beg the administration and hire their teachers as tutors twice a week since kindergarten for 200. 00 per week.Drugs are sold openly om campus.', 'It is a great school for everyone. They offer all kind of classes and teachers are very nice. There is different kinds of opportunities for everyone with different interests.', 'My experience with Ridgewood High School has been fairly positive. There are plenty  of resources that are available to the students. The school is constantly improving. It has the most expansive extra circular programs. The guidance department is constantly looking to help students well-being. There are truly ample opportunities that students have if they chose to take them.', 'Teachers at RHS prepare you well for college, although its physics department is definitely a weak spot.', 'So you could either be lucky, or... not so lucky. Some teachers are absolutely perfect for the job, whIle others teach absolutely nothing.', "Overall good school. It's a great school for college readiness. There are many resources for students. Students are able to achieve their goals and exceed. My only complaint would be the food. The cafeteria food is just like any other frozen school food also with the same pizza.", 'Ridgewood High School has an extremely challenging academic curriculum, but gives you excellent preparation for college. Teachers are (generally) helpful and accommodating, but have exceptionally high expectations for students.', "I really enjoyed Ridgewood High School because the teachers not only taught the material, but I learned many life lessons as well. Many high school students tend to get all fussed over their GPA and ACT/SAT scores, which is fair, but what's more important to take away from high school is to work hard and make connections. At Ridgewood High School this was the philosophy, and the teachers and academic plan did a very good job of standing behind it.", 'Ridgewood High School is a very ordinary high school with very ordinary kids. It\'s motto is that the school has a "Tradition of Excellence". Do not get me wrong, I had a lot of fun and made a lot of friends that I will have with me for the rest of my life. But it wasn\'t until I moved to California after graduation where I noticed how other high school kids act. It made me realize that although Ridgewood has excellent academics and opportunities, it is really up to the individual to make something out of their experience in RHS. Ultimately, it made me realize how much of a bubble Ridgewood is and how little people seem to care of what\'s happening in the world outside of the high school hallways.', "It was my first year at RHS and it was a pleasant experience. First month of school gave me so many opportunities to join clubs, sports, and just to get to know teachers and other students. All the clubs and activities at RHS involve all grades, so I got to know many upperclassmen, which helped me out a lot throughout the year. Other students are always ready to help you, especially the upperclassmen, they give advice so we can have an easier year. Our teachers teach and follow the curriculum. You become friendly with one or two teachers and that's great. I was in two sports this year and it's a experience everyone should take. You get to know kids in your grade and maybe even above a lot better and you become a family you can rely on. Overall great school.", "there are many clubs so anybody can feel like they are accepted. Some teachers don't seem like they care about teaching and seem like they have their favorites. Some also don't really listen to the students' opinions.", 'Ridgewood high school has great academics and clubs, and it is good at preparing kids for college. However, there is little to no diversity and the students tend to be spoiled and wealthy.', "Maybe a couple of the teachers can't be called the best at what they do, but personally, all of mine were great. All of them were eager to help me, and they all felt very genuine. Nothing in the school felt old or worn out. There's plenty of tech to help you out, and it's all kept up to date.", "Ridgewood High School offers many resources for students to learn in the best environment possible. I enjoy studying in the Learning Commons because it allows me to concentrate, and the librarians are always eager and willing to answer any questions I have. The use of Chromebooks has helped significantly with our academic experience, and makes research and turning in assignments much easier. I think that the school's auditorium could use more space for shows and productions. Overall, it is clear that the teachers care about their students. Throughout my four years here, Ridgewood High School has allowed me to have the best education possible."]

column2: ["Fantastic high school. It has a great array of classes, teams, teachers, and people to spend your four years with. I've met some close friends and I've been inspired to do fantastic things here due to the staff. I wish they had more vegetarian option for lunch though and it's not very diverse.", 'I liked Greenwich High School because of the variety of resources for help with academics, and at this time, college preparation.', "I'm very grateful for the opportunities I've had at Greenwich High School. I've been able to pursue academic fields and interests I wouldn't be able to in many other districts. My only issue is the environment of the school, but I imagine it's similar in any high school.", 'Greenwich High School has an amazing education program. Students are always successful as long as they put in the work. The counselors at GHS set up all of their students up for success. During the college application season, counselors put their students first as they hope to see them succeed in life. GHS is also excellent with student involvement. There are many clubs, sports  teams, and extracurricular activities that all students can join. Students are able to feel comfortable and welcomed into this friendly community because of this. Overall, Greenwich High School is great, all-around whether it comes to education or activities.', 'The academics are good I am taking all ap or honors classes and it is good. Some of the problems are there are a lot of drugs and other bad things all over.', 'My experience attending Greenwich High were positive, I made life-long friends, network connections that I will continue to use for the rest of my life.', 'i moved to greenwich highschool when i was a junior the education was good and the people there are welcoming the only bad thing was my guidance counselor she didnt help me apply to any college', "Its a big School and may be a good fit for people that don't mind big schools. However, if you don't like big schools, it may be uncomfortable or/and not a good fit.", 'Greenwich High School presents a lot of opportunities to their students that are not necessarily available at other public schools. However, with these opportunities comes a very competitive environment that fosters unhealthy levels of stress put on kids.', 'Greenwich High School has a lot of resources and provides support for all types of students ranging from college-track to vocational to special education and gifted.  The school is large (3,000 students), but manages to employ enough guidance counselors, social workers, psychologists and other mental health support staff so that students have a personal connection with at least one adult other than their teachers.  The school has both a strong music and arts program that includes chorus, band, orchestra, drama, theater, painting, dance, photography, etc.  Also, students are encouraged to pursue scientific, technological, or mathematical interests.  There are many, many opportunities to play a variety of sports at various levels (intramural, junior varsity or varsity) The school is very diverse and celebrates difference.  Greenwich High School is very much like a small college.  It has a rigorous curriculum and students learn to balance their studies with their other commitments.', "Greenwich High school is almost close to being a college campus. It has many students that attend the school, about 3,000. Going to GHS and seeing everything they have to offer makes me feel very proud as a student and a person. There are so many resources there that can help you improve academically, socially, and even physically. Although 3,000 students in one high school seem outrageous it isn't as bad as it sounds. Once you meet one or two people there is almost a snowball effect and all of a sudden you are bouncing around many different friend groups.", 'I have really enjoyed my time at Greenwich High School.  I have enjoyed the wide variety of classes to choose from and being able to create a diverse schedule that fits my preferences.  I have also really enjoyed the teachers here; the relationships I have been able to build with my teachers through one  on one help and also normal class time has really helped me develop as a student.  Taking part in the athletics at this school, both as a player and a fan, have also been a great experience for me.  Again, the relationships I have been with teammates and coaches have been integral parts to my high school experience.    The only knock I have against Greenwich High School is the lack of emphasis from the administration put on updating the facilities in the main school, such as classrooms and bathrooms.', 'GHS was a good school.  The teachers were in my experience dedicated and helpful.  Having said that, I do not feel that in my experience, they were encouraging enough of college/post-graduation planning.  I felt like my choice to continue my education could have been encouraged more.  Having said that, a teacher/guidance counselor cannot be expected to put in more effort than a student is willing to put forth.', "Greenwich High School was a great place for students who sought out their own experiences and leadership positions. The school's advanced classes are taught very well but there is a large difference between each class depending on the teacher which caused for very different grading.", 'Greenwich High  School has many great and enthusiastic teachers. It also has a ton of opportunities for students, sports-wise, academically, and extra-curricularly. Although the building, cafeteria food, and diversity are nothing special, the resources & BUDGET speak for themselves.', 'GHS has a 148 page course guide with academic course you would see at a small college. The array of courses are deep, enriching, and rigorous. Even the variety of activities for students is endless with varsity sports, intramural leagues, and clubs. But the school is busting out of its seams as the only public high school in a town of approximately 63,000 people. The infrastructure is deteriorating along with the fields which have been deemed toxic by the EPA. The Board of Education gave students Chromebooks to enhance the learning experience, however the network infrastructure is week and null that using a device for learning is frustrating; not the supportive tool one hoped for.  In fact, since there are no usable lockers the devices have become 6-lb burdens on backs and shoulders throughout the school day. My wish would be for an individual or organization (wealthy alumni) to give back to the community and invest in GHS, to pay it forward.', 'Greenwich High School is a remarkable school that offers an extensive list of electives and clubs. Teachers and staff are expected to be understanding and caring towards students. Most have a passion for their work and help students in every way they can. There are great counselors and psychologists. Because the school is relatively large, it is easy to find, meet and connect with people who share interests.', "It's a very caring and safe environment. The school however does lack sports opportunities in squash.", 'Excellent Academics.Excellent Teachers.Excellent Clubs & Activities Average School CultureExcellent SportsExcellent ResourcesPoor DiversityExcellent College ReadinessExcellent SafetyExcellent AdministrationExcellent FoodExcellent Facilities', 'The academics are very good. If you go to GHS you will be very prepared for college, and the students usually do great on their AP tests. The environment is a little too stressful/competitive and there is a ton of pressure to take a lot of AP classes- almost like a competition to see who can take the most. I feel that the teachers are either really good or really bad. And there are a lot of resources available to help you succeed. However, I t’s also not the most diverse school, but Greenwich is not really a diverse town. A lot of kids are really preppy, but not everyone is if you find the right kids. However, it is a really big school which can seem daunting at first, but you get used to it. It’s kind of nice to have 800 kids in your grade, as opposed to a private school with like 50 kids, but it’s still just as “clique-y” as other high schools. Sports are really big and Greenwich high has great coaches, teams, and facilities, for the most part.']
