column6: ['It is a very diverse school with amazing programs as well as opportunities! Although it is a public school, in my option it is equivalent to a private school.', "If you are planning to send your child to Greenwich High school, you must be an involved parent. I cannot stress this enough. The guidance department and most teachers do not care and your child will pay the price. Speak up as a parent and don't be afraid to push your child to be a advocate for themselves. Chris Winters is much more interested in how many kids take AP exams than how much your child is actually learning.", 'Greenwich High was one of the best schools academically in Connecticut.  It also prepared me extremely well for college.  The sports program was also phenomenal and one of the best in the state.  The student body was extremely friendly and very connected and close.  The size allowed for an easy transition to college, but at the same time felt like a small community because of the connectedness of the school as a whole.', 'Greenwich High School is a very large school with a tremendous amount to offer.  It is not the best school for students who excel in a small intimate setting (ie. my son) but is incredible for those who flourish in a large setting (my daughters).  The students who choose to get involved have so many options, my kids were very well prepared for college.', "Greenwich High School is a great school filled with many resources and an abundance of classes. This ensures that its student's challenge themselves and learn which not only prepares its students greatly for college, but allows them to become well-rounded people.", "I really liked the atmosphere of the school. The students are all welcoming and care about their grades. However, the teachers do not really. The school staff is so isolated that students do not know most of the staff there and therefore can't access resources easily. Many other teachers do not really do their jobs and teach properly while just trying to keep the kids entertained.", 'I’m a Senior at the high school and had a good 4 years at the high school .  It is pretty diverse, the teachers were good. My guidance counselor was good and I did well in school.', 'Wonderful academics and teachers yet the school is plagued by hopeless administration:-The student center is full of trash because no one will punish people who weren\'t raised right and leave trash everywhere. Seriously, it looks like someone tipped over trash cans. - Suspending students who were protesting because they refused to go to class and "talked back". People cut every day but you decide to punish these motivated students? Do you really think that people will start to cut just to stand in the middle of the cafeteria for the whole day?- my lesbian friend emailed "you\'re gay" to her GIRLFRIEND as a joke. She almost got suspended even AFTER she explained that she was joking and her girlfriend agreed.- The newspaper can\'t run surveys anymore because one pissed off a librarian and she changed the results. Wow, what a good lesson to teach kids- that adults can cheat with no consequences.- No talking in the library- except us, the librarians, who can loudly talk.', 'Greenwich High School was a great experience. All activities are offered from clubs to sports to drama you can always find a home at Greenwich High School.', 'Well maintained, clean school. Some teachers care more than others. Very competitive environment between students, but still easy to make friends.', 'I love Greenwich High School. I have found who I am at the school and it is the reason I am who I am today. The teachers are great and the students are really diverse.', "I loved Greenwich High School for its willingness to accept students of all origins. I'm part of the LGBT+ community and I was accepted by all my colleagues, plus teachers help you with your next steps. I was never put down because of my race or how I looked. The teachers' willingness to push every student to succeed was fantastic, I'm glad teachers cared enough to help because I might have failed otherwise. A lot of my teachers also tried to make the classes fun by making jokes during class or always applying what we learn to the community or real world. I wish everyone got the opportunity I did.", 'I would say that the experience at Greenwich High School would constitute 4 stars because I am privileged to live in a district that has a lot of money that allows the school, especially the high school, to offer a range of services and opportunities to prepare students for college and has excellent teachers that help student in all our academic, athletic, and extracurricular activities. The only downside to Greenwich High School is that there  are really poor levels of diversity. Out of 2,000+ students, over 70% of them are white and most of the kids come from affluent families, which causes a lack of diversity in the classroom, especially in honors and AP classes and causes potential problems for students of color.', "My experience at Greenwich High School can be best summarized as a steady adjustment to fierce competition. The honors track has some challenging but excellent standards, but the atmosphere is detrimental to mental health in many occasions. The past four years led me to discover many things about myself and those around me. I learned what I truly valued in friends and teachers; and especially what made a class strong or weak. The science department for example is archaic in its style of teaching and difficulty levels for some of the AP classes can jump from the fair and worthy challenge to a ridiculous level of unfairness due to a teacher's forgetful nature. English and History/Social studies/Psychology are definitely strong in their curriculum and teaching though. One thing I can still say for sure though, and that is that the level of education and athletics are top notch.", 'Greenwich High gives students the opportunity to explore a variety of different studies. This school allows its students the resources to find what suits each and every individual. This school promotes independence, diversity, and prides itself on its supportive environment. All have the liberty to challenge themselves intellectually. Overall, the school does a fantastic job at preparing its students for college.', 'I enjoyed the high level of academics that Greenwich High School provided- the rigor of the classes made me feel confident in my ability to proceed to college level courses because of the preparation I was given.', "Greenwich High School is the best school I've ever been to compared to other schools. All the resources are available to help us learn. Teachers are very helpful and they really care about their students. Being in a classroom is like being at home because of how comfortable it is being there.", 'I love Greenwich Highschool. The teachers and students are very driven and kind.  At Greenwich Highschool you have the access and oppurtunity to succeed at whatever you put your mind to. The teachers really care about your success and strive to help you become a more engaged student.  GHS is filled with a community of people who care about eachother and they really help one another to prosper. The academics are very rigorous and prepare you for college.', 'They offer a wide variety of courses to choose from. The food id fresh, and the staff is very comprehensive.', 'I think that Greenwich High School is a great high school and offers a wide array  of class, clubs, and sports so they everyone can find something that they are interested in doing. The amount of students and the size of the school can be daunting to some potential students but the size allows the school to have classes in all genres.']
column8: ['It is a very diverse school with amazing programs as well as opportunities! Although it is a public school, in my option it is equivalent to a private school.', "If you are planning to send your child to Greenwich High school, you must be an involved parent. I cannot stress this enough. The guidance department and most teachers do not care and your child will pay the price. Speak up as a parent and don't be afraid to push your child to be a advocate for themselves. Chris Winters is much more interested in how many kids take AP exams than how much your child is actually learning.", 'Greenwich High was one of the best schools academically in Connecticut.  It also prepared me extremely well for college.  The sports program was also phenomenal and one of the best in the state.  The student body was extremely friendly and very connected and close.  The size allowed for an easy transition to college, but at the same time felt like a small community because of the connectedness of the school as a whole.', 'Greenwich High School is a very large school with a tremendous amount to offer.  It is not the best school for students who excel in a small intimate setting (ie. my son) but is incredible for those who flourish in a large setting (my daughters). Very competitive environment between students, but still easy to make friends.', 'I love Greenwich High School. I have found who I am at the school and it is the reason I am who I am today. The teachers are great and the students are really diverse.', "I loved Greenwich High School for its willingness to accept students of all origins. I'm part of the LGBT+ community and I was accepted by all my colleagues, plus teachers help you with your next steps. I was never put down because of my race or how I looked. The teachers' willingness to push every student to succeed was fantastic, I'm glad teachers cared enough to help because I might have failed otherwise. A lot of my teachers also tried to make the classes fun by making jokes during class or always applying what we learn to the community or real world. I wish everyone got the opportunity I did.", 'I would say that the experience at Greenwich High School would constitute 4 stars because I am privileged to live in a district that has a lot of money that allows the school, especially the high school, to offer a range of services and opportunities to prepare students for college and has excellent teachers that help student in all our academic, athletic, and extracurricular activities. The only downside to Greenwich High School is that there  are really poor levels of diversity. Out of 2,000+ students, over 70% of them are white and most of the kids come from affluent families, which causes a lack of diversity in the classroom, especially in honors and AP classes and causes potential problems for students of color.', "My experience at Greenwich High School can be best summarized as a steady adjustment to fierce competition. The honors track has some challenging but excellent standards, but the atmosphere is detrimental to mental health in many occasions. The past four years led me to discover many things about myself and those around me. I learned what I truly valued in friends and teachers; and especially what made a class strong or weak. The science department for example is archaic in its style of teaching and difficulty levels for some of the AP classes can jump from the fair and worthy challenge to a ridiculous level of unfairness due to a teacher's forgetful nature. English and History/Social studies/Psychology are definitely strong in their curriculum and teaching though. One thing I can still say for sure though, and that is that the level of education and athletics are top notch.", 'Greenwich High gives students the opportunity to explore a variety of different studies. All have the liberty to challenge themselves intellectually. Overall, the school does a fantastic job at preparing its students for college.', 'I enjoyed the high level of academics that Greenwich High School provided- the rigor of the classes made me feel confident in my ability to proceed to college level courses because of the preparation I was given.', "Greenwich High School is the best school I've ever been to compared to other schools. All the resources are available to help us learn. Teachers are very helpful and they really care about their students. Being in a classroom is like being at home because of how comfortable it is being there.", 'I love Greenwich Highschool. The teachers and students are very driven and kind.  At Greenwich Highschool you have the access and oppurtunity to succeed at whatever you put your mind to. The teachers really care about your success and strive to help you become a more engaged student.  GHS is filled with a community of people who care about eachother and they really help one another to prosper. The academics are very rigorous and prepare you for college.', 'They offer a wide variety of courses to choose from. The food id fresh, and the staff is very comprehensive.', 'I think that Greenwich High School is a great high school and offers a wide array  of class, clubs, and sports so they everyone can find something that they are interested in doing. The amount of students and the size of the school can be daunting to some potential students but the size allows the school to have classes in all genres.']

column2: ['Briarcliff Middle School is a highly rated, public school located in Briarcliff Manor, NY. It has 347 students in grades 6-8 with a student-teacher ratio of 17 to 1. According to state test scores, 75% of students are at least proficient in math and 61% in reading.', 'A very welcoming school, lots of resources in terms of technology and facilities. The academics are very diverse and inclusive, and there are a multitude of AP and honors/college options. The science research program offers a lot of opportunities to explore many different fields and interact with active professionals intellectually and in the field. The guidance counselors are very helpful and supportive, and there are many accommodations available to those who need them, like the designated testing center.', 'Great academic competitiveness, great athletics, great arts. Everyone is very welcoming to whoever you are regardless of background. If you are looking to transfer in, your will 100% make close friends at this school. Overall fantastic school and environment.', 'Briarcliff is extremely accepting, they challenge you but also support you not only academically but also with your passion, whatever that may be. Briarcliff has tons of clubs, activities and ways to get involved in the school, they have many ways to get to know people and make friends. Everyone there is super nice and will help you. At Briarcliff, they are a family that is always looking for new members, they understand that people are different in many ways and accept you for who you are. Academics and Sports and The Arts are important to Briarcliff allowing students to find themselves and do what they love. Students are welcomed to stay after school to do homework, meet with teachers, play sports, do the fall drama or spring musical and enjoy every part of high school. Everyone has a place at Briarcliff High School and a chance to excel in life and have a future.', 'Great community to grow up in and learn from. Academics prepared me for college. The small school size allows for a large number of students to get leadership experience.', 'The teachers at Briarcliff are amazing. The english, history, and science departments are incredibly strong.', 'I really enjoy the facilities in this high school and the support structure that the teachers provide for the students. There are also great clubs/after school activities to pursue but the atmosphere is too competitive and the is little to no diversity in this high school. A good proportion of kids in this high are very stuck up and have large sense of entitlement. This school tends to often be in its own bubble since people in this high school know very little about the real world', 'The teachers and classes are hard, but prepare you for college. The school offers a great number of resources compared to other schools in the area. There are plenty of clubs and sports to participate in. Briarcliff is really good in certain sports, and terrible in others. Our soccer, basketball, and lacrosse programs are fantastic and the most popular (good in individual sports like swimming and tennis as well). The facilities and food at the school are mediocre. Briarcliff definitely is lacking in diversity and school spirit. The school is in what many call the "Briarcliff Bubble", because the vast majority of the kids have grown up in the town all their life and do not understand how different the real world is.', "-High School Junior-Students have a wide variety of classes to pursue.-Teachers are usually nice and care about you.-Clubs are varied but may not be worthwhile. -School culture is strong, especially in sports-Sports have excellent coaches and facilities-Resources are great for the most part. Our new MacBook Pros allows us to do more than ever.-Parent Involvement in sports, clubs, and administration is noticeable and strong. -Diversity is alright with most people being Caucasian and then Asian, Latino, African-American, and Other in that order of commonality. (My opinion) -College Readiness appears to be strong with many going to good colleges-Safety is good-Administration appears to be good-Food is mostly good quality -Facilities are very good including classrooms, bathrooms, and athleticsUnfortunately, Briarcliff doesn't seem to do much to help students that don't have the mental drive for academics or take a long time to complete tests.", "The high school is a high performing school for its intense sense of competitiveness and offers different opportunities and experiences to even the newest students. Its student body is overall fun and energetic. As for teachers and faculty, they all are great people once you get to know them  and are actively helping students whenever possible. If you are a student looking for a challenge, this place is a perfect fit. However, you may need to help yourself when it comes to joining clubs as there isn't the grandest spectrum of subjects for extracurricular activities. As well as that, Briarcliff  places the student in a strong role to guide themselves to reach out for help, find out information about colleges or courses, and even look for scholarships. Upon entering the high school, you think you know it all, but once you graduate, you know really understand how much more you should learn once you're off to college!", 'Overall, a good school with a lot of support structure. Your experience is what you make out of it. While Briarcliff can very challenging socially, it has a great emphasis on academics to make up for it.', 'It is one of the top 50 schools in New York, and I can guarantee that if you are a student that loves to explore their limits you will enjoy the school. The school has made me college ready and I feel I will be succesfull when I go to college.', 'I liked my experience at Briarcliff High School. I had amazingly intelligent and helpful teachers at my disposal, as well as lots of resources in the library and on computers. The Intel science program was especially crucial. However, I wish I had more college readiness once graduating.', 'Family like community. Small sized public school. Therefore, everyone knew each other. Challenging academic courses offered.', 'Ive never felt like my health was at risk here', 'There are lots of activities to participate in', 'Many students are involved in many activities so there is a lot of shared great ideas all over', 'The teachers are for the most part very dedicated to their students and helping them succeed', 'Many of the teachers are passionate about what they teach and had very impressive jobs before they came to work at the school. Teachers have great relationships with students', 'Students and faculty are not welcoming.']

column6: ['The teachers at Briarcliff High School need more training and do not know how to welcome new students.', 'Extracurriculars are important and enjoyable', "I'll miss it once I graduate", 'The teachers are intelligent and engaging.', "Somewhat diversified...be open to meeting new people and share your interest.  Don't relegate yourself to being anonymous at the school; challenge yourself and be who you are!!!", 'Being in a small school district has its pros and cons.  The teachers and students really get to know each other and have a positive impact on each other.  There are fewer classes offered based on the small size of the school.', 'The school always has an anti-bullying assembly for the students.  There is a dress code but it is not strictly adhered to.', 'The teachers seem concerned about the success of their students.  However, at times it seems the better students get more attention than the students that need help.', 'Sports and athletics are very important in our school, and most kids are involved.  School spirit can be high at times.', "Although there is a security guard at the school entrance, I don't know how well people are interrogated for entrance.", 'All types of extracurriculars including modified, JV and varsity sports, and clubs of all types.', 'Most teachers are very qualified and engaging.', "Athletics isn't the biggest thing at Briarcliff. I did wish that there was more school spirit at our school.", 'There are many options for clubs and organizations including sports, arts, and cultural groups.', 'There was a good sandwich bar, but the hot foods were all unhealthy and not too appetizing.', "There wasn't much visible bullying at our school. The principal was very friendly and tried to learn everyone's name.", 'Everyone is relatively friendly at Briarcliff High School. I would chose this school again because most people at this school are hard working and dedicated.', "Definitely challenging, but if you work hard, it's really worth it and you learn a lot.", 'Really helpful and allow thought provoking conversation in class.', "It's a lot of fun, but not very intense or competitive."]

column2: ['Harborfields High School is a place where you won’t be afraid to express yourself. Although there is a moderate amount of vaping in the school, it feels like a safe place where you can get involved with whatever you choose to without being judged. Plus, academics are great and there are some high-caliber teachers who work there.', "It's a good school, but tends to be lacking a little in preparing students for college. The art program could be a little more developed and there should be more clubs devoted to art and science. Overall, its a great school and has a lot to offer if you are willing to put the work and effort in.", 'Harborfields was a great school for my 4 years of attendance.  The class selection was challenging and I did well.  My grade point average is 3.8.  I enjoyed the music program.  I am in the symphony orchestra, the chamber orchestra and Tri-M.  the music honor society.   My teachers were helpful and I made many friends.  I will miss High School, but am so looking forward to having the college experience and continuing with my music.', 'I am currently a Junior at HHS and have an academically rigorous schedule. Many AP classes are offered, and the teachers care about their students and prepare them well for the exams. There is a good selection of clubs. HHS is not a large school. Two things that are not ideal are the layout and the food. The school is essentially one long twisted hallway, with a cafeteria and gym the middle and second floors at each end. This causes certain points to be frequently congested with a high volume of students all trying to go through at the same time. The food is good but can use improvement. These are only minor though. The teachers really care about their students succeeding and enjoy teaching. Overall, I am impressed with the school and proud to be a part of it.', 'I spent all four of my years of high school at Harborfields. The teachers are for the most part very good. There are various clubs and extracurricular activities that students can join and participate in.', 'Harborfields High School has been able to maintain a strong partnership with the community which has impacted the school tremendously. The idea of the HFamily has really been stressed and prevalent throughout my years here. This has taught me the importance of building relationships and collaborating with others. If I were to speak on one change it would be for equal attention and funding into the art department. Being that I am involved in both departments it would mean a lot to see some advancements towards the art department.', 'I liked the overall experience over my four years. From day one I was involved in many clubs and activities with friends and felt so welcomed and involved. The sports were very competitive and my teammates became my best friends. In my sophomore and junior years the Guidance Department tried their best to assist me with my college planning and always had answers to my many questions.', 'I loved my experience at Harborfields high school. I have nothing that I would change. This school has amazing resources and a great administration.', "I've attended Harborfields schools since kindergarten.  The high school is great.  The teachers are very encouraging and always there for the students.  The kids are all like a family to one another since we have all grown up together.  The school offers a wide variety of AP classes, as well as electives.  There are many clubs to join and I have loved being a part of the Tornado News Team and broadcasting live varsity games for the community via our website.", 'At Harborfields High School I’ve had wonderful teachers who care and take pride in helping their students learn. My guidance counselor has been the biggest help there. My school has won the blue ribbon for Long Island and I don’t think anything needs to change because I feel it is a great place already.  It is a fun and safe environment with a make up of friendly kids. I am lucky to be a student in the harborfields school district.', 'I like the small school family feel to Harborfields. The teachers are awesome as well as the administration. It is not too diverse however.', 'I have been enjoying my high school experience at Harborfields. Everyone is kind, helpful and we truly all are a family. There is really nothing I would want to see changed there.', "The school is nice, don't get me wrong. I'm in orchestra and they tore up the floors in my junior year and said they were going to replace them over the 2016 Christmas break, a year later and they still haven't done anything. The school cares more about sports than the arts and the programs aren't getting the funding that they should. However, most of the teachers are pretty good at their jobs and their classes are thoroughly enjoyable. The students could participate more in fundraisers, but no one is perfect", 'I loved going to Harborfields high school, it offers numerous AP courses and has a lot of extracurricular activities available to everyone. All of the teachers were very caring and very helpful.', 'The school never has a problem when it comes to making somebody feel safe. If you ever feel otherwise there are many clubs and teachers and organizations there to help you.', 'There are many extracurricular activities for people to get involved in.', 'I love the spirit at my school. One of my favorite experiences would have to be homecoming and pep rally. The whole school gets so involved and it makes you feel like you are a part of something huge and positive. Another great experience is the variety show which is similar to a talent show. Anybody can audition and the school decides who will perform and it is always a great night. The school plays are also always incredible due to the amazing theater program we have.', 'The teachers at my school are very approachable and will always help you with anything you may need. They are friendly and teach lessons that are engaging and that you can actually relate to.', 'Overall, academics are pretty good in upper level courses.  Definitely tends to vary from teacher to teacher', 'I always feel safe here.  We do emergency drills a couple times a year and multiple fire drills']
column4: ['Harborfields High School is a place where you won’t be afraid to express yourself. Although there is a moderate amount of vaping in the school, it feels like a safe place where you can get involved with whatever you choose to without being judged. Plus, academics are great and there are some high-caliber teachers who work there.', "It's a good school, but tends to be lacking a little in preparing students for college. The art program could be a little more developed and there should be more clubs devoted to art and science. Overall, its a great school and has a lot to offer if you are willing to put the work and effort in.", 'Harborfields was a great school for my 4 years of attendance.  The class selection was challenging and I did well.  My grade point average is 3.8.  I enjoyed the music program.  I am in the symphony orchestra, the chamber orchestra and Tri-M.  the music honor society.   My teachers were helpful and I made many friends.  I will miss High School, but am so looking forward to having the college experience and continuing with my music.', 'I am currently a Junior at HHS and have an academically rigorous schedule. Many AP classes are offered, and the teachers care about their students and prepare them well for the exams. There is a good selection of clubs. HHS is not a large school. Two things that are not ideal are the layout and the food. The school is essentially one long twisted hallway, with a cafeteria and gym the middle and second floors at each end. This causes certain points to be frequently congested with a high volume of students all trying to go through at the same time. The food is good but can use improvement. These are only minor though. The teachers really care about their students succeeding and enjoy teaching. Overall, I am impressed with the school and proud to be a part of it.', 'I spent all four of my years of high school at Harborfields. The teachers are for the most part very good. There are various clubs and extracurricular activities that students can join and participate in.', 'Harborfields High School has been able to maintain a strong partnership with the community which has impacted the school tremendously. The idea of the HFamily has really been stressed and prevalent throughout my years here. This has taught me the importance of building relationships and collaborating with others. If I were to speak on one change it would be for equal attention and funding into the art department. Being that I am involved in both departments it would mean a lot to see some advancements towards the art department.', 'I liked the overall experience over my four years. From day one I was involved in many clubs and activities with friends and felt so welcomed and involved. The sports were very competitive and my teammates became my best friends. In my sophomore and junior years the Guidance Department tried their best to assist me with my college planning and always had answers to my many questions.', 'I loved my experience at Harborfields high school. I have nothing that I would change. This school has amazing resources and a great administration.', "I've attended Harborfields schools since kindergarten.  The high school is great.  The teachers are very encouraging and always there for the students.  The kids are all like a family to one another since we have all grown up together.  The school offers a wide variety of AP classes, as well as electives.  There are many clubs to join and I have loved being a part of the Tornado News Team and broadcasting live varsity games for the community via our website.", 'At Harborfields High School I’ve had wonderful teachers who care and take pride in helping their students learn. My guidance counselor has been the biggest help there. My school has won the blue ribbon for Long Island and I don’t think anything needs to change because I feel it is a great place already.  It is a fun and safe environment with a make up of friendly kids. I am lucky to be a student in the harborfields school district.', 'I like the small school family feel to Harborfields. The teachers are awesome as well as the administration. It is not too diverse however.', 'I have been enjoying my high school experience at Harborfields. Everyone is kind, helpful and we truly all are a family. There is really nothing I would want to see changed there.', "The school is nice, don't get me wrong. I'm in orchestra and they tore up the floors in my junior year and said they were going to replace them over the 2016 Christmas break, a year later and they still haven't done anything. The school cares more about sports than the arts and the programs aren't getting the funding that they should. However, most of the teachers are pretty good at their jobs and their classes are thoroughly enjoyable. The students could participate more in fundraisers, but no one is perfect", 'I loved going to Harborfields high school, it offers numerous AP courses and has a lot of extracurricular activities available to everyone. All of the teachers were very caring and very helpful.', 'The school never has a problem when it comes to making somebody feel safe. If you ever feel otherwise there are many clubs and teachers and organizations there to help you.', 'There are many extracurricular activities for people to get involved in.', 'I love the spirit at my school. One of my favorite experiences would have to be homecoming and pep rally. The whole school gets so involved and it makes you feel like you are a part of something huge and positive. Another great experience is the variety show which is similar to a talent show. Anybody can audition and the school decides who will perform and it is always a great night. The school plays are also always incredible due to the amazing theater program we have.', 'The teachers at my school are very approachable and will always help you with anything you may need. They are friendly and teach lessons that are engaging and that you can actually relate to.', 'Overall, academics are pretty good in upper level courses.  Definitely tends to vary from teacher to teacher', 'I always feel safe here.  We do emergency drills a couple times a year and multiple fire drills']
column6: ['Theatre Company works very hard to put on the best productions we can and has a lot of talent, but we lack the basic funding and facilities we require.', 'Most students are friendly and the small atmosphere creates the feeling of an "HFamily"', 'Most teachers are approachable, helpful, and knowledgeable.  Despite a few exceptions, they make an effort to connect with students and support their extracurricular pursuits.  The best teachers are extremely personable and make the classroom environment fun.', 'Harbor fields is extremely diverse on all spectrums', 'Harborfields offers a wide variety of classes but they could offer more electives', 'Harborfields has pretty good health and safety management programs', 'Harborfields could probably be more diverse in their extracurricular activities', 'Harbor fields is a great district/ school, everyone is friendly and respects each other', 'The teachers are devoted to making sure that their students succeed in high school and college', 'I have never felt unsafe at my school.', 'coaches, instructors are devoted and amazing.', 'Almost every parent knows each student.', 'Each and every teacher is easily approachable.', 'Academics are one of the best things about HF.', 'Overall everyone is pretty accepting of others.', "Even though they all might not be super nice, the all know what they're doing and prepare you for important tests.", 'Great Extracurriculars, there is something to do for almost everyone.', 'My school has a zero tolerance for bullying, and in general everyone treats each other with a lot of respect and there is an overall feeling of love between students and faculty members. The school nurse is amazing as well.', "I absolutely love Harborfields and I wouldn't have wanted to attend high school anywhere else. Everyone is so passionate about the things they're involved in whether it's sports, clubs, music, etc. and the school spirit is contagious. There are so many times in which entire grades will come together whether it be for playfest or homecoming, and students are inspired and motivated by their peers to get involved in everything that HF has to offer, which really makes for a great high school experience.", "As in most schools, there are some outstanding teachers, and there are some who shouldn't be in a position to teach at all. Overall, the teachers really care about their students, are available for extra help, and really want their students to do well. I loved a lot of my teachers at HF and I still go back to visit them."]

column2: ["As a current student of Ardsley High School, I have been studying there since September of 2017. After a quick year of studying in the city, moving into the suburbs, I was able to experience a very different environment and its uniqueness in general. Ardsley High School is a very competitive school, with students obsessively talking about grades and getting A's and where sport goes hand-in-hand with academics. 90% of the students that I have come across are usually affiliated with a sport. This sheer determination of students wanting to compete against one another and get into a better college is what sets apart Ardsley High School from the rest.Being a small school, it also is a very friendly community with amazing teachers, some who have very high education backgrounds, to help you all-day long. Students themselves are very caring and open to new people and it definitely feels like a second home for me. It is the best school for someone who wishes to be competitive and successful.", 'Great educational environment due to teachers, school culture and parent involvement. Clubs & Activities plus sports added to the all around positive experience of high school that has prepared my daughter for her next educational step...college!', 'The community between teachers and students is excellent. However, there are some teachers that have unique teaching techniques which may not work for nor benefit everyone.', 'My experience with Ardsley High School has always been positive and enriching. The school has an amazing atmosphere and the student body is very accepting of people from all backgrounds and lifestyles. I feel that Ardsley schools excel at giving students a variety of clubs, sports, and class opportunities to choose from. Although Ardsley students are very open to those of other ethnicities, the school as a whole tends to lack having a lot of diversity. Also, because of the highly competitive environment, students that fall in average or below average areas tend to feel high amounts of academic pressure. This occurs especially because of the fact that the school seems to put the pressure of college onto the students all at once rather than allowing it to develop over time and prepare them sooner. Teachers in general tend to be very supportive of students, allowing them to develop an important trust and connection with them.', "I really believe that Ardsley High School set me up for my future well. Through challenging courses, clubs, and sports, I was able to figure out who and what I wanted to be when I grew up. I participated in many clubs and was a part of the JV and Varsity team (specifically for tennis) for all 4 years of high school. I wouldn't change a lot other than maybe allowing students to have more of a voice and more chances to participate in a certain event, class, etc.", 'Loved some of my teachers and classes, but hated others. I wished the school were bigger so we could focus on more important things, rather than trivial ones. The school has many social divisions and I wish everyone had the ability to truly be themselves.', 'Had some great teachers who were really willing to help me. The resources available for clubs like video production and photography were great.', "I would love for their to be more classes offered in areas such as business. Also, I would like there to be more classes focused on things like Women's history etc.", 'Teachers show interest in the subjects that they teach. There is a sense of community that makes everybody feel welcome at the school. Academics is a main priority but they have many other things to offer for free time.', 'people are very sheltered but nice i guess. teachers are good, but some are better than others. its a small school so you get to know everyone easily.', 'Academics are definitely rigorous, but the competition pushes you to do better.', 'Most people are very accepting of however you choose to live your life.', 'There are so many clubs you can be a part of, and most people take advantage of them.', 'The school is a tight-knit community that pushes all its students to be as excellent as they can possibly be.', "Teachers here utilize a variety of different teaching styles. If a teacher uses methods that aren't right for your learning style, there will always be another teacher with a different method.", 'Very passionate teachers, feel prepared for college', 'Not the best not the worst', "We have a somewhat diverse population, but it's mainly white, jewish students or Indian students. We have students of different cultures, but its not as strong", 'Extremely competitive academics. Many students take about 2 AP classes a year with the addition of college prep courses and honors classes. Most students spent 4-6 hours on homework a night. Popular classes include, forensics, criminal justice, AP Psych, and film production', 'All of the doors are locked and the teachers have ID cards on them at all times. The school has multiple drills to practice fire safety as well as intruder saftey']

column6: ['It has high educational standards, with a lot of activities for students. The students are very competitive but many go on to high ranked colleges. Ardsley students tend to do a lot at the high school. Most participate in more than one sport and more than one club. The students are a bit preppy and spoiled, but most students in the area are', 'Security guards helpful feel pretty safe', 'I am in science research and it is the best', 'Really great academics but also very competitive.', 'Always available and approachable, most have a genuine passion for the subject they teach and are more interested in the ideas a student has to offer instead of their grade point average. Classroom are always intimate.', 'Even though Ardsley High School has taken many steps to increase school security, more needs to be done to insure complete safety of the students who attend this school.  Even though faculty members are required to carry ID, and that doors are well locked, the lack of physically security within the school creates a large loophole with regards to creating a very safe school.  Many parents and members of the Ardsley community do not see crime as a threat to themselves and to students at the High School, which also creates an issue in which people are not fully acceptive to adding greater security measures within the facility.  Yet, there are cameras, needs of ID, and occasionally the presence of protective security personal.', 'Ardsley High School offers many after school clubs and activities.  From wanting to learn about diverse cultures, all the way to wanting to understand business concepts, Ardsley is known for having so many opportunities for students to be able to learn more then just what is being taught inside of the classroom. If a student feels as if their is a club that needs to be introduced to the school, he or she has great access to the resources that is needed in order to start that club.  Overall, the clubs that are offered truly express the diversity of the students who attend Ardsley schools.', "Overall, my high school experience has had a positive experience in my life.  I believe that due to Ardsley's small population, being part of a small school has taught me a lot about myself.  There are only so many kids that have the same common interests as you do when there are only around 150 kids in your grade.  Having said that, in order to strive in a small school setting, you have to have a very open personality which will result in obtaining as many friends and acquaintances as possible.  I can proudly say that I have created as many friends and bonds with students as I possibly could at Ardsley High School  Having this said, I also learned that not everyone is accepting of who you are, and of the background that you come from.  This is something that I have also accepted as an individual.  The most important thing that I have learned through my 12 years in Ardsley is that you have to be accepting of yourself, and to not change yourself in order to be accepted by other.  Because of this, I would most certainly attend Ardsley High School again if I could do it all over again, so that I can re-learn the very important pieces of information which has been taught to me inside and outside of the classroom.", 'The teachers at Ardsley High School are always there to help students succeed to the best of their abilities.  Ardsley has an extra period after the eight mandatory class periods are over.  This is called the "ninth period".  The ninth period gives Ardsley students an opportunity to visit the teachers of their wanting in order to review educational material, study, take missed exams or for other reasons that will further help the student strive in their academic setting.  Of course, the ninth period is not required for all students to use, therefore some students do not take advantage of the period.  In the classroom, teachers all have the common goal to teach the students as much as possible throughout the corse.  Every teacher has their own particular style of teaching, but overall they do indeed keep students interested in learning and have done a very good job in teaching the students at Ardsley High School.', "I've been attending the schools in the Ardsley District since Grade 3. It's small enough that after a few years, you memorize everyone, their names, their sibling's names, and know a lot by the time you graduate. Everyone is Ardsley High School is friendly, and there are not many accounts of bullying or any other type of incidents thanks to a strict no-bullying standard within the school. The academics are to a high standard, but you choose whether or not to take advanced classes or not. The average student at Ardsley High School takes about one or two AP classes, if not more, and play at at least one sport for a season. The school places a lot of emphasis on academics and athletics, too.\r Ardsley is unique in the way that out of the Rivertowns, we place a lot of emphasis on having a good academic record but also having a diverse experience. Students are encouraged to join a variety of different clubs and sports, as well as school events, and to interact with their peers. We're also one of the smallest towns, as well. The AHS class graduating has about 160 students graduating this year and I can tell you the names of every one of us, and also provide an accurate physical description. That's how small we are. \r I love the different academics that the school offers, but at the same time, everyone is independently competitive within their social circles. All of my friends took at least 3 AP classes, and some take as many as 5 APs in a single year. Teachers provide enough help though, if you decide to take it. There is an optional ninth period of the day where all teachers are required to be available for student help. If you ever have a question or need to talk to the teacher for extra help, ninth period is extremely helpful.", 'I love all of the sports and clubs I am involved in.', 'Located in a nice family area.  Great academics.  Great teachers.  Students graduate with plans to attend top colleges and universities.  Many extracurricular options.', 'Amazing school. Really prep you for college and teachers really care about students.', 'Great security, always felt safe.  As everyone should feel in school.', 'Pretty good lunches.  Good amount of time for lunch and seniors can go out for lunch', 'Great teachers.  Some of the best I have ever known!', 'An amazing school that really prepares you for college.  Teachers and administration really care about individual success of each student.', 'Options are okay, but most people are happy', 'Nice fields, need better equipment', 'Most are wonderful, some are too strict']
column8: ['Many different clubs, but have to do own funding', 'Definitely prepared me for college', 'Compared to the (NYC) city public schools, Ardsley High School is quite safe. Entrance into the buildings is limited and controlled by security personnel. They have had several false bomb threats that have been quite disruptive to the educational process overall. Not-with-standing, the overall safety of the school is good.', 'Could use more money for sports teams', 'Would prefer a larger school.', 'They do a good job', 'They do a good job', 'The courses offered at AHS are relatively difficult when compared to neighboring schools. The workload can be intense if the student is taking difficult classes. To help out, the school offers an hour after the school day for teacher help.', "A majority of teachers at the school are incredibly knowledgable and are often available for help outside of class. They give great lectures and make sure that the information has really sunk into the students' minds before moving forward.", 'There is a push to be more healthy. The school has been pushing to serve whole wheat pizza instead of white pizza, but there is still an overwhelming amount of unhealthy snacks and foods being served.', "The teachers, parents, and other staff members do an incredible amount of work for the success of their students. If I had the chance to go back in time and do it all over, I wouldn't do anything differently. The positive and competitive atmosphere of the school has helped me achieve my goals and more.", 'Parent involvement skyrockets in Ardsley. The PTA board puts in a lot of time and effort to organize events and raise money for additional student-enrichment programs and facilities. Additionally, many technology donations are made to the students. Recently, an entire room of Mac desktops was added to the building.', 'There are a variety of clubs and organizations that take place after-school. Also, an annual club fair is held during the first month of classes. This fair invites students to sign up for clubs and go to general interest meetings. The administration is also very supportive of students and extracurriculars. The teachers put in a lot of effort to help students organize events and fundraisers.', 'The school is incredibly safe. We have had multiple false bomb-threats that led the school to implement security measures such as additional cameras and an upgraded security staff. The school is also very close to the police department. Often, a police officer is standing at the front of the school.', "Guidance counselors don't do as much as they should do. When asked for help about choosing classes, they don't offer any sort of guidance; they tell you what's out there and make you choose, all the information that you already had.", 'There are definitely schools worse than us in the athletic department. We have access to a great fitness room and many talented coaches. The director of the department cares about his job and makes sure we have the proper equipment to compete in each sport. Team performance varies based on sport. The football team is weak in our division whereas the soccer and fencing teams are incredible at their games/meets.', 'The community in Ardsley is incredibly small. The high school is made up of fewer than one thousand students. Additionally, Ardsley is known to be one of the wealthier school districts made up of many upper-middle class families. This leads to an over-protected atmosphere for the students. It\'s harder for these students to enter the "real world" after graduation because they\'ve never had to really fight for what they wanted; it\'s always come relatively easily for them.', "Because the community is so small, the students are fairly close to one another. Of course there are cliques, but they aren't as defined as would be seen in larger schools.", 'The teachers at the school are great, however the subs are not.', 'The teachers at this school are amazing, and helpful.']

column1: Northern Valley Regional High School Demarest
column2: ['The education is good, yet some teachers are not as qualified as they should be to teach the subjects they are. NVD has a lot of school pride and is a very fun school to attend.', 'Great high school - so many opportunities to make yourself better. Teaches really care and administration and faculty is very understanding. The parents are  pretty involved usually and the sports programs are great at NVD. Furthermore, their arts program is amazing and their musicals have never failed to wow. Definitely recommend.', 'I had a great academic experience at my high school. The teachers and the curriculum they taught really prepared me for what I need in order to succeed in college.', 'I love Northern Valley Regional High School. Good staff, good education. It is ranked very highly for a public school in this area. I think there should be more school spirit.', 'The school has great academics, but I would like to see more classes and opportunities related to understanding finance, home economics, and diversity.', 'People literally sleep 1-2 hours a night and it’s normal. People who don’t take all honors/AP are somewhat looked down on. Some teachers are great, but some just don’t seem to care much about their students. Overall, the school is competitive and cliquey, and I’m counting the days until graduation next year.', "NVD is a great school that has great opportunities for students. Teachers will definitely prepare students well for college, and are completely willing to do their best to help student do well. The administration does need some adjustments, but they're not so terrible that your school life will be ruined. Food is typical. It tastes good, but it's mostly fried food.", "Most of the teachers here are very nice, they are sincere and know what they are talking about most of the time. The students here are also very nice and are pretty open-minded about things. However the administration can be hard to deal with and it is hard to get things done, especially for the students. They seem to care about things that don't matter and the things that do matter are of very little importance to them. The students are all pretty high achievers which can be encouraging to other students as well. In the end, everybody is trying their best and are very kind. It's a good school, a good fit for anybody who is into tech and is a high achiever.", 'NVD has excellent teachers who do a good job of preparing the students for college level courses.  They offer plenty of clubs and activities and always encourage students to get involved. My biggest criticism would be they do not have an established school culture, but I love how they are trying to change this by promoting student created events, like music videos and movie nights.', 'Well, let me start off by saying how complicated my school was. For one, there was no typically bullying. There were rarely any fights (that I know of) and even more rarely were there just people critically insulting others. What my school instead prided upon was the effect of showing off. Social media plays a massive role in our society today but it is especially present in schools. In my school, there are endless pictures and stories of people showing off what they have and what they are doing. Oh, you\'re going to a party and have to make sure the school knows you are cool and drink? Post some pictures of you drinking! Oh, you\'re working out and getting those "gains" as they say? Post some pictures and don\'t forget to flex it off! Oh, you got into a good college by having your family donate massive amounts to the undergrad program? Post some pictures and make everyone feel bad about their colleges! It has come to a point where once you achieve something, the whole school must know.', 'NVD is a great school that ensures student feel safe and welcome. It prepares students for college and provides the needed resources  to succeed. Students are welcome to express themselves freely, and are prompted to participate in the school community.', 'Northern Valley Demarest overall is a fantastic school that offers an incredibly well-rounded education. In 2014 the school implemented a 1-1 technology program that allows students to learn in a way that opens their eyes and their minds, as well as puts the power to further education into their own hands through their personal computers. The school offers a wide variety of classes, clubs and student run organizations to participate in, so no one is ever left behind.', 'I loved the staff and my friends at school. I really felt welcomed in my school and my community. Everyone was helpful, and I did not view high school as a cut-throat competition as some make it out to be. We have a lot of school spirit. School sports, plays, and other activities and events are very fun. Football games are my favorite!', 'NVD was a place where I could be myself and explore what  I wanted to do. The students here are all extremely nice and so where the teachers. The teachers where all helpful and were willing to help any student that needed the help. They were always there and willing to make time.', 'I would not know what I would have done with out the  faculty and staff from Northern Valley regional high school  At Demarest.  Everyone there is supportive and  helps you reach your highest goals.', 'Northern Valley Demarest has a great teachers that always help you learn and want you to do your best. The sporting events at the school is what makes the school the most fun. Everyone is involved in a fun club or activity and the whole school supports you.', 'The academics in this school is very competitive, and people are pushed to be the best they can be. However, some teachers are not very good at teaching the class, and instead, depend on other people\'s PowerPoints or YouTube videos to teach the class. The college readiness is very good, as most people from this school graduate and go to a higher level of education. The administration is horrible. For example, during the PARCC tests, people would do homework after they were done, but the administrators felt that this was "pressuring" other students to finish, so homework was banned and only "non-academic" things were allowed. The next day, people decided to bring pillows, because if they couldn\'t do their homework, they might as well get in another hour of sleep. The administrators came around to every class and confiscated every pillow until the front office was filled with them. Overall, the school is good at preparing you for college, but every other aspect is mediocre.', 'Northern Valley Regional High School at Demarest notably invests time in choosing superb and dedicated educators who always put their students first. Their one-to-one initiative program promotes progressive use of technology in the classroom and allows for more innovative methods of learning. Furthermore, there are a wide variety of options available for students to choose from regarding elective classes which allows students to explore their interests and passions.', 'This school is pretty good if you love sports. It focuses heavily on the importance of sports and extracurricular activities, and helps students release their potential.', "There's not much options in courses. I would like to see more courses in math, such as Multivariables and Differential Equations, and science, such as Biotechnology and Organic Chemistry."]
column4: ['The education is good, yet some teachers are not as qualified as they should be to teach the subjects they are. NVD has a lot of school pride and is a very fun school to attend.', 'Great high school - so many opportunities to make yourself better. Teaches really care and administration and faculty is very understanding. The parents are  pretty involved usually and the sports programs are great at NVD. Furthermore, their arts program is amazing and their musicals have never failed to wow. Definitely recommend.', 'I had a great academic experience at my high school. The teachers and the curriculum they taught really prepared me for what I need in order to succeed in college.', 'I love Northern Valley Regional High School. Good staff, good education. It is ranked very highly for a public school in this area. I think there should be more school spirit.', 'The school has great academics, but I would like to see more classes and opportunities related to understanding finance, home economics, and diversity.', 'People literally sleep 1-2 hours a night and it’s normal. People who don’t take all honors/AP are somewhat looked down on. Some teachers are great, but some just don’t seem to care much about their students. Overall, the school is competitive and cliquey, and I’m counting the days until graduation next year.', "NVD is a great school that has great opportunities for students. Teachers will definitely prepare students well for college, and are completely willing to do their best to help student do well. The administration does need some adjustments, but they're not so terrible that your school life will be ruined. Food is typical. It tastes good, but it's mostly fried food.", "Most of the teachers here are very nice, they are sincere and know what they are talking about most of the time. The students here are also very nice and are pretty open-minded about things. However the administration can be hard to deal with and it is hard to get things done, especially for the students. They seem to care about things that don't matter and the things that do matter are of very little importance to them. The students are all pretty high achievers which can be encouraging to other students as well. In the end, everybody is trying their best and are very kind. It's a good school, a good fit for anybody who is into tech and is a high achiever.", 'NVD has excellent teachers who do a good job of preparing the students for college level courses.  They offer plenty of clubs and activities and always encourage students to get involved. My biggest criticism would be they do not have an established school culture, but I love how they are trying to change this by promoting student created events, like music videos and movie nights.', 'Well, let me start off by saying how complicated my school was. For one, there was no typically bullying. There were rarely any fights (that I know of) and even more rarely were there just people critically insulting others. What my school instead prided upon was the effect of showing off. Social media plays a massive role in our society today but it is especially present in schools. In my school, there are endless pictures and stories of people showing off what they have and what they are doing. Oh, you\'re going to a party and have to make sure the school knows you are cool and drink? Post some pictures of you drinking! Oh, you\'re working out and getting those "gains" as they say? Post some pictures and don\'t forget to flex it off! Oh, you got into a good college by having your family donate massive amounts to the undergrad program? Post some pictures and make everyone feel bad about their colleges! It has come to a point where once you achieve something, the whole school must know.', 'NVD is a great school that ensures student feel safe and welcome. It prepares students for college and provides the needed resources  to succeed. Students are welcome to express themselves freely, and are prompted to participate in the school community.', 'Northern Valley Demarest overall is a fantastic school that offers an incredibly well-rounded education. In 2014 the school implemented a 1-1 technology program that allows students to learn in a way that opens their eyes and their minds, as well as puts the power to further education into their own hands through their personal computers. The school offers a wide variety of classes, clubs and student run organizations to participate in, so no one is ever left behind.', 'I loved the staff and my friends at school. I really felt welcomed in my school and my community. Everyone was helpful, and I did not view high school as a cut-throat competition as some make it out to be. We have a lot of school spirit. School sports, plays, and other activities and events are very fun. Football games are my favorite!', 'NVD was a place where I could be myself and explore what  I wanted to do. The students here are all extremely nice and so where the teachers. The teachers where all helpful and were willing to help any student that needed the help. They were always there and willing to make time.', 'I would not know what I would have done with out the  faculty and staff from Northern Valley regional high school  At Demarest.  Everyone there is supportive and  helps you reach your highest goals.', 'Northern Valley Demarest has a great teachers that always help you learn and want you to do your best. The sporting events at the school is what makes the school the most fun. Everyone is involved in a fun club or activity and the whole school supports you.', 'The academics in this school is very competitive, and people are pushed to be the best they can be. However, some teachers are not very good at teaching the class, and instead, depend on other people\'s PowerPoints or YouTube videos to teach the class. The college readiness is very good, as most people from this school graduate and go to a higher level of education. The administration is horrible. For example, during the PARCC tests, people would do homework after they were done, but the administrators felt that this was "pressuring" other students to finish, so homework was banned and only "non-academic" things were allowed. The next day, people decided to bring pillows, because if they couldn\'t do their homework, they might as well get in another hour of sleep. The administrators came around to every class and confiscated every pillow until the front office was filled with them. Overall, the school is good at preparing you for college, but every other aspect is mediocre.', 'Northern Valley Regional High School at Demarest notably invests time in choosing superb and dedicated educators who always put their students first. Their one-to-one initiative program promotes progressive use of technology in the classroom and allows for more innovative methods of learning. Furthermore, there are a wide variety of options available for students to choose from regarding elective classes which allows students to explore their interests and passions.', 'This school is pretty good if you love sports. It focuses heavily on the importance of sports and extracurricular activities, and helps students release their potential.', "There's not much options in courses. I would like to see more courses in math, such as Multivariables and Differential Equations, and science, such as Biotechnology and Organic Chemistry."]
column6: ['Challenging at times but manageable', 'Most students are generally similar', "Lot's of diversity and most are fun", 'Most teachers are friendly and knowledgeable', 'Such a great and easy place to make new friends.', 'The school is very big on health and public safety.', 'The programs are very inclusive and have something for everyone to try.', 'Very good school. they taught me a lot and prepared me for my college career.', 'Very good school, they teach you very well. They make sure you understand the material.', 'Sometimes I feel like I am in a prison.', 'I like the extracurriculars I am involved in.', 'There is too much of a focus on grades and not enough focus on other important developmental factors such as a personality or honesty.', 'There are some amazing teachers, but there are also quite a few teachers that are either not that intelligent or do not work hard.', 'There is a wide range of activities to choose from. Clubs range in commitment level.  For instance, you can be a member of the panda club and meet once a month to help animals. All of the sports team require a large commitment as practices meet 5-6 days a week. They have clubs for everyone!!', 'Overall, I have had a great high school experience. I have made some life-long friendships and great professional relationships with teachers as well. What makes this school unique is how devoted the faculty is to making each and every student succeed. The school cares about each student and will go out of its way to provide the students with the best learning environment possible. If I could do it all over again, I would choose this school again because it challenged me academically and also gave me the skills needed to thrive in college.', 'The teachers at Northern Valley Regional High School are caring, devoted to their students, and passionate about their jobs. A lot of the teachers incorporate technology into their lessons and have standard teaching styles. Some teachers use power-points, some give you worksheets with notes to fill in, while others lecture. The teachers are well educated and are very knowledgable about their subjects. They want students to succeed and provide them with the skills needed to thrive in college.', 'I would have to say that security here is extremely tight. There is always police waiting by the front entrance of thee building and student and visitor sign in is certainly required. The police are always watching the security cameras that are set up at almost each corner of each hallways in the high school. A bonus is that the policemen are extremely friendly to students and staff. All staff members of the high school are always willing to help students whenever they are in need and make sure that each and every student is comfortable with their high school life. Overall, this high school is very safe and comfortable.', 'The extracurricular activities that are made available in my school certainly has a wide range. The extracurricular activities also are very diverse, therefore, it is certain that there is a club for every single student. Every club allows the student to shine and be involved in the interests of their choice.', "The parents of the students who have attended my school have always been involved in their child's academic life. They seem to always make sure that they are on the right track and not struggling to do so. However, some of the parents seem to put their efforts in supporting the child's athletic life more than their academic life, which I find not to be the right thing to do.", "A teacher that I once had was extremely helpful and I certainly owe my academic success to that teacher. That teacher always was able to incorporate real-life examples and relate wit the subject that she taught. Most of all, she was very patient and understanding of her student's feelings."]

column2: ["Westfield High School is an excellent place to get an education. It will push you or your child to work extremely hard with wonderful, helpful teachers and many high caliber extracurricular programs. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is that the level of difficulty can provide a great deal of unnecessary stress on the students, but, if you can handle that, you will have a fantastic experience.", 'I have had a wonderful experience in my four years at Westfield High School.  Most of it is thanks to our wonderful principal, Dr. Derrick Nelson, who unfortunately, passed away earlier this month.   His loss is felt deeply by all students, staff and parents.  He was a selfless, intelligent administrator and an awesome person.  I only hope future principals can follow his lead, but I feel no one can fill his shoes.  He was one of a kind and I feel fortunate to have had him for as long as we did', 'This school is one of the better schools around and anyone can have the opportunity to pursue classes that fit their interests and academic level. However, diversity is lacking and minorities are limited.', "A lot of great teachers and successful preparation for college but also a lot of stress. There is an unhealthy amount of pressure put on students and not enough emphasis on their personal strengths and mental health. As a student over the past 4 years, I think it's safe to say that I would not want to put my own children through this school system.", 'Many great teachers - unfortunately also some less motivated teachers.  Building is old and facilities need to be updated.  Highly motivated, ambitious kids and kids with individual learning plans seem to thrive - kids in the middle tend to struggle.', 'although westfield tends to be cliquely, i loved my high school experience. i miss it so much and it seriously was some of the best years of my life. overall westfield prepared me for college in every way as well.', "I was unfortunately at Westfield High School for one year, during that year I experienced many new things teachers helped me get my grades up, made new friends. One of the best things about Westfield High School is that it is very diverse and there aren't a lot of cliques.", 'Your experience at this school will completely depend on your teachers. There are some super awesome teachers here but also some teachers who do not care about their students at all.', 'I believe that the high school provides lots of diverse academics and electives towards the students to really help student find what they love to do later on in life. Sports at WHS are very limited if they aren’t football or soccer. Overall I like the school and how it’s becoming very innovative', 'Great School, Excellent academics, located in a wonderful safe town. Very athletic high spirited school that offers many clubs and activities for students. Teachers and staff always there to help. Great resources. Prepared me very much for college.', 'Great high school, lots of courses offered, regular, honors or AP, great teachers going the extra mile to help students, lots of clubs, sports activities.Only weakness: Counseling Department needs improvement.', 'There are endless opportunities at Westfield Highschool from academics to athletics to clubs that give back to the community. The teachers at Westfield Highschool are outstanding. They truly care about their students and go out of their way to provide their students with the tools they need to succeed. I have a teacher this year that aside from being more than willing to meet during any period of the school day holds 2 hour AP review sessions after school leading up to the AP exams. My teacher’s enthusiasm spreads to her students.  The one thing I would like to see change is the facilities. The bathrooms, especially, need to be redone.', 'My education has been uncomparable at Westfield High School. However, the rigor of the classes causes for a lot of students to have mental health issues. The school does not have enough resources for students in distress. Despite this, I feel prepared for college because of how challenging my classes were.', 'The school is really amazing in how it prepare the students for college. There is a lot of education and help that the teachers give the students as they are always willing to help. I will say that the school heavily focuses on athletics and dies not have that diverse of a population.', "Westfield High School is strong academically and prepares students for college and other pursuits after high school. In addition to academics, the school has very strong programs for athletics, music, and theater. It's a very well rounded school.", 'I did not enjoy Westfield High School that much. The environment was too competitive and made me way too stressed as a 14-17 year old. I feel like I lost those years, and even the years I have now because the feeling has not gone away. The kids were mean and not very welcoming. The school is not diverse at all and I thought the management was horrible. However, I had some teachers that have changed my life and loved.', 'Westfield Senior High School is a very normal suburban middle class school. The classes are all very good and the school has a lot of Advanced Placement options. It is incredibly average as far as high schools go. The teachers are nice, some are very difficult to work with. The sports teams usually do very well and school spirit is good.', "Westfield Senior High School is good in terms of academics and rather highly competitive, sometimes with a little too much pressure for everyone to do well.  It is very sports-centered, but mostly the conventional sports like football, lacrosse, and soccer.  Less popular sports won't be followed by anyone not involved.  The sports team usually do well.", 'Westfield High School is ranked very high in academics and will prepare your children well for college. Faculty very nice as well as teachers always willing to help.', "The teachers for the most part really care about seeing students succeed in the classroom and are willing to put in the work if the students are also willing. It's a large student body so it feels like it's easy to get lost, but there are so many clubs, teams and other activities that you can find a group of like minded individuals fairly quickly. Cafeteria food is not horrible, they offer healthy options, just stay away from the nasty looking stuff, you'll know it when you see it."]
