column6: ['Westfield High has outstanding academics. My overall experience was amazing the lessons and the work that we were exposed to definitely helped me be prepared for college and excel.  Although diversity was something that can use some work, before I graduated it was obvious that it was on their priority list to expanded in that area.', 'This school has so much to offer; if only more students took advantage of its resources! Although it could work on its diversity, it does a lot for students academically and for preparing them for college', 'There are many excellent teachers who truly care about the students. These teachers have changed my life for the positive and I can not thank them enough. The  administration is completely unsupportive of teachers and they have zero idea of what to do about student discipline. The administration is in constant turnover and the incompetence runs rampant. Nothing is done about bullying and drug use is high. The administration is focused on test scores (PARCC & A.P.) and not at all on student well-being. It is a highly competitive environment.  This is either a good thing or a bad thing depending on the student. There is a lack of diversity and an air of privilege. The school does not take any criticism well. Students and teachers are punished for suggesting any sort of changes in the school. You will get an excellent education from the teachers but stay away from the awful administration. The people at the board office are less supportive of students so do not waste your time.', "Westfield High School is a place that is academically challenging and very sports orientated. Most of the students are enrolled in the school's various sports programs as well as clubs such as theater. This school provides many ways to meet new people through the surplus of clubs and athletic programs which allows for a much bigger social network then normal. However, I didn't enroll in any of these clubs due to my fencing scheduled, which ended up isolating me from most of the other students.", 'There are a lot of people here of varying commitment to education, but the honors and AP courses were really fun for me', "Great four year high school in a safe suburban neighborhood. I had a good experience attending, but I wasn't prepared for college at all. The application process wasn't explained well. Fortunately, the teachers are always helpful, and I didn't drown in the application process. There are a number of clubs and activities, so you won't be bored. It is in a very safe neighborhood, with a great community. 3/5, I recommend attending.", 'Westfield High School is an excellent school for academics and extracurriculars. There are a ton AP and honors classes to choose from, as well as some excellent teachers. The school is fairly large and has good facilities, including 3 gyms, 2 cafeterias, a large theater space, and a small but excellent TV Studio. The biggest drawbacks would have to be the administration and the school culture. The principal disappeared for a majority of my senior year. The school is very cliquey, and seemingly spoiled.', 'Prepared you extremely well for college if you challenge yourself. Great school spirit, very good at sports. Well known-well respected.', "Being a senior at the Westfield High school in Westfield Nj, I have witnessed almost four years in the school. Overall, this school has influenced my life in such a positive direction by preparing me for the future by testing my abilities and having me learn so much valuable and relevant content. The school's faculty and students are so caring and supportive. It makes the whole experience worthwhile.", "The teachers at Westfield High School are committed to having their students understand the class and the criteria. They are constantly there to help students if the student doesn't understand the topic they are learning. In addition, the teachers are encouraging for students to take risks in furthering their education.", 'Westfield HS is a great school. It offers so many opportunities not just in academics but also in extracurricular activities and sports.', "Overall, this is a good school in comparison to others in the area. What I have found in my experience is that although we have a lot of honors and AP classes available, some of the teachers teaching them are lazy and do not care about their students! As far as diversity goes, its a school of rich white kids, so it's limited. The building is old, and not the cleanest, although we have a really nice, new fitness center. There are a lot of clubs/groups to join here, and plenty of resources.", 'Education is more than a value here at this particular school. Given the high ranking of our curriculum, there is nothing but confidence and hard work seeping from the walls of this institution. Since, learning and education is something of such high precedence, I felt nothing but privileged and knowledgeable when leaving this school to continue my education at a collegiate level. By attending Westfield High school, I am able to continue pursuing my life with a well rounded and college ready background. ', 'I believe that Westfield High School has throughly prepared me for college and is a safe environment.', 'The teacher vary from easy to hard, along with the classes, but if there is something you want to take we most likely have it', 'If you are part of a big crowd of friends there is a lot of pressure, but if you float around and do what you want youll be find, like me', 'From sports to academic to art to community service to theater, there is everything, if you want to create a new club you are welcome to. The advisers are great and the kids who do them are genuinely interested.', 'I do not get too involved with the school since I work, there are sports that have great attendance and support but then there are others that no one really cares about', 'there are a lot of good teacher, but every year there is that one teacher that does not really care, grades unfairly, or has favorites that you can not control and when you are not one of them your grade suffer. The great teachers are the ones that stay after, are always available when they can be, are reasonable and understanding.', 'The school offers a lot of high level classes and many of the students there take advantage of them.']

These teachers have changed my life for the positive and I can not thank them enough. The  administration is completely unsupportive of teachers and they have zero idea of what to do about student discipline. The administration is in constant turnover and the incompetence runs rampant. Nothing is done about bullying and drug use is high. The administration is focused on test scores (PARCC & A.P.) and not at all on student well-being. It is a highly competitive environment.  This is either a good thing or a bad thing depending on the student. There is a lack of diversity and an air of privilege. The school does not take any criticism well. Students and teachers are punished for suggesting any sort of changes in the school. You will get an excellent education from the teachers but stay away from the awful administration. The people at the board office are less supportive of students so do not waste your time.', "Westfield High School is a place that is academically challenging and very sports orientated. Most of the students are enrolled in the school's various sports programs as well as clubs such as theater. This school provides many ways to meet new people through the surplus of clubs and athletic programs which allows for a much bigger social network then normal. However, I didn't enroll in any of these clubs due to my fencing scheduled, which ended up isolating me from most of the other students.", 'There are a lot of people here of varying commitment to education, but the honors and AP courses were really fun for me', "Great four year high school in a safe suburban neighborhood. I had a good experience attending, but I wasn't prepared for college at all. The application process wasn't explained well. Fortunately, the teachers are always helpful, and I didn't drown in the application process. There are a number of clubs and activities, so you won't be bored. It is in a very safe neighborhood, with a great community. 3/5, I recommend attending.", 'Westfield High School is an excellent school for academics and extracurriculars. There are a ton AP and honors classes to choose from, as well as some excellent teachers. The school is fairly large and has good facilities, including 3 gyms, 2 cafeterias, a large theater space, and a small but excellent TV Studio. The biggest drawbacks would have to be the administration and the school culture. The principal disappeared for a majority of my senior year. The school is very cliquey, and seemingly spoiled.', 'Prepared you extremely well for college if you challenge yourself. Great school spirit, very good at sports. Well known-well respected.', "Being a senior at the Westfield High school in Westfield Nj, I have witnessed almost four years in the school. Overall, this school has influenced my life in such a positive direction by preparing me for the future by testing my abilities and having me learn so much valuable and relevant content. The school's faculty and students are so caring and supportive. It makes the whole experience worthwhile.", "The teachers at Westfield High School are committed to having their students understand the class and the criteria. They are constantly there to help students if the student doesn't understand the topic they are learning. In addition, the teachers are encouraging for students to take risks in furthering their education.", 'Westfield HS is a great school. It offers so many opportunities not just in academics but also in extracurricular activities and sports.', "Overall, this is a good school in comparison to others in the area. What I have found in my experience is that although we have a lot of honors and AP classes available, some of the teachers teaching them are lazy and do not care about their students! As far as diversity goes, its a school of rich white kids, so it's limited. The building is old, and not the cleanest, although we have a really nice, new fitness center. There are a lot of clubs/groups to join here, and plenty of resources.", 'Education is more than a value here at this particular school. Given the high ranking of our curriculum, there is nothing but confidence and hard work seeping from the walls of this institution. Since, learning and education is something of such high precedence, I felt nothing but privileged and knowledgeable when leaving this school to continue my education at a collegiate level. By attending Westfield High school, I am able to continue pursuing my life with a well rounded and college ready background. ', 'I believe that Westfield High School has throughly prepared me for college and is a safe environment.', 'The teacher vary from easy to hard, along with the classes, but if there is something you want to take we most likely have it', 'If you are part of a big crowd of friends there is a lot of pressure, but if you float around and do what you want youll be find, like me', 'From sports to academic to art to community service to theater, there is everything, if you want to create a new club you are welcome to. The advisers are great and the kids who do them are genuinely interested.', 'I do not get too involved with the school since I work, there are sports that have great attendance and support but then there are others that no one really cares about', 'there are a lot of good teacher, but every year there is that one teacher that does not really care, grades unfairly, or has favorites that you can not control and when you are not one of them your grade suffer. The great teachers are the ones that stay after, are always available when they can be, are reasonable and understanding.', 'The school offers a lot of high level classes and many of the students there take advantage of them.']

column2: ["My experience with High Tech High School was very eventful. I made so many friends, and memories while attending a school full of opportunities. High Tech High molded me into the person I am today. The faculty, student body, and the atmosphere helped me become a better me. Overall my experience with High Tech High School will be one to remember, I wouldn't change a thing.", 'The teachers here communicate well with students and give students many opportunities to not only bring their grades up, but to also take the next step and take internship opportunities in real work environments.', "I've had an amazing 3+ years at High Tech High School. The overall community helps bring together a wonderful high school experience.", 'High Tech can be very hit or miss. Some teachers love their job so they keep their class intriguing and others do not. All in all I enjoyed my four years at High Tech.', "The administration at High Tech is corrupt and biased. They don't care about the children in the school, they only care about their image and the amount of funding they are getting. Since dropping $160 million on a building that is falling a part, they have demoted and fired performing art teachers. LISTEN to this: the current musical theater teacher was transferred from County Prep. Do you want to know why? She was physically violent with students there, and since the police report or something along those lines was messed up, they couldn't properly fire her. The only reason why I don't give a 1 star review, is because there are some teachers that actually care about their jobs. Most of the teachers in each major care about their students and whether or not they learn. If you love your child, do not send them to High Tech until they decide to either change administrator or change the way they run the schools. This is a place of learning, not a place for political agendas.", "I believe that High Tech High School is a great school where I can truly express myself while also feeling comfortable. High Tech offers unique academies to choose from such as the biomedical science, culinary arts, computer designing, Dfab, robotics, and my interest...performing arts. It's important for students to identify their skills and specialize in an area of interest in preparation for college where we must declare a major. There is always be something different to experience and enjoy, especially in performing arts such as a musical, coffee house, dance showcase, volunteer work, etc. It's been enjoyable. There are so many of different types of people from different backgrounds, cultures, and communities. It has allowed me to be more open-minded, adaptable and accepting of all people...which made me a better human being!", 'A school that introduces students to many opportunities, High Tech helped me not only find who I am as a person, but made me realize the hidden passion I had for the major that I am pursuing now! With such diversity, High Tech successfully combines students of all culture, race, religious beliefs, etc., and introduces students to a safe and accepting environment. Being a student of High Tech has prepared me for what is to come and has me excited for my future!', "Was at the old school until Junior year, so I've had equal experience with both schools. I can agree it's going downhill with its policies, but there are some amazing teachers here, Gutmann being my favorite.", "The majors in high school is a good experience. Not all majors get equal opportunities, but I guess that's to be expected. I'm in my senior year, and I genuinly have enjoyed my time at high tech. I spent two years at the old building and two at the new building, it's a pretty nice school.", 'High Tech High School offers Freshman to Seniors a full high school experience from the wonderful teachers to the flash mobs after school. It is an overall great high school where entertainment is at its finest!', 'High Tech High School is an excellent high school that guides students into finding a possible career path. The majors that High Tech offers are very versatile and provide unique opportunities for the students. The new Secaucus campus is sleek and modern.', "The four years I have been attending High Tech has helped me figure out what I want to do in the future as long with how to get there. Not only did I learn from my classes, I learned from the people surrounding me. Fellow peers and staff taught me a lot about the world and how  I should prepare for the challenges I am going to be facing. Considering this school has many students coming from all over Hudson County who applied and worked hard to get in, the environment is anything but competitive. From my experience, everyone is willing to help each other when one is down and lost. It's like we are all a team trying to help everyone reach their goals.", 'High Tech is a great school where you can meet  so many new people. Everyone in this school is very friendly and welcoming. The school makes me feel very safe since there are security guards everywhere. One of the best things at high tech is how there are is many clubs and activities you can involve yourself in. We do many fundraisers for clubs in raise money for the awareness we support. The education I have received at high tech is amazing and it will be very useful for college.', 'The school used to be good, but we have moved from North Bergan and ar in Secaucus now and the school culture is gone, the rules are very strict, and they accept too many students now. Most teachers here are very nice though, and we have good food.', 'This school is amazing because it is diverse, while not being in their Verilog forced way. It involves all the artistic fields like dance, fine arts, video, audio tech, and even music theory. It also has very relevant fields like programming and digital design that are in high demand right now. Another strong spect is the DEFAB majors like wood tech and engineering, who cooperate with the robotics team to allow a dynamic team composition of clubs and classes. Driven kids can make long lasting connections with their students, like I did with my science teacher. She was a great inspiration and we had many long political conversations. Generally it feels that high tech is far more open, and tight knit than other high schools, especially for its huge size.I over high tech, it was a phenomenal experience and I would go back in a heart beat. It wasn’t a perfect school, but if it was not be I would’ve missed on the n certain life lessons.', "It was pretty good the first three years before the new building. Felt like family and home. I made lots of good friends with students and teachers. I don't know how my high school life would have been like without the great people I met.", 'High Tech is an awesome school with awesome academic opportunities. However it is not as diverse as the communities that it represents, my prayer is that this will change sooner than later.  This school is nearly built and graduated its 1st senior class in June 2019, however the buildings layout was not well thought out to accommodate its growing student body. However,  I would definitely recommend this school.', 'The school was much better when it was in North Bergen. When it moved to Secaucus the school has become much more strict and everything that used to be great about High Tech High School went bad. We have no more freedom as we used to and it feels as if new rules to restrict us are added every week. This is kind of ridiculous and I am happy to graduate so that I am no longer trapped in this prison.', 'What I loved most about High Tech were the various tools they gave students to succeed as well as the versatile curriculum as it prepares students for college and the workforce. The installation of majors also allowed me to explore different hobbies and interests.', 'High Tech High School is an inclusive school with many different activities for those with different passions such as performing arts or science. The ability to chose a major is something unique and an advantage to students attending the school. Something that can be changed is communication between administration and students.']

column6: ["High Tech environment has changed. Lacks resources necessary to prepare for success.   Doesn't have sports dances nor homecoming. They removing AP classes so less college prep. Not great. Most diverse high achievers and careless students. Too many social cliques and bullies. No where to print. overall do not like the school very much not a real high school experience", 'What comes with the name "High Tech High School" is the freedom to express yourself. They also have a massive amount of programs and majors including dance, musical theatre, medical and environmental sciences, design and fabrication, and visual and audio tech. The opportunity to get a head start in the college major of your choice in high school is great, and it definitely prepares you for college, admissions, and portfolios. Although there are some problems. Some of the academic teachers aren\'t as good at teaching compared to some of the others. High Tech doesn\'t have sports teams which definitely takes the opportunity for sports game and rallies away from the students. We also don\'t plan dances or formal events for freshman and sophomores, so it takes away from the high school experience.', "I liked how nice the teachers are and how they try their best to be nice to you for the most part. On the contrary, this school is too focused on majors and doesn't let their students really explore their interests. On top of that, most of the AP classes are a joke, and the students are just annoying and bad for the most part. If anyone cares about skin color diversity, we sort of have that. However there is little diversity of thought and ideas, which I think is more important.", "High Tech has such an amazing culture and community. Everyone, no matter how different, are able to be friends. There are no stereotypical cliques or bullies who pick on people who are different. Everyone is able to just be themselves and have an overwhelming amount of acceptance. There is also an incredible amount of diversity amongst students and faculty. There are so many different faces of High Tech that is makes for a unique experience and an eye-opening one. Truthfully, I wouldn't change a thing about High Tech.", 'I went to High Tech High School and while it can be a very chill environment and "care-free" there is also a different side. One that prepares you for college and even life in general.', 'Severely lacks resources and guidance.  It’s a North Bergen extension for  employees & politician’s children to attend. Those are students who get attention and guidance.  The others who work diligently long hours on homework and studying are pushed to the side & ignored. Grades are subjective. A bias community of social cliques starting from the administration.  99% Favoritism. Teachers pick on students.  Computer lab is gone.  Computer courses are non existent. Super LONG lunch lines serving leftovers.  New students don’t care and cause problems. OVERRATED school. Great new building with disappointing consequences. Nothing appears as it seems.', 'The teachers at the school are amazing and one of a kind. Most are ready to help and be your friend. Administration and higher-ups have ruined the culture of the school however, and year by year, the quality of the students and the freedom and creative expression deteriorate-- but if you enjoy having a fancy building with shiny floors, its alright.', 'Not great. There are no sports and the school is not the most diverse. If you are into living an only academic lifestyle, come here but if you want to be social and have lots of friends I would go elsewhere. I am in the culinary program and I feel that I am sectioned off to only that division. I do not love the major because it gets tedious and is 80 MINUTES A DAY. I overall do not like the school very much and do not feel completely ready and prepared for college.', 'High Tech is an exceptional high school. This school is great for college prep and helping students get a hand on experience on what they would like to pursue in college. High Tech has different majors to choose from, all offering great opportunities involving colleges. High Tech has no sports, considering it is a county school and students that wish to play high school sports would have to play sports for their home school. Teachers at this school really guarantee that their students excel in class. This is a great school.', "High Tech is a very open school with a lot of opportunities whether it be finding jobs, getting the hands-on experience, or connections. The new school provides all the tools and resources you need to excel in your specific major. Scheduling is free and flexible to make sure you take all the classes necessary, but as well as the ones you're interested in. The thing that High Tech can work on is the way administration runs. Due to it's openness and flexibility in structure, things always get rescheduled, or not everyone knows what's going on. A school assembly can be planned for one day, yet rescheduled multiple times because not everyone that was going to be involved was even aware.", "No more school computer lab where students worked and printed assignments??  No access to computer/printers. Wood tech equipment hasn’t been moved. New big building plenty of updates. The culture has changed in a bad way. They're trying to get more students to fill the building but these students aren't the best quality causing trouble.  The food is still good but long lines that take ALL period long. Bring snacks or you will starve waiting. Guidance was divided by wings DFab got the BAD batch Brennan isnt good no student support, no guidance, lacks  communication.  NO FAIR.  We want Nardiello back. They frown on parent involvement. Isn’t the school it used to be.  Only the results of HS graduates with college offers & scholarships can truly determine if this school/guidance provides students the resources to get accepted into the best colleges and obtain the highest scholarships. Severely Lacks student guidance and communication.", "I loved my time in High Tech. The culture they created in that school while I attended was truly unlike any other. It was accepting, it was open minded, it was caring. Everyone knew everyone and cared about each others well beings. We were treated like adults; teachers respected students just as students respected teachers. The food couldn't be compared any other schools, it was amazing. We had the utmost freedom which allowed us to be expressive and to be involved in our school community. My senior year, the year the school decided to move to their new building in Secaucus, New Jersey, was when things started to change. The culture has changed and not in a good way. Because the school building is bigger, they're trying to get more students to fill it; however these students aren't of the best quality which leaves room for trouble and conflict. The isolation of the classrooms, majors, students, and teachers also poses an issue.", 'My experience at High Tech High School has been filled with nothing but positivity and opportunities to further and expand my knowledge. Although the school does not offer sports, there is no lack of school spirit whatsoever. The students are all very diverse due to the fact that the students come from all over Hudson County. The teachers and administrators are there to guide you and truly want the best for you.', 'High Tech is what you make of it. If you want to challenge yourself, take the AP classes. If you just want to have a more relaxed environment, just take the pre-req classes/', 'Higher Acceptance Rate to allow more students to utilize the schools resources. I would also like to see more sport involvement such as a High Tech volleyball team or even a simple basketball team would be nice. I also have to complain about how the school security is not at its finest.', "It's changed. Used to be a good place for you to express yourself, now it's just trying to be like other schools. It still has a good reputation and you get a good education. The enviornment has just changed.", "Great school, new building could be better. The new building is kind of depressing and doesn't compare both on the outside and inside to the old one.", 'High Tech High School would always be very close to my heart. This school gave me the opportunity to build, not only, connections but also my resume. This is an environmental friendly school, with many amazing options such as Farm to Table, recycling, and having solar panels!', 'Overall a great school. High Tech prepares students for college and exposes them to challenging academics.', 'Interesting and innovative approach to education but severely lacks resources necessary to prepare kids for success in the real world.']

We had the utmost freedom which allowed us to be expressive and to be involved in our school community. My senior year, the year the school decided to move to their new building in Secaucus, New Jersey, was when things started to change. The culture has changed and not in a good way. Because the school building is bigger, they're trying to get more students to fill it; however these students aren't of the best quality which leaves room for trouble and conflict. The isolation of the classrooms, majors, students, and teachers also poses an issue.", 'My experience at High Tech High School has been filled with nothing but positivity and opportunities to further and expand my knowledge. Although the school does not offer sports, there is no lack of school spirit whatsoever. The students are all very diverse due to the fact that the students come from all over Hudson County. The teachers and administrators are there to guide you and truly want the best for you.', 'High Tech is what you make of it. If you want to challenge yourself, take the AP classes. If you just want to have a more relaxed environment, just take the pre-req classes/', 'Higher Acceptance Rate to allow more students to utilize the schools resources. I would also like to see more sport involvement such as a High Tech volleyball team or even a simple basketball team would be nice. I also have to complain about how the school security is not at its finest.', "It's changed. Used to be a good place for you to express yourself, now it's just trying to be like other schools. It still has a good reputation and you get a good education. The enviornment has just changed.", "Great school, new building could be better. The new building is kind of depressing and doesn't compare both on the outside and inside to the old one.", 'High Tech High School would always be very close to my heart. This school gave me the opportunity to build, not only, connections but also my resume. This is an environmental friendly school, with many amazing options such as Farm to Table, recycling, and having solar panels!', 'Overall a great school. High Tech prepares students for college and exposes them to challenging academics.', 'Interesting and innovative approach to education but severely lacks resources necessary to prepare kids for success in the real world.']

column2: ['The experience at Hewlett High School for me personally was good. I can confidently say that I have actually made life long friends, and formed a group of close friends I call my brothers. The teachers make it very easy to learn difficult material, and the resources I am offered every day is unmatched. The school even goes above and beyond in requiring us to take a Financial Literacy Test, so that in the real world, we have a basis of understanding on how to write a check, do taxes, etc. The only knock that I have on Hewlett High School is the fact that there is zero school spirit. It would be exciting if people actually went to the games that our fellow classmates partake in, if people cared about how we did in athletics, it would make my experience much more enjoyable.', 'Great School!!!! Awesome selection of classes. And the connection between the students and the teachers is a major influence on the quality of the students future.', "I had a pretty great high school experience at George W. Hewlett High School. The school has great courses with caring and dedicated teachers. There are multiple opportunities to improve as a student and get in involved. With the after school clubs and sports, it's easy to call yourself a Bulldog!", 'I overall had a memorable experience in this high school. I feel as though my teachers have made a great impact on me. The safety has highly improved  as well. However, I feel as though there is a lack of communication at times between parents/ students/ and the school.', 'I would like to be a High School Social Studies teacher. I have been fortunate that my Social Studies teachers have been helpful in giving me advice and helping me with the college process to achieve my education and career goals', 'The school, academically is really incredible. Opportunities are plentiful in numerous academic and artistic fields such as Theatre, Arts, Science, History and more. Diversity is not great and neither as culture as there is not much school pride and alot of individual competitiveness within classes.  Administration and Safety is always kept up especially in the modern climate of concern, the staff is usually always on top of it and I have not have had bad moments with the administration as of yet. Additionally the classes are extremely diverse as there are options for all student types which include the numerous AP, college and honor classes of which some have job specialization. Overall the school is great academically but does have numerous things to workout.', 'The Hewlett-Woodmere school district provides students with a superior form of education. In George W. Hewlett High School, students are academically challenged, all while exploring their different interests. Students are set on a path to college readiness, and given plenty of opportunities to find a career path that intrigues them. There are so many things to do outside of school, ranging from a variety of sports teams, to after school clubs of all sorts. Teachers are helpful and school administration works to keep the school a safe space.', 'Hewlett High School has excellent academic programs. It offers a multitude of AP, honors, and regents courses designed for the needs of different students. The facilities are all new and in good condition. In addition, teachers have high standards, helping students prepare for college and beyond. However, the amount of homework and testing per week can sometimes be a bit excessive.', 'Very nice teachers and staff but in my opinion it’s turning into a prison because people are too emotional and everyone’s feelings get hurt by every little thing which makes the school have to change their guidelines which is ridiculous. In the 4 years I’ve attended this school it’s changed dramatically and the students get more immature every year which also needs to be addressed accordingly.', 'I have been part of this district since first grade. Coming into freshman year I appreciated the opportunity of recieving tablets in order to use in classes and for coursework. It really was an effective way to learn about how to adapt to the growing technology.  Aditionally I enjoyed having the opportunity to take classes that may not be offered at every school such as AP Seminar and Fashion Design and Merchandising.', 'I love Hewlett High School. Great atmosphere with great people and fun clubs, activities, and sports. Offers 10 periods a day and is very worthwhile. Also offers many business, college and ap courses. Extra help is always there if ever needed and every teacher wants to help as much as they can. Teachers are friendly and really prepare you for college. As I am graduating, I will miss it very much.', 'The funding for Hewlett High School was top notch and allowed for a nice variety of curriculum. I particularly enjoyed the programming class taught by Mrs. Panarelli .', "It's high school, what do you expect? I wouldn't say it was the prime of my life, but when it felt like the complete opposite, all my teachers were so supportive of me. I felt some favoritsm in the arts category but besides that, it's a solid school.", 'I have gone to Hewlett High school for 3 years and it was the best experience of my life! I was exposed to amazing people who taught me new things everyday! All my teachers were the best and ensured that all the students understood the topics being covered. I was also able to graduate 1 year early from Hewlett High school with the help of my guidance counselor because I had enough high school credits! It is an amazing school and if I was still in high school, I would be loving it!', 'I liked the teacher involvement at Hewlett High School and the amount of thought that teachers put into ensuring that the students received a sufficient education. The school also has a large amount of resources for students to access and the Guidance Department plays a major role in preparing students for college.', 'I have really enjoyed my time in Hewlett High School. It really prepares you for college and helps you a lot with the college application process.', "The building itself has a very nice and welcoming atmosphere. The students get along with each other very well. The teachers are amazing, they make time around your time to get in extra help, or to go over a test. Some teacher do more than other but they all try their best to help students as much as possible. This schools has a lot to offer from the classes you take all the way to the clubs you join. There's something for everyone no matter what you like to do. The students have an active participation in what school does with certain things. This school really does offer a lot that many other schools don't get,  there's a reason why this school is 25 in the country. Even when certain students fail test teachers still push their students because they know what they can do and achieve in  high school. The guidance counselors are such a huge help, they are super good with communication with both students, parents and teachers.", 'Hewlett High School is a wonderful school that excels in diversity academics and so much more.  The school offers so many things that helps students persist and become better for college.', 'My years spent at George W.Hewlett High School were rather bittersweet, honestly I was not so impressed with this institution and the professionalism of their staff. I believe the weakest things about this school are the administration and quality of teachers/faculty. Overall students are well prepared for secondary education upon graduating from G.W. Hewlett High School. But there are definitely gaps in whether all students are treated fairly, and if the staff is professional when dealing with various student related problems.', 'I would like to see change in how the administration deals with faculty vs. student issues, and in the attitudes of certain faculty members.']

column6: ['I love science and the courses were great. They have an amazing research class that offers competitions that really challenge you. The teachers are nice and also helpful. Schedules are easy to follow although theres blue / white days (kinda like block schedules). Youll understand it pretty wuickly though.', 'The majority of the students are of European descent but dont let that discourage you. It doesnt affect your life much. Although there are cliques in this school, its not really so bad because everyones generally friendly, its just that you hang out more with the people youve known longest. Peer pressure is a small issue.', 'Its really diverse. The clubs are mostly free and covered but the others who arent are affordable. The people you meet are incredible and dont be shy, everyones friendly. I joined fencing and it made my freshman year the best ever.', 'I love the people and the environment. The location is great for hangouts because there are shops everywhere.', 'It depends on who you have of course but overall those I did meet were amazing people.', "There's a club for everyone. I'm not disappointed in the clubs I take part in: World Language Club (as Vice President for 3 years) and Youth Leadership Club.", 'I really enjoyed out Ha readership A primary it has supervisor Dr. David Rifkind. I enjoyed learning about systems thinking tools and iceberg models for new teaching methods for future students. Overall, this was one of the many moments I enjoyed at George W. Hewlett High School.', 'Most of the teachers are consistent with their grading practices. In my experiences, some teachers may too busy to be asked questions during or after class; this is the case with the Spanish teachers.', 'The sports programs at this school are excellent, speaking from personal experience the sport programs at Hewlett changed my life. Along with the numerous after school clubs and programs for students add an excellent array of choices for students.', 'This school was very friendly and you always felt like you were welcome wherever you went, whether it be a sporting event, a school related activity, etc. The parents of the district and within the PTA were all more then friendly and were always looking to do their best to help however they could.', 'The teaching at this school was very engaging and helped get students involved in their learning. Work environment was always friendly and felt very safe.', "As an athlete I'm particularly fond of sports. I believe that there is a great variety of sports and activities after school that allow students to get the exercise they need every day of the week.", "I can't imagine going to another school and having to start all over again. I'm happy and satisfied at the achievements I've made, and I wouldn't want to miss having the friends I have now. As far as parents getting involved with their students at my school, I think that the pressure parents put on their students is overbearing at times, but the fact that at this school that parents will put all that pressure and not support the school programs that their son or daughter would be in while caring so much about how they do serves as a hypocritical example of what their general involvement in my school is like.", 'I noticed that the teachers who teach in the different departments around my school have personalities that correlate to their subjects. For example, the teachers in the science department tend to be more friendly open to ideas while the teachers in the social studies department will be serious and official.', 'There are many AP and dual-enrollment classes offered.', 'There are many students of different races that come from different countries.', 'Parents interact well with teachers for the most part.', 'There are many small problems with this high school. However, it does offer many AP courses, extracurricular activities, and research programs for social science as wells as biological.', 'The teachers there are approachable. Some are easier to talk to than others. Overall, the learning experience is great. the teachers take their time to make sure that students understand the material at hand.', 'Teachers here are amazing! They address all issues and are willing to stay with you after class to go over what you need. AP teachers can be tough, but still help you when needed.']

column2: ['Good community school, great teachers, great athletics programs. Facilities are great. Food is not great.', 'GCHS has fantastic, rigorous academics that helped me prepare for college and kept me engaged. There are many options for classes and a lot of school pride. Although sports are highly prized in the district, the art and music program is also fantastic and receives recognition. As for changes, there is little to no diversity in the school and few accessible, quality resources for students of color, disabled students, LGBT students, low income students, and students with mental health needs.', 'As a senior at GCHS, I can tell from pure experience how amazing this school is. All the teachers are incredibly helpful and truly want to see their students succeeding. The guidance department was outstanding during my college application journey.  You will not regret sending your kids to this stellar school!', 'Garden City High School is the public high school of Garden City, New York. Garden City is a dominantly affluent, caucasian community. My experience has been fine, but I have given 4 stars simply because of the high quality education.', 'My experience has been truly amazing. I made tons of friends and my teachers always make it known that they want you to succeed.', "The Garden City High School has intensely prepared me for college with rigorous AP courses, and the help is dedicated teachers always taking time out of their day to help and guide you. At my school I have made friendships that will last a lifetime. School events are always well planned and a great time. I know the school has prepared me well for college, but I'm sad to leave it behind.", 'Garden City High School has a lot to offer. Students are able to excel academically with passionate teachers and assisting resources provided including math and writing centers during the school day and extra help before and after school. While students are set up for success in the classroom, Garden City High School refuses to address issues of mental health even after a member of the student body committed suicide. The school avoids issues of mental health and fails to help suffering members of the student body. In many cases where bullying has been reported little action has been taken against it, despite the claim the school made by the school that it is anti-bullying community. Overall the teachers are very committed and the variety courses are rigorous but Garden City High School cares more about the number than they do about the student.', "The expectations are very high for students at my school, and this is in part due to some student's parents. People are attending multiple Ivy League institutions each year from our graduating class, and the pressure to join that group is always there. Not all parents put that pressure on their child, but it is definitely noticable", "The teachers at Garden City High School are top of the line educators who go above and beyond what is expected of them. I've never had a teacher that I felt wasn't extremely knowledgeable and that I couldn't ask for extra help when I needed it. The teachers are one of the many things that make Garden City High School as great as it is", "Theres a large choice of classes so everyone can take the classes the fit them the best. Science classes rage all the way from conceptual, to AP. The harder classes are HARD and you should expect a heavy workload, but in my opinion they're worth it and honestly more fun. Most teachers work hard to help students succeed but there are also lazy ones.", "As far as racial diversity theres little to none. Theres only one african american in my grade and id say about 5 in the whole school. Theres more asians but not many. There are very few first generation Americans. Everyones really accepting of the LGBT community, and its definitely a factor in the school were all aware of. Theres very little assimilation of groups, like any school you have your cliques, but don't get me wrong, everyones really nice, just very little diversity.", 'There are lots of extracurricular activities available to everyone. You\'re not going to be "popular" if you don\'t do sports but there are plenty of other clubs to meet lots of really nice people at. All clubs are free, fun, and do some amazing work. Highly recommend joining clubs.', 'Myself and my family never felt as disrespected as we have the past few years at this school! After learning I had dyslexia IN SOPHOMORE YEAR (the school really screwed up there) they made getting any needed accommodations and help a living hell because my grades were "too good" so basically you get punished for hard work. They definitely show favoritism toward their athletes, and they give some kids, usually the lazy kids, 100s of chances to do well in school, while the treat others very poorly and don\'t give them as many chances. The school has messed up signing me up for several crucial exams such as SAT\'s and ACTs. They even lost my final exam!! the actual teachers are great but the principals and the "higher up" staff members are some of the most awful, mean, hypocritical, and simply unfair people I\'ve ever met.', 'there are so many things to do here', 'Because the schools population is very affulent, sometimes things are skewed', 'Most of the teachers go really out of there way to help students, and truly care about them', "Majority of the students got involved. There wasn't a lot of peer pressure, but LBQT wasn't seen that much, students were scared to come out because the community was preppy and prestigious. There also wasn't much racial diversity, majority of the students were Caucasian.", 'I felt very safe attending this school', 'The school had a lot of options for extracurricular activities whether it was a variety of sports, clubs, or school plays. Anyone had something to choose from.', 'Garden City High School was a school that was proud of their high academic and athletic ranking. The school had a lot school spirit which made it enjoyable to attend especially the football games. What makes the school so unique would definitely be the school spirit. I would choose this school again because the teachers went out of their way to make sure their students understood the material.']

They definitely show favoritism toward their athletes, and they give some kids, usually the lazy kids, 100s of chances to do well in school, while the treat others very poorly and don\'t give them as many chances. The school has messed up signing me up for several crucial exams such as SAT\'s and ACTs. They even lost my final exam!! the actual teachers are great but the principals and the "higher up" staff members are some of the most awful, mean, hypocritical, and simply unfair people I\'ve ever met.', 'there are so many things to do here', 'Because the schools population is very affulent, sometimes things are skewed', 'Most of the teachers go really out of there way to help students, and truly care about them', "Majority of the students got involved. There wasn't a lot of peer pressure, but LBQT wasn't seen that much, students were scared to come out because the community was preppy and prestigious. There also wasn't much racial diversity, majority of the students were Caucasian.", 'I felt very safe attending this school', 'The school had a lot of options for extracurricular activities whether it was a variety of sports, clubs, or school plays. Anyone had something to choose from.', 'Garden City High School was a school that was proud of their high academic and athletic ranking. The school had a lot school spirit which made it enjoyable to attend especially the football games. What makes the school so unique would definitely be the school spirit. I would choose this school again because the teachers went out of their way to make sure their students understood the material.']
column6: ['The teachers were very knowledgeable and relabel, even though I graduated in 2014, I still use the skills they taught me.', 'In my earlier years, I participated in Gymnastics and Junior Varsity Cheerleading. Both activities were awesome to join. I made many new friends, and we enjoyed it  all together by taking road trips to competitions or games . The coaches and teachers that helped out really made my experience enjoyable and made me feel apart of something.', "My school has been one of the most amazing outlets for me to really find myself, and grow as a human being. The undivided attention from faculty and staff has had a major affect on me succeeding throughout my four years in my high school. The healthiness in the air of Garden City High School has showed me what I could possibly become or achieve in my near future. I have had my up's and down's as a worried young freshman, but from the boost I received from my peers converted me into a strong individual. From walking through the front doors and being greeted by a sweet man Tom at the front desk to my Italian teacher greeting me with her love and care, my school is my home away from home. My district happens to be in a wealthy town, so our school does everything they can from donating prom dresses to girls in need to holding bake sales almost every week. All of the clubs and organizations are motivated to help the needy and less fortunate, not just to raise the money but with love for society around us.", "The educators at my school are the top-notch type. They have really prepared me, personally, for college and my later years of life. Throughout my thirteen years in my district, every single teacher I have had always motivated me to do my best and to succeed inside and outside the classroom. They are the building blocks to my future, and they have been there for me every step of the way, academically and emotionally. If it wasn't for them, my grade point average would not have increased thirteen points higher from my sophomore year to junior year. These people have really pushed me to go above and beyond to make me realize the person I could become, and have become. There are many teachers that have had major experience in and out of my high school,  and they really portray that in the classroom. The love and devotion that these people have really shows just by having a smile on his of her face, most of the time if not all. If it's just looking at a page of a book, or reading over an essay, the passion in my teachers eyes really show through. Whether it's an assembly about keeping us safe or a personal story that would really move us, I have been learning from my educators ever since I stepped foot into the district's facilities.", 'They is such a diverse number of extracurricular activities, thus allowing students to feel comfortable in any club they wish to attend.', 'There is just so many opportunities and open doors for every student to part take in and succeed.', 'They are all great teachers and so many of them put in the extra time to help charity and other organizations out of their own free time; which is absolutely amazing.', 'Teachers engage with their student and try to make lessons more interesting and try to keep students involved.', "There's never really been a safety issue in my time", "The clubs at the school are good, but not great. However, the sports are fantastic. Most teams are at least competitive, and many are top-of-the-line teams in the county and state year after year. There are clubs and teams that are hardly any commitment, and then there are some that are huge commitments. Depends what you're looking for.", 'The high-difficulty classes can make you overly stressed at times, but overall the experience is great. I feel very prepared to go on to college, and I think the non-academic aspects of the school make the experience a positive one.', 'Aside from a few teachers, the faculty at GCHS are a great bunch. They make time for you to ask questions, want you to learn and succeed, and are knowledgeable about their subjects.', 'I have never felt unsafe at this school . The doors are monitored closely . Kids who feel unsafe can easily find one of our security guards or assistant principals to express a concern. The nurses are very helpful and they offer students a wide variety or resources although most students typically avoid the nurses office. Overall , I feel very safe at my school .', 'We have a wide range of extracurricular activities at our school. Every student is involved in at least one club. We are diverse in the way that many students art part of sports and artistic activities. It is not uncommon to find state ranked athletes singing in the school plays. We also have a deep commitment to community service with the many service clubs we offer that each host multiple events a year .', 'I have had a very positive experience at this high school . While my classes have taught me well , I also enjoyed clubs and teams. As a president of a few clubs, I can say that the staff are very involved and help the clubs to be very active. I feel like this school has helped me to make a positive impact on my community and has given me the skills I need to thrive when I graduate .', 'I think all of the teachers that I have had go above and beyond both inside and outside of the classroom. I find myself enjoying subjects I previously disliked because my teachers have been so engaging and excited about what they are teaching. For the most part , the teachers at Garden City High School love to teach , and are amazing at it.', "Although the educational aspect was very beneficial, there are many things that the parents and teachers could improve on, such as not stressing the kids out so much with all the work and review. It's tedious and causes lots of problems for kids.", 'A lot of the teachers spend lots of time drilling the students on material over and over again, helping them to remember how to do certain tasks. The education level is high and the amount of people who graduate is almost 100%', 'The administration took funding away from the home ec department (cooking, parenting, and other fun electives). Computer and technology classes are insufficient. There are no special study options. Only stiffens in honors asks AP level courses are truly prepared for college work, but they start tracking too early. Many teschews are wondeful, but I did not have a good experience with my math teachers.  Creativity was occasionally squashed in stone classes,  sucg as English.', 'I enjoyed my involvement in Key Club and Student Council (middle and high school) as well as HOPE club.  However I was disappointed when the district decided not to fund home ec type classes and along with it,  Food for Friends,  a stoicism responsible club that met once a month to cook a meal for the local homeless center. Additionally the Gay-Straight Alliance started in my senior year was discouraged and faced discrimination from students, patents,  the administration, and the community.']
column8: ["There of course we're parents who were supportive and not over bearing. However there also were the parents who would call amber complain to the teachers about a poor grade theirs child received and either force a higher grade,  extra credit,  or to have their student do a do over despite fair grading practices. The PTA, like the school fabled the funding of sports let anything else,  and even put pressure on the administration to dismantle the Gay-Straight Alliance started in my senior year.", "I have had a few truly amazing teachers who inspired me and won were dedicated to their students,  and field. However I have also had teachers who knew the material but could not teach. In fact,  I believe I unlearned math in my Pre-Calc class;  I don't know how that teacher has tenure. She wad unapproved of me and neither she note the teacher in the math center had any patience with me,  I normally A student. The social studies department was phenomenal, as we're show of the science and English teachers.", 'Overall, the academics offered at this school are very good however; the social aspect is the issue. I would most likely not suggest this school to people with more liberal views as it has a very prominent conservative population. Unfortunately, there is minimal cultural diversity as well.', 'Teachers and administration definitely help promote clubs and organizations that the school offers.', 'I felt prepared for college because I had taken college classes out of my high school classroom. I felt that the teachers tried to help prepare us for what was next whether it was the real world or college.', 'I loved Garden City HS soooo much and will be so sad to leave in June!', 'I usually bring my lunch but the food looks pretty good', "THere aren't a lot of disciplinary issues at our school", 'We have an excellent athletic program with something for everyone that is interested', 'I have had the most wonderful teachers during these past four years at GCHS.  They are so caring and go above and beyond for students', 'There are a variety of excellent clubs to participate in', 'There are so many types of people at this school you can usually fit in', 'The school takes drugs, drinking and sexual conduct serious', 'I would do it all over again!', "I don't really each lunch at school", 'They overall stand firm on discipline', 'Overall our facilities are great', "I have had only a few teachers that I felt didn't really inspire me academically.  Overall my experience in our school district had been great - and I love my guidance person!", 'I am involved in several clubs in and out of School.  I love being very busy and I love giving back to my school and my community around me.  Although I live in a more wealthier community - my parents have been through a long term job loss and my mom had a very serious medical condition that hurt us a bit financially, with that my family believes in strongly in giving back of time because it is free.\r I also love cheerleading and have enjoyed my experience on the Varsity cheer team at GCHS!', 'I feel safe at my school.']

column1: Northern Valley Regional High School - Old Tappan
column2: ['In Northern Valley Regional High School in Old Tappan, my experience varied. I enjoyed the openness, as well as inclusiveness that was heavily apparent among my peers. The administrators were hands-on, and prepared to aid a student if necessary or in the event something happened. Education and academics are diversely offered in many different aspects, such as Economics or Detective Studies. The wide range in classes that our school possesses provides a more comfortable environment for students to actually enjoy what classes they are taking. Safety is one of the most important things in our school, and it is shown through the police officers and security guards that we have patrolling the halls, which provide a stable environment among ourselves. At any sports event, particularly the football games in the fall, our school community becomes even more tight-knit as we gather in the bleachers together, cheering and motivating our football team, regardless of the weather.', "It's a very interesting community at OT. I liked the sports programs the most, and I feel like they can do a better job with designing certain regulations. The tardy/detention system isn't very good in my opinion and that can definitely be fixed.", 'My overall experience at Old Tappan was great, the sports teams are very competitive and the academics is also very good. The food in the cafeteria is not the best but when you are a junior you have the option to leave the school and eat at home or go grab grub at a restaurant. Some of the teachers are lazy and sloppy but most are graduates from amazing schools. The teacher and student relationship is really great at Old Tappan and they are always on top to make sure that a student is living their best life.', 'My school has opened me up to so many opportunities in the field i would like to study. My teachers and students have been so supportive. Not many kids go into the field i would like to study who graduate from my school; so i am finding my own way but, with so much support from my administration and teachers. I am so grateful that i have had been exposed to so much music and theater. My school allowed me to participate in my state theater competition, and with their guidance i won. My school has helped so much, i just need to take the next step for myself, and do what i love to do.', "I loved being at a school where everyone is nice and willing to help you no matter what. The support system at my school was amazing. Every student should have the opportunity to go to a wonderful school like I did. I wouldn't change anything, just keep supporting the students!", "I'm only a sophomore at this school, but so far it's been enjoyable. All my classes are fine and I don't really have any problems with the teachers or students. There are many opportunities to get involved which I am now taking advantage of. My one complaint is the food. I live off chicken and some days I am very skeptical of what I am eating. Get the buffalo chicken and lo mein whenever it appears.", "Northern Valley Old Tappan is a very average school. People here like to pretend as they care so much about the students but really it's mostly about money. The majority of teachers are lazy but there are some really amazing ones that make up for it, the administration does not help. They care too much about others see the school rather than how the students feel.", 'Northern Valley Regional High School at Old Tappan is ranked among the top public high schools in all of the United States. It is located in a wealthy suburban area, just outside of New York City. This town is extremely safe and the people are more than welcoming. It is a great community to grow up in and I am fortunate to have gotten the chance to do so. Over my four years at Old Tappan, I developed into a strong individual who is more than ready for college and whatever else is to come on the road ahead. The teachers and faculty at Northern Valley Old Tappan (NVOT) are some of the best in the state of New Jersey and because of this, NVOT graduates go on to do amazing things.', "It's a great school.sdhbcjnaklmcfwnruqgihebjncklMOEFPWJIRHGUFIEJFEDJFBEDJWDEFHRFEJDWKJNEDMWMSDFFDFGERWRQFDDGSAEWHWUIIQWDKNJKSAL;", 'Although I have a reading and mathematical learning disability, my teachers have always played a huge role in why I have excelled throughout my entire high school career. Additionally, the school spirit and friends I have made have aided in my amazing time at my high school!', 'Northern Valley Regional High School is an excellent school that helped prepare me for college. The teachers were knowledgable and the Guidance department were extremely helpful through the college application process.', 'Best high school around, love the atmosphere. Clean school. Looks nice, great sporting teams. Many school wide events. Sports games are very fun. Great to bring my family and friends to on the weekends. Good and clean cafeteria. Very nice atmosphere. People are all very very nice. I have never had a bad experience while visiting this school. It seems very safe, with top security. the school is constantly being guarded and patrolled. Administration is very nice, respectful, understanding and helpful', 'The people have made my high school experience, not the school. Every understanding teacher, every friend and every laugh in class made my experience. The stress of the academics placed by the administration did not make my four years bearable. It was only the people.', 'Old Tappan has been one of the most educational and fun experiences of my life. Academically, our school excels in college readiness and our faculty continues to prove their merit in the success of their students once they move off to college and outdo their peers from rival schools. The atmosphere has always been a welcoming and exciting one, sports life is huge and school spirit is at a constant high. The support students show for their teams and fellow students and make me excited to participate in events. But, despite being an all-around good school- it is not perfect. The lack of a central air conitioning system  makes for steamy hallways at the beginning and end of the year near the summr months, this situation was recently improved with induvidual air conditioning units in different classrooms, but there is roo for improvment for the comfort of the staff and students.', 'Northern Valley helped prepare me for college and my future. The teachers are involved and take pride in our success. I would change LUNCH!!! The whole school eats at the same time and there are not enough seats for everyone!', 'At NVOT we had amazing teachers, guidance counselors and faculty. The school is such a tight knit community with so many opportunities, events, and learning resources available.', 'My experience with NVOT was very good! I never really had bad teachers, although I still heard about some. I was taught very well in most of my classes but in some, the teacher did not explain things very clearly. Sports were great to play in and to watch. The football team making it to MetLife twice was the highlight of the fall seasons. The themes of the football games always made it more fun to go and watch. It was a great time to hang out with people who sometimes you would not even talk to. Freshman year was a little rough with the whole friend situation, but after playing sports, I made friends. My guidance counselor, was so helpful throughout all of my years.', 'Great teachers and excellent academics. Everyone has so much school spirit and pride. Football games are a blast and it is so much fun to help support your school. NVOT has many sports, clubs, and activities that almost everyone is involved in at least one extracurricular.', 'NVOT is a wonderful public school with excellent college preparation and an understanding and effective administration.', 'Excellent School.......they really care about the students academically and socially. Great extracurricular and sports programs and things to do for any student. We moved to this area specifically so our daughter could attend NVOT']

column6: ['This is a great high school.  There are many options to challenge yourself and, if focused you can really do well and get into a great college. This is a school that has success in athletics, performing arts and music. There is school spirit , but not unity. You have to write a check for everything. If you cannot afford it there is nowhere to ask. The guidance department is not effective. They are reactive vs. proactive and they focus on top 5% and student athletes.  Their diversity effort is in having a Korean Parents Association.', "I honestly feel that the faculty did a great job. The only reason it isn't five stars is because high school is high school - there's always struggles for teens. But NVOT did a great job at trying to limit the amount of stressors on the students and faculty there.", "I liked this high school and proudly satisfied graduating from this high school since I got accepted from all colleges that I applied. This school truly shows that positive result coming from one's efforts. If you work hard in classes and always tried to catch up and even ahead of class, there is no way you cannot get an A.", 'Northern Valley Old Tappan is one of the most prestigious high school that definitely prepares its students for college. Not only is is challenging academically, but athletically as well. It is rare to come across a local public high school that so vigorously challenges and praises its students to do their best and successfully achieve the best outcomes. They work as hard as possible to provide the best resources for us to obtain the best education we can achieve. Teachers work tirelessly to help and drive their students in the best way possible. The school is overwhelmed with school spirit, showing that students have nothing but pride for the high school they go to.', "I feel that any school is highly dependent on the environment. The overall environment of NVOT is positive; like any school, there are diamonds in the rough-- teachers who are truly life-changing. On the flip side, there are teachers that couldn't care less about their students; however, this is apparent in any school. The diversity is severely lacking in this school; however, it isn't really the school's problem, as it is the location. It is overwhelmingly Caucasians, with a small population of Asians, an even smaller population of Latin Americans, and very few African Americans. Again, this isn't an issue that's entirety is to be blamed on the school. I would definitely like to see the food changed in the future. It's strange that french fries cost $1.50 while a salad cost $4. Honestly, it's the select few teachers here that truly made this school worth going to: it's the support they gave and the willingness they had to help their students.", "Northern Valley Regional High School Old Tappan has prepared me to become an adult and to further my education.  The teachers are all extremely supportive of one's goals and ambition.  They also apply direction and encourage the students to receive higher education.", 'I liked the studies and academic programs which I think will prep me well for college.  Athletic programs are good, very competitive in most sports.  Teachers and administrators are above average, very involved and interested in students.', 'Not diverserved at all. Like not in the least, everybody is the exact same. So this leads the students (mostly the girls) to believe they NEED to be the same in every aspect (same...clothes, mentality, feeling of superiority over others, ect). If you’re not, well you’re just socially unacceptable. I’m not going to lie, personally I do not look very different from everyone else (blonde and blue eyes). However, I have means to believe I think differently from everyone else. Therefore, I never want to get into the stuck up crowd so I stay FAR away from them. If you’re coming to this school, I suggest you do the same and brace yourself for mean girls 2.0!!', "NVOT is a great school that allows their students to explore their character all while getting an awesome education. The teachers truly care about their students. Even if you don't participate in sports, being in the crowd is just as interactive and fun. The only negative would be the food offered at lunch. NVOT is a personable, safe place that I've made into my second home.", "The clubs and activities that were allowed for me to try as a student were absolutely great. Sometimes it was a bit difficult to afford certain necessities like prom, but they were happy to set up payment plans or give reduced fees based on my situation. The teachers I've had are all great at making sure that their workload wasn't too much as well. Overall, it has been a great experience.", 'Coming from an immigrant family, all my parents wanted for me to do was go to school and learn more than they could. At Old Tappan, I was able to receive one of the best educations in the state and my area. I enjoyed all the classes I attended, feeling happy with both the content and my teachers. I felt as if the staff was always there and cared for the students, and gave them more time than was necessary, just to help. Aside from academics, the student body was amazing. The school has such a sense of unity and pride in being good at sports, academics, and more.  There always was endles oppertunities for everyone, reguardless of interests. There was always something for everyone.', "NVOT is a great school that gives many opportunities to students for their future. The teachers promote positivity and the schoolwork is not too easy. Additionally, the people who attend NVOT are friendly and are not exclusive. The clubs and activities are also great, but I think there should be a little more clubs that help students learn more about the career they want to follow. Overall, it's a great experience.", 'Great school with amazing sports programs and extracurricular activities. Great faculty and teachers who foster growth and help get ready for college.', 'NVOT is an excellent school that prepares their students for college and beyond.  My oldest daughter graduated last year and is now attending Cornell University where she is finding the work load to be very manageable. Thanks to NVOT for the preparation. My other daughter is now in her second year at the High School and has so many AP courses to choose from going forward. I do t feel any new changes are necessary at this time. They have made many upgrades since my old eats was a Freshman.', 'If your child is not an athlete or an honors student, do not expect to get much support from the guidance department.', 'NVOT has great resources and teachers that opens up their students to diverse opportunities. They have many experts that would help students go through complicated college application process, not only by conducting numerous seminars, but also having many one-on-one meeting with the students. Academically as well, NVOT provides students with the best possible environment through various AP courses, tutoring, workshops and more!', 'I was a transfer student, but my counselor was very helpful transitioning me into the school. Also, got a lot of help when it was time to apply for college!', 'Regional highschool in a wealthy area allows for excellent facilities coupled with excellent teaching. Even though a regional school, class size is still moderate to allow for ample help for each student. However, as with any regional school some kids can fall through the cracks.', 'Northern Valley Old Tappan is a great place to advance your education while also getting involved in countless activities tailored to you! It readily prepares students for a life outside of high school.', "The school has stellar academics and athletics for a public school. There is usually at least one Ivy League bound student each year, and those who don't go to any Ivy schools usually end up at schools close in ranking."]
