At any sports event, particularly the football games in the fall, our school community becomes even more tight-knit as we gather in the bleachers together, cheering and motivating our football team, regardless of the weather.', "It's a very interesting community at OT. I liked the sports programs the most, and I feel like they can do a better job with designing certain regulations. The tardy/detention system isn't very good in my opinion and that can definitely be fixed.", 'My overall experience at Old Tappan was great, the sports teams are very competitive and the academics is also very good. The food in the cafeteria is not the best but when you are a junior you have the option to leave the school and eat at home or go grab grub at a restaurant. Some of the teachers are lazy and sloppy but most are graduates from amazing schools. The teacher and student relationship is really great at Old Tappan and they are always on top to make sure that a student is living their best life.', 'My school has opened me up to so many opportunities in the field i would like to study. My teachers and students have been so supportive. Not many kids go into the field i would like to study who graduate from my school; so i am finding my own way but, with so much support from my administration and teachers. I am so grateful that i have had been exposed to so much music and theater. My school allowed me to participate in my state theater competition, and with their guidance i won. My school has helped so much, i just need to take the next step for myself, and do what i love to do.', "I loved being at a school where everyone is nice and willing to help you no matter what. The support system at my school was amazing. Every student should have the opportunity to go to a wonderful school like I did. I wouldn't change anything, just keep supporting the students!", "I'm only a sophomore at this school, but so far it's been enjoyable. All my classes are fine and I don't really have any problems with the teachers or students. There are many opportunities to get involved which I am now taking advantage of. My one complaint is the food. I live off chicken and some days I am very skeptical of what I am eating. Get the buffalo chicken and lo mein whenever it appears.", "Northern Valley Old Tappan is a very average school. People here like to pretend as they care so much about the students but really it's mostly about money. The majority of teachers are lazy but there are some really amazing ones that make up for it, the administration does not help. They care too much about others see the school rather than how the students feel.", 'Northern Valley Regional High School at Old Tappan is ranked among the top public high schools in all of the United States. It is located in a wealthy suburban area, just outside of New York City. This town is extremely safe and the people are more than welcoming. It is a great community to grow up in and I am fortunate to have gotten the chance to do so. Over my four years at Old Tappan, I developed into a strong individual who is more than ready for college and whatever else is to come on the road ahead. The teachers and faculty at Northern Valley Old Tappan (NVOT) are some of the best in the state of New Jersey and because of this, NVOT graduates go on to do amazing things.', "It's a great school.sdhbcjnaklmcfwnruqgihebjncklMOEFPWJIRHGUFIEJFEDJFBEDJWDEFHRFEJDWKJNEDMWMSDFFDFGERWRQFDDGSAEWHWUIIQWDKNJKSAL;", 'Although I have a reading and mathematical learning disability, my teachers have always played a huge role in why I have excelled throughout my entire high school career. Additionally, the school spirit and friends I have made have aided in my amazing time at my high school!', 'Northern Valley Regional High School is an excellent school that helped prepare me for college. The teachers were knowledgable and the Guidance department were extremely helpful through the college application process.', 'Best high school around, love the atmosphere. Clean school. Looks nice, great sporting teams. Many school wide events. Sports games are very fun. Great to bring my family and friends to on the weekends. Good and clean cafeteria. Very nice atmosphere. People are all very very nice. I have never had a bad experience while visiting this school. It seems very safe, with top security. the school is constantly being guarded and patrolled. Administration is very nice, respectful, understanding and helpful', 'The people have made my high school experience, not the school. Every understanding teacher, every friend and every laugh in class made my experience. The stress of the academics placed by the administration did not make my four years bearable. It was only the people.', 'Old Tappan has been one of the most educational and fun experiences of my life. Academically, our school excels in college readiness and our faculty continues to prove their merit in the success of their students once they move off to college and outdo their peers from rival schools. The atmosphere has always been a welcoming and exciting one, sports life is huge and school spirit is at a constant high. The support students show for their teams and fellow students and make me excited to participate in events. But, despite being an all-around good school- it is not perfect. The lack of a central air conitioning system  makes for steamy hallways at the beginning and end of the year near the summr months, this situation was recently improved with induvidual air conditioning units in different classrooms, but there is roo for improvment for the comfort of the staff and students.', 'Northern Valley helped prepare me for college and my future. The teachers are involved and take pride in our success. I would change LUNCH!!! The whole school eats at the same time and there are not enough seats for everyone!', 'At NVOT we had amazing teachers, guidance counselors and faculty. The school is such a tight knit community with so many opportunities, events, and learning resources available.', 'My experience with NVOT was very good! I never really had bad teachers, although I still heard about some. I was taught very well in most of my classes but in some, the teacher did not explain things very clearly. Sports were great to play in and to watch. The football team making it to MetLife twice was the highlight of the fall seasons. The themes of the football games always made it more fun to go and watch. It was a great time to hang out with people who sometimes you would not even talk to. Freshman year was a little rough with the whole friend situation, but after playing sports, I made friends. My guidance counselor, was so helpful throughout all of my years.', 'Great teachers and excellent academics. Everyone has so much school spirit and pride. Football games are a blast and it is so much fun to help support your school. NVOT has many sports, clubs, and activities that almost everyone is involved in at least one extracurricular.', 'NVOT is a wonderful public school with excellent college preparation and an understanding and effective administration.', 'Excellent School.......they really care about the students academically and socially. Great extracurricular and sports programs and things to do for any student. We moved to this area specifically so our daughter could attend NVOT']

column2: ["I actually really enjoyed high school, in part because of Ms. Lacey, the security guards who were awesome people, and my friends. The school also has a ton of awesome facilities like a dark room for photo, a huge theater stage with lighting equipment, and a new building. It also has a really good music program. Obviously it has its problems, and I didn't have a lot of good experiences with teachers there, but I learned a lot and enjoyed myself. The learning approach there is really effective and prepared me well for college. It could definitely be more diverse, especially economically.", 'I love Beacon mainly because of its resources. The music department is especially nice, as the current music teacher helped in the design of the new building to make the entire basement dedicated to music. There are plenty of bands and ensembles open for everyone to join, but classes focus mostly on production and audio engineering using Pro Tools and Logic.', 'As a student at The Beacon School, I truly had a great experience here over the years. The teachers are very committed to assuring that you are doing well in class and they constantly make themselves available and ensure that they tell us all the times they are free so we could come to them with any problems. I also believe they allow the students to have a great support system especially when it came to college. The guidance counselors and college counselors are very involved aand on top of making sure students do not feel extremely stressed throughout the process. Also, I always feel safe in school and leaving school, the safety there is outstanding because the teachers and guards lookout for the students immensely. As for something I would change, I wish there was more of a diversity of activities and clubs although there is a good amount now.', 'Beacon creates such a unique and welcoming environment for students who are looking to find their passion! At Beacon I met so many of my current best friends who have inspired and taught me so much artistically as well as cognitively. The teachers I have had at Beacon have, for the most part, given me very valuable insight in the field they taught; they helped me shape my politics with a more keen eye for details and showed me the trials and tribulations of the real world and how to navigate them. Through the Beacon music department, I was able to find the trade which I plan to major in college and the career I hope to foster. The music department faculty has given me countless opportunities to experiment musically and to learn the "tricks of the trade" in the music industry.I have felt nothing but welcomed and valued at Beacon!', 'Great School ... The Academics is very good and the teacher are the best. Very good school. The sport teams are very good winning many championship', 'The Beacon School has great academics and really pushes its students to work hard and do their best. It provides students with a great education and gives them a lot of opportunities to be involved in the community. I felt challenged in a good way in this school and I was able to thrive academically.', "The building is very beautiful and welcoming.  The atmosphere is very nice and most people are very open.  It is a school with a lot of cliques which can make it challenging to make new friends, but other than that it is a good school socially.   In terms of teachers, some of them are understanding and some aren't.  You could be stuck with a really good teacher or a really bad one (it's just a matter of luck).", "The building itself is beautiful: vibrant, colorful, and kept clean, thus honestly one of the most unique and 'aesthetic' schools I've seen in NY. Many of the teachers care about their students education, and I've had many who really enjoy the subject(s) they teach. The school does give a lot of difficult work, and it can become quite stressful at times. The school is college preparatory, so the influx of material at its level is suitable if you want to get accustom to college work before you actually attend, but, if you cannot keep up, you will fall behind easily, and it can really hurt your GPA. Most teachers are understanding and allow extensions if asked, plus tutoring and help sessions. The school is very accommodating, and offers many resources, so for me personally this has been extremely beneficial. Despite the challenges, I feel I got really lucky to attend a school that takes its student seriously, and offers them a lot of support when prepping for their future.", 'excellent academics. Amazing and supportive teachers. The workload was tough to manage sometimes, but it definitely prepared me for college.', 'The history department is phenomenal and they push you to your best.  Although the same cannot be said for the science department. Unfortunately, Beacon is a school for those interested in pursuing the humanities and not STEM.', "Great school with vigorous academics. Beacon will challenge one's typical way of thinking. It offers wonderful opportunities to visit abroad, for summer programs and for scholarships. The college office is great resource and prepare you for college and the college process.", 'Beacon has a plethora of cool and interesting resources, from a range of art facilities to excellent history programs, but it lacks on the diversity front, creating a somewhat elitist environment that can be rough to deal with as a student of color.', 'Beacon provides students with strong written and verbal skills that can be used in higher education. Their location is extremely convenient.', 'Excellent program with something for everyone.  Work prepares you for college.  Lots of support from teachers.', 'The teachers are very supportive! The sport teams are very good! The learning disability help is very strong! There is a little bit too much homework but might prepare students for college.', "This is a wonderful school. The teachers are amazing and they care so much. When you need help or are struggling you can always rely on the teachers at beacon to lift you up and provide you with the help you need. The teachers here are not only concerned with your academic progress but they also care about you're well being and what is going on at home. If you need an extension they work with you to make sure you are benefitting from your classes. The students are highly motivated and care a lot about school and each other. I definetly reconment this school to any prospective students.", 'Beacon is overhyped. The teachers tend to forget that their students have 4 other classes that they get homework for. Some teachers at Beacon don’t care about their students, don’t even know their students names. Then the drug problem here is out of control and Beacon does nothing about it. Kids going through mental health and this school does nothing about it. I’m not even learning in any of my classes. This school is literally a circus. So many things this school has to improve on it’s ridiculous...', 'Beacon is a great school and I am so glad that I selected it. The teachers care so deeply for their students and have supported me throughout the college application processes. The facilities are new and beautiful. I have had to work very hard but I have met so many passionate, creative, and unique people.', 'Beacon is a wonderful place, that balances the sciences, arts, and humanities, making every student a well-rounded person who is willing to learn. Because of the lack of regents, teachers are allowed to teach whatever they please, often what they are more passionate about. This makes every class more interesting, fun, and rewarding. Despite the academic rigor and flourishing after school life, there are quite a few students who do not care. Beacon has systems to help them do well in school, and socially/emotionally, but this area could play a larger role in student life.', "Very good school for students who excel and don't let themselves be defined by a letter/grade. Being that the education system is different than most public schools, it provides a lot of room for personal growth and allows you to find yourself academically."]

column6: ['The teachers tend to forget that everyone has 4 other classes in addition to their class, so the amount of homework and assignments is really excessive. There is virtually no SAT or ACT preporation (or preporation for any standardized test). The math department with the exception of a few teachers is very subpar. Transitioning into college is very difficult because of this, so despite the efforts of preparing students for college, those who are not considering a liberal arts degree will have a lot of difficulty with test-taking and staying on track with the ideal 4-year college plan. The other thing about Beacon is that its really difficult to make friends when half of the student population comes from the same middle school. Not only is there a lack of diversity in terms of where students are coming from, but most students are white and have rich parents.', "Although the Beacon School does offer a lot of experiences - whether that be in sports, dance, theatre, music, etc - it tends to assert its primary focus on those four categories. As someone whose passion is primarily literature, I find it difficult to branch out and find clubs, activities, or electives that pertain to me. There are many art electives and the beacon drama department is a huge part of my school but in my four years attending, every literature based elective has been removed and nearly every club, as well. There is no AP English but there's more than one AP science class. I think it's great that so much is proposed and suggested at Beacon but I wish writers like me were exposed to bigger and better opportunities, as well.", "Great challenging academics and some well meaning good teachers. A lot of upper class white students that are sometimes ignorant to others, typical to a fancy Manhattan school. Administration and staff is constantly changing due to people leaving. I was a High achieving student with an IEP and got almost no support. Beacons negligence and disregard of mental illness and special needs students essentially led me to not being able to graduate. If you have one problem they'll quickly suggest you transfer to City As or other alternative schools to get you off their hands. Don't apply if you're someone who needs any extra resources.", 'As a junior attending the Beacon school I really appreciate the amount of college preparation we receive as students. However, I would change the work load of certain subjects and diversify courses provided.', "I like how Beacon is a hard school and prepares you for college. The students at Beacon are not only smart but are also very talented in sports and/or arts. I couldn't imagine myself at any other school.", 'I think overall my school has done a very good job of finding a multitude of different types of teachers to fit different types of students. There is a place for everyone at my school and I think that is where they excel the most.', "The Beacon School offers students a well-rounded and rigorous education that prepares them for college as well as their future endeavors. The school's atmosphere is friendly and the building is state of the art ready. Teachers have tutoring time set aside and have wonderful working relationships with their students. Highly recommended!", 'The large building allows for an incredible learning environment! The teachers are experienced and passionate, and there are many opportunities to step outside of your comfort zone with a broad range of electives, clubs and sports!', 'I graduated from Beacon this past June of 2018. Going to Beacon, was an experience I will never forget. As a freshman, I was encouraged to think critically beyond textbook readings and into the real world. A phrase used by my history teacher sophomore year that I will never forget was: “history is written by the winner, therefore we must be critical of every point of view we read.” At Beacon I received a liberal arts education where I was able to grow as a student and world citizen since my focus was not on taking regents (students at the school don’t take them). Although we received heavy homework loads, my teachers really did care about my education and motivated me. One thing the school can definitely do better is pay closer attention to mental health and teach its students how to deal with stress in a positive way.', "I had just graduated from Beacon (Class of 2018, WOO WOO!) My four years in this high school were, hard and challenging. But my teachers always encouraged me to keep going, and all the sleepless nights of doing homework or catching up with classwork was not for nothing! I received an amazing education and now I'm off UPenn (so excited) UPenn has been my dream college since forever and Beacon helped me achieve it. I love that overall the whole school is so easy going. During free or lunch periods, we can hangout out in the hallways, the library, the staff's rooms (wherever really). Overall my high school experience was worth it.", "I'm a current junior at Beacon, and my last 3 years have been absolutely amazing. Teachers and other students are really caring and you can go to them if you need any help without worrying about judgement, or whatsoever. I made a lot of great friends, and although sometimes the HW or workload can get to be a lot, you will receive an amazing education. Just a tip: don't procrastinate. Especially freshmen year", "When I was enrolled, I didn't realize how well my classes would prepare me for college. I wrote countless essays under very short amounts of time, so once I got to college, every essay seemed way easier. Though many professors had their flaws, a lot of them knew what they were doing and what worked. They did their best to help us succeed and how to be mindful of the real world. I wish that the college office was more helpful, but they did provide the resources I needed as a low income student.", 'If you are looking for a school with prestige academia that simultaneously incorporates the arts, then Beacon is the school for you.', "Solid school, good academics, supportive teachers. Main complaint: some kids wind up with very light workloads while others are drowning in essays, readings, tests, projects etc. Certain teachers disregard the fact that students are taking classes other than theirs... so it can be extremely intense and overwhelming at times. Despite this, teachers have lots of extra hours-- they want you to do well, and will respect you if you respect them. Like any other school, there are numerous flaws. While I have gotten a very good education for the most part, I'm not entirely sure if the stress was worth it!", 'A lot of the teachers are passionate about the subjects that they teach and they are absolutely dedicated to the success of their students. Although the curriculum is quite rigorous, all teachers are willing to dedicate their free time helping students catch up and/ or make sure that they understand the lessons.', 'I love the different classes you could take, from electives to the math, science, history and english courses. Every teacher is enthused about teaching and loves their students.', "the workload is a lot but by the time you're done I promise, you will be prepared for almost any school. Most teachers are easy to talk to the school is beautiful as well and has new facilities. You're basically getting a private school education and experience through a public school.", "I like the wide variety of courses and after school activities made available at Beacon. We are not just focused on one specific major like science and instead we are very holistic and are allowed to specialize in many different disciplines like art and math or just focus on one discipline like film. I also appreciate the freedom that we are given and how we can challenge rules we don't like and have honest conversations with the administrators. Finally, Beacon is a very good school for social justice, as many teachers encourage students to think for themselves and express their opinions and fight for what they believe in.", 'Love it! I think that the Beacon High School has the best academics and it has pushed my interests in multiple areas to new levels.', 'Beacon has many resources that work to make all their students successful. The college office is very helpful during the college process and you can walk in to ask questions at any point throughout the school day. Teachers have free periods and tutoring bands where you can talk to them if you need help.']
column8: ['Beacon is one of the foremost schools in the NYC area, pushing for a progressive and secular education which prepares its students for the rigors of college. Freshmen will be drilled from their first day on the art of writing essays for the various fields of work they may take in the future. They learn how to cite information in multiple formats, for dozens of career paths, under the tutelage of professors who have a vested interest not just in their academic success, but in their social and mental prosperity as well.', 'Needs more diversity. This school has a ton of opportunities and has a great principal. However, it would be even better if different types of students came here. Way too many kids come from MS51 and Park Slope, and there is definitely some issues with class divides. It has great music and arts programs, an awesome cross country team, a fantastic college office, and so many clubs and activities.', 'In terms of academics the courses are rigorous and do require substantial amount of work. The teachers and faculty, at least most of them, do a good job of teaching their classes and pushing students to become better critical thinkers and better express themselves. They are also very helpful when it comes to tutoring. The school offers a variety of after school clubs and activities for students to enjoy and become a part of. Diversity at beacon is relatively poor as there is an abundance of one race of the others.', 'It is an amazing opportunity to be selected by this school. It has prepared me how to write essays through English and History classes. The teachers care about their students and prepare meaningful lessons throughout their curriculum. Debates and creativity is apart of every class’ environment, furthering our understandings on the lessons and allows making real world connections. The school focuses on the students’ growth to become active citizens in today’s society and encourages students to work hard for their successes. The school’s culture is amazing because it allows students to be academically and artistically active within the community. The Music, Film, Dance, Drama, and Arts departments are enriched with talented and intelligent teachers who also like to challenge students to become comitted and innovative.', 'The Beacon School will push you out of your comfort zone in order for you to thrive as an individual. The teachers there will support you and your peers will guide you in your journey of maturing as a student. At times, the workload can be overwhelming but your hard work will pay off because Beacon is preparing you for college.', 'It is a very rigorous school and prepares students for college. However, it lacks diversity and is not very inclusive of marginalized students.', 'This school is extremely racially biased. It is predominantly white and they favor those type of students. It is challenging in the fact that most classes are honors.', 'I really like the community that The Beacon School has to offer. I have learned so much and it really is a genuine privilege to be able to attend such a good school. The arts are extremely appreciated at this school, and the wide range of electives and classes ensures that one is always in at least one class that they enjoy. I am especially fond of the dance company at beacon and all the really cool shows that they put on every year.', "I really like how there is a lot of college counselors to help you with your college process. I think that the amount of work that we do here prepares us for college but the work here is time-consuming and there's just so much work. Especially in the History and English classes.", 'Beacon is highly overrated and gets by on reputation but does very little to maintain quality. The teachers are unresponsive and the administration is beyond unhelpful. If you do not have money, do not expect to feel comfortable or welcome at the school. I am in education and have been involved in many schools both as a parent and as an educator and I can tell you that the fact that only 42% of the teachers find the principal effective is not something to be taken lightly. From the top down there is little sense of caring or warmth. My son is a junior at the school and if I could undo this decision, I would. My other child did not even put it on the list. My son is a good student and has made friends and done fine academically, but there are so many places where your child will not just get by but thrive. Keep looking!', "Though Beacon is an incredibly creative and artistic school, it's definitely difficult to have an opinion different from the people surrounding you. People like to argue that it's a very acceptive environment because modt students support lgbtqia+ rights and black rights but if anyone were to have a different perspective, there would be a definite uproar. It's also extremely hard to find friends if you aren't outgoing, athletic, or came from a different middle school than the majority of the kids already there. Some of the teachers are pretty rude and just plain mean while others are angels and actually passionate about their field of work and the school.", 'The Beacon School has been an excellent experience to date, my child is now a sophomore. Engaged teachers, parents and kids.', 'The academics are hardcore, teachers can be controversial but the English and History departments are the hardest.', "Students don't learn through textbooks. Instead classes are led by discussions, allows for creativity, environment is very safe to ask questions. Teachers are amazing, and know their material very well. Every year students are to do a project based assessments, which is a great way to prepare for college.", 'When I reflect on the time I spent at Beacon, I can only remember the positives. Granted I am a graduate from the old building, the culture that was fostered there was one that prioritized personal and communal responsibility in and out of the school. As I am exposed to new people in my classes every semester in college, I am always grateful for the things that I have learned at Beacon academically as well as the core values that many people seem to be indifferent about.', 'The culture was very elite and there is no communication with the parents. Policies did not include the students.', "I've learned so much and really grown as a student and person at the Beacon School. Teachers push you to do your best and your peers are your motivators. You can always go to them if you have a question or problem. The work is a lot and can sometimes be overwhelming but makes you proud of yourself in the end and allows you to realize your capabilities. I've made amazing friends for life and am so happy I went to Beacon.", 'Teachers in the school are amazing and try their best to help you out. The students there are open minded and work hard to succeed. There are so many activities and clubs to join. The best part is the surrounding area of NYC and all it has to offer.', 'Beacon has to help me find my confidence and figure what I love to do and how to apply that to the real world. The college consumers are very optimistic yet very real with where you are as a student. The teachers are some of the best I experiences in my life they are truly amazing. They are truly passionate about what they are teaching and that really translates how they teach. The opportunities in the school are amazing and there is a willingness to help everyone no matter where they are academically and socially', 'Beacon is a great school, but there are many social issues among the students and the school is driven by fundraising and "recommend" $1000 per household. On the other hand, Beacon has helped me greatly prepare for my college process and academics.']

column2: ['I have only been here for a little while but everything from the teachers to the food is great.  I think that it is a very cool community to be in, and the clubs that you can be apart of are awesome.', 'Tappan Zee High School has an amazing staff.  My teachers always helped me when I needed them and they were one of my main supporters in finding a college right for me.', 'The school over all is a fine school. It is your average suburban  white bread school. it is mostly made up of blue color workers. In this political, polarized environment it is hard to talk to friends about the state of our country. Most of the students just follow their parents lead on this state of affairs. My parents are on opposite sides. So I made up my own mind on whats right and wrong. I feel it has separated out of people in this school. There is always the normal clicks and social tensions but now it is even harder to get along.', 'Tappan Zee High school is a very frustrating place due to the fact that there is inconsistency. The math department is extremely lacking for lower ranking maths, yet the science department is very good. The school needs to raise the bar across the board and fire a lot of people at that school.', 'Tappan Zee is a great public high school. From great teachers and education to impressive sports team to being extremely safe, there is not much to complain about TZ.', 'The best high school experience anyone can ask for is at Tappan Zee. A diverse set of classes and clubs to take, and everyone is treated like family. The teachers are determined to make sure that their students can be the best they can be and that they are well prepared for college.', 'Teachers and coaches are invested in making the school great. Teachers can relate to HS students. Plenty of opportunities to participate in sports, clubs, leadership programs and honor societies. Everyone is accepted for the person they are. There are all types of students and they accept each other and work side by side each other. There is tremendous school spirit. Many students attend sporting events, concerts, etc. Students want to do well in school and help and support each other. There is a feeling of community and family throughout the school. The academic classes ate challenging but fair. They have all different levels to support all of th students and their individual abilities. The building is maintained in a nice way and there are many renovations being done to keep it up to date.', 'My high school is one of best in our county, even the East Coast. Everyone here is extremely inclusive and all students have a collective appreciation of the outstanding education this school offers.', 'This school is one of the best high schools in the region. The school has some great faculty who work extremely hard to provide students with a well rounded education. In addition, the school is very strong in sports, taking home many titles and trophies. This high school is just one of the many stellar schools in the South Orangetown School District.', 'I have had a good experience at this school. It is very clean and the teachers are friendly. I have never witnessed any bullying and there are strict rules against it. Most of the students are friendly and I think the school and the community is very good and I am proud to have attended this school.', 'My experience at Tappan Zee High School really shaped the person I am today. Not only have I found a great group of friends, but my level of understanding for many different ideas and subjects has broadened so much thanks to the wonderful teachers. This school created a great sense of community for me, with support from everyone around. I am very thankful that I got to attend this school.', "I have had a great 4 years at TZHS. As a senior, I have had many of the schools teachers and most except for a select few are the best I have ever had. The sports facilites and the teams are all excellent and I wouldn't choose to ever be in any other fan section.", 'I love my school. There are so many activities and clubs to get involved, and best of all funding is equally spread across music, theater, language, athletics, and more so that no one activity is favored. I find the learning style very hands on but also very informative and depending on the classes one chooses to take, the coursework is very diverse and just challenging enough.', 'Great highschool, really involved community, great area, not much more to ask for. Everyone at the school is great and willing to help you at any time', 'Tappan Zee High School is a large school where everybody gets to know each other through connectivity in the classroom, extracurricular activities, and athletic events. There is always a great turnout at sports games and for art happenings such as open mics for musicians and poets. Student involvement plays a big role in getting things done. However, the teachers are always willing to listen and provide for student projects. Overall, everyone I know has loved their experience with Tappan Zee High School and was well-prepared for college.', 'During my three years at Tappan Zee I encountered very nice people and helpful teachers that want you to succeed. In the future I would like to see it become more diverse because it would great to see different cultures mixed in. A lot of the students have know each other since they were little and it might be hard for a new student to find a group of people to relate to or connect with. Overall, I never had a problem and since it is a close-knit community, everyone looks out for one another.', 'I enjoy how easily accepting people are in diverse culture, seeing that I have travelled and have been isolated because of my cultural diversity. I would like to see the newcomer involvement change in future times.', 'Tappan Zee overall is a nice school. However, there is very little diversity among the student body.', "Tappan Zee High School is a very nice school with lots of opportunity to further one's education. For four years students are given help to follow any career path they may be interested in. Whether it is a career in music, engineering, teaching or art, TZHS offers classes students can participate in throughout their high school journey. Not to mention the many sports and clubs students can get involved with. The teachers and other staff are very friendly and will gladly help students out with any problem they may be facing. Overall my experience at Tappan Zee was great. Personally I had an amazing time, made lots of new friends, participated in sports, and learned quite a lot.", "Tappan Zee High School is a place I consider my second home. There was never a day that I didn't want to go to school. I got to hang out with my friends while getting a great education and playing the sports I love. While the school can seem a little run down at times, our administrators do a great job of getting up all new recreational and educational equipment. I'm glad that for the past 4 years of my life I had the pleasure of attending such a great school."]

column8: ['Most of the teachers are excellent. They truly care about the students and go above and beyond what is required. The teachers use a lot of technology and a variety of teaching modalities. Grades are posted on a portal and access is given to students and parents to track progress. Parent teacher conferences are held every year and teachers will call or email when questions or concerns arise.', 'This is a very safe school. There are security guards at all entrances and doors are kept locked. All visitors are required to show identification. There is some bullying, but there are programs in place to minimize it and it is made known that bullying will not be tolerated. The health program is excellent and covers a wide variety of important topics and the  school nurse is great!', "Tappan Zee High School is known as one of the best high schools in Rockland County. The teachers are excellent and care about the students. There are clubs and activities for a variety of interests. There is a Spirit Week and a Zee Night to show school spirit and have some fun. Project Lead the Way offers classes in Engineering and there are many opportunities to earn college credits. I can't think of a better place to go to high school!", 'The academics are fantastic. There are 28 APs offered, which is not typical of a public high school.', 'The guards and the officer are very friendly and always look out for the students, and are available at all times to talk or anything you need. Also the health teacher is very friendly and tries her best to make sure everyone is adequately aware of consent, contraception, and the dangers of drugs. People respect her, and I think she does a good job. The school nurse is also helpful and friendly.', 'There are so many possibilities and opportunities that everyone has a chance to become involved.', "Everyone is very accepting, and embraces different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, and sexual orientation groups. There is no peer pressure: if you don't want to do something, you don't have to. This is in part due to the training programs for athletic teams, which teaches them about a different prevalent subject every week: gender and gender roles, oppression and bullying, etc.", 'There are 28 AP courses offered, which is a lot for a public school. The teachers are knowledgeable, and they are always wiling to teach anyone who wants to learn. Workload is as expected, but manageable. If there are extenuating circumstances, teachers are always willing to work with you to make up assignments or learn lessons.', "The school nurse is highly qualified and always willing to help. The officer for our school is very friendly and approachable, and he is always willing to help in any situation. The security guards also are very kind, and smart. One of them is my friend's father. The health teacher is very kind, and knowledgeable, and she really tries to teach everyone about safe sex and the dangers of drugs. Everyone respects her, and I think because of her efforts students are aware of consent and drug dangers.", 'There are a lot of extracurriculars, and if students want to form their own club, they can. It is relatively simple. There is a lot of funding for clubs, and the advisors are always helpful and eager for the students to participate.', "The school is a fantastic school, where you get amazing education: 28 AP courses are offered, across a broad span of subjects, and there are many honors courses as well. Student input on what classes they'd like is considered- a new Women and Gender Studies class was just created for that reason. Sports and athletics are important, and serve to bond the community, but are not the only things that matter in the school. The music department is very strong, as is the art department, and a lot of kids, even the 'jocks', come to the school plays. In fact, the main lead in the play was a football player. Everyone seeks to help the students, and the atmosphere is generally good. The only thing I would change about it is to have a senior-level history course, because right now, if you take AP European History junior year, there are no other histories that can be taken.", "The teachers are interested in the students, and actively incorporate the student's knowledge and creativity into lessons and other classroom activities. The teachers are also highly knowledgeable and are free with their knowledge, always willing to discuss either in or out of class anything that they know, or anything the student is interested. If I come back to a previous teacher and ask for help on a paper, or want to discuss current events, they are always willing. This is also true for my current teachers, who make time to see me and help with work I do not understand. The staff is excellent, young, and highly motivated to make a difference in the student's lives.", 'Most of the teachers are very knowledgeable and truly want their students to succeed, which in my opinion is the best asset of the school. I have met some nice people here as well. Aside from these facts, I would not choose this school again if I could do it all over for many reasons, mostly due to the fact that my personal experiences were not life changing or incredibly memorable.', 'The school does not help the average student as much as those that really succeed or those really struggling.', 'My school is relatively large so I found many people with the same interests as me.', 'My teachers are on the most part very understanding and willing to help students outside of school hours.', 'only participate in sports related activities and programs for the most part', 'student involvement in activities supporting other teams', 'They work well with students that need extra help', 'I think that the health and safety policies at this school are pretty good. The security guards tend to get along with the students, so the student know that they can go to them for anything. The school nurse is very friendly and is able to calm you down if you are panicking. There is a police officer at the school for majority of the day.']

column2: ['There is a lot of participation involved and it requires us to be very vocal and involved in the lessons. I feel very prepared for life in the future.', "I love my experience with the school.  You can really tell the teachers want you to succeed, and I always feel like part of a community.  The funding is focused on learning opportunities and curriculums such as out IB program, and not only do we learn new information and become better students, we learn life skills that allow us to become better people. We may have to declaim, which seems tedious, but that allows us to grow in public speaking, and the feeling one has after a successful declamation is a great one. Sure, we may have to share a building with other schools (which might be more of a problem later on, with our school's rapid growth and all), and sure, we may not have consistent  Airconditioning and Heating, but in my opinion, that's a small price to pay for all the experiences we've been through, the people I've met, and the growth we've had.  All in all, I wouldn't replace my school for any other.", 'Teachers are great. They are not the kind that are there just for a paycheck. They care about the students and their jobs.  They really work hard to see their students succeed.', "My experience has been pretty remarkable. The school has been an exciting challenge for me all four years, and I have made so many incredible relationships with so many diverse groups of people. I do not regret my high school decision and I wouldn't trade it for anything.", 'Brooklyn Latin has allowed me to figure out my interest through introductions to Various topics. While here, I am able to meet so many people allowing me to learn about and understand so many cultures and ideas that stemmed from them. I was not only able to find out what type of student I am but also what type of person I am and want to be.', 'Im a Sophmore transfer student and I already hate this school. I feel restricted I’m more used to wearing my own clothes and having the freedom to buy food for lunch but they don’t have that their outlunch is basically playing outside so now I’m back to my old schedule of starving myself as the school food is just terrible. There was mistakes in the schedule on the first day of school and I was placed in the wrong class. Another thing is there’s something called declamations it basically where you have to memorize a text in a class and they have this in Spanish. Then you talk about it or something but it’s all in front of the class. This school just reminds me on a catholic school plus no one really likes the school. I feel restricted and it’s not good for my mind I’m literally having anxiety which is not fun.', 'I like the education because it was above and beyond what most high schools offer. They even offered opportunities outside of school.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School was fairly hard to get admitted to and I am glad I worked hard enough to get the opportunity to attend this school. The school has one thing that I love the most about it and that is community. Fellow students are often nice but the teachers are the absolute best I have ever had compared to any of the other schools I have attended. The teachers have closer relationships with students as this is a fairly small school and they care for students so much.', 'I am a recent alumna and very proud. Although we are a small school with a tight budget, TBLS has introduced me to a diverse community full of many personalities and opinions. This allowed for interesting conversations, seminars, and fun times. The rigor of academics can be overwhelming at times, so I deeply appreciate the fact that every teacher is always willing to help and has dedicated office hours.', 'The teachers are the best part of this school. It was really small when I was there and I am not sure if it is still the same but I had a close relationship with the teachers. They really wanted you to learn.', 'Every teacher I had was very approachable with any problems that I might have had during my time there.', 'Amazing community of students and staff. Incredible educational opportunities paired with personal growth in familiar social setting.', 'Brooklyn Latin is the perfect fit for most high school students. With its diverse student population and emphasis on being well-rounded, the school ties in different qualities that everyone should have.', 'The Brooklyn Latin schools has a large focus on the classics and requires students (discupuli) to take four years of latin.', 'I like how the teachers support you in your endeavors and offer you support in office hours after school.  The curriculum is challenging, yet fun once you get used to it. It is true that this school is centered around speaking and writing and humanities. Although art is given, this is the only art class we truly have other than a writing workshop. Unlike most schools, we only have gym twice a week and for the gym class, we have two job assessment per term that access whether you can jog for 25 minutes straight without stopping. However, the teachers are appreciative and do not assign homework during any of the breaks, rather they have all major assessment given before the break begins.', 'It was a somewhat difficult change from middle school, but the teachers and community really help you get integrated with the school. I really like the small community and the rigorous curriculum.', 'Loved my time at TBLS. The rigorous curriculum and kind faculty really prepared me for my college education. There will be days that feel endless, but it will be worth it in the end!', 'What I love about TBLS is the dedication of the teachers in connecting with the students. I still keep in touch with my favorite teachers, whether its emailing or going back to visit. It is clear that the teachers are passionate about their subjects and want to help the students develop beyond just getting decent grades.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School is a small community of diverse and committed students who take part in the International Baccalaureate program. The intense rigor at this school allows for students to be determined and dedicated to their education and futures. The school pushes them to be more involved in their communities and in the school programs. The athletic division in the school has been developing greatly over the past few years. However something that could be improved drastically in the school is the inclusion of arts in both the curriculum and the extra curricular programs.', 'The school has a great staff and it’s a very nice school. The only downsides are that it’s a shared campus meaning there is limited space within hallways and classrooms. The staff is very nice and knows how to handle various situations.']
