The funding is focused on learning opportunities and curriculums such as out IB program, and not only do we learn new information and become better students, we learn life skills that allow us to become better people. We may have to declaim, which seems tedious, but that allows us to grow in public speaking, and the feeling one has after a successful declamation is a great one. Sure, we may have to share a building with other schools (which might be more of a problem later on, with our school's rapid growth and all), and sure, we may not have consistent  Airconditioning and Heating, but in my opinion, that's a small price to pay for all the experiences we've been through, the people I've met, and the growth we've had.  All in all, I wouldn't replace my school for any other.", 'Teachers are great. They are not the kind that are there just for a paycheck. They care about the students and their jobs.  They really work hard to see their students succeed.', "My experience has been pretty remarkable. The school has been an exciting challenge for me all four years, and I have made so many incredible relationships with so many diverse groups of people. I do not regret my high school decision and I wouldn't trade it for anything.", 'Brooklyn Latin has allowed me to figure out my interest through introductions to Various topics. While here, I am able to meet so many people allowing me to learn about and understand so many cultures and ideas that stemmed from them. I was not only able to find out what type of student I am but also what type of person I am and want to be.', 'Im a Sophmore transfer student and I already hate this school. I feel restricted I’m more used to wearing my own clothes and having the freedom to buy food for lunch but they don’t have that their outlunch is basically playing outside so now I’m back to my old schedule of starving myself as the school food is just terrible. There was mistakes in the schedule on the first day of school and I was placed in the wrong class. Another thing is there’s something called declamations it basically where you have to memorize a text in a class and they have this in Spanish. Then you talk about it or something but it’s all in front of the class. This school just reminds me on a catholic school plus no one really likes the school. I feel restricted and it’s not good for my mind I’m literally having anxiety which is not fun.', 'I like the education because it was above and beyond what most high schools offer. They even offered opportunities outside of school.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School was fairly hard to get admitted to and I am glad I worked hard enough to get the opportunity to attend this school. The school has one thing that I love the most about it and that is community. Fellow students are often nice but the teachers are the absolute best I have ever had compared to any of the other schools I have attended. The teachers have closer relationships with students as this is a fairly small school and they care for students so much.', 'I am a recent alumna and very proud. Although we are a small school with a tight budget, TBLS has introduced me to a diverse community full of many personalities and opinions. This allowed for interesting conversations, seminars, and fun times. The rigor of academics can be overwhelming at times, so I deeply appreciate the fact that every teacher is always willing to help and has dedicated office hours.', 'The teachers are the best part of this school. It was really small when I was there and I am not sure if it is still the same but I had a close relationship with the teachers. They really wanted you to learn.', 'Every teacher I had was very approachable with any problems that I might have had during my time there.', 'Amazing community of students and staff. Incredible educational opportunities paired with personal growth in familiar social setting.', 'Brooklyn Latin is the perfect fit for most high school students. With its diverse student population and emphasis on being well-rounded, the school ties in different qualities that everyone should have.', 'The Brooklyn Latin schools has a large focus on the classics and requires students (discupuli) to take four years of latin.', 'I like how the teachers support you in your endeavors and offer you support in office hours after school.  The curriculum is challenging, yet fun once you get used to it. It is true that this school is centered around speaking and writing and humanities. Although art is given, this is the only art class we truly have other than a writing workshop. Unlike most schools, we only have gym twice a week and for the gym class, we have two job assessment per term that access whether you can jog for 25 minutes straight without stopping. However, the teachers are appreciative and do not assign homework during any of the breaks, rather they have all major assessment given before the break begins.', 'It was a somewhat difficult change from middle school, but the teachers and community really help you get integrated with the school. I really like the small community and the rigorous curriculum.', 'Loved my time at TBLS. The rigorous curriculum and kind faculty really prepared me for my college education. There will be days that feel endless, but it will be worth it in the end!', 'What I love about TBLS is the dedication of the teachers in connecting with the students. I still keep in touch with my favorite teachers, whether its emailing or going back to visit. It is clear that the teachers are passionate about their subjects and want to help the students develop beyond just getting decent grades.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School is a small community of diverse and committed students who take part in the International Baccalaureate program. The intense rigor at this school allows for students to be determined and dedicated to their education and futures. The school pushes them to be more involved in their communities and in the school programs. The athletic division in the school has been developing greatly over the past few years. However something that could be improved drastically in the school is the inclusion of arts in both the curriculum and the extra curricular programs.', 'The school has a great staff and it’s a very nice school. The only downsides are that it’s a shared campus meaning there is limited space within hallways and classrooms. The staff is very nice and knows how to handle various situations.']
column6: ['Although the school requires lots of dedication and time, it prepares you well for college through their IB courses in junior and senior year. Brooklyn latin is a small school, but that makes our community strong.', 'The courses are made to be harder so the students have to put in a lot of work to succeed but is effective in terms of college readiness. However, I hope that there will be more clubs because there is barely and clubs or activities that the small population of students can enjoy. We also have limited resourses because we had to share the school building with two other school. Tranportaions that are needed to get to this school on time is really a pain to deal with.', 'The Brooklyn Latin High school was distinct due to its investment in the IB program which most NYC high schools fail to offer. It allowed students to take college level courses for an open opportunity to earn college credits. The school offered a diverse variety of classes including Latin, Greek, and theater which are courses not common in other high schools. Moreover, the teachers at this school demonstrate a huge determination to help students better their education. They constantly invest time after school such as office hours for extra tutoring. Despite its vast investment in education, the school lacks funding therefore it cannot afford a large range of programs or clubs. The clubs and activities within the school are highly limited and thus fail to cater to every student. I think with more government funding towards the school, they can invest in more support for things outside of solely academics and will overall, improve the community of the school.', "Love most of the teachers here, most of them are really invested in students' well beings. Would be much better though if the administration was kinder and played favourites less.", 'It is tough and explores the IB approach in education. Seminars and declamation help build the communication skills. Many of our works involve analytical skills and improving ourselves while mastering topics. Reaching junior to senior year, we are able to choose the levels of study we wish to pursue. However, there are many deadlines and stressful projects that are to be completed in order to graduate and obtain the IB diploma.', 'As a senior at The Brooklyn Latin School, I can say that my experience at this school has be a good one. There are many improvements that need to be made to this school however, I am grateful for the experience that I had here. One of the best parts about this school is the education. Although it is extremely rigorous and at times can become very overwhelming, I believe that it has allowed me to grow as a student and I feel that I was able to learn a lot through the years. Additionally, the support from teachers is never ending and allows the students to feel safe and comfortable at school. With all this being said, I think that the school can improve with the lack of resources and cleanliness of the school.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School is one of the best academically rigorous schools in New York City. Ranking as one of the top high schools in the city. The IB curriculum that the school uses contains college level work and material to prepare their students  for college. The teachers are very engaging and put their best foot forward to make sure students understand their material.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School (TBLS) was an important stepping stone in my journey to adulthood. Thanks to TBLS, my high school years felt more like going to school with a giant family who looks after one another. The faculty there is second to none, every teacher I have encountered during my time there has been incredibly dedicated to the success of each one of their students no matter the cost. If a student is willing to put in the work required by such a demanding school, they will truly reap what they sow. Sure, with every freshman and sophomore class being honors, and most junior and senior classes being International Baccalaureate (IB), TBLS is by no means easy. However, it is because of the rigorous schedule and supportive faculty that TBLS is able to build the problem solvers, leaders, and thinkers of tomorrow.', "The teachers in this schools have office hours available, they are very understanding, once you ask they don't hesitate to give. The student population is very diverse.", 'Small school but teachers and office stuffs are very heartwarming care people. My son transferred from zone school to the Brooklyn Latin school in sophomore year. He struggled the beginning adjusting the volume of work but it’s worth it !! Friendly atmosphere, highly recommend this school .', 'There is a focus on building a great sense of community, which is successfully completed. Despite the extremely heavy and tiring workload, TBLS helps one get through challenging courses that are worth it in the end. It gives us life long skills and relationships one can’t imagine having at such a young age.', "This is the smallest specialized high school with around 900 students total. If you like intimacy between teachers and your pupils this is definitely the school for you. However, this school focuses on public speaking including classwide seminars and declamations. These assessments teach you the skills to form unique, persuasive and clear arguments. If you want to be a political figure or lawyer I would recommend this school. If you are really shy or have stage fright this is not a good school for you to attend. This school participates in the International Baccalaureate program. In other schools families would have to pay around 1200 dollars for their children to participate in the program, however, this school pays for each student's participation. This causes the school to have disadvantages. Most of the school's funding goes towards the students' education, and as a result heating, air conditioning and the overall maintenance of the building is poor.", 'Although The Brooklyn Latin School takes on the IB program compared to other regular schools which take on the AP program in New York City, the school provides good rigorous education—the way which makes students challenge themselves and are able to learn and reflect on their successes and failures. The school also provides a strong sense of community among students, teachers, and faculty as students are able to interact with them one-on-one. Despite the workload, The Brooklyn Latin School is a school which helps students to channel their academic progress and be prepared for college as well as be able to communicate with teachers.', 'I believe the Brooklyn Latin School is a school that best prepares students for college. Their IB curriculum is very rigorous and challenging which has an even greater effect on students because of the teachers there. Additionally, the school prepares students to speak publicly, with many assignments dedicated to that area.', "The Brooklyn Latin School is like a family. Teachers take responsibilities above and beyond. They stay long hours to assist in subjects students struggle with and provide opportunities for students to improve class grades. They’re dedicated to teaching us to be independent, organized and equipped to deal with our future via group projects with our peers. My school isn't all work. Some clubs I am involved in is History In Action, A Capella, Drama Team, and Mock UN. Here we get to strengthen relationships with peers sharing a common interest. I’d love to see more assessments use student led mediums.", "The school was very diverse, fulled with different people and a great place to meet to new people. The academics were rigorous with the addition of seminars and declamations that was unique to this school. One  thing that I hope can be improves is the facilities that the school provides, I'm referencing the bathrooms.", 'Decent teachers who were fun, open and willing to help.  Made some decent friends too.  There was plenty of fun things to learn, from the standard English, Math, and Science to the foreign Languages like Spanish and Latin.  It was a nice and diverse place and preached LGBT tolerance.', "I'd like to see funding for student amendities like better bathroom supplies, gym materials, laptops, etc.", "I'm incredible happy that I chose to attend this school, I can't imagine having gone to a different high school these past 4 years. As challenging as it is, the IB program has taught me to think deeply in subjects like history, Latin, and biology for which I had never had any real enthusiasm prior to freshman year. It's not the wealthiest school in the world, but it has amazing teachers and extremely dedicated college counsellors who help students through high school into college.", 'The staff and teachers are all very supportive and passionate about their jobs. The school definitely provides students with the care needed to succeed in college and later years. The academic courses are rigorous and essential when in college. However, the school is not very clean.']
column8: ["Latin is amazing if you are a hard working student with a lot of ambition. The IB curriculum is extremely rigorous but holistic, and can leave a student feeling tired, but fulfilled. If you do not however like public speaking at all (you can be nervous, they'll help you, but not resistant) Latin is not the school for you. Seminars and declamations are a weekly if not daily occurrence that can in many ways strengthen you readiness for college classes and for careers. However, Latin is pretty underfunded and shares a building with three other schools often compromising the extent to which students can engage in their community and seize opportunities that require funding. The teachers and student however are incredibly diverse, teachers are willing to work alongside you no matter the size of your struggles and are seriously passionate about the work they do.", "I think this school is great especially if you're trying to get out of you are interested in humanities and public speaking. Also, if you ever need help with anything that you don't understand in class, teachers have office hours where you can go for help or makeup work. All in all, it's a pretty great school but be prepared for the HUGE workload. (and I mean HUGE)", 'I loved the Brooklyn Latin school. The people there r amazing and the teachers know the material very well.', 'Academic pressure is excellent. However, the students are exploited for money. As students we never even see what kind of improvement these donations, affiliated clothing etc are making. Bathrooms are horrendous, limited seating in classes, crowded hallways and lunch room. Down right disgusting behaviour from staff members towards students. School is filled with nerdy kids and the staff member bullies knowing no one would say anything back.  All the teachers are from prestigious universities however being knowledgeable and being able to teach two different things.', 'I absolutely love it here, it has definitely shaped who I am as a person. Although we are a specialized high school, there is very minimal competition and a strong community that comes along with support between the students. The teachers are all highly educated and truly passionate about teaching others, with an exception of maybe 5 at most. The workload can be stressful, especially with extracurriculars, and require sincere time management. Teachers do have office hours which can be used to get ahead on work, and many will let you work during lunch in their classroom. One thing we do lack is funding (we are a relatively new public school). We utilize Donors Choose and get many opportunities from that. If students are passionate they can attempt to form a new club or activity, however it is difficult. Truly it is an incredible experience and many of my favorite memories come from it.', 'I loved the teachers. They all care deeply about the success of their students, which I found rather inspiring.', "The Brooklyn Latin School values their students being more holistic learners. Their emphasis on classical literature, public speaking, and leadership makes the school very excellent in their teachings in the liberal arts. To add on, there is a lot of diversity in our school, not just in race, but economic standings and political views. Overall, it's a very decent school.", 'Brooklyn Latin is definitely not for the mathematical or scientific minded student. It will be really difficult for you to cope with the curriculum here. I am a freshman here and I\'m taking conceptual physics while my friends at Tech or Bard are taking courses such as AP physics and such with qualifications lower than mine. The "conceptual physics" is at such a rudimentary level that it is very challenging for many of my peers who are intrigued by science to sustain their interest of science in school. I was very excited to learn that TBLS had an up and running Science Olympiad club, which of course, turned out to be bogus. This school is also not for the creative mind either. We do have drama, art and A capella, but their organization and execution is worse than my middle school. But this school teachs in an unconventional way which could be a hit or miss. If you hit it then you\'re on your path to getting into an Ivy league institution, otherwise you\'re going to a community college.', "It was okay but the  kids all hate the school and each other and there's so much drama and toxicity. I left and I do not regret it at all. I did not find it a happy environment to learn in and the thought of spending all my high school there brought me dread.", "The Brooklyn Latn School is definitely a great school, considering how eager teachers are willing to work with students. Although the majority of the school is one floor, it doesn't really matter because students need to constantly go up and down the stairs. One thing we don't have,however, is a library. In addition, students aren't allowed to go outside which kind of lacks our freedom. But other than that, The Brooklyn Latin School is great!", 'I liked the rigorous academics that this school offered because it helped prepare me for college academics. However, this also gave me a lower gpa compared to other schools that offer easier classes, and to some colleges they care more about the number than the courses in all honesty. The neighborhood was dangerous and I did not feel safe coming out of the building after school hours. On the plus side the faculty and teachers were caring and involved.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School is a Specialized High School located in the neighborhood of Williamsburg, Brooklyn, New York.  Students attending this school are very disciplined and are required to meet high expectations. While this school excels in the areas of academics, as the International Baccalaureate program is offered to juniors and seniors, college readiness, safety, and parent involvement, other areas that could use improvement include sports, clubs & activities, and the school food.', 'It is an excellent school. Although it is understandable that we are trying to be prepared for college and a more rigorous curriculum, but sometimes it is a bit ridiculous.', 'Attending this school was an overall great experience. The diverse community and activities made the school feel very lively. The work may be a bit too cumbersome at times but I would recommend this school to those willing to put in the effort.', "The Brooklyn Latin School follows an IB curriculum which is argued as more rigorous than AP. The school life can be very hard especially if the commute is long. You have 2-3 hours of hw everyday but the teachers are really helpful and available at office hours for extra help. There are many clubs and sports but honestly, they aren't the most highest quality. I really do not like the facility because it has really disgusting restrooms, lead-filled water fountains, shared gym, shared school building, and overall nothing high end. The budgets are very low for facilities and its uncomfortable. On the other hand though, the school community is very welcoming and supportive towards each other. Very open minded environment with approachable people.", "TBLS is a full IB school, making it very rigorous, but not competitive. Even if you aren't on track to getting the IB Diploma, you will have no choice but to take IB classes, which are college level. However, the rigor of the school will prepare you for college really well, better than most schools. The school is committed to diversity and we have a really wonderful community, it's small, but the absolute best thing about the school is how committed the teachers are and how easy it is to talk to them, as most of them are younger (still wonderful teachers) and approachable, providing students a strong support system for the rigor of the classes. The school, however, does not receive enough money, leaving students without basic things like textbooks or a library, as what little funding we have, is spent on IB, so the students don't have to pay for it.  But the commitment the school has to excellence isn't stopped by the low funding.", "TBLS is a good school in terms of the academics it has and the workload they give definitely provides the individual with a college ready feel yet at the same time the academics they provide are limited, especially classes in the arts and social sciences. Since the school runs on the IB programme a lot of money goes into the classes we take junior and senior year which detracts from the amount of money that is able to come into the school itself. Bathroom facilities for both boys and girls are in poor conditions. The boys' bathroom has permanently remained smelly, even after cleaning. People have to cover both their noses and mouths as soon as the door opens because the smell is terribly horrid. While the girls bathroom does not smell as bad, several of the toilets have become flooded and have stopped working, and at some point, a piece of the ceiling fell off. Due to the strength of our academics, we should obtain more funding.", "Brooklyn Latin is a very challenging school because unlike other schools, it has an IB curriculum, instead of AP. IB is a very rigorous program and it's really useful for college because it not only gives us college credits by passing the classes, it also prepares us for the work in college.Brooklyn Latin has so many different aspects from other schools, which makes a lot of students dislike it because it seems really extra to have to many different aspects but honestly, the special things about Brooklyn Latin is extremely helpful and it does more good than bad to its students. The school is extremely small, with only about 600-700 students but this small environment makes our school community extremely close.", 'The Liberal Arts Curriculum is superb. I was learning about the myth of Laocoon in English and Latin, while analyzing the work of art featuring Laocoon in Art History, while studying Ancient Roman civilization in History. Brooklyn Latin also has a very tight-knit community that immediately recognizes people of diverse backgrounds and perspectives. The Roman/Latin culture also enhances that sense of community. Students, teachers and administrators all take part  in the nomenclature of calling students "discipuli", teachers "magistri", the bathroom "latrina", etc. The teachers above all care about the success and comfort of the students. You wouldn\'t believe how many teachers will pause class to talk about something not related to academics because that was where our minds were.', 'The Brooklyn Latin School allowed for me to go past my comfort zone. It is a school that stresses public speaking, and with assessments like seminar and declamation, I was able to learn how to communicate better with other people. It taught me the true meaning of having a family, for I was in a supportive environment where the teachers truly wanted me to thrive. I am proud of the student I have become, for I have this desire for learning and becoming more well-rounded.']

column2: ['I would like the school to address the achievement gap. There are too many students of color in academic classes and not enough in Advanced Placement classes. We also need a better science, specifically physics, department. Our math department is very strong. I like the freedom the students have.', 'Montclair High, while an overall fun and excellent schooling experience, has a few flaws. There was an infrastructural issue at the start of last year, and while the administration had plenty of time to determine a solution and follow through with it, they rescinded their plan at the last minute, leading to that same infrastructural issue not being fixed by the start of the next year. The students are fun and some of the teachers are outright amazing, but this cannot be overlooked. 4/5', "Montclair High School has a lot of high achieving students. I feel like that environment has helped me stay motivated and excel. There is however a lack of college readiness. I should have had a meeting with a mentor that could help me map out a plan for my high school years. There could have also been an organization or club dedicated to such. I didn't know the importance of extracurriculars neither what classes to take that would help me get into desired colleges. This left me with a lot of stress, confusion, and regrets. Opportunities were not broadcasted. I had to go deep into the school website to find volunteer opportunities and programs that they did not tell us was there. There are many hidden clubs that I would have loved to join but I did not even know were going on. It seems you have to have connections to actually know about opportunities. The Media Center was helpful for printing things and doing work. Most of the teachers are excellent. There are many food options.", 'I had an amazing experience at montclair high school. The teachers were quality and really prepared you for college courses.', 'Montclair High School was a safe environment in which I could focus on my studies and befriend individuals with interests similar to mine. I appreciated the diversity of the student body not only in terms of race, but also socioeconomically, and educationally. The instruction I received at Montclair High School was valuable in that it prepared me for college-level learning. Some teachers including those of AP Physics B, however, fell short in doing their job to best prepare students for university.', "it was ok, they have some electives but it's pretty boring overall. the stairs also collapsed, so that kind of made things a little worse. the whole school system could be improved in many ways", 'Montclair high is an interesting, but fun school. You can learn many things coming here and meet new friends and gain different experiences', "It is what it is. Some teachers are good, some aren't. A lot about this school is ultimately finessing the system, which creates a culture among the students to get as much as they can out of what they have. Overall, its ok, but it feels like a community.", 'I transferred into Montclair High School in my sophomore year unsure as to what to expect. I was told that the school had not only many prestigious and seasoned teachers, but also a very good education system in general. I have found this to be very much true as classes can be rather challenging, with the teacher(s) of those classes being enthusiastic about both the subject and the students themselves. Montclair High School has been academically fulfilling and has provided me with the tools I need to do well in college. In terms of extracurriculars, Montclair High School offers a wide variety of clubs in all shapes and sizes, making for a very vibrant and diverse atmosphere. With regards to staff interactions, all of the staff I have had the chance to speak to have been helpful and interested in aiding me in any way that they can. In short, I believe that Montclair High School is very much an excellent school and I do not regret my time there.', 'We need better infrastructure and more teacher that are motivated to teach. Cleaner school. Academics are excellent.', "While I have since graduated from Montclair High School, I can honestly say after the fact that I appreciate the insight and high school experience I was allowed. Just like any other suburban high school, there are cliques, parties, the whole 9 yards. Although, the experience at Montclair High was so much more than that. Compared to those in my university, I was given a more comprehensive and diverse look at what the world could be like. Everyone at this school, in this town, coexists quite harmoniously. Not perfectly, nothing is perfect, but compared to those I've spoken to outside of Montclair, the environment at Montclair High is unmatched. As I hear it, Montclair high is faced with some structural issues and that is something that is currently being resolved. Also, I am not sure in what way, if at all, that the parking situation has been resolved but I believe that they should allow student discounts since the school itself does not offer a parking lot.", 'Montclair High School is a great school because it is very diverse and their as a lot to do. They have many sports and clubs you can join that is in your interest. The teachers are great and make sure that you are learning and ready for the next level.', 'I enjoy the vast diversity at MHS as well as the many opportunities: academically, socially, and athletically. Some things still need improvement, such as the multiple collapsed stairwells, while other things are very useful, like the access to technology(Chromebooks and computer labs).', 'I like the amount of opportunities available. There’s many clubs and sports, such as the Caribbean Club and Basketball, that you can join. Montclair High School has great academics programs and the average GPA is around 3.5. What I do not like about it is that sometimes there’s unfair circumstances and unfair justice served for it. An example would be when the school’s stairs collapsed. We had to stay home for about 4 days until school officials got it under control. When we came back to school, there were only about 2 or 3 working stairs and it was a disaster. Everyone was trying to get to class, causing it to be crowded because there’s not many stairs to attend to. Students would get punished for being late although it is not their fault that they don’t have many stairs to attend to. This collapse of the stairs also made the school highly unsafe. It made it harder to get out on time in the case of a fire drill. Overall, it’s an average school.', "A school is like a second home and Montclair High School did a great job of being that. The teachers and culture are great, there's so many opportunities to join clubs and sports, and the resources are amazing, my guidance counselor Ms Csuka is the nicest person in the world. Just like any home though, it has flaws, and that became apparent this year when the stairs collapsed. We learned how to work around it, the stairs couldn't be repaired since the walls were filled with asbestos at all. All the while the administration was changed and new rules were coming as fast as they were going. Despite this issue, the teachers and people are amazing through it all. The teachers show genuine enthusiasm for what they teach and everyone makes the best out of whatever circumstance to give us students a good education. I'd definitely recommend MHS despite its faults.", 'Until this year I would have  given the school 4 stars, however, with this year‘s falling of one of the staircases in the main building it’s been a very stressful year. Our classes are in the cafeteria and in the auditorium, we are down 31 classrooms. They won’t be fixing the stairs till the summer so we also won’t be graduating at the school. Overall I don’t think they handled the situation well.', "There's no other school like MHS. You're able to be who you want to be and can find any group of people who enjoy the same interests as you do. All the teachers care and put in lots of work to help you. They all sacrifice their time to help you out. All are so understanding and kind. MHS is a bridge to unite everyone and I love my school!", 'This is a wonderful school, has so many programs to help students achieve higher academic goals and athletic achievement. Has about 4 small learning communities that are important and helps kids prepare for college and the outside world. A great place to attend.', 'Montclair offers diversity across the board in all aspects of schooling. You grow to appreciate this as you are put into different environments especially college. There is a sense of family in Montclair High, no matter what group you may identify with we all always come together. & we all bleed blue #Mounties', "Montclair High School consistently sends more kids to IVY, NESCAC, polytechnic and prestigious, ancient academic institutions than any other public high school in the state.  In fact, it sends close to a hundred kids to little ivies and public ivies.  It is not uncommon to see 8 or more students accepted to Cornell.  MHS alumni can be found attending Cambridge, Trinity, Oxford, St Andrews, Stanford, etc..It has a high degree of school pride and plenty of reasons to justify it.  It's full of beautiful kids from diverse backgrounds and even international students from England, Spain, Sweden, etc..  Sports teams like CREW/Rowing are National Champions for years in a row.  Football?  State Champs.  And original Lacrosse institution, teams regularly place sectional titles, and players are committed to D1 programs by Sophomore year.  Did I mention the Latin and Economics programs or the Dentistry lab or the AP Mandarin courses?"]
column4: ['I would like the school to address the achievement gap. There are too many students of color in academic classes and not enough in Advanced Placement classes. We also need a better science, specifically physics, department. Our math department is very strong. I like the freedom the students have.', 'Montclair High, while an overall fun and excellent schooling experience, has a few flaws. I didn't know the importance of extracurriculars neither what classes to take that would help me get into desired colleges. This left me with a lot of stress, confusion, and regrets. There are many hidden clubs that I would have loved to join but I did not even know were going on. It seems you have to have connections to actually know about opportunities. The Media Center was helpful for printing things and doing work. Most of the teachers are excellent. There are many food options.", 'I had an amazing experience at montclair high school. The teachers were quality and really prepared you for college courses.', 'Montclair High School was a safe environment in which I could focus on my studies and befriend individuals with interests similar to mine. I appreciated the diversity of the student body not only in terms of race, but also socioeconomically, and educationally. The instruction I received at Montclair High School was valuable in that it prepared me for college-level learning. Some teachers including those of AP Physics B, however, fell short in doing their job to best prepare students for university.', "it was ok, they have some electives but it's pretty boring overall. the stairs also collapsed, so that kind of made things a little worse. the whole school system could be improved in many ways", 'Montclair high is an interesting, but fun school. You can learn many things coming here and meet new friends and gain different experiences', "It is what it is. Some teachers are good, some aren't. A lot about this school is ultimately finessing the system, which creates a culture among the students to get as much as they can out of what they have. Overall, its ok, but it feels like a community.", 'I transferred into Montclair High School in my sophomore year unsure as to what to expect. I was told that the school had not only many prestigious and seasoned teachers, but also a very good education system in general. I have found this to be very much true as classes can be rather challenging, with the teacher(s) of those classes being enthusiastic about both the subject and the students themselves. Montclair High School has been academically fulfilling and has provided me with the tools I need to do well in college. In terms of extracurriculars, Montclair High School offers a wide variety of clubs in all shapes and sizes, making for a very vibrant and diverse atmosphere. With regards to staff interactions, all of the staff I have had the chance to speak to have been helpful and interested in aiding me in any way that they can. In short, I believe that Montclair High School is very much an excellent school and I do not regret my time there.', 'We need better infrastructure and more teacher that are motivated to teach. Cleaner school. Academics are excellent.', "While I have since graduated from Montclair High School, I can honestly say after the fact that I appreciate the insight and high school experience I was allowed. Just like any other suburban high school, there are cliques, parties, the whole 9 yards. Although, the experience at Montclair High was so much more than that. Compared to those in my university, I was given a more comprehensive and diverse look at what the world could be like. Everyone at this school, in this town, coexists quite harmoniously. Not perfectly, nothing is perfect, but compared to those I've spoken to outside of Montclair, the environment at Montclair High is unmatched. As I hear it, Montclair high is faced with some structural issues and that is something that is currently being resolved. Also, I am not sure in what way, if at all, that the parking situation has been resolved but I believe that they should allow student discounts since the school itself does not offer a parking lot.", 'Montclair High School is a great school because it is very diverse and their as a lot to do. They have many sports and clubs you can join that is in your interest. The teachers are great and make sure that you are learning and ready for the next level.', 'I enjoy the vast diversity at MHS as well as the many opportunities: academically, socially, and athletically. Some things still need improvement, such as the multiple collapsed stairwells, while other things are very useful, like the access to technology(Chromebooks and computer labs).', 'I like the amount of opportunities available. There’s many clubs and sports, such as the Caribbean Club and Basketball, that you can join. Montclair High School has great academics programs and the average GPA is around 3.5. What I do not like about it is that sometimes there’s unfair circumstances and unfair justice served for it. An example would be when the school’s stairs collapsed. We had to stay home for about 4 days until school officials got it under control. When we came back to school, there were only about 2 or 3 working stairs and it was a disaster. Everyone was trying to get to class, causing it to be crowded because there’s not many stairs to attend to. Students would get punished for being late although it is not their fault that they don’t have many stairs to attend to. This collapse of the stairs also made the school highly unsafe. It made it harder to get out on time in the case of a fire drill. Overall, it’s an average school.', "A school is like a second home and Montclair High School did a great job of being that. The teachers and culture are great, there's so many opportunities to join clubs and sports, and the resources are amazing, my guidance counselor Ms Csuka is the nicest person in the world. Just like any home though, it has flaws, and that became apparent this year when the stairs collapsed. We learned how to work around it, the stairs couldn't be repaired since the walls were filled with asbestos at all. All the while the administration was changed and new rules were coming as fast as they were going. Despite this issue, the teachers and people are amazing through it all. The teachers show genuine enthusiasm for what they teach and everyone makes the best out of whatever circumstance to give us students a good education. I'd definitely recommend MHS despite its faults.", 'Until this year I would have  given the school 4 stars, however, with this year‘s falling of one of the staircases in the main building it’s been a very stressful year. Our classes are in the cafeteria and in the auditorium, we are down 31 classrooms. They won’t be fixing the stairs till the summer so we also won’t be graduating at the school. Overall I don’t think they handled the situation well.', "There's no other school like MHS. You're able to be who you want to be and can find any group of people who enjoy the same interests as you do. All the teachers care and put in lots of work to help you. They all sacrifice their time to help you out. All are so understanding and kind. MHS is a bridge to unite everyone and I love my school!", 'This is a wonderful school, has so many programs to help students achieve higher academic goals and athletic achievement. Has about 4 small learning communities that are important and helps kids prepare for college and the outside world. A great place to attend.', 'Montclair offers diversity across the board in all aspects of schooling. You grow to appreciate this as you are put into different environments especially college. There is a sense of family in Montclair High, no matter what group you may identify with we all always come together. & we all bleed blue #Mounties', "Montclair High School consistently sends more kids to IVY, NESCAC, polytechnic and prestigious, ancient academic institutions than any other public high school in the state.  In fact, it sends close to a hundred kids to little ivies and public ivies.  It is not uncommon to see 8 or more students accepted to Cornell.  MHS alumni can be found attending Cambridge, Trinity, Oxford, St Andrews, Stanford, etc..It has a high degree of school pride and plenty of reasons to justify it.  It's full of beautiful kids from diverse backgrounds and even international students from England, Spain, Sweden, etc..  Sports teams like CREW/Rowing are National Champions for years in a row.  Football?  State Champs.  And original Lacrosse institution, teams regularly place sectional titles, and players are committed to D1 programs by Sophomore year.  Did I mention the Latin and Economics programs or the Dentistry lab or the AP Mandarin courses?"]
column6: ["The staff can be very helpful. The teachers care about your child's education. The school offers various resources if needed to families. They have various sports programs and Clubs for students participation. This is great for the children to make friends , enjoy doing things they like and it develops their social skills. Montclair is a very diverse community for children and there families to thrive and feel safe within there community.", "Montclair has one public high school. Not many places offer a high school career surrounding a themed curriculum, present opportunity to play uncommon sports, leave for lunch or have an open campus, nor get to choose a language with AP.No place is perfect. Students come from all over. School can't control individuals & some aren't as academic or clearly ungrateful for their education. Resources aren't the best, given the quality and age of some of the books; buildings seem to be crumbling apart, while some staff isn't aware of the effectiveness nor influence.Overall, MHS is good. Strong community, & people come together in differences. Children + parents alike are very integrated in creation of atmosphere + culture. Majority of Montclair is liberal, & supportive of concerns from diversity to identity + orientation, & more. I am appreciative.", 'The sports teams are incredible as well as the school spirit that comes with them. The resources are great especially the library but the school could use more air conditioning for the spring.', "I like the freedom during lunch time and how I was able to make friends easily when I moved there. I don't like how there is no public school buses and how some teachers teach.", 'How involved the teachers were, and the small learning communities that made my overall learning experience very personalized. One of the best part about MHS was being able to partake in the Career Internship Program, which allows for seniors to go on an internship with local businesses as opposed to attending fourth marking period classes.', "It was an amazing experience, but the culture can be very privileged. People don't think bullying happens, but it's very covert bullying. If you can't find your place, you can feel very lonely.", 'Montclair high school provides a safe and very liberal community, giving students many opportunities to explore new things outside of everyday academic classes through things such as clubs and electives.', 'I enjoyed the diversity and how they had lots of clubs and other activities to participate in at anytime', "I love my school! There are so many cool and diverse people from different backgrounds. There are a lot of artsy kids here, but also a lot of tech and STEM enthusiasts, too, so it makes for great and very intriguing conversations. The teachers are also overall very passionate about teaching us not just academics, but how to better ourselves as well. We've got a mini park outside the 9th Grade building which is beautiful, a really cool-looking outside hangout center/mini-stadium where you can sit and relax, and there are plenty of electives and after-school sports and activities to chose from!", 'My overall experience at Montclair High School has been amazing! The teachers and staff are incredibly helpful in preparing students for college and encourage us to find activities that we enjoy to identify possible careers for our future. You will find multiple races and ethnicities in every classroom which makes it easy to make new friends. There is a plethora of clubs and activities where students can explore their interests. Sports are very popular at Montclair High School and games are a time where we all come together as a family to support our teams. Our school has a strict no-bullying policy which allows people to freely express themselves without having to fear about getting judged by others. At Montclair High School, people can feel a sense of community where students are comfortable with one another.', "I love the diversity of Montclair High School. It's such a welcoming environment that made me love going to school. The clubs and programs offered at the high school are unlike any I've seen anywhere else.", 'Montclair High School has given me the opportunity to explore all aspects of education. It provides a lot of opportunities  for experimentation and fosters a community where diversity of thought and action are appreciated.', 'I have been in the architecture program all 4 years of high school, and I absolutely love it. Because of that class, I am going to study architecture in college.', 'I liked the diversity of our school. Would I would like to see change is how they handle racism in the school.', "Our school has absolutely everything that can be offered. The family atmosphere of the high school offers a friendly and encouraging place to learn. There is a diversity of people as well as a diversity of thought and everyone is treated with equal respect no matter where they fall. Our sports teams are rallied around all throughout the school. I was captain of our undefeated football team in 2017 and the student body really love to see our success. We support each other, because we are all representatives of our school. Every where we go as students and alums of Montclair High School we know that we are the best prepared to conquer the world. Our teachers the best in the state and the country. I have never heard a student ever be told that they cannot do something, because the school doesn't offer it or can't afford it. Although we are a public school, we have tremendous support from the parents and the community to accomplish our academic dreams.", 'choice, diversity, sports, academics, town, restaurants, community involvement, parent involvement, opportunities, support.', 'Great school with great teachers but a huge difference between students who try and those who don\'t. As a student who had potential but didn\'t care at all for school, I was pushed aside to make way for "promising" students. Once again, the academics are great; still, you have to fit a certain number of criteria to be given attention.', 'High school was really fun. It included academics that were awesome, sports teams that created community and really cool clubs.', 'My daughter has been in the Montclair school system since kindergarden. I have always loved the teachers and counselors. They are very active in the students education and they are always available to parents.', 'This school had lots of ups and downs. Lots of bad memories but with the bad came the good. Wouldn’t send my kids here though.']

column2: ["The school is a lot like any other high school in regards to the people, however, there isn't a tremendous amount of bullying that I'm aware of. The school itself is a bit outdated but the teachers have been amazing and I know I have received an amazing education.", 'I  entered Wilton High School my freshman year. It was difficult to make friends at first but I  had the support of many great teachers. The school provided many sport options which helped me settle into the new school and new town, they offered many clubs as well which helped me get involved very easily. The school itself is very big but it is filled with helpful teachers and kind students to help you through it.', "My experience at Wilton High School has been above average. It's your typical high school, not too big and not too small. Wilton High School has lots of great staff and an interesting curriculum.", 'I like the emphasis the school puts on college readiness and that both the academic and athletic environments are filled with high-achieving students and supportive teachers/coaches.', 'the education is wonderful you get good highly educated teachers that like to challenge the students. the sports are competitive the coaches are very trained and keeps everyone safe. a lot of students get into good colleges such as Brown University of Charleston, Penn State, University of Notre Dame, University of North Carolina.', "Wilton High School excelled in providing me with a solid education and optimal college preparedness. The teachers were above average and so were the facilities and resources. I even made good friends here. Of course they changed quite a bit over the years but that is quite normal as maturing young adults. So what made me ascribe only 3/5 stars to Wilton? This high school severely lacks a grasp, appreciation, and presence of different cultures, traditions, and ways of life, at least in the school setting. White privileged culture is the sole culture that is prominent in this school which is reinforced by many of the surrounding high schools that operate in similar manners. Being part of a sheltered predominantly white high school only proves to be a hurtle in later life. This lack of understanding about different people's ways of life creates difficulties in communicating and relating to people, thus causing an inability or decreased ability to form a broad span of relationships.", 'Wilton High School, while strong in academics, is rather average. Despite having an excessive budget, many of the students at WHS are not very dedicated to their educations. Though there are many strong-willed and devoted students who genuinely enjoy learning, they are often outnumbered by their apathetic peers who just want to graduate. There are many departments in which WHS has no lacking, and these include ignorant students and nicotine addicts. Considering Wilton is a very affluent and Caucasian suburb, many students are either uneducated or merely prejudiced. For many years, minority peers have been subjugated to anti-Semitic remarks, casual racism, and a myriad of other issues over which the administration has taken little action. Despite these flaws amongst the student body and administration, the teachers at Wilton High School are dedicated to helping students learn and grow and have been the highlight of my experience at Wilton High School.', "The teachers are quite prepared for the course content, but their efforts are often undermined by the school's bureaucratic and incapable administration.", 'Overall academics and facilities are very good and prepare you well for college.   Teachers care and administrators can be helpful.', 'Wilton High School is filled with hard working students in which everyone tries to motivate each other to do better.  Everyone is very genuine and friendly which attributes over to the athletic competition at the school.  The teachers are very supportive towards the students and offer extra help for those in need.', 'Most teachers are enthusiastic.  Some are lax and don’t really teach, or are hard to understand because they only know one way to explain things. This is easily fixed by asking fellow peers or more questions to the teacher, or asking upperclassmen about tips on how to do well in the class. The environment in the school is very friendly, and everyone is willing to help out.', "Very stressful and teachers act as if they don't care if the students fail or succeed. However, you do learn a lot and there is a great variety of courses to take. They really do help you prepare for college. School is not diverse at all. Sports are average but there are lots of great clubs in the school to try out. Cafeteria is great and even provides an entire breakfast menu to make sure everyone is able to start the day off right.", 'I have had a great experience at Wilton High School for the past 3 and a half years. The classes and teachers have done an excellent job of preparing me for my future in college. A couple of things that I would like to see change are the level of diversity in the student body and the amount of pressure placed on the students. The workload at times seems excessive but it helps me to stay hard-working and achieve success.', 'Been in the district my whole life and like most people would probably also say, the schools will get better as you move through the district. The teachers here are incredibly knowledgeable and know what they’re talking about and how to talk and teach about it.  There’s co-curriculars for basically everything and everyone.', 'It is a very safe environment that fosters creativity. It is clear that many people in this building would like you to succeed in life.', 'Wilton High School prepares you for college but it is very stressful there. Everyone did not really like it there and the administration needs to step up their game.', 'Wilton High School gave me the advantage of higher education while giving me the sense of community and school spirit that I desired. Wilton High School is far from the best school out there with some teachers who lack the passion that others obtain.', "Wilton High School has a great reputation for a reason: its challenging academics, great teachers, warm environment, and safety. The expectations at Wilton High School are high; everyone in Wilton considers attending a 4-year college after college as set in stone, and doing anything else is frowned upon. The school is divided into two academic groups: those who take all honors and APs and strive for As, and those who take the easiest classes possible and hope to have above a 3.0, but if you didn't ask someone about their grades, you wouldn't be able to tell the difference. Some of the teachers I had at WHS are my best friends. I'm writing this for scholarship entry", 'Great for confident, college-minded kids who can keep up academically. Academics are top notch.  Unfortunately, the school turns a blind eye to students who are struggling, socially or academically.  If you struggle here, you will really struggle.  Guidance is not the best, but some of the teachers are great.', 'I enjoyed how the students created a good atmosphere for everyone around them. I would like to see some of the arrogance change.']

column6: ['WHS is a great place to prepare academically for college. Socially I think  it can be hard  for students if they don’t find a group to be a part of.', 'This school is very good. I had a fun time. All I think Wilton High School needs to work on is its diversity, otherwise it is great.', 'I spent four very fun years here! Wilton High School definitely well-prepared me for college. The teachers always helped me when I needed it, and I made some of my best friends here.', 'Wilton High is a school like no other. In just recent months, I have witnessed several instances of discrimination (swastikas, racial slurs, etc) - most of which administration has done nothing about. The school consists of white, upper middle class Christians. There are obvious cliques, but new students shouldn\'t have a problem finding one that "fits" so long as they are outspoken. As for the teachers... I think most students have an adult they could go to in school, but I get the sense that forming relationships with students either isn\'t encouraged, or the teachers just don\'t know that their job is more than textbooks and test scores. There is a good number of course offerings and academics are highly competitive, but depending on where you\'re coming from, you\'ll find that the town is in it\'s own bubble.', 'The teachers were great, and I met a great deal of long lasting friends. I felt extremely prepared for college academically. It could be more diverse though. I think that they should also provide more de-stressing activities for students.', 'I liked how supportive the teachers were, but some could be unreasonable as they treat us like college students, that could have its up and downs! I wish there were more diversity but other than that, it’s an amazing school!!', 'A quite preppy school, of course, this is to be expected in Wilton Connecticut. But there are some circles of really rad people, I found an excellent community in the theatre department.', 'The experience was good. Would like to see the counselors work with children earlier. they seem to interact with kids only in senior year. The teachers are excellent and so also the resources.', 'Great school with many great teachers. Overall, the academics are excellent, minus a few teachers. Has a very inclusive environment where nayone can fit in.', 'I think overall Wilton HS is a very good school and will have prepared me well for college.  Just like many schools and life in general, there are teachers that really care about the subject they are teaching and are trying their best to convey their knowledge.  But then there are always a handful of not so good teachers.  The administration makes it very difficult to switch into and out of classes so that can be frustrating.  The entire study body is very homogenous but I would say there is practically no racism or hatred towards non-conformists.', 'This is a great school district which embodies a safe community and prepares students for post secondary education.', 'My experience at Wilton High School has been overall very pleasant!The academics are suitable for people with learning disabilities and people who are interested in college level courses. The majority of students strive to do well in academics and plan on going to college. The teachers are amazing and helpful and extra help is always offered.', "My high school life was filled with many dramas actions. It started as a disaster because I couldn't get used to the high school system and I was adapting to the western culture.  As a result, I fail to get along with friends and keep the friendships I made during the middle school. Later in the years, the life progressed to chaos to a great experience. I expanded my vision and started to make friends who cares about me, and joined clubs. And due to my friend's silly action, somehow I ended winning homecoming competition. It was fun and I am thankful for him for letting me experience a great event. The teachers were great and flexible too. They were all great with different styles of teaching.", 'Great teachers and administration and great selection of courses. Clubs and activities could be more diverse.', "Wilton High School is a very academically minded school. The faculty's main goal is to send its students to college. There are many AP courses available to students, and the climate is very competitive.", 'Wilton High is very good in getting students ready and prepared for college. As an almost second semester senior, I can tell you from first hand experience that the teachers and guidance counselors are devoted to helping students achieve their goals and get into the schools they would like to. There are so many resources available through the school and teachers/guidance counselors for preparing for/applying to college.', "Wilton High School has been an incredible experience. Every year I've attended, I have received unlimited support from the incredible faculty. The teachers and administration truly care about the students and want them to succeed. However, there was a low-level of diversity and some students did not empathize with the struggles of other ethnic and social groups like they should have. Nevertheless, the Wilton High School faculty wanted to see all students succeed regardless of background, opinion, or GPA. I personally recommend Wilton High School to anyone in search of an unparalleled learning experience.", 'Wilton High School is a great school that prepares students well for the world ahead. With a wide variety of courses to choose from and caring teachers that will help you however you need, Wilton provides all opportunities imaginable for students.', 'Teachers are young and aggressively use new technology in their classrooms.', 'We are a primarily white Christian community of wealthy families. There is very little diversity, but we are accepting of differences']
column8: ['WHS is a great place to prepare academically for college. Socially I think  it can be hard  for students if they don’t find a group to be a part of.', 'This school is very good. I had a fun time. All I think Wilton High School needs to work on is its diversity, otherwise it is great.', 'I spent four very fun years here! Wilton High School definitely well-prepared me for college. The teachers always helped me when I needed it, and I made some of my best friends here.', 'Wilton High is a school like no other. In just recent months, I have witnessed several instances of discrimination (swastikas, racial slurs, etc) - most of which administration has done nothing about. The school consists of white, upper middle class Christians. There are obvious cliques, but new students shouldn\'t have a problem finding one that "fits" so long as they are outspoken. As for the teachers... I think most students have an adult they could go to in school, but I get the sense that forming relationships with students either isn\'t encouraged, or the teachers just don\'t know that their job is more than textbooks and test scores. There is a good number of course offerings and academics are highly competitive, but depending on where you\'re coming from, you\'ll find that the town is in it\'s own bubble.', 'The teachers were great, and I met a great deal of long lasting friends. I felt extremely prepared for college academically. It could be more diverse though. I think that they should also provide more de-stressing activities for students.', 'I liked how supportive the teachers were, but some could be unreasonable as they treat us like college students, that could have its up and downs! I wish there were more diversity but other than that, it’s an amazing school!!', 'A quite preppy school, of course, this is to be expected in Wilton Connecticut. But there are some circles of really rad people, I found an excellent community in the theatre department.', 'The experience was good. Would like to see the counselors work with children earlier. they seem to interact with kids only in senior year. The teachers are excellent and so also the resources.', 'Great school with many great teachers. Overall, the academics are excellent, minus a few teachers. column2: ["I loved going to this school. Most of the teachers genuinely care and your academy teacher always has your back. The chance to go to community college senior year really prepared me for college and the internships we're required to do gave me professional experience on my resume before I even graduated.", 'Morris County School of Technology is different than most high schools not only because of the academies, but because everyone, even the upperclassmen are kind and willing to help. Everyone is very welcoming and there is a truly positive community at the school. I have met some of the best people at this school and have made wonderful connections. This school is amazing because everyone is just as motivated as I am and pushes me to worker harder and become a better person.', 'Morris County School of Tech is a Career Ready School. If you have a passion and consider to thrive in it go to Mcst and they will put you ahead of everyone else. But this school does come with some downfalls. There aren’t many sports and clubs.  Everybody there try’s to be better then each other which can be very competitive. Another downfall is that if you are unsure what you want to do in your future you can’t switch academies and try a different passion for once. You are kind of stuck in one academy and it’s hard to change your mind and go in a different direction for college', 'The Morris County School of Technology paves a path for many young and ambitious adolescents. Within the walls of this school, lay the very diverse academies of healthcare, law and public safety, multimedia, art and design, business and much more. Along with this, the school\'s extracurriculars strive as they appeal to all students from all of the different academies. While stressing CTE practices, this school is designed to prepare a naive child to become bold and driven workers throughout the workforce. As the wise Confucius once said, "Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life." Hence, this school reflects this quote with beauty and excellence as it never fails to prepare students for a bright future.', 'The Morris County School of Technology is a great school to surround yourself with hard-working individuals. Some aspects may not be as strong as those compared to average public schools, but the opportunity to get a head-start on technical education through CTE (Career Technical Education) makes it all worth it.', 'It’s a really great place to learn. I look forward to going there daily. I’m in healthcare and I really enjoy the material I learn there.', 'MCST is a school that is highly focused on CTE and prepares students for college and the workforce. It offers a vast amount of full-time and part-time programs which incorporate industry professionals, standard equipment, and endless internship/volunteer opportunities within the chosen industry. MCST is filled with students who come in eager to learn each day, and that creates a fantastic school environment. If you know the career path you would like to take, I would definitely recommend.', 'I love being a student at Morris County School of Technology. All of the students and staff are very welcoming and the school has such a positive atmosphere. I am currently partaking in experiences that I would’ve never been able to receive if I did not go to Morris County School of Technology. My experiences are setting me up for college and beyond, in my future career. One of my favorite opportunities that you can receive attending this school, is the chance to attend college courses while in your senior year of high school.', 'The Morris County School of Technology differs greatly from other high schools in the area, mostly because every student attended with the purpose of studying what they are truly passionate about. Since it is a public school, yet you have to apply in order to attend, it is a small school. I believe this school was very beneficial in helping its students to succeed because the small student body enabled a close staff to student relationship to form. The counselors were phenomenal and they provided touching assemblies from time to time to remind us how we are not alone. The only thing I wish was different is the constant competitiveness among student grades.', 'The staff here will make an effort to develop good relationships with the students. If you want to be helped, you must be willing to help yourself. Being a part of an academy does not guarantee a lot of friends, but will help you develop a strong work ethic and good communication skills. One amazing thing about this school is that you are required to get an internship, which at first, may seem very tedious. However, based on the amount of time and effort you put in, you could land an amazing internship that could create connections for lifetime or for future encounters.', 'It is a blue ribbon school with excellent students who are dedicated, ambitious and studious about going to school. There are many smart children at this school to learn from. It is a great experience.', 'Love it here. All the students and teachers cultivate both a great academic and social environment. Would recommend.', 'LOVE LOVE LOVE mcst! the only downside is the commute :( the academy program really prepares students for the future and gives them a taste of what they may want to pursue in college and as a career.', "The way MCST organizes students into academies allows for some really quality connections to be made with their peers and helps prevent the formation of cliques. Everyone seems to have their own friend groups but there are very few students that actively avoid each other. It is frustrating, though, how difficult it is to pursue other options when you are struggling in a class. I have had classes with teachers that I couldn't learn from at all, and I had to struggle through the class because the school was small and didn't have many alternate options.", 'I loved MCST! It was a place where I was constantly surrounded by hardworking, inspiring students who always pushed me to be my best. I loved all of the teachers and faculty members. MCST was a place that I was happy to call home for my high school career.', 'I loved the diversity that was included in this school. It was easy to get comfortable and to make friends. The teachers care about you on a personal level and they generally want you to succeed. The administrative team works tirelessly to provide a great environment for the students.', 'I was part of the veterinary science academy and really enjoyed my time there. With a diverse collection of animals in the classroom, it was easy to learn the more complex concepts. The program taught us how to deal with real life scenarios and what the industry was like. Most teachers were nice and cared about the students and their progress. Playing in the volleyball team was fun and always got me through a tough day. The key was to get involved in extracurricular activities of interest and to choose the right academy since I studied the subject during all four years.', 'This school was beyond exceptional. The staff and teachers and always there to support you. The education was always relevant and modern.', 'The Morris County School of Technology is an excellent school for any incoming high-school student who wishes to get a head start on his/her career pathway. With specific academies, this school prepares students for college through hands-on learning and experience.My only problem with this school is its competitive nature. I believe that many of the students here do not seek to help each other, instead looking to pull each other down.', "I liked how different Morris Tech felt from a normal high school.  The academies in the school really prepare each student for their career path and preparing them for college.  While in the Culinary program I learned a lot of skills which will help me in life.  The school is rather small which I enjoyed better than a bigger school.  But there wasn't the feel of a normal high school like Friday Night Football games and school dances which just weren't existent.  I really really enjoyed having the option of attending CCM for my senior year and it really helped me out in the long run.  The school is missing some aspects of a normal high school, but instead gives a unique experience no other school gives."]
