column6: ["I am having a fantastic experience at MCST! Amazing teachers for the most part, fantastic people, and a very accepting environment. I wish there were more events outside of school like dances and sports games, but that doesn't outweigh the other amazing aspects of the school.", 'The school is great. There’s amazing student life and very supportive teachers. Everyone there is so helpful with one another', 'My experience at MCST has been overall, pretty good! Some of the teachers can be bad, especially for certain academy programs, which can make the experience a lot worse for some people. Some teachers are amazing, especially some of the math teachers and english teachers. The school vibe is a lot more chill than public high schools in the area, and people are generally pretty nice!', 'This school is really good. We are very well educated and prepared for college. Although we have terrible sports that not what we are known for. We have great academies and they have great opportunities for everyone.', 'I am beyond glad that I found and chose to attend Morris County School of Technology. As I am now applying to colleges, I realize how well prepared I am because of my teachers and courses. Administrators and teachers are open o answering any and all questions I have, making everything really easy and straightforward for me. Students are accepting and motivating to each other, which creates the perfect environment to learn and grow.', 'Morris County School of Technology gave me a great high school experience. I believe that choosing to go to this high school has truly set me up for my future. I have learned so much in my Education and Learning academy that has guided me to picking my major for college. I feel like this school is so welcoming and they provide every resource necessary to succeed. The environment at this school is very diverse and everyone fits in. It is not just like any other high school, Morris Tech offers programs that most high school students do not see until they are in college. If I had to change anything at this school, I would add more sports programs to choose from for athletes that are interested in sports like football, lacrosse, field hockey, tennis, track, etc.', 'Horrible! None of the teachers actually have the certification. They do not have the knowledge or skills to handle high schoolers! Horrible experience with the administration! Do not send your children here!', "I really love this school, it's almost like a fresh start and definitely prepared me for the world and my major in film for the future.", 'Good school if you know what you want to specialize in, not so great if you’re aiming for a top level school', 'My son has attended MCST for 2 years now and he absolutely loves it.  The teachers really care about the success of their students.  Some of the coursework can be very challenging at times; however, this is offset by the Academy blocks that teach career subjects that the kids are really interested in.  In 8th grade, my son was awarded several scholarships to local private high schools.  However, he only wanted to attend the Academy, so he turned down the scholarships.   He made a wise choice!', 'The teachers appear to enjoy the kids and instill a sense of enthusiasm. Guidance counselors have been quite helpful and take their role helping seriously and thoughtfully', 'My son just entered his sophomore year at Morris County School of Technology, after enjoying his freshman year there.  He likes the academics and the social atmosphere.  Very good administration and staff, who are helpful and knowledgeable.  He scored very well on the PARCC so that is further proof of solid teaching provided at MCST.  Would highly recommend to other parents.', 'I love the fact that you gain more experience and knowledge in the field of study that you are particularly interested in, so it aids you in preparing for the future. Going to this school helps you figure out your career path, and gain wonderful experiences with students at your level of intelligence. Although there are a few flaws in the school system, the school overall is a great place to be.', 'MCST is an unbelievably welcoming school. The teachers are amazing and always want to see their students succeed. Each academy gives students real life experiences in the field they wish to pursue. I have been so lucky to be part of an atmosphere as supportive as MCST’s. The students at MCST are so genuine and funny and I have made strong, long-lasting friendships that I will cherish forever.', "I found out about MCST only through its math, science, and engineering academy/program.  After researching the school, I found out that there are several other career specific academies such as culinary, business, and the one that interested me the most, veterinary science!  Though you cannot switch academies after you've been accepted, I don't regret applying for the veterinary science academy because I really feel like I've gotten a good head start in the animal science field.  I get to work with animals almost daily and my academy teacher knows a lot about the field.  The rest of the staff/faculty is also resourceful and understanding and has no problem helping its students.  Them and the school's program offers many opportunities like a 120 hour internship program for seniors and classes at community colleges, which help prepare its students for college.  Students at MCST are also unique and very friendly, making the school much more lively with all our differing interests.", "MCST is a Great school and it really does prepare you for working a real job unlike your average high school. However the administration and Guidance department are just complete and utter garbage.  I don't know how the school managed to find so many different individuals with the complete inability to perform the functions of their job, but they certainly accomplished it.", "There are both upsides and downsides to MCST. The teachers and administration are great and always there to help out. The class sizes are small, so you definitely get individualized attention, which is great in many ways. Because of the size of the school, however, we do have less opportunities in terms of sports and clubs, but that's never been an issue for those looking to really get involved.", 'The Morris County School of Technology pushed me to be a much better student than I would have been if I attended my home district high school. I was in a culture that made me work hard and I show for it. Coming to MCST was a very good decision.', 'My son Michael just completed his senior year at MCST where he majored in Computer Science.  The New “votech” schools are now the best schools in NJ and many more people taking notice. Mike just loved school & many of his Kinnelon friends later wished they had gone to MCST after hearing Mike’s experiences. The teachers where excellent & Mike’s CS teacher had 20+ years of experience in CS. Mike’s classmates where super smart and all the kids I met from MCST where very driven, focused & happy. Mike will be going to Boston Uni. & will be doing an accelerated MS in computer science. It was obvious to us that the education Mike got at MCST was far better then the education Mike would have gotten at any other HS. If your kid knows what they might like to do in college and is more of the academic type then investigate MCST. You will be glad you made the decision.', "Despite being a vocational school, the Morris County School of Technology  feels more like a college preparatory school that can truly help me develop the necessary skills I need to succeed in college and achieve my career goals. As a student who's dream is to one day become a veterinarian, I was ecstatic when I first learned that the school housed a large collection of animals. Through its veterinary science academy program, I was able to not only enhance my knowledge of animal science, but also gain hands-on experience in caring for a variety of mammals, reptiles, fish, and amphibians. It was an enriching experience that helped me grow tremendously as an individual looking to enter the field of veterinary medicine."]

He likes the academics and the social atmosphere.  Very good administration and staff, who are helpful and knowledgeable.  He scored very well on the PARCC so that is further proof of solid teaching provided at MCST.  Would highly recommend to other parents.', 'I love the fact that you gain more experience and knowledge in the field of study that you are particularly interested in, so it aids you in preparing for the future. Going to this school helps you figure out your career path, and gain wonderful experiences with students at your level of intelligence. Although there are a few flaws in the school system, the school overall is a great place to be.', 'MCST is an unbelievably welcoming school. The teachers are amazing and always want to see their students succeed. Each academy gives students real life experiences in the field they wish to pursue. I have been so lucky to be part of an atmosphere as supportive as MCST’s. The students at MCST are so genuine and funny and I have made strong, long-lasting friendships that I will cherish forever.', "I found out about MCST only through its math, science, and engineering academy/program.  After researching the school, I found out that there are several other career specific academies such as culinary, business, and the one that interested me the most, veterinary science!  Though you cannot switch academies after you've been accepted, I don't regret applying for the veterinary science academy because I really feel like I've gotten a good head start in the animal science field.  I get to work with animals almost daily and my academy teacher knows a lot about the field.  The rest of the staff/faculty is also resourceful and understanding and has no problem helping its students.  Them and the school's program offers many opportunities like a 120 hour internship program for seniors and classes at community colleges, which help prepare its students for college.  Students at MCST are also unique and very friendly, making the school much more lively with all our differing interests.", "MCST is a Great school and it really does prepare you for working a real job unlike your average high school. However the administration and Guidance department are just complete and utter garbage.  I don't know how the school managed to find so many different individuals with the complete inability to perform the functions of their job, but they certainly accomplished it.", "There are both upsides and downsides to MCST. The teachers and administration are great and always there to help out. The class sizes are small, so you definitely get individualized attention, which is great in many ways. Because of the size of the school, however, we do have less opportunities in terms of sports and clubs, but that's never been an issue for those looking to really get involved.", 'The Morris County School of Technology pushed me to be a much better student than I would have been if I attended my home district high school. I was in a culture that made me work hard and I show for it. Coming to MCST was a very good decision.', 'My son Michael just completed his senior year at MCST where he majored in Computer Science.  The New “votech” schools are now the best schools in NJ and many more people taking notice. Mike just loved school & many of his Kinnelon friends later wished they had gone to MCST after hearing Mike’s experiences. The teachers where excellent & Mike’s CS teacher had 20+ years of experience in CS. Mike’s classmates where super smart and all the kids I met from MCST where very driven, focused & happy. Mike will be going to Boston Uni. & will be doing an accelerated MS in computer science. It was obvious to us that the education Mike got at MCST was far better then the education Mike would have gotten at any other HS. If your kid knows what they might like to do in college and is more of the academic type then investigate MCST. You will be glad you made the decision.', "Despite being a vocational school, the Morris County School of Technology  feels more like a college preparatory school that can truly help me develop the necessary skills I need to succeed in college and achieve my career goals. As a student who's dream is to one day become a veterinarian, I was ecstatic when I first learned that the school housed a large collection of animals. Through its veterinary science academy program, I was able to not only enhance my knowledge of animal science, but also gain hands-on experience in caring for a variety of mammals, reptiles, fish, and amphibians. It was an enriching experience that helped me grow tremendously as an individual looking to enter the field of veterinary medicine."]

column2: ['My experience at Hastings High School has overall been good. The students are supportive of one another for the most part, and there are some very dedicated and helpful teachers who will stay late to help students study. However, there is a big lack in diversity in the school and the few cultural activities we do have often die out when the person in charge of them graduates due to a lack of interest from other students.', 'My experience was pleasant, though I did notice a decline in quality over my 4 years. Most of my teachers were competent and genuinely interested in helping the students but there were some that you could tell could not wait to retire and some that were new and incompetent. The school doe not excel in sports (god help our sorry excuse of a football team) but the music and theatre are top notch.', 'Very small classes with a strong sense of community as many students are in the school district from kindergarten through 12th grade. Most of the teachers are really good at their jobs and I felt incredibly well prepared for college.', 'Hastings High School is a place full of artistic, smart, and liberal thinkers. Although the town is not very diverse and is quite small (with only 500 students attending HHS), my experience there has been a rich one. The school has provided me with the opportunity to pursue my interests in music, theatre and journalism as well as my passions for French and English literature. The relationships I have established there—both with teachers and the students around me—have brought me immense fulfillment.', 'A very overhyped place, but not horrible honestly. I’m not sure why it gets an a+, seems optimistic.....', 'I made close friends. Had good relationships with my teachers and faculty.Will value my education from this school as I head off to college', 'Fantastic teachers who really care about their students their education. Could provide better counseling about college and some community college courses or more AP classes to prepare students for college.', 'The acedemics are fantastic and you’ll find some really really good teachers here. My biggest complaint is the people at the school. It being so small there are only so many people you can talk to this creating a lack of social mobility and a clique culture. As far as the facilities, they’re what you might expect from a very old building. The water fountains are absurdly slow, the heating system doesn’t really work so well, and a lot of rooms have no A/C. That being said, the custodial staff is fantastic and they’re very committed to the school. They keep the building very clean and are very quick about fixing anything that breaks. They’re also so friendly and have no issue with helping you retrieve a forgotten item from a locked room. The guidance department is top notch and the administration is very supportive of student activities.', "I was excited to start high school as a Freshman, but it was a tough transition. I regret not working hard enough, but I still got A LOT out of my high school experience. The extracurriculars were fantastic and I loved my friends. I had elusive relationships with my teachers and they're exceptionally talented. I would constantly go after school to chat with them and I still keep intouch with them. The teachers changed my global perspective, (most people just enhance it), helped me become a real thinker/question things, and prepared me for LIFE. The majority of people in the world will NEVER LEARN what students at HHS learn. You have agency and don't take your education for granted. I sorely miss this place and the innocence of high school, but once you graduate, you'll have THIS experience for the rest of your life.", "Hastings highschool is truly a unique learning experience inside the classroom and out. The teachers are amazing and you will take them for granted until it is time to leave. The actual students attending the school are mostly all very privileged and very wealthy so if you don't fit that mold you will be an outsider, but it is honestly worth it for the education you will receive. It's a great community if you are musically inclined or enjoy theatre, any of the arts really. There are very strong programs. Honestly you will find your place no matter what you like. Athletics are more or less a joke besides soccer, even the teams who do well won't get attention because they are not soccer. But the boys variety soccer team did win states so that's cool! Anyways overall you will have an unforgettable experience here, I would recommend it.", "I love being a student in Hastings. It's a great environment to learn in. I believe that it will prepare me well for college.", 'This is an amazing school, full of academic opportunities for students. We have the best staff and faculty.', "The teachers, the environment and the encouragement that I've received from the entire community has resulted in who I am today and where I've gotten so far. So many teachers and friends have pushed me out of my comfort zone into a place I never thought I would be comfortable in or where I thought I could grow, but I was clearly wrong. As long as you show that you are trying in their class, and actually care, teachers will go out of their way to help you in anyway they can be use they actually care about you and your future.", "I love hastings high school, it is very open to people of all gender, sexual identity and race. I feel very at home here and can't wait to spend another 2 years here!", 'This school is very focused on academics and is a very artsy school.', 'The teachers engage a lot with the students and do lots of hands on work with them.', 'I have never felt unsafe at school. Emergencies are handled in a very organized manner.', 'Not all sports are treated equally and people who play sports do not have access to the resources other extracurriculars do', 'There are a lot of people helping each student succeed, but certain areas (guidance department) could use some improvement.', 'Teachers are qualified, engaged, and lessons are generally stimulating']

column6: ['There seem to be many options for all kinds of students. There are volunteer opportunities. Sports and theater are popular activities.', 'Wonderful teachers in the high school. Very accessible and supportive of the students.', 'The women who work in the health office are amazing! Very caring and kind. The school seems to take safety very seriously. Bullying is not tolerated and the culture of the school overall is very accepting.', 'The faculty and staff are very caring of the students. The guidance department offers a lot of support, both academic and emotional. For the most part, it is a very tolerant and accepting community.', 'I have never felt unsafe at Hastings High School, and I think they have an average yet effective quality of safety policies and measures implemented in the district.', 'There are multiple clubs and groups to participate in after and outside the school, and a large number of students participate in them on a regular basis. Some clubs are more popular than others, and the level of participants varies for each.', "Although I have only attended Hastings High for two years, I am able to say that I have genuinely appreciated my time here. The courses and curriculums are all rigorous and push me to perform my best academically, which often puts a lot of stress and pressure on me. But I appreciate the challenges I've faced, and I know that I am very well-prepared for college. The students are overall friendly, but they are not necessarily fully welcoming to newcomers, as I have experienced. It took me a while to develop a strong group of friends, and it's still hard for me to find someone who shares the same Christian beliefs that I do. I have often felt left out, and sometimes discriminated against, because of my faith - though it has usually been indirectly, it has affected me greatly. My experience at Hastings, however, is one that I do not regret, and I know that I will graduate confidently knowing that I am ready for the real world.", 'The one thing I strongly appreciate and respect about Hastings High School is the quality of the teachers and staff. I have several personal, friendly relationships with my teachers - including teachers that I have and have not had. They push me to do my hardest and strike me with their genuine care and consideration of how their students are doing both academically and mentally. They care about my school life and out-of-school life, and for that I am beyond grateful.', "I moved from the Bronx to Hastings on Hudson when I was 11 and it was the best experience I've ever had. The school's staff is very much involved in trying to help students reach their full potential academically, athletically, and artistically", "This school was good for my kids. Hastings High School and Hastings elementary school are very good.  The middle school is so-so. The High School has an excellent arts program and a really interesting community.  As all high schools, it's clique-y and status-y.  But it's not a terribly hard-driving school with everyone out to get into an Ivy, like Ardsley and Irvington (other Rivertown area schools) are.  And it's not strict and regimented like Dobbs Ferry (another Rivertown school).  It's pretty mellow and very artsy.", 'Great school. Great teachers. Great community to learn in.', 'There are a few teachers who have been so passionate that it helps you learn. Others are just average', 'Our sports use to be better but everyone loves going to the games. Amnesty is a very popular club.', 'Administrators are great about this', 'I have done very well academically and with my sports.  I do feel that the sports program is improving but the Senior class is only 118 students, very small.', 'There are enough options in the cafeteria', 'The administration is the best', 'They are in the process of renovating the fields at our shcol', 'The majority of the teachers are great', 'Hastings High School is a great school to attend']

column2: ['I really liked the way teachers cared about you and your studies. They were really on top of you if you were slipping in the class. I also liked the fact that the guidance counselors really cared about the work of students and prepared them as much as possible for college. The school encouraged everyone to be a part of club, sports, or any extracurricular activities. The diversity was really good and I would like to see Fox Lane become an even better school in the near future.', "Fox Lane is extremely diverse. Every corner you turn, you'll find someone with different backgrounds, interest, hobbies, and more. Not only is the community diverse but its also diverse in its clubs, sports (shout out to the wrestling team), and much more! The staff has some of the most polite and respectful peopole who will do anything to answer a simple question or find help. Great school, more than content with my 4 years there.", 'It is a very welcoming and nice community.  The staff is very helpful and will do everything in their power to help out if needed.  Many courses are available as well as a huge variety of sports.', "Fox Lane High School was a nice four years of my life. The academics were a hit or miss for me though. Only the science department seems to have the majority of good teachers. However, I love how many AP's our school has, as well as the campus and overall school vibe. Diversity SUCKS though, although that's not really the school's fault. Overall had a nice experience. Nothing special though I don't think.", 'Fox Lane is a public school that gives the academic experience of a private school. Students are provided with a curriculum that is at their level and goes at their pace, and then they are pushed to exceed what they thought they could. The staff members are personable as well as knowledgeable and create a safe space for students to grow and succeed.', "Fox Lane is a rigorous high school that leaves students very well prepared for college. The faculty provides students with a great support system and are always willing to help students learn in a way that works for them. However, the math department could use some re-staffing as many teachers don't seem to teach in a way that most students understand. One department that stands out is the music department, which has amazing staff, technology and opportunities for students. Fox Lane has great facilities equipped with new learning technology that helps students to adapt to the changing world around them. Overall, a terrific public school.", 'Fox lane is great. Cherish the time you have there with friends and the ones you love. You’ll miss it trust me. Things may seem rough or brutal, but it will be some of the best memories of your life.', 'Teachers are great for the most part but the upper staff such as the principal and vice principal could be much better. Over the past 3 years I have found that the upper staff prohibits students from doing most things. Hard to start a club and upper staff doesn’t care much about students.', "FLHS has been my home for over three years now, and I couldn't be happier anywhere else. Every student is going to have their own outlook on what makes our school good and bad, and that's fine. Overall, Fox Lane is an exceptional school and its community has made my life a whole lot better. I unfortunately have limited space to write.I love my classes, but some of my former teachers aren't good at supporting their students and their learning. Classes prepare you for college. Every one of my closet friends has a different religious and/or ethnic background. Clubs bring different people together. I always feel safe. Administration listens and parent helpers bring about change. My biggest complaint is the ventilation in the girl's locker room. My girls and I don't deserve this.", '80% of the kids are preppy, over privileged kids. There are very few teachers who are actually good at their jobs and make the kids excited to learn. It is super hard to fit in, especially when moving into the district. The food isn’t great. The teachers specifically for math classes make math almost seem impossible. I will say, however, that students do have good access to technology and resources. Most homework now is assigned online which makes things easy. There are many electives to choose from which not many schools have, so that’s a positive aspect. Honestly, the teachers for electives like art and music are the only kind teachers, and they are really the only ones interested in what and how a student wants to learn or do. The school only really cares about the popular or athletic kids.', "I studied at Fox Lane High Scholl, I was a senior last year. This school or most important to say the teachers and counselors had shaped the person that I am now. They all were very kind and nice to the school. All the teachers woke up inside me a hunger for education and I'm very thankful for that.", 'Fox lane provided me with a well rounded, generic education while also offering challenging courses and interesting opportunities for non-academic pursuits.  I would like to see them offer more AP classes in the future and make clubs and after school productions a larger part of the school.', 'The teachers are the best part of this school. They are so caring, funny and genuinely want you to do your best. A flaw would be that when an incident occurs, there were favorites and no one was disciplined and problems continued because of it.', 'Fox Lane is a very welcoming community. They offer great classes with teachers who are devoted to the subjects they teach.', "Fox Lane's strongest asset is their academics. The teachers there are always willing to help students out and even go the extra mile to check up on students. The relationship that you build with your teachers allows you to persevere through challenging courses and do better than one may think. Aside from the teachers your peers are very caring and always willing to help you out in anything that you need. Whether that is a study partner or someone that you can count on outside of the classroom. Fox Lane really prepares students to become great socially and have an incredible ability to interact and work with others.", 'What I liked about FLHS it was the diversity and the various clubs students were participating in. It is a place that has changed my life forever and is changing the lives of many more. I am not saying it is discrimination free but it is close to it. Students can rely on each other for help no matter their background, which is very rare for a school to have this.', 'It is a very diverse high school that offers a huge variety of courses. The ASPIRE program helps seniors find an internship and explore career options. I would like to see better budget management in the district as a while as we were in a debt.', 'The teaching is overall very sufficient. There are some problems with the diversity issue in the school, but the experience is relatively great.', 'The teachers are very good and the opportunities for AP courses really helped me.  The teachers want you to succeed and they provide plenty of resources and help.  All of the sports programs are fantastic and there are numerous clubs as well.', 'As a graduating Senior, I really enjoyed the diverse culture of the school as it readies me for the "real world".  My friends in surrounding towns, while they are in public schools, there is no difference in the socioeconomic culture of the students, which I feel will be a problem when they first go to college.']

Over the past 3 years I have found that the upper staff prohibits students from doing most things. Hard to start a club and upper staff doesn’t care much about students.', "FLHS has been my home for over three years now, and I couldn't be happier anywhere else. Every student is going to have their own outlook on what makes our school good and bad, and that's fine. Overall, Fox Lane is an exceptional school and its community has made my life a whole lot better. I unfortunately have limited space to write.I love my classes, but some of my former teachers aren't good at supporting their students and their learning. Classes prepare you for college. Every one of my closet friends has a different religious and/or ethnic background. Clubs bring different people together. I always feel safe. Administration listens and parent helpers bring about change. My biggest complaint is the ventilation in the girl's locker room. My girls and I don't deserve this.", '80% of the kids are preppy, over privileged kids. There are very few teachers who are actually good at their jobs and make the kids excited to learn. It is super hard to fit in, especially when moving into the district. The food isn’t great. The teachers specifically for math classes make math almost seem impossible. I will say, however, that students do have good access to technology and resources. Most homework now is assigned online which makes things easy. There are many electives to choose from which not many schools have, so that’s a positive aspect. Honestly, the teachers for electives like art and music are the only kind teachers, and they are really the only ones interested in what and how a student wants to learn or do. The school only really cares about the popular or athletic kids.', "I studied at Fox Lane High Scholl, I was a senior last year. This school or most important to say the teachers and counselors had shaped the person that I am now. They all were very kind and nice to the school. All the teachers woke up inside me a hunger for education and I'm very thankful for that.", 'Fox lane provided me with a well rounded, generic education while also offering challenging courses and interesting opportunities for non-academic pursuits.  I would like to see them offer more AP classes in the future and make clubs and after school productions a larger part of the school.', 'The teachers are the best part of this school. They are so caring, funny and genuinely want you to do your best. A flaw would be that when an incident occurs, there were favorites and no one was disciplined and problems continued because of it.', 'Fox Lane is a very welcoming community. They offer great classes with teachers who are devoted to the subjects they teach.', "Fox Lane's strongest asset is their academics. The teachers there are always willing to help students out and even go the extra mile to check up on students. The relationship that you build with your teachers allows you to persevere through challenging courses and do better than one may think. Aside from the teachers your peers are very caring and always willing to help you out in anything that you need. Whether that is a study partner or someone that you can count on outside of the classroom. Fox Lane really prepares students to become great socially and have an incredible ability to interact and work with others.", 'What I liked about FLHS it was the diversity and the various clubs students were participating in. It is a place that has changed my life forever and is changing the lives of many more. I am not saying it is discrimination free but it is close to it. Students can rely on each other for help no matter their background, which is very rare for a school to have this.', 'It is a very diverse high school that offers a huge variety of courses. The ASPIRE program helps seniors find an internship and explore career options. I would like to see better budget management in the district as a while as we were in a debt.', 'The teaching is overall very sufficient. There are some problems with the diversity issue in the school, but the experience is relatively great.', 'The teachers are very good and the opportunities for AP courses really helped me.  The teachers want you to succeed and they provide plenty of resources and help.  All of the sports programs are fantastic and there are numerous clubs as well.', 'As a graduating Senior, I really enjoyed the diverse culture of the school as it readies me for the "real world".  My friends in surrounding towns, while they are in public schools, there is no difference in the socioeconomic culture of the students, which I feel will be a problem when they first go to college.']
column6: ['I love the Teachers at Fox Lane High School and all the support I have received while attending.  There is a wide range of sports and clubs at the school.  Also, the school is diverse.', 'Fox Lane is a school that is very diverse. It has a lot of different activities and sports to participate. Fox lane also has a lot of different academic programs that are challenging and help prepare me for college.', "I like how Fox Lane tried to take action against all of the bad things done at the school, such as kids doing drugs or vaping.  I also like how the school encourages students to reach out and participate in all different kinds of activities and clubs.  What I would change about this school is the way the schedule works - it can be very confusing for many, and it's hard to keep track of what classes you have each day.  Another negative part of my experience at Fox Lane is that many teachers don't understand all of the other stresses and activities the students have on a daily basis, and we get a lot of work at once.", 'I enjoyed the people I hung out with everyday and I had grat teachers. This school has a variety of classes to take.', 'I was moved to the Fox Lane district to be in a special needs program. This program made it possible for me to excel academically and move on to college.', 'Children are not prepared for college after graduation. Heard same thing from many parents whose children have moved on in different directions.', "Best public high school in the county. I'm a senior and due to my experiences at Fox Lane, I feel more college ready than ever. There's a lot of options for honors and AP Classes to choose from. The school has various events that attempt to bring the community together, such as Wellness Day and Collaborative Lunch. The school puts an emphasis on sports and most of the student body is involved in a sport and attend sporting events, especially basketball. Teachers are helpful and want the students to succeed. The guidance counselors get to know the students and try to start the college process as early as junior year. The school is very open to student input, as students are able to participate in the school board's meetings. Attending Fox Lane High school has made me feel ready for college and my future.", "Throughout high school I had great teachers who cared about every student and made sure they worked their hardest. Along with that I went to a very diverse school which I loved as well because most schools around our district were based off of majority's. Our school was very spirited and open to anyone and everyone which is what I loved most about the school. There were clubs that supported everything, assembly's that addressed problems, and fundraisers for good causes.", "As a rising senior at Fox Lane High School, I have a multitude of experience at my school. I believe Fox Lane is unique as a school compared to other high schools in the area with it's strong belief in diversity- it advocates for equality, whether racially or socioeconomically, the school strives to break social barriers and create a comfortable space for every student to attend. I have great relationships with many teachers that work hard to make the classroom an enjoyable academic experience. The only thing I wish our school district could improve is the amount of finance it puts into making resources and facilities more updated and available to students.", "It's a great school district and a great school  because of the resources provided by the faculty, parents, and teachers. Diversity is greatly appreciated here and one of the best things about fox lane is it's Avid program as well as its ESOL program.", 'At Fox Lane High School, I enjoyed the atmosphere that was full of school pride and enthusiasm for learning.', 'My experiences is good I liked the diversity at fox lane. I liked how the school have many clubs where everyone can fit in one. There is always something to do at fox lane. Sports', 'I really loved attending fox lane because I met my closest friends here and learned a lot about myself. I was able to grow and continue my successes at Loyola University Maryland.', 'The school overall prepared me well for college. However, the school tends to cater its academia to the students who have trouble learning and lack programs for excelling students. Socially the school is very segregated. The social scene is very cliquey and it is hard to move between "social classes". Most students disregard the presence of the hispanic community. Further, the school has very unnecessary protocols for safety and treats its students like children rather than young adults. The school tries extremely hard to be "pc" however it comes off as "babying" the students. For example, the sign-out system for leaving campus is very arbitrary, inefficient, and demonstrates a lack of trust between administration and the students. As for cleanliness, it is unknown how often the bathroom facilities are cleaned. However, if I were to take a guess, then I\'d assume less than once per day.', 'Overall, I had a pretty good experience considering the hell that high school life entails. The school offered multiple AP classes, and the teaches for these classes  were for the most part exceptional. All students who actually pay attention in class have a far chance of doing well on the AP exam. Also, the guidance office was a big help when it came to picking a college and applying.', 'What I really liked about Fox Lane is the education. I actually felt prepared for college and the level of independence and extra help you could receive is outstanding.', 'Fox Lane High School was one the best experiences of my life. Excellent teachers, nice students, and an environment that incredibly facilitates learning in a way that no other place can.', 'Overall, I had a really great experience during my time at Fox Lane High School. I had the opportunity to receive an excellent education that provided me with college readiness and social skills to enter the real world. I think that being able to take AP courses really helped me have a better understanding of what type of work to expect in college, and the amount of preparation you should be putting into projects and exams. Fox Lane is a very diverse and supportive community, and through extracurricular activities and community service, I am grateful for having those opportunities to develop leadership skills and relationships with others in a group project setting. The teachers really do care about the success of their students, and are always there and willing to help you when you need it and encourage you to be your best.', "I like how easy it is to use this website on your phone. It's easy to understand and to apply for scholarships. I just made my account and I've already applied for 2 scholarships.", "My experience with Fox Lane High School was rather pleasant. The staff were dedicated to helping its students out and furthering their future to college. FLHS offered opportunities to its students and cared for its students as well. If there was an issue of bullying between classmates, it would be dealt with swiftly; the school was very anti-bullying. It's a very diverse school and it's proud of its diversity and celebrates it with Multicultural Week. Spanish classes for native speakers is offered at the school (and the middle school) to sharpen the native Spanish speakers skills. The school was heavily guarded and the students felt safe at the school because of the security guards and the security systems placed around the school. One thing that FLHS could change is the new schedule that it switched to on my last year. They should organize the schedule so that it works out with more ease or revert back to its old schedule."]

column2: ["It's an okay school. I guess the academic standards are pretty good in the Westchester County, but not as good as Scarsdale or Eastchester where there are more wealthy, studious students and family. The teachers are really good, they always there for you when it comes to extra support and very flexible. It's a kind of a school where if you want it, you have to go and get it - the opportunities are out there.", 'I like it a lot. I moved here my junior year of high school and immediately noticed a positive change in my grades and overall performance at school.', "Harrison high school has extremely difficult classes, but passing these classes will look very impressive to colleges. Students at Harrison have the ability to apply for an IB diploma, which will help them in their college applications. It seems that the administrators care more about English and History classes rather than Math and Science classes. The teachers don't offer a lot of support for their students which can make  classes and work overwhelming. The administration and staff do not take claims of  discrimination, such as racism and homophobia, seriously. It seems as though the wealthier students don't get as harsh of punishments as others. There are multiple school psychologists working everyday, most likely due to the large amount of students who can't handle the massive amounts of stress that Harrison puts on their students.", 'I like how teachers are willing to go the extra mile for students who need a little extra help and I also admire the acceptance of cultures from all around the world.', "I think that the quality of the teachers at Harrison High School are the driving force of its excellence. There are most definitely some undesirable aspects of the school, but I think that the superb quality of the teachers overrule that entirely. Aspects of the school such as the administration appearing to lack understanding of the students along with how the school budgets its construction projects disproportionately are important to think about when considering a student's livelihood at Harrison High School. With all that being said, I believe that the quality of the educators present possess the power for students to propel themselves towards their personally individualized outcomes regarding what it is that they'd like to get out of high school.", 'My experience at Harrison was a great one. I moved to Harrison and came in as a Freshman. Most of the students were friends their entire life. I made friends eventually, it would be great to come up with ways to get New students involved. The teachers really care and are very supportive. Sports is s big part of The school but even if you are not involved in a sport there are other fun clubs available.', 'It’s a school with good sports and academics. Great, friendly environment that enables intellectual growth.', "Something that I really loved about Harrison High School would be the food, especially the wrap/salad place. At the area, a lady who works there would ask me if I want a wrap, sandwich, quesadilla, or salad. I would always chose a wrap and they have different variations of things that you can put inside the wrap. An example can be is that they have a good variety of cheeses. But something that I don't like about the high school would be that when its around summer time, they put the Air Conditioner really high. And when its also winter time, some of my classes are really cold.", "A good school that offers pretty good things. Will shove the IB Diploma down your throat, but if you're interested in that it may be worth it in the long haul.", 'Harrison high school has amazing opportunities, from resources such as technology to help you study, to planning and initiating your own ideas. However, the social environment could definitely be better. There is a huge divide among student. I know, \'cliques\'is something that can\'t be "solved". Most international students simply don\'t feel at home because there is hardly any unity among student.', 'A lot of opportunities to take rigorous classes and for the IB Diploma or otherwise. HHS also provides a lot of different clubs and extracurricular clubs to get involved.', 'I think I had a pretty good experience. The classes offered were challenging and fit my need to become prepared for college education.', 'Harrison High School shaped my future, allowing me to further myself and grant myself opportunity I otherwise would not believed would be possible.  I am going to Cornell University in the fall of 2017 and I thank Harrison High School for that', 'The overall experience was great at Harrison High School.School was not very helpful in college search/apply process.', 'Harrison High School has given me a great experience throughout my four years here. The teachers are very helpful and always go that extra mile for you. The small community makes it easier for you to reach out to get help.', "Resources are abundant, but lopsidedly applied (e.g., cafeteria gets million dollar renovation with eight TVs no one watches, but the library computers still barely work). IB program brings in international base, and overall promotes analytic thinking, but can alienate by allowing some unchecked bigotry in the classroom. Class offerings could improve (only languages are French, Italian, and Spanish). Cut-throat environment among the upper wealth stratum; fixation on GPAs; grade inflation. Not much bullying but ignorance and slurs are rampant. Sports are intense, potentially leading to burnout. Cafeteria food is standard fare. Clubs are diverse; funding varies. Club membership is excessive, with quantity trumping quality. Administration is extremely bureaucratic, cumbersome, unresponsive, and thoroughly disliked by students and teachers alike. Blue-collar preparatory courses (e.g. automobile repair) have been abandoned, underscoring lack of care for students who don't bolster rankings.", "There are anti-bullying measures and talks but it's still prevalent. The school nurse is not very helpful; she always overreacts and typically just sends people home if they have a headache. The security guards and police officer really don't provide that great of a sense of protection but the area itself is pretty safe.", 'There are a very great number of diverse clubs, but they are not taken seriously by the teachers running them or by the students participating. For this reason, the existing clubs never really achieve anything and it is relatively impossible to start a new club because of lack of funding.', "I've been making the most of my high school experience. I have had to deal with unmotivated and unhelpful teachers but I have done my best to take advantage of the IB program and everything my school has to offer.", "Some teachers really go above and beyond in doing everything they can to maximize the learning experience they provide their students with. Others do the minimum; these teachers don't really teach in class and expect students to teach themselves more."]

column6: ["I went from a geeky freshman to a varsity wrestler, to one of the male leads in the school musical.  Harrison encourages it's students to try, to be, to do!  The teachers were always available for help.  It was not unusual to be on the phone with my AP Chemistry teacher at 11pm going over a homework assignment I was struggling with.  Kids could walk in and attend a past teacher's class, during a free period of course.  Sadly, when a few students passed away, the entire school, teachers, students, and families would come together for candlelight vigils.", 'Harrison High School is a great school for many reasons. One reason being that sports are very seriously as the school is considered a powerhouse in sports for New York public schools. Also the school is part of the IB program which allows students to challenge themselves and think and come up with different perspectives.', 'I felt pretty prepared for college, not so much the real world.', "A student's experience at Harrison High school is very subjective; The quality of your four years will be determined by he amount of effort a student in having a good experience. The experience is what a student chooses to do, to get a positive or negative experience. In my four years at Harrison, I have had an overall good experience because of the friends I surrounded myself with and the teacher I've been lucky to have. Not all students are friendly and not all teachers are of the same quality, but those factors are not the only reasons to have a negative high school experience.", 'The cafeteria has been recently renovated to include more and improved food options for before, during, and after school. The main food bars have hot lunches, salads, and sandwiches. This food is always healthy and makes a strong effort to incorporate all main food groups into the lunches, making healthier options. The added food bar is open before and after school as well, serving extra snacks, coffee and assorted drinks. It is popular when the main food bar is not open. Also the school allows for food services in the town to deliver food to the high school during lunch periods.', "The school's administration cares for all students and does their job to ensure everyone has an equal opportunity for education and equality. Multiple guidance counselors for all four grades ensures that there is a smaller student to counselor ratio, giving students more individual attention when they need advice or help with scheduling. The vice principles work hard to monitor student activity in the classroom, to make sure all students are adequately passing classes and are attending them with punctuality.", 'Harrison High School has more than average amounts of spirit and pride for the school. Most students and faculty attend the football games to show support for athletes. Besides sports, the number of sports options and ways to exercise at the school are above average as well. There is a fitness center with the latest amount of equipment and the sports teams always work their hardest to compete with other schools.', 'Most teachers have a genuine interest in their students, and work at the best of their abilities to encourage students to work hard and reach their maximum potential.', 'Most students engage in after school activities, and have a plethora of options to choose from at this school. Examples such as debate club, student government, Gay Straight Alliance, French club, etc. Within each of these clubs, is a dedicated teacher or staff member always engaged and ready to get the most out of their time. A trend is that students first join cubs in freshman year, and continue them through senior year. This shows commitment and genuine interest in the club itself.', 'Not much peer pressure present. The school is very against sexual orientation. Rejected a club to pass out ribbons about Come-Out-Day during a football game and refused to create a mullti-sex bathroom', "There are a variety of classes available but puts an emphasis on the IB program. Due to this there are not many AP classes offered. The scheduling process may take forever if your counselor can't comply with your wishes. The teachers are good depending on who you get. There are some sucky teachers that still work here", "Every school event that occurred was good like the pep rally and sports events but the dances are ok. There are people that always end up being drunk. I probably wouldn't choose this school again if I could do it all over", "The school nurse only talks on the phone the whole time and are never there when you need them. We the police in our school just in case but there's only one police member for the whole school.", "Some are great teachers and hold extra help at least twice a week. Some teachers are horrible in which they change your grade depending on their mood and don't hold any extra help. They also yell at you for asking simple questions and deduct your grade by answering a question wrong using the information that they gave you", 'School building and facilities and technology are available to students but only for a limited time. College prep and tutoring is almost not present here', 'Counselors are there to support you but can make mistakes that can affect college and school', 'A little pricey but overall it tastes good', 'Varsity sports are very serious and perform very well', 'Many opportunities and commitment differs from depending on how many times the club meets', "Harrison High School has a large variety of after school activities. All sports have the option to be on junior varsity or varsity which is more challenging however both require a try out. If a student isn't interested in sports however they still have many more options. Almost every foreign language has a club as well. If a student is interested in a club that doesn't exist it is really easy to get it started ! All the student needs to do is find a few others interested in the club, find an administrator who would supervise and get approval by the principal. All the students are very active in after school activities , and if they are not apart of a specific club a lot of students hang out until the after school bus comes in the new student union and watch tv or play games."]
column8: ["I went from a geeky freshman to a varsity wrestler, to one of the male leads in the school musical.  Harrison encourages it's students to try, to be, to do!  The teachers were always available for help.  It was not unusual to be on the phone with my AP Chemistry teacher at 11pm going over a homework assignment I was struggling with.  Kids could walk in and attend a past teacher's class, during a free period of course.  Sadly, when a few students passed away, the entire school, teachers, students, and families would come together for candlelight vigils.", 'Harrison High School is a great school for many reasons. One reason being that sports are very seriously as the school is considered a powerhouse in sports for New York public schools. Also the school is part of the IB program which allows students to challenge themselves and think and come up with different perspectives.', 'I felt pretty prepared for college, not so much the real world.', "A student's experience at Harrison High school is very subjective; The quality of your four years will be determined by he amount of effort a student in having a good experience. The experience is what a student chooses to do, to get a positive or negative experience. In my four years at Harrison, I have had an overall good experience because of the friends I surrounded myself with and the teacher I've been lucky to have. Not all students are friendly and not all teachers are of the same quality, but those factors are not the only reasons to have a negative high school experience.", 'The cafeteria has been recently renovated to include more and improved food options for before, during, and after school. The main food bars have hot lunches, salads, and sandwiches. This food is always healthy and makes a strong effort to incorporate all main food groups into the lunches, making healthier options. The added food bar is open before and after school as well, serving extra snacks, coffee and assorted drinks. It is popular when the main food bar is not open. Also the school allows for food services in the town to deliver food to the high school during lunch periods.', "The school's administration cares for all students and does their job to ensure everyone has an equal opportunity for education and equality. Multiple guidance counselors for all four grades ensures that there is a smaller student to counselor ratio, giving students more individual attention when they need advice or help with scheduling. The vice principles work hard to monitor student activity in the classroom, to make sure all students are adequately passing classes and are attending them with punctuality.", 'Harrison High School has more than average amounts of spirit and pride for the school. Most students and faculty attend the football games to show support for athletes. Besides sports, the number of sports options and ways to exercise at the school are above average as well. There is a fitness center with the latest amount of equipment and the sports teams always work their hardest to compete with other schools.', 'Most teachers have a genuine interest in their students, and work at the best of their abilities to encourage students to work hard and reach their maximum potential.', 'Most students engage in after school activities, and have a plethora of options to choose from at this school. Examples such as debate club, student government, Gay Straight Alliance, French club, etc. Within each of these clubs, is a dedicated teacher or staff member always engaged and ready to get the most out of their time. A trend is that students first join cubs in freshman year, and continue them through senior year. This shows commitment and genuine interest in the club itself.', 'Not much peer pressure present. The school is very against sexual orientation. Rejected a club to pass out ribbons about Come-Out-Day during a football game and refused to create a mullti-sex bathroom', "There are a variety of classes available but puts an emphasis on the IB program. Due to this there are not many AP classes offered. The scheduling process may take forever if your counselor can't comply with your wishes. The teachers are good depending on who you get. There are some sucky teachers that still work here", "Every school event that occurred was good like the pep rally and sports events but the dances are ok. There are people that always end up being drunk. I probably wouldn't choose this school again if I could do it all over", "The school nurse only talks on the phone the whole time and are never there when you need them. We the police in our school just in case but there's only one police member for the whole school.", "Some are great teachers and hold extra help at least twice a week. Some teachers are horrible in which they change your grade depending on their mood and don't hold any extra help. They also yell at you for asking simple questions and deduct your grade by answering a question wrong using the information that they gave you", 'School building and facilities and technology are available to students but only for a limited time. College prep and tutoring is almost not present here', 'Counselors are there to support you but can make mistakes that can affect college and school', 'A little pricey but overall it tastes good', 'Varsity sports are very serious and perform very well', 'Many opportunities and commitment differs from depending on how many times the club meets', "Harrison High School has a large variety of after school activities. All sports have the option to be on junior varsity or varsity which is more challenging however both require a try out. If a student isn't interested in sports however they still have many more options. Almost every foreign language has a club as well. If a student is interested in a club that doesn't exist it is really easy to get it started ! All the student needs to do is find a few others interested in the club, find an administrator who would supervise and get approval by the principal. All the students are very active in after school activities , and if they are not apart of a specific club a lot of students hang out until the after school bus comes in the new student union and watch tv or play games."]

column2: ['I wish that there would be more emphasis on the music and art programs from the administration. The administration and faculty often  hinder or outright eliminate certain programs when they feel they are not benefiting the student body. The music program leaders had drastic cuts as well as an overall lack of enthusiasm and support for the students who are involved in activities like the marching band or concert bands. There are other minor improvements that could be instituted such as changes in the food quality and an increase in parent involvement and input.', 'Some staff give little to no care about students success, but rather tests cores and funding. Some teachers put fourth little effort into teaching, and provide little resources for students to grasp concepts better.', "WMMHS has great teachers and lots of cool classes from Environmental Science to Culinary Arts. They also offer the IB program which many schools don't. There are tons of clubs and activities in addition to the sports. It is an inclusive culture as well, so there is a sense of belonging and being a part of something bigger than yourself. It's not too small, and not too big, so there is a large enough class in each grade to find your social niche and broaden your horizons within a diverse student body.", 'West Morris Mendham is the ideal high school for college bound students.  Guidance counselors are sincerely interested in registering students for their preferred classes. They meet with students to inquire about their progress. Also, the counselors help students choose colleges, majors, and apply for scholarships. AP science classes are challenging but worth the investment. Teachers present logic and reasoning for all of the what, when, why and how questions in Biology, Chemistry and Physics.  Mendham is one of the first to offer the IB STEM program. With a new computer lab,  the AP computer science teacher loves what he does and enjoys seeing his students succeed.  Mendham needs a few structural improvements. Although the school is fairly new, it lacks air conditioning.  The first month of school is toasty. The school has a new football field and track; however, baseball fields need new fencing and fan seating.All things considered, I am happy to attend West Morris Mendham.', 'I had a horrible experience here! The people here were not nice especially the faculty and once my daughter transferred to central she had a great experience.', 'My experience was overall good. The teachers challenged the students and the work level could often be difficult. Things I disliked about the school were their dress code, poor lunches, and strictness. The administration could give more attention towards the arts and music programs since they are often left in the shadows while the sports are always their priority. The security in the school is very high, and the guidance councilor care deeply about preparing you for college. The lunches consisted of mostly the same food every day, and no healthy vegetarian or vegan options. Not only this, but the lunches were too much money for what they were worth. There are several clubs and sports to get involved in, and there is never violence.', 'I like most of the teachers, but would like to see more interesting classes offered to let students explore their interests more.', "Mendham is a school that values academics and sports. I transferred to Mendham after my family moved, and I couldn't be happier with taking the IB and AP programs offered. I was happy to be given the opportunity to learn and to challenge myself.", "Mendham high school provided a very challenging curriculum and I chose to be part of the IB program. It gave me a sense of responsibility that I know will be very valuable to me in years to come. I was a 4 year participant in sports at the high school and have made many long lasting friendships. I was class president for 3 of my 4 years and in my senior year, was asked to be the student representative on the School Board. It was an extremely filled four years at the high school which I'm now preparing to graduate from.", "It's pretty sad that Mendham is considered one of the best public schools in New Jersey.  There were some teachers that taught well, but many do not.  They pressure you to do the IB program, which is awful.  Most of the students have some sort of anxiety disorder, and many are drug users.  The school is way too small for the number of students there are, and hundreds of students are forced to eat on the floor during lunch, which must be a fire hazard.  My time there was certainly the worst years of my life.", 'Excellent school and staff.  The staff is very dedicated and truely care about the kids.  High level of academics, kids very prepared for college. Also offer a wide range of clubs and activities to become inolved in.', 'West Morris Mendham has an amazing rigorous education. It helps to prepare for college. When I first came here I felt welcomed and involved. There’s many clubs and activities to choose from. All the teachers will try to make extra time to help explain material. Although since I started in freshman year with a build your own salad bar, now junior year I feel like they only have pizza every day since they got rid of the salad bar. Needs more healthy lunch options.', 'The teachers and staff are actively involved in helping the students progress academically and become better learners. The learning environment is currently adapting to use more technology, and they continue to provide new resources for students to take advantage of in order to continue to prove their academic prowess.', 'What I like about my school is that it has gotten me ready for college.The school has also created a very safe place for each and every person in it. The teachers want you to thrive and become advocates for yourself. I have also have been lucky enough to have met some of my best friends at this school, and I know that I will have these people in my life forever.', 'I like this school because most of the people are really great and there are some teachers who really love to help you out and care about you.  The education is great and I think the schools overall culture is good. The only thing that we do not have is diversity.', 'Everything about the school is very good, as my goal for school is to prepare me for college. There are some aspects outside of academics though that aren’t as good as they should be coming from a school with such a good reputation. For example, over the years, there have been many new faces in the administration, each one with new goals for the school, making it extremely hard to actually accomplish something. They have put so much money and effort into sports that they often forget about the other clubs that make up 90% of the activities offered at the school. The ironic thing is that the school sports teams still are pretty bad. Also, in the past, the administration has had a reputation of consistent disrespect to students. To be fair, some students think they are doing a great job, but the majority have a strong dislike of them.', 'I love the diversity of academic classes and clubs. Working on creating a boys volleyball team. I would love some more parent involvement. Maybe have a parent student lunch?!', 'Apart from being located inside a very nice community, West Morris Mendham High School integrates all types of kids and makes them feel part of the larger community by allowing them to interact with kids they normally would not and by giving them the resources and encouragement that they can succeed.', "everyone is fake af and the only some of the teachers are good otherwise you're screwed. it may be ranked high but honestly it is not good.", 'I graduated in 2016. Looking back at WMMHS I am greatful that I had the college preperation. Because mendham expects out of you though, it can make your child feel like they are failing when they actually have talents. I graduated with a non impressive gpa (like 2.-whatever) but as I enter jr yr I am in 2 honor societies and on the Dean’s List. WMMHS has great resources for people with disabilities however I believe the program BSP for kids with anxiety and learning problems coddle the students. Yes they do work and have created a little community, but from the outside looking in wmmhs needs to acknowledge more that they exist']

column6: ['The IB Program is very good in preparing you for college and getting used to writing long essays in a short period of time.', "In my time at West Morris Mendham, I've been able to truly become the person I never expected I would be walking in on the first day of freshman year. Academically, the school sets you up for the future and allows its students ample opportunities for educational challenges and experiences. Through its myriad of AP or IB courses and the assistance that each individual teacher provides, the faculty of WMMHS is dedicated to helping students learn, and succeed, in a variety of subjects. The guidance office is helpful in guiding students through the college process and in personal counseling as well. In terms of sports, I've participated in a variety of them over the past 4 years. The team atmosphere that exists is really strong - I've made some of my best friends on the teams. The school is really committed to excellence in sports and most of our teams do very well in county and state tournaments.", "The best instructors teach the higher level classes. It is rated high as far as public high schools go in the state of NJ. My personal experience was fine overall, but after experiencing a private school for a year, the personal vested interest in students is vastly different and superior in an independent high school. Although rules and bureaucracy must exist in a large public high school, I suppose, but students should be allowed more freedom for self-expression, and there should be more room for individualized learning. This high school exists in an upper-middle-class suburb, and some days I felt like I was walking the halls of an institution. If it weren't for my friends and the few good teachers I had, I will say that if you can afford an independent school, go to one. This is a nice high school, it has good honors classes and a good athletic department, but if I have to look back on it, nothing really stands out.", 'WMMHSD is a very nice high school, with great teachers and classes. Although the classes tend to expect more from a student than an average public high school, I believe it has prepared me for college. West Morris Mendham Highschool could improve by creating a more community like and fun atmosphere.', "I liked the staff they were always good at preparing students for college. Also the academics are really good. The sports teams are a little lackluster due to the amount of students that end up going to private schools instead for sports. Also the school spirit is poor so i'd like to see that improve. Overall it was a good high school experience.", 'My experience so far has been good. The teachers are encouraging and make coming to school interesting and worthwhile. We have a lot of class choices. I agree with the other review that we have a fair amount of clubs but some I don’t know what they are and it’s hard to find out.  Some people are very vocal about not being accepting of others. The bathrooms are gross and the toilet seats need to be changed. We have lots of sports but most of the time no one goes to the games.  The big problem is that freshmen eat lunch on the floor. When you do get to sit at a lunch table, a lot of the seats are broken. I don’t understand how we can get brand new white boards with terrible speakers but no new lunch tables.', 'Mendham prepared me well for college, but the environment was very competitive and stressful.  The school pushed the IB program very heavily and made it seem better than AP.', 'As a Mendham High School student, I know Mendham to be academically rigorous and  competitive, resulting in success in high school and beyond.', "Overall, I'd rate my experience at Mendham as very good. There is little to no bullying at the school, most kids are very nice and the teaching is very good and has prepared me for college. Some of the teachers I have encountered throughout my education at this establishment have made the difference in my education.  However, there are issues at Mendham. One is that some teachers need to be fired as they cannot teach for their life. Another issue is that there are a fair amount of clubs yet if you want to start anything like a sports team or club it is next to impossible due to the current person in the position of sports and clubs even when you have gone through all the steps and collected pages of signatures of people who would be interested. My last grievances with Mendham is the boys bathrooms being in absolute need of an upgrade as some haven't been updated in probably a few decades, there being no diversity at all besides a few kids  being of different color and religion", 'Mendham High School is an amazing place to obtain a high school education. Everyone, from students to faculty, works tremendously hard at what they do in order to fulfill their goals. Every student I have ever met has been so passionate at what they do whether it is academic, athletic, musical or artistic. At times it seems as though students are competing against each other for their accomplishments, but in the end it is hard work and dedication that each person puts in so that they can succeed. The teachers do a phenomenal job to be approachable to students and offer all of their education to help students with theirs. Our school has a strong sense of pride in our athletics, even though we may not be the best football or tennis team and it amplifies the spirit of our staff and students in our abilities. Mendham High School excels in providing the resources for students to discover their purpose through various activities, clubs, sports and ultimately academics.', 'Mendham was the most typical high school. Nothing special. It definitely could have been better but it also could have been far worse.', 'The teaching staff at Mendham was fantastic. Teachers really cared about my future education and made noticeable efforts to give advice on areas of later life like financial planing and time management. This school prepared me really well for the work load that I took on my freshmen year of college.', 'It was a great learning environment which challenged me academically and thoroughly prepared me for the years to come once attending a university.', 'Mendham High School students are generally very focused, and the staff on the whole is very knowledgeable and supportive. Because it seems that the majority of students do well and take honors classes, there is some grade inflation or teachers who refuse to give As, so students apply to college with excellent test scores and sometimes a less competitive GPA. Overall, the Mendham High culture is good and WMMHS remains a top school in NJ that prepares students for life beyond high school.', 'My experience at West Morris Mendham High School has been incredible. The school offers many higher level courses like AP and the IB diploma program.  I was able to constantly challenge myself and prepare myself for college courses. Many students who graduated from Mendham felt prepared for college. For the most part the teachers are receptive, engaging, and have the best interests of their students. The academic programs enable students to build a well-balanced education. The language program is especially great at Mendham with the Chinese program being chosen as a model language program for the state. There is a great variety of clubs to choose from and the sports program is also excellent. The typical Mendham student is driven, competitive, hard-working, witty, and caring. Mendham is generally pretty homogenous with little diversity. However, the school makes up for it by trying to expose students to global perspectives in its courses.', 'I liked how everyone supports each other everyday and wants to see other succeed. The teachers are staff are very helpful.', "I enjoyed Mendham HS. The academics are rigorous and most of the teachers care if you do well or not. Lunch isn't very fun since there is constantly not enough places to eat and the freshman have to sit on the floors. If you do not do the IB program you are almost forgotten about and the IB program runs the school.", "Academically, there's a whole range of types of students, but the school population's homogeneity gets really boring really quickly.", 'Though WMMHS still has extremely competitive and bright students, we are losing the excellent teachers that allowed us to become a prestigious NJ school.', 'I liked the variety of classes and clubs that are offered allowing one to easily pursue their desired careers. The students are very accepting and friendly allowing for a comfortable enviornment for all. ']
