There is little to no bullying at the school, most kids are very nice and the teaching is very good and has prepared me for college. Some of the teachers I have encountered throughout my education at this establishment have made the difference in my education.  However, there are issues at Mendham. One is that some teachers need to be fired as they cannot teach for their life. Another issue is that there are a fair amount of clubs yet if you want to start anything like a sports team or club it is next to impossible due to the current person in the position of sports and clubs even when you have gone through all the steps and collected pages of signatures of people who would be interested. My last grievances with Mendham is the boys bathrooms being in absolute need of an upgrade as some haven't been updated in probably a few decades, there being no diversity at all besides a few kids  being of different color and religion", 'Mendham High School is an amazing place to obtain a high school education. Everyone, from students to faculty, works tremendously hard at what they do in order to fulfill their goals. Every student I have ever met has been so passionate at what they do whether it is academic, athletic, musical or artistic. At times it seems as though students are competing against each other for their accomplishments, but in the end it is hard work and dedication that each person puts in so that they can succeed. The teachers do a phenomenal job to be approachable to students and offer all of their education to help students with theirs. Our school has a strong sense of pride in our athletics, even though we may not be the best football or tennis team and it amplifies the spirit of our staff and students in our abilities. Mendham High School excels in providing the resources for students to discover their purpose through various activities, clubs, sports and ultimately academics.', 'Mendham was the most typical high school. Nothing special. It definitely could have been better but it also could have been far worse.', 'The teaching staff at Mendham was fantastic. Teachers really cared about my future education and made noticeable efforts to give advice on areas of later life like financial planing and time management. This school prepared me really well for the work load that I took on my freshmen year of college.', 'It was a great learning environment which challenged me academically and thoroughly prepared me for the years to come once attending a university.', 'Mendham High School students are generally very focused, and the staff on the whole is very knowledgeable and supportive. Because it seems that the majority of students do well and take honors classes, there is some grade inflation or teachers who refuse to give As, so students apply to college with excellent test scores and sometimes a less competitive GPA. Overall, the Mendham High culture is good and WMMHS remains a top school in NJ that prepares students for life beyond high school.', 'My experience at West Morris Mendham High School has been incredible. The school offers many higher level courses like AP and the IB diploma program.  I was able to constantly challenge myself and prepare myself for college courses. Many students who graduated from Mendham felt prepared for college. For the most part the teachers are receptive, engaging, and have the best interests of their students. The academic programs enable students to build a well-balanced education. The language program is especially great at Mendham with the Chinese program being chosen as a model language program for the state. There is a great variety of clubs to choose from and the sports program is also excellent. The typical Mendham student is driven, competitive, hard-working, witty, and caring. Mendham is generally pretty homogenous with little diversity. However, the school makes up for it by trying to expose students to global perspectives in its courses.', 'I liked how everyone supports each other everyday and wants to see other succeed. The teachers are staff are very helpful.', "I enjoyed Mendham HS. The academics are rigorous and most of the teachers care if you do well or not. Lunch isn't very fun since there is constantly not enough places to eat and the freshman have to sit on the floors. If you do not do the IB program you are almost forgotten about and the IB program runs the school.", "Academically, there's a whole range of types of students, but the school population's homogeneity gets really boring really quickly.", 'Though WMMHS still has extremely competitive and bright students, we are losing the excellent teachers that allowed us to become a prestigious NJ school.', 'I liked the variety of classes and clubs that are offered allowing one to easily pursue their desired careers. The students are very accepting and friendly allowing for a comfortable enviornment for all. ']

column2: ['I love the look of the school. I love the teachers and the academic experience I received at Ward Melville high school. I love the sports programs and the resources we had to make us better student athletes. What I would like to see change is some of the teachers take more of an interest in the middle of the road students to ensure they’re success for a fulfilling future.', 'WM prepared me for all of the potential future plans I was making in grades 9-12. I feel I was best prepared for my college experience and transitioning to freshman year was successful because of the preparation WM provided academically.', 'Excellent opportunities for students to be challenged by thought provoking teachers/administrators.  Caring teachers that go out of their way to be available for students for extra help, when needed, and always very responsive to parent outreach.  Student body that seems to care about one another with high levels of school spirit.', 'I had an overall very good experience because I kept my self involved.  There are many sports teams and clubs to choose from.  It is a large school so some kids do get lost in the shuffle, especially an average student.  Perhaps more peer and staff mentoring for students.', 'I think all around it is an all around very good public institution. I think there is a great amount of room for students to go above and beyond their academic potential. At the same time, however, the school could work on its relationship with its students, with many students having a general resentment for the administration and their policies. Other than that though I like the school very much.', 'The school had absolutely no diversity everyone had a Jeep wrangler or some other fancy car. The teachers and academic area was amazing the students killed the school.', 'Ward Melville offers a large variety of activities and classes which appeal to people of varying interests. My teachers cared very much about their students and helping us grow, and made a noticeable effort to help us learn. While the diversity of classes and supportive teachers made Ward Melville a great school, it can be overwhelming due to class size. It is a large school and it is easy for students to become drowned out. Still, my peers and I developed well in this school and others are often impressed when hearing we graduated from Ward Melville.', 'It’s an overall great school, academics are really good and most people are really into their grades. Only thing is that Ward Melville students have a reputation of being rich a snobby, and to be honest a lot of them are. If u find your right friend group then the experience can be great.', 'There were a lot of opportunities in a safe environment, some teachers try to hard to press their opinion on the students.', 'My experience at Ward Melville was very special to me. I got the resources I needed when I was struggling, all of my teachers were very open to helping me when I had questions, and everyone is welcome at this school with open arms. Overall, I wouldn’t have wanted to graduate from anywhere else.', 'I have had a great experience with my High School. The teachers have all been wonderful, helpful and amazing. There have been a wide array of programs that I have been able take advantage of. This has given me a great exposure to sports and my coaches have been a great mentor in guiding my athletic journey. Highly recommended school!', 'This is a great school with many connections in many areas. There are a myriad of opportunities available, but as a student you need to step up and take them if you want them; this is why there is a gap between the top students and average students. The STEM programs are amazing and have top teachers.', 'I like the teaching staff at Ward Melville, they are always so kind. I also enjoyed the athletic department, they are always so enthusiastic about sports and cares a lot about their athletes. The coaches are very motivating and they always are trying to help athletes improve.', 'The teachers, staff, and administration at WMHS are extremely supportive, caring, and kind. Academics are top-notch.', "Ward Melville is an awesome place! There is always something to do. There are clubs ranging from Ceramics Club to Chamber Orchestra. We have great athletics, including a boys' lacrosse team that has won States, a top notch fencing team, and a tennis team that has won counties. In terms of student life, there are cliques but many people from different groups will be close.  I have close friends from different friend groups and I couldn't be happier. Big class size means constantly meeting new people. In terms of academics, it can be pretty challenging, coming from an AP/Honors student. It's a lot of work but it's manageable. The teachers here are usually willing to help and pretty understanding. The environment here is somewhat competitive.  Students like to work together but they also want others to learn from mistakes.  Food here is okay, could be healthier. Note that many kids here are children of employees at the numerous nearby hospitals and Stony Brook University.", 'Ward Melville high school is great. Grades 10-12, they get you ready for the demands for college!The work load was not too demanding , but just the right amount for your 1st year at college. Classes were fun yet challenging! There are many activities to get involved in and at a competitive level. Many athletic scholarships are given along with academic ones are awarded.You need to be involved! There are so many amazing activities.  I am very happy that my son went to Ward Melville high school!', 'I really enjoyed the atmosphere I was in. The school is nice and big with so many students and so many new people to meet. I got to meet some people who are now my closest friends. If I could change one thing it would be the security. I feel like it’s too easy to get in and out of the school.', "Ward Melvile is a very prestigious high school, everyone has a high GPA and it is literally impossible to fail the lowest grade you can get is a 65. Yet they make us work twice as hard compared to any other school. It's like college level work in a guided environment. They tell us that colleges favor kids that go here. Everyone here is white and very wealthy which explains why a large population of the students are stuck up, show offish, and VERY immature. Theres so many students; you can graduate with over 600 people easy. The teachers are highly qualified, especially in the sciences. Theres every club you could ever imagine. The school itself is big and modern. The art department is AMAZING I dont know any other school with a variety of art classes such as ours. STEM is also really big here. You hear about someone winning a new award/achievement over the loud speaker every morning in sports and mostly academics. I wish there was more independence and a less snobby environment.", 'Ward Melville is a fantastic school with some flaws. The academics are great. Classes are relatively small and I have had plenty of awesome teachers. There are dozens of options of electives to take that are simply not offered at other high schools. If you need more help, the writing center is open throughout the day to help you  revise your essays. I also never had a problem making an appointment with a teacher. College Prep is okay. Naviance is a great resource and English classes spend some time helping with essays but I wished the school did more to help you find a career and school. The social stuff was meh. There are plenty of well-funded clubs and sports but I felt an overall disinterest across the school. Overall, Ward Melville gave me a quality High School Experience.', 'Really good educational oprotunity. Enjoyed every year from 10th grade to 12th. From classes to extracurricular activities with friends']

column6: ["I had a wonderful experience at Ward Melville.  I've made friends for life.  There is a large student body and Lots of diversity.  It's easy to get around and I always feel safe in my school.", "Overall I had a pretty good time at Ward Melville. There's a lot of AP courses available, so if you are able to handle those types of classes, they are available to you. Most of my teachers were helpful, as long as you make the effort first. There are a lot of different clubs after school, and it is fairly easy to make one if what you're interested in doesn't exist. Overall, I would say it is a pretty good school.", 'This school has honestly been my second home to me. It has given me a place to enjoy my teachers, friends and learning. Everyone there has been so kind to me, and I am truly greatful to have had such a wonderful time at such a great school. Sadly, i will soon be leaving such school, but I have left my mark in many ways. I have painted a school mural, connected with my teachers in a way that I never thought was possible, and was able to enjoy subjects that I had no idea existed. If you’re ever looking for a school to welcome you, Ward Melville is the place to be. Ward Melville, thank you so much for shaping the woman I am today. I will carry your school spirit wherever I go and will always come back to visit.', "It went by really fast, and the teachers are top notch, but if you don't join a club or sport it can be hard to find a group to chill with.", 'WM was a pretty good place to go to school, everyone cares, however some people care t o o much. Sometimes it can get catty and competitive, however, the academic, music and athletic programs are outstanding for a public school.', 'Ward Melville was a wonderful place for me to spend Sophomore through Senior Year of High School, the teachers were happy to help out in any way shape or form, the classes available are spectacular and the resources available - if you chose to use them- are spectacular. Parents are readily involved in all the events especially senior year. Events such as the Senior Prom are a BIG deal at Ward Melville and parents and students are ready to pitch in and help with these events (especially if it means preferred seating on the red carpet side lines to watch their kids enter prom as fabulously as possible). The Ward Melville community is powerful and can often persuade admission to make big changes which will benefit the overall wellbeing of students, faculty, and staff.', "I loved coming to this school. The teachers are very helpful and truly care about their students. This is obvious in everything from their detailed and education lesson plans to daily banter with them. Another plus is the clubs, from Model United Nations to help strengthen public speaking to our Robotics Team to help strengthen a student's STEM abilities. The only hang up that I have with this school is how the school handles different events. From banning students from an out of school event to threating (yet not acting) on the threat of suspension to any student that participated in a national walkout day.", 'Ward Melville offers a very high education standard. I feel that by attending Ward Melville I gained the best education. The teachers are always there to help with questions or concerns.', 'Ward melville is a pretty decent place the admins are bad amd alot of annoying kids but alot of really good people and great teachers.', 'Ward Melville is a top notch public school. They have so many different things you can explore with experts to help students acheieve their highest potential.', "Overall my experience at Ward Melville was for the most part was pretty outstanding. All the staff, teachers, and students, for so helpful, nice and just fun to be around. I can say that academically my school is extremely good at. The teachers are so professional, if you need help you can always get it. There is a bunch of electives to take, so you will never find something that doesn't interest you. Even though Ward Melville is great in this aspect, in the having fun activities after school wasn't the best. I just hope that in the future they make Ward Melville an even better place to go to school now and have their activities be over the top.", 'What I liked about Ward Melville was the competitive academics, challenging classes, and the teachers are mostly supportive and willing to work with you. The competitive nature of the school pushes students to perform their best, with multiple students of each graduating class going to Ivies each year. I would change the diversity of Ward Melville HS because the population of the school is overwhelmingly white, with little minorities.', 'My experience was terrible. The school was great for education, but terrible when it came to the atmosphere and the students. Little diversity, mostly caucasian', 'Strong academics, great teachers, very strong sports programs. Not extremely diverse but pretty accepting. Wide variety of clubs and activities to participate in. People are generally friendly, staff wants to see you find success, easy to find lifelong friends.', 'Ward Melville has so much to offer, all you have to do is get involved.  Between JV and Varsity sports and tons of clubs to choose from, you can have something to do every day.  As for the classes you can take, there are so many electives to choose from, so you can get a feel for a subject and maybe pursue it in college.  They offer honors and AP classes and there are lots of resources to help you.  They offer ACT and SAT prep classes, teachers always offer extra help and they even offer drivers ed! The guidance department is always there to help you, whether it be a social issue, a teacher concern, or getting ready for the college application process.  I am having a great experience in High School, being on the Girls Varsity Swim team, president of the prom committee, and active members of The National Honor Society and French National Honor society.', 'I have had a fairly typical "high school experience." Like most I dread going to school some days, while others I am eager to learn. There have been classes that I hated the material and/or the manner it was being taught. While I have absolutely loved other classes.', "Ward Melville is an excellent school... for some. There are certain groups who thrive in Melville's environment, namely student-athletes and wealthy caucasians. I enjoyed everything about the school with regards to its student population, however, there are very few minorities, and someone who is a member of a smaller ethnic group, or who has different interests than what is deemed 'popular' may have a very different experience. The staff is sometimes encouraging and devoted to the betterment of the school, but other times may be lazy and disinterested in the welfare of the students. The administration is a nightmare, as are the 'Three Village Moms' who choose to involve themselves in unimportant matters. However, depending on the type of student that you are and the areas that you are interested in pursuing, you might have an excellent experience.", 'Alright, this school is extremely competitive and selective. You either have to be smart, pretty, or both. If you’re none of those things, your high school life is going to be non-existent.', 'Although slightly competitive, the atmosphere of Ward Melville allows learning to blossom. Amazing people go here, and the kind of place where you want to be involved with whatever is going on.', 'Ward Melville is a competitive school overall; above average students.  However, it gets highly competitive at the top 3% of students: GPAs differ in the hundredths (the highest GPAs in my year are sub-106).  Class grades are very reliant on the teacher, but most offer decent extra help.  The music departments are strong but lack funding.  Bring food to avoid the unappealing "food" (it basically meets the bare minimum for nutrition).  For college readiness, it\'s all up to your work ethic.  If you do not have any AP or Honors classes, you will have teachers who only care about passing the course, which makes it difficult for those who want to move up to harder courses from Regents.  Take as many AP and Honors courses as possible since those classes always have better teachers.  The School won\'t do much if you are bullied, even though they claim bullying is not allowed.  There\'s a good diversity of clubs with decent funding.']

Bring food to avoid the unappealing "food" (it basically meets the bare minimum for nutrition).  For college readiness, it\'s all up to your work ethic.  If you do not have any AP or Honors classes, you will have teachers who only care about passing the course, which makes it difficult for those who want to move up to harder courses from Regents.  Take as many AP and Honors courses as possible since those classes always have better teachers.  The School won\'t do much if you are bullied, even though they claim bullying is not allowed.  There\'s a good diversity of clubs with decent funding.']

column2: ['extreme lack of diversity and horrible food, the teachers aren’t that bad but they still needs improvements', 'Rye Neck High School is a tight knit community with great academics and a good community. Since the school is fairly small, most people are friends with each other and teachers are always free to help you out with any personal problems you are having in any classes. The school has a variety of clubs and activities and makes it easy to get involved with them or start new activities, and the administration is open to ideas. Overall, Rye Neck is a great place to spend your teenage years as you become close with many more friends and have access to top tier academics before college.', 'Rue neck highschool prepares its students well for college. While offering various clubs and sports for students to participate in. In addition to the sports and academics there are many resources available to the students.', 'The school environment is overall fine, though it lacks in solidarity and sometimes not very student-friendly. The academics are fine and some teachers are very devoted to teaching. However, the school building and lunch is bad.', 'RNHS is a small school in which many can get a well-rounded education. Within the district, everyone knows one another and news travel fast. The school provides a diverse range of courses that help students get experience and learn about themselves during their high school years.', 'I loved my experience at Rye Neck High School. Haveing such amazing teachers made me choose my major. I want to have a positive impact on students the same way my teachers influenced me to be the best person I can be. The only thing I would change about Rye Neck is the amount of classes they offer their students I know that it is hard to offer classes like cooking and painting because it is so small but I wish there were a way to find enough money In the budget for it.', 'Very nice school amazing staff. Tons of APs, only issue is small class size so not a lot of new people but the class sizes makes it easier for extra help to be available', 'Over all this a really good school. The teachers really try hard to help students understand the curriculum and sometimes over study us so state exams do not seem as difficult. There are several ways to get involved as a student like joining clubs and doing sports. There are also multiple electives to choose from in all the STEAM fields. Even though this school isn’t big, students are capable of bonding together in ways bigger schools wouldn’t be able to do. Overall this is a great place to attend :).', 'Rye Neck is a small school that has given me a great education. They truly work hard to give each student an individual experience, which helps them achieve the most each student can.', 'Small school. Resembles a private school in size and academic prestige. A wonderful environment for a growing boy. Children!!', 'My Rye Neck High School experience has been filled with fantastic and caring teachers,  amazing extracurricular activities, and challenging academic courses.', 'I really happy with how small the school is and how much attention and support is available from the teachers.', "I graduated from Rye Neck High School and Middle School many moons ago.  In retrospect Rye Neck was the foundation that helped me succeed in life.  The teachers in high school were far better, far more caring, and just more likable than most college professors while getting paid far less and dealing with much more difficult students.  Rye Neck is a really small school, and at the end of the day, this ended up being a good thing.  In high school we all got along and we all had fun together.  This was before facebook, smart phones, or any of the electronics and on-demand internet that is frankly, destroying all of us.Were there problems...of course.  Far too many marijuana users, far too many students without a purpose in life; but that's the case in most places.  If you put in the effort, Rye Neck's teachers will put in the effort for you.My review has to be less than 1000 characters...great.", 'My experience in each year was determined by the teachers I was assigned. If one does not stay in the honors programs and advanced classes, they get lower quality teachers it seems and is difficult for them to advance in their studies. Also, it is impossible to really change anything as an upset student or parent, you just get referrals on referrals and nothing happens.', 'Rye Neck High School is a very good school because it is small enough for students to really develop close relationships with teachers. Teachers really want you to succeed and they make sure that you get help if you need it.', 'My experience at Rye Neck has been excellent. My classmates and teachers have been really supportive. Through this school district I have been able to grow as a person and prepare me for college.', 'Parental involvement and cooperation is high, the PTA is well-supported and the musicals are award-winning.\r School experience goes far beyond academics.', 'close, tight knit and happy, confident group.', 'Security and health programs and resources are very bountiful and helpful.', 'There is an extensive variety of extracurriculars to participate, which are fun, accepting of everyone, and teach helpful skills.']

column6: ['I have only been in the school since 10th grade and yet the teachers and parents are able to successfully work together in creating an overall better educational experience for their children. Furthermore, the school environment in general is friendly and aesthetic which gives more than enough reason to attend it again.', 'Incredible skills, knowledgeable and connected to students.', 'Rye Neck has great extracurricular activities. I, personally, never am without something to do. I love the sports I play and the musical that I do every year.', "This school has been a major part of my life for many years. I've met my closest friends here and the activities I have taken part in are truly memorable. However, the school is very small which can be difficult at times on ones social life. We are still a close knit community that will be hard to forget in the years to come. I'm glad Rye Neck is a part of me.", 'The teachers in this school are truly caring and understanding of the students. They do everything they can to help you do your best and never give up on anyone.', "Although the school nurse does not know anything about medicine that you don't know, everyone who attends feels safe all the time.", 'There are many club opportunities for all people whether they want to be very involved or rather just a part of something,', 'All of the students are helpful and willing to work together', 'The teachers are very willing to help the students', 'pretty great school with good academics and some amazing teachers', 'generally healthy food but could be better', 'Most but not all teachers are great', 'Could be more choices in sports and clubs', 'Overall experience is great - I have met my bestest friends, I have been challenged, and I have had fun.', 'There is a big variety of foods: salads, deli line, hot dishes, soups, fruit, cold pastas, yogurts, cereal bars and sometimes even sushi. The food is of goof quality but sometimes it is overprices. Special dietary accommodations are available', 'The guidance counselors are very helpful and supportive and are always on top of their students in order to make sure that they are on the right track. Discipline is important, so cutting class, wearing hats in the classroom and dressing inappropriately are strictly prohibited.', 'Rye Neck is a small school, but the sports teams have made it very far. The opportunities are abundant. Students are very involved and the school is very spirited.', 'The teachers know what they are doing - they care about their jobs and their students and they make an effort to make their lessons engaging and meaningful. They are always available for extra help and they will do everything they can to help their students improve.', 'Students at Rye Neck are encouraged to participate in after school activities as an essential part of their high school careers and a way to enhance their education. Some of the clubs are: Key Club (community service), SADD (Students Against Destructive Decisions), art club, science olympiad, Glee club, GSA (Gay-straight alliance), Strategy club, NYC Club, Reef club, Student Awareness Coalition and a series of others. They are available to all students and are a great way of meeting new people and spending time with those who care about the same issues or activities. A popular option is taking part in the musical production, a famous Rye Neck tradition.', 'All the facilities of the school building work perfectly. There are many resources available to the student.']

column2: ['I’ve enjoyed my education that I have received from APA, but the community of students makes it hard to enjoy the school.', 'It is filled with great opportunities. As a senior in high school  I have been allowed to attend Kean University for free.', 'The Academy for Performing Arts is a great school where hard work is taught early on. I know many people that have been accepted to great colleges because of the rigorous curriculum here.', 'Wonderful experience with a small class. A school focused on unity and love. Pursuing dance and theatre alongside brilliant teachers and staff pearing you for college and life.', 'I love it!! I have found a space where I can learn and grow alongside people with the same interests as me. Our school is a small and tight-knit community that I will be sad to leave. The teachers are so nice and they actually care about your future.', 'The Academy for Performing Arts is a wonderful school.  The facility is beautiful, they have many resources, and the teachers are excellent.  All classes are honors level courses, so the academics are very challenging. The teachers are very proactive and do not leave any students behind.  Although APA is an amazing school academically, they are not a very diverse school.  Since its very selective in their acceptance process, the school is predominately white.  As a diverse student myself, I have never felt out of place here at APA.  All the students and teachers are very accepting of all races and genders.  However, I wish it was more diverse in their selection process.  Other than that, I have enjoyed my experience with the Academy for Performing Arts.  I have learned so much about myself as a student and person and hope to continue to grow each day.', 'My experience in the Academy for Performing Arts has been an incredible one. I was able to learn and follow my passion for theatre while still being academically challenged. APA pushes students to be as free and creative as possible whilst helping them grow as intellectuals. All in all, the Academy for Performing Arts is a great school full of positive energy, acceptance and learning,', 'This is the best school for finding and understanding yourself. With the lack of judgement and the teachers constant support, any student can learn more about who they are and who they want to become.', 'This school really helped me grow as a performer, student, and as a person. Upon entering Freshman year, I was really shy and kind of closed off, but after 4 years of nurturing from my teachers and incredible support from faculty I find my self saying “Hi” and talking to everyone in the halls. It’s to the point that almost every Freshman, Sophomore, and Junior knows me by name! Of course the school isn’t perfect, and I’d love to see them be able to build an additional theatre to the Black Box, but one of the many awesome things about APA is that every year it’s growing and adapting to the new batch of students walking through its doors and learning from those who are graduating.', "This school has made me so happy. I was so scared to attend my home high school. If I didn't go to UCVTS, I don't know where I'd be. The teachers are considerate and actually care about your grades. They want you to succeed. I wasn't used to that in middle school. They will sit down with you one-on-one to help you. You have an awesome block schedule, and it all just seems amazing.", "I loved my time at APA. I would not be the actor I am today without the incredible and immersive theatre training I received. That being said, I do believe because it is a new school that there is a lot regarding safety and class development that needs to be worked on. For example, a nurse's office should be placed in the building, not across campus. I also feel the students would benefit from having a library.", 'Attending this school was one of my best decisions I have made  so far. It was a  school where I was able to obtain many opportunities to become a more well-rounded individual. From sitting on Teacher Student boards to being a part of Class Council and Student Government; APA was a school I was proud to attend. Every day I attended the school I felt as if I was learning something valuable and something I would need later in life; which I know now was correct. Also, being able to attend a school that fostered the arts and expression in such a fashion were also extremely valuable. The theatre, and rest of my academic classes, I received at APA and the rest of UCVTS were some of the best in the state, and in fact according to US NEWS Reports; some of the best in the country. However, one thing I would like to see changed at APA and UCVTS is the creation of sports teams and a choral/band music program.', "The Academy for Performing Arts is a school straight out of a movie! It was and still is my dream school. The staff and administration are such kind people and they work hard t ensure that every student is accommodated and comfortable. The only thing that is different from other schools is the fact that we don't have any sports teams, but are allowed to go back to our district high school to play sports there. The academics, although tough, push the students to work harder and if they prove to be difficult for students they can reach out to the teachers and peer tutors for extra help. The school is a very open environment and it encourages students to tap into their creative side and feel comfortable.  Every time I walk into school I never feel like I am in danger, and always feel safe and protected by the security guards and teachers. Any child would be extremely fortunate to attend the Academy for Performing Arts!", 'Attending the Academy for Performing Arts has allowed me to study and cultivate my passion for dance.  The small study body afforded me the opportunity to get individualized attention and learning.  The staff is very supportive. The teachers have not only prepared me to attend and thrive in a BFA dance program in college but for the academic challenges that I may face.   APA has also provided me with opportunies to be involved in community service as well as fill leadership roles to meet common goals.  I have had the opportunity to make lifelong friends from different communities in Union County.  My overall high school experience at The Academy for Performing Arts has been unique and has been so rewarding.', 'I liked how there was only four classes per day because there was less stress put  on students since we had at least two days to complete every assignment. The chromebook laptops the school gave us to use throughout high school is helpful for writing assignments but does not help in research projects because most websites are blocked. I do not like how the faculty does not care if you fail in a particular class and say it is up to the student to do well.  Opinions like that, in my experience did not make me feel confident or comfortable in learning new material and when I did put the effort and tried to stay after school to work with a teacher, but they cancelled. This teacher happened to be from another school on campus, but the teachers at APA are friendlier and want to see you succeed. I do like how APA allows students the opportunity to earn college credits their senior year.', "My experience in the school has been amazing and stressful at the same time. I loved almost all my teachers, especially my history, theater, and english school teachers. The teachers are kind, nice, and actually want to see you succeed in school and in life, so they will help any way they can.They've given us chromebooks to work on our projects throughout the years which is helpful to those that do not own a computer themselves. However, many sites are blocked on them so writing reports with sources is a bit of a struggle. The cafeteria on campus has food that is a bit overpriced for students but they have the lunch program for low-income families to apply to. We were very prepared for college because in our senior year, we take freshman courses at Kean University so we not only get a feel of what it's like, but also become more responsible for ourselves and take the credits with us to whatever school we choose to go to.", 'Out of nearly 1000 applicants, I am 1 of the select few accepted into my class of 49. We are intellectual, talented, creative, and passionate individuals. We have a will to learn, to succeed, and to express ourselves through art. Our classes are advanced and our teachers help create an environment in which learning is fun. APA is a safe haven for many students who attend. As someone who hates using public restrooms, I must say that the APA facilities are very clean. Our administrators are like second parents to us. My principal is an African American woman and she is one of the most inspirational people I have ever met. We spend our senior year at Kean University taking all college courses, receiving college credits. There are 3 boys in my grade, surprisingly none of which are gay. We are of all different ethnic and religious backgrounds. Yet somehow, we all manage to come together- as students, as artists, and as a family.', 'I enjoyed the family atmosphere and the lifestyle at the Academy for Performing Arts. The faculty is beyond amazing, and care so much for their students. They get to know their students, and help them achieve their goals. It is very challenging academically, but I feel prepared to go to college thanks to them.', 'I majored in theatre here. My theatre education was excellent, though there was not a great deal of flexibility in exploring outside of my major. This year, I am a senior, and I will spend this year studying at Kean University for free as part of a dual-enrollment partnership between APA and Kean. I will receive around 30 credits this year - tuition-free! Although I will not continue to study theatre after high school, APA offered a fantastic opportunity for me to pursue and cultivate my interests.', "The Academy for Performing arts is a school that is like no other. This advanced educational environment not only pushes it's students to work hard, but to strengthen their talents and passions as well. When thinking about a performing arts high school, many people assume APA is a place that refers to academics as a second priority. However, this is extremely wrong. What I admire most about this high school is how there is an even balance between academics and performing. Dancers and actors have the opportunity to strengthen and perfect their trade over four years,  as well as their minds. Sending seniors to Kean is another aspect of APA that makes it unique. Experiencing college before high school is even over has prepared me and my peers tremendously. I feel ahead of the game and ready to face my future."]

However, many sites are blocked on them so writing reports with sources is a bit of a struggle. The cafeteria on campus has food that is a bit overpriced for students but they have the lunch program for low-income families to apply to. We were very prepared for college because in our senior year, we take freshman courses at Kean University so we not only get a feel of what it's like, but also become more responsible for ourselves and take the credits with us to whatever school we choose to go to.", 'Out of nearly 1000 applicants, I am 1 of the select few accepted into my class of 49. We are intellectual, talented, creative, and passionate individuals. We have a will to learn, to succeed, and to express ourselves through art. Our classes are advanced and our teachers help create an environment in which learning is fun. APA is a safe haven for many students who attend. As someone who hates using public restrooms, I must say that the APA facilities are very clean. Our administrators are like second parents to us. My principal is an African American woman and she is one of the most inspirational people I have ever met. We spend our senior year at Kean University taking all college courses, receiving college credits. There are 3 boys in my grade, surprisingly none of which are gay. We are of all different ethnic and religious backgrounds. Yet somehow, we all manage to come together- as students, as artists, and as a family.', 'I enjoyed the family atmosphere and the lifestyle at the Academy for Performing Arts. The faculty is beyond amazing, and care so much for their students. They get to know their students, and help them achieve their goals. It is very challenging academically, but I feel prepared to go to college thanks to them.', 'I majored in theatre here. My theatre education was excellent, though there was not a great deal of flexibility in exploring outside of my major. This year, I am a senior, and I will spend this year studying at Kean University for free as part of a dual-enrollment partnership between APA and Kean. I will receive around 30 credits this year - tuition-free! Although I will not continue to study theatre after high school, APA offered a fantastic opportunity for me to pursue and cultivate my interests.', "The Academy for Performing arts is a school that is like no other. This advanced educational environment not only pushes it's students to work hard, but to strengthen their talents and passions as well. When thinking about a performing arts high school, many people assume APA is a place that refers to academics as a second priority. However, this is extremely wrong. What I admire most about this high school is how there is an even balance between academics and performing. Dancers and actors have the opportunity to strengthen and perfect their trade over four years,  as well as their minds. Sending seniors to Kean is another aspect of APA that makes it unique. Experiencing college before high school is even over has prepared me and my peers tremendously. I feel ahead of the game and ready to face my future."]
column6: ['I am currently a senior at the Academy for Performing Arts and these past four years have been amazing. I have met some of the greatest people in my life and have had amazing teachers and built relationships with them. This did not feel like a normal high school. It feels like home and when I go to school I feel like I am with my family and not just my teachers. There was only one year I had a not so great math teacher but in any school you will have a teacher like that so I have no complaints.', "It's a quality performing arts school. People not wanting to get involved in the arts will not be able to escape them. The major classes are demanding and serious, but they teach lessons applicable outside the arts too.", 'Overall the teachers are great people; caring, approachable, friendly. Theatre and dance are the best of the best. However, the maths and sciences are lacking in teachers with a strong command of the subjects.', 'Almost all of the teachers are amazing.', "There are no competitive sports at APA. However, you can participate in any sports offered at your local high school. There are intramural sports, but I know less than nothing about them. Few people participate, if they're even still around. In terms of regular school spirit, though, everyone really loves their school on campus, even if we make jokes. APA students love the school and truly feel accepted within it. Everyone is incredibly supportive of each other and their achievements, especially regarding shows. In terms of physical fitness, APA is a little bit of a mixed bag. You only take fitness every other day for one marking period. You're expected to complete a certain number of hours of exercise outside of class (31, I believe) which can include everything from team sports to walking to the bus stop. The fitness classes themselves are top-notch, with dedicated teachers who'll make you dread their period but leave much healthier. They're also your health teacher, answering all your embarrassing questions honestly and without  judgment. The fitness centers themselves are excellent (especially the one in Magnet), although not in APA themselves. The centers are open during Co and after school most days.", "I truly love the vast majority of my teachers on campus. They are passionate, intelligent, and truly, truly care about their students. I feel more comfortable with some of my teachers than I do my parents. They work us hard, but that's because they know we're smart enough to meet those expectations. APA teachers know and love how creative their students can be, and they're thrilled when you put in the extra effort to make a project truly special, even if the final product is not what they expected. Teachers never cease to push themselves, as well, coming up with innovative projects and lessons. Teachers really care more that you're learning and growing than the grade- although that's no excuse to slack off. You'll get out of APA what you put into each of your classes. They're just really great.", "My year at APA is 50% minority students, with the typical minority being black or latino. Race is far from an issue, and students are accepting regarding the variety of  socioeconomic backgrounds, with kids coming from towns from Elizabeth to Westfield. People make jokes, but it's all in good fun and no feelings are hurt. In terms of gender, however, there is quite a difference. There are a few who identify as genders besides male or female, and they are accepted by all, although not always understood. However, it unfortunately does not get much better than that at any high school. In terms of the male/female divide... APA is not the high school for the boy crazy. Testosterone is hard to come by, and girls learn to love their male classmates platonically. Everyone's really cool and accepting, though, especially in terms of sexual orientation. Politically, almost everyone who cares is a liberal, although there are a few conservatives here and there. However, they are few and far between. In fact, this is where most of the tension in APA lies, although people learn to respect each other, even if they disagree with someone's views.", "It's difficult and subsequently  uncommon for clubs to meet after school, due to the geographic diversity of the students here. As such, most clubs meet during the co-curricular period (half an hour before or after lunch). There is a wide variety of clubs on campus, and if you see a need for a club, it's not difficult to start one, so long as you're willing to do the work.", "Students and faculty members are required to wear IDs at all times, especially when changing buildings. When this rule is not followed by students, they are quickly reprimanded by a member of the faculty. There are unarmed security guards in the lobby of every school who monitor the doors and visitors. I have never felt unsafe on campus. The nurse is sweet, but doesn't put up with BS. If you're actually sick, you shouldn't have a problem.", 'My school is the perfect fit for me. I would not change a thing.', 'The resources at my school are amazing. Everything is top-notch.', "My school doesn't offer sports, but the multiple fitness rooms are great", "I am so comfortable at school. I know that if I'm ever having a bad day, my friends will be there for me.", 'Though my school lacks sports, it makes up for it in the variety of clubs.', 'My school works hard to make sure the students feel comfortable and strive to create a positive learning environment.', 'It was cafeteria food, what more can I say?', "It's a pretty good curriculum, all of our courses are honors courses.", 'Some of the policies can be a little strict for an "art school" because as artists we want to feel free to express ourselves through art (within reason because we\'re still in high school and the administration is responsible for the students) and some of the rules could be very restricting. For example: it would be "inappropriate" to do pieces about religion.', 'The principal and staff always tried to ensure a safe and secure learning environment for the students.', 'The school needs more support from the Board of Ed to hire more teachers and to find an adequate building for the students.  How can you have a performing arts school without a stage? How can you call it a performing arts school and you have only one production a year?']

column2: ['Bernards High School teachers and counselors take the time to help you with personal, school, home or work problems. Transferring in from a large school district, I feel a smaller school allows for more success in learning and focusing on each student as individuals verse a whole.', 'If you have a student with  any kind of LD  or ADHD don’t go!  They will do the minimum requirements to graduates your child.  Your IEP will be a joke, you will get lied to day after day by the highest up people.  You will get a case worker who is Incompetent and you child will not receive education.  They will try to force you into the “Annex program”. It’s their most restrictive environment that violate the LRE law to drop you from getting the out of district placement that is needed.   It’s every parents  nightmare!', "Great place to be raised if you're fortunate enough. Small enough where most people are friendly, but any drama will be broadcast throughout the whole town.", "The teachers you have are dedicated to helping you. I've formed a lot of connections with my past teachers and they are always willing to help. The curriculum is rigorous and there are a lot of classes made available to students.", 'I had a great experience. The guidance counselors are very helpful with placing you in classes and college searches. The school offers many extra curricular activities and courses that can be used later in life. For example, they have a life skills class which talks about writing checks, mortgages, and payments on houses or apartments or cars.', "I love this school so much! Sporting events are amazing and the academics are even better. I wouldn't want to attend any other high school, and I'm so proud to say I'll be graduating from here in just a few short months!", 'Excellent school that prepares all students for college. Teachers genuinely care about all students and strive to help them learn and succeed. Atmosphere in school is great and really helps with creating a lively and supportive environment.', 'I like the teachers, but they are to strict with letting people use the media center - I often need to use it for school but I have to have a pass from the other side of the school to get in, and it can only be during my lunch', 'Really great experience, lots of really great classes and levels of classes to take. You can really design your own path to college and the school will help you get there. really great music program even though it is  a smaller school.', 'Great school! Many supportive teachers and stuff. The school offers many rigorous courses. The school offers many courses online as well. The teachers are great, although, some can be on the mean side.', 'My high school experience was incredible. The teachers and administrators treat us (the students) with respect and high expectations. I wouldn’t change a thing, they helped me to get where I am now.', 'Bernards High School is absolutely one of the top schools in New Jersey.  There are many, many great opportunities here, and a relatively small population of students.  Because of that, students really have the ability to get involved in any sport, club, arts, etc., program that they wish to pursue.  It was an outstanding experience for our kids.', 'Very good and competitive academics. Small school so everyone knows each other which is nice for some but others would prefer a larger school. Many teachers really care about their students and their successes. The student body is overall very nice though there is a large lack of diversity.', 'I really enjoy Bernards High School. I think that the school prepares you very well to continue your education in college. I think that the facilities are decent but need some renovations. The food is also decent but there needs to be a wider variety.', 'Bernards High School is an awesome school. Most students are involved in after-school sports, clubs, and activities. The spirit is strong and the classes are decent.', 'As a junior at BHS, my experience has been entirely positive. The teachers are extremely supportive and caring, and I feel that I am prepared already to transition to a college environment. Opportunity is everywhere at this school.', 'Some really good teachers that will help prepare you for college. School needs to stop spending money on the football team and should start helping out other sports, clubs, band etc.', 'I really liked the atmosphere that the school sets on its own and the opportunities that BHS presents.', "Right off the bat, let me say that it's a really wonderful school! The principal knows every student by name and is very supportive of all the activities that the school has to offer. If a student does not find a club or activity that they are interested in, they can speak with the principal and create the club they desire. Very supportive and nurturing environment. 10/10", 'Very good teachers and education. Everyone who attend school tends to be rich, republican and WASPY. but each student will receive a good education and opportunities not presented at other schools']

column6: ["It's a small school that is lacking in a lot of departments. There have been severe budget cuts in the state of New Jersey, and the art programs at this school were the first to go. BHS spent and continues to spend a vast majority of their funds on sports, but completely neglect to support the art programs. I was in the concert and marching bands, and even my middle and elementary schools played better. There was almost no diversity in this school. 99% of the student body is upper class Vineyard Vines clad preppy white kids who don't accept anyone different. A lot of the teachers were either excessively strict for no reason, hated their jobs and had zero interest in the classes they were teaching, or just treated us like children. I got suspended for going to the bathroom when the teacher said no. I am so glad I graduated and never have to come back to this miserable place ever again. I don't miss the tiniest bit of my high school experience.", 'The school provides challenging courses to its students, but the environment is very competitive. Students have a tendency to burn themselves out before college by taking too many higher level classes in addition to sports and clubs. The focus is very much on college admission here.', 'Bernards High School is a great school. Most students are involved in after school activities and sports. The overall spirit is great and the classes are decent.', "My experience at Bernards High School is like no other. Since it is a small public school, everyone gets to know one another well and we work collaboratively as a family and team. I love being a part of  Bernards High's community and will miss it tremendously next year.", 'I enjoyed my full four years at Bernards High! I made tons of friends, created great relationships with my teachers, and prepared myself for a world of success as I moved on to college. All of the teachers made it very clear that they loved their jobs, which made me excited to come to school every day. The curriculum that teachers taught for AP courses my senior year prepared me for college classes, which I am incredibly thankful for. Most of the population of other high school students here were friendly, and I never really witnessed any bullying. The atmosphere at this high school was very safe. There were lots of resources, with the guidance office being a tremendous help with anything you needed, all hours of the school day. The only thing I would change about my high school was the cafeteria food! Other than that, I quite enjoyed my experience at Bernards High!', 'Bernards High is a great place to go to school.  It has the size of a private school with all the benefits of a public school.', 'Very small and closed-minded group of students (and area), but a great school with educated and helpful teachers. Students leave this school and go to great colleges!', "Overall good school- one exception: Varsity Soccer Coach. This individual consistently can do far more damage to young people than can do good Never assume that your child's talent, hard work, or dedication will land them a position on the team. Starting positions are reserved for the kids of the coaches friends to whom he owes something. There are good coaches out there who truly care about the quality of their work and the kids they mold, there are some like this man who are totally clueless and act like infantile bullies", "The AP teachers have real world experience or lot of knowledge. However, the quality of the teachers goes down as the course rigor goes down (meaning the better teachers tend to be AP teachers and regular classes have teachers that are of average quality). Most are also uninspiring, but they know what they're doing.", "We don't really need too many safety precautions taken. The worst thing that has happened in my four years at BHS would be someone punching a kid because he made fun of his sister- but the fight was broken up within seconds by our one school security officer.", 'The extracurriculars are great here- something for everyone', "Bernards High School has has been a great experience and I have enjoyed all of my years here. The school is in a great location- Bernardsville is such a nice town and the town is literally in the school's backyard. The teachers at my school are great and they really care about connecting with the students. They also take our needs and wants into consideration when they plan their lessons. The athletic events at Bernards are always so much fun. The whole town comes out to support the football team and everyone goes crazy. I love that we live in a small town so our high school is very small. We have about 800 students in our school which is really nice because you get a chance to know everyone.", 'teachers are very good and they want to be there', 'The scheduling process is very easy at Bernards High school. The Guidance Counselors are always available, but if not they make sure to meet with you as soon as possible. The workload really depends on which classes you take. A student who takes four AP classes has a greater workload compared to a student who only takes one AP class.', 'There is some peer pressure at Bernards High School. As far as ethnic and racial diversity there is very little diversity at this school. The majority of students are Caucasian and Christian. There is a very low percentage of African-Americans and Asians.', 'There are many extracurricular opportunities at Bernards High School. The majority of the students at Bernards are involved in more than one extracurricular activity. Some of the activities include Green Team, Book Club, French Club, Tennis, Soccer, Baseball, Hockey, Swimming, and Football.', 'The teachers at Bernards High School are some of the best teachers in the country. The majority of the teachers are well educated and always available for extra help. The teachers at Bernards High School push their students to the best of their ability.', 'Bernards high is very safe. This high school does several safety drills every month to ensure the safety of the students and the staff. Doors surrounding the school are always kept locked and anyone entering the school goes through the main office and is identified via a name tag.', 'While there are some exceptions, the teaching at BHS is very high quality.', 'They are concern about health']

I love that we live in a small town so our high school is very small. We have about 800 students in our school which is really nice because you get a chance to know everyone.", 'teachers are very good and they want to be there', 'The scheduling process is very easy at Bernards High school. The Guidance Counselors are always available, but if not they make sure to meet with you as soon as possible. The workload really depends on which classes you take. A student who takes four AP classes has a greater workload compared to a student who only takes one AP class.', 'There is some peer pressure at Bernards High School. As far as ethnic and racial diversity there is very little diversity at this school. The majority of students are Caucasian and Christian. There is a very low percentage of African-Americans and Asians.', 'There are many extracurricular opportunities at Bernards High School. The majority of the students at Bernards are involved in more than one extracurricular activity. Some of the activities include Green Team, Book Club, French Club, Tennis, Soccer, Baseball, Hockey, Swimming, and Football.', 'The teachers at Bernards High School are some of the best teachers in the country. The majority of the teachers are well educated and always available for extra help. The teachers at Bernards High School push their students to the best of their ability.', 'Bernards high is very safe. This high school does several safety drills every month to ensure the safety of the students and the staff. Doors surrounding the school are always kept locked and anyone entering the school goes through the main office and is identified via a name tag.', 'While there are some exceptions, the teaching at BHS is very high quality.', 'They are concern about health']

column2: ['I liked the focus on improving the academic side of Fairfield Warde High School. For example, critical thinking started being emphasized a couple years ago. The clubs, activities, and facilities are also very advanced. We have a classroom that includes unique aspects such as white board tables, computer monitors that connect to your laptop, and smart-boards. This allows students to be creative in group work and flexible in learning styles and habits. Our school is passionate in expanding opportunities for students to learn in new ways and think critically.', 'I like warde because it has many opportunities for its students. It has many ap courses and honors courses students can take to  challenge themselves. It also has a lot of sports, clubs and activities for students to participate in. It is a great school.', "Variety of clubs and sports to join. It's a hit or miss with some teachers. For example, my AP bio teacher sat at her computer and gave us worksheets to do with our classmates. I didn't learn anything in that class. My AP Calculus teacher, on the other hand, was veryyy helpful and tutored me during or after school hours. However, the student body is not as diverse as I would like. Everyone is somewhat nice but after a while, it might seem a bit clique-y.", 'My experience at Warde has been amazing. I have challenged myself with a rigorous schedule and a heavy course load. Whenever I struggle with a concept my teachers are always willing to meet with me after-school and work through it with me.  At warde I am apart of two clubs an honors society and on the varsity swim team. They make it possible for me to work school into my clubs and after school activities.', "Many of the teachers and faculty are amazing and are willing to help a student with anything even if they don't know who they are.  There are however some teachers that favorite students and can hinder the ability of students.", 'I would like to see greater diversity and more college preparation resources available to students at FWHS.', 'There are excellent teachers and students are well taught. Everyone gets along for the most part and there are a lot of opportunities when it comes to sports and clubs. Everyone is supportive and willing to help others for the most part and the school takes in students opinions to better the atmosphere and school lifestyle.', 'The teachers at Warde are truly amazing people and will go out of thier way to help you. A downside is that some sports are given more resources than others. Diversity is also lacking seeing as the area the school is situated in.', 'I loved everything about Fairfield Warde. I attended Warde for my freshman and sophomore year of high school. I was part of the soccer team and key club. It has a small community feeling and I pretty much knew everyone in my class by name. Even though I did not graduate from Warde, I wish I had. I met great people and had amazing teachers who have contributed to my current success in life.', 'The opportunities that has been presented to me via this school have been incredible. I am forever grateful. It is a great atmosphere for learning, a great curriculum, and a great place to help prepare you for your future. The teachers and district genuinely care about the well being of the children.', 'Fairfield Warde was an amazing high school. They offer great academics and teachers and focus on acceptance. While providing a magnificent education, they raise good people.', "Overall I've had a great experience, but the guidance counselors are not always the most helpful during the college process, and some of the administrators are unhelpful too.", 'I have two older siblings who have both attended Fairfield Warde High School and we have all agreed it is an excellent school that offers high quality academics while also allowing their students to get involved in the sport, volunteering, music and clubs available in the area. Despite only haven gone to this school for a year now, I have met new friends and have accumulated a diverse group of intelligent, active and kind people. The acronym truly speaks for itself when it states how this school is welcoming, academic, respectful, dynamic and ethical. I am looking forward to working with my amazing guidance counselor to find a college that is right for me. My sister has gone through this process already and has expressed the various ways the school has helped her to not only find a perfect school for her, but also prepare her for what she will face.', 'Fairfield Warde encourages a welcoming environment. Its acronym stands for: welcoming, academic, respectful, dynamic, ethical, which all students follow. Teachers are supportive, friendly, and relatable. The school offers a variety of courses in all subjects imaginable.', 'Excellent academics and athletics. Teachers are experienced and dedicated. Education is taken very seriously. Helped prepare me for life after high school. College preparation is promoted and assistance with applications is easily attainable. Was able to gain a well rounded education.', 'Teachers there are great. The environment is good. Wish there were more workshops on applying to college.', "My experience at Fairfield Warde High School was positive. Administrators do a good job at maintaining order, I never have felt unsafe or in harm's way. Teachers and counsilors are approachable, and students work together to create an inclusive environment.", "It's a very welcoming, academic, respectful, dynamic, and ethical school - that's the Warde acronym! And it stands true. Faculty and staff do a great job at ensuring these qualities in the high school and enforcing rules. The rules are strict, but students still have so much freedom to be themselves in this school. The teachers only want the best for their students, and in the situation where a teacher is unreliable, guidance counselors are always another friendly face that students can turn to.", 'Overall Warde has great academics all around and a plentiful selection of electives. One thing that the school could do better is the foreign language department.', 'I really enjoyed my time at Fairfield Warde High School and hope that all the Freshman that come in love their school.']

column6: ['My children have received an excellent education.  I would prefer to see less testing. The focus each year seems to be on test scores and not always the process of learning.  Often times the children were required to study for tests, complete projects and engage in homework all at the same classes at the same time.  I also felt that teachers of the same team should be coordinating assignments with each other for the children to not get overloaded with work.', 'Fairfield Warde High School is a diverse school that has a lot of spirit and energy. Fairfield Warde not only helps prepare students to graduate but they also provide programs to help students prepare college applications and search scholarships that brightly match students by their background. I miss Fairfield Warde because of their support, community, and excellent learning experiences.', 'Fairfield Warde has a very diverse population, making it feel like a safe place to embrace your identity. I think the best part of my high school experience was learning to embrace my ethnicity.', 'This high school is great! Teachers are great and the environment is amazing compared to the other towns high school. There is a good amount of diversity for being in Fairfield, yet there still needs to be more oppurtunities for those of minorities. All in all the school is great at offering options for their future and extra curriculars.', 'Warde created a good atmosphere for students with faculty and student involved activities. They followed an acronym that students can look to to be a mustang, which was Welcoming, Academic, Respectful, Dynamic, and Ethical. These were characteristics which most students represented for the school which I thought was a good way to build school spirit and be more involved into your academics.', "Fairfield Warde High School is a school filled with teacher who genuinely cae for it's students. The acronym warde stands for Welcoming, Academic, Respectful, Dynamic, and Ethical. The students and staff live up to this", "My high school offered me a wide range of academic and extracurricular opportunities. I was able to take advantage of advanced placement courses that helped enhance my learning of those subjects but also helped in creating effective studying strategies and developing critical thinking that will be applicable after high school. I participated in the music program playing an instrument for four years, in addition to also participating in sports teams. The school offered a variety of clubs and extracurriculars to fit various students' interests, cultures, or help us participate in the community outside of our high school.", 'Mostly great teachers, welcoming environment, sometimes a poor budget, but this comes with having 2 highschools in fairfield. As a senior if I could choose between Warde and Luddlowe to restart my highschool career, I would go with Warde. Definitly no need to pay for a private school education when the public schools are nationally ranked.', 'Teachers are easy going will help you with anything you need the administration is always on top the facilities is amazing they are always adding new stuff', "Warde is a very welcoming environment that is excepting of everyone and what they believe in. The school strives for their students's academic success and proves many resources to help students through their four years in the school.", 'I have been with Fairfield Warde for almost 4 years.  It has a safe environment and both the teachers and administrators are very professional and they do care about the students.  If I need extra helps with any of my classes, I can always count on the teachers.   If I need guidance with college application, I can count on my guidance counselor.', 'I enjoyed my four years at Fairfield Warde High School because I think it provides excellent education with amazing teachers and has lots of diversity. There was no feeling of being an outcast at this school because of the wide range of student backgrounds and personalities which made the high school experience very comfortable. The things that I would like to see change are already in progress for next year. Warde has recently updated the classes a student can take in high school to further ready themselves for college such as a medical calculations class. Overall, Fairfield Warde is an outstanding high school and I would love to have my own children become educated  there as well.', 'Fantastic school. ALmost all teachers are great and really care about their students. Diversity is great, sports are great, lots of options for classes', 'I love it. I would not want to go to any other school. It has afforded me the opportunity to grow and develop my character beyond my expectations.', 'I love the inclusive environment that the school offers, and the determination of the teachers to see all students achieve.', 'All different kinds of people go to Warde. I came from NY during sophomore year and it was difficult to find people who were willing to be friends with someone new.', "I think Warde had a very good academic program, but needs to approve on social causes. During my time there, we had many LGBTQ students, but the teachers weren't as educated as they should have been.", 'In my experience at Warde, there is a great deal of school spirit. Teachers and students alike love the school. In the halls, you can see a lot of Warde apparel and most students try to make as many sports games as they can. Even the teachers attend some games. The administration has done a good job of embedding school spirit into the daily lives of students, especially through the WARDE acronym.', 'I loved fairfield ware high school. It was a lot of fun. The teachers are amazing and everyone is really nice. The work is difficult but if you do it', 'I had a great experience at Warde. The teachers were great, and I feel like I learned a lot. People are friendly and care about one another. It was a goal at this school to make sure everyone felt included. I have made a lot of good friends here, and I know I can always count on them. My teachers were also great people who I learned to trust and felt like they wanted me to succeed. There is a lot of school spirit, and everyone likes to support sports teams. Everyone in the school had the drive to do well, and that drove other people to want to succeed as well. I am proud to have gone to this school and got to meet so many great people.']
