column1: Middlesex County Academy for Allied Health & Biomedical Sciences
column2: ['I like the academy because I know I am being very well prepared for college and getting a good foundation. I want to study either pre med or psychology in college and I feel confident that I will be fully able to succeed when I graduate. All the teachers are extremely supported and really do their best to help you to succeed. The only thing I miss about my home school is there is no art programs but you know that going into the application process.', 'The one major benefit I have from going to this school is the preparedness for college. This school is medically focused, so alot of the classes are very interesting and prepared me well for my future career in healthcare. However, some of the teachers here can be condescending and may discourage you instead of shining a light on your strengths and encouraging you. This school is also very competitive in nature to the point where your fellow classmates and "friends" may hide things from you or straight up lie to you in order to benefit themselves. Also, due to the intense workload, having time to do a lot of extracurricular activities is tough, so time management is extremely important. Overall, it is the medically-focused academics that really make this school worthwhile.', 'In eighth grade, I was accepted to the MCVTS Academy for Allied Health and Biomedical Sciences - a school geared to prepare students for a future in medicine. I had an array of opportunities ranging from rigorous college-level courses to real organ dissections. Through these, I started to enjoy studying the intricacies of the human body. The more I heard stories from my teachers of their times as ER nurses, army medics, and trauma surgeons, the deeper I became captivated by the field of healthcare. In this schol, my sprouting interest has solidified into grounded ambition.', 'The school is very challenging and prepares students well for college and beyond. One improvement would be to lower the stress inflicted on students.', 'My Russian culture revolves heavily around theatre, literature, music, and art. After choreographing numerous slavic shows and competing as a ballroom dancer for seven years, I knew that even if I decided to pursue medicine, I would want to pick a school that would allow me to express myself through art, culture, and science. I confirmed this after I attended a health oriented high school that eliminated all forms of art and replaced it with health related electives and dual enrollment courses. Although I continued to sing in church choir and play the piano, I missed the sense of community that used to surround my musical endeavors. As a result, I fell in love with our school, but I had to sacrifice art for science. However, now that I am applying to college, I know exactly what environment I am looking for.', 'It prepares you well for healthcare and teaches you how to be a good student. I appreciate most of the staff. Clubs are limited.', 'It was very medicine-based, so I learned a lot about the health profession. It is very rigorous and the teachers are hard.', 'This school has provided me with many opportunities, including access to college credits from my freshman year and the ability to conduct research. Here, I realized the career path that I want to embark on in the future. All of the teachers are excellent and provide me with all of the necessary tools for success in the future. I will always remember my time spent here!', 'Throughout my years at the Academy, I felt that I was inhibited by the environment that was provided by my fellow peers and teachers. The administration and teachers do not communicate effectively with one another, making it more stress-inducing for the students. In addition, people who have returned from college have mentioned that the teachers tend to unnecessarily  over-prepare for college.', 'My experience at the Middlesex County Academy for Allied Health and Biomedical Sciences was subpar at best. I found an amazing community of friends and a plethora of academic opportunities, but felt that the faculty and administration were not supportive of the students. The school also lacked social events to give students the proper high school experience. Overall, I feel that this school inhibited my growth and opportunity for success, which I have had to overcome.', "I know many people did not really enjoy the Academy over their 4 years, but looking back as an alum, I felt like the Academy was my second home. The people I was able to connect with - friends, peers, and especially teachers - made school an amazing experience, and I can truly say that the Academy taught me more than I can ever realize as an aspiring health care professional. I do admit there are quite a few downsides, especially being such a small school and having limited resources, but I felt overall the opportunities I was able to obtain and the experiences I had - on a daily basis and otherwise also - could not have been had in a normal public high school with a class of 600-700. I only look back and smile now because all of the truly memorable moments I had. I wish I didn't have to leave honestly because the Academy became my comfort zone", "I like that the class sizes are very small compared to normal highschools, with 60-70 students per grade. There is also a good teacher to student ratio, so the amount of people in one class is not overwhelming. I also like the medical/ health-related classes and the fact that many of the teachers have previously or still do work in the health field, so you get to hear their experience and advice. One of the downsides is the competitiveness. Students here are very competitive to the point that if you ask for help on something you might not get it unless they benefit somehow. Another thing is a lot of the teachers pile up work on you and expect you to complete it the day of, but don't realize that you have a lot of work from other classes too, so often it's hard NOT to procrastinate, especially during junior year when you have SAT's, AP's and extracurriculars you need  to spend time on too.", "The administration and excessive respect for tenure need to be fixed.  Many of the teachers at the academy are not equipped to teach for success. Unless you are positive you want to become a medical professional, don't attend the academy.", "This school has some issues. The workload is a lot, and they're very strict on attendance, almost to the point of being unreasonable. It's very hard to get a break, or even leave to do some of the 50 hours required to complete the senior year Capstone project. Clubs are another downside; you can only be in one official club that meets during monthly club days. Other extracurriculars have to be conducted before school, or outside of school.As for benefits, the medical curriculum is excellent and often incredibly interesting; this is a good place to get a strong foundation for anyone considering a medical career. The block schedule is also a benefit, as it allows you 2 days to do any homework so you can plan ahead if things get busy. Another advantage is the other students. It's interesting and beneficial to learn in a group of similarly motivated peers, and I have met a lot of wonderful people in my time here.", 'Although the program seems great for a student who knows what they want from their high school experience it is devoid of concern for a students social emotional health!  The teachers are very entitled and the leadership is weak. Students are left to sink or swim. I don’t believe this rating of diversity is accurate! The student attendance is not a true depection of the people who live in Middlesex County. I sent my child back to our local high school, since she is much happier!', 'Woodbridge Academy is a great school for those who want to learn about a possible career in biomedical science or allied health. It has experienced staff and provides many opportunities for success and exploration. It is very competitive, but provides substantial college readiness.', 'This school is really good if you want to be prepared for college and are interested in medicine. However, the school does not have an amazing environment as students often separate into cliques.', 'The Middlesex County Academy for Allied Health & Biomedical Sciences allowed me to receive exposure to a breadth of coursework relevant to healthcare professions. I cherish the practical applications and knowledge in clinical medicine that I have gained from the curriculum at this high school. I think that improvement is necessary in the environment and culture of the school because the competition amongst students can become toxic and detrimental.', "I went to the Academy hoping to take rigorous academics within a close community. I was also intrigued by the science and allied health focus of the curriculum. The program's curriculum seems to be set up very nicely, but the way it is carried out in practice does not make the Academy the best option for the type of students accepted. I felt that several of the teachers at the Academy did not actively contribute to my learning of the subject matter, and this especially affected my performance in STEM subjects. I felt that a few teachers here did not teach properly or even perform the minimum required as a high school teacher. Teachers, at times, made discouraging remarks. I also felt that the administration did not effectively respond to student complaints. There were, however, a few good exceptions in teachers whom I appreciate. Most the Academy's clubs were held during school timings, and I think that this could limit extracurricular involvement.", 'The workload is heavy so it prepares you for college. I would like to see better teachers who can help the students achieve their goals more. I would also like late buses for those who do not have rides to stay after school']

This school is also very competitive in nature to the point where your fellow classmates and "friends" may hide things from you or straight up lie to you in order to benefit themselves. Also, due to the intense workload, having time to do a lot of extracurricular activities is tough, so time management is extremely important. Overall, it is the medically-focused academics that really make this school worthwhile.', 'In eighth grade, I was accepted to the MCVTS Academy for Allied Health and Biomedical Sciences - a school geared to prepare students for a future in medicine. I had an array of opportunities ranging from rigorous college-level courses to real organ dissections. Through these, I started to enjoy studying the intricacies of the human body. The more I heard stories from my teachers of their times as ER nurses, army medics, and trauma surgeons, the deeper I became captivated by the field of healthcare. In this schol, my sprouting interest has solidified into grounded ambition.', 'The school is very challenging and prepares students well for college and beyond. One improvement would be to lower the stress inflicted on students.', 'My Russian culture revolves heavily around theatre, literature, music, and art. After choreographing numerous slavic shows and competing as a ballroom dancer for seven years, I knew that even if I decided to pursue medicine, I would want to pick a school that would allow me to express myself through art, culture, and science. I confirmed this after I attended a health oriented high school that eliminated all forms of art and replaced it with health related electives and dual enrollment courses. Although I continued to sing in church choir and play the piano, I missed the sense of community that used to surround my musical endeavors. As a result, I fell in love with our school, but I had to sacrifice art for science. However, now that I am applying to college, I know exactly what environment I am looking for.', 'It prepares you well for healthcare and teaches you how to be a good student. I appreciate most of the staff. Clubs are limited.', 'It was very medicine-based, so I learned a lot about the health profession. It is very rigorous and the teachers are hard.', 'This school has provided me with many opportunities, including access to college credits from my freshman year and the ability to conduct research. Here, I realized the career path that I want to embark on in the future. All of the teachers are excellent and provide me with all of the necessary tools for success in the future. I will always remember my time spent here!', 'Throughout my years at the Academy, I felt that I was inhibited by the environment that was provided by my fellow peers and teachers. The administration and teachers do not communicate effectively with one another, making it more stress-inducing for the students. In addition, people who have returned from college have mentioned that the teachers tend to unnecessarily  over-prepare for college.', 'My experience at the Middlesex County Academy for Allied Health and Biomedical Sciences was subpar at best. I found an amazing community of friends and a plethora of academic opportunities, but felt that the faculty and administration were not supportive of the students. The school also lacked social events to give students the proper high school experience. Overall, I feel that this school inhibited my growth and opportunity for success, which I have had to overcome.', "I know many people did not really enjoy the Academy over their 4 years, but looking back as an alum, I felt like the Academy was my second home. The people I was able to connect with - friends, peers, and especially teachers - made school an amazing experience, and I can truly say that the Academy taught me more than I can ever realize as an aspiring health care professional. I do admit there are quite a few downsides, especially being such a small school and having limited resources, but I felt overall the opportunities I was able to obtain and the experiences I had - on a daily basis and otherwise also - could not have been had in a normal public high school with a class of 600-700. I only look back and smile now because all of the truly memorable moments I had. I wish I didn't have to leave honestly because the Academy became my comfort zone", "I like that the class sizes are very small compared to normal highschools, with 60-70 students per grade. There is also a good teacher to student ratio, so the amount of people in one class is not overwhelming. I also like the medical/ health-related classes and the fact that many of the teachers have previously or still do work in the health field, so you get to hear their experience and advice. One of the downsides is the competitiveness. Students here are very competitive to the point that if you ask for help on something you might not get it unless they benefit somehow. Another thing is a lot of the teachers pile up work on you and expect you to complete it the day of, but don't realize that you have a lot of work from other classes too, so often it's hard NOT to procrastinate, especially during junior year when you have SAT's, AP's and extracurriculars you need  to spend time on too.", "The administration and excessive respect for tenure need to be fixed.  Many of the teachers at the academy are not equipped to teach for success. Unless you are positive you want to become a medical professional, don't attend the academy.", "This school has some issues. The workload is a lot, and they're very strict on attendance, almost to the point of being unreasonable. It's very hard to get a break, or even leave to do some of the 50 hours required to complete the senior year Capstone project. Clubs are another downside; you can only be in one official club that meets during monthly club days. Other extracurriculars have to be conducted before school, or outside of school.As for benefits, the medical curriculum is excellent and often incredibly interesting; this is a good place to get a strong foundation for anyone considering a medical career. The block schedule is also a benefit, as it allows you 2 days to do any homework so you can plan ahead if things get busy. Another advantage is the other students. It's interesting and beneficial to learn in a group of similarly motivated peers, and I have met a lot of wonderful people in my time here.", 'Although the program seems great for a student who knows what they want from their high school experience it is devoid of concern for a students social emotional health!  The teachers are very entitled and the leadership is weak. Students are left to sink or swim. I don’t believe this rating of diversity is accurate! The student attendance is not a true depection of the people who live in Middlesex County. I sent my child back to our local high school, since she is much happier!', 'Woodbridge Academy is a great school for those who want to learn about a possible career in biomedical science or allied health. It has experienced staff and provides many opportunities for success and exploration. It is very competitive, but provides substantial college readiness.', 'This school is really good if you want to be prepared for college and are interested in medicine. However, the school does not have an amazing environment as students often separate into cliques.', 'The Middlesex County Academy for Allied Health & Biomedical Sciences allowed me to receive exposure to a breadth of coursework relevant to healthcare professions. I cherish the practical applications and knowledge in clinical medicine that I have gained from the curriculum at this high school. I think that improvement is necessary in the environment and culture of the school because the competition amongst students can become toxic and detrimental.', "I went to the Academy hoping to take rigorous academics within a close community. I was also intrigued by the science and allied health focus of the curriculum. The program's curriculum seems to be set up very nicely, but the way it is carried out in practice does not make the Academy the best option for the type of students accepted. I felt that several of the teachers at the Academy did not actively contribute to my learning of the subject matter, and this especially affected my performance in STEM subjects. I felt that a few teachers here did not teach properly or even perform the minimum required as a high school teacher. Teachers, at times, made discouraging remarks. I also felt that the administration did not effectively respond to student complaints. There were, however, a few good exceptions in teachers whom I appreciate. Most the Academy's clubs were held during school timings, and I think that this could limit extracurricular involvement.", 'The workload is heavy so it prepares you for college. I would like to see better teachers who can help the students achieve their goals more. I would also like late buses for those who do not have rides to stay after school']
column6: ['I liked the friendships I made and the diverse group of personalities I encountered. However, I thought that the teachers ill-prepared me for whats to come (education wise). In terms of ethnicity, it is not as diverse as a public school. The food is not great, so I would recommend bringing your own lunch.', "If you're looking for a challenge, this school delivers, although not in the way you expect. Teachers obviously choose favorites and the administration does not punish those who cheat their way to the top. Go to a district high school if you want a fair chance of getting into honor societies and a full high school experience. Would only recommend to students who are passionate about the medical field and are certain they want to pursue it in their futures.", "The community at the Academy is great. Because the school is very small (less than 300 students total) everyone is familiar with each other. The teachers are also very kind and helpful. No teacher will ever deny helping a student, whether it be school work or something extra. The classes are very focused on the biomedical field, and I can honestly say I gained a very thorough exposure to the medical field. One downside to the academy is the sports available. Especially for boys. The school offer co-ed soccer, girls' basketball, and girls' softball. However, they are starting a boys tennis team, and as the school continues to grow, more sports will hopefully be available to the students. Overall, attending the academy was a great experience.", 'This school allowed me to explore the medical field like not other school would let me. It has been a place where memories can be made, new friends can be found, and where you get to learn more about yourself. This school opens your eyes to college life in the sense that it teaches you how to self study rather than to have everything spoon-fed to you which helps you learn how to live in college.', "After attending this academy for the past four years, I've come to appreciate the college readiness that this school has integrated into my doctrine. Those long nights studying and completing endless assignments were gruesome, but it is with this school I have found my love for the sciences and medical field. The knowledge I have obtained from this school has given me some of the knowledge I need to pursue my path and future as a medical student, and for that I am grateful. I hope to leave this school with my head held high and confidence in high spirits as I leave to take on the real world ahead of me.", "It is a great school.  The teaching staff is not the best, the rigor of the curriculum really prepares students for college.  This is this particular school's primary selling point.  Sports, clubs, and other ancillary aspects are quite lacking, but I am fond of this school's ability to prepare students for college and a career in the today's dynamic healthcare industry.", 'The Academy was a great experience. The heavy workload and tough subjects, as well as electives focused on the medical field, allows for students to gain more knowledge about the medical field as well as become prepared for their time in college.', 'Teachers are the best part of school :) most are super understanding, always willing to offer extra help, and overall just fun people to be around.', 'What I like about this school is that it is small, and all of the students share a common interest when it comes to achieving their goals. It prepares me for college and life skills.', "This school is associated with Rutgers and students who complete and pass all of the offered classes can go to Rutgers with over 10 credits. For those interested in pursuing the medical field, this school is an excellent option because it shows you the medical field from a very broad standpoint. One of the downsides of the school however is that many of the students do not get home until 4 or 5 o'clock and this restricts the students ability to participate in extracurricular activities.", 'If you are looking for a school that will prepare you for a career in health care, then Woodbridge Academy is the school for you. However, this school is not for the weak of heart. You will be surrounded by extremely competitive students and teachers that are geniuses in their own right. In fact, one may even say that many of the teachers in this school are overqualified for their positions.', "The librarian is so mean that if I could go back in time I wouldn't have gone to the school solely because of her. Why can't you just be nice? We are all humans. She treated the kids like garbage.", "The school is kind of difficult, but the students are great. I love being in the small community. Everyone knows everyone else. The one bad thing about this school is that you're screwed over in terms of your gpa.", "The school sucks, teachers are horrible at teaching. They're either too easy or too difficult, there is no in-between. I wish I'd gone to my regular high school instead of coming here, because I feel like my educational experience would've been better. As a student, you have to be very very very dedicated to medicine straight out as an 8th grader, because the entire curriculum is very science-based, so there is no room to change your mind later on. For me, the experience was not good, but at least this school taught me I am not interested in pursuing medicine later. ", 'In terms of academics, this school is by far one of the best ive seen', "There isn't much but it's lit i guess. Some fun some not", 'I love this school, it has my favorite health classes.', 'Teachers are pretty great, some are very open and talkative while others are quiet. But they all do their job well.', "I chose this school because I know exactly what I want to do with my future: medicine. However, the struggles and mental obstacles I have had to overcome at this school have been quite severe. Although the students are generally very nice and supportive of each other, there is an underlying competitiveness in all of us that wants to beat everyone else to get to where we want to be. Everyday, kids talks about SATs scores and AP tests and GPAs and colleges and medical programs. Everyone is extremely stressed, not even in a good way. There is a detrimental effect on the mental health of teenagers at this school, and it does not culminate a positive atmosphere for teenagers to grow up and positively discover the people that they are going to become. While stress is a normal part of life for high school students everywhere, the amount of stress that students have here is overwhelming. Personally, I feel like I have mental breakdowns from the stress more than is healthy. It's ironic, really, because all of the students come to this school in hopes of becoming physicians or go into the medical profession. This school has classes from Rutgers that have to do with healthcare in place of normal high school electives. Only some of these classes are worth any of the effort it takes to go to this school and are also only worth it if you decide to go to the schools that take the credits for these classes. I don't know if I would choose this school over again if I could. I would definitely choose a vocational school that specializes in medicine, but not this school.", 'I feel like I\'ve only learned from one or two of all of the teachers at this school. Classes that don\'t have to do with medicine or allied health generally do not help you learn and seem like they are only there because it is required by law. Although classes are stated to be "honors"-level, it certainly does not seem that way. Teachers have a habit of being very biased and not involved in their students\' activities, so come time to ask for letters of recommendation, teachers have no way of distinguishing one student from another based on personal connections and go purely based off of a resume and transcripts. Each teacher has very different ways of grading. One mathematics teacher uses tests and quizzes for 90% of your grade; these are not separate percentages put together, but rather, tests and quizzes are the same thing and weighted the same. Other teachers may have tests only worth 45% of your grade. Teaching does not seem to be adequate for high-school-level learning and often feels like I am back in middle school. Either work given is too rigorous or no work is given at all. Lots of busy work. Teachers also expect too much of the students, which is where personal bias comes into play and lends to favoritism, resulting in some better letters of recommendation and teacher communication to one student versus another. Overall, the quality and standard of teachers hired at this school are not seemingly high enough for a school with a reputation of such high caliber. Student test scores are only high because they all have the drive to succeed and do well, working themselves without help of teachers.']
column8: ['No one really cares for the extracurriculars at at this school. there is no authority and legit representation of them.', 'My typical and dreamed of high school experience was actually not met at this school. there a lot of things i wish i could have done like i would have at a different school in terms of clubs, extracurriculars and school events. Its been a struggle but the support of friends and a few loving teachers has helped me move on.', 'The teachers at this school are generally outgoing and consistent. They engage students with personal examples due the close knit environment that makes up our school. However there are a few teachers that may not respect your rights and authorities as a student and go beyond their limits.', 'It is very safe and nobody gets injured except in gym class or sports.', 'Most are amazing, but we always have some that seem to push us too far.', "It's a challenge, exactly what I signed up for so I can't complain. It will really prepare me for college.", "There aren't many, but they are extremely fun to participate in.", "My overall experience in this school has been great. There were definitely times where I felt like giving up and dropping out of the school, but I learned to survive here. I met so many amazing friends here, people I could understand. One of my favorite experiences was playing basketball. At the school, sports aren't very important. We usually lose most of our games, but the thing is, playing on the team is fun. I loved being part of the team and going to practices. If I could do it all over, I would definitely choose this school again. Although, if I were to do it all over again, I'd try my best starting freshman year, rather than junior year. Sadly, I didn't realize how important it was to not procrastinate until my junior year. Of course, there are some cons to this school. For example, this school is very very competitive. The students always compare themselves to the others, and that makes the school incredibly stressful. But, I do not regret coming to the school, because I have learned so much.", "Most of the teachers are college professors, and we also have a nurse and a trauma surgeon, as well as an engineer that has worked for NASA. That being said, all of our teachers are very knowledgeable in what they teach. On the other hand, however, some of them aren't approachable, and some don't teach well at all. Overall, I feel that this school is mainly self study. The most important skill you learn here is how to self study, because some teachers do not teach.", "My school, The Academy for Allied Health and Biomedical Sciences, is a school in which students must apply and interview to get in. After the application process, only about 70 students are accepted. This school has been the most interesting, unique experience of my life. With a predominantly Indian population, the culture of the school flourishes. Being a white Catholic male, I had never experienced such new fetes until attending my school. Aside from the culture shock, my school is extremely competitive academically. I love this school for preparing me for college yet sometimes I do not know if colleges understand the difference of my school from others. I worry colleges only see me as an average 3.4 GPA student, rather than an extremely hard working person taking all college-based classes. If I had the choice go back and go to a different school, I would not. The humbling experience of not flying by high-school with straight A's has taught me a lot, and I truly appreciate it.", "The school is okay. I met some of my best friends there because we all had similar interests. With a small student body, it's easier to become cliquey after a few years. Lots of drama between friends and lots of rumors. The name doesn't really help with getting into colleges. Many unique medical courses with lots of different and new labs, however, will not recommend over a larger school with more APs, extracurriculars, and more opportunities in general. If you change your mind about whether you want to pursue medicine while in this school, it will not help you with colleges at all.", 'It helped me become a stronger person, through challenges and tough college style teaching. I feel like I was prepared when I took online college courses, and I will feel even more prepared at other colleges, \r The people are also extremely nice. There are cliques, like at every high school, but these cliques are malleable and everyone honestly meshes with each other within and between grades. \r We learn biology and anatomy that most med students learn in their later undergrad or earlier grad years. It is challenging, and our GPAs might not be perfect because they push us hard, but we all grow as a family.', "My school challenges me and always keeps me busy. Although there are times where I've disliked my school strongly, I can't imagine going to any other school. Majority of the faculty is great and so are the students.", "It's a small cozy community. It takes a while to get used to, but once you fall into the rhythm of its daily life, it's hard to leave. The relationships a lot of people create during these years last a long time. One of the downfalls of such a cozy school is the fact that rumors spread quickly, true or untrue. Everyone is competitive, sometimes overly-so, but there are a lot of helpful people who want to see you succeed. If I had to choose to come here again, I probably would have. And a key piece of advice is do NOT procrastinate! I can't stress this enough because every time I say this, nobody listens. Then they complain that this school takes up too much time and effort. You have to learn what the teachers want and give it to them with your own personal touch. It's the art of high school: learn it early and you will be golden.", 'This school is unique in that it is small, and everyone knows each other. However, I would not choose to go to this school again because the teachers were not significantly better than in my local high school and because there are not many scheduling options or electives to take like in a normal high school.', 'A great environment to thrive in academically, socially, and professionally. Teaches not only educational skills but skills for the future such as public speaking.', 'This school has seen me fall and get back up w/o any help which has helped me become a stronger person and ready for the real world. I have gained so much knowledge, more than I would have retained at my normal high school. Although there have been many rough patches in the school I can with strong confidence say that I love my school', 'Students usually stay out of trouble and the staff trust students enough not to impose any disciplinary actions or unfair policies.', 'Prior to making the decision to come to this school, one must understand the level of work and maturity this school demands from its students. If you organize your time and keep yourself on an organized schedule then you will be able to find the time to do everything you plan on doing in a high school. This is a small school, the student community is very close-knit and everyone knows your name. As a Blue Ribbon School, the Academy works hard to groom their students to become top college students. Our students get accepted into top accelerated medical programs, and other top programs in the nation. This is a high school for individuals who want to attend college a step ahead of other students; the students operate on a high level, consistently. This is definitely a school for the best and the brightest of Middlesex County. Those who attend sometimes struggle to understand the flood of information and content from their numerous coursework, however, all understand the importance and achievement of their work. Students here are proud of their studies and school. This school is not for anyone, you must trust yourself to succeed in a highly competitive environment.', 'We have some good acceptance in this school. The only issue I can think of is that we have one African American in the school. ONE.']

column1: Fiorello H. Laguardia High School Of Music & Art & Performing Arts
column2: ['At this school, you are always surrounded by talent, which encourages you to try harder in your major. Additionally, teachers are very supportive of students. They will often come to sports games and performances to cheer on their students. Teachers are also willing to work with students on scheduling. This is a dual-mission school, so they are understanding that sometimes it becomes hard to balance studio requirements and performances with homework.', 'If you are very focused on your major and have high hopes of pursuing it as your career, then this is the school for you. However, it is not your average "public school".  There is not a wide range in teachers, you either get mazing teachers that have went to Yale or teachers that can barely speak english.', 'I love the amount of diversity in the student body and some of the teachers are top notch however, they put to much of an emphasis on testing instead of actual learning.', "LaGuardia is a school that allowed me to learn so much about myself. Entering, I was a shy, closed-off person who though the only interest I was allowed to have was music. Now, I've grown to be more open, expressive and have many different passions and interests - music, physics, and others. The combination of cramming arts courses and academics into a single day may seem overwhelming at first, but you quickly get used to it. I would not be the person I am today without LaGuardia.", 'Best choice! Honestly, I am glad I will soon be graduating from this school. It has helped me tremendously, especially within the arts. It can not compare to any school. The long hours are worth it.', 'Laguardia High School is the top specialized performing arts schools in the country. so many apply , but only a few make it. This school will teach you everything you nee to know for whatever major your going into.', 'Laguardia HS allows for a wonderful opportunity to be exposed to the arts. There is a good balance between arts and rigorous academics, that help me feel really well prepared for college.', 'i had an amazing time, even though the academics interfered with my work as a performing artist.  they gave too much homework.', 'I love this school, my schedule is great and my teachers are all very nice and helpful. I made many new friends this year so far and everyone seems so welcoming and fun. There are ALOT of club activity choices and some interesting sports teams choices to try out for. Overall this school is everything and more than I looked forward to and I love it :)', "I came into Laguardia with high ambitions and this school has managed to make them even higher. High school can be a very difficult time in someone's life because of the environment it offers. LaGuardia has provided a safe and welcoming environment for me where I was able to discover myself. In all seriousness, I want to come to school. I love the drama department because there is a sense of trust. We work on projects together and we present them together. I have played characters that helped me understand who I am as a person. I have been able to grow out of my comfort zone and be more accepting of who I am. Laguardia helped me get out of my head and stopped me from always second-guessing my self. I feel more confident about the person I have become, and I will always be thankful that this was my highschool experience.", 'It is a great performing arts school. However, the schedule is long with 10 periods lasting 45 minutes each. The new admin seems better and loves art, but academics may be getting less focus. The teachers are alright.', "I've really loved my time at LaGuardia.  I've worked on the All School Musical for the past 3 years and it's amazing to see such incredible and talented students come together to put on such amazing productions.  While having a heavy emphasis on the arts, I still take AP Calculus BC and AP Physics and have teachers who want me to succeed.  While I'm greatly looking forward to the next 4 years of my life, I will always treasure my time at LaGuardia.", 'I loved my time at LaGuardia. I wouldn’t trade it for Anything. However, the school has changed a lot since I left.', 'The school is an incredible institution dedicated to providing quality arts education to all New Yorkers.', 'At my school everyone is so different and everyone accepts that with open arms which I love my school is very large which causes over crowded classrooms and some impersonal teacher student relationships. at time my school lacks organization and guidence but when our school needs to unit and be a community we always stand together as one. some of the teachers I have had have not been the best at teaching their subject but have been great sources of support for myself and many of my peers which in turn held much more value than being able to grade papers in week span of time', "I'm a freshman in art major of the school. Even though I am new to the school but throughout the first few weeks I can feel that it's a great school. Teacher are nice and professional, as well as my peers. The school also got a great supports system they will send you newsletter to get you informed, and tutoring during lunch to help with your school work.", "The school day is too long, we start at 8 and end at 4:10. There are people who end even later due to musical and production rehearsals. There are a handful of teachers who know what they're doing. The bathrooms are very dirty, lots of roaches. The hallways are pretty dark too. The music program I am in is okay, could be more. I don't find anything too special about the school, like everyone keeps saying. Its a normal school that ends very late.", 'Loved laGuardia! but should have more diversity in teachers of the arts, all the various arts teachers were exclusively white.', 'Cool Professor and people. Diverse Community.I wish they had college parking space for students who drive in.', 'At LaGuardia, students are able to explore their field of arts, whether visual or performing. There are many opportunities for students to get connected with their field via their staff and have access to performances, art galleries, and programs that would further their studies in the arts. Academics are somewhat strong but generally, the school was a great 4-year experience for me.']

However, the school has changed a lot since I left.', 'The school is an incredible institution dedicated to providing quality arts education to all New Yorkers.', 'At my school everyone is so different and everyone accepts that with open arms which I love my school is very large which causes over crowded classrooms and some impersonal teacher student relationships. at time my school lacks organization and guidence but when our school needs to unit and be a community we always stand together as one. some of the teachers I have had have not been the best at teaching their subject but have been great sources of support for myself and many of my peers which in turn held much more value than being able to grade papers in week span of time', "I'm a freshman in art major of the school. Even though I am new to the school but throughout the first few weeks I can feel that it's a great school. Teacher are nice and professional, as well as my peers. The school also got a great supports system they will send you newsletter to get you informed, and tutoring during lunch to help with your school work.", "The school day is too long, we start at 8 and end at 4:10. There are people who end even later due to musical and production rehearsals. There are a handful of teachers who know what they're doing. The bathrooms are very dirty, lots of roaches. The hallways are pretty dark too. The music program I am in is okay, could be more. I don't find anything too special about the school, like everyone keeps saying. Its a normal school that ends very late.", 'Loved laGuardia! but should have more diversity in teachers of the arts, all the various arts teachers were exclusively white.', 'Cool Professor and people. Diverse Community.I wish they had college parking space for students who drive in.', 'At LaGuardia, students are able to explore their field of arts, whether visual or performing. There are many opportunities for students to get connected with their field via their staff and have access to performances, art galleries, and programs that would further their studies in the arts. Academics are somewhat strong but generally, the school was a great 4-year experience for me.']
column6: ['LaGuardia Highschool is a great school for the arts, but for the past few years we have had a terrible principle that solely cared for academics. She would often times cut the budget for performances and rehearsals. But she is gone now!! -The school is located in a great location(Lincoln Center in New York City) where there is a lot to explore.-There is little to none bullying or fights.-There is absolutely no discrimination on gender identity, religion, and/or sexuality.  Everyone at our school is unique in their own way and art form. We respect one another. -You will meet some of the coolest kids with the coolest styles. -We have very  strict but cool security guards and deans.', "I would like to see the administration listen and be open about students' ideas as well as better planning school activities. We should always have both the arts and academics side by side and never to weigh one over the other.", "They have you work very hard and most teachers care deeply about students. The drama department is self funded, so we have phenomenal shows but other departments, like art, require students to purchase hundreds of dollars worth of their own materials because of a lack of funding. You'll be in a very creative setting and your peers will inspire you. One huge downfall is that there is no college advisor. The guidance counselors are individually assigned to hundreds of students, making them the only resource for academics/college/personal life/guidance for hundreds of students at a time. This is NOT enough to help us. Students will often spend their whole lunch period waiting in line outside their guidance counselor's office to speak to them, not even getting to see them.", 'The arts teachers are extremely talented and passionate. The academic teachers are a hit or miss. Some are very excited about their subjects and try to incorporate the arts, others are lazy and boring. The administration doesn’t always seem to be on our side and values academics over the arts, but we just got a new principal so change is likely.', 'Due to the old principle leaving, i really hope laguardia changes for the better. i love my major and i think most kids do/should, but the school should stop prioritizing all these aps because those types of classes might help some students but it hurts others. Laguardia is a hard school, but i think the school should be able to know what the students need which is more regular, but interesting classes. Laguardia doesnt offer a lot of regular classes the 2 last years which is why so many kids are actually forced to take ap classes and end up becoming anxious and depressed and thats y so many kids endup using substances and/or jumping out of windows.', "It's been nice being surrounded by so many creative people. This place is 99% non-judgemental and is filled with many outgoing and bright people. I've loved being here but also with every school, there are some downsides. For example, my guidance counselor has changed 3 times in the last 3 years, which makes it really hard for me to get my college applications on track.", 'I am an art major. Although I have my problems with LaGuardia, I could not imagine myself anywhere else. Yes, the hours are long, but we also have up to FOUR art classes PER DAY. Sometimes the teachers assign "boring" projects, or do not offer enough critisism. Regardless, we are still practicing art every day, and therefore improving. The academics are  strong here, and students don\'t seem to have a hard time getting into competitive schools out of LaGuardia. There is a mental health crisis because LaGuardia does not provide a lot of systems to combat anxiety and depression. The student body is working on that, and there is a new principal who will hopefully help improve LaGuardia in that regard. There aren\'t really cliques, as everyone just hangs out with each other. I have a ton of different friend groups. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to the sgo lag instagram page!', "I like all my teachers since freshmen, I had an excellent experienced with all them, they're very accommodating and listens to the needs and concerns of the students. I would like to personally commend my vocal teachers as they 've done an amazing job with us (the vocal major team), I can say that they've put the best in all the concerts that we did since day one in the stage. I would also like to brag to all the other high school in New York and the other states that our academic teachers are the best teachers in the entire universe, strict but flexible, firm but sensible. I have learn to embrace my weak subject because I had a teacher that is very patient and determined. All in all I would say that I am one lucky person to be part of Fiorello La guardia High School of Music and Art and Performing Arts! The Best high school in New York City!!! The BEST TEACHERS in New York City!!!!", "Laguardia is a place where students aren't afraid to showcase their talent. There are six majors, or areas of study: Dance, Drama, Vocal Music, Instrumental Music, Art, and Technical theatre. All students from different majors are able to work well with one another in different showcases such as Rising Stars and the all school musical. The school is audition based and is very competitive but once you get here, we love you like family", 'LaGuardia Arts High School achieves its dual mission- dedication to arts and academics- very well. The curriculum is flexible, meaning you can choose a more arts focused of a more academic focused path. The administration of the school is horrible, and its reputation is sinking for good reason.', 'I love most parts about my school. However, over the years that I have been there, there has been a decline in the creative spirit of the school. It is supposed to be the number one performing arts school in the country and slowly academics are becoming the most important part which is not why I chose to attend.', "This school has no good community dynamic, but good programs. The students have to take a lot of initiative to get basic things done, because the availability of the administration is really low. The teachers don't get enough recognition for their hard work, and neither do the students. Good arts programs.", "Great school for performing arts. Musical theater, instrumental music, vocal, dance. Decent academics (some) Weak programs - History, Computers. Not much help with AP classes. Need a tutor to get through. But that's probably true everywhere. Overall, good experience. Made new friends for life.", 'I like that our schedules are fit into our studios. We can have dance class or vocal class during our school day. I think a lot of things have to be changed in this school. For example, the cleanliness in the school is not so great. Kids are smoking in bathrooms. Some of the staff members are not so nice.', 'LaGuardia High School has an incredible support system and is able to nurture its students artistically and academically. We are taught to juggle our academics and the arts in addition to our social lives. The students have an abundance of resources, connections, and amazing teachers and peers to learn from. Personally, LaGuardia has shaped me to be a very well-rounded performer and has taught me two very important things about music, art, and life in general: I will go through thousands of rejections. However, within a sea of people telling me “no,” there will be one person that says “yes” and it’ll change my life forever. Most importantly, it’s taught me that there is a hidden silence in this world and if one dares to break that silence, it should be through art and it should ring with passion.', "My experience at Laguardia H.S. has been very all over the place. I'd say that the greatest thing that I got out of this school was a wonderful set of friends. However, my interactions with the administration have been horrible. No one truly cares about student's safety and they are extremely concerned with how the press reviews them. I had a handful of impressionable teachers, though the majority were not up to par. I wish that my high school experience could've been better, but I've learned to take what I can get with LaG.", "I was a studio art major who just graduated last year. I actually really miss the artistic community I had at LaGuardia since coming to a more traditional liberal arts college! The artistic vibe and overall diversity is great; teachers/academics are hit or miss and vary by department. Most of the art teachers are great. If you take AP classes you're usually good in terms of regular academics (APs usually attract better teachers and better students).", 'This school overall has many good things like diversity, arts, and academics. Over the years especially when I have attended this school they have put a lot more interest and funding into the academic part of the school. Recently the arts have been quite neglected or have been censured.', "Personally, I am an art major and I have liked every single art studio teacher I've ever gotten because they all are supportive of all your endeavors, your dreams, and your passions.Right now, I'm a senior and I really loved my experience here at Laguardia High School. This school is both heavy on talent and academics, making you a well balanced student which is great for college. Around winter break, vocal majors go around the school singing carols.Going to Laguardia gave me a chance to be surrounded by people that will challenge you in your particular major. I was surrounded by people who were better than me and I felt like my craft improved much faster.Additionally, he school is very big on being inclusive. They've recently added gender neutral bathrooms which helps people who do not identify with their biological sex to be able to use the bathroom.", 'LaGuardia High School is a very unique community filled with all kinds of people. Drugs and vaping are extremely common in the school, but there had almost never bullying or disrespect. There are also plenty of good students who are only engaged in high GPA and study. Anyone would find a group that is right for him or her. But the environment could be distracting for people who are easily influenced.']

column2: ['As a parent of a senior heading off to college in just a few months, I can truly say that this school district has prepared my child in the academic rigor, diversity and well balanced curriculum to succeed in the post high school years.', "I had a wonderful time at North Shore. Overall, I will miss my favorite teachers. My math teacher had taught me that math, even though it is hard, it is great to accomplish something that you struggle with. I have always struggled with math, she picked me back up when I wasn't confident in my skills regarding math. My photography teacher, she had taught me to inspire others and go for what I want in life. I am so happy that they were wonderful influences on me. They both were an inspiration to me. They really helped me grow as a learner.  I feel like I am truly ready for college because of their guidance. I am moving forward, I am excited to conquer college. I will remember high schools a great experience, that I will never forget.", "I had an excellent high school experience. The teachers and staff at North Shore genuinely care about their students and want to see them succeed. Whenever a student needs help or assistance, it is right there waiting for her. Additionally, there are many clubs, sports, and extracurricular activities that students are not only told about but encouraged to take part in. I felt extremely prepared for college and attribute that readiness to North Shore's resources and curriculum!", "North Shore is a lot of things. I can speak to the IB program as I was a candidate my junior and senior year. Many of the teachers are well-trained in IB, but I think the shift from AP to IB is still in process. Generally speaking, all of my teachers are helpful to an extent, some will go out of their way to help you, others will not (really depends on the subject and/or teacher). Other than the IB program, most of my teachers were poor to average. The resources are meh...when applying for college YOU need to reach out, guidance counselors may help a little, but the heavy lifting is on you. Needless to say, North Shore isn't all bad. Although the administration is almost impossible to contact/nothing will come from it, I feel ready for college and the challenges it will bring. I guess I enjoyed North Shore, but it was too difficult/exhausting at times. Again, I took the IB so I am biased!!", 'North Shore Schools is a spectacular place to receive an education. The teachers are all very welcoming, friendly, and understanding. The district works hard to ensure the students are well-educated and well-rounded. However, there is a lack of diversity in the school district.', "I feel pressured to do my best the entire time here. Not necessarily a bad thing, but I never get enough time to sleep and still be able to do well of my tests the next day. Not enough different level course choices, and the IB program is too limiting. I take all IB classes (no diploma) and I just feel like it's a constant routine. I am not allowed to have lunch if I want to take music and visual art, so I have to eat in certain classes or bring snacks for the whole day", 'After my four years attending North Shore High School, I can say that I have had a very pleasurable experience. I have made lasting relationships with many of my fellow students, as well as the staff who have made my transitions throughout the years much easier.', "My experience has been amazing. I took advantage of everything my school offered and I have excelled in so many aspects. I excelled on and off the field as a Varsity Captain of football to the President of Mock Trial to the President of Track and Field to an athlete scholar. I have enjoyed my experience here and I am going to truly miss my teachers and the staff. If it weren't for them and my drive and motivation, I wouldn't have excelled in the way I did. I am so thankful that we live in a district that places their students first.", 'I liked the art department, I liked the variety of classes. I wish the school had more diversity and cared more about the students', "I loved the school overall...but its no where no near AMAZING.It was a good 4 years ranging from creating wonderful memories with your peers, to having multiple bonds with teachers and many more! Just, it was very overpopulated, and some teachers had poor motivation towards students etc. I'm glad to finally leave this school and move on towards my future.", 'I greatly enjoyed my time as a student at North Shore High School. They have many resources for students to utilize, and the teachers are very passionate about teaching. The school is academically challenging, and it helped me prepare for life in college. One thing I wish North Shore High School had was more diversity. North Shore High School is predominantly Caucasian, so I hope in the future they are able to have more diversity in their future classes. I would definitely send my child to North Shore High School.', "North Shore's promotion of all aspects of learning makes it a rich place for education and allows for all interests to grow and thrive. Every student is able to find success given North Shore's strong programs. From robotics to theatre to track and field, there's a niche for every type of learner.", 'some of the teachers are very good and nice, the students themselves are truly something else, and not in a good way. very snotty and stuck up.', 'I love the community. We think similarly; we act similarly - maybe even too similarly. One of the major flaws I feel as I look on my time as a high schooler is having nearly non-existent experience with non-white students inside and outside the classroom. Transitioning to the IB program was a good decision - for the workload of IA’s and other essays - I feel - prepared me for the more concenptual and long term work of higher education. But, many courses are inferior to their AP counterparts. For example, in my experience, Biology and notably the humanities are inferior to their corresponding AP program - at least in the first of their two years.', 'I have greatly enjoyed my experience at North Shore. The school has great teachers who are very understanding. Myself, I have a digestive disease and my school has helped me through all of the days I miss.', 'too much crack these kids be juuling all day every day. unsafe too many pods. too much nic. juul chargers are not provided.', "Great, loved everything about it. I miss it so much, we're all a family. Teachers and staff are great really helpful, and students life is pretty fun just get involved into school related activities", 'Many people refer to North Shore High School as the "North Shore bubble". While this may seem dramatic, it is understandable considering the little diversity seen throughout the district. In addition, I would love to see the IB program that has recently been implemented to be considered more closely considering the immense amount of stress that many students seem to be under.', 'North Shore High School was a great school. The teachers were motivating and caring. The curriculum was challenging, but in a good way. It was good preparation for college.', 'Its fine. Great AP courses. Tough though. Students are spoiled rich kids. Status is key. Teachers are awesome if you do your research before picking classes. Sports are a pain. They take more time out of your schedule than you think. Coaches do not care about your academics and will push you to the side if you miss some time for extra help. Pretty controlling environment.']

I miss it so much, we're all a family. Teachers and staff are great really helpful, and students life is pretty fun just get involved into school related activities", 'Many people refer to North Shore High School as the "North Shore bubble". While this may seem dramatic, it is understandable considering the little diversity seen throughout the district. In addition, I would love to see the IB program that has recently been implemented to be considered more closely considering the immense amount of stress that many students seem to be under.', 'North Shore High School was a great school. The teachers were motivating and caring. The curriculum was challenging, but in a good way. It was good preparation for college.', 'Its fine. Great AP courses. Tough though. Students are spoiled rich kids. Status is key. Teachers are awesome if you do your research before picking classes. Sports are a pain. They take more time out of your schedule than you think. Coaches do not care about your academics and will push you to the side if you miss some time for extra help. Pretty controlling environment.']
column6: ['My experience at North Shore Senior High School was a pleasant one. One thing they could change is the overwhelming amount of parent involvement.', 'I liked the variety of classes and the  majority of the teachers that were willing to help when I needed it.  ', 'north shore schools gave mea great education good sports good teachers friends academic opportunities sports programs arts programs parent involvement', "There are a lot of different optional classes to fit every student's interests. The guidance counselors are also very available to work with students about their schedules.", 'We barely have any diversity at this school. All of the students are white and wealthy.', "A lot of the teachers are very invested in student's future. Although there are a slim few that seem to not care about students or their success in class.", 'The after-school sports are most popularly involved in. Most people are involved in the sports at North Shore in some way or the other. Participating in these different after-school activities is a great way to become friends with people from other grades.', 'The teachers and guidance counselors make sure all the students know that they are safe and have people to confide in.', 'Teachers are good, good guidance department', 'Not a bad area decent Saftey', 'Good extracurricular activites with many options', "Good high school, people aren't so great but overall good education and", 'Good high school education and college prep.', 'Overall the school is very safe. I never feel in danger', 'A large variety of clubs and sports for anyone to join', 'Again I feel the teachers are very selective in who they choose to help. I also feel that social status plays a huge role in this district and not for a positive reason', 'Depending on the student and teachers I feel they pick favorites and go above and beyond for some but not so much for others causing them to not do as well', 'Overall my experience is great because I love being involved in the play and musical that our school puts on each year. I think this is what makes our school unique is the talent everyone has. I would choose this school again because I love the friendships I have made and things I have learned from these awesome extracurricular actives such as Mosaic (Our schools literary arts magazine) and costume crew!', 'Teachers use some real world examples and we do talk about what is happening in the world. They mostly teach on smart boards which is easy to keep up with/follow. They all know a lot about what they teach and are great at answering your questions.', 'I always feel safe when i am at school, and I rarely ever feel unsafe.']

column2: ['The diverse mix of students allowed myself to meet students from varying backgrounds in terms of race, ethnicity, religion, financial background, etc. I enjoyed the chance to interact with students of all types.', "Diverse school, with amazing people who don't judge and they make you feel accepted. You don't have to change who you are to feel belonged. Be yourself, be happy and live life to the fullest. The people are nice and won't make you feel bad about yourself. The faculty is amazing, they're try their best to help students who are seeking help.", "Walt Whitman High School has been a foundation for many people's future career and plans. From the Homecoming to Senior Follies to Lip Sync Battle, this school as demonstrated engagement between students and teachers in a fun yet educational way. Iconic field trips, such as the Bronx Zoo trip with anthropology or the Riverhead Jail Trip with Crime and Delinquency invite students to have personal interactions with the lessons that they learn in the classroom.", 'Being able to be a student at Walt Whitman High School was such a great experience. The teaching staff were all great people, very willing to help students succeed academically. Fun community to be around', 'What I liked most about whitman it’s how diverse the school is. All districts are very diverse. The teachers at whitman are also very helpful and the most supportive.If I could change one thing about whitman it’s the school lunch.', 'in Whitman, I had a variety of class options and resources available to help me succeed. the teachers are devoted to helping each student do their best. admistrators were friendly and understanding. my 4 years in Whitman ill always remember. The school and community are tight-knit and welcoming.', 'The diversity in this school in unbelievable. Everyone fits in no matter your race, creed or orientation. There is something for everyone whether in clubs, teams or educational groups.', 'Walt Whitman High School is a very diverse school of many devoted teachers who are willing to dedicate after hours to help students.  Furthermore, the school events are always a blast especially Powderpuff, an event where boys are cheerleaders to a football game played by girls.  This school may not offer every Ap course but offers a significant amount and the bank of courses is only growing.', "Loved it. Amazing. The teachers are always ready to help and the safety is top notch. However, If I was to do it all over again, I wouldn't. I am ready to move on and move to the next chapter in my life.", 'Attending Walt Whitman High School in 2011 was a bit frightening at first, but the amount of help the security guards on campus was very helpful. the guidance counselors were very helpful when it came to making my class schedule and helping me apply for my sat exam. They have a therapist who is available at anytime to talk too. the lunch food is not that great sometimes the food is expired, i personally recommend to take your own food to school from home.', 'After hearing about other school in Suffolk County, Whitman has been the best one. Greatest selection of electives and classes. Nice architecture and system. Great administration and teachers. Though not all schools are 100% perfect. Some small things could change such as accessibility to Wilson tech could change to be and such.', "I love this school; not as much as I once did freshman year, but I love it nonetheless. There are stricter rules for the bathrooms, kids staying after school for activities, and overall just more serious. It's begun to feel less like a home and more like a prison, in my opinion, but it isn't terrible. The teachers are absolutely wonderful (most of them) and I love so many of them.", 'I had a very pleasant high school experience at Walt Whitman. There is so much diversity and plenty of activities for everyone. I participated in many clubs and activities throughout my  4 years there. I loved all of my teachers and felt I became very prepared for college.', "Attending Walt Whitman was an experience I truly treasure. Speaking to friends in college now about the classes I took then, I am even more appreciative of the hard work and love that Whitman teachers put into their job. The variety of classes only gives these teachers a greater outlet to teach about things they're passionate in: Anthropology, Nature of Language, Creative Writing, Sociology, AP Environmental. Not only were they teachers that pushed me hard, they were like second parents that were there if I ever needed anything. I was lucky to participate in amazing extracurriculars like Fencing and served as the yearbook editor in chief. Both of these activities allowed me to hone in on leadership skills and problem solving skills. I had the choice to attend private school like my brother, but i would make the same choice every day to spend my 4 years of high school at Whitman.", 'My 4 year experience in Walt Whitman High School were magnificent and delightful, I loved the clubs, the sports and my teachers. The only thing I would change about Walt Whitman it would be the reinforcements in communication between the students, we need to socialize more with one each other.', 'Walt Whitman High School is an amazing school with supportive teachers, staff, and students. The fun clubs that I’ve been a part of, such as National Art Honor Society and Asian Culture Club, have been great to meet nice people and cultivate your interests. The sports teams are also very competitive, which is a good thing when it comes to winning championships. I personally play varsity badminton and I have never seen such a tight knit team like this one. There’s also many events that go on after school, such as International Night, the theatre performances, Senior Follies, Powderpuff, etc. But, the most important thing is that their education is top notch and the teachers are very dedicated to their students.', 'I like the challenge that comes with each assignment and most students are nice and friendly. most students look out for each other and want to see each other succeed. One thing that has bothered me though is that everyone tries to out do everyone else. wether it be grade wise, socially, or when applying to college.', 'Walt Whitman High School made me the person I am today. Without the guidance of my teachers and my involvement of all my school has to offer, I could barely consider myself a person.', 'The school is very diverse. Clubs that accommodate all interests, and you can easily make a new club. The teachers are great, they not only want you to succeed but they want you to have a good time in their class.', 'I really liked this school. Difficult classes, not for slackers. Will teach your child to write an essay better than most entering college. Teachers committed and principal devout. Excellent school--most will agree.']
