column6: ['Whitman is a great school with amazing students, teachers, and administration. Most teachers make the effort to get to know you and acknowledge you in class and in the halls. There are so many events that really made me love going to Whitman such as senior follies and powderpuff and there really is something for everyone here.', "I love Whitman, it is the best high school that I could ever ask for, however I'm still unable to give it a 5 star rating. The academics are very stressful and there is immense pressure from all aspects of the community, we are constantly compared to each other and stressed out to the point that it's extremely unhealthy.", "It's okay, you need to have a unique voice in order to find where you belong. If you try to be like everyone else, you will not be good at this school.", 'Improved indoor sporting facilities such a the use of an indoor track . Bigger weight room and increased number of coaching staff', 'My sister graduated in 2015 and now I am going to graduate in 2018. I have had a really great four years here. There are many teachers that I appreciate and thank for teaching me everything they know. I have done very good on tests because of them.', "As a current senior at Walt Whitman, my four years here have been amazing. I've met so many amazing students who I can now call my family. I've met so many amazing teachers, who are working nonstop to help us succeed. I've been exposed to multiple of Whitman's amazing extracurricular activities, and can not say a bad thing about one of them. Whitman is not just special because of how diverse it is, but because our school puts so much spirit and love behind every single event, club, game, etc. We definitely are a family here and I never want to leave.", 'Small community feel aprox 400 per grade 9-12. Mr. Murphy awesome principal really knows the kids. He is always at after school functions and games. The only bad experience my kids had were the coaches for team sports such as baseball. Hardly ever won because coach keep his same favorite players in even when they were losing constantly.  Wrestling coaches wonderful though.  School is diverse which prepares kids for the real world. Teachers approachable and helpful but your success is up to you. Need to reach out and be involved to have a a truly great experience. My kids didn’t want to leave they loved it so much.', 'Walt Whitman is a good academic school, that fully prepares me for college and gives me opportunities to thrive in my high school career. Most of the teachers respect me and are good role models for the students. The only thing that should be changed is having more flexible schedules for students.', "I am a very proud Alum of SHUFSD's Walt Whitman High School. The faculty are incredible. Whenever you have a problem, they will help you out not because they have to, but because they want to. I was properly prepared for the difficulty of college courses after my course load during high school. Mr. Murphy, the Principal of Walt Whitman High School, has been making monumental changes to the school. He has implemented computer science courses and emphasizes the importance of STEM. The Arts/Music programs are highly ranked and are viewed with great pride. I personally thank Mr. Murphy, the Administration, the BOE, and Faculty for diligently working to make Walt Whitman High School a safe and extraordinary learning environment.", 'Walt whitman high school is a very welcoming school. Very diverse and very open minded. Faculty is very involved and parents are always involved. This school provides all the possible resources needed in order to be successful and get into college.', 'Overall the experience there was good. The majority of staff and teachers were very good at their jobs and created a positive learning environment. The administration was receptive to the student body and reasonable.', "Some great teachers, as good an environment as a high school can get (as in, I wasn't viciously bullied, and people weren't outright rude to me - low standards, but that's kind of the best that you can hope for). I was pretty glad to get out of there for college, and I don't miss it in the least, but I do appreciate what it did for my degree and study habits.", 'Walt Whitman was an incredible school. The teachers were supportive, and wanted to see all of their students do well, and there were plenty of support services offered for those who needed it. In addition, the extracurriculars offered are in a wide range of subjects.', "Spending 4 years at Walt Whitman High School was one of the best experiences I've ever had. The teachers, students, and everyone are just great. You are treated equally and everyone loves you.", 'As a student in Walt Whitman High School, I can honestly say it is one of the most rewarding, friendly, and memorable academic experiences in the nation. The Niche and national rankings might say otherwise, but my school is amazing. Every teacher is always doing their utmost to guarantee success for every student; the students are welcoming and motivated; and the staff at large and whole school district create a wonderful environment that fosters a healthy education. There are many ways for one to "fit in" at Walt Whitman from our sports teams, bounty of available clubs and honor societies such as: Football, soccer, bowling, golf, Debate Club, Fashion Club, International Thespian Society, National Honor Society, World Language Honor Society, etc. An education at Walt Whitman and the gift of being part of such a close knit community is priceless and I would gladly recommend this school to any parents looking for a wholesome education and safe environment for their children.', 'Walt Whitman high school is the most diverse school ever. You get to meet new people and create relationships with them a bond that can\'t be broken. When the students at Whitman talk about how great and exciting the school is people can\'t believe it all they say is "that\'s your high school?". Although there might be groups that don\'t talk to each other or interact with each other, we all feel like a big family.', 'Walt Whitman High School is a great school.  Teachers are there for the students and the coaches instill commitment and team work for their players.  I have excelled in Walt Whitman because of the type of people that are part of the school.  From security guards, to administrators, teachers, coaches and the principal.  They are all there to help support and guide the students.  I am very happy to have had this great experience at my High School.', 'I had a great time at whitman. Great faculty and student body. Truly nice people. Very tight knit community. Truly a great place.', 'Overall I would say my experience was a 4/5. The school had a great variety of classes to choose from. Some classes were greater than others but you get out of it what you put into it. All of the teachers that I have had there were nice and really wanted you to succeed. Some teachers were more strict than others. I wish the school put more money into academics and the arts instead of into sports.', 'I love Walt Whitman High School. From the inclusive teachers and stellar academics, to the diverse culture and club opportunities, this school has it all. Teachers go out of their way to make students feel comfortable, and there are countless services for students who have difficulties in classes, at home, or elsewhere. This school does a great job at handling issues the students, but can feel a little unresponsive regarding issues that change school policy. Certain policies make it very difficult for students to reach their lockers, or for ALL students to gain access to services provided for some students, for example- a student wifi only offered to specific students. These issues are (likely unintentionally) exclusionary by nature, and provide for unequal treatment of students. Overall, this school is incredible and I am so glad I attended here.']

column2: ['go ville great sports principles are great not much more to say overall great. The only complaint is the science wing its terrible and old and musty.', 'Pleasantville High school is very dedicated to the individual students by giving them a home away from home. They treat you as individuals, yet, as part of a community. They view academics very highly and integrate sports and other extracurriculars into daily conversation and class discussion to get students involved.', "This school is very college-focused. If you want to go on to college, this is a great school to help you get there. As a smaller school, there is perhaps a smaller variety of classes and clubs, but all the administrators will know you personally and by name. You don't have to worry about becoming lost in the crowd and being forgotten.", 'The teachers here are really there to help you succeed. They all know who you really are and know what makes you a great student. You get really close with all the teachers considering the small classroom sizes. The environment is also great however student drama can be a little overwhelming. The guidance counselors are there to help you and will do a lot just to get your schedule perfect for you during the beginning of each semesters. The athletics at this school are also amazing considering the multiple Section 1 titles we have won this year. Our theater program is also magnificent showing how hard the students work with such an amazing director for the school. We also have various clubs and activities at our school to join. People get a great education here and create many new friendships along the way.', 'It really helps to allow students to be aware of different schools on a more casual way in which many students can relate.', 'The learning opportunities at this school are amazing. Each program allows students to excel and expand their knowledge in each subject. The scheduling process at this school is very accessible and great for accommodating different , various classes. The work load is sometimes heavy but definitely manageable with the access of good study options.', 'Everyone at this school is so friendly and always there to help each other out. Friends will always stick up for one another and be there for each other. Peers at Pleasantville High School are a second family.', 'There are over 20 club activities at our school, there is something for everyone to join. Each extra curricular activity offers great opportunities to learn and give back.', "Overall, my experience at Pleasantville High School was amazing. My school has offered tons of extra curricular activities and great education programs to be apart. The school is a family; parents, teachers, and students always come together to make the best of every situation. It is an education at a school I wouldn't trade for anything.", 'The teachers at Pleasantville High School are always putting in the best effort to make sure each and every student fully understand the lessons. They make sure all students are engaged and participating. In addition, the teachers always make sure their available to help the students as well. Overall, the students at  Pleasantville High School will get the best education possible with great teachers.', 'A lot of variety, something for everyone.', 'My kids are happy...that says it all!', "I really love my small-sized high school. Growing up with the same kids has been a challenge but also a blessing. I've especially enjoyed all of the exciting extracurriculars I've been able to be a part of, especially my a cappella group and the school play. Sports are a little clique-y but it hasn't stopped me from playing my favorite sport. Another point of interest is the active engagement of students in the community. We are a very small community and therefore the school is able to directly impact the town as a whole. Oh, and we have some pretty fun field trips.", 'Obviously I have no other point of comparison but I believe that the teachers at PHS do a great job at being available outside of class, especially for those in need of extra help. Though the teaching styles vary from class to class, I believe my education is well-rounded and I am prepared for various learning styles in college. All of my teachers are very knowledgeable in their respective fields and are for the most part good communicators. Some teachers are better than others at consistency in grading but overall they are fine.', 'Teachers are engaging and involved . Part of the community', "This school is alright. Aside from the new principal, most of the administration is rude and couldn't be bothered with anything having to do with students. There's a lot of electives and clubs to get involved in though, so that's a plus. It's also a nice looking school, inside and out.", 'Some things are brand new and some seem centuries old', 'It is not rather challenging', 'We had to undergo a renovation, but despite the large construction and remodeling project, the school was always clean and sanitary. It was scary how shiny the floors were and hot spotless the cafeteria always was. There are plenty of computers for students to use, but usually a student needs permission to work on a computer if he/she is not with a class. Tutoring is done by the students of the National Honors Society, unless parents want a professional, and this usually works out well. Parents are always actively involved with everything at the school, and many times, they are too involved. The SAT Reading/Writing prep class was essential in my education, and I am so glad I took it. ', 'There is absolutely no diversity at all in the school. Rich, white kids are what make up the student body.']
column4: ['go ville great sports principles are great not much more to say overall great. The only complaint is the science wing its terrible and old and musty.', 'Pleasantville High school is very dedicated to the individual students by giving them a home away from home. They treat you as individuals, yet, as part of a community. They view academics very highly and integrate sports and other extracurriculars into daily conversation and class discussion to get students involved.', "This school is very college-focused. column1: Leon M. Goldstein High School for the Sciences
column2: ['Goldstein, in my opinion, is like mini-stuy. In other words, although we are not this glorified specialized high school with over 5,000 students like Brooklyn Tech, we are a small community that also has innumerable opportunities. To demonstrate, we have the lovely Science Olympiad team who placed 9th over in the city and will be competing at Yale this year. We also have the Biology Olympiad and Brain Bee (Neuroscience Competition) in which we placed 2nd in NYC as well as Model UN and Debate Team who placed 1st in their recent competition and have competed at Harvard, Yale, and Upenn. Lastly, all the AP Biology students also apply to Genes in Space Challenge which we won the Honorable Mention for as well as a cool PCR machine!!! Overall, I love Goldstein due to its academics and opportunities. Oh and the only thing I would change is the food...yuck', 'The perfect High School, because it is more selective than specialized ones without being a specialized one. Very chill and laid back enviorment while enforcing a great worth ethic into its students, and prepares them, if not over prepares them, for college. Beautiful location, right on the water.', 'The school is slightly overcrowded with some classes not having enough space to fit more students. The teachers are decent , but some of them aren’t the best at teaching so I would suggest asking other students on their thoughts and opinions. There is a school store, so if you’re every hungry it’s always open.', "Going in freshman year can kind of be overwhelming if you don't come from the main middle schools like Bay Academy, Bambi, and Mark Twain. But as long as you keep a positive attitude and attempt to be social you'll find that most people here are really nice. The teaching has gone downhill in the last couple of years for multiple reasons so you have to keep on top of your own work. Join clubs or teams, do volunteer work, and get a friend group and you'll be just fine", "Leon M. Goldstein, for the last four years, has giving me and unforgettable high school experience and has shaped me into the young woman that I am today. The academic challenges and cultural shock I have endured allowed me to form an opinion on certain controversial topics, think sharply, and learn what it truly means to respectfully disagree with other people's opinions", 'amazing time great teachers and staff i had the time of may life and surely prepared me well for college', 'Leon M Goldstein High School is situated in a convenient, safe, and beautiful area on the same territory as a college campus. We even used some of the facilities within the college which enhance our educational opportunities. Goldstein provides a very safe and supportive community. It’s very tight knit and small yet not too small. The teachers are highly professional and engaging. We have various sports, clubs and activities that expose students to immersive experiences as well as develop imperative skills for their futures.', 'I am currently a junior at Goldstein. I wish that my school hired better science teachers. There are a handful of teachers that are passionate about their jobs, whereas, the rest simply lack enthusiasm when teaching.', 'Very good but the school needs more money. The school otherwise has everything it needs to become a great school. The government cut too much money from them.', "When it comes to the people in LMGHS I honestly think we have a diverse and fun student body and hanging out and doing fun stuff is nice, however the academics are lacking. Our averages are inflated beyond belief and a lot of the teachers roboticize the students when it comes to the lessons. I wouldn't approve of going to a school for academics where teachers specifically teach us as if we shouldn't think. There are a few diamonds in the rough but overall this school is subpar.", "What I like the most about Leon M. Goldstein is the amount of dedication to science and math that is in the school. However, as of late the school needs work in terms of better staff, teachers, supplies, and bathrooms. Certain teachers are great while others are horrible at teaching and don't connect very well with the students. What saves it is the opportunities it gives through college readiness from the College NOW courses and AP courses.", 'Best school out there. Top students, great teachers with high degrees, a lot of clubs and so much more. Rated as the number one school in Brooklyn. It truly is the one and only Goldstein High School. It is an equivalent alternative for Brooklyn Tech. A small school, where students can really be a community, unlike Tech.', 'Leon M. Goldstein High School for the Sciences is a great school that fosters a learning environment through its friendly and knowledgable staff, and passionate student population.', "I would like to see this school hire better teachers. I've had a few bad experiences with teachers who couldn't teach. I also think our school needs to be more diverse. The majority of the school is white.", "I've been at lmghs for the past two years and is a rising junior. Leon M. Goldstein is one of the best schools that I have been to. The students and teachers are kind and helpful.", "Goldstein is the best public high school in Brooklyn, without question, but there's a LOT of room for improvement. The student culture is very competitive and they thoroughly stress themselves out over APs and college, which leads to collective burnout, more often than not. Granted, most of the teachers are very good. They really want to see you do well and will help you understand. However, I struggled a lot during regents geometry, trig, and physics. Besides the academic portion, many clubs are terribly underfunded, especially the Science Olympiad one year -- absurd for a high school for the sciences! Every incoming year, too many students are given a faulty schedule which they must go through the process of getting corrected. I spent four years here and I can't say I miss it too much.", "It's a very nice school right next to the ocean. Nice building and rooms, and it is not crowded at all. There is roughly 250 for each grade. Lots of AP Courses and MOST of the teachers are great. It is not hard at all to have a good grade, more than half of the students my year had a 90+ GPA, myself having a 96. You meet a lot of nice people.", 'Everything was great apart from the diversity, in both the student body and the administrators/teachers. I also wish I was more prepared for college, in numerous ways.', 'Leon M. Goldstein High School is a school that is unlike all the others with a great education for the students and has teachers that are really great. A lot of competition, but it just motivates the students to do better work. Top school in New York. High recommend this school to anyone who is looking for a good school in New York.', "Not a terrible school, but also not the best.  It's very unorganized when it comes to the people running the school. If you're lucky and get the good teachers you'll have an alright experience (although most of the good teachers have retired). Watch out for snakes."]

It's very unorganized when it comes to the people running the school. If you're lucky and get the good teachers you'll have an alright experience (although most of the good teachers have retired). Watch out for snakes."]
column6: ['Good in terms that it is a small school, but that can also be at your disadvantage in terms of school culture.', "Student body is bland and offers little intellectual and cultural diversity. Few teachers are motivated to teach their subjects well and most rely on the student to search for help outside the school. Campus is safe and clean, has nice views. School's curriculum incorporates college-level courses and offers a good amount of courses for different interests.", 'This high school is good for math and science subjects. They are fairly challenging. The school is not very diverse, given the neighborhood it is in.', 'The school offers a wide range of AP courses for you to take, and the teachers overall are good for them. Regular classes are hit or miss. Campus is very safe. Would like to see more organization within the staff.', 'This school does an excellent job of preparing its students for college it provides many AP classes to its students in various subjects.', "I think that the caliber of the teachers in the science, social studies, and english departments are very good. However, the teachers in the lower level math classes aren't that good and the negative experiences tend to dissuade students from pursuing higher and harder math classes. Majority of the teachers are supportive and will take time out of their day to help any struggling student.", "Academically I was challenged and encouraged by my teachers. There is a lot of AP classes and College Now courses offered. They also have a lot of international school trips. The only thing I don't like about Goldstein is that it lacks diversity.", 'Leon M Goldstein was very nice school. The faculty were very caring and understanding, always trying to help the students as much as they can. Teachers were willing to stay after school and help a student out if needed. The only thing I would change is make the school a little more organized.', 'Leon M. Goldstein High School for the Sciences  has an outstanding History and English Department. However, there should be more variety in the courses offered to students, especially in the science department.', 'It is safe and clean but there sometime are issue with the bathrooms. Often the bathroom are either closed or damaged, like missing a toilet seat or it in general doesn’t flush. The food there is horrendous, but some times it could taste good depending on who is eating it but other time it really doesn’t matter who is eating it.', "Leon M. Goldstein is a very diverse school that makes sure that education is there number one priority. Most of the teachers and staff are very inclusive, and they make sure that everyone is learning at their own pace. The teachers always make sure that what they are teaching is understandable, and there is a large variety of extracurricular afterschool activities, as well as many choices of AP classes and electives. The schedule and hours of the days are very convenient, as well as the location, which is inside Kingbouro College Campus. The school is overall clean, and everybody feels safe. If you've are looking for a highschool to attend to, Leon M. Goldstein High School for the Sciences should be one of your top choices.", 'Though some issues popped up from time to time, it was the people in my classes and the teachers who made the Goldstein experience fun and productive. Because the school is smaller than most high schools in NYC, there is a tighter sense of community and this is what I felt in my experience.', 'Four years of my life have been devoted to vigorous studying for AP Chemistry, staying until five o’clock for leading Christian Club, and practicing in room 405 for Mr. Robertson’s instrumental club. While it is true that my school is relatively small (about 1100 students in total) I feel as though we are a family with so many diverse clubs and group studying sessions. I’m also incredible thankful for the fact that teachers would take time out of their lunch periods to tutor me on a concept that I didn’t quite understand in class. Overall, Goldstein is a very good institution with a balance of the academic and social life.', 'Was once a place welcoming of alternative learning styles and really working with the students. Today it has become a much more systematic competitive like all other top ranking schools, not so personal anymore', 'I transferred to Goldstein in my sophomore year with a interest in science(mostly medical). The school was okay, but it wasn’t how I expected a school names itself “for the sciences” to be like.', 'It is a pretty above average high school, but a few things could absolutely be better. Most facilities have to be taken care of better, but it is usually linked to Kingsborough C.C. and their job at keeping up our facilities (we are connected)', 'Leon M. Goldstein High School provided me with a fantastic academic education. The best feature about the school is the fact that there is a very large variety of classes offered to take. In each subject, there are several A.P. courses, electives, and college now courses available to students. Students also get to choose their schedules rather than having uninteresting classes forced upon them. Contrastingly, the school can work on extra-curricular activities and sports availability. Students faced a very difficult time trying to instill new sports teams for the school, and most attempts were unsuccessful. The blame would have to fall on the school’s administration in the case. However, there are no doubts that Goldstein has high potential to solve these problems in the future. More extra-curriculars and sports teams encourage students to be more involved in their schooling, and helps to improve grades in order to participate in these events.', 'This school is great for preparing students for the college environment as long as one is willing to study, work hard, and strive for good grades. The environment is relaxed, and the teachers are willing to help out if one asks for advice or any particular question. Although the learning environment is above average, club and extracurricular activities on campus need work - many clubs do not get the proper funding to carry out their full potential and school spirit seems to be lacking as compared to other high schools in the vicinity. On the other hand security guards are always ready to help at a moments notice, so the safety level is very high.', 'During my past 4 years, I have been given the opportunity for so many extracurriculars and so many opportunities. The staff is very helpful.', 'Leon M. Goldstein is a good learning environment. The teachers are knowledgeable and often willing to help students that are having a difficult time. However, there could be more done to promote diversity in the student body and faculty.']
column8: ['I like that Leon M. Goldstein High School for the Sciences is a safe, helpful community and it is located on a beautiful college campus. I did not give it 5 stars because I feel like they lack certain resources for students to apply to jobs/internships and are not very supportive in the college process for seniors.', "It's a great school. Generally, the teachers are good and students are offered a variety of electives and AP classes. The only thing that can be changed is how the school manages clubs. Most clubs only meet once or twice a month and don't get much done in that tome period.", 'This is a great school. I love it. I love the fact that they offer a wide variety of courses. Especially APs.', 'Safe campus, great school environment, and a large variety of classes and opportunities. LMG is full of great teachers who care about their students.', 'I like how the school offers lots of AP classes for students and the teachers there always motivate the students to do the best and take challenging courses. I would like the school to enhance their clubs participation and acquire more resources for students to study with.', "My experience at Goldstein is great. The staff and teachers help guide you all the way through. The school doesn't have metal detectors and college security making it a very safe environment to learn in.", 'The school was very supportive and definetly had the students best intrest in mind, but it seem as though they rather have the students go straight to college instead of trying to find different alternatives.', "Overall it's a nice school their can be changes made but it's not bad compared to other schools.Not much of diversity.The school lunch is nasty.Sports I tried joining a softball team but the principal said not enough funding.The people who work in the office give you an attitude and are lazy to help.The teachers are really nice and persuade u to do more than what they expect.We have more than 100 clubs so that's a lot to offer.The school make u do college now.Everyone is nice and not much conflicts are seen around the school.", 'I really enjoyed going to Goldstein, as the campus was nice and the majority of the teachers were good. There were many different clubs to join and you could easily make one of your own. Something that I would have loved that was not offered, was more language courses. They only offered Spanish and Italian at the time, while other top schools offer many other language classes.', 'Goldstein was filled with many different types of people, and the people themselves were interested in various fields, events and activities.  In every club there were always a lot of people who really enjoyed being with each other and enjoying what the club had to offer.  Sports teams were very competitive and I enjoyed being on a team which won a lot of games.  There were also many opportunities academic wise in every subject considering the small size of the school.  That being said, I only wish teachers had been more adamant about being more responsible and completing all assignments instead of inflating grades to circumvent that.I had the opportunity to be in two sports teams, several clubs of which two I was in the leadership, and take college level courses which I consider to be in on par with college courses I have taken.  This school is great for most students as long as they are willing to push themselves.', 'I lime the fact that there are many activities for the students to get involved in but i would like to see better teachers', 'Overall, my experience at Leon M. Goldstein is something that I wish I could re-live again. The school helped me with absolutely everything. From college now courses to AP courses, to the college application process, they aided me with all of the resources that I needed. The only downside for me was that out of the three guidance counselors the school had, I was placed with Ms. Mosconi-- the one who was always the least helpful.', 'Goldstein is a small school filled with amazing people with warm hearts and lots of memories. I loved how close my senior class was and this was only due to the fact that the school is so small. The teachers were able to pay more attention to each student individually.', "L.M.G.HS is not the most diverse of school, but it is a school full of intelligent minds, students chose from many AP classes including AP Biology, Calculus, Chemistry, Physics, World History, US Economy, and much more. Next year I will be a junior, and I've opted in to take AP Biology and Calculus AB. As far as extracurricular activities go, the school doesn't have the largest of variety, but there are interesting clubs and events going around all over the school, and students themselves are able to make their own afterschool clubs. And finally, the school even offers collage now classes for their juniors, and seniors.", "The experience i had at this school was terrible. The teachers don't help even though they see you struggle in class. I am a transfer from Rachel Carson high school and the school believes you know what's going on but in reality you need to figure it out yourself. They don't help you. They don't get involved all they care about is their academic grade.", "I loved having resources to further my education readily available to me. However it was very hard to get adjusted and feel comfortable in my first two years as the school isn't very diverse. I found myself looking for outlets to express my culture. One that didn't quite fit in with the status quo that had already been set before I attended the school.", "Great School! If you are willing to learn and do your assignments, it will prepare you for college. Teachers are patient and willing to go the extra mile for any dedicated student. Do not be afraid and ask any questions that come into your mind, they will be willing to answer.  Don't even get me start on describing the beauty of the school's campus. Since it is on KCC campus, the ambiance and security is top notch. You will definitely enjoy your four years there.", "Teachers can be a mixed bag. History and English teachers are fun, engaging and innovative and prepared me for college, while, the majority of Math and Science teachers fell short. The administration has some pearls but most are rocks. Counseling for both classes and college are mediocre. The school isn't very diverse. The school slashed it's arts program which used to be vibrant and colorful. It is in a beautiful building/campus and you feel really safe. It feels like a suburban school with the luxuries of New York City. At the end of the day, the school is what you make of it.", 'Leon M. Goldstein is a wonderful school where I feel comfortable being myself. I feel challenged in the academic realm and I feel the need to succeed within every aspect of the learning community. School activities bring every one together and it gives the school atmosphere a great place to make friends that share similar interests. This school is my home and the teachers are so involved and dedicated in making sure you are successful and even provide alternate measures if one is struggling. This school will forever hold a special place in my heart.', 'Great school with great teachers. Everyone is very friendly and it is very easy to get involved in clubs or other school activities']

column2: ['I am very lucky to have gone to Mahwah High School. Many others don’t have access to the quality education and resources available at my school. That being said, we are pushed very hard to achieve the best scores possible since we have such a good curriculum.', 'Mahwah high school supplied me with multiple avenues in which I could explore my abilities and create my future. With the hundreds of options of different academic courses with talented teaching staff gives you the opportunity to study what you want. The teachers that I have at Mahwah challenged me as a learner, making me work harder then I have in the past. Mahwah High School has done a great job preparing me for the future ahead.', 'I love this place, luv. The teachers here are the love of my life, luv. I love the sports and activities and I excell in math, luv. Women in STEM.', 'The majority of the teachers are very helpful and create a good learning environment. The students are mostly welcoming as well, and you will always feel safe in this school. In addition, the sports programs are great for anyone who wants to stay fit or keep playing sports in college.', "At Mahwah High School, I was involved in two different sports teams, several clubs, and excelled in my academics as well. This high school prepared me for college well. I was able to carry my study habits and desire for exceptional grades into my college experience and I found this trait to be monumental. Something I might change about Mahwah High School is the strictness of its' lack of extra credit oppotunities. While I am aware of the fact that the teachers at Mahwah High School are attempting to prepare students for all kinds of college experiences possible for every student, there is definitely room for at least a few extra credit opportunities to be provided. I have only completed one semester in college so far, yet I have had several opportunities to gain extra credit in just about each of my classes. This was something I had not been prepared for or used to having access to yet it made a huge difference in how my experience in each of my classes panned out.", "Mahwah High School was okay, I attended the school for my last two years of high school and I feel they really prepared me for college, especially academics wise. Most of the teachers/ staff are great, but there are definitely some people that make you wonder how they're still working there. The administration and guidance departments in particular really need some help. Overall, I'm glad I went to MHS because the generally the school helped me prepare to further my education, and be prepared to take on most of the things that get thrown at you in college.", 'It is a great school with great teachers and staff. It has a great atmosphere and is a place where any child will succeed.', 'I like the teachers at Mahwah they really care about your future.  Also, at Mahwah the teachers are always willing to help whenever you need it.', 'Mahwah is a strong high school academically and a great community of involved students.  Mahwah high school also offers a large amount of different clubs and activities, both educational and fun.  The course selection is varied and there are a good amount of honors and advanced placement classes that are offered.  Most of the teachers are really strong and all teachers are willing to help the students if they need extra help outside of class.  Safety and security of the students and the building is a top concern and Mahwah is very good about maintaining security and keeping parents informed if an incident occurs.', "A great dedicated staff of teachers, scores of non-sports activities guided by talented staff,  AP programs that produce results ( 4s and 5s on AP tests) and an atmosphere that facilitates dedication by students driven to excel while being conducive to an enjoyable and memorable student experience.  My daughter ended up with 9 AP 4s and 5s and should get her masters in 4 years.  Great acceptance rate last year at the nation's top 30 colleges and universities.", 'When I moved down to Mahwah, New Jersey, it opened a portal to a whole new learning environment. The staff really cares about their students education and push us and even me to do things I would have never wanted to know or learn.', 'Treatment of teachers by administration in general is pretty bad, but what else is new around here. Other than that, pretty great.', 'My experience as a Mahwah High School student is very fun and safe. In other words, the environment in Mahwah is very safe for many kids and the different activities make the high school a very fun place to be. Activities such as sports, the music program, and a variety of clubs, make Mahwah High School a very enjoyable place to be. Additionally, Mahwah High School does an extremely good job in preparing kids to go to college, and encountering the real world.', 'Mahwah HS is not the best high school when not preparing their Seniors for college. Their guidance counselors just don’t do their jobs correctly. Some teachers are great and others just should be better when teaching the course work to their students.', 'My experience at MHS was a very aspiring one. All the staff personnel were very friendly, and the guidance department did an outstanding job helping students with the college process and other topics the student body had trouble with. The one thing I would like to see change is the morning video announcements on Fridays. I wish for them to be more creatively put together and funny.', "It's a very good school, there are a lot of opportunities to be able to become a great student. There are so many sports and activities in which you can get involved.", "Mahwah High School, is a very good school, there is no arguing it. It is well funded, has good teachers, and the food is not terrible. Mahwah also isn't a poor community  and it is obvious the schools benefit from it. However the high school, middle school, and one of the elementary schools, are all located on the same road, screwing up arrival and departure times.", 'Mahwah High School is an okay school. Overall, the academics are challenging but a good amount of challenging as to prepare you for college and to push you to work harder and be the best you can be. The main problem I have with the school though is that it does not have a great guidance department and their treatment of transfer students is not great. Besides that it really is a great school with awesome teachers.', 'Mahwah High School was a great experience. Most of the teachers are nice and caring. They can give a lot of homework sometimes. Overall, high school was a good experience.', 'this school is a melting pot and I have made so many friends who I hope to carry with me on my journey through adulthood']

column6: ["Overall, I think the academics were pretty good. It would be nice if there was more diversity among the students, though. It's very cliquey.", 'The northern New Jersey school is average.  I think there are better high schools  with better educational funds in the surrounding area.  Some teachers are very good and make it their missions to improve the lives of their students, while some teachers spend time in the classroom insulting their students.  School budget seems to get cut frequently; Latin was cut out of the language program around the 2008 financial crisis, while the school built a new football field/track.  However, compared to some high schools in states with poor educational systems, students come out well prepared for college and life.', "For the most part, all students attending Mahwah High School are incredibly kind; the teachers as well. I'm very lucky that through all four years of attending, I've had the best teachers. By best, I mean it has been very easy to talk to them and they have all been extremely understanding. Some teachers, however, are not the best at teaching. The school is very safe, as Mahwah is a very safe town. Since I'm not a college student yet, I am unable to determine if they have helped me prepare for college, but a majority of students that have graduated seem to believe they have helped with college readiness.", 'Great education with many opportunities. Teaches you important life skills that I know will be very valuable in the future.', 'Mahwah is a great town. I have lived here since I was six and I have had great times and horrible times. But when it comes to the school it is a place where everyone is together. The classes, schedules, and free time between classes or off-campus study halls plays a big part in getting to see and know everyone at Mahwah. It has been my second home for the past four years and I am sad to leave it and the people I love but I’m excited to start new adventures and meet new people. Thanks to Mahwah, I learned who I was. Growing up I had troubles with friends a lot but there was always someone I could talk to if I ever needed. They taught me how to make new friends, which I can’t wait to do over the next four years at college, and even after that. Thanks to Mahwah, I will always know what good people and good education looks like.', 'I have had a great experience at Mahwah HS. Wonderful teachers and a great selection of courses. I have had the opportunity to take Honors and AP classes in all of my core subjects. In addition, in my Senior Year I have had the opportunity to tailor my schedule to my interests with great classes focusing on film and digital media.', "I made really close friends that I still hang out with after I graduated here. The education is good and you become very close friends with the teachers. The activities there are great too and it's a supporting school.", 'My experience at Mahwah High School was an overall positive one. Majority of the teachers there care about your academic success, and promote a positive attitude towards learning. The school is up to date as well.', 'Very clean, well equipped, progressive school. I moved to mahwah in 8th grade and went to the high school...since I have graduated, the school has added security cameras, more parking, and expanded the building. I believe mahwah to be a safe town and will be raising my family here.', 'Mahwah is great. Teachers are the most caring and incredible people I have ever met in my life. Their job does not end in the classroom and they do their best to support their students like family. The community of students is kind and welcoming and the academic program is rigorous yet managable. Not every school is perfect and the administration is stringent at times. That being said, the positives outweigh the negatives.', 'This school is one of the best in Bergen county. Many move to Mahwah for the school district and the High School trains students for college. Teachers are engaged, if the students are and are always willing to help', 'I loved the classes we were able to take that were not available in other schools. For example, senior year I took S.T.E.M Research, Engineering Mechanics, and Drafting. These classes were amazing and they pushed me to where I am today, a mechanical engineering major and I love it! These classes not only thought me a lot, but also inspired me and helped me decide what I wanted to do in my future. Because of these wonderful classes, I now feel ahead of the game in my mechanical engineering classes at NJIT. Thanks Mahwah!', 'I like the teachers of Mahwah High School; they are very dedicated to teaching their students. However, due to a contract dispute, they cannot perform their duties as well as they can. I would like to see this settled so that the teachers can get what they deserve for all that they do.', "Mahwah High School is a place where teachers make the extra effort for their students! Even when under contract negotiations, the teachers take the time (that they don't get paid for!) to help students do their best!", 'The level of a course correlates with the workload', 'The school is extremely diverse and has cliques', 'Teachers have little involvement in clubs', 'My favorite experiences come from the activities', 'The teachers genuinely care about the students', 'There are many clubs  to join, if you want to be active and "part of the school".']

column2: ["Eastchester was able to diagnose my daughter's learning disability and made a dramatic impact on her education. Before she started at Eastchester she was getting D's and C's. After working with the school administration, teachers, and special ed department, by her senior year she was getting A's and B's.", 'The teachers are very competent and nice and provide a great education for all students who want to learn.', 'Eastchester HS administration is good, teachers care for the most part.  Some Students are very involved and others not at all. Sports are a big deal and if your not in one, your kind of left  out.', "I enjoy going to EHS because there is a wide variety of things to involve yourself in. I play multiple sports for the high school but I know many people who are involved in the arts or both! EHS also offers many classes and most of the teachers are kind and willing to help you with whatever you need. Also, you never really experience the school until you've bought a cookie from the cafeteria.", 'My experience was relatively average. There needs to be more emphasis on college readiness or college alternatives for those who do not plan on going to a 2/4 year school.', 'Since I was a freshman I have loved Eastchester High School.. I was happy to have been given the opportunity to be in their film classes and after school activities.  I had fantastic teachers who helped me academically and prepared me for college', 'One thing that I enjoyed about Eastchester Senior High School was the diversity of people throughout the school. In many other schools, diversity could be a problem due to bullying/violence within the school and different grade levels. Its very easy for new students to adapt to a new/friendly environment.', 'I enjoy my time at Eastchester High School and feel that without attending there, I would not be the person I am today. The only change I would reccomend is that the staff and security keeps a better eye on their students.', 'This school needs to focus more on their arts department. This department is neglected which is unfortunate because there are so many talented students in that arena. It seems as though if you aren’t involved on a sports team then your club will not get any financial support.', 'The teachers really cared about their students and wanted to see them succeed and the range of advanced placement courses offered was really good.', 'Fantastic teachers who really care about your performance and well being in class. Also, currently remodeling a large portion of the building!', 'I have gone to Eastchester HighSchool for four years. The school isn’t very diverse but the academics and learning environments are great! The food is good and they are doing construction to expand the environment!', 'I feel as though I was given the best opportunity to attend the college of my choice. I was able to be involved in sports and clubs while maintaining acceptable grades in school. I felt like I could approach certain teachers about personal problems and always felt like I had someone to turn to for any sort of help.', "Eastchester High School houses a great staff and provides fantastic facilities that will help you achieve greatly in the future given you are motivated enough to utilize them to further your education. However, the administration generally does not cater to children' concerns and often stands by when instances of bullying or harassment, though rather rare, may occur. The majority of the school is Italian and Irish, with a few Asians.", 'eastchester high school is a great school as it prepares you for college and with many diverse students and clubs is a great learning environment', 'I had a great experience at Eastchester High school so far it had everything a student wants and is preparing me for a successful life.', 'I love how there are so many different activities for any kind of student to fit in. The teachers really engage in with their students to help them strive. The counselors are awesome, mine has helped me throughout so many difficult times. Although I like many aspects of the school, it is very clicky with friend groups and I would like to see everyone feel at the same level with eachother in the upcoming years.', 'Their cross country team was excellent. Every Friday before the race we had a pasta party to prepare with carbs. Good team effort and individual development. Science department had amazing teachers to prepare you for college classes. Moreover, art department was secretly a great place to learn, make friends, and to relax from studying. well supplied and full of opportunities for shows and internships.', 'Most of the teachers were very knowledgeable and helpful. Lots of different clubs and activities to choose from. The students are very cliquey and the building needs remodeling. Generally a positive experience.', 'Eastchester High School has been a truly wonderful experience. It has helped me grow as person by allowing me to be more outgoing and comfortable with myself. I grew to be more outgoing by participating in soccer and other clubs. It has been a truly great 4 years I will look fondly upon.']

I grew to be more outgoing by participating in soccer and other clubs. It has been a truly great 4 years I will look fondly upon.']
column6: ["Eastchester Senior High School was an overall good experience. Most teachers are super good and care about all of the students. However, there are a handful who are delusional and should  not be employed. When I finished my first semester of college recently, I realized I was very well prepared for college by this school. The culture and sports are incredibly good for a school that some years lack competitive teams. The safety has increased alot over the past five years. I have seen security put in place, new rules on guests, and more strictness on safety precautions. The biggest negative I would say about this school is the diversity. It's a ton of white itailian/irish kids, a  small group of spanish people, a small group of african american kids, and a small group of asian kids. One positive note is, there are no signs however of rascism ever coming into play as everyone is seen as equal.", "The teachers are great, and the courses are very interesting. The school is very technologically advanced, and it allows you to learn in a more in-depth and interesting way. You have fun while you learn, and it isn't boring. The food is also good, which is a plus. The athletic teams are great, along with modern facilities. The campus is a good size, and there are a plethora of after-school activities that you can do. Overall, Eastchester High School is a great school that will prepare you for life in a fun and interesting way.", 'I love EHS.I have come along way in 4 years.I am currently taking college classes,as a senior ,which I can transfer.My advisors have been unbelievable assisting me,in my college search .I have made many great friends,and learned so much .I have done stats for bball and involved myself with many different activities,I work with special need teens ,in the community,many whom are classmates.', 'Honestly a really good school. Everyone complains while they are in it because it is "so small" but a great community and great school. ', 'Players Club is lots of fun and really well run.', 'Lots of different activities (drama, music, sports) for all different interests.', 'In general, teachers are helpful and engaging.', 'This school was good, but I want to move on now.', 'Most kids get what the deserve if they act up.', 'We just got a new state of the art track and field', 'Most teachers do the very best they can.', 'Types of clubs vary and many students participate.', 'The school had helped me build my character in becoming more responsible and confident in who i am.', 'the timing of the buses are great.', 'Clubs make announcements every morning to let students know they are welcome and let them as well what they are up too.', 'The school can do a better job in exposing the students more to other cultures and real life examples.', 'The school makes announcements every morning about events and activities that students can get involved in. The school spirit is amazing and support our school events.', 'We have assembling in the beginning of the year to address the school code of conduct and who you can go to for help.', 'I think the teacher quality is great. There is definitely a variety in teaching styles but most of them are great. They are knowledgeable and resourceful. They are interested in the students and their grades and well being.', 'Some food in the cafeteria is better than others. There is a variety between healthy and unhealthy foods, and the prices are good. They have some special dietary accommodations but nothing major.']

column2: ['Hillsborough High School offers many different types of programs which is beneficial to its students. Many of the teachers are very good. They teach students in an efficient manner and do their best to help students comprehend the material at hand. Some downsides are the fees that were put in due to budget cuts which sometimes hinders students to participate in certain extracurricular or sports of their choosing.  In addition, the facilities are not the best as some things are broken and certain classrooms tend to be crowded due to budget cuts. Overall it is an above average environment and gives me ample learning opportunities.', 'I loved Hillsborough because it gave me the opportunity to explore who I am personally and academically. It gave me so many options to create myself and build my character.', 'Solid academics, but courses are typically very challenging. Teachers vary, some are great and some are poor.', "Although HHS is academically over the top, the culture of the school itself brings the rating down significantly. Hillsborough Township Public Schools District no longer has funds to do anything. You have to pay a significant amount of money to be in any clubs, to get bussing and to play sports. That is absurd!Overall, it can't be rated more than an average school.", 'I think Hillsborough High School is a very good school to attend.  Most of the teachers are great and the classes are fun.  One thing I really like is that I can build up a connection with most of my teachers as the school year progresses which I feel helps me get through the year and makes it more enjoyable.  The school also offers several fun dances, such as homecoming and prom, themed school football games, many sports, tons of clubs, and a fun night called spirit night where each of the four grades is teamed together against the other grades and tries to win in various activities of the night and throughout the year.  One thing I would change is that the district recently passed a referendum which cut a lot of spending.  This has made everything at the school super expensive.', 'Hillsborough High School has a lot of great educational programs and concentrations to help you think about a major for college, and there are some really nice teachers. The office policies are not very clear all the time and it can be difficult to get help when planning for college specifics. Other than that, this is a great school to attend.', 'Hillsborough High school is a very average school it has given me a good foundation to start at and I like the diversity it has although the building is not the nicest the employees are very nice.', 'This town is going down the drain. Overcrowding, teacher and budget cuts, athlete prioritization and awful food are some of the examples.', 'Some teachers were great and really made sure students understood the material, but a fair amount of teachers were could absolutely not have cared less about whether the students were responsive to their teaching methods.', 'Hillsborough High School offers many sports, clubs, and activities for different grades and interests. There are also lots of courses and electives available to further your education in specific subjects and possible majors students are interested in.', "Hillsborough High School is a place where you can do well if you're independent. Various learning styles are not explored and at no point did I feel that faculty was willing to reform teaching methods for those were incompatible with their styles of instruction. I fared well as somebody who can learn on her own but ultimately, there was minimal development in the way I learned and studied.", 'The experience at the High school was really nice. The curriculum was at a good pace. The counselors were very helpful with helping me get where I need to be. I wish there would have been more opportunities to do activities as a school.', 'HHS is a great place to complete your primary education. In general the main draw for HHS is the academics and well regarded faculty that allow you to learn.  Students who chose to take a large amount of honors or AP classes might find themselves stressed out as the difference between unweighted and honors and AP classes in terms of difficulty is immense due to the teachers teaching the higher level courses. This truly prepares you for college, and a friendly and helpful guidance staff makes the transition from apply to deciding on a college seamless. The school infrastructure is becoming dated and rooms with no heat or air conditioning is common. Lunch food is what you would expect, it is a good idea to bring your own lunch. Clubs are plentiful and there is no excuse to not have anything to do after school is over. The school also supports an NHS chapter which I was a part off and keep you involved.', 'I really enjoyed the opportunities I had to take honors and AP courses throughout my high school career, and I had many teachers that changed my education experience for the better.', 'I love Hillsborough High School! You meet people you never thought that you’ll meet plus theirs plenty of teachers that care for you. None of the guidance counselors want to see you fail. Everyone last one of my teachers pushed me to my best potential I don’t think I could’ve found anything else like that at any other school.', "The school itself has amazing teachers who really do care about their students and their education. However, like every place there are downsides. Sometimes the school wouldn't take action on a certain issue and there would still be ongoing issues months after.", 'I believe this school is good, but there are some areas that need improvement. I think more focus needs to be put on the individual student’s health and confidence as high school can have a lot factors influencing student’s lives.', 'I like meeting new people and being able to get chrome books for learning. There are a variety of classes and courses to take, which is nice. The school isn’t that big so it’s easy to find your way around. However, the food, bathrooms, locker rooms, heating and cooling, and cleanliness of the school is very poor compared to others. The teachers could be nicer and the curriculum kind of sucks. There also needs to be more of a variety of clubs and activities. I am also not a fan of the desks and chairs, because they are very uncomfortable and old.', "A lot of teachers really care about their student's well being, but the drug policies are too relaxed to make any real change to behaiviors. Also, there is currently a lot of overcrowding and scheduling issues.", 'Overall good and safe schoolStudent can learn a lot with good teachersBest cultureLots of extra curriculam activities']

column6: ['It is one of the best school I have ever attended throughout my school life. It had the best bully-free zone and the friendliest teachers in the world. They have very rigorous courses that help students challenge themselves and be prepared for college. I think by attending this school, I have been prepared for the outcomes of the future and to handle them in the best way possible. This school, also to mention, has many activities and clubs, including fun days and Spirit Night, to get students active, working, and include the fun factor.', 'It is an amazing school that will provide  an excellent education. Most of the teachers are really invested and knowledge in their subjects.', 'Our school is focused on getting kids to figure out their path in life. Everyone is going in a different direction, so our guidance counselors are focused to make sure we end up where we want to go.', 'It has good teachers and prepares you well for college if you are on the Honors and AP tracks. The CP courses do not have as good of teachers. In recent years the administration has gotten to be very strict and have zero-tolerance which is not always a good thing. They can sometimes judge on the appearance of a situation rather than taking into account every aspect.', "Hillsborough High School  was a good high school in many ways, however, there are numerous negatives associated with the school. To begin with, positives include the athletic's at Hillsborough High School were very competitive and the coaches for the sport  given us athletes many camps and personal training options.  The sport I pursued was wrestling, as Junior and Senior captain we went to numerous camps to help our team succeed. Furthermore,  Hillsborough High School teachers were very considerate and helped see you succeed. Although, they did not push me enough or prepare me enough for college,  which is an obvious negative. As I entered college I had pursued an AA degree in exploratory studies due to not knowing my major. I wish my high school helped students figure out possible majors before entering college.  My first year at my college I didn't do well in my academics.", 'Went through the IB program, and would only recomend it for a select group of people. IB IS A COLLEGE PREP COURSE, DOES NOT EARN MANY COLLEGE CREDITS!!!! Choose IB if your worried about how well you will do in college and want a transition period. IF YOU WANT COLLEGE CREDIT, DUAL ENROLL', "Overall, I had a pleasant experience during my time at Hillsborough High School. The school provides lots of opportunities for academic advancement but like any opportunity in life, it is up to the student to apply themselves accordingly to reap the reward they desire. One of the best decisions I made during my time at HHS was enrolling in AP Macro/Microeconomics. The grading structure and college-level workload of this class prepared me very well for college. In regards to the social environment, students form strong cliques and are slightly hesitant to include new kids in their groups. Don't be so obsessed with fitting in, be whoever you want to be and others will be attracted to your authenticity. Student culture popularizes mediocrity while teacher culture tries to bring out the best in students.", "Hillsborough, being one of the best towns to live in the USA, holds up to it's reputation with its education system. The teachers really care for their students and make it seem like you're not alone. Aside from the academics, there is always something to do at school; from clubs, to sports, all the way to school-wide pep rallies, its more of a task to do nothing when it comes to Hillsborough High School. 4 years is a long time to spend in one institution but the memories I've made there make me want to revisit the past sometimes.", 'Challenging workload at times, but ultimately a very good environment. Some teachers are awesome, some of the teachers aren’t great and can truly hurt your high school experience, but thats honestly the case anywhere. Definitely take advantage of all extra-curricular activities that sound interesting.', "I like HHS because it's a great place to learn.  The teachers are really involved and cooperative and make so many efforts to work with you to get you any extra help you need.  The atmosphere  is also good because people are really involved in clubs and sports as well as year/school wide activities such as Spirit Night.", 'I think Hillsborough High School is a very good diverse school. There are all types of people and many clubs and sports you can participate in. I would like to see different electives that would go into specified programs like nursing. Also some electives say one thing on the newspaper but the class itself is not what is said at all. Overall the school is not bad.', 'Hillsborough High School offers a quality education in almost every field. Most of the teachers I had were incredibly dedicated to helping students succeed, and extracurricular support was phenomenal. Hillsborough High School is also an innovative school, utilizing a 1:1 Chromebook Distribution program to help students become better equipped to succeed in a world that is becoming more reliant on technology.', 'Hillsborough is not my dream school, but it provided almost everything I needed and a few things I never knew I wanted. Most students and teachers are polite to one another and work together to make the school a wholesome learning environment. It says a lot that the thing I hate the most about the school is the apparent inability of students to go to class without causing massive traffic jams.', "There were very few teachers that I had that I didn't like. That being said, I was in a lot of AP Classes, so most of my teachers were competent. MOST. There were a few that were not the best teachers, but they were all very helpful and kind regardless.", "I've lived in various other states and in very different school systems, but Hillsborough Middle School and Hillsborough High School are absolutely amazing. Your teachers genuinely care about your education. In Middle School, our pod felt like a family, and at HHS, I can remember each of my teachers and smile. HHS also provides an array of opportunities in the form of electives and AP classes. If I had another year, I would take advantage of all of them: Mechanical Drawing, Medical Laboratory Techniques,  Computer Programming 2... Not to mention, the ease for students to create a club that doesn't already exist. I was able to create Future Medical Leaders of America in a month and have it running for the 2017-2018 school year. The opportunities are endless at HHS. I recommend anyone to attend this amazing school. I'm actually sad to be graduating this year, but I wouldn't have gotten a better education anywhere else.", 'My experience at Hillsborough High School has been very enjoyable throughout my whole high school career. The school makes it enjoyable with many school activities such as spirit night, when the grades compete against each other.', 'Hillsborough High School is a great school. There are variety of courses offered for students, the teachers are great, and the courses are rigorous which help with preparation for college classes. Also, there are many AP classes offered at the school. I would like the school to change the process of getting into a math and science course.', "Hillsborough is a great place to get your education and prepare for college. Courses are rigorous; there are a lot of great AP classes offered, and students are well prepared for college. Extracurricular are also great, with great athletics and arts. The only main issue is the school's funding priorities for extracurricular athletics. Hillsborough's swim and track teams consistently win state championships, and their arts programs are ranked among the best in the state. However, these programs are all strapped for money, which is funneled instead into the struggling football program. Hillsborough needs to fix its funding priorities.", 'Hillsborough High School has a decent reputation. Things that I would like to fix are the food from the cafeteria, activities during gym class, and additions of new electives.', 'Most Teachers were very helpful.  The biggest issue is that the school is overcrowded.  It is so difficult to move from class to class because you often need to walk a great distance between wings.  The school is very old.  The administration does its best to make it look and feel more appealing.']

The biggest issue is that the school is overcrowded.  It is so difficult to move from class to class because you often need to walk a great distance between wings.  The school is very old.  The administration does its best to make it look and feel more appealing.']

column2: ["The amount of cheating going on in this school is rampant. Almost everyone cheats or gets answers from a group chat or something. It's ridiculous and needs to stop. Some of the classrooms are in complete dishevel. You can see paint peeling off and disgusting radiators. When this school gets grants from the State, it's usually to fund their athletics program. Sometimes (once in a blue moon), they will actually improve their academics, but the spending habits of the school board baffles me. The teachers are indifferent and the students are egotistical, arrogant, and just plain rude.", 'Bridgewater Raritan High School was an amazing school with nice teachers who cared about their students and the principals were always there to support any major problems in our school.', 'Amazing school. Very big with a student body of about 3000. The teachers really care about their students. A main issue is the administration and availability of resources for students.', 'I love the diversity of both the students and the teachers at BRHS. All of the teachers are nice and they all want their students to succeed. The teachers come up with very fun and imaginative ways to help students learn and remember the information they are taught, whether that is through online games, like Quizlet or Kahoot, Jeopardy, or other review games. I also love that there has been a big push to allow students to learn the material on their own and in their way so that the teacher is not just lecturing the class day in and day out. The students are expected to learn the material and find answers for themselves to prepare them for the working world.', 'My experience at Bridgewater Raritan High School was a very positive one in terms of academics, extracurriculars, and friendships. The school has a big variety of different elective classes which allow students to explore one’s passion and lots of clubs for students to earn volunteer hours. The teachers and staff are very friendly and approachable for extra help and as a friend.', 'High school teachers is good, specially AP teachers, who are very professional.The school has good academy courses to meet student need.', 'Bridgewater Raritan High School has one of the impressive public educations that is offered in the state of New Jersey. The school is very diverse from a racial and intellectual standpoint. However, this does not force promising students to have compromised educations. Those in the honors and AP tracks obtain an exquisite learning experience. From the history classes which force students to reexamine notions which are taken for granted to the Science classes which require critical thinking repeatedly, Bridgewater Raritan High School offers an ideal learning experience which forces students to think, preparing them for their future in the real world.', 'We have great opportunities compared to many other schools, but due to the size of our school the competition is ridiculous and teachers tend to not be very personable.', "It's a great school with amazing music programs and teachers. The music programs make the school so much more bearable.", 'Although the high school is a California Style school, it is very easy to manage. The set up f campus helps the kids get ready for a college campus. The teachers have been very helpful and available for extra help. The sports at ever level are extremely talented and ranked high in the state.', 'I am graduating BRHS this year and I have to say it has been my best school experience yet! I came from NY to NJ and Bridgewater High School has made me feel at home. Everyone is very sweet and the teachers really care about your grades and what they can do to help you succeed. The school is very into sports and after school activities and it makes the school year so much fun.', 'I loved being at BRHS, I had an amazing time there especially in the choir and music programs. There is a reason why our high school is renowned for music, we have competed nationally and gotten within the top 20 of the nation. Many students at this high school learn at such a high level that they often come into college with more than 10 credits if they try, and I was very ready for college when I left.', 'Terrible school. Coaches are terrible. They don’t know how to use talent. They aren’t  qualified to coach. Teacher don’t care for student some do. Most don’t care. There iep program is terrible. They self  diagnose my son and hurt him in school very bad.', "In general, staff and students are friendly. It has an extremely diverse student class with people of all backgrounds. There are a ton of classes to pick from-genetics to woodshop to AP studio art to family and child classes. There are a ton of clubs and tons of opportunities for getting involved in athletics, music, and other extracurriculars. The teachers vary a lot. Some teachers are amazing and will work extremely hard for their students to succeed while some are the opposite-they don't care one bit about how their students do. The food is mediocre at best.", 'I liked Bridgewater High School, it was a good experience and the teachers educate well. It is in a relatively safe location and it is extremely large. I would like to see the time between classes increase, though, so that there is time to walk out of each building and run to the next class.', 'I have liked most of my teachers here although some were either rude or crazy. The California- style campus is enjoyable in the spring and on nice, sunny days but, it is not pleasant during the winter months or when it is raining outside. At first the school looks quite intimidating due to its size but, it is very easy to navigate after a couple of days. Being apart of a sports team is very enjoyable and has been a highlight during my time at the school.', 'It was a great experience.  Teacher were caring.  Sports programs were excellent.  I enjoyed the industrial arts classes the most.  The German teacher was top notch.', "My experience was okay. Academics are taken very seriously, which is a pro of the school. Very successful in sports. Very large school with huge student population. I didn't feel welcomed when coming back as an alum.", 'I was able to experience what is it truly like to be proud of something. Playing sports for the school has allowed me to play for something greater, and win for the right reasons. The values I learned along the way will stick with me for life', 'This school gives many opportunities and prepares you well for college. However, this results in a stressful atmosphere in which certain students are centered only on grades. Regardless, most teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. You are bound to find your place in this large school.']
