column8: ['I enjoyed my time here at Bridgewater Raritan High School. All of the teachers were very kind and understanding people and I was always connected with them. The counselors are always open and available to talk to whenever you needed them. The material taught in class was always easy to learn and fun to learn. There are security guards that patrol the school to make sure all of the students are safe. The only thing I would change is that I would make the school lunches healthier and the bathrooms cleaner. Otherwise I had a great experience here.', 'I consider myself privileged to attend Bridgewater Raritan High School. I took for granted the amazing opportunities that the school offered in every department, and I regret it now. Being in college, I see a lot of different types of students from all over the state, and to see the difference of the quality of students is amazing. I feel BRHS truly prepared me for the high-pace and vigorous course-style of college.', "If you're a high achiever, then BRHS offers a very comprehensive education for a public school. AP courses abound, usually with teachers who know what they're teaching, and students are generally encouraged to at least try out an AP course. As of this year, only the AP Biology course is a little suspect, as the teacher reportedly does not know how to teach. If you go into AP Bio, be prepared to self-study a lot.", 'Would like school to offer courses on African American history. Have teachers that have experience in dealing /teaching more diverse students with different points of view.', 'As a student, teachers are the most important feature of a school.  Unfortunately many teachers are not the best teachers.  For me, I was able to have those teachers that were actually good at teaching.  Many of my friends did not have the same opportunities as I had.  The open campus is strange for a school in the middle of New Jersey.  The administration leaves no room for any slip up by students or any changes to the school that they do not approve.  The attendance policy is absurd.', 'Great school. Good programs including AP courses. Good teachers. Large selection of after-school activities and sports. Mostly good kids. However some disobedient kids need to be disciplined.  Smoking on school campus is unacceptable. This punk kid Jerry Vogel was seen smoking cigarettes next to the cafeteria building everyday. The school needs to take strict actions on this kind of behavior.', 'Since BRHS has a very diverse community, there is a great amount of respect and recognition of other cultures from both faculty and students. I am grateful that I have attended this high school because of the tougher curriculum and passionate teachers.  ', "This school is very large and I've made many friends because of it because the classes are always a mix of different people. There's many heavy, main courses but also a myriad of fun extracurricular classes and the requirements for graduation at this school make it easy to meet college requirements without having to worry about it since freshman year. The most unique thing about this school is the way it's laid out. Classes are grouped by subject into buildings and we have 10 different buildings, similar to a college campus.", 'Teachers are generally ok. The issue is that very few can teach effectively. Some of the AP teachers are very educated but they lack the skills to pass on that education. Most teachers enjoy their subject. They tend to be consistant throughout the year but grading varies from teacher to teacher. Most go different routes in their teaching.', 'The extracirriculars at BRHS are of the highest standard. There is a club and activity for everyone, and enthusiastic and helpful teachers and student leaders at the head of these clubs. Everyone can fit in when they find the club of their choosing.', "I have really enjoyed by 3 years here at Bridgewater Raritan. I like the teaching staff and I've made great connections with a few teachers that have really extended beyond teacher into more of a mentor figure. I love sports at BRHS, I'm president of the varsity club and a captain of the swim team and I love how strong our school is in other sports, winning at least one state title in any given sport per year. There are lots of people at this school and they're in the most part friendly and willing to talk or be friends with anyone willing to to reciprocate kindness. There are so many opportunities for clubs as well at BRHS, and an activity for any person imaginable. People are passionate about their extracurriculars here and that shows in our school's success in various fields.", 'Teachers at BRHS are generally very knowledgeable and successful at allowing students to have a good grasp on the material. Obviously not every single teacher is the best of the best but I feel that as a whole, the teaching staff is excellent, one of the best in New Jersey and will help you have a successful time in their class if you are willing to put in the effort. Most of the teachers I have had really respect hard workers and will devote a lot of their time to helping you if they see you putting in effort, even if you struggle with the material. In general, the teachers are approachable, helpful, and competent at Bridgewater-Raritan High School.', 'Lots of ways to get involved! The sports are awesome, we have almost every sport. Lots of clubs for all interests, hobbies, languages, etc. there are also many ways to do community service in clubs. The clubs can make a well rounded student.', "The school has a high standard it likes to meet. I have learned a lot and met a large variety of people here that I won't forget. After all, it is high school so it is going to be a roller coaster of feelings throughout the years. It is definitely easy to adjust from middle school to here. I think Bridgewater is one of the best high schools in Central Jersey. We have so much to offer and you get a great wel rounded experience here.", 'Majority of the teachers are super nice and very helpful. Teachers are definitely knowledgable about their subjects, but all of them have different teaching styles and interaction with their students. A large variety is present. But there is definitely a "top teacher" in each department', "Bridgewater-Raritan High School is an incredible school, I've had many great experiences by meeting new people and making friends. I would chose to go to this school again because their program is great and there are a bunch of opportunities.", 'The teachers are very helpful and help students when they are struggling', 'A lot of students in our school participate in Key Club. These participants go out into the community and volunteer at various places such as hospitals, nursing homes, and animal shelters. Being a part of Key Club is a rewarding experience because I get to help those around me in need.', 'This is a very large school, so there is an opportunity for every student to participate in a large variety of extracurricular activities. My favorite activity is the Future Health Leaders of America club, in which we raise money for a charity every year, and we educate our peers and our community about the health field and healthy lifestyles.', 'The teachers at this school are very knowledgeable about the subjects that they teach. The science department is very good. Most teachers have a high degree in science. These science teachers teach more than the curriculum says to teach. For example, in my microbiology class, I not only learned about the various microbes and pathogens, but I also learned about how to do some advanced laboratory techniques that were not in the curriculum, such as performing a transduction.']

column2: ['Great school with a lot of freedom. Great teachers who offer lots of help to students. Has a high average GPA in comparison to many other public schools. Would definitely recommend.', 'I have loved my teachers at Calhoun and the ability to have choices in class selection.  I am able to choose some AP classes, some regular level classes, and some college level classes.', 'this was kinda g but also kinda cringe if u catch my drift. this was kinda g but also kinda cringe if u catch my drift. this was kinda g but also kinda cringe if u catch my drift.', 'Calhoun fosters a very accepting atmosphere.  All students regardless of abilities, backgrounds, interests and idiosyncrasies are welcomed and accepted by others.  The Theater and Arts program has made all my dreams come true.  My well rounded education is comprised of challenging academics, forming amazing relationships with peers, and opportunities to develop my craft through Music and Theater programs.', 'Calhoun was great! There are so many classes to choose from and so many helpful advisors and teachers to help you along the way. Awesome academics and activities', 'Calhoun is a pretty good High School in Merrick, New York. It has great art programs and a really good theater program known as On Tour. Most of the staff is helpful and good teachers, although there can be some teachers who don’t teach or aren’t as nice/ good at teaching. It offers many programs and clubs and you could always create your own club, but it is still also lacking in some areas such as film.', 'Both my children went to Calhoun and each had different interest, one in Theatre, one in Sports.  Calhoun equally supports the Arts programs as they do the Sports programs.  And the academics are even stronger!  Principal Nicole Hollings is the heart and soul of Calhoun!', 'The community at Calhoun is very warm and inviting. Everyone is committed to Calhoun, whether is be through sports or clubs or music. School spirit is undeniable at Calhoun, everyone has a Calhoun shirt on any day of the week.', 'Good high school, lots of activities good teachers. I love this high school and hope my kids will go here some day', 'I would like to see a better guidance department and a better informed student populace. There was too much of an emphasis on buzzwords like "safe spaces" "individuality" and feelings. However, there were great programs for drama and science research.', 'The students and teachers there were so much nicer than my last school, Sachem North. Everyone seemed to care about each other.', 'I would like to see more AP courses available. Also guidance counselors push students to take certain classes which is nice, but they push too far sometimes.', "I love all the teachers there. They really care about you not just as a student but as a person. The administration could handle things better in terms of bullying, sexual harassment and things of that nature. There's not much diversity which can cause problems and while Calhoun says they're open minded in terms of things related to the LGBTQA+ Community the administration has a long way to go in relation to being accommodating and giving equal treatment to those students. But hey, they have a good performing arts program though right?", 'My time at Calhoun HS will be one I will never forget. I have learned so much. With the help and guidance of my parents and the faculty I have matured so much academically and personally. I have participated in varsity soccer, varsity badminton, DECA and written for the school newspaper. These wonderful experiences I will take with me for a lifetime. Some of the classes I have taken were very challenging, I have learned to how to study better and organize better so that I was able to meet these challenges. Thanks to my time at Calhoun HS I feel that I am prepared for the next phase of my life. I am looking forward to going to college and experiencing all that it has to offer.', 'Being a part of the Sanford H. Calhoun environment has been fantastic. The arts program here is amazing. The willingness of the administration to accept a music program like the one that we have here is just unbelievable. For me the only real problem that l’ve  faced in Calhoun is the lack of diversity and coming together. Yes, we have clubs that bring people with different ethnicities together ,but we always confine ourselves to our own friend groups and people with similar ethnicities. The special education program here in Calhoun is amazing. Kids with special needs are integrated into regular classes so they don’t feel unwanted and they have so many activities to play after school. We also participate in the Bellmore-merrick challenge which gives children with disabilities the opportunity, to pair up with a typical developing same aged peer, and participate in fun filled learning activities.', "I would have gone to Mepham but I got into the On Tour program and I'm so glad I'm at Calhoun! It is the most accepting and friendly school in the whole Bellmore-Merrick district. Everyone is so passionate about what they do. The teachers are great, the guidance counselors are the most helpful people, and the atmosphere of the school is like no other.", "It's okay a lot of undercover drug usage but nothing too hardcore. The school should look into improving the quality of it's special ed department since it is very lacking, the same goes for their staff that are supposed to help the students such as guidance counselors and psychologists.", 'I loved the effort done by the principal and assistant principal in insuring that despite having to follow the rules, everyone is enjoying their experience. There’s so many teachers in Calhoun that care so much about their students and are willing to stay late at extra help and host review sessions just to go above and beyond in assisting people learn who learn at different paces. If I could critique one thing it would be that there should be more classes on learning a trade. Besides the main classes in science, math, etc. there should be more encouragement on elective classes that might have more of a correlation to careers for some students who aren’t so interested in the main subjects. This school has taught me so much academically and in life and there’s going to be so much that I carry with me into my future. Tomorrow is my last day and I am going to cherish every moment before I count down my last minutes of high school.', "Very accepting of everyone! Great balance of support for athletics and arts. The security has been updated and we have around 10 security guards. We have security cameras rolling all the time. The food isn't too good though- moderate.", "This high school lives up to its reputation of academic excellence and spirit. There is something for people of any interest to be involved in. Additionally, I've encountered many teachers with personalities and work ethics to look up to. I graduated in June 2017, and one thing I'd like to address is the lack of diversity in this predominantly white high school. I was the ONLY black person in my class and you could imagine how this extreme fact could have influenced exclusion and uncomfortable situations on my behalf. I think because many of the students have minimal encounters with people of color, they are more comfortable with passive aggressive racism, many are racist explicitly."]

Calhoun equally supports the Arts programs as they do the Sports programs.  And the academics are even stronger!  Principal Nicole Hollings is the heart and soul of Calhoun!', 'The community at Calhoun is very warm and inviting. Everyone is committed to Calhoun, whether is be through sports or clubs or music. School spirit is undeniable at Calhoun, everyone has a Calhoun shirt on any day of the week.', 'Good high school, lots of activities good teachers. I love this high school and hope my kids will go here some day', 'I would like to see a better guidance department and a better informed student populace. There was too much of an emphasis on buzzwords like "safe spaces" "individuality" and feelings. However, there were great programs for drama and science research.', 'The students and teachers there were so much nicer than my last school, Sachem North. Everyone seemed to care about each other.', 'I would like to see more AP courses available. Also guidance counselors push students to take certain classes which is nice, but they push too far sometimes.', "I love all the teachers there. They really care about you not just as a student but as a person. The administration could handle things better in terms of bullying, sexual harassment and things of that nature. There's not much diversity which can cause problems and while Calhoun says they're open minded in terms of things related to the LGBTQA+ Community the administration has a long way to go in relation to being accommodating and giving equal treatment to those students. But hey, they have a good performing arts program though right?", 'My time at Calhoun HS will be one I will never forget. I have learned so much. With the help and guidance of my parents and the faculty I have matured so much academically and personally. I have participated in varsity soccer, varsity badminton, DECA and written for the school newspaper. These wonderful experiences I will take with me for a lifetime. Some of the classes I have taken were very challenging, I have learned to how to study better and organize better so that I was able to meet these challenges. Thanks to my time at Calhoun HS I feel that I am prepared for the next phase of my life. I am looking forward to going to college and experiencing all that it has to offer.', 'Being a part of the Sanford H. Calhoun environment has been fantastic. The arts program here is amazing. The willingness of the administration to accept a music program like the one that we have here is just unbelievable. For me the only real problem that l’ve  faced in Calhoun is the lack of diversity and coming together. Yes, we have clubs that bring people with different ethnicities together ,but we always confine ourselves to our own friend groups and people with similar ethnicities. The special education program here in Calhoun is amazing. Kids with special needs are integrated into regular classes so they don’t feel unwanted and they have so many activities to play after school. We also participate in the Bellmore-merrick challenge which gives children with disabilities the opportunity, to pair up with a typical developing same aged peer, and participate in fun filled learning activities.', "I would have gone to Mepham but I got into the On Tour program and I'm so glad I'm at Calhoun! It is the most accepting and friendly school in the whole Bellmore-Merrick district. Everyone is so passionate about what they do. The teachers are great, the guidance counselors are the most helpful people, and the atmosphere of the school is like no other.", "It's okay a lot of undercover drug usage but nothing too hardcore. The school should look into improving the quality of it's special ed department since it is very lacking, the same goes for their staff that are supposed to help the students such as guidance counselors and psychologists.", 'I loved the effort done by the principal and assistant principal in insuring that despite having to follow the rules, everyone is enjoying their experience. There’s so many teachers in Calhoun that care so much about their students and are willing to stay late at extra help and host review sessions just to go above and beyond in assisting people learn who learn at different paces. If I could critique one thing it would be that there should be more classes on learning a trade. Besides the main classes in science, math, etc. there should be more encouragement on elective classes that might have more of a correlation to careers for some students who aren’t so interested in the main subjects. This school has taught me so much academically and in life and there’s going to be so much that I carry with me into my future. Tomorrow is my last day and I am going to cherish every moment before I count down my last minutes of high school.', "Very accepting of everyone! Great balance of support for athletics and arts. The security has been updated and we have around 10 security guards. We have security cameras rolling all the time. The food isn't too good though- moderate.", "This high school lives up to its reputation of academic excellence and spirit. There is something for people of any interest to be involved in. Additionally, I've encountered many teachers with personalities and work ethics to look up to. I graduated in June 2017, and one thing I'd like to address is the lack of diversity in this predominantly white high school. I was the ONLY black person in my class and you could imagine how this extreme fact could have influenced exclusion and uncomfortable situations on my behalf. I think because many of the students have minimal encounters with people of color, they are more comfortable with passive aggressive racism, many are racist explicitly."]
column6: ['Sanford H Calhoun High school is located in Merrick NY. Calhoun has great academics, sports and spirit. The staff of Calhoun is remarkably useful', 'Throughout my 4 years spent at Calhoun I have noticed many great things ranging from superior sports teams to many involving clubs. I loved my time spent here and will miss all the relationships I had made.', 'It is a great school with great people, great activities, great places to learn about all different topics, great guidance department, and great all around structure of development and language.', 'Sanford H. Calhoun is great high school.  It is very open to everyone and everything with many different, great opportunities.', 'Calhoun is a great high school with lots of talent within the music and sports departments.  The teachers are great and the administration is great as well.', 'Excellent school with a lot of opportunities.  I feel well prepared for college. Guidance could be a little more involved in college search process. Teachers were great for the most part. Always available if needed. Coaches were excellent and really care about the players.', "While I've only gone to Calhoun for my Junior and Senior years, it was much better than my previous school. The students were much nicer and willing to include new people. Almost every teacher I've had both years were fantastic.", 'The school is overall amazing. It is so safe and the staff is so caring towards their students and peers. They have various security guards in the hallways if you need assistance which is an amazing factor to include in the school.', 'The school culture and environment is really an incredible thing. I loved coming here everyday and being involved. At Calhoun being involved was fun AND cool- the best combination. Such a welcoming community.', 'Great school community in a great area, lots of different groups and ways to get involved, supportive environment, awesome teachers and good curriculum to prepare for college', 'Calhoun is an exceptional school where students have the opportunity to delve deep into any topic that interests them.', 'As a senior at Calhoun High School who already knows where I  am going to college, I have been able to reflect back on my four year experience. While I did not participate much my freshman year by only playing one sport, I grew more attached to the school after sophomore year. I never had a serious problem with any teacher or administrator, and felt Calhoun really prepared me for my college process!', "This school has good academic and artistic opportunities, such as ASR and On Tour. People are generally okay and there's a lot of good classes to choose from once you're an upperclassman.", 'No matter what the issue, there was always someone there to be able to help me situate it. I always felt included in whatever was going on. Teachers are understandable and work with you to see you do your best.', "Calhoun is a great school with so many opportunities. I am doing senior experience this year which is awesome. The only negative would be the food. It's not very good", 'My experience at Calhoun has been and exciting journey. Never had I had so many exciting experiences to reminisce on. The environment is friendly and excepting, except of the occasional hiccups in our system. But overall this school has made me more efficient in how to survive in my later life, and dream big (especially the art department). The one major criticism I have is to be more strict on the regular language department. Constantly I feel like my teachers are uninformed on how to communicate and actually teach the information proficiently. Maybe that review is a little harsh, but in order to improve one must actually evaluate and work on the advice they see.', "Great school, really prepares its' students for college. Very inclusive student body, there's a place for everybody. Teachers and Guidance Counselors are terrific for the most part. I've been very impressed.", 'Calhoun has had the greatest influence on my development as a student and a person. The support of the administration, the extracurricular opportunities available, the great course selection, and the dedicated support of the teachers allowed me to unlock my potential. Additionally, the atmosphere in Calhoun is unparalleled to that of other high schools I have heard about or been in. Everybody is immensely supportive; from my experience, I have known several people who were very comfortable with their ability to express themselves in whatever way pleased them. Race, socioeconomic status, gender identity, familial background, and material possessions have NO influence over how students and teachers think of one another. It is truly a place that fosters camaraderie and cooperation. If I were to change one thing about Calhoun, it would be increasing the unity between Calhoun and the other schools in our district.', 'Our school has a great student body, caring teachers and an overall great school.  Our school does so much for the community in terms of fund raisers and drives to assistant the less fortunate in our surrounding areas.  The education standard is very high and we are well prepared for college.  My high school career has been very rewarding.', 'Calhoun High School is a special place.  I have never seen kids so involved in sports, clubs, activities, etc.  Just about everyone can find something they love and excel at.  This school also includes special needs children in with regular students which really makes the kids understand what these kids go through and the challenges they have with learning.  Calhoun also has a very involved principal who knows exactly what is going on with the kids.  If there is a secret meeting place where kids are planning to meet at night, the principal will email the parents and let them know what is going on.  She tells the kids what the dangers are and how this can affect their record if they get caught doing something illegal.  They have a great security team at the school. Additionally, they help kids prepare for college in many ways with the excellent guidance teams.']

column2: ['Fairfield Ludlowe is an amazing school. I transferred to Ludlowe during the middle of sophomore year of high school. During my transition, teachers were very helpful making it a smooth transition for me. It has  an amazing education system and wonderful, helpful teachers.I found friends very quickly there since everyone was very friendly. Ludlowe has a lot to offer and overall it’s a great high school!', 'My experience at FLHS has been great! The teachers are very knowledgeable and provide a great deal of knowledge to us students. They offer extra help before and after school to make sure we have all of the resources we need to succeed. The administration is very helpful, always there to support us in everything - classes, clubs, extracurricular activities and sports. They also bring in speakers that share their life experiences and help us make better choices now so we are prepared for our futures. FLHS also has a pretty competitive sports program and I have enjoyed playing soccer and lacrosse throughout my high school career  I feel I have received a well-rounded education here that has prepared me for college and beyond.', 'With many strengths such as resourceful teachers. The teachers at Fairfield Ludlowe truly do care about their students and want to see them succeed. With offerings for things such as extra help, a student at Ludlowe is able to get any extra academic help in any topic they need. No teacher at Ludlowe wants to see their students fall behind and will put in the extra effort to make sure they don’t.The hudge selection of academics to choose from is yet another reason Ludlowe his an excellent school. With many different classes to choose from students at Ludlowe are sure to find their passion in life. Examples include classes such as Human Anatomy or Chemistry of Medicine for those interested in the medical field to Early Childhood classes that teach the future teachers of America.These are only two reasons why Ludlowe is an outstanding school, but they are why Ludlowe stands out to me.', "Fairfield Ludlowe High School has a great positive atmosphere.  I am interested in Fashion marketing and was able to take this class and get a feel if this is what I want to pursue in college.  There is a whole department devoted to Fashion design, marketing, and business.  We also get to do internships our senior year which was very instrumental.  Overall it's a great school and a positive place to learn.", 'The teachers are really nice and approachable.  Ludlowe is an incredibly rewarding place for students who are possessed with a drive for academic excellence.  However there are some teachers who are not as good.  Overall i have loved my experience here.', "Ludlowe is an incredibly rewarding place for students who are possessed with a drive for academic excellence, though tends to fall short at ensuring the extracurricular involvement of its' students.", 'School is very academic but many unmotivated and miserable teachers. Also they need more college readiness starting junior year and also no resources for therapy or help with problems as the counselors tattle and Tim the drug counselor is always busy.', 'The teachers at FLHS are well trained and care about the students. Almost everyone goes to a good college, and it all goes back to the educational system provided by the school.', "Fairfield Ludlowe High school has a lot of qualities that I think a lot of students take for granted. The majority of the teachers are passionate and very qualified for their jobs, we have resources available to the music and art department (like 3D printers!) that we're extrememly lucky to have, and we have a principal that is amazing and does his best to ensure the school is really serving the students in the best possible way.", "My overall experience at Ludlowe was amazing.  Its a great school with great teachers and I made a lot of friends.  The school itself is very up to date and extremely clean.  The only thing I wish they would change is the parking situation.  We have to pay to park and sometimes even the seniors don't have a spot because the spaces are so limited.  When we park in the surrounding area the neighbors complain and we get parking tickets from the police.  Other than that one issues the school itself is amazing!!!", 'Great programs for sports and other activities. This high school has so many great opportunities to offer.', 'I have had a memorable experience at Fairfield Ludlowe High School. I have developed great relationships with teachers who have taught me so much about academic subjects and life skills.', 'My High School years have been excellent. we have a wonderful staff and welcoming environment. Respect is shown in this school.', 'I have loved all four years I have been at Fairfield ludlowe High School. During my time here I was involved in many sports teams, clubs, and other after school activities. The staff here is awesome from teachers to counselors and even the janitorial staff; they are all amazing.', 'The school system at Ludlowe is phenomenal. They have great teachers and incredible athletics. Past students have stated that Ludlowe has made them extremely prepared for college.', "In general, the teachers are incredibly supportive and passionate about what they're teaching. Honors and AP classes are challenging but there are classes for all levels. Pretty good community feel. Students definitely don't have the most full world view though; located in quite a privileged community.", 'I had the best four years at Ludlowe. I worked hard and turned my grades around. I have also been on the football team as well as track and field for 4 years as well as involved in club activities', 'I really enjoyed my time at Ludlowe. I made friendships with many different people, but there were also many cliques since it was high school. They were also very strict on the administrative side about random rules.', 'I had the best experience at Ludlowe. From the academics, structure, and social events they offer a lot of oppoturinity and support for students.', 'Ludlowe for me was great. Everything about the school is pretty good, one thing that’s awesome that I loved about it was that all the kids aren’t that diffent from each other and fitting in was no problem, I did have some few teachers who’s expectations were a bit too high but I mean I can’t complain to much. The friends I have make the school 100% better and the community is dope, we’re all close and we try to help out kids we see that don’t allways feel like they fit in. Also Playing lacrosse and soccer for ludlowe was the best thing I could have done because we kick ass most the time but also because I feel like we’re a family.']

column6: ['FLHS has offered resources that I have taken advantage of in order to prepare myself for college. Some teachers may be better than others, but the ones that truly care make the bad ones worth it. I would also give the school a 0/10 in diversity. The school needs to try to educate its students so that they are comfortable with people who are different than them.', "Overall, my experience with Fairfield Ludlow High School was really good in the academic aspect. We had really good resources, facilities, and programs. Outside of the academics, the diversity lacked; and the out reach program to those who were diverse was poor. However, I didn't mind this much because my main focus was obtaining great education.", 'Fairfield Ludlowe High School is a wonderful school, I love it.  I am entering my senior year and it has been quite a rollercoaster. Most teachers are awesome and everyone is always willing to help you get by.', "Fairfield Ludlowe High School was a school that definitely prepared me for college, but at a price. There was zero diversity, they didn't encourage conversation, and shut down any attempt to change the status quo. The administration acts like it is trying to help, but shuts down any internal investigations and pushes their problems aside. Overall, my experience with the teachers there was great, minus a few bad apples, but that is to be expected. The people that go to FLHS are driven, but often entitled.", "Great school that is very inclusive and has a vast selection of courses to satisfy anyone's interests.  The school is strong in the core requirements as well.", "personally I didn't like the building or The student population. The teachers are great and they really try to have a personal academic connection with all of their students. Absolutely adore the deans.", 'There are a lot of great opportunities that are offered both academically and outside of school.  The teachers at FLHS are very good at their jobs and offer students a very good opportunity to learn at an advanced level. There is a great variety of sports teams offered at Ludlowe ranging from football, to lacrosse, to golf, and many more.', 'Fairfield Ludlowe is a nice school which I have been attending for four years already. I entered this school as a freshman and now I am already a senior who is considering enter New York University. The teachers in my school are all nice and do their job very well. Most of the students in the school are friendly and hard working. Being a senior, I know that many students around me get into good colleges to study what they want.', 'Great academics, wide variety of teachers & classes. Lots of Advanced Placement (AP) classes available. Many counselors among other services are available to students.', "As a high school senior, my experience at Ludlowe has made a tremendous impact on who i've become. I feel that this school has a lot to offer whether it be the diverse clubs, sports teams or electives. A lot is expected of you with a hefty workload, however this has prepared me for my future education. Every teacher will take the time to help you succeed.", 'I love my high school! I have had a multitude of engaged, helpful, and highly educated teachers. My school offers so many programs and materials. They are very interested in students concerns. My only complaint is that the school can feel very competitive and the majority of students care more about good grades than learning.', "The school is generally alright. Most of the teachers are friendly and understanding however, a few bad teachers will probably become much more memorable. Students are alright to each other. Generally, if you are nice to others, people will be nice to you. The school obviously is adequately funding with all of its computers and TV's.", "At my four years at Ludlowe High School, I have made so many friends and made great memories. I have been able to excel my learning and understanding of many different subjects. I have also been able to get into many clubs to get involved with the school and the town. The teachers are very helpful and understanding. I have never not felt welcomed at my school and wouldn't want to go to high school anywhere else!", 'Good school. Great athletic programs, tons of clubs, and there are tons of cool classes to take. Music program is good too and the people are really nice.', 'My experience at Fairfield Ludlowe High School has been great. The teachers are always offering help and support to students to clarify material. The academic standards are perfect preparing every student to be successful in college. Fairfield Ludlowe has provided me with great academics and athletics where I would not even think about attending a private high school. As a whole, the faculty and students are supported by the town of Fairfield at all of our home sports games. In return, as athletes and students, Fairfield Ludlowe always finds a way to give back to the needy and community. School spirit is never fades at athletic events and students have always enjoyed their four years with teachers who they connect with and make life long bonds with. Fairfield Ludlowe is a perfect high school acadeically and athletically preparing students to be successful in life while having fun doing what we love.', 'I did not like Fairfield Ludlowe High School very much. While the school offers an abundance of options for classes it is very difficult to fit any electives into your schedule. There are so many required courses that the extra electives are not an option.', 'Fairfield Ludlowe is a overall a high school. It is filled with teachers who strive to help you reach your goals and the students are nice. One drawback is that there is NO diversity (all affluent white kids), but it has a lot of clubs.', "Ludlowe is pretty great. Teachers are good, classes are good as well. I've had some scheduling problems before but that's about it. Great activities and a great atmosphere.", 'FLHS has amazing academics. The school focuses on each student individually, and students can really excel if they make an effort to do so. The clubs an activities are also exceptional. A few years ago, the school began having an activity period during the day to get more students involved in clubs, and it really works. It is one of the smartest decisions that the school has made. The school also prepares students very well for college with the block schedule and rigorous work. The administration is very good at enforcing the rules, although the teachers are not always the best. Many teachers are wonderful and really care about their students. The other disadvantage is the lack of diversity; some students do come over from Bridgeport on a special program, but there is not must integration between those students and the "WASP" type Fairfield-Southport-Greenfield Hill residents. Other than that, Fairfield Ludlowe is a great school, and I cherish my time spent here. ', "I moved to Fairfield in my junior year and made friends relatively fast that I think will always be there for me in times of need as I will for them. My favorite experience in this school was a trip to Disney and Universail Studios with the orchestra I've played in for 8 years. This is because my friends and i roomed together and bonded at a new level. We stayed up at night telling stories, talking about hot girls we'd be asking to prom, and even listening to use while playing video games. This was an experience that was great for me because I never really went so far away from home with just my friends. If I could've been in this school for all four years of high school I'd be even happier, but I'm satisfied that I spent my last two years in this school."]
column8: ['FLHS has offered resources that I have taken advantage of in order to prepare myself for college. Some teachers may be better than others, but the ones that truly care make the bad ones worth it. I would also give the school a 0/10 in diversity. The school needs to try to educate its students so that they are comfortable with people who are different than them.', "Overall, my experience with Fairfield Ludlow High School was really good in the academic aspect. We had really good resources, facilities, and programs. Outside of the academics, the diversity lacked; and the out reach program to those who were diverse was poor. However, I didn't mind this much because my main focus was obtaining great education.", 'Fairfield Ludlowe High School is a wonderful school, I love it.  I am entering my senior year and it has been quite a rollercoaster. Most teachers are awesome and everyone is always willing to help you get by.', "Fairfield Ludlowe High School was a school that definitely prepared me for college, but at a price. There was zero diversity, they didn't encourage conversation, and shut down any attempt to change the status quo. The administration acts like it is trying to help, but shuts down any internal investigations and pushes their problems aside. Overall, my experience with the teachers there was great, minus a few bad apples, but that is to be expected. The people that go to FLHS are driven, but often entitled.", "Great school that is very inclusive and has a vast selection of courses to satisfy anyone's interests.  The school is strong in the core requirements as well.", "personally I didn't like the building or The student population. The teachers are great and they really try to have a personal academic connection with all of their students. Absolutely adore the deans.", 'There are a lot of great opportunities that are offered both academically and outside of school.  The teachers at FLHS are very good at their jobs and offer students a very good opportunity to learn at an advanced level. There is a great variety of sports teams offered at Ludlowe ranging from football, to lacrosse, to golf, and many more.', 'Fairfield Ludlowe is a nice school which I have been attending for four years already. I entered this school as a freshman and now I am already a senior who is considering enter New York University. The teachers in my school are all nice and do their job very well. Most of the students in the school are friendly and hard working. Being a senior, I know that many students around me get into good colleges to study what they want.', 'Great academics, wide variety of teachers & classes. Lots of Advanced Placement (AP) classes available. Many counselors among other services are available to students.', "As a high school senior, my experience at Ludlowe has made a tremendous impact on who i've become. I feel that this school has a lot to offer whether it be the diverse clubs, sports teams or electives. A lot is expected of you with a hefty workload, however this has prepared me for my future education. Every teacher will take the time to help you succeed.", 'I love my high school! I have had a multitude of engaged, helpful, and highly educated teachers. My school offers so many programs and materials. They are very interested in students concerns. My only complaint is that the school can feel very competitive and the majority of students care more about good grades than learning.', "The school is generally alright. Most of the teachers are friendly and understanding however, a few bad teachers will probably become much more memorable. Students are alright to each other. Generally, if you are nice to others, people will be nice to you. The school obviously is adequately funding with all of its computers and TV's.", "At my four years at Ludlowe High School, I have made so many friends and made great memories. I have been able to excel my learning and understanding of many different subjects. I have also been able to get into many clubs to get involved with the school and the town. The teachers are very helpful and understanding. I have never not felt welcomed at my school and wouldn't want to go to high school anywhere else!", 'Good school. Great athletic programs, tons of clubs, and there are tons of cool classes to take. Music program is good too and the people are really nice.', 'My experience at Fairfield Ludlowe High School has been great. The teachers are always offering help and support to students to clarify material. The academic standards are perfect preparing every student to be successful in college. Fairfield Ludlowe has provided me with great academics and athletics where I would not even think about attending a private high school. As a whole, the faculty and students are supported by the town of Fairfield at all of our home sports games. In return, as athletes and students, Fairfield Ludlowe always finds a way to give back to the needy and community. School spirit is never fades at athletic events and students have always enjoyed their four years with teachers who they connect with and make life long bonds with. Fairfield Ludlowe is a perfect high school acadeically and athletically preparing students to be successful in life while having fun doing what we love.', 'I did not like Fairfield Ludlowe High School very much. While the school offers an abundance of options for classes it is very difficult to fit any electives into your schedule. There are so many required courses that the extra electives are not an option.', 'Fairfield Ludlowe is a overall a high school. It is filled with teachers who strive to help you reach your goals and the students are nice. One drawback is that there is NO diversity (all affluent white kids), but it has a lot of clubs.', "Ludlowe is pretty great. Teachers are good, classes are good as well. I've had some scheduling problems before but that's about it. Great activities and a great atmosphere.", 'FLHS has amazing academics. The school focuses on each student individually, and students can really excel if they make an effort to do so. The clubs an activities are also exceptional. A few years ago, the school began having an activity period during the day to get more students involved in clubs, and it really works. It is one of the smartest decisions that the school has made. The school also prepares students very well for college with the block schedule and rigorous work. The administration is very good at enforcing the rules, although the teachers are not always the best. Many teachers are wonderful and really care about their students. The other disadvantage is the lack of diversity; some students do come over from Bridgeport on a special program, but there is not must integration between those students and the "WASP" type Fairfield-Southport-Greenfield Hill residents. Other than that, Fairfield Ludlowe is a great school, and I cherish my time spent here. ', "I moved to Fairfield in my junior year and made friends relatively fast that I think will always be there for me in times of need as I will for them. My favorite experience in this school was a trip to Disney and Universail Studios with the orchestra I've played in for 8 years. This is because my friends and i roomed together and bonded at a new level. We stayed up at night telling stories, talking about hot girls we'd be asking to prom, and even listening to use while playing video games. This was an experience that was great for me because I never really went so far away from home with just my friends. If I could've been in this school for all four years of high school I'd be even happier, but I'm satisfied that I spent my last two years in this school."]

column2: ['I enjoy my experience at Watchung Hills Regional High School. The school has given me many opportunities that other schools do not offer. I gave the rating four stars because I do believe there is room to grow and improve. I think the school needs to focus on diversity and not putting so much pressure on going to college. Most students feel obligated to go to college but some drop out and feel that college is not meant for them. I wish my school offered trade classes. I know that we have a vocational school, but I did not know I wanted to pursue the medical field in 8th grade when I would have had to make the decision.', 'WHRHS has extensive STEAM classes, programs, and after school activities. They offer PLTW (Project Lead The Way) engineering classes and have numerous after school clubs dedicated to the arts, hard sciences, and engineering. The curriculum is what students make of it. It can be very challenging or barely engaging depending on which classes a student chooses.', 'This school is very competitive, but challenges students to reach their full potential. With every club imaginable, different sports and elective courses , one is able to achieve anything they strive for. However, sometimes having a large schools isn’t as beneficial for students. Most sports are incredibly competitive and therefore hard to get into, limiting students top potential. On the other hand, there are tons of clubs that each student is welcome to join which makes up for the sports. Although the schools offers tons of electives from AP to honors and life-learning skill electives (Ex. Culinary arts) I feel as though it lacks electives focused on the medical field. There are tons of electives that are related to law but other than AP biology and AP chemistry there aren’t much on medical field specifically.', "My experience at WHRHS has been a good one. I've made a lot of friends from all  4 towns that attend the high school, and it is a generally very healthy environment. The courses are academically rigorous but teachers are almost always willing to give extra help, and peer-to-peer tutoring is also offered. The athletic teams are also pretty good and our school has a lot of spirit. There is a slight lack in terms of diversity, but the school makes an effort to attend to everyone's needs and include everyone.", 'I greatly appreciate all there is to offer at WHRHS. If you cannot find your exact interests in a certain class, there is a club for it. Students also have the ability to tailor their schedules quite accurately to their desired speed and curriculum, all the way down to the level of the class. I have really enjoyed being given the opportunity to make my schedule and my school days fit me as best as possible to both ready me for college and keep me engaged all day long.', 'Overall I had a very good experience. However, I did not like some administrative choices. It seems that the board of education does not care for their students or listen to the student body as much as they should. Nevertheless, the teachers are great and I felt that I got a good education before college.', 'Very nice school with very lenient teachers. There are some really great teachers that you should get to know. Take advantage of all the clubs that WHRHS has to offer.', "I loved my four years at WH!  Coming from a small district, it was great to meet new students and friends.  There are so many classes to choose from and everything you could imagine.  The electives allow you to try new interests and hobbies you'd otherwise likely never have the opportunity to try.  Sports...the best!  Great coaches and student support at games was amazing.  Many of the teachers are there for you if you need extra assistance in any subject.", 'I like the vigorous course load that Watchung Hills offers. There is a broad variety of AP courses, which I took advantage of in order to place out of introductory college courses, and there is a diverse selection of electives, which allowed me to experiment with different interests. For example, I took Computer Aided Graphic Design and found that I enjoyed Photoshop. The school also has many well-funded clubs and sports, and I made the most of my time on cross country and robotics.', 'I personally did not have a good time in this high school. The main reasoning being the social scene. The school was extremely cliquey. Im sure that there were people where I could of have found my place in but the school was too big and exclusive for me too. I found myself stuck being friends with my old friends I had in middle school.The workload was definitely a lot if your in accelerated or honor classes. Junior year being the worst. I also found that the  courses went too fast and there were a lot of unnecessary tests. Again I dont know if this is just how it is in America. They had a good range of clubs and sports for people to find what they enjoy. Even though I never said much, I really enjoyed the jsa debate club. Another good thing about the school is that they have a good range of different electives for you to chose from.Now I go to a international highschool in Istanbul and im having a much better time socially and academically.', 'I had a great experience in high school and met some amazing people. I was well prepared for college.', "The teachers do a good job of preparing you, but theres not much protection for someone who changes their mind or wants to explore new things. Very little school spirit. You're in with a lot of other kids so sometimes can become very competitive.", 'Whatcung hills puts a huge focus on courses revolving the STEM program and as someone interested in engineering, I was always thrilled to have classes in DIG, PoE, aerospace, etc...etc...', 'The education that students get here is amazing. The teachers here for the most part want to see the students succeed, and will work with them to make sure they have a solid understanding of the material. This school prepared me well for college, and I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to go to a school like Watchung Hills.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School offers students numerous ways to express themselves. Whether it be artistically, academically, or athletically there is room for every student to participate in something they are passionate about. The teachers are incredibly friendly and helpful for the most part, and will aid students to achieve their academic goals as long as they see their hard efforts in doing so. Extra help with teachers is always offered as an alternative to expensive tutors for those who do not have the same financial resources as others. Although the school has its flaws, it is for the most part a safe and peaceful learning environment for students.', "Watchung Hills helped get me to the right place for school. While I struggled with some personal issues at home school was  a safe space. There are many teachers I didn't get to have however some of the teachers I did have will remain in my memory for a long time. Always having an open office door or being understanding of what I was going through. The academics that are offered are amazing, with variety and opportunities to earn college credit.", 'It was a lot of fun, but a lot of work as well. I had a a lot of fun with my friends here. I like the school because 4 different townships go here, so you make a lot of friends. Most teachers are nice and helpful, and the guidance counselors help a lot with the college process.', 'I felt Watchung Hills focused too much on schoolwork and how competitive the school is instead of focusing on mental health and giving their students a break.', 'Overall a good school with lots of AP classes and club opportunities but very little diversity, especially within the programs created to help prepare students for college.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School gave me a lot of opportunities. But not all the teachers are good and work well with understanding students situations.']

column6: ['The teachers and stuff are very helpful. People are very friendly. My daughter made good friends and has improved  academically every year.', 'Watchung Hills is above average in both size and quality. Housing around 2000 students, the school comes with many of the ups and downs this brings. On the ups side, the opportunities present are extremely varied, with a slew of elective classes to choose from along with extremely diverse clubs and activities. However, on the downside of things, the sheer size of Watchung Hills makes social life more of a challenge. This inevitably causes cliques to form, a system that also has its own benefits and downsides. In regards to sports and clubs, sports in particular are often fairly tight knit and make for a good way to make new friends. Clubs, however, meet less frequently and for a shorter period of time than sports in most cases, and are less effective at achieving this. Despite that, the sheer volume of clubs is quiet impressive.', 'The education within Watchung Hills Regional High School is why I am extremely grateful to attend this school. For example, I have not only learned an immense amount of important history from my three years of taking history class, I also learned about the human condition and many life lessons because of my phenomenal teachers within the history wing. Many of the teachers wishing Watchung Hills truly care about their students, and it shows. In addition, I have immersed myself within the theatre arts area of the school, and have learned more about myself as an artist. Because of the many music and arts courses I have taken, I know that I will continue the arts in my college pursuits.', 'The academics at this school are unnecessarily hard. I know students who have graduated who come back and tell me that our high school over-prepares us. For example, one of my friends has 126 in one of his classes in college but his GPA in high school was below a 3.0. This might look like an advantage, but it honestly shouldn\'t be considered as one. Students are overworked and are always stressed out. There are times when we have to pull all-nighters due to the unnecessary workload that is given. Students who have low GPAs aren\'t actually dumb or don\'t work hard. It\'s just that the school is hard. With the level of difficulty, the school has a "no extra-credit" policy, which is what makes it even worse. This makes a lot of the students look bad when they apply to colleges, but they\'re really not,  which is the sad part.', 'Not only does the school place a strong emphasis on safety, the general supportive atmosphere in the school makes it a suitable learning environment.', 'Loved that there was a a wide variety of electives to choose from. The teachers were always cared for the students.', 'Had a great 4 years, loved the choices for electives that my school has to offer. The athletic programs are great.  Guidance Department really works with you to get you prepared for the college application process.', 'has a great academic programs for all types of students.   I would like to see the school offer a mechanical program for students interested in that field', 'Watching hills has a lot of diversity and readiness for college. Has resources that better the students and eduction.', 'Many of the teachers were passionate about their job and very engaging in class. It is a big high school so there are many different people with different interests all over the place, guaranteeing that others will share common interests.', 'Watchung Hills has EXCELLENT teachers that will literally change your life for the better and prepare you so well for the future. The school is really big and has a lot of great clubs to get involved in so be sure to explore all your options and get involved because you won’t regret it and you will make some great friends along the way! The only bad thing about the school is the administration just because of all the politics and how people at the top are always trying to take away students freedoms just to make the school look better to the public. Overall, WH is a pretty good school and I’m so grateful for the enriching education I’ve receieved!', 'Watchung Hills provides extensive resources to students who are preparing for college. The amount of niche programs lets students explore choices that impact their decision post-graduation.', "Considered one of NJ's wealthiest high schools.Lots of programs and extra-curriculars. One of the rare schools that offer engineering/architecture electives and AP classes.", "Watchung Hills is overall a good school. Compared to a lot of other schools nationwide or even in the area, it is very advanced and prepares you well for college. While the administration can be hard to work with, most teachers are nice. I've had a number of teachers who've really inspired me, been kind to me, and definitely influenced my direction in life. (The history department in particular.) Yes, there is plenty of drama and fights over trivial things, but you'll find that at any school. As a senior, my best advice is to take advantage of all the school offers. Be it clubs, sports, extra help...take advantage of it, and immerse yourself in the culture. You'll get teachers you hate or courses you hate, or have to deal with seemingly incompetent administrators, but in the end, the good memories outweigh the bad. Have fun, apply yourself in class and extracurriculars, and thank those teachers that go above and beyond to help you learn. If you do, Watchung Hills will serve you well.", "As a student here, I have a slightly biased view and, like all high schoolers,  I can't wait to leave. But, it's a school in a suburban neighborhood so you kind of know everybody but then don't at the same time.", 'I thought that my experience at Watchung Hills was very good. All of the staff and teachers were nice and eager to help. One thing, however, which I hope they change is the school spirit. I feel like no one has spirit, and little students attend the sporting events.', 'High school is a formative time for everybody, and the staff at WHRHS know this and are there to help you succeed. All of the faculty including the academic advisors are all there to help you succeed to the best of your ability. At this school, everything that you put into it will be given back and then some. It is important to be somewhat self motivated to make sure you get the most out of everything offered here.', 'I enjoyed the number of engineering classes offered.  Classes such as intro to engineering design, principles of engineering, and civil engineering and architecture really allowed me to explore engineering and fostered a love for engineering.  These classes led me to major in engineering in college.', 'Watchung Hills Regional is an amazing school overall. With so many electives and a range of academic classes there is always a place for any student to fit in and find their niche.', "Currently a senior at Watchung Hills, I've seen everything. Good and bad. Watchung Hills is a very great school, academically. The students are ambitious, the athletes are motivated, and the teachers truly love their jobs. The school has an ambundous of resources such as technology, art supplies, instruments, biology tools, etc. Overall, there are no major accounts of issues regarding bullying or physical fights. However, one criticism. There is no diversity. It is a very caucasian dominant school, and students here have a very closed-off mindset. I feel as though most students are not very educated about people not like themselves, and therefore don't know how to act around certain minorities.  I have witnessed racial slurs, mostly behind people's backs, and felt very uncomfortable. The worst part of all, administration is not aware nor informed of occurrences like these, therefore there is no action against stopping this. We need change."]

Many of the teachers are there for you if you need extra assistance in any subject.", 'I like the vigorous course load that Watchung Hills offers. There is a broad variety of AP courses, which I took advantage of in order to place out of introductory college courses, and there is a diverse selection of electives, which allowed me to experiment with different interests. For example, I took Computer Aided Graphic Design and found that I enjoyed Photoshop. The school also has many well-funded clubs and sports, and I made the most of my time on cross country and robotics.', 'I personally did not have a good time in this high school. The main reasoning being the social scene. The school was extremely cliquey. Im sure that there were people where I could of have found my place in but the school was too big and exclusive for me too. I found myself stuck being friends with my old friends I had in middle school.The workload was definitely a lot if your in accelerated or honor classes. Junior year being the worst. I also found that the  courses went too fast and there were a lot of unnecessary tests. Again I dont know if this is just how it is in America. They had a good range of clubs and sports for people to find what they enjoy. Even though I never said much, I really enjoyed the jsa debate club. Another good thing about the school is that they have a good range of different electives for you to chose from.Now I go to a international highschool in Istanbul and im having a much better time socially and academically.', 'I had a great experience in high school and met some amazing people. I was well prepared for college.', "The teachers do a good job of preparing you, but theres not much protection for someone who changes their mind or wants to explore new things. Very little school spirit. You're in with a lot of other kids so sometimes can become very competitive.", 'Whatcung hills puts a huge focus on courses revolving the STEM program and as someone interested in engineering, I was always thrilled to have classes in DIG, PoE, aerospace, etc...etc...', 'The education that students get here is amazing. The teachers here for the most part want to see the students succeed, and will work with them to make sure they have a solid understanding of the material. This school prepared me well for college, and I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to go to a school like Watchung Hills.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School offers students numerous ways to express themselves. Whether it be artistically, academically, or athletically there is room for every student to participate in something they are passionate about. The teachers are incredibly friendly and helpful for the most part, and will aid students to achieve their academic goals as long as they see their hard efforts in doing so. Extra help with teachers is always offered as an alternative to expensive tutors for those who do not have the same financial resources as others. Although the school has its flaws, it is for the most part a safe and peaceful learning environment for students.', "Watchung Hills helped get me to the right place for school. While I struggled with some personal issues at home school was  a safe space. There are many teachers I didn't get to have however some of the teachers I did have will remain in my memory for a long time. Always having an open office door or being understanding of what I was going through. The academics that are offered are amazing, with variety and opportunities to earn college credit.", 'It was a lot of fun, but a lot of work as well. I had a a lot of fun with my friends here. I like the school because 4 different townships go here, so you make a lot of friends. Most teachers are nice and helpful, and the guidance counselors help a lot with the college process.', 'I felt Watchung Hills focused too much on schoolwork and how competitive the school is instead of focusing on mental health and giving their students a break.', 'Overall a good school with lots of AP classes and club opportunities but very little diversity, especially within the programs created to help prepare students for college.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School gave me a lot of opportunities. But not all the teachers are good and work well with understanding students situations.']
